"[845-his sister]

[[His]844-his sister]845-his sister became abruptly still , and lapsed into a pondering silence . [Abraham]212-abraham talked on , rather for the pleasure of utterance than for audition , so that [[his]844-his sister]845-his sister 's abstraction was of no account . [He]844-his leant back against the hives , and with upturned face made observations on the stars , whose cold pulses were beating amid the black hollows above , in serene dissociation from these two wisps of human life . [He]844-his asked how far away those twinklers were , and whether [God]222-god was on the other side of them . But ever and anon [his]844-his childish prattle recurred to what impressed [his]844-his imagination even more deeply than the wonders of creation . If [Tess]198-tess were made rich by marrying [a gentleman]6008-a gentleman , would [she]198-tess have money enough to buy a spyglass so large that it would draw the stars as near to [her]198-tess as [Nettlecombe - Tout]44-nettlecombe - tout ?

The renewed subject , which seemed to have impregnated [the whole family]848-the whole family , filled [Tess]198-tess with impatience .

" Never mind that now ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess exclaimed .

" Did [you]212-abraham say the stars were worlds , [Tess]198-tess ? "[6008-a gentleman]

" Yes . "[6008-a gentleman]

" All like [ours]6019-we ? "[6008-a gentleman]

" [I]6008-a gentleman do n't know ; but [I]6008-a gentleman think so . They sometimes seem to be like the apples on [our]6019-we stubbard - tree . Most of [them]6020-them splendid and sound - a few blighted . "[6008-a gentleman]

" Which do [we]6019-we live on - a splendid one or a blighted one ? "[6008-a gentleman]

" A blighted one . "[6008-a gentleman]

" ' Tis very unlucky that [we]6019-we did n't pitch on a sound one , when there were so many more of 'em ! "[6008-a gentleman]

" Yes . "[6008-a gentleman]

" Is it like that REALLY , [Tess]198-tess ? "[212-abraham] said [Abraham]212-abraham , turning to [her]198-tess much impressed , on reconsideration of this rare information . " How would it have been if [we]6019-we had pitched on a sound one ? "[212-abraham]

" Well , [father]5842-father would n't have coughed and creeped about as [he]5842-father does , and would n't have got too tipsy to go on this journey ; and [mother]5917-mother would n't have been always washing , and never getting finished . "[6008-a gentleman]

" And [you]198-tess would have been [a rich lady ready - made , and not have had to be made rich]6023-a rich lady ready - made , and not have had to be made rich by marrying [a gentleman]6008-a gentleman ? "[212-abraham]

" [O Aby]224-aby , do n't - do n't talk of that any more ! "[6008-a gentleman]

Left to [his]212-abraham reflections [Abraham]212-abraham soon grew drowsy . [Tess]198-tess was not skilful in the management of a horse , but [she]198-tess thought that [she]198-tess could take upon [herself]198-tess the entire conduct of the load for the present and allow [Abraham]212-abraham to go to sleep if [he]212-abraham wished to do so . [She]198-tess made [him]212-abraham a sort of nest in front of the hives , in such a manner that [he]212-abraham could not fall , and , taking the reins into [her]198-tess own hands , jogged on as before .

[Prince]223-prince required but slight attention , lacking energy for superfluous movements of any sort . With no longer a companion to distract [her]198-tess , [Tess]198-tess fell more deeply into reverie than ever , [her]198-tess back leaning against the hives . The mute procession past [her]198-tess shoulders of trees and hedges became attached to fantastic scenes outside reality , and the occasional heave of the wind became the sigh of some immense sad soul , conterminous with the universe in space , and with history in time .

Then , examining the mesh of events in [her]198-tess own life , [she]198-tess seemed to see the vanity of [[her]198-tess father]557-her father 's pride ; [the gentlemanly suitor awaiting [herself]198-tess in [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's fancy]850-the gentlemanly suitor awaiting herself in her mother 's fancy ; to see [him]212-abraham as [a grimacing personage]852-a grimacing personage , laughing at [her]198-tess poverty and [her]198-tess shrouded knightly ancestry . Everything grew more and more extravagant , and [she]198-tess no longer knew how time passed . A sudden jerk shook [her]198-tess in [her]198-tess seat , and [Tess]198-tess awoke from the sleep into which [she]198-tess , too , had fallen .

[They]853-they were a long way further on than when [she]198-tess had lost consciousness , and the waggon had stopped . A hollow groan , unlike anything [she]198-tess had ever heard in [her]198-tess life , came from the front , followed by a shout of " Hoi there ! "[853-they]

The lantern hanging at [her]198-tess waggon had gone out , but another was shining in [her]198-tess face - much brighter than [her]198-tess own had been . Something terrible had happened . The harness was entangled with an object which blocked the way .

In consternation [Tess]198-tess jumped down , and discovered the dreadful truth . The groan had proceeded from [[her]198-tess father]557-her father 's poor horse [Prince]223-prince . [The morning mail - cart]855-the morning mail - cart , with its two noiseless wheels , speeding along [these lanes]856-these lanes like an arrow , as it always did , had driven into [her]198-tess slow and unlighted equipage . The pointed shaft of [the cart]857-the cart had entered the breast of [the unhappy Prince]858-the unhappy prince like a sword , and from the wound [his]858-the unhappy prince life 's blood was spouting in a stream , and falling with a hiss into [the road]550-the road .

In [her]198-tess despair [Tess]198-tess sprang forward and put [her]198-tess hand upon the hole , with the only result that [she]198-tess became splashed from face to skirt with the crimson drops . Then [she]198-tess stood helplessly looking on . [Prince]223-prince also stood firm and motionless as long as [he]223-prince could ; till [he]223-prince suddenly sank down in a heap .

By this time [the mail - cart man]860-the mail - cart man had joined [her]198-tess , and began dragging and unharnessing the hot form of [Prince]223-prince . But [he]223-prince was already dead , and , seeing that nothing more could be done immediately , [the mail - cart man]860-the mail - cart man returned to [his]860-the mail - cart man own animal , which was uninjured .

" [You]198-tess was on the wrong side , "[860-the mail - cart man] [he]860-the mail - cart man said . " [I]860-the mail - cart man am bound to go on with the mail - bags , so that the best thing for [you]198-tess to do is bide here with [your]198-tess load . [I]860-the mail - cart man 'll send [somebody]6000-somebody to help [you]198-tess as soon as [I]860-the mail - cart man can . It is getting daylight , and [you]198-tess have nothing to fear . "[860-the mail - cart man]

[He]860-the mail - cart man mounted and sped on [his]860-the mail - cart man way ; while [Tess]198-tess stood and waited . The atmosphere turned pale , the birds shook themselves in the hedges , arose , and twittered ; [the lane]631-the lane showed all [its]631-the lane white features , and [Tess]198-tess showed [hers]198-tess , still whiter . The huge pool of blood in front of [her]198-tess was already assuming the iridescence of coagulation ; and when the sun rose a hundred prismatic hues were reflected from it . [Prince]223-prince lay alongside , still and stark ; [his]223-prince eyes half open , the hole in [his]223-prince chest looking scarcely large enough to have let out all that had animated [him]223-prince .

" ' Tis all [my]647-the girl doing - all mine ! "[647-the girl] [the girl]647-the girl cried , gazing at the spectacle . " No excuse for [me]647-the girl - none . What will [mother]5917-mother and [father]5842-father live on now ? [Aby]224-aby , [Aby]224-aby ! "[647-the girl] [She]647-the girl shook [the child , who had slept soundly through the whole disaster]864-the child , who had slept soundly through the whole disaster . " [We]6028-we ca n't go on with [our]6028-we load - [Prince]223-prince is killed ! "[647-the girl]

When [Abraham]212-abraham realized all , the furrows of fifty years were extemporized on [his]212-abraham young face .

" Why , [I]647-the girl danced and laughed only yesterday ! "[647-the girl] [she]647-the girl went on to [herself]647-the girl . " To think that [I]647-the girl was such [a fool]6029-a fool ! "[647-the girl]

" ' Tis because [we]6028-we be on a blighted star , and not a sound one , is n't it , [Tess]198-tess ? "[212-abraham] murmured [Abraham]212-abraham through [his]212-abraham tears .

In silence [they]865-they waited through an interval which seemed endless . At length a sound , and an approaching object , proved to [them]865-they that [the driver of [the mail - car]867-the mail - car]866-the driver of the mail - car had been as good as [his]866-the driver of the mail - car word . [[A farmer]868-a farmer 's man from near [Stourcastle]32-stourcastle]869-a farmer 's man from near stourcastle came up , leading a strong cob . [He]869-a farmer 's man from near stourcastle was harnessed to the waggon of beehives in [the place of [Prince]223-prince]870-the place of prince , and the load taken on towards [Casterbridge]41-casterbridge .

The evening of the same day saw the empty waggon reach again the spot of the accident . [Prince]223-prince had lain there in the ditch since the morning ; but the place of the blood - pool was still visible in the middle of [the road]550-the road , though scratched and scraped over by [passing vehicles]872-passing vehicles . All that was left of [Prince]223-prince was now hoisted into the waggon [he]223-prince had formerly hauled , and with [his]223-prince hoofs in the air , and [his]223-prince shoes shining in the setting sunlight , [he]223-prince retraced the eight or nine miles to [Marlott]21-marlott .

[Tess]198-tess had gone back earlier . How to break the news was more than [she]198-tess could think . It was a relief to [her]198-tess tongue to find from the faces of [[her]198-tess parents]873-her parents that [they]873-her parents already knew of [their]873-her parents loss , though this did not lessen the self - reproach which [she]198-tess continued to heap upon [herself]198-tess for [her]198-tess negligence .

But the very shiftlessness of [the household]874-the household rendered the misfortune a less terrifying one to [them]873-her parents than it would have been to [a thriving family]875-a thriving family , though in the present case it meant ruin , and in the other it would only have meant inconvenience . In [the Durbeyfield]198-tess countenances there was nothing of the red wrath that would have burnt upon [the girl]647-the girl from [parents more ambitious for [her]647-the girl welfare]877-parents more ambitious for her welfare . [Nobody]754-nobody blamed [Tess]198-tess as [she]198-tess blamed [herself]198-tess .

When it was discovered that [the knacker and tanner]879-the knacker and tanner would give only a very few shillings for [Prince]223-prince 's carcase because of [his]223-prince decrepitude , [Durbeyfield]198-tess rose to the occasion .

" No , "[223-prince] said [he]223-prince stoically , " [I]223-prince wo n't sell [his]223-prince old body . When [we]6030-we d'Urbervilles was knights in [the land]6031-the land , [we]6030-we did n't sell [our]6030-we chargers for cat 's meat . Let ['em]6030-we keep [their]879-the knacker and tanner shillings ! [He've]223-prince served [me]223-prince well in [his]223-prince lifetime , and [I]223-prince wo n't part from [him]223-prince now . "[223-prince]

[He]223-prince worked harder the next day in digging [a grave for [Prince]223-prince in [the garden]881-the garden]880-a grave for prince in the garden than [he]223-prince had worked for months to grow a crop for [[his]223-prince family]5890-his family . When the hole was ready , [Durbeyfield]198-tess and [[his]223-prince wife]819-his wife tied a rope round the horse and dragged [him]223-prince up the path towards [it]880-a grave for prince in the garden , [the children]700-the children following in [funeral train]885-funeral train . [Abraham]212-abraham and ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu sobbed , Hope and [Modesty]214-hope and modesty discharged [their]700-the children griefs in loud blares which echoed from the walls ; and when [Prince]223-prince was tumbled in [they]700-the children gathered round [the grave]886-the grave . The bread - winner had been taken away from [them]700-the children ; what would [they]700-the children do ?

" Is [he]223-prince gone to [heaven]6032-heaven ? "[212-abraham] asked [Abraham]212-abraham , between the sobs .

Then [Durbeyfield]198-tess began to shovel in the earth , and [the children]700-the children cried anew . All except [Tess]198-tess . [Her]198-tess face was dry and pale , as though [she]198-tess regarded [herself]198-tess in the light of [a murderess]888-a murderess .

V

The haggling business , which had mainly depended on the horse , became disorganized forthwith . [Distress]225-distress , if not penury , loomed in the distance . [Durbeyfield]198-tess was what was locally called [a slack - twisted fellow]889-a slack - twisted fellow ; [he]889-a slack - twisted fellow had good strength to work at times ; but the times could not be relied on to coincide with the hours of requirement ; and , having been unaccustomed to the regular toil of [the day - labourer]890-the day - labourer , [he]889-a slack - twisted fellow was not particularly persistent when [they]700-the children did so coincide .

[Tess]198-tess , meanwhile , as [the one who had dragged [[her]198-tess parents]873-her parents into this quagmire]891-the one who had dragged her parents into this quagmire , was silently wondering what [she]198-tess could do to help [them]873-her parents out of it ; and then [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother broached [her]658-her mother scheme .

" [We]873-her parents must take the ups wi ' the downs , [Tess]198-tess , "[658-her mother] said [she]658-her mother ; " and never could [your]198-tess high blood have been found out at a more called - for moment . [You]198-tess must try [[your]198-tess friends]6033-your friends . Do [ye]198-tess know that there is [a very rich Mrs d'Urberville living on [the outskirts o ' [The Chase]39-the chase]6035-the outskirts o ' the chase , who must be [[our]873-her parents relation]5967-our relation]6034-a very rich mrs d'urberville living on the outskirts o ' the chase , who must be our relation ? [You]198-tess must go to [her]6034-a very rich mrs d'urberville living on the outskirts o ' the chase , who must be our relation and [claim kin]6037-claim kin , and ask for some help in [our]873-her parents trouble . "[658-her mother]

" [I]198-tess should n't care to do that , "[198-tess] says [Tess]198-tess . " If there is such [a lady]6038-a lady , ' twould be enough for [us]873-her parents if [she]6034-a very rich mrs d'urberville living on the outskirts o ' the chase , who must be our relation were friendly - not to expect [her]6034-a very rich mrs d'urberville living on the outskirts o ' the chase , who must be our relation to give [us]873-her parents help . "[198-tess]

" [You]198-tess could win [her]6034-a very rich mrs d'urberville living on the outskirts o ' the chase , who must be our relation round to do anything , [[my]658-her mother dear]6039-my dear . Besides , perhaps there 's more in it than [you]198-tess know of . [I]658-her mother 've heard what [I]658-her mother 've heard , good - now . "[658-her mother]

The oppressive sense of the harm [she]198-tess had done led [Tess]198-tess to be more deferential than [she]198-tess might otherwise have been to the maternal wish ; but [she]198-tess could not understand why [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother should find such satisfaction in contemplating an enterprise of , to [her]198-tess , such doubtful profit . [[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother might have made inquiries , and have discovered that [this Mrs d'Urberville]896-this mrs d'urberville was [a lady of unequalled virtues and charity]897-a lady of unequalled virtues and charity . But [Tess]198-tess 's pride made the part of [poor relation]898-poor relation one of particular distaste to [her]198-tess .

" [I]198-tess 'd rather try to get work , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess murmured .

" [Durbeyfield]198-tess , [you]899-i can settle it , "[819-his wife] said [[his]899-i wife]819-his wife , turning to where [he]899-i sat in the background . " If [you]899-i say [she]896-this mrs d'urberville ought to go , [she]896-this mrs d'urberville will go . "[819-his wife]

" [I]899-i do n't like [[my]899-i children]6040-my children going and making [themselves]6040-my children beholden to [strange kin]6041-strange kin , "[899-i] murmured [he]899-i . " [I]899-i 'm [the head of the noblest branch o ' [the family]719-the family]6042-the head of the noblest branch o ' the family , and [I]899-i ought to live up to it . "[899-i]

[His]899-i reasons for staying away were worse to [Tess]198-tess than [her]198-tess own objections to going . " Well , as [I]198-tess killed the horse , [mother]5917-mother , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said mournfully , " [I]198-tess suppose [I]198-tess ought to do something . [I]198-tess do n't mind going and seeing [her]6045-her , but [you]5917-mother must leave it to [me]198-tess about asking for help . And do n't go thinking about [her]6045-her making a match for [me]198-tess - it is silly . "[198-tess]

" Very well said , [Tess]198-tess ! "[557-her father] observed [[her]198-tess father]557-her father sententiously .

" Who said [I]205-joan had such a thought ? "[205-joan] asked [Joan]205-joan .

" [I]198-tess fancy it is in [your]5917-mother mind , [mother]5917-mother . But [I]198-tess 'll go . "[198-tess]

Rising early next day [she]198-tess walked to [the hill - town called [Shaston]2-shaston]902-the hill - town called shaston , and there took advantage of [a van]903-a van which twice in the week ran from [Shaston]2-shaston eastward to [Chaseborough]45-chaseborough , passing near [Trantridge]38-trantridge , [the parish in which the vague and mysterious [Mrs d'Urberville]905-mrs d'urberville had [[her]905-mrs d'urberville residence]906-her residence]904-the parish in which the vague and mysterious mrs d'urberville had her residence .

[Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess 's route on this memorable morning lay amid the north - eastern undulations of [the Vale in which [she]198-tess had been born]907-the vale in which she had been born , and in which [her]198-tess life had unfolded . [The Vale of [Blackmoor]4-blackmoor]595-the vale of blackmoor was to [her]198-tess [the world]497-the world , and [its]595-the vale of blackmoor inhabitants the races thereof . From [the gates and stiles of [Marlott]21-marlott]910-the gates and stiles of marlott [she]198-tess had looked down [its]595-the vale of blackmoor length in the wondering days of infancy , and what had been mystery to [her]198-tess then was not much less than mystery to [her]198-tess now . [She]198-tess had seen daily from [[her]198-tess chamber]911-her chamber - window towers , [villages]912-villages , [faint white mansions]913-faint white mansions ; above all , [the town of Shaston]596-the town of shaston standing majestically on [its]596-the town of shaston height ; [its]596-the town of shaston windows shining like lamps in the evening sun . [She]198-tess had hardly ever visited [the place]5882-the place , only [a small tract even of [the Vale]917-the vale]916-a small tract even of the vale and [[its]595-the vale of blackmoor environs]918-its environs being known to [her]198-tess by close inspection . Much less had [she]198-tess been far outside [the valley]496-the valley . [Every contour of [the surrounding hills]921-the surrounding hills]920-every contour of the surrounding hills was as personal to [her]198-tess as that of [[her]198-tess relatives]922-her relatives ' faces ; but for what lay beyond , [her]198-tess judgment was dependent on the teaching of [the village school]563-the village school , where [she]198-tess had held a leading place at the time of [her]198-tess leaving , a year or two before this date .

In those early days [she]198-tess had been much loved by others of [her]198-tess own sex and age , and had used to be seen about [the village]473-the village as one of three - [all nearly of the same year]925-all nearly of the same year - walking [home]5850-home from [school]927-school side by side ; [Tess]198-tess the middle one - in a pink print pinafore , of a finely reticulated pattern , worn over a stuff frock that had lost its original colour for a nondescript tertiary - marching on upon long stalky legs , in tight stockings which had little ladder - like holes at the knees , torn by kneeling in [the roads]928-the roads and banks in search of vegetable and mineral treasures ; [her]198-tess then earth - coloured hair hanging like pot - hooks ; the arms of [the two outside girls]929-the two outside girls resting round the waist of [Tess]198-tess ; [her]198-tess arms on the shoulders of [the two supporters]930-the two supporters .

As [Tess]198-tess grew older , and began to see how matters stood , [she]198-tess felt quite a Malthusian towards [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother for thoughtlessly giving [her]198-tess so many [little sisters]932-little sisters and [brothers]586-brothers , when it was such a trouble to nurse and provide for [them]934-them . [[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's intelligence was that of [a happy child]936-a happy child : [Joan Durbeyfield]205-joan was simply [an additional one]937-an additional one , and that not the eldest , to [[her]198-tess own long family of waiters on [Providence]266-providence]938-her own long family of waiters on providence .

However , [Tess]198-tess became humanely beneficent towards [the small ones]939-the small ones , and to help [them]939-the small ones as much as possible [she]198-tess used , as soon as [she]198-tess left [school]927-school , to lend a hand at haymaking or harvesting on [neighbouring farms]941-neighbouring farms ; or , by preference , at milking or butter - making processes , which [she]198-tess had learnt when [[her]198-tess father]557-her father had owned cows ; and being deft - fingered it was a kind of work in which [she]198-tess excelled .

Every day seemed to throw upon [her]198-tess young shoulders more of the family burdens , and that [Tess]198-tess should be [the representative of [the Durbeyfields]218-the durbeyfields at [the d'Urberville mansion]944-the d'urberville mansion]943-the representative of the durbeyfields at the d'urberville mansion came as a thing of course . In this instance it must be admitted that [the Durbeyfields]218-the durbeyfields were putting [their]218-the durbeyfields fairest side outward .

[She]198-tess alighted from [the van]945-the van at [Trantridge Cross]47-trantridge cross , and ascended on foot [a hill in the direction of [the district]503-the district known as [The Chase]39-the chase]946-a hill in the direction of the district known as the chase , on the borders of which , as [she]198-tess had been informed , [[Mrs d'Urberville]948-mrs d'urberville 's seat]949-mrs d'urberville 's seat , [The Slopes]48-the slopes , would be found . [It]950-it was not [a manorial home]951-a manorial home in the ordinary sense , with [fields , and pastures]952-fields , and pastures , and [a grumbling farmer]953-a grumbling farmer , out of whom [the owner]954-the owner had to squeeze an income for [himself]954-the owner and [[his]954-the owner family]5890-his family by hook or by crook . It was more , far more ; [a country - house built for enjoyment pure and simple , with not an acre of troublesome land attached to [it]950-it beyond what was required for [residential purposes]957-residential purposes]956-a country - house built for enjoyment pure and simple , with not an acre of troublesome land attached to it beyond what was required for residential purposes , and for [a little fancy farm]958-a little fancy farm kept in hand by [the owner]954-the owner , and tended by [a bailiff]960-a bailiff .

[The crimson brick lodge]961-the crimson brick lodge came first in sight , up to [its]961-the crimson brick lodge eaves in dense evergreens . [Tess]198-tess thought this was [the mansion itself]962-the mansion itself till , passing through the side wicket with some trepidation , and onward to a point at which [the drive]963-the drive took a turn , [the house]652-the house proper stood in full view . [It]652-the house was of recent erection - indeed almost new - and of the same rich red colour that formed such a contrast with the evergreens of [the lodge]965-the lodge . Far behind the corner of [the house]652-the house - which rose like a geranium bloom against the subdued colours around - stretched the soft azure landscape of [The Chase]39-the chase - [a truly venerable tract of [forest land]968-forest land]967-a truly venerable tract of forest land , one of [the few remaining woodlands in [England]10-england]969-the few remaining woodlands in england of undoubted primaeval date , wherein Druidical mistletoe was still found on aged oaks , and where enormous yew - trees , not planted by the hand of [man]970-man grew as they had grown when they were pollarded for bows . All this sylvan antiquity , however , though visible from [The Slopes]971-the slopes , was outside [the immediate boundaries of [the estate]973-the estate]972-the immediate boundaries of the estate .

Everything on [this snug property]974-this snug property was bright , thriving , and well kept ; [acres of glass - houses]975-acres of glass - houses stretched down the inclines to the copses at [their]975-acres of glass - houses feet . Everything looked like money - like the last coin issued from [the Mint]49-the mint . [The stables]976-the stables , partly screened by Austrian pines and evergreen oaks , and fitted with every late appliance , were as dignified as [Chapels - of - Ease]50-chapels - of - ease . On [the extensive lawn]977-the extensive lawn stood an ornamental tent , [its]977-the extensive lawn door being towards [her]978-her .

[Simple Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess stood at gaze , in a half - alarmed attitude , on the edge of the gravel sweep . [Her]978-her feet had brought [her]978-her onward to this point before [she]978-her had quite realized where [she]978-her was ; and now all was contrary to [her]978-her expectation .

" [I]978-her thought [we]981-we were [an old family]6047-an old family ; but this is all new ! "[978-her] [she]978-her said , in [her]978-her artlessness . [She]978-her wished that [she]978-her had not fallen in so readily with [[her]978-her mother]658-her mother 's plans for " claiming kin , "[978-her] and had endeavoured to gain assistance nearer [home]5850-home .

The d'Urbervilles - or [Stoke]226-stoke - d'Urbervilles , as [they]981-we at first called [themselves]981-we - who owned all this , were [a somewhat unusual family to find in [such an old - fashioned part of [the country]507-the country]983-such an old - fashioned part of the country]982-a somewhat unusual family to find in such an old - fashioned part of the country . [Parson Tringham]179-parson tringham had spoken truly when [he]179-parson tringham said that [our]985-our shambling [John Durbeyfield]192-john durbeyfield was [the only really lineal representative of [the old d'Urberville family]987-the old d'urberville family existing in [the county]5889-the county]986-the only really lineal representative of the old d'urberville family existing in the county , or near [it]5889-the county ; [he]179-parson tringham might have added , what [he]179-parson tringham knew very well , that [the Stoke - d'Urbervilles]989-the stoke - d'urbervilles were no more d'Urbervilles of the true tree then [he]179-parson tringham was [himself]179-parson tringham . Yet it must be admitted that [this family]990-this family formed [a very good stock whereon to regraft a name which sadly wanted such renovation]991-a very good stock whereon to regraft a name which sadly wanted such renovation .

When old [Mr Simon Stoke]226-stoke , latterly deceased , had made [his]226-stoke fortune as [an honest merchant]992-an honest merchant [some said money - lender in [the North]52-the north]993-some said money - lender in the north , [he]226-stoke decided to settle as [a county man in [the South of [England]10-england]995-the south of england , out of hail of [[his]226-stoke business district]996-his business district]994-a county man in the south of england , out of hail of his business district ; and in doing this [he]226-stoke felt the necessity of recommencing with a name that would not too readily identify [him]226-stoke with [the smart tradesman of the past , and that would be less commonplace than the original bald , stark words]997-the smart tradesman of the past , and that would be less commonplace than the original bald , stark words . Conning for an hour in [the British Museum]998-the british museum the pages of works devoted to extinct , half - extinct , obscured , and ruined families appertaining to [the quarter of [England]10-england in which [he]226-stoke proposed to settle]999-the quarter of england in which he proposed to settle , [he]226-stoke considered that d'Urberville looked and sounded as well as any of [them]1000-them : and d'Urberville accordingly was annexed to [his]226-stoke own name for [himself]226-stoke and [[his]226-stoke heirs]1001-his heirs eternally . Yet [he]226-stoke was not [an extravagant - minded man]1002-an extravagant - minded man in this , and in constructing [his]226-stoke family tree on the new basis was duly reasonable in framing [his]226-stoke inter - marriages and aristocratic links , never inserting a single title above a rank of strict moderation .

Of this work of [imagination poor Tess]198-tess and [[her]1003-her parents]873-her parents were naturally in ignorance - much to [their]873-her parents discomfiture ; indeed , the very possibility of such annexations was unknown to [them]873-her parents ; who supposed that , though to be well - favoured might be the gift of fortune , a family name came by nature .

[Tess]198-tess still stood hesitating like a bather about to make [his]226-stoke plunge , hardly knowing whether to retreat or to persevere , when a figure came forth from the dark triangular door of [the tent]1005-the tent . It was that of [a tall young man]1006-a tall young man , smoking .

[He]1006-a tall young man had an almost swarthy complexion , with full lips , badly moulded , though red and smooth , above which was a well - groomed black moustache with curled points , though [his]1006-a tall young man age could not be more than three- or four - and - twenty . Despite the touches of barbarism in [his]1006-a tall young man contours , there was a singular force in [the gentleman]1007-the gentleman 's face , and in [his]1006-a tall young man bold rolling eye .

" Well , [[my]1006-a tall young man Beauty]6048-my beauty , what can [I]1006-a tall young man do for [you]198-tess ? "[1006-a tall young man] said [he]1006-a tall young man , coming forward . And perceiving that [she]198-tess stood quite confounded : " Never mind [me]1006-a tall young man . [I]1006-a tall young man am [Mr d'Urberville]6049-mr d'urberville . Have [you]1006-a tall young man come to see [me]1006-a tall young man or [[my]1006-a tall young man mother]6050-my mother ? "[1006-a tall young man]

This embodiment of a d'Urberville and [a namesake]1008-a namesake differed even more from what [Tess]198-tess had expected than [the house]652-the house and [grounds]1010-grounds had differed . [She]198-tess had dreamed of an aged and dignified face , the sublimation of all the d'Urberville lineaments , furrowed with incarnate memories representing in hieroglyphic the centuries of [[her]198-tess family]1011-her family 's and [England]10-england 's history . But [she]198-tess screwed [herself]198-tess up to the work in hand , since [she]198-tess could not get out of it , and answered -

" [I]198-tess came to see [[your]1006-a tall young man mother]6051-your mother , [sir]5821-sir . "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess 's sense of a certain ludicrousness in [her]198-tess errand was now so strong that , notwithstanding [her]198-tess awe of [him]1014-the lately deceased gentleman , and [her]198-tess general discomfort at being [here]5975-here , [her]198-tess rosy lips curved towards a smile , much to the attraction of [the swarthy Alexander]1016-the swarthy alexander .

" It is so very foolish , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess stammered ; " [I]198-tess fear ca n't tell [you]1014-the lately deceased gentleman ! "[198-tess]

" [Mother]228-mother asked [me]198-tess to come , "[198-tess] [Tess]198-tess continued ; " and , indeed , [I]198-tess was in the mind to do so [myself]198-tess likewise . " Ho ! [Poor relations]6058-poor relations ? "[198-tess]

" Yes . "[198-tess]

" [Stokes]229-stokes ? "[198-tess]

" No ; d'Urbervilles . "[198-tess]

" Ay , ay ; [I]198-tess mean d'Urbervilles . "[198-tess]

" [Our]6057-we names are worn away to [Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield ; but [we]6057-we have several proofs that [we]6057-we are d'Urbervilles . [Antiquarians]6059-antiquarians hold [we]6057-we are , - and - and [we]6057-we have an old seal , marked with a ramping lion on a shield , and [a castle over [him]1017-him]6060-a castle over him . But it is so worn that [mother]5917-mother uses it to stir the pea - soup . "[198-tess]

" A castle argent is certainly [my]1017-him crest , "[1017-him] said [he]1017-him blandly . " And [my]1017-him arms a lion rampant . "[1017-him]

" And so [mother]5917-mother said [we]6057-we ought to make [ourselves]6057-we beknown to [you]367-alec d'urberville - as [we]6057-we 've lost [our]6057-we horse by a bad accident , and are [the oldest branch o ' [the family]719-the family]6064-the oldest branch o ' the family . "[198-tess]

" Very kind of [[your]367-alec d'urberville mother]6051-your mother , [I]367-alec d'urberville 'm sure . And [I]367-alec d'urberville , for one , do n't regret [her]6051-your mother step . "[367-alec d'urberville] [Alec]367-alec d'urberville looked at [Tess]198-tess as [he]1017-him spoke , in a way that made [her]198-tess blush a little . " And so , [[my]367-alec d'urberville pretty girl]6067-my pretty girl , [you]198-tess 've come on a friendly visit to [us]6057-we , as [relations]6068-relations ? "[367-alec d'urberville]

" [I]198-tess suppose [I]198-tess have , "[198-tess] faltered [Tess]198-tess , looking uncomfortable again .

" Well - there 's no harm in it . Where do [you]198-tess live ? What are [you]198-tess ? "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess gave [him]1017-him brief particulars ; and responding to further inquiries told [him]1017-him that [she]198-tess was intending to go back by [the same carrier who had brought [her]198-tess]1018-the same carrier who had brought her .

" It is a long while before [he]1017-him returns past [Trantridge Cross]47-trantridge cross . Supposing [we]6069-we walk round [the grounds]6070-the grounds to pass the time , [[my]1018-the same carrier who had brought her pretty Coz]6071-my pretty coz ? "[1018-the same carrier who had brought her]

[Tess]198-tess wished to abridge [her]198-tess visit as much as possible ; but [the young man]471-the young man was pressing , and [she]198-tess consented to accompany [him]471-the young man . [He]471-the young man conducted [her]198-tess about the lawns , and flower - beds , and conservatories ; and thence to [the fruit - garden]1020-the fruit - garden and greenhouses , where [he]471-the young man asked [her]198-tess if [she]198-tess liked strawberries .

" Yes , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess , " when [they]6072-they come . "[198-tess]

" [They]6072-they are already [here]5975-here . "[230-d'urberville] [D'Urberville]230-d'urberville began gathering specimens of the fruit for [her]198-tess , handing them back to [her]198-tess as [he]471-the young man stooped ; and , presently , selecting a specially fine product of the " British Queen "[471-the young man] variety , [he]471-the young man stood up and held it by the stem to [her]198-tess mouth .

" No - no ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said quickly , putting [her]198-tess fingers between [his]471-the young man hand and [her]198-tess lips . " [I]198-tess would rather take it in [my]198-tess own hand . "[198-tess]

" Nonsense ! "[471-the young man] [he]471-the young man insisted ; and in a slight distress [she]198-tess parted [her]198-tess lips and took it in .

[They]1021-they had spent some time wandering desultorily thus , [Tess]198-tess eating in a half - pleased , half - reluctant state whatever [d'Urberville]471-the young man offered [her]198-tess . When [she]198-tess could consume no more of the strawberries [he]471-the young man filled [her]198-tess little basket with them ; and then [the two]1022-the two passed round to the rose - trees , whence [he]471-the young man gathered blossoms and gave [her]198-tess to put in [her]198-tess bosom . [She]198-tess obeyed like one in a dream , and when [she]198-tess could affix no more [he]471-the young man [himself]471-the young man tucked a bud or two into [her]198-tess hat , and heaped [her]198-tess basket with others in the prodigality of [his]471-the young man bounty . At last , looking at [his]471-the young man watch , [he]471-the young man said , " Now , by the time [you]198-tess have had something to eat , it will be time for [you]198-tess to leave , if [you]198-tess want to catch the carrier to [Shaston]2-shaston . Come here , and [I]471-the young man 'll see what grub [I]471-the young man can find . "[471-the young man]

[Stoke d'Urberville]226-stoke took [her]198-tess back to [the lawn]1023-the lawn and into [the tent]1005-the tent , where [he]471-the young man left [her]198-tess , soon reappearing with a basket of light luncheon , which [he]471-the young man put before [her]198-tess [himself]471-the young man . It was evidently [the gentleman]1007-the gentleman 's wish not to be disturbed in this pleasant tete - a - tete by [the servantry]1026-the servantry .

" Do [you]198-tess mind [my]471-the young man smoking ? "[471-the young man] [he]471-the young man asked .

" Oh , not at all , [sir]5821-sir . "[471-the young man]

[He]471-the young man watched [her]198-tess pretty and unconscious munching through the skeins of smoke that pervaded [the tent]1005-the tent , and [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess did not divine , as [she]198-tess innocently looked down at the roses in [her]198-tess bosom , that there behind the blue narcotic haze was potentially the " tragic mischief "[198-tess] of [her]198-tess drama - one who stood fair to be the blood - red ray in the spectrum of [her]198-tess young life . [She]198-tess had an attribute which amounted to a disadvantage just now ; and it was this that caused [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville 's eyes to rivet themselves upon [her]198-tess . It was a luxuriance of aspect , a fulness of growth , which made [her]198-tess appear more of [a woman]1028-a woman than [she]198-tess really was . [She]198-tess had inherited the feature from [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother without the quality it denoted . It had troubled [her]198-tess mind occasionally , till [[her]198-tess companions]558-her companions had said that it was a fault which time would cure .

[She]198-tess soon had finished [her]198-tess lunch . " Now [I]198-tess am going [home]5850-home , [sir]5821-sir , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , rising .

" And what do [they]558-her companions call [you]198-tess ? "[1031-he] [he]1031-he asked , as [he]1031-he accompanied [her]198-tess along [the drive]963-the drive till [they]1033-they were out of sight of [the house]652-the house .

" [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess , down at [Marlott]21-marlott . "[1031-he]

" And [you]1031-he say [[your]1031-he people]6077-your people have lost [their]6077-your people horse ? "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess - killed [him]223-prince ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess answered , [her]198-tess eyes filling with tears as [she]198-tess gave particulars of [Prince]223-prince 's death . " And [I]198-tess do n't know what to do for [father]5842-father on account of it ! "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess must think if [I]198-tess can not do something . [[My]198-tess mother]6050-my mother must find a berth for [you]198-tess . But , [Tess]198-tess , no nonsense about ' d'Urberville ' ; - ' [Durbeyfield]198-tess ' only , [you]198-tess know - quite another name . "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess wish for no better , [sir]5821-sir , "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess with something of dignity .

For a moment - only for a moment - when [they]1035-they were in the turning of [the drive]963-the drive , between the tall rhododendrons and conifers , before [the lodge]965-the lodge became visible , [he]223-prince inclined [his]223-prince face towards [her]198-tess as if - but , no : [he]223-prince thought better of it , and let [her]198-tess go .

Thus the thing began . Had [she]198-tess perceived this meeting 's import [she]198-tess might have asked why [she]198-tess was doomed to be seen and coveted that day by [the wrong man]1038-the wrong man , and not by [some other man]1039-some other man , [the right and desired one]1040-the right and desired one in all respects - as nearly as humanity can supply the right and desired ; yet to [[him]223-prince who amongst [her]198-tess acquaintance]1041-him who amongst her acquaintance might have approximated to this kind , [she]198-tess was but a transient impression , half forgotten .

In the ill - judged execution of the well - judged plan of things the call seldom produces [the comer]1042-the comer , [the man to love]1043-the man to love rarely coincides with the hour for loving . [Nature]231-nature does not often say " See ! "[231-nature] to [her]231-nature poor creature at a time when seeing can lead to happy doing ; or reply " Here ! "[231-nature] to a body 's cry of " Where ? "[231-nature] till the hide - and - seek has become an irksome , outworn game . [We]1044-we may wonder whether at the acme and summit of the human progress these anachronisms will be corrected by a finer intuition , a closer interaction of the social machinery than that which now jolts [us]1044-we round and along ; but such completeness is not to be prophesied , or even conceived as possible . Enough that in the present case , as in millions , it was not the two halves of a perfect whole that confronted each other at the perfect moment ; [a missing counterpart]1045-a missing counterpart wandered independently about [the earth]1046-the earth waiting in crass obtuseness till the late time came . Out of which maladroit delay sprang anxieties , disappointments , shocks , catastrophes , and passing - strange destinies .

When [d'Urberville]223-prince got back to [the tent]1005-the tent [he]223-prince sat down astride on a chair , reflecting , with a pleased gleam in [his]223-prince face . Then [he]223-prince broke into a loud laugh .

" Well , [I]223-prince 'm damned ! What a funny thing ! Ha - ha - ha ! And what [a crumby girl]6081-a crumby girl ! "[223-prince]

[VI

Tess]198-tess went down [the hill]642-the hill to [Trantridge Cross]47-trantridge cross , and inattentively waited to take [her]198-tess seat in [the van]945-the van returning from [Chaseborough]45-chaseborough to [Shaston]2-shaston . [She]198-tess did not know what [the other occupants]1050-the other occupants said to [her]198-tess as [she]198-tess entered , though [she]198-tess answered [them]1050-the other occupants ; and when [they]1050-the other occupants had started anew [she]198-tess rode along with an inward and not an outward eye .

[One among [[her]198-tess fellow - travellers]1052-her fellow - travellers]1051-one among her fellow - travellers addressed [her]198-tess more pointedly than any had spoken before : " Why , [you]198-tess be quite [a posy]6082-a posy ! And such roses in early June ! "[1051-one among her fellow - travellers]

Then [she]198-tess became aware of the spectacle [she]198-tess presented to [their]1050-the other occupants surprised vision : roses at [her]198-tess breasts ; roses in [her]198-tess hat ; roses and strawberries in [her]198-tess basket to the brim . [She]198-tess blushed , and said confusedly that the flowers had been given to [her]198-tess . When [the passengers]1053-the passengers were not looking [she]198-tess stealthily removed the more prominent blooms from [her]198-tess hat and placed them in the basket , where [she]198-tess covered them with [her]198-tess handkerchief . Then [she]198-tess fell to reflecting again , and in looking downwards a thorn of the rose remaining in [her]198-tess breast accidentally pricked [her]198-tess chin . Like [all the cottagers in [Blackmoor Vale]53-blackmoor vale]1054-all the cottagers in blackmoor vale , [Tess]198-tess was steeped in fancies and prefigurative superstitions ; [she]198-tess thought this an ill omen - the first [she]198-tess had noticed that day .

[The van]945-the van travelled only so far as [Shaston]2-shaston , and there were several miles of pedestrian descent from [that mountain - town]1056-that mountain - town into [the vale]917-the vale to [Marlott]21-marlott . [[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother had advised [her]198-tess to stay [here]5975-here for the night , at [the house of [a cottage - woman [they]1062-they knew]1061-a cottage - woman they knew , if [she]198-tess should feel too tired to come on]1060-the house of a cottage - woman they knew , if she should feel too tired to come on ; and this [Tess]198-tess did , not descending to [[her]198-tess home]1063-her home till the following afternoon .

" Oh yes ; [I]658-her mother know all about it ! [I]658-her mother told [']658-her mother [ee]658-her mother it would be all right , and now ' tis proved ! "[658-her mother]

" Since [I]198-tess 've been away ? What has ? "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess rather wearily .

[John Durbeyfield]192-john durbeyfield had more conceit than energy or health , and this supposition was pleasant to [him]192-john durbeyfield .

Meanwhile [Tess]198-tess was walking thoughtfully among the gooseberry - bushes in [the garden]881-the garden , and over [[Prince]223-prince 's grave]1092-prince 's grave . When [she]198-tess came in [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother pursued [her]658-her mother advantage .

[[Her]198-tess father]557-her father coughed in [his]557-her father chair .

" [I]647-the girl do n't know what to say ! "[647-the girl] answered [the girl]647-the girl restlessly . " It is for [you]658-her mother to decide . [I]647-the girl killed the old horse , and [I]647-the girl suppose [I]647-the girl ought to do something to get [ye]658-her mother a new one .
