[The children]700-the children , who had made use of this idea of [Tess]198-tess being taken up by [[their]700-the children wealthy kinsfolk]1097-their wealthy kinsfolk which [they]700-the children imagined [the other family]1098-the other family to be as a species of dolorifuge after the death of the horse , began to cry at [Tess]198-tess 's reluctance , and teased and reproached [her]198-tess for hesitating .

" [Tess]198-tess wo n't go - o - o and be made a la - a - dy of ! - no , [she]198-tess says [she]198-tess wo - o - on't ! "[700-the children] [they]700-the children wailed , with square mouths . " And [we]700-the children sha n't have a nice new horse , and lots o ' golden money to buy fairlings ! And [Tess]198-tess wo n't look pretty in [her]198-tess best cloze no mo - o - ore ! "[700-the children]

[[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother chimed in to the same tune : a certain way [she]658-her mother had of making [her]658-her mother labours in [the house]652-the house seem heavier than they were by prolonging them indefinitely , also weighed in the argument . [[Her]198-tess father]557-her father alone preserved an attitude of neutrality .

" [I]198-tess will go , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess at last .

[[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother could not repress [her]658-her mother consciousness of the nuptial vision conjured up by [the girl]647-the girl 's consent .

" That 's right ! For [such a pretty maid as ' tis]6128-such a pretty maid as ' tis , this is a fine chance ! "[658-her mother]

[Tess]198-tess smiled crossly .

" [I]198-tess hope it is a chance for earning money . It is no other kind of chance . [You]647-the girl had better say nothing of that silly sort about parish . "[198-tess]

[Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield did not promise . [She]180-mrs durbeyfield was not quite sure that [she]180-mrs durbeyfield did not feel proud enough , after [the visitor]1104-the visitor 's remarks , to say a good deal .

Thus it was arranged ; and [the young girl]1105-the young girl wrote , agreeing to be ready to set out on any day on which [she]1105-the young girl might be required . [She]180-mrs durbeyfield was duly informed that [Mrs d'Urberville]1106-mrs d'urberville was glad of [her]1106-mrs d'urberville decision , and that a spring - cart should be sent to meet [her]1106-mrs d'urberville and [her]1106-mrs d'urberville luggage at [the top of [the Vale]917-the vale]1107-the top of the vale on the day after the morrow , when [she]1106-mrs d'urberville must hold [herself]1106-mrs d'urberville prepared to start . [Mrs d'Urberville]1109-mrs d'urberville 's handwriting seemed rather masculine .

" [A cart]6129-a cart ? "[205-joan] murmured [Joan Durbeyfield]205-joan doubtingly . " It might have been [a carriage]5908-a carriage for [[her]1109-mrs d'urberville own kin]6131-her own kin ! "[205-joan]

Having at last taken [her]1105-the young girl course [Tess]198-tess was less restless and abstracted , going about [her]1105-the young girl business with some self - assurance in the thought of acquiring another horse for [[her]198-tess father]557-her father by an occupation which would not be onerous . [She]198-tess had hoped to be [a teacher at [the school]1112-the school]1111-a teacher at the school , but the fates seemed to decide otherwise . Being mentally older than [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother [she]198-tess did not regard [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield 's matrimonial hopes for [her]198-tess in a serious aspect for a moment . [The light - minded woman]1114-the light - minded woman had been discovering good matches for [[her]1114-the light - minded woman daughter]669-her daughter almost from the year of [her]198-tess birth .

VII

On the morning appointed for [her]198-tess departure [Tess]198-tess was awake before dawn - at the marginal minute of the dark when the grove is still mute , save for one prophetic bird who sings with a clear - voiced conviction that [he]557-her father at least knows the correct time of day , the rest preserving silence as if equally convinced that [he]557-her father is mistaken . [She]198-tess remained [upstairs]762-upstairs packing till breakfast - time , and then came down in [her]198-tess ordinary week - day clothes , [her]198-tess Sunday apparel being carefully folded in [her]198-tess box .

[[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother expostulated . " [You]198-tess will never set out to see [[your]198-tess folks]6132-your folks without dressing up more the dand than that ? "[658-her mother]

" But [I]198-tess am going to work ! "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess .

" Well , yes , "[180-mrs durbeyfield] said [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield ; and in a private tone , " at first there mid be a little pretence o't ... But [I]658-her mother think it will be wiser of ' [ee]6133-ee to put [your]6133-ee best side outward , "[658-her mother] [she]658-her mother added .

" Very well ; [I]198-tess suppose [you]658-her mother know best , "[198-tess] replied [Tess]198-tess with calm abandonment .

And to please [[her]198-tess parent]1118-her parent [the girl]647-the girl put [herself]647-the girl quite in [Joan]205-joan 's hands , saying serenely - " Do what [you]658-her mother like with [me]647-the girl , [mother]5917-mother . "[647-the girl]

[Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield was only too delighted at this tractability . First [she]180-mrs durbeyfield fetched a great basin , and washed [Tess]198-tess 's hair with such thoroughness that when dried and brushed it looked twice as much as at other times . [She]180-mrs durbeyfield tied it with a broader pink ribbon than usual . Then [she]180-mrs durbeyfield put upon [her]198-tess the white frock that [Tess]198-tess had worn at [the club]5905-the club - walking , the airy fulness of which , supplementing [her]198-tess enlarged coiffure , imparted to [her]198-tess developing figure an amplitude which belied [her]198-tess age , and might cause [her]198-tess to be estimated as [a woman]1028-a woman when [she]198-tess was not much more than [a child]1122-a child .

" [I]198-tess declare there 's a hole in [my]198-tess stocking - heel ! "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess .

" Never mind holes in [your]658-her mother stockings - [they]6135-they do n't speak ! When [I]198-tess was [a maid]6136-a maid , so long as [I]198-tess had a pretty bonnet [the devil]6137-the devil might ha ' found [me]198-tess in heels . "[198-tess]

[[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's pride in [the girl]647-the girl 's appearance led [her]198-tess to step back , like [a painter from [his]1125-a painter from his easel easel]1125-a painter from his easel , and survey [her]647-the girl work as a whole .

" [You]647-the girl must zee [yourself]647-the girl ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess cried . " It is much better than [you]647-the girl was t'other day . "[198-tess]

As the looking - glass was only large enough to reflect a very small portion of [[Tess]198-tess 's person]1126-tess 's person at one time , [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield hung a black cloak outside the casement , and so made a large reflector of the panes , as it is the wo nt of [bedecking cottagers]1127-bedecking cottagers to do . After this [she]198-tess went [downstairs]1128-downstairs to [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband , who was sitting in [the lower room]1130-the lower room .

" [I]198-tess 'll tell [']791-her husband [ee]791-her husband what ' tis , [Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield , "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess exultingly ; " [he]791-her husband 'll never have the heart not to love [her]198-tess . But whatever [you]180-mrs durbeyfield do , do n't zay too much to [Tess]198-tess of [his]791-her husband fancy for [her]198-tess , and this chance [she]198-tess has got . [She]198-tess is such [an odd maid]6138-an odd maid that it mid zet [her]198-tess against [him]791-her husband , or against going [there]5839-there , even now . If all goes well , [I]198-tess shall certainly be for making some return to [pa'son]191-pa'son tringham at [Stagfoot Lane]54-stagfoot lane for telling [us]6140-us - dear , [good man]6141-good man ! "[198-tess]

However , as the moment for [the girl]647-the girl 's setting out drew nigh , when the first excitement of the dressing had passed off , a slight misgiving found place in [Joan Durbeyfield]205-joan 's mind . It prompted [the matron]668-the matron to say that [she]668-the matron would walk a little way - as far as to the point where the acclivity from [the valley]496-the valley began its first steep ascent to [the outer world]672-the outer world . At the top [Tess]198-tess was going to be met with the spring - cart sent by [the Stoke - d'Urbervilles]989-the stoke - d'urbervilles , and [her]198-tess box had already been wheeled ahead towards this summit by [a lad with trucks , to be in readiness]1136-a lad with trucks , to be in readiness .

Seeing [[their]1137-our mother]1138-their mother put on [her]1138-their mother bonnet , [the younger children]704-the younger children clamoured to go with [her]1138-their mother .

" [I]704-the younger children do want to walk a little - ways wi ' [Sissy]234-sissy , now [she]234-sissy 's going to marry [[our]1137-our gentleman - cousin]6142-our gentleman - cousin , and wear fine cloze ! "[704-the younger children]

" Now , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess , flushing and turning quickly , " [I]198-tess 'll hear no more o ' that ! [Mother]228-mother , how could [you]228-mother ever put such stuff into [their]704-the younger children heads ? "[198-tess]

" Going to work , [[my]180-mrs durbeyfield dears]5915-my dears , for [[our]1137-our rich relation]6144-our rich relation , and help get enough money for a new horse , "[180-mrs durbeyfield] said [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield pacifically .

" Goodbye , [father]5842-father , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess , with a lumpy throat .

" Goodbye , [[my]177-sir john maid]6146-my maid , "[177-sir john] said [Sir John]177-sir john , raising [his]177-sir john head from [his]177-sir john breast as [he]177-sir john suspended [his]177-sir john nap , induced by a slight excess this morning in honour of the occasion . " Well , [I]177-sir john hope [[my]177-sir john young friend]6147-my young friend will like such a comely sample of [his]6147-my young friend own blood . And tell'n , [Tess]198-tess , that being sunk , quite , from [our]1137-our former grandeur , [I]177-sir john 'll sell [him]6147-my young friend the title - yes , sell it - and at no onreasonable figure . "[177-sir john]

" Not for less than a thousand pound ! "[235-lady durbeyfield] cried [Lady Durbeyfield]235-lady durbeyfield .

" [Tell'n]236-tell'n - [I]198-tess 'll take a thousand pound . Well , [I]198-tess 'll take less , when [I]198-tess come to think o't . [He]6147-my young friend 'll adorn it better than [a poor lammicken feller like [myself]198-tess]6148-a poor lammicken feller like myself can . Tell'n [he]6147-my young friend shall hae it for a hundred . But [I]198-tess wo n't stand upon trifles - tell'n [he]6147-my young friend shall hae it for fifty - for twenty pound ! Yes , twenty pound - that 's the lowest . Dammy , [family honour]6149-family honour is [family honour]6149-family honour , and [I]198-tess wo n't take a penny less ! "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess 's eyes were too full and [her]198-tess voice too choked to utter the sentiments that were in [her]198-tess . [She]198-tess turned quickly , and went out .

So [the girls]576-the girls and [[their]576-the girls mother]1138-their mother all walked together , [a child on each side of [Tess]198-tess]1142-a child on each side of tess , holding [her]198-tess hand and looking at [her]198-tess meditatively from time to time , as at [one who was about to do great things]1143-one who was about to do great things ; [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother just behind with the smallest ; [the group forming a picture of honest beauty flanked by innocence , and backed by simple - souled vanity]1145-the group forming a picture of honest beauty flanked by innocence , and backed by simple - souled vanity . [They]576-the girls followed the way till [they]576-the girls reached the beginning of the ascent , on the crest of which the vehicle from [Trantridge]38-trantridge was to receive [her]198-tess , this limit having been fixed to save the horse the labour of [the last slope]1146-the last slope . Far away behind the first hills [the cliff - like dwellings of [Shaston]2-shaston]1147-the cliff - like dwellings of shaston broke [the line of [the ridge]1149-the ridge]1148-the line of the ridge . [Nobody]754-nobody was visible in [the elevated road which skirted the ascent]1151-the elevated road which skirted the ascent save [the lad whom [they]576-the girls had sent on before [them]576-the girls , sitting on the handle of the barrow that contained all [Tess]198-tess 's worldly possessions]1152-the lad whom they had sent on before them , sitting on the handle of the barrow that contained all tess 's worldly possessions .

" Bide [here]5975-here a bit , and [the cart]857-the cart will soon come , no doubt , "[180-mrs durbeyfield] said [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield . " Yes , [I]180-mrs durbeyfield see it yonder ! "[180-mrs durbeyfield]

It had come - appearing suddenly from behind the forehead of [the nearest upland]1153-the nearest upland , and stopping beside [the boy with the barrow]1154-the boy with the barrow . [[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother and [the children thereupon]1156-the children thereupon decided to go no farther , and bidding [them]576-the girls a hasty goodbye , [Tess]198-tess bent [her]198-tess steps up [the hill]642-the hill .

[They]576-the girls saw [her]198-tess white shape draw near to the spring - cart , on which [her]198-tess box was already placed . But before [she]198-tess had quite reached [it]1158-it [another vehicle]1159-another vehicle shot out from a clump of trees on [the summit]1160-the summit , came round the bend of [the road]550-the road there , passed [the luggage - cart]1162-the luggage - cart , and halted beside [Tess]198-tess , who looked up as if in great surprise .

[[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother perceived , for the first time , that [the second vehicle]1164-the second vehicle was not a humble conveyance like the first , but a spick - and - span gig or [dog - cart]1165-dog - cart , highly varnished and equipped . [The driver]1166-the driver was [a young man of three- or four - and - twenty]1167-a young man of three- or four - and - twenty , with a cigar between [his]1166-the driver teeth ; wearing a dandy cap , drab jacket , breeches of the same hue , white neckcloth , stick - up collar , and brown driving - gloves - in short , [he]1166-the driver was [the handsome , horsey young buck who had visited [Joan]205-joan a week or two before to get [her]205-joan answer about [Tess]198-tess]1168-the handsome , horsey young buck who had visited joan a week or two before to get her answer about tess .

[Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield clapped [her]180-mrs durbeyfield hands like [a child]1122-a child . Then [she]180-mrs durbeyfield looked down , then stared again . Could [she]180-mrs durbeyfield be deceived as to the meaning of this ?

" Is dat [the gentleman - kinsman]6153-the gentleman - kinsman who 'll make [Sissy]234-sissy [a lady]6038-a lady ? "[1170-the youngest child] asked [the youngest child]1170-the youngest child .

Meanwhile the muslined form of [Tess]198-tess could be seen standing still , undecided , beside this turn - out , whose owner was talking to [her]198-tess . [Her]198-tess seeming indecision was , in fact , more than indecision : it was misgiving . [She]198-tess would have preferred [the humble cart]1171-the humble cart . [The young man]471-the young man dismounted , and appeared to urge [her]198-tess to ascend . [She]198-tess turned [her]198-tess face down [the hill]642-the hill to [[her]198-tess relatives]922-her relatives , and regarded [the little group]1175-the little group . Something seemed to quicken [her]198-tess to a determination ; possibly the thought that [she]198-tess had killed [Prince]223-prince . [She]198-tess suddenly stepped up ; [he]471-the young man mounted beside [her]198-tess , and immediately whipped on the horse . In a moment [they]1176-they had passed [the slow cart]1177-the slow cart with the box , and disappeared behind the shoulder of [the hill]642-the hill .

[Directly Tess]198-tess was out of sight , and the interest of the matter as a drama was at an end , [the little ones]1179-the little ones ' eyes filled with tears . [The youngest child]1170-the youngest child said , " [I]1170-the youngest child wish [poor , poor [Tess]198-tess]6155-poor , poor tess was n't gone away to be [a lady]6038-a lady ! "[1170-the youngest child] and , lowering the corners of [his]1170-the youngest child lips , burst out crying . The new point of view was infectious , and [the next child]1181-the next child did likewise , and then the next , till [the whole three of [them]1179-the little ones]1182-the whole three of them wailed loud .

There were tears also in [Joan Durbeyfield]205-joan 's eyes as [she]205-joan turned to go [home]5850-home . But by the time [she]205-joan had got back to [the village]473-the village [she]205-joan was passively trusting to the favour of accident . However , in bed that night [she]205-joan sighed , and [[her]205-joan husband]791-her husband asked [her]205-joan what was the matter .

" Oh , [I]205-joan do n't know exactly , "[205-joan] [she]205-joan said . " [I]205-joan was thinking that perhaps it would ha ' been better if [Tess]198-tess had not gone . "[205-joan]

" Ought n't [ye]205-joan to have thought of that before ? "[791-her husband]

" Well , ' tis a chance for [the maid]5971-the maid - Still , if ' twere the doing again , [I]205-joan would n't let [her]5971-the maid go till [I]205-joan had found out whether [the gentleman]1007-the gentleman is really [a good - hearted young man]6159-a good - hearted young man and choice over [her]5971-the maid as [[his]1007-the gentleman kinswoman]6160-his kinswoman . "[205-joan]

" Yes , [you]205-joan ought , perhaps , to [ha]6161-ha ' done that , "[177-sir john] snored [Sir John]177-sir john .

[Joan Durbeyfield]205-joan always managed to find consolation somewhere : " Well , as [one of the genuine stock]6162-one of the genuine stock , [she]5971-the maid ought to make [her]5971-the maid way with ' en , if [she]5971-the maid plays [her]5971-the maid trump card aright . And if [he]1007-the gentleman do n't marry [her]5971-the maid afore [he]1007-the gentleman will after . For that [he]1007-the gentleman 's all afire wi ' love for [her]5971-the maid any eye can see . "[205-joan]

" What 's [her]5971-the maid trump card ? [Her]5971-the maid d'Urberville blood , [you]367-alec d'urberville mean ? "[205-joan]

" No , [stupid]6163-stupid ; [her]5971-the maid face - as ' twas [mine]367-alec d'urberville . "[205-joan]

VIII

Having mounted beside [her]205-joan , [Alec]367-alec d'urberville d'Urberville drove rapidly along [the crest of [the first hill]1187-the first hill]1186-the crest of the first hill , chatting compliments to [Tess]198-tess as [they]1188-they went , [the cart]857-the cart with [her]198-tess box being left far behind . Rising still , an immense landscape stretched around [them]1188-they on every side ; behind , [the green valley of [her]205-joan birth]1190-the green valley of her birth , before , [a gray country of which [she]205-joan knew nothing except from [her]205-joan first brief visit to [Trantridge]38-trantridge]1191-a gray country of which she knew nothing except from her first brief visit to trantridge . Thus [they]1188-they reached the verge of an incline down which [the road]550-the road stretched in a long straight descent of nearly a mile .

Ever since the accident with [[her]205-joan father]557-her father 's horse [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess , courageous as [she]205-joan naturally was , had been exceedingly timid on wheels ; the least irregularity of motion startled [her]205-joan . [She]205-joan began to get uneasy at a certain recklessness in [[her]205-joan conductor]1194-her conductor 's driving .

" [You]230-d'urberville will go down slow , [sir]5821-sir , [I]205-joan suppose ? "[205-joan] [she]205-joan said with attempted unconcern .

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville looked round upon [her]205-joan , nipped [his]230-d'urberville cigar with the tips of [his]230-d'urberville large white centre - teeth , and allowed [his]230-d'urberville lips to smile slowly of themselves .

" Why , [Tess]198-tess , "[230-d'urberville] [he]230-d'urberville answered , after another whiff or two , " it is n't [a brave bouncing girl like [you]198-tess]6165-a brave bouncing girl like you who asks that ? Why , [I]230-d'urberville always go down at full gallop . There 's nothing like it for raising [your]198-tess spirits . "[230-d'urberville]

" But perhaps [you]230-d'urberville need not now ? "[230-d'urberville]

" Ah , "[230-d'urberville] [he]230-d'urberville said , shaking [his]230-d'urberville head , " there are [two to be reckoned with]6166-two to be reckoned with . It is not [me]230-d'urberville alone . [Tib]237-tib has to be considered , and [she]237-tib has a very queer temper . "[230-d'urberville]

" Who ? "[230-d'urberville]

" Why , [this mare]6167-this mare . [I]230-d'urberville fancy [she]6167-this mare looked round at [me]230-d'urberville in a very grim way just then . Did n't [you]230-d'urberville notice it ? "[230-d'urberville]

" Do n't try to frighten [me]198-tess , [sir]5821-sir , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess stiffly .

" Well , [I]230-d'urberville do n't . If [any living man]6169-any living man can manage this horse [I]230-d'urberville can : [I]230-d'urberville wo n't say [any living man]6169-any living man can do it - but if such has the power , [I]230-d'urberville am [he]6169-any living man . "[230-d'urberville]

" Why do [you]230-d'urberville have such a horse ? "[230-d'urberville]

" Ah , well may [you]230-d'urberville ask it ! It was [my]230-d'urberville fate , [I]230-d'urberville suppose . [Tib]237-tib has killed [one chap]6171-one chap ; and just after [I]230-d'urberville bought [her]6171-one chap [she]6171-one chap nearly killed [me]230-d'urberville . And then , take [my]230-d'urberville word for it , [I]230-d'urberville nearly killed [her]6171-one chap . But [she]6171-one chap 's touchy still , very touchy ; and [one]6172-one 's life is hardly safe behind [her]6171-one chap sometimes . "[230-d'urberville]

[They]1195-they were just beginning to descend ; and it was evident that the horse , whether of [her]1196-her own will or of [his]1197-he the latter being the more likely , knew so well the reckless performance expected of [her]1196-her that [she]1196-her hardly required a hint from behind .

Down , down , [they]1195-they sped , the wheels humming like a top , [the dog - cart]1198-the dog - cart rocking right and left , its axis acquiring a slightly oblique set in relation to the line of progress ; the figure of the horse rising and falling in undulations before [them]1195-they . Sometimes a wheel was off the ground , it seemed , for many yards ; sometimes a stone was sent spinning over the hedge , and flinty sparks from the horse 's hoofs outshone the daylight . The aspect of [the straight road]1199-the straight road enlarged with [their]1195-they advance , the two banks dividing like a splitting stick ; one rushing past at each shoulder .

The wind blew through [Tess]198-tess 's white muslin to [her]198-tess very skin , and [her]198-tess washed hair flew out behind . [She]198-tess was determined to show no open fear , but [she]198-tess clutched d'Urberville 's rein - arm .

" Do n't touch [my]198-tess arm ! [We]1195-they shall be thrown out if [you]1197-he do ! Hold on round [my]198-tess waist ! "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess grasped [his]1197-he waist , and so [they]1195-they reached the bottom .

" Safe , thank [God]222-god , in spite of [your]1197-he fooling ! "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess , [her]198-tess face on fire .

" [Tess]198-tess - fie ! that 's temper ! "[198-tess] said d'Urberville .

" ' Tis truth . "[198-tess]

" Well , [you]1197-he need not let go [your]1197-he hold of [me]198-tess so thanklessly the moment [you]1197-he feel [yourself]1197-he [our]6173-our of danger . "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess had not considered what [she]198-tess had been doing ; whether [he]1197-he were [man]970-man or [woman]744-woman , stick or stone , in [her]198-tess involuntary hold on [him]1197-he . Recovering [her]198-tess reserve , [she]198-tess sat without replying , and thus [they]1202-they reached [the summit of another declivity]1203-the summit of another declivity .

" Now then , again ! "[744-woman] said d'Urberville .

" No , no ! "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess . " Show more sense , do , please . "[198-tess]

" But when [people]5930-people find [themselves]5930-people on [one of the highest points in [the county]5889-the county]6175-one of the highest points in the county , [they]5930-people must get down again , "[1197-he] [he]1197-he retorted .

[He]1197-he loosened rein , and away [they]1202-they went a second time . [D'Urberville]230-d'urberville turned [his]1197-he face to [her]198-tess as [they]1202-they rocked , and said , in playful raillery : " Now then , put [your]198-tess arms round [my]1197-he waist again , as [you]198-tess did before , [[my]1197-he Beauty]6048-my beauty . "[1197-he]

" Never ! "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess independently , holding on as well as [she]198-tess could without touching [him]1197-he .

" Let [me]1197-he put one little kiss on those holmberry lips , [Tess]198-tess , or even on that warmed cheek , and [I]1197-he 'll stop - on [my]1197-he honour , [I]1197-he will ! "[1197-he]

[Tess]198-tess , surprised beyond measure , slid farther back still on [her]198-tess seat , at which [he]1197-he urged the horse anew , and rocked [her]198-tess the more .

" Will nothing else do ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess cried at length , in desperation , [her]198-tess large eyes staring at [him]1197-he like those of a wild animal . This dressing [her]198-tess up so prettily by [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother had apparently been to lamentable purpose .

" Nothing , dear [Tess]198-tess , "[1197-he] [he]1197-he replied .

" Oh , [I]198-tess do n't know - very well ; [I]198-tess do n't mind ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess panted miserably .

[He]1197-he drew rein , and as [they]1205-they slowed [he]1197-he was on the point of imprinting the desired salute , when , as if hardly yet aware of [her]198-tess own modesty , [she]198-tess dodged aside . [His]1197-he arms being occupied with the reins there was left [him]1197-he no power to prevent [her]198-tess manoeuvre .

" Now , damn it - [I]198-tess 'll break both [our]1205-they necks ! "[198-tess] swore [[her]198-tess capriciously passionate companion]1206-her capriciously passionate companion . " So [you]198-tess can go from [your]198-tess word like that , [[you]198-tess young witch]6178-you young witch , can [you]198-tess ? "[198-tess]

" Very well , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess , " [I]198-tess 'll not move since [you]1197-he be so determined ! But [I]198-tess - thought [you]1197-he would be kind to [me]198-tess , and protect [me]198-tess , as [[my]198-tess kinsman]6179-my kinsman ! "[198-tess]

" [Kinsman]6180-kinsman be hanged ! Now ! "[198-tess]

" But [I]198-tess do n't want [anybody]6181-anybody to kiss [me]198-tess , [sir]5821-sir ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess implored , a big tear beginning to roll down [her]198-tess face , and the corners of [her]198-tess mouth trembling in [her]198-tess attempts not to cry . " And [I]198-tess would n't ha ' come if [I]198-tess had known ! "[198-tess]

[He]1207-he was inexorable , and [she]198-tess sat still , and d'Urberville gave [her]198-tess the kiss of mastery . No sooner had [he]1207-he done so than [she]198-tess flushed with shame , took out [her]198-tess handkerchief , and wiped the spot on [her]198-tess cheek that had been touched by [his]1207-he lips . [His]1207-he ardour was nettled at the sight , for the act on [her]198-tess part had been unconsciously done .

" [You]198-tess are mighty sensitive for [a cottage girl]6183-a cottage girl ! "[471-the young man] said [the young man]471-the young man .

[Tess]198-tess made no reply to this remark , of which , indeed , [she]198-tess did not quite comprehend the drift , unheeding the snub [she]198-tess had administered by [her]198-tess instinctive rub upon [her]198-tess cheek . [She]198-tess had , in fact , undone the kiss , as far as such a thing was physically possible . With a dim sense that [he]1207-he was vexed [she]198-tess looked steadily ahead as [they]1209-they trotted on near [Melbury]55-melbury Down and [Wingreen]238-wingreen , till [she]198-tess saw , to [her]198-tess consternation , that there was yet another descent to be undergone .

" [You]198-tess shall be made sorry for that ! "[1207-he] [he]1207-he resumed , [his]1207-he injured tone still remaining , as [he]1207-he flourished the whip anew . " Unless , that is , [you]198-tess agree willingly to let [me]1207-he do it again , and no handkerchief . "[1207-he]

[She]198-tess sighed . " Very well , [sir]5821-sir ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said . " Oh - let [me]198-tess get [my]198-tess hat ! "[198-tess]

At the moment of speaking [her]198-tess hat had blown off into [the road]550-the road , [their]1209-they present speed on the upland being by no means slow . [D'Urberville]230-d'urberville pulled up , and said [he]1207-he would get it for [her]198-tess , but [Tess]198-tess was down on the other side .

[She]198-tess turned back and picked up the article .

" [You]198-tess look prettier with it off , upon [my]1207-he soul , if that 's possible , "[1207-he] [he]1207-he said , contemplating [her]198-tess over the back of [the vehicle]836-the vehicle . " Now then , up again ! What 's the matter ? "[1207-he]

The hat was in place and tied , but [Tess]198-tess had not stepped forward .

" No , [sir]5821-sir , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , revealing the red and ivory of [her]198-tess mouth as [her]198-tess eye lit in defiant triumph ; " not again , if [I]198-tess know it ! "[198-tess]

" What - [you]1207-he wo n't get up beside [me]198-tess ? "[198-tess]

" No ; [I]198-tess shall walk . "[198-tess]

" ' Tis five or six miles yet to [Trantridge]38-trantridge . "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess do n't care if ' tis dozens . Besides , [the cart]857-the cart is behind . "[198-tess]

" [[You]1207-he artful hussy]6187-you artful hussy ! Now , tell [me]198-tess - did n't [you]1207-he make that hat blow off on purpose ? [I]198-tess 'll swear [you]1207-he did ! "[198-tess]

[Her]198-tess strategic silence confirmed [his]1212-he suspicion .

Then [d'Urberville]230-d'urberville cursed and swore at [her]198-tess , and called [her]198-tess everything [he]1212-he could think of for the trick . Turning the horse suddenly [he]1212-he tried to drive back upon [her]198-tess , and so hem [her]198-tess in between the gig and the hedge . But [he]1212-he could not do this short of injuring [her]198-tess .

" [You]1212-he ought to be ashamed of [yourself]1212-he for using such wicked words ! "[198-tess] cried [Tess]198-tess with spirit , from the top of the hedge into which [she]198-tess had scrambled . " [I]198-tess do n't like ' [ee]6188-ee at all ! [I]198-tess hate and detest [you]1212-he ! [I]198-tess 'll go back to [mother]5917-mother , [I]198-tess will ! "[198-tess]

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville 's bad temper cleared up at sight of [hers]198-tess ; and [he]1212-he laughed heartily .

" Well , [I]1212-he like [you]198-tess all the better , "[1212-he] [he]1212-he said . " Come , let there be peace . [I]1212-he 'll never do it any more against [your]198-tess will . [My]1212-he life upon it now ! "[1212-he]

Still [Tess]198-tess could not be induced to remount . [She]198-tess did not , however , object to [his]1212-he keeping [his]1212-he gig alongside [her]198-tess ; and in this manner , at a slow pace , [they]1213-they advanced towards [the village of Trantridge]1214-the village of trantridge . From time to time [d'Urberville]198-tess exhibited a sort of fierce distress at the sight of the tramping [he]1212-he had driven [her]198-tess to undertake by [his]1212-he misdemeanour . [She]198-tess might in truth have safely trusted [him]1212-he now ; but [he]1212-he had forfeited [her]198-tess confidence for the time , and [she]198-tess kept on the ground progressing thoughtfully , as if wondering whether it would be wiser to return [home]5850-home . [Her]198-tess resolve , however , had been taken , and it seemed vacillating even to childishness to abandon it now , unless for graver reasons . How could [she]198-tess face [[her]198-tess parents]873-her parents , get back [her]198-tess box , and disconcert the whole scheme for the rehabilitation of [[her]198-tess family]1011-her family on such sentimental grounds ?

A few minutes later the chimneys of [The Slopes]48-the slopes appeared in view , and in [a snug nook to the right [the poultry - farm]1219-the poultry - farm and cottage of [Tess]198-tess ' destination]1218-a snug nook to the right the poultry - farm and cottage of tess ' destination .

IX

[The community of fowls to which [Tess]198-tess had been appointed as [supervisor]1221-supervisor , [purveyor]1222-purveyor , [nurse]1223-nurse , [surgeon]1224-surgeon , and [friend]1225-friend]1220-the community of fowls to which tess had been appointed as supervisor , purveyor , nurse , surgeon , and friend made [its]1220-the community of fowls to which tess had been appointed as supervisor , purveyor , nurse , surgeon , and friend headquarters in [an old thatched cottage]1226-an old thatched cottage standing in an enclosure that had once been [a garden]1227-a garden , but was now [a trampled and sanded square]1228-a trampled and sanded square . [The house]652-the house was overrun with ivy , [its]652-the house chimney being enlarged by the boughs of the parasite to the aspect of [a ruined tower]1230-a ruined tower . [The lower rooms]1231-the lower rooms were entirely given over to the birds , who walked about [them]1231-the lower rooms with a proprietary air , as though [the place]5882-the place had been built by [themselves]1233-themselves , and not by [certain dusty copyholders who now lay east and west in the churchyard]1234-certain dusty copyholders who now lay east and west in the churchyard . [The descendants of [these bygone owners]1236-these bygone owners]1235-the descendants of these bygone owners felt it almost as a slight to [[their]1235-the descendants of these bygone owners family]1237-their family when [the house which had so much of [their]1235-the descendants of these bygone owners affection]1238-the house which had so much of their affection , had cost so much of [[their]1235-the descendants of these bygone owners forefathers]1239-their forefathers ' money , and had been in [their]1235-the descendants of these bygone owners possession for several generations before [the d'Urbervilles]1240-the d'urbervilles came and built [here]5975-here , was indifferently turned into [a fowl - house]1242-a fowl - house by [Mrs Stoke]239-mrs stoke - d'Urberville as soon as [the property]1243-the property fell into hand according to law . " ' Twas good enough for [Christians]240-christians in [grandfather]458-grandfather 's time , "[1235-the descendants of these bygone owners] [they]1235-the descendants of these bygone owners said .

[The rooms wherein [dozens of infants]1245-dozens of infants had wailed at [their]1245-dozens of infants nursing]1244-the rooms wherein dozens of infants had wailed at their nursing now resounded with the tapping of nascent chicks . [Distracted hens in [coops]1247-coops]1246-distracted hens in coops occupied spots where formerly stood chairs supporting sedate agriculturists . The chimney - corner and once - blazing hearth was now filled with inverted beehives , in which the hens laid [their]1246-distracted hens in coops eggs ; while out of doors [the plots that [each succeeding householder]1249-each succeeding householder had carefully shaped with [his]1249-each succeeding householder spade]1248-the plots that each succeeding householder had carefully shaped with his spade were torn by the cocks in wildest fashion .

[The garden in which [the cottage]1251-the cottage stood]1250-the garden in which the cottage stood was surrounded by a wall , and could only be entered through a door .

When [Tess]198-tess had occupied [herself]198-tess about an hour the next morning in altering and improving the arrangements , according to [her]198-tess skilled ideas as [the daughter of [a professed poulterer]1253-a professed poulterer]1252-the daughter of a professed poulterer , the door in the wall opened and [a servant in white cap and apron]1254-a servant in white cap and apron entered . [She]198-tess had come from [the manor - house]1255-the manor - house .

" [Mrs d'Urberville]6191-mrs d'urberville wants the fowls as usual , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said ; but perceiving that [Tess]198-tess did not quite understand , [she]198-tess explained , " [Mis'ess]6192-mis'ess is [a old lady]6193-a old lady , and blind . "[198-tess]

" Blind ! "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess .

Almost before [her]198-tess misgiving at the news could find time to shape itself [she]198-tess took , under [[her]198-tess companion]1256-her companion 's direction , two of the most beautiful of the Hamburghs in [her]198-tess arms , and followed [the maid - servant , who had likewise taken two]1257-the maid - servant , who had likewise taken two , to [the adjacent mansion]1258-the adjacent mansion , which , though ornate and imposing , showed traces everywhere on this side that [some occupant of [[its]1258-the adjacent mansion chambers]1260-its chambers]1259-some occupant of its chambers could bend to the love of dumb creatures - feathers floating within view of the front , and hen - coops standing on the grass .

In [a sitting - room on the ground - floor]1261-a sitting - room on the ground - floor , ensconced in an armchair with [her]198-tess back to the light , was [the owner and mistress of [the estate]973-the estate]1262-the owner and mistress of the estate , [a white - haired woman of not more than sixty , or even less , wearing a large cap]1264-a white - haired woman of not more than sixty , or even less , wearing a large cap . [She]1264-a white - haired woman of not more than sixty , or even less , wearing a large cap had the mobile face frequent in [those whose sight has decayed by stages]1265-those whose sight has decayed by stages , has been laboriously striven after , and reluctantly let go , rather than the stagnant mien apparent in persons long sightless or born blind . [Tess]198-tess walked up to [this lady]1266-this lady with [her]198-tess feathered charges - one sitting on each arm .

" Ah , [you]1266-this lady are [the young woman]6194-the young woman come to look after [my]6191-mrs d'urberville birds ? "[6191-mrs d'urberville] said [Mrs d'Urberville]6191-mrs d'urberville , recognizing a new footstep . " [I]6191-mrs d'urberville hope [you]1266-this lady will be kind to [them]6195-them . [[My]6191-mrs d'urberville bailiff]6196-my bailiff tells [me]6191-mrs d'urberville [you]1266-this lady are quite [the proper person]6197-the proper person . Well , where are [they]6195-them ? Ah , this is [Strut]241-strut ! But [he]241-strut is hardly so lively to - day , is [he]241-strut ? [He]241-strut is alarmed at being handled by [a stranger]1085-a stranger , [I]6191-mrs d'urberville suppose . And [Phena]242-phena too - yes , [they]242-phena are a little frightened - are n't [you]1266-this lady , [dears]6199-dears ? But [they]242-phena will soon get used to [you]1266-this lady . "[6191-mrs d'urberville]

While [the old lady]1082-the old lady had been speaking [Tess]198-tess and [the other maid]1269-the other maid , in obedience to [her]1082-the old lady gestures , had placed the fowls severally in [her]1082-the old lady lap , and [she]1082-the old lady had felt them over from head to tail , examining [their]1270-their beaks , [their]1270-their combs , the manes of the cocks , [their]1270-their wings , and [their]1270-their claws . [Her]1082-the old lady touch enabled [her]1082-the old lady to recognize [them]1270-their in a moment , and to discover if a single feather were crippled or draggled . [She]1082-the old lady handled [their]1270-their crops , and knew what [they]1270-their had eaten , and if too little or too much ; [her]1082-the old lady face enacting a vivid pantomime of the criticisms passing in [her]1082-the old lady mind .

The birds that [the two girls]1271-the two girls had brought in were duly returned to [the yard]1272-the yard , and the process was repeated till all the pet cocks and hens had been submitted to [the old woman]1273-the old woman - [Hamburghs]243-hamburghs , [Bantams]1274-bantams , [Cochins]244-cochins , [Brahmas , Dorkings]1275-brahmas , dorkings , and such other sorts as were in fashion just then - [her]1082-the old lady perception of [each visitor]1276-each visitor being seldom at fault as [she]1082-the old lady received the bird upon [her]1082-the old lady knees .

It reminded [Tess]198-tess of a Confirmation , in which [Mrs d'Urberville]1277-mrs d'urberville was [the bishop]1278-the bishop , the fowls [the young people]1279-the young people presented , and [herself]1082-the old lady and [the maid]5971-the maid - servant [the parson and curate of [the parish]5847-the parish]1281-the parson and curate of the parish bringing [them]1279-the young people up . At the end of the ceremony [Mrs d'Urberville]1283-mrs d'urberville abruptly asked [Tess]198-tess , wrinkling and twitching [her]1273-the old woman face into undulations , " Can [you]198-tess whistle ? "[1273-the old woman]

" Whistle , [Ma'am]6200-ma'am ? "[1283-mrs d'urberville]

" Yes , whistle tunes . "[1273-the old woman]

[Tess]198-tess could whistle like [most other country - girls]1284-most other country - girls , though the accomplishment was one which [she]198-tess did not care to profess in genteel company . However , [she]198-tess blandly admitted that such was the fact .

" Then [you]198-tess will have to practise it every day . [I]1283-mrs d'urberville had a lad who did it very well , but [he]1283-mrs d'urberville has left . [I]1283-mrs d'urberville want [you]198-tess to whistle to [my]1283-mrs d'urberville bullfinches ; as [I]1283-mrs d'urberville can not see [them]1279-the young people , [I]1283-mrs d'urberville like to hear [them]1279-the young people , and [we]6201-we teach ['em]6202-'em airs that way . Tell [her]198-tess where [the cages]6203-the cages are , [Elizabeth]213-liza - lu . [You]198-tess must begin to - morrow , or [they]6203-the cages will go back in [their]6203-the cages piping . [They]6203-the cages have been neglected these several days . "[1283-mrs d'urberville]

" [Mr d'Urberville]6049-mr d'urberville whistled to 'em this morning , [ma'am]6200-ma'am , "[213-liza - lu] said [Elizabeth]213-liza - lu .

" [He]6049-mr d'urberville ! Pooh ! "[213-liza - lu]

[The old lady]1082-the old lady 's face creased into furrows of repugnance , and [she]1082-the old lady made no further reply .

Thus the reception of [Tess]198-tess by [[her]1082-the old lady fancied kinswoman]1286-her fancied kinswoman terminated , and the birds were taken back to [[their]1287-their quarters]1288-their quarters . [The girl]647-the girl 's surprise at [Mrs d'Urberville]1290-mrs d'urberville 's manner was not great ; for since seeing the size of [the house]652-the house [she]647-the girl had expected no more . But [she]647-the girl was far from being aware that [the old lady]1082-the old lady had never heard a word of [the so - called kinship]1293-the so - called kinship . [She]647-the girl gathered that no great affection flowed between [the blind woman]1294-the blind woman and [[her]1082-the old lady son]6089-her son . But in that , too , [she]647-the girl was mistaken . [Mrs d'Urberville]1296-mrs d'urberville was not [the first mother]1297-the first mother compelled to love [[her]1296-mrs d'urberville offspring]1298-her offspring resentfully , and to be bitterly fond .

In spite of the unpleasant initiation of the day before , [Tess]198-tess inclined to the freedom and novelty of [her]198-tess new position in the morning when the sun shone , now that [she]198-tess was once installed [there]5839-there ; and [she]198-tess was curious to test [her]198-tess powers in the unexpected direction asked of [her]198-tess , so as to ascertain [her]198-tess chance of retaining [her]198-tess post . As soon as [she]198-tess was alone within [the walled garden]1300-the walled garden [she]198-tess sat [herself]198-tess down on a coop , and seriously screwed up [her]198-tess mouth for the long - neglected practice . [She]198-tess found [her]198-tess former ability to have degenerated to the production of a hollow rush of wind through the lips , and no clear note at all .

[She]198-tess remained fruitlessly blowing and blowing , wondering how [she]198-tess could have so grown out of the art which had come by nature , till [she]198-tess became aware of a movement among the ivy - boughs which cloaked [the garden]881-the garden - wall no less then [the cottage]1251-the cottage . Looking that way [she]198-tess beheld a form springing from the coping to [the plot]1303-the plot . It was [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville , whom [she]198-tess had not set eyes on since [he]1304-i had conducted [her]198-tess the day before to the door of [[the gardener]1305-the gardener 's cottage where [she]198-tess had lodgings]1306-the gardener 's cottage where she had lodgings .

" Upon [my]1304-i honour ! "[1304-i] cried [he]1304-i , " there was never before such a beautiful thing in Nature or Art as [you]198-tess look , ' [Cousin]245-cousin ' [Tess]198-tess ' Cousin ' had a faint ring of mockery . [I]1304-i have been watching [you]198-tess from over the wall - sitting like [IM]246-im - patience on a monument , and pouting up that pretty red mouth to whistling shape , and whooing and whooing , and privately swearing , and never being able to produce a note . Why , [you]198-tess are quite cross because [you]198-tess ca n't do it . "[1304-i]

" [I]1304-i may be cross , but [I]1304-i did n't swear . "[1304-i]

" Ah ! [I]1304-i understand why [you]1304-i are trying - [those bullies]6206-those bullies ! [[My]1304-i mother]6050-my mother wants [you]198-tess to carry on [their]6206-those bullies musical education . How selfish of [her]6050-my mother ! As if attending to these curst cocks and hens here were not enough work for [any girl]6208-any girl . [I]1304-i would flatly refuse , if [I]1304-i were [you]1304-i . "[1304-i]

" But [she]6050-my mother wants [me]1304-i particularly to do it , and to be ready by to - morrow morning . "[1304-i]

" Does [she]6050-my mother ? Well then - [I]1304-i 'll give [you]1304-i a lesson or two . "[1304-i]

" Oh no , [you]1307-you wo n't ! "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess , withdrawing towards the door .

" Nonsense ; [I]1307-you do n't want to touch [you]1307-you . See - [I]1307-you 'll stand on this side of the wire - netting , and [you]1307-you can keep on the other ; so [you]1307-you may feel quite safe . Now , look here ; [you]1307-you screw up [your]1307-you lips too harshly . There ' tis - so . "[1307-you]

[He]1307-you suited the action to the word , and whistled a line of " Take , O take those lips away . "[1307-you] But the allusion was lost upon [Tess]198-tess .

" Now try , "[230-d'urberville] said [d'Urberville]230-d'urberville .

[She]198-tess attempted to look reserved ; [her]198-tess face put on a sculptural severity . But [he]1307-you persisted in [his]1307-you demand , and at last , to get rid of [him]1307-you , [she]198-tess did put up [her]198-tess lips as directed for producing a clear note ; laughing distressfully , however , and then blushing with vexation that [she]198-tess had laughed .

[He]1307-you encouraged [her]198-tess with " Try again ! "[1307-you]

[Tess]198-tess was quite serious , painfully serious by this time ; and [she]198-tess tried - ultimately and unexpectedly emitting a real round sound . The momentary pleasure of success got the better of [her]198-tess ; [her]198-tess eyes enlarged , and [she]198-tess involuntarily smiled in [his]1307-you face .

" That 's it ! Now [I]198-tess have started [you]1307-you - [you]1307-you 'll go on beautifully . There - [I]198-tess said [I]198-tess would not come near [you]1307-you ; and , in spite of such temptation as never before fell to [mortal man]6209-mortal man , [I]198-tess 'll keep [my]198-tess word ... [Tess]198-tess , do [you]1307-you think [[my]198-tess mother]6050-my mother a queer old soul ? "[198-tess]

" [I]1307-you do n't know much of [her]6050-my mother yet , [sir]5821-sir . "[1307-you]

" [You]1307-you 'll find [her]6050-my mother so ; [she]6050-my mother must be , to make [you]1307-you learn to whistle to [her]6050-my mother bullfinches . [I]198-tess am rather out of [her]6050-my mother books just now , but [you]1307-you will be quite in favour if [you]1307-you treat [her]6050-my mother live - stock well . Good morning . If [you]1307-you meet with any difficulties and want help here , do n't go to [the bailiff]6212-the bailiff , come to [me]198-tess . "[198-tess]

It was in the economy of [this regime]1308-this regime that [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess had undertaken to fill [a place]1309-a place . [Her]198-tess first day 's experiences were fairly typical of those which followed through many succeeding days . A familiarity with [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville 's presence - which [that young man]1310-that young man carefully cultivated in [her]198-tess by playful dialogue , and by jestingly calling [her]198-tess [[his]1310-that young man cousin]1311-his cousin when [they]1312-they were alone - removed much of [her]198-tess original shyness of [him]1310-that young man , without , however , implanting any feeling which could engender shyness of a new and tenderer kind . But [she]198-tess was more pliable under [his]1310-that young man hands than a mere companionship would have made [her]198-tess , owing to [her]198-tess unavoidable dependence upon [[his]1310-that young man mother]6090-his mother , and , through [that lady]5965-that lady 's comparative helplessness , upon [him]1310-that young man .

[She]198-tess soon found that whistling to the bullfinches in [[Mrs d'Urberville]1315-mrs d'urberville 's room]1316-mrs d'urberville 's room was no such onerous business when [she]198-tess had regained the art , for [she]198-tess had caught from [[her]198-tess musical mother]1317-her musical mother numerous airs that suited those songsters admirably . A far more satisfactory time than when [she]198-tess practised in [the garden]881-the garden was this whistling by the cages each morning . Unrestrained by [the young man]471-the young man 's presence [she]198-tess threw up [her]198-tess mouth , put [her]198-tess lips near the bars , and piped away in easeful grace to [the attentive listeners]1320-the attentive listeners .

[Mrs d'Urberville]1321-mrs d'urberville slept in [a large four - post bedstead hung with heavy damask curtains]1322-a large four - post bedstead hung with heavy damask curtains , and the bullfinches occupied [the same apartment]830-the same apartment , where [they]1324-they flitted about freely at certain hours , and made little white spots on the furniture and upholstery . Once while [Tess]198-tess was at the window where the cages were ranged , giving [her]198-tess lesson as usual , [she]198-tess thought [she]198-tess heard a rustling behind the bed . [The old lady]1082-the old lady was not present , and turning round [the girl]647-the girl had an impression that the toes of a pair of boots were visible below the fringe of the curtains . Thereupon [her]198-tess whistling became so disjointed that [the listener]1327-the listener , if such there were , must have discovered [her]198-tess suspicion of [his]471-the young man presence . [She]198-tess searched the curtains every morning after that , but never found [anybody within them]1328-anybody within them . [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville had evidently thought better of [his]471-the young man freak to terrify [her]198-tess by an ambush of that kind .

X

[Every village]1329-every village has [its]1329-every village idiosyncrasy , its constitution , often its own code of morality . The levity of [some of [the younger women in and about [Trantridge]38-trantridge]1331-the younger women in and about trantridge]1330-some of the younger women in and about trantridge was marked , and was perhaps symptomatic of the choice spirit who ruled [The Slopes in [that vicinity]1333-that vicinity]1332-the slopes in that vicinity . [The place]5882-the place had also a more abiding defect ; [it]5882-the place drank hard . The staple conversation on [the farms around]1335-the farms around was on the uselessness of saving money ; and [smock - frocked arithmeticians]1336-smock - frocked arithmeticians , leaning on [their]1336-smock - frocked arithmeticians ploughs or hoes , would enter into calculations of great nicety to prove that parish relief was a fuller provision for [a man]1337-a man in [his]1337-a man old age than any which could result from savings out of [their]1336-smock - frocked arithmeticians wages during a whole lifetime .

The chief pleasure of [these philosophers]1338-these philosophers lay in going every Saturday night , when work was done , to [Chaseborough]45-chaseborough , [a decayed market - town two or three miles distant]1339-a decayed market - town two or three miles distant ; and , returning in the small hours of the next morning , to spend Sunday in sleeping off the dyspeptic effects of the curious compounds sold to [them]1336-smock - frocked arithmeticians as beer by [the monopolizers of [the once - independent inns]1341-the once - independent inns]1340-the monopolizers of the once - independent inns .

For a long time [Tess]198-tess did not join in the weekly pilgrimages . But under pressure from [matrons not much older than [herself]198-tess]1342-matrons not much older than herself - for [a field - man]1343-a field - man 's wages being as high at twenty - one as at forty , marriage was early here - [Tess]198-tess at length consented to go . [Her]198-tess first experience of the journey afforded [her]198-tess more enjoyment than [she]198-tess had expected , the hilariousness of the others being quite contagious after [her]198-tess monotonous attention to [the poultry - farm]1219-the poultry - farm all the week . [She]198-tess went again and again . Being graceful and interesting , standing moreover on the momentary threshold of womanhood , [her]198-tess appearance drew down upon [her]198-tess some sly regards from loungers in [the streets of [Chaseborough]45-chaseborough]1345-the streets of chaseborough ; hence , though sometimes [her]198-tess journey to [the town]1346-the town was made independently , [she]198-tess always searched for [[her]198-tess fellows]1347-her fellows at nightfall , to have the protection of [their]1347-her fellows companionship homeward .

This had gone on for a month or two when there came a Saturday in September , on which a fair and a market coincided ; and [the pilgrims from [Trantridge]38-trantridge]1348-the pilgrims from trantridge sought double delights at [the inns]1349-the inns on that account . [Tess]198-tess 's occupations made [her]198-tess late in setting out , so that [[her]198-tess comrades]643-her comrades reached [the town]1346-the town long before [her]198-tess . It was a fine September evening , just before sunset , when yellow lights struggle with blue shades in hairlike lines , and the atmosphere itself forms a prospect without aid from more solid objects , except the innumerable winged insects that dance in it . Through this low - lit mistiness [Tess]198-tess walked leisurely along .

[She]198-tess did not discover the coincidence of [the market]1352-the market with the fair till [she]198-tess had reached [the place]5882-the place , by which time it was close upon dusk . [Her]198-tess limited marketing was soon completed ; and then as usual [she]198-tess began to look about for [some of [the Trantridge cottagers]1355-the trantridge cottagers]1354-some of the trantridge cottagers .

At first [she]198-tess could not find [them]1354-some of the trantridge cottagers , and [she]198-tess was informed that [most of [them]1354-some of the trantridge cottagers]1356-most of them had gone to what [they]1354-some of the trantridge cottagers called a private little jig at [the house of]1357-the house of [a hay - trusser and peat - dealer who had transactions with [[their]1354-some of the trantridge cottagers farm]1359-their farm]1358-a hay - trusser and peat - dealer who had transactions with their farm . [He]1360-he lived in [an out - of - the - way nook of [the townlet]1362-the townlet]1361-an out - of - the - way nook of the townlet , and in trying to find [her]198-tess course thither [her]198-tess eyes fell upon [Mr d'Urberville]1363-mr d'urberville standing at [a street corner]1364-a street corner .

" What - [my]1363-mr d'urberville Beauty ? [You]198-tess here so late ? "[1363-mr d'urberville] [he]1363-mr d'urberville said .

[She]198-tess told [him]1363-mr d'urberville that [she]198-tess was simply waiting for company homeward .

" [I]1363-mr d'urberville 'll see [you]198-tess again , "[1363-mr d'urberville] said [he]1363-mr d'urberville over [her]198-tess shoulder as [she]198-tess went on down [the back lane]1365-the back lane .

Approaching the [hay - trussers]1366-hay - trussers , [she]198-tess could hear the fiddled notes of a reel proceeding from [some building in the rear]1367-some building in the rear ; but no sound of dancing was audible - an exceptional state of things for [these parts]1368-these parts , where as a rule the stamping drowned the music . The front door being open [she]198-tess could see straight through [the house]652-the house into [the garden]881-the garden at the back as far as the shades of night would allow ; and nobody appearing to [her]198-tess knock , [she]198-tess traversed [the dwelling]1371-the dwelling and went up the path to [the outhouse]5951-the outhouse whence the sound had attracted [her]198-tess .

It was a windowless erection used for storage , and from the open door there floated into the obscurity a mist of yellow radiance , which at first [Tess]198-tess thought to be illuminated smoke . But on drawing nearer [she]198-tess perceived that it was a cloud of dust , lit by candles within [the outhouse]5951-the outhouse , whose beams upon the haze carried forward the outline of the doorway into the wide night of [the garden]881-the garden .

When [she]198-tess came close and looked in [she]198-tess beheld indistinct forms racing up and down to the figure of the dance , the silence of [their]1366-hay - trussers footfalls arising from [their]1366-hay - trussers being overshoe in ' scroff " - that is to say , the powdery residuum from the storage of peat and other products , the stirring of which by [their]1366-hay - trussers turbulent feet created the nebulosity that involved the scene . Through this floating , fusty debris of peat and hay , mixed with the perspirations and warmth of [the dancers , and forming together a sort of vegeto - human pollen , the muted fiddles]6213-the dancers , and forming together a sort of vegeto - human pollen , the muted fiddles feebly pushed [their]1366-hay - trussers notes , in marked contrast to the spirit with which the measure was trodden out . [They]1366-hay - trussers coughed as [they]1366-hay - trussers danced , and laughed as [they]1366-hay - trussers coughed . Of [the rushing couples]6214-the rushing couples there could barely be discerned more than the high lights - the indistinctness shaping [them]1366-hay - trussers to [satyrs clasping nymphs]6215-satyrs clasping nymphs - a multiplicity of Pans whirling a multiplicity of Syrinxes ; [Lotis]247-lotis attempting to elude [Priapus]248-priapus , and always failing .[1366-hay - trussers]

At intervals [a couple]1375-a couple would approach the doorway for air , and the haze no longer veiling [their]1375-a couple features , [the demigods]1376-the demigods resolved [themselves]1376-the demigods into [the homely personalities of [[her]198-tess own next - door neighbours]1378-her own next - door neighbours]1377-the homely personalities of her own next - door neighbours . Could [Trantridge]38-trantridge in two or three short hours have metamorphosed itself thus madly !

[Some Sileni of the throng]1379-some sileni of the throng sat on benches and hay - trusses by the wall ; and [one of [them]1379-some sileni of the throng]1380-one of them recognized [her]198-tess .

"[1380-one of them]

" But when be any of [you]1380-one of them going [home]5850-home ? "[198-tess] asked [Tess]198-tess with some anxiety .

" Now - a'most directly . This is all but the last jig . "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess waited . The reel drew to a close , and [some of [the party]1382-the party]1381-some of the party were in the mind of starting . But [others]1383-others would not , and another dance was formed . This surely would end it , thought [Tess]198-tess . But it merged in yet another . [She]198-tess became restless and uneasy ; yet , having waited so long , it was necessary to wait longer ; on account of the fair [the roads]928-the roads were dotted with [roving characters of possibly ill intent]1385-roving characters of possibly ill intent ; and , though not fearful of measurable dangers , [she]198-tess feared the unknown . Had [she]198-tess been near [Marlott]21-marlott [she]198-tess would have had less dread .

" Do n't [ye]198-tess be nervous , [[my]1386-his dear good soul]6225-my dear good soul , "[1386-his] expostulated , between [his]1386-his coughs , [a young man with a wet face]1387-a young man with a wet face and [his]1386-his straw hat so far back upon [his]1386-his head that the brim encircled it like the nimbus of [a saint]1388-a saint . [She]198-tess did not abhor dancing , but [she]198-tess was not going to dance here . The movement grew more passionate : the fiddlers behind the luminous pillar of cloud now and then varied the air by playing on the wrong side of [the bridge]1389-the bridge or with the back of the bow . But it did not matter ; the panting shapes spun onwards .

[They]1390-their did not vary [[their]1390-their partners]1391-their partners if [their]1390-their inclination were to stick to previous ones . [Changing partners]1392-changing partners simply meant that a satisfactory choice had not as yet been arrived at by one or other of [the pair]795-the pair , and by this time [every couple]1394-every couple had been suitably matched . It was then that the ecstasy and the dream began , in which emotion was the matter of [the universe]1395-the universe , and matter but an adventitious intrusion likely to hinder [you]1396-you from spinning where [you]1396-you wanted to spin .

Suddenly there was a dull thump on the ground : [a couple]1375-a couple had fallen , and lay in a mixed heap . [The next couple]1398-the next couple , unable to check its progress , came toppling over the obstacle . An inner cloud of dust rose around the prostrate figures amid [the general one of [the room]778-the room]1399-the general one of the room , in which a twitching entanglement of arms and legs was discernible .

" [You]1396-you shall catch it for this , [[my]1403-my gentleman]6227-my gentleman , when [you]1396-you get [home]5850-home ! "[1403-my] burst in female accents from the human heap - those of [the unhappy partner of [the man whose clumsiness had caused the mishap]1402-the man whose clumsiness had caused the mishap]1401-the unhappy partner of the man whose clumsiness had caused the mishap ; [she]1403-my happened also to be [[his]1402-the man whose clumsiness had caused the mishap recently married wife]1404-his recently married wife , in which assortment there was nothing unusual at [Trantridge]38-trantridge as long as any affection remained between [wedded couples]1405-wedded couples ; and , indeed , it was not uncustomary in [their]1375-a couple later lives , to avoid making odd lots of [the single people between whom there might be a warm understanding]1406-the single people between whom there might be a warm understanding .

A loud laugh from behind [Tess]198-tess 's back , in the shade of [the garden]881-the garden , united with the titter within [the room]778-the room . [She]198-tess was so tired after [her]198-tess long day and [her]198-tess walk that [she]198-tess confided [her]198-tess trouble to [him]1402-the man whose clumsiness had caused the mishap - that [she]198-tess had been waiting ever since [he]1402-the man whose clumsiness had caused the mishap saw [her]198-tess to have [[their]1409-their company]1410-their company [home]5850-home , because [the road]550-the road at night was strange to [her]198-tess . It was a three - mile walk , along [a dry white road]1421-a dry white road , made whiter to - night by the light of the moon .

[Tess]198-tess soon perceived as [she]198-tess walked in the flock , sometimes with this one , sometimes with that , that the fresh night air was producing staggerings and serpentine courses among [the men who had partaken too freely]1422-the men who had partaken too freely ; [some of [the more careless women]1424-the more careless women]1423-some of the more careless women also were wandering in [their]1423-some of the more careless women gait - to wit , a dark virago , [Car Darch]251-car , dubbed Queen of Spades , till lately a favourite of d'Urberville 's ; [Nancy]252-nancy , [[her]251-car sister]715-her sister , nicknamed [the Queen of Diamonds]1426-the queen of diamonds ; and [the young married woman who had already tumbled down]1427-the young married woman who had already tumbled down . Yet however terrestrial and lumpy [their]1416-the trantridge people appearance just now to the mean unglamoured eye , to [themselves]1416-the trantridge people the case was different . [They]1416-the trantridge people followed [the road]550-the road with a sensation that [they]1416-the trantridge people were soaring along in a supporting medium , possessed of original and profound thoughts , [themselves]1416-the trantridge people and surrounding nature forming an organism of which all the parts harmoniously and joyously interpenetrated each other . [They]1416-the trantridge people were as sublime as the moon and stars above [them]1416-the trantridge people , and the moon and stars were as ardent as [they]1416-the trantridge people .

[Tess]198-tess , however , had undergone such painful experiences of this kind in [[[her]198-tess father]557-her father 's house]1430-her father 's house that the discovery of [their]1416-the trantridge people condition spoilt the pleasure [she]198-tess was beginning to feel in the moonlight journey . Yet [she]198-tess stuck to [the party]1382-the party , for reasons above given .

In [the open highway]1432-the open highway [they]1416-the trantridge people had progressed in scattered order ; but now [their]1416-the trantridge people route was through [a field]1433-a field - gate , and [the foremost]1434-the foremost finding a difficulty in opening [it]1433-a field , [they]1416-the trantridge people closed up together .

[This leading pedestrian]1435-this leading pedestrian was [Car the Queen of Spades , who carried a wicker - basket containing [[her]1435-this leading pedestrian mother]658-her mother 's groceries , [her]1435-this leading pedestrian own draperies , and other purchases for the week]1436-car the queen of spades , who carried a wicker - basket containing her mother 's groceries , her own draperies , and other purchases for the week . The basket being large and heavy , [Car]251-car had placed it for convenience of porterage on the top of [her]1435-this leading pedestrian head , where it rode on in jeopardized balance as [she]1435-this leading pedestrian walked with arms akimbo .

" Well - whatever is that a - creeping down [thy]1435-this leading pedestrian back , [Car Darch]251-car ? "[1438-one of the group] said [one of [the group]616-the group]1438-one of the group suddenly .

[All]622-all looked at [Car]251-car . [Her]1435-this leading pedestrian gown was a light cotton print , and from the back of [her]1435-this leading pedestrian head a kind of rope could be seen descending to some distance below [her]1435-this leading pedestrian waist , like [a Chinaman]1441-a chinaman 's queue .

" ' Tis [her]1435-this leading pedestrian hair falling down , "[1438-one of the group] said another .

No ; it was not [her]1435-this leading pedestrian hair : it was a black stream of something oozing from [her]1435-this leading pedestrian basket , and it glistened like a slimy snake in the cold still rays of the moon .

" ' Tis treacle , "[1442-an observant matron] said [an observant matron]1442-an observant matron .

[Treacle]253-treacle it was . [[Car]251-car 's poor old grandmother]1443-car 's poor old grandmother had a weakness for the sweet stuff . Honey [she]1443-car 's poor old grandmother had in plenty out of [her]1443-car 's poor old grandmother own hives , but treacle was what [her]1443-car 's poor old grandmother soul desired , and [Car]251-car had been about to give [her]1443-car 's poor old grandmother a treat of surprise . Hastily lowering the basket [the dark girl]1444-the dark girl found that the vessel containing the syrup had been smashed within .

By this time there had arisen a shout of laughter at the extraordinary appearance of [Car]251-car 's back , which irritated [the dark queen]1445-the dark queen into getting rid of the disfigurement by the first sudden means available , and independently of the help of [the scoffers]1446-the scoffers . [She]1444-the dark girl rushed excitedly into the field [they]1447-they were about to cross , and flinging [herself]1444-the dark girl flat on [her]1444-the dark girl back upon the grass , began to wipe [her]1444-the dark girl gown as well as [she]1444-the dark girl could by spinning horizontally on the herbage and dragging [herself]1444-the dark girl over it upon [her]1444-the dark girl elbows .

The laughter rang louder ; [they]1447-they clung to the gate , to the posts , rested on [their]1447-they staves , in the weakness engendered by [their]1447-they convulsions at the spectacle of [Car]251-car . [[Our]1448-our heroine]1449-our heroine , who had hitherto held [her]1449-our heroine peace , at this wild moment could not help joining in with the rest .

It was a misfortune - in more ways than one . No sooner did [the dark queen]1445-the dark queen hear the soberer richer note of [Tess]198-tess among those of [the other work - people]1451-the other work - people than a long - smouldering sense of rivalry inflamed [her]1444-the dark girl to madness . " How darest th ' laugh at [me]1444-the dark girl , [hussy]6236-hussy ! "[1444-the dark girl] [she]1444-the dark girl cried .

" [I]198-tess could n't really help it when [t'others]6237-t'others did , "[198-tess] apologized [Tess]198-tess , still tittering .

" Ah , th'st think th ' beest everybody , dostn't , because [th ' beest]6238-th ' beest first favourite with [He]6237-t'others just now ! To [Tess]198-tess 's horror [the dark queen]1445-the dark queen began stripping off the bodice of [her]1445-the dark queen gown - which for the added reason of its ridiculed condition [she]1445-the dark queen was only too glad to be free of - till [she]1445-the dark queen had bared [her]1445-the dark queen plump neck , shoulders , and arms to the moonshine , under which [they]1453-they looked as luminous and beautiful as some Praxitelean creation , in [their]1453-they possession of the faultless rotundities of [a lusty country - girl]1454-a lusty country - girl .
