" Indeed , then , [I]462-the latter shall not fight ! "[462-the latter] said [the latter]462-the latter majestically ; " and if [I]462-the latter had know [you]198-tess was of that sort , [I]462-the latter would n't have so let [myself]462-the latter down as to come with such a whorage as this is ! "[462-the latter]

The rather too inclusive speech brought down a torrent of vituperation from other quarters upon [fair Tess]198-tess 's unlucky head , particularly from [the Queen of [Diamonds]56-diamonds , who having stood in the relations to d'Urberville that [Car]254-dark car had also been suspected of , united with [the latter]462-the latter against [the common enemy]1457-the common enemy]254-dark car . [Several other women]1458-several other women also chimed in , with an animus which none of [them]1458-several other women would have been so fatuous as to show but for the rollicking evening [they]1458-several other women had passed . Thereupon , finding [Tess]198-tess unfairly browbeaten , [the husbands]1459-the husbands and [lovers]1460-lovers tried to make peace by defending [her]198-tess ; but the result of that attempt was directly to increase the war .

[Tess]198-tess was indignant and ashamed . [She]198-tess no longer minded the loneliness of the way and the lateness of the hour ; [her]198-tess one object was to get away from [the whole crew]1461-the whole crew as soon as possible . [She]198-tess knew well enough that the better among [them]1461-the whole crew would repent of [their]1461-the whole crew passion next day . [They]1461-the whole crew were all now inside [the field]610-the field , and [she]198-tess was edging back to rush off alone when [a horseman]1463-a horseman emerged almost silently from the corner of the hedge that screened [the road]550-the road , and [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville looked round upon [them]1461-the whole crew .

" What the devil is all this row about , [work - folk]6240-work - folk ? "[1463-a horseman] [he]1463-a horseman asked .

The explanation was not readily forthcoming ; and , in truth , [he]1463-a horseman did not require any . Having heard [their]1461-the whole crew voices while yet some way off [he]1463-a horseman had ridden creepingly forward , and learnt enough to satisfy [himself]1463-a horseman .

[Tess]198-tess was standing apart from the rest , near the gate . [He]1463-a horseman bent over towards [her]198-tess . " Jump up behind [me]1463-a horseman , "[1463-a horseman] [he]1463-a horseman whispered , " and [we]6241-we 'll get shot of the screaming cats in a jiffy ! "[1463-a horseman]

[She]198-tess felt almost ready to faint , so vivid was [her]198-tess sense of the crisis . At almost any other moment of [her]198-tess life [she]198-tess would have refused such proffered aid and company , as [she]198-tess had refused them several times before ; and now the loneliness would not of itself have forced [her]198-tess to do otherwise . But coming as the invitation did at the particular juncture when fear and indignation at [these adversaries]1465-these adversaries could be transformed by a spring of the foot into a triumph over [them]1465-these adversaries , [she]198-tess abandoned [herself]198-tess to [her]198-tess impulse , climbed the gate , put [her]198-tess toe upon [his]1463-a horseman instep , and scrambled into the saddle behind [him]1463-a horseman . [The pair]795-the pair were speeding away into the distant gray by the time that [the contentious revellers]1467-the contentious revellers became aware of what had happened .

[The Queen of Spades]1468-the queen of spades forgot the stain on [her]1468-the queen of spades bodice , and stood beside [the Queen of Diamonds]1426-the queen of diamonds and [the new - married , staggering young woman]1470-the new - married , staggering young woman - all with a gaze of fixity in the direction in which the horse 's tramp was diminishing into silence on [the road]550-the road .

" What be [ye]1470-the new - married , staggering young woman looking at ? "[1472-a man who had not observed the incident] asked [a man who had not observed the incident]1472-a man who had not observed the incident .

" Ho - ho - ho ! "[254-dark car] laughed [dark Car]254-dark car .

" Hee - hee - hee ! "[1473-the tippling bride] laughed [the tippling bride]1473-the tippling bride , as [she]1473-the tippling bride steadied [herself]1473-the tippling bride on the arm of [[her]1473-the tippling bride fond husband]1474-her fond husband .

" Heu - heu - heu ! "[254-dark car] laughed [[dark Car]254-dark car 's mother]1475-dark car 's mother , stroking [her]1475-dark car 's mother moustache as [she]1475-dark car 's mother explained laconically : " Out of the frying - pan into the fire ! "[1475-dark car 's mother]

Then [these children of the open air , whom even excess of alcohol could scarce injure permanently]1476-these children of the open air , whom even excess of alcohol could scarce injure permanently , betook [themselves]1476-these children of the open air , whom even excess of alcohol could scarce injure permanently to [the field - path]1477-the field - path ; and as [they]1476-these children of the open air , whom even excess of alcohol could scarce injure permanently went there moved onward with [them]1476-these children of the open air , whom even excess of alcohol could scarce injure permanently , around the shadow of [each one]1478-each one 's head , a circle of opalized light , formed by the moon 's rays upon the glistening sheet of dew . [Each pedestrian]1479-each pedestrian could see no halo but [his]1480-his or [her]1481-her own , which never deserted the head - shadow , whatever its vulgar unsteadiness might be ; but adhered to it , and persistently beautified it ; till the erratic motions seemed an inherent part of the irradiation , and the fumes of [their]1476-these children of the open air , whom even excess of alcohol could scarce injure permanently breathing a component of the night 's mist ; and the spirit of the scene , and of the moonlight , and of Nature , seemed harmoniously to mingle with the spirit of wine .

[XI

The twain]255-xi the twain cantered along for some time without speech , [Tess]198-tess as [she]198-tess clung to [him]1474-her fond husband still panting in [her]198-tess triumph , yet in other respects dubious . [She]198-tess had perceived that the horse was not the spirited one [he]1474-her fond husband sometimes rose , and felt no alarm on that score , though [her]198-tess seat was precarious enough despite [her]198-tess tight hold of [him]1474-her fond husband . [She]198-tess begged [him]1474-her fond husband to slow the animal to a walk , which [Alec]367-alec d'urberville accordingly did .

" Neatly done , was it not , dear [Tess]198-tess ? "[1474-her fond husband] [he]1474-her fond husband said by and by .

" Yes ! "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess . " [I]1474-her fond husband am sure [I]1474-her fond husband ought to be much obliged to [you]1474-her fond husband . "[1474-her fond husband]

" And are [you]1474-her fond husband ? "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess did not reply .

" [Tess]198-tess , why do [you]198-tess always dislike [my]1474-her fond husband kissing [you]198-tess ? "[1474-her fond husband]

" [I]1474-her fond husband suppose - because [I]1474-her fond husband do n't love [you]198-tess . "[1474-her fond husband]

" [You]1474-her fond husband are quite sure ? "[1474-her fond husband]

" [I]1474-her fond husband am angry with [you]1474-her fond husband sometimes ! "[1474-her fond husband]

" Ah , [I]1474-her fond husband half feared as much . "[1474-her fond husband] Nevertheless , [Alec]367-alec d'urberville did not object to that confession . [He]1474-her fond husband knew that anything was better then frigidity . " Why have n't [you]198-tess told [me]1474-her fond husband when [I]1474-her fond husband have made [you]198-tess angry ? "[1474-her fond husband]

" [You]198-tess know very well why . Because [I]1474-her fond husband can not help [myself]1474-her fond husband here . "[1474-her fond husband]

" [I]1474-her fond husband have n't offended [you]1474-her fond husband often by love - making ? "[1474-her fond husband]

" [You]198-tess have sometimes . "[1474-her fond husband]

" How many times ? "[1474-her fond husband]

" [You]198-tess know as well as [I]1474-her fond husband - too many times . "[1474-her fond husband]

" Every time [I]1474-her fond husband have tried ? "[1474-her fond husband]

[She]1482-she was silent , and the horse ambled along for a considerable distance , till a faint luminous fog , which had hung in the hollows all the evening , became general and enveloped [them]1483-them . It seemed to hold the moonlight in suspension , rendering it more pervasive than in clear air . Whether on this account , or from absent - mindedness , or from sleepiness , [she]1482-she did not perceive that [they]1483-them had long ago passed the point at which [the lane]631-the lane to [Trantridge]38-trantridge branched from [the highway]598-the highway , and that [[her]1482-she conductor]1194-her conductor had not taken [the Trantridge track]1487-the trantridge track .

[She]1482-she was inexpressibly weary . [She]1482-she had risen at five o'clock every morning of that week , had been on foot the whole of each day , and on this evening had in addition walked the three miles to [Chaseborough]45-chaseborough , waited three hours for [[her]1482-she neighbours]1488-her neighbours without eating or drinking , [her]1482-she impatience to start [them]1488-her neighbours preventing either ; [she]1482-she had then walked a mile of the way [home]5850-home , and had undergone the excitement of the quarrel , till , with the slow progress of [their]1483-them steed , it was now nearly one o'clock . Only once , however , was [she]1482-she overcome by actual drowsiness . In that moment of oblivion [her]1482-she head sank gently against [him]1490-you .

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville stopped the horse , withdrew [his]1490-you feet from the stirrups , turned sideways on the saddle , and enclosed [her]1482-she waist with [his]1490-you arm to support [her]1482-she .

This immediately put [her]1482-she on the defensive , and with one of those sudden impulses of reprisal to which [she]1482-she was liable [she]1482-she gave [him]1490-you a little push from [her]1482-she . In [his]1490-you ticklish position [he]1490-you nearly lost [his]1490-you balance and only just avoided rolling over into [the road]550-the road , the horse , though [a powerful one]1492-a powerful one , being fortunately the quietest [he]1490-you rode .

" That is devilish unkind ! "[1490-you] [he]1490-you said . " [I]1490-you mean no harm - only to keep [you]1482-she from falling . "[1490-you]

[She]1482-she pondered suspiciously , till , thinking that this might after all be true , [she]1482-she relented , and said quite humbly , " [I]1482-she beg [your]1490-you pardon , [sir]5821-sir . "[1482-she]

" [I]1490-you wo n't pardon [you]1490-you unless [you]1490-you show some confidence in [me]1490-you . Good God ! "[1490-you] [he]1490-you burst out , " what am [I]1482-she , to be repulsed so by a mere chit like [you]1482-she ? For near three mortal months have [you]1490-you trifled with [my]1482-she feelings , eluded [me]1482-she , and snubbed [me]1482-she ; and [I]1482-she wo n't stand it ! "[1482-she]

" [I]1482-she 'll leave [you]1490-you to - morrow , [sir]5821-sir . "[1482-she]

" No , [you]1490-you will not leave [me]1482-she to - morrow ! Will [you]1490-you , [I]1482-she ask once more , show [your]1490-you belief in [me]1482-she by letting [me]1482-she clasp [you]1490-you with [my]1482-she arm ? Come , between [us]6244-us two and [nobody else]6245-nobody else , now . [We]6244-us know [each other]577-each other well ; and [you]1490-you know that [I]1482-she love [you]1490-you , and think [you]1490-you [the prettiest girl in [the world]497-the world]6247-the prettiest girl in the world , which [you]1490-you are . May n't [I]1482-she treat [you]1490-you as [a lover]6249-a lover ? "[1482-she]

[She]1493-i drew a quick pettish breath of objection , writhing uneasily on [her]1493-i seat , looked far ahead , and murmured , " [I]1493-i do n't know - [I]1493-i wish - how can [I]1493-i say yes or no when - "[1493-i]

[He]1494-you settled the matter by clasping [his]1494-you arm round [her]1493-i as [he]1494-you desired , and [Tess]198-tess expressed no further negative . Thus [they]1495-we sidled slowly onward till it struck [her]1493-i [they]1495-we had been advancing for an unconscionable time - far longer than was usually occupied by the short journey from [Chaseborough]45-chaseborough , even at this walking pace , and that [they]1495-we were no longer on [hard road]1496-hard road , but in [a mere trackway]1497-a mere trackway .

" Why , where be [we]1495-we ? "[1493-i] [she]1493-i exclaimed .

" Passing by a wood . "[1493-i]

" A wood - what wood ? Surely [we]1495-we are quite out of [the road]550-the road ? "[1493-i]

" A bit of [The Chase]39-the chase - [the oldest wood in [England]10-england]6251-the oldest wood in england . It is a lovely night , and why should [we]1495-we not prolong [our]1495-we ride a little ? "[1493-i]

" How could [you]1494-you be so treacherous ! "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess , between archness and real dismay , and getting rid of [his]1494-you arm by pulling open [his]1494-you fingers one by one , though at the risk of slipping off [herself]198-tess . " Just when [I]198-tess 've been putting such trust in [you]1494-you , and obliging [you]1494-you to please [you]1494-you , because [I]198-tess thought [I]198-tess had wronged [you]1494-you by that push ! Please set [me]198-tess down , and let [me]198-tess walk [home]5850-home . "[198-tess]

" [You]1494-you can not walk [home]5850-home , [darling]6254-darling , even if the air were clear . [We]1495-we are miles away from [Trantridge]38-trantridge , if [I]1493-i must tell [you]1494-you , and in this growing fog [you]1494-you might wander for hours among these trees . "[1493-i]

" Never mind that , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess coaxed . " Put [me]198-tess down , [I]198-tess beg [you]1494-you . [I]198-tess do n't mind where it is ; only let [me]198-tess get down , [sir]5821-sir , please ! "[198-tess]

" Very well , then , [I]1493-i will - on one condition . Having brought [you]1494-you here to [this out - of - the - way place]6256-this out - of - the - way place , [I]1493-i feel [myself]1493-i responsible for [[your]1494-you safe - conduct [home]5850-home]6257-your safe - conduct home , whatever [you]1494-you may [yourself]1494-you feel about it . As to [your]1494-you getting to [Trantridge]38-trantridge without assistance , it is quite impossible ; for , to tell the truth , [dear]6259-dear , owing to this fog , which so disguises everything , [I]1493-i do n't quite know where [we]6260-we are [myself]1493-i . Now , if [you]1494-you will promise to wait beside the horse while [I]1493-i walk through the bushes till [I]1493-i come to [some road]6261-some road or [house]5948-house , and ascertain exactly [our]6260-we whereabouts , [I]1493-i 'll deposit [you]1494-you [here]5975-here willingly . When [I]1493-i come back [I]1493-i 'll give [you]1494-you full directions , and if [you]1494-you insist upon walking [you]1494-you may ; or [you]1494-you may ride - at [your]1494-you pleasure . "[1493-i]

[She]1498-i accepted these terms , and slid off on the near side , though not till [he]1499-he had stolen a cursory kiss . [He]1499-he sprang down on the other side .

" [I]1498-i suppose [I]1498-i must hold the horse ? "[1498-i] said [she]1498-i .

" Oh no ; it 's not necessary , "[367-alec d'urberville] replied [Alec]367-alec d'urberville , patting [the panting creature]1500-the panting creature . " [He]1499-he 's had enough of it for to - night . "[367-alec d'urberville]

[He]1499-he turned the horse 's head into the bushes , hitched [him]1500-the panting creature on to a bough , and made a sort of couch or nest for [her]1498-i in the deep mass of dead leaves .

" Now , [you]1498-i sit there , "[1499-he] [he]1499-he said . " The leaves have not got damp as yet . Just give an eye to the horse - it will be quite sufficient . "[1499-he]

[He]1499-he took a few steps away from [her]1498-i , but , returning , said , " By the bye , [Tess]198-tess , [[your]1498-i father]5918-your father has a new cob to - day . [Somebody]6000-somebody gave it to [him]5918-your father . "[1499-he]

" [Somebody]6000-somebody ? [You]1498-i ! "[1499-he]

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville nodded .

" O how very good of [you]1499-he that is ! "[1498-i] [she]1498-i exclaimed , with a painful sense of the awkwardness of having to thank [him]1499-he just then .

" And [the children]700-the children have some toys . "[1499-he]

" [I]1498-i did n't know - [you]1499-he ever sent [them]700-the children anything ! "[1498-i] [she]1498-i murmured , much moved . " [I]1498-i almost wish [you]1499-he had not - yes , [I]1498-i almost wish it ! "[1498-i]

" Why , [dear]6259-dear ? "[1499-he]

" It - hampers [me]1498-i so . "[1498-i]

" [Tessy]256-tessy - do n't [you]256-tessy love [me]1499-he ever so little now ? "[1499-he]

" [I]1498-i 'm grateful , "[1498-i] [she]1498-i reluctantly admitted . " But [I]1498-i fear [I]1498-i do not - "[1498-i] The sudden vision of [his]1499-he passion for [herself]1498-i as a factor in this result so distressed [her]1498-i that , beginning with one slow tear , and then following with another , [she]1498-i wept outright .

" Do n't cry , [dear]6259-dear , [dear one]6270-dear one ! Now sit down here , and wait till [I]1498-i come . "[1498-i] [She]1498-i passively sat down amid the leaves [he]1499-he had heaped , and shivered slightly . " Are [you]1498-i cold ? "[1499-he] [he]1499-he asked .

" Not very - a little . "[1499-he]

[He]1499-he touched [her]1498-i with [his]1499-he fingers , which sank into [her]1498-i as into down . " [You]1498-i have only that puffy muslin dress on - how 's that ? "[1499-he]

" It 's [my]1499-he best summer one . ' Twas very warm when [I]1499-he started , and [I]1499-he did n't know [I]1499-he was going to ride , and that it would be night . "[1499-he]

" Nights grow chilly in September . Let [me]1499-he see . "[1499-he] [He]1499-he pulled off a light overcoat that [he]1499-he had worn , and put it round [her]1498-i tenderly . " That 's it - now [you]1498-i 'll feel warmer , "[1499-he] [he]1499-he continued . " Now , [[my]1499-he pretty]6271-my pretty , rest there ; [I]1499-he shall soon be back again . "[1499-he]

Having buttoned the overcoat round [her]1498-i shoulders [he]1499-he plunged into the webs of vapour which by this time formed veils between the trees . [She]1498-i could hear the rustling of the branches as [he]1499-he ascended the adjoining slope , till [his]1499-he movements were no louder than the hopping of a bird , and finally died away . With the setting of the moon the pale light lessened , and [Tess]198-tess became invisible as [she]198-tess fell into reverie upon the leaves where [he]1499-he had left [her]198-tess .

In the meantime [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville had pushed on up [the slope]1501-the slope to clear [his]1499-he genuine doubt as to the quarter of The Chase [they]1502-they were in . [He]1499-he had , in fact , ridden quite at random for over an hour , taking any turning that came to hand in order to prolong companionship with [her]1498-i , and giving far more attention to [[Tess]198-tess 's moonlit person]1503-tess 's moonlit person than to any wayside object . A little rest for the jaded animal being desirable , [he]1499-he did not hasten [his]1499-he search for landmarks . A clamber over [the hill]642-the hill into [the adjoining vale]1505-the adjoining vale brought [him]1499-he to the fence of [a highway whose contours]1506-a highway whose contours [he]1499-he recognized , which settled the question of [their]1502-they whereabouts . [D'Urberville]230-d'urberville thereupon turned back ; but by this time the moon had quite gone down , and partly on account of the fog [The Chase]39-the chase was wrapped in thick darkness , although morning was not far off . [He]230-d'urberville was obliged to advance with outstretched hands to avoid contact with the boughs , and discovered that to hit the exact spot from which [he]230-d'urberville had started was at first entirely beyond [him]230-d'urberville . Roaming up and down , round and round , [he]230-d'urberville at length heard a slight movement of the horse close at hand ; and the sleeve of [his]1499-he overcoat unexpectedly caught [his]1499-he foot .

" [Tess]198-tess ! "[230-d'urberville] said [d'Urberville]230-d'urberville .

There was no answer . The obscurity was now so great that [he]230-d'urberville could see absolutely nothing but a pale nebulousness at [his]230-d'urberville feet , which represented the white muslin figure [he]230-d'urberville had left upon the dead leaves . Everything else was blackness alike . [D'Urberville]230-d'urberville stooped ; and heard a gentle regular breathing . [He]230-d'urberville knelt and bent lower , till [her]1507-her breath warmed [his]230-d'urberville face , and in a moment [his]230-d'urberville cheek was in contact with [hers]1507-her . [She]1507-her was sleeping soundly , and upon [her]1507-her eyelashes there lingered tears .

Darkness and silence ruled everywhere around . Above [them]1508-them rose the primeval yews and oaks of The Chase , in which there poised gentle roosting birds in [their]1509-their last nap ; and about [them]1509-their stole the hopping rabbits and hares . But , might some say , where was [[Tess]198-tess 's guardian angel]1510-tess 's guardian angel ? where was the providence of [her]1507-her simple faith ? Perhaps , like [that other god of whom [the ironical Tishbite]257-the ironical tishbite]1511-that other god of whom the ironical tishbite spoke , [he]1511-that other god of whom the ironical tishbite was talking , or [he]1511-that other god of whom the ironical tishbite was pursuing , or [he]1511-that other god of whom the ironical tishbite was in a journey , or [he]1511-that other god of whom the ironical tishbite was sleeping and not to be awaked .

Why it was that upon [this beautiful feminine tissue , sensitive as gossamer , and practically blank as snow as yet]1512-this beautiful feminine tissue , sensitive as gossamer , and practically blank as snow as yet , there should have been traced such a coarse pattern as it was doomed to receive ; why so often the coarse appropriates the finer thus , [the wrong man]1038-the wrong man [the woman]674-the woman , [the wrong woman]1515-the wrong woman [the man]1516-the man , many thousand years of analytical philosophy have failed to explain to [our]1517-our sense of order . [One]6172-one may , indeed , admit the possibility of a retribution lurking in the present catastrophe . Doubtless [some of [[Tess d'Urberville]198-tess 's mailed ancestors]1520-tess d'urberville 's mailed ancestors rollicking [home]5850-home from a fray]1519-some of tess d'urberville 's mailed ancestors rollicking home from a fray had dealt the same measure even more ruthlessly towards [peasant girls]1522-peasant girls of [their]1519-some of tess d'urberville 's mailed ancestors rollicking home from a fray time . But though to visit the sins of [the fathers]1523-the fathers upon [the children]700-the children may be a morality good enough for divinities , it is scorned by average human nature ; and it therefore does not mend the matter .

As [[Tess]198-tess 's own people]1525-tess 's own people down in [those retreats]1526-those retreats are never tired of saying among each other in [their]1525-tess 's own people fatalistic way : " It was to be . "[1525-tess 's own people] There lay the pity of it . An immeasurable social chasm was to divide [[our]1517-our heroine]1449-our heroine 's personality thereafter from [that previous self of hers who stepped from [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's door to try [her]198-tess fortune at [Trantridge poultry - farm]1530-trantridge poultry - farm]1528-that previous self of hers who stepped from her mother 's door to try her fortune at trantridge poultry - farm .

END OF PHASE THE FIRST

Phase the Second : [Maiden]176-maiden No More

XII

The basket was heavy and the bundle was large , but [she]198-tess lugged [them]1531-them along like [a person who did not find [her]198-tess especial burden in material things]1532-a person who did not find her especial burden in material things . Occasionally [she]198-tess stopped to rest in a mechanical way by some gate or post ; and then , giving the baggage another hitch upon [her]198-tess full round arm , went steadily on again .

It was a Sunday morning in late October , about four months after [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess 's arrival at [Trantridge]38-trantridge , and some few weeks subsequent to the night ride in [The Chase]39-the chase . The time was not long past daybreak , and the yellow luminosity upon the horizon behind [her]198-tess back lighted the ridge towards which [her]198-tess face was set - the barrier of [the vale wherein [she]198-tess had of late been [a stranger]1085-a stranger - which [she]198-tess would have to climb over to reach [[her]198-tess birthplace]1535-her birthplace]1533-the vale wherein she had of late been a stranger - which she would have to climb over to reach her birthplace . The ascent was gradual on this side , and [the soil]1536-the soil and scenery differed much from those within [Blakemore Vale]58-blakemore vale . Even the character and accent of [the two peoples]1537-the two peoples had shades of difference , despite the amalgamating effects of a roundabout railway ; so that , though less than twenty miles from the place of [her]198-tess sojourn at [Trantridge]38-trantridge , [[her]198-tess native village]1538-her native village had seemed [a far - away spot]1539-a far - away spot . [The field - folk shut in]1540-the field - folk shut in [there]5839-there traded northward and westward , travelled , courted , and married northward and westward , thought northward and westward ; [those on this side]1542-those on this side mainly directed [their]1542-those on this side energies and attention to the east and south .

The incline was the same down which d'Urberville had driven [her]198-tess so wildly on that day in June . [Tess]198-tess went up the remainder of [its]5839-there length without stopping , and on reaching the edge of [the escarpment]1543-the escarpment gazed over [the familiar green world beyond]1544-the familiar green world beyond , now half - veiled in mist . It was always beautiful from here ; it was terribly beautiful to [Tess]198-tess to - day , for since [her]198-tess eyes last fell upon it [she]198-tess had learnt that the serpent hisses where the sweet birds sing , and [her]198-tess views of life had been totally changed for [her]198-tess by the lesson . Verily [another girl than the simple one [she]198-tess had been at [home]5850-home]1545-another girl than the simple one she had been at home was [she]198-tess who , bowed by thought , stood still here , and turned to look behind [her]198-tess . [She]198-tess could not bear to look forward into [the Vale]30-the vale .

Ascending by [the long white road that [Tess]198-tess [herself]198-tess had just laboured up]1547-the long white road that tess herself had just laboured up , [she]198-tess saw [a two - wheeled vehicle]1548-a two - wheeled vehicle , beside which walked [a man]1337-a man , who held up [his]1337-a man hand to attract [her]198-tess attention .

[She]198-tess obeyed the signal to wait for [him]1337-a man with unspeculative repose , and in a few minutes [man]970-man and horse stopped beside [her]198-tess .

" Why did [you]198-tess slip away by stealth like this ? "[1551-d'urberville] said [d'Urberville]1551-d'urberville , with upbraiding breathlessness ; " on a Sunday morning , too , when [people]5930-people were all in bed ! [I]1551-d'urberville only discovered it by accident , and [I]1551-d'urberville have been driving like the deuce to overtake [you]198-tess . Just look at the mare . Why go off like this ? [You]198-tess know that [nobody]754-nobody wished to hinder [your]198-tess going . And how unnecessary it has been for [you]198-tess to toil along on foot , and encumber [yourself]198-tess with this heavy load ! [I]1551-d'urberville have followed like [a madman]6274-a madman , simply to drive [you]198-tess the rest of the distance , if [you]198-tess wo n't come back . "[1551-d'urberville]

" [I]198-tess sha n't come back , "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess .

" [I]198-tess thought [you]198-tess would n't - [I]198-tess said so ! Well , then , put up [your]198-tess basket , and let [me]198-tess help [you]198-tess on . "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess listlessly placed [her]198-tess basket and bundle within [the dog - cart]1198-the dog - cart , and stepped up , and [they]1553-they sat side by side . [She]198-tess had no fear of [him]1554-he now , and in the cause of [her]198-tess confidence [her]198-tess sorrow lay .

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville mechanically lit a cigar , and the journey was continued with broken unemotional conversation on the commonplace objects by the wayside . [He]1554-he had quite forgotten [his]1554-he struggle to kiss [her]198-tess when , in the early summer , [they]1553-they had driven in the opposite direction along [the same road]1555-the same road . But [she]198-tess had not , and [she]198-tess sat now , like a puppet , replying to [his]1554-he remarks in monosyllables . " What are [you]198-tess crying for ? "[1554-he] [he]1554-he coldly asked .

" [I]198-tess was only thinking that [I]198-tess was born over there , "[198-tess] murmured [Tess]198-tess .

"[1558-he]

[He]1567-he leapt up lightly , arranged the reins , and was gone between the tall red - berried hedges .

[Tess]198-tess did not look after [him]1567-he , but slowly wound along [the crooked lane]1568-the crooked lane . [THY]1578-thy , DAMNATION , SLUMBERETH , NOT . 2 Pet . ii . 3 .

Against [the peaceful landscape]1579-the peaceful landscape , the pale , decaying tints of the copses , the blue air of the horizon , and the lichened stile - boards , these staring vermilion words shone forth . They seemed to shout themselves out and make the atmosphere ring . [Some people]733-some people might have cried " Alas , [poor Theology]6297-poor theology ! "[733-some people] at the hideous defacement - the last grotesque phase of a creed which had served [mankind]1581-mankind well in its time . [Get Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville in the mind to marry [her]1597-her ! [He]1598-he marry [HER]1597-her ! On matrimony [he]1598-he had never once said a word . And what if [he]1598-he had ? But [[her]1597-her poor foolish mother]1599-her poor foolish mother little knew [her]1597-her present feeling towards [this man]1582-this man . Perhaps it was unusual in the circumstances , unlucky , unaccountable ; but there it was ; and this , as [she]1597-her had said , was what made [her]1597-her detest [herself]1597-her . [She]1597-her had never wholly cared for [him]1582-this man ; [she]1597-her did not at all care for [him]1582-this man now . [She]1597-her had dreaded [him]1582-this man , winced before [him]1582-this man , succumbed to adroit advantages [he]1582-this man took of [her]1597-her helplessness ; then , temporarily blinded by [his]1582-this man ardent manners , had been stirred to confused surrender awhile : had suddenly despised and disliked [him]1582-this man , and had run away . [[Her]1601-the agonized girl mother]658-her mother was subdued .

" [I]658-her mother thought if [I]658-her mother spoke of [his]6330-his fond feelings and what they might lead to , [you]1118-her parent would be hontish wi ' [him]6330-his and lose [your]1118-her parent chance , "[658-her mother] [she]658-her mother murmured , wiping [her]658-her mother eyes with [her]658-her mother apron . " Well , [we]6331-we must make the best of it , [I]658-her mother suppose . ' Tis nater , after all , and what do please [God]222-god ! "[658-her mother]

XIII

The event of [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess 's return from [the manor of [her]198-tess bogus kinsfolk]1604-the manor of her bogus kinsfolk was rumoured abroad , if rumour be not too large a word for a space of a square mile . In the afternoon [several young girls of [Marlott]21-marlott]1605-several young girls of marlott , [former schoolfellows and [acquaintances of [Tess]198-tess]1607-acquaintances of tess]1606-former schoolfellows and acquaintances of tess , called to see [her]198-tess , arriving dressed in [their]1605-several young girls of marlott best starched and ironed , as became [visitors to [a person who had made a transcendent conquest as [they]1605-several young girls of marlott supposed]1609-a person who had made a transcendent conquest as they supposed , and sat round [the room]778-the room looking at [her]198-tess with great curiosity . For the fact that it was [this said thirty - first cousin]1611-this said thirty - first cousin , [Mr d'Urberville]1612-mr d'urberville , who had fallen in love with [her]198-tess , [a gentleman not altogether local , whose reputation as [a reckless gallant and heartbreaker]1614-a reckless gallant and heartbreaker was beginning to spread beyond the immediate boundaries of [Trantridge]38-trantridge]1613-a gentleman not altogether local , whose reputation as a reckless gallant and heartbreaker was beginning to spread beyond the immediate boundaries of trantridge]1608-visitors to a person who had made a transcendent conquest as they supposed , and sat round the room looking at her with great curiosity . for the fact that it was this said thirty - first cousin , mr d'urberville , who had fallen in love with her , a gentleman not altogether local , whose reputation as a reckless gallant and heartbreaker was beginning to spread beyond the immediate boundaries of trantridge , lent [Tess]198-tess 's supposed position , by its fearsomeness , a far higher fascination that it would have exercised if unhazardous .

[Their]1605-several young girls of marlott interest was so deep that [the younger ones]1615-the younger ones whispered when [her]198-tess back was turned -

" How pretty [she]198-tess is ; and how that best frock do set [her]198-tess off ! [I]1615-the younger ones believe it cost an immense deal , and that it was a gift from [him]1613-a gentleman not altogether local , whose reputation as a reckless gallant and heartbreaker was beginning to spread beyond the immediate boundaries of trantridge . "[1615-the younger ones]

[Tess]198-tess , who was reaching up to get the tea - things from the corner - cupboard , did not hear these commentaries . If [she]198-tess had heard them , [she]198-tess might soon have set [[her]198-tess friends]1616-her friends right on the matter . But [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother heard , and [Joan]205-joan 's simple vanity , having been denied the hope of a dashing marriage , fed itself as well as it could upon the sensation of a dashing flirtation . Upon the whole [she]658-her mother felt gratified , even though such a limited and evanescent triumph should involve [[her]658-her mother daughter]669-her daughter 's reputation ; it might end in marriage yet , and in the warmth of [her]198-tess responsiveness to [their]1605-several young girls of marlott admiration [she]198-tess invited [[her]198-tess visitors]1619-her visitors to stay to tea .

[Their]1605-several young girls of marlott chatter , [their]1605-several young girls of marlott laughter , [their]1605-several young girls of marlott good - humoured innuendoes , above all , [their]1605-several young girls of marlott flashes and flickerings of envy , revived [Tess]198-tess 's spirits also ; and , as the evening wore on , [she]198-tess caught the infection of [their]1605-several young girls of marlott excitement , and grew almost gay . The marble hardness left [her]198-tess face , [she]198-tess moved with something of [her]198-tess old bounding step , and flushed in all [her]198-tess young beauty .

At moments , in spite of thought , [she]198-tess would reply to [their]1605-several young girls of marlott inquiries with a manner of superiority , as if recognizing that [her]198-tess experiences in the field of courtship had , indeed , been slightly enviable . But so far was [she]198-tess from being , in the words of [Robert South]261-robert south , " in love with [her]198-tess own ruin , "[261-robert south] that the illusion was transient as lightning ; cold reason came back to mock [her]198-tess spasmodic weakness ; the ghastliness of [her]198-tess momentary pride would convict [her]198-tess , and recall [her]198-tess to reserved listlessness again .

And the despondency of the next morning 's dawn , when it was no longer Sunday , but Monday ; and no best clothes ; and [the laughing visitors]1620-the laughing visitors were gone , and [she]198-tess awoke alone in [her]198-tess old bed , [the innocent younger children]1621-the innocent younger children breathing softly around [her]198-tess . In place of the excitement of [her]198-tess return , and the interest it had inspired , [she]198-tess saw before [her]198-tess a long and stony highway which [she]198-tess had to tread , without aid , and with little sympathy . [Her]198-tess depression was then terrible , and [she]198-tess could have hidden [herself]198-tess in [a tomb]1622-a tomb .

In the course of a few weeks [Tess]198-tess revived sufficiently to show [herself]198-tess so far as was necessary to get to [church]813-church one Sunday morning . [She]198-tess liked to hear the chanting - such as it was - and the old Psalms , and to join in the Morning Hymn . That innate love of melody , which [she]198-tess had inherited from [[her]198-tess ballad - singing mother]1624-her ballad - singing mother , gave the simplest music a power over [her]198-tess which could well - nigh drag [her]198-tess heart out of [her]198-tess bosom at times .

To be as much out of observation as possible for reasons of [her]198-tess own , and to escape the gallantries of [the young men]1625-the young men , [she]198-tess set out before the chiming began , and took a back seat under [the gallery]1626-the gallery , close to the lumber , where only [old men]1627-old men and [women]1628-women came , and where [the bier stood on end among the churchyard tools]1629-the bier stood on end among the churchyard tools .

[Parishioners]1630-parishioners dropped in by twos and threes , deposited [themselves]1630-parishioners in rows before [her]198-tess , rested three - quarters of a minute on [their]1630-parishioners foreheads as if [they]1630-parishioners were praying , though [they]1630-parishioners were not ; then sat up , and looked around . When the chants came on , one of [her]198-tess favourites happened to be chosen among [the rest]6118-the rest - the old double chant " Langdon "[198-tess] - but [she]198-tess did not know what it was called , though [she]198-tess would much have liked to know . [She]198-tess thought , without exactly wording the thought , how strange and god - like was [a composer]1632-a composer 's power , who from the grave could lead through sequences of emotion , which [he]1632-a composer alone had felt at first , [a girl like [her]198-tess who had never heard of [his]1632-a composer name , and never would have a clue to [his]1632-a composer personality]1633-a girl like her who had never heard of his name , and never would have a clue to his personality .

[The people who had turned [their]1634-the people who had turned their heads heads]1634-the people who had turned their heads turned [them]1634-the people who had turned their heads again as the service proceeded ; and at last observing [her]198-tess , [they]1634-the people who had turned their heads whispered to [each other]577-each other . [She]198-tess knew what [their]1634-the people who had turned their heads whispers were about , grew sick at heart , and felt that [she]198-tess could come to [church]813-church no more .

[The bedroom which [she]198-tess shared with [some of [the children]700-the children]1638-some of the children]1637-the bedroom which she shared with some of the children formed [her]198-tess retreat more continually than ever . Here , under [[her]198-tess few square yards of thatch]1640-her few square yards of thatch , [she]198-tess watched winds , and snows , and rains , gorgeous sunsets , and successive moons at their full . So close kept [she]198-tess that at length almost [everybody]569-everybody thought [she]198-tess had gone away .

The only exercise that [Tess]198-tess took at this time was after dark ; and it was then , when out in [the woods]1642-the woods , that [she]198-tess seemed least solitary . [She]198-tess knew how to hit to a hair's - breadth that moment of evening when the light and the darkness are so evenly balanced that the constraint of day and the suspense of night neutralize each other , leaving absolute mental liberty . It is then that the plight of being alive becomes attenuated to its least possible dimensions . [She]198-tess had no fear of the shadows ; [her]198-tess sole idea seemed to be to shun mankind - or rather that cold accretion called [the world]497-the world , which , so terrible in the mass , is so unformidable , even pitiable , in its units .

On [these lonely hills and dales]1644-these lonely hills and dales [her]198-tess quiescent glide was of a piece with the element [she]198-tess moved in . [Her]198-tess flexuous and stealthy figure became an integral part of the scene . At times [her]198-tess whimsical fancy would intensify natural processes around [her]198-tess till they seemed a part of [her]198-tess own story . Rather they became a part of it ; for [the world]497-the world is only a psychological phenomenon , and what [they]497-the world seemed they were . The midnight airs and gusts , moaning amongst the tightly - wrapped buds and bark of the winter twigs , were formulae of bitter reproach . A wet day was the expression of irremediable grief at [her]198-tess weakness in the mind of [some vague ethical being whom [she]198-tess could not class definitely as the God of [her]198-tess childhood]1646-some vague ethical being whom she could not class definitely as the god of her childhood , and could not comprehend as any other .

But this encompassment of [her]198-tess own characterization , based on shreds of convention , peopled by phantoms and voices antipathetic to [her]198-tess , was a sorry and mistaken creation of [Tess]198-tess 's fancy - a cloud of moral hobgoblins by which [she]198-tess was terrified without reason . It was [they]1647-they that were out of harmony with [the actual world]1648-the actual world , not [she]198-tess . Walking among the sleeping birds in the hedges , watching the skipping rabbits on [a moonlit warren]1649-a moonlit warren , or standing under a pheasant - laden bough , [she]198-tess looked upon [herself]198-tess as [a figure of Guilt intruding into the haunts of Innocence]1650-a figure of guilt intruding into the haunts of innocence . But all the while [she]198-tess was making a distinction where there was no difference . Feeling [herself]198-tess in antagonism , [she]198-tess was quite in accord . [She]198-tess had been made to break an accepted social law , but no law known to the environment in which [she]198-tess fancied [herself]198-tess such an anomaly .

XIV

It was a hazy sunrise in August . [The denser nocturnal vapours , attacked by the warm beams]1651-the denser nocturnal vapours , attacked by the warm beams , were dividing and shrinking into isolated fleeces within hollows and coverts , where [they]1647-they waited till they should be dried away to nothing .

The sun , on account of the mist , had a curious sentient , personal look , demanding the masculine pronoun for its adequate expression . [His]1652-his present aspect , coupled with the lack of all human forms in the scene , explained the old - time heliolatries in a moment . [One]6172-one could feel that a saner religion had never prevailed under the sky . [The luminary]1654-the luminary was [a golden - haired , beaming , mild - eyed , God - like creature]1655-a golden - haired , beaming , mild - eyed , god - like creature , gazing down in the vigour and intentness of youth upon an earth that was brimming with interest for [him]1654-the luminary .

[His]1654-the luminary light , a little later , broke though chinks of cottage shutters , throwing stripes like red - hot pokers upon cupboards , chests of drawers , and other furniture within ; and awakening [harvesters who were not already astir]1656-harvesters who were not already astir .

But of all ruddy things that morning the brightest were two broad arms of painted wood , which rose from the margin of [yellow cornfield hard by [Marlott village]1658-marlott village]1657-yellow cornfield hard by marlott village . [They]1659-they , with [two others below]1660-two others below , formed the revolving Maltese cross of the reaping - machine , which had been brought to [the field]610-the field on the previous evening to be ready for operations this day . The paint with which [they]1659-they were smeared , intensified in hue by the sunlight , imparted to [them]1659-they a look of having been dipped in liquid fire .

[The field]610-the field had already been " opened "[1667-lads] ; that is to say , [a lane a few feet wide]1663-a lane a few feet wide had been hand - cut through the wheat along the whole circumference of [the field]610-the field for the first passage of the horses and machine .

[Two groups]1665-two groups , one of [men]5841-men and [lads]1667-lads , [the other of women]1668-the other of women , had come down [the lane]631-the lane just at the hour when the shadows of the eastern hedge - top struck the west hedge midway , so that the heads of [the groups]1670-the groups were enjoying sunrise while [their]1659-they feet were still in the dawn . [They]1659-they disappeared from [the lane]631-the lane between the two stone posts which flanked the nearest field - gate .

Presently there arose from within a ticking like the love - making of the grasshopper . The machine had begun , and a moving concatenation of three horses and the aforesaid long rickety machine was visible over the gate , [a driver]1672-a driver sitting upon one of the hauling horses , and [an attendant on the seat of the implement]1673-an attendant on the seat of the implement . Along one side of [the field]610-the field [the whole wain]1675-the whole wain went , the arms of [the mechanical reaper]1676-the mechanical reaper revolving slowly , till it passed down [the hill]642-the hill quite out of sight . In a minute it came up on the other side of [the field]610-the field at the same equable pace ; the glistening brass star in the forehead of the fore horse first catching the eye as it rose into view over the stubble , then the bright arms , and then [the whole machine]1679-the whole machine .

The narrow lane of stubble encompassing [the field]610-the field grew wider with each circuit , and the standing corn was reduced to a smaller area as the morning wore on . Rabbits , hares , snakes , rats , mice , retreated inwards as into a fastness , unaware of the ephemeral nature of [their]1659-they refuge , and of the doom that awaited [them]1659-they later in the day when , [their]1659-they covert shrinking to a more and more horrible narrowness , [they]1659-they were huddled together , [friends]1681-friends and [foes]1682-foes , till the last few yards of upright wheat fell also under the teeth of [the unerring reaper]1683-the unerring reaper , and [they]1659-they were every one put to death by the sticks and stones of [the harvesters]1684-the harvesters .

The reaping - machine left the fallen corn behind it in little heaps , each heap being of the quantity for a sheaf ; and upon these [the active binders in the rear]1685-the active binders in the rear laid [their]1685-the active binders in the rear hands - mainly [women]1628-women , but some of [them]1685-the active binders in the rear men in print shirts , and trousers supported round [their]1685-the active binders in the rear waists by leather straps , rendering useless the two buttons behind , which twinkled and bristled with sunbeams at every movement of [each wearer , as if they were a pair of eyes]1687-each wearer , as if they were a pair of eyes in the small of [his]1688-his back .

But [those of the other sex]1689-those of the other sex were the most interesting of [this company of binders]1690-this company of binders , by reason of the charm which is acquired by [woman]744-woman when [she]744-woman becomes part and parcel of outdoor nature , and is not merely an object set down therein as at ordinary times . [A field - man]1343-a field - man is a personality afield ; [a field - woman]1693-a field - woman is a portion of [the field]610-the field ; [she]1693-a field - woman had somehow lost [her]1693-a field - woman own margin , imbibed the essence of [her]1693-a field - woman surrounding , and assimilated [herself]1693-a field - woman with it .

[The women]5900-the women - or rather [girls]1696-girls , for [they]5900-the women were mostly young - wore drawn cotton bonnets with great flapping curtains to keep off the sun , and gloves to prevent [their]5900-the women hands being wounded by the stubble . There was [one wearing a pale pink jacket , another in a cream - coloured tight - sleeved gown]1697-one wearing a pale pink jacket , another in a cream - coloured tight - sleeved gown , another in a petticoat as red as the arms of [the reaping - machine]1698-the reaping - machine ; and others , older , in the brown - rough " wropper "[1697-one wearing a pale pink jacket , another in a cream - coloured tight - sleeved gown] or over - all - the old - established and most appropriate dress of [the field - woman]1699-the field - woman , which [the young ones]1700-the young ones were abandoning . This morning the eye returns involuntarily to [the girl in the pink cotton jacket]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket , [she]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket being the most flexuous and finely - drawn figure of [them]5900-the women all . But [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket bonnet is pulled so far over [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket brow that none of [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket face is disclosed while [she]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket binds , though [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket complexion may be guessed from a stray twine or two of dark brown hair which extends below the curtain of [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket bonnet . Perhaps one reason why [she]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket seduces casual attention is that [she]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket never courts it , though [the other women]1702-the other women often gaze around [them]1702-the other women .

[Her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket binding proceeds with clock - like monotony . From the sheaf last finished [she]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket draws a handful of ears , patting their tips with [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket left palm to bring them even . Then , stooping low , [she]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket moves forward , gathering the corn with both hands against [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket knees , and pushing [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket left gloved hand under the bundle to meet the right on the other side , holding the corn in an embrace like that of [a lover]6249-a lover . [She]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket brings the ends of the bond together , and kneels on the sheaf while [she]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket ties it , beating back [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket skirts now and then when lifted by the breeze . A bit of [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket naked arm is visible between the buff leather of the gauntlet and the sleeve of [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket gown ; and as the day wears on its feminine smoothness becomes scarified by the stubble and bleeds .

At intervals [she]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket stands up to rest , and to retie [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket disarranged apron , or to pull [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket bonnet straight . Then one can see the oval face of [a handsome young woman with deep dark eyes and long heavy clinging tresses , which seem to clasp in a beseeching way anything they fall against]1704-a handsome young woman with deep dark eyes and long heavy clinging tresses , which seem to clasp in a beseeching way anything they fall against . The cheeks are paler , the teeth more regular , the red lips thinner than is usual in [a country - bred girl]1705-a country - bred girl .

It is [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess , otherwise d'Urberville , somewhat changed - the same , but not the same ; at the present stage of [her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket existence living as [a stranger]1085-a stranger and [an alien here]1707-an alien here , though it was [no strange land that [she]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket was in]1708-no strange land that she was in . After a long seclusion [she]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket had come to a resolve to undertake outdoor work in [[her]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket native village]1538-her native village , the busiest season of the year in [the agricultural world]1710-the agricultural world having arrived , and nothing that [she]1701-the girl in the pink cotton jacket could do within [the house]652-the house being so remunerative for the time as harvesting in [the fields]498-the fields .

The movements of [the other women]1702-the other women were more or less similar to [Tess]198-tess 's , the whole bevy of [them]1702-the other women drawing together like [dancers in a quadrille]1714-dancers in a quadrille at the completion of a sheaf by each , [every one]1715-every one placing [her]1715-every one sheaf on end against those of the rest , till a shock , or ' stitch " as it was here called , of ten or a dozen was formed .[1702-the other women]

[They]1702-the other women went to breakfast , and came again , and the work proceeded as before . As the hour of eleven drew near [a person watching [her]198-tess]1716-a person watching her might have noticed that every now and then [Tess]198-tess 's glance flitted wistfully to [the brow of [the hill]642-the hill]1717-the brow of the hill , though [she]198-tess did not pause in [her]198-tess sheafing . On the verge of the hour the heads of [a group of [children , of ages ranging from six to fourteen]1720-children , of ages ranging from six to fourteen]1719-a group of children , of ages ranging from six to fourteen , rose over the stubbly convexity of [the hill]642-the hill .

The face of [Tess]198-tess flushed slightly , but still [she]198-tess did not pause .

[The eldest of [the comers]1723-the comers]1722-the eldest of the comers , [a girl who wore a triangular shawl , its corner draggling on the stubble , carried in [her]1722-the eldest of the comers arms what at first sight seemed to be a doll , but proved to be [an infant in long clothes]1725-an infant in long clothes]1724-a girl who wore a triangular shawl , its corner draggling on the stubble , carried in her arms what at first sight seemed to be a doll , but proved to be an infant in long clothes . [Another]1726-another brought some lunch . [The harvesters]1684-the harvesters ceased working , took [their]1684-the harvesters provisions , and sat down against one of the shocks . Here [they]1684-the harvesters fell to , [the men plying a stone jar freely]1728-the men plying a stone jar freely , and passing round a cup .

[Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess had been one of the last to suspend [her]198-tess labours . [She]198-tess sat down at the end of the shock , [her]198-tess face turned somewhat away from [[her]198-tess companions]558-her companions . When [she]198-tess had deposited [herself]198-tess [a man in a rabbit - skin cap]1730-a man in a rabbit - skin cap , and with a red handkerchief tucked into [his]1730-a man in a rabbit - skin cap belt , held the cup of ale over the top of the shock for [her]198-tess to drink . But [she]198-tess did not accept [his]1730-a man in a rabbit - skin cap offer . As soon as [her]198-tess lunch was spread [she]198-tess called up [the big girl]1731-the big girl , [[her]198-tess sister]715-her sister , and took [the baby]666-the baby of [her]198-tess , who , glad to be relieved of the burden , went away to the next shock and joined [the other children playing there]1734-the other children playing there . [Tess]198-tess , with a curiously stealthy yet courageous movement , and with a still rising colour , unfastened [her]198-tess frock and began suckling [the child]1735-the child .

[The men who sat nearest considerately]1736-the men who sat nearest considerately turned [their]1736-the men who sat nearest considerately faces towards the other end of [the field]610-the field , some of [them]1736-the men who sat nearest considerately beginning to smoke ; one , with absent - minded fondness , regretfully stroking the jar that would no longer yield a stream . [All the women]1738-all the women but [Tess]198-tess fell into animated talk , and adjusted the disarranged knots of [their]1738-all the women hair .

When [the infant]1739-the infant had taken its fill , [the young mother]1740-the young mother sat it upright in [her]1740-the young mother lap , and looking into the far distance , dandled it with a gloomy indifference that was almost dislike ; then all of a sudden [she]1740-the young mother fell to violently kissing it some dozens of times , as if [she]1740-the young mother could never leave off , [the child]1735-the child crying at the vehemence of an onset which strangely combined passionateness with contempt .

" [She]1740-the young mother 's fond of [that there child]6332-that there child , though [she]1740-the young mother mid pretend to hate en , and say [she]1740-the young mother wishes [the baby]666-the baby and [her]6332-that there child too were in [the churchyard]6334-the churchyard , "[1742-the woman in the red petticoat] observed [the woman in the red petticoat]1742-the woman in the red petticoat .

" [She]1740-the young mother 'll soon leave off saying that , "[1743-the one in buff] replied [the one in buff]1743-the one in buff . " [Lord]6335-lord , ' tis wonderful what [a body]6336-a body can get used to o ' that sort in time ! "[1743-the one in buff]

" A little more than persuading had to do wi ' the coming o't , [I]1745-the group who certainly was not ill - defined as plain reckon . There were [they]6337-they that heard a sobbing one night last year in [The Chase]39-the chase ; and it mid ha ' gone hard wi ' [a certain party]6338-a certain party if [folks]6339-folks had come along . "[1745-the group who certainly was not ill - defined as plain]

" Well , a little more , or a little less , ' twas a thousand pities that it should have happened to [she]198-tess , of all others . But ' tis always the comeliest ! [The plain ones]6340-the plain ones be as safe as churches - hey , [Jenny]262-jenny ? "[617-the speaker] [The speaker]617-the speaker turned to one of [the group who certainly was not ill - defined as plain]1745-the group who certainly was not ill - defined as plain .

It was a thousand pities , indeed ; it was impossible for even [an enemy]1746-an enemy to feel otherwise on looking at [Tess]198-tess as [she]198-tess sat there , with [her]198-tess flower - like mouth and large tender eyes , neither black nor blue nor grey nor violet ; rather all those shades together , and a hundred others , which could be seen if [one]6172-one looked into [their]1748-their irises - shade behind shade - tint beyond tint - around pupils that had no bottom ; [an almost standard woman]1749-an almost standard woman , but for the slight incautiousness of character inherited from [her]198-tess race .

A resolution which had surprised [herself]198-tess had brought [her]198-tess into [the fields]498-the fields this week for the first time during many months . After wearing and wasting [her]198-tess palpitating heart with every engine of regret that lonely inexperience could devise , common sense had illuminated [her]198-tess . [She]198-tess felt that [she]198-tess would do well to be useful again - to taste anew sweet independence at any price . The past was past ; whatever it had been , it was no more at hand . Whatever its consequences , time would close over [them]1751-them ; they would all in a few years be as if they had never been , and [she]198-tess [herself]198-tess grassed down and forgotten . Meanwhile the trees were just as green as before ; the birds sang and the sun shone as clearly now as ever . The familiar surroundings had not darkened because of [her]198-tess grief , nor sickened because of [her]198-tess pain .

[She]198-tess might have seen that what had bowed [her]198-tess head so profoundly - the thought of [the world]497-the world 's concern at [her]198-tess situation - was founded on an illusion . [She]198-tess was not an existence , an experience , a passion , a structure of sensations , to [anybody]6181-anybody but [herself]198-tess . To [all humankind]1754-all humankind besides , [Tess]198-tess was only a passing thought . Even to [friends]1681-friends [she]198-tess was no more than a frequently passing thought . If [she]198-tess made [herself]198-tess miserable the livelong night and day it was only this much to [them]1751-them - " Ah , [she]198-tess makes [herself]198-tess unhappy . "[198-tess] If [she]198-tess tried to be cheerful , to dismiss all care , to take pleasure in the daylight , the flowers , [the baby]666-the baby , [she]198-tess could only be this idea to [them]1751-them - " Ah , [she]198-tess bears it very well . "[198-tess] Moreover , alone in [a desert island]1757-a desert island would [she]198-tess have been wretched at what had happened to [her]198-tess ? Not greatly . If [she]198-tess could have been but just created , to discover [herself]198-tess as [a spouseless mother]1758-a spouseless mother , with no experience of life except as [the parent of [a nameless child]1760-a nameless child]1759-the parent of a nameless child , would the position have caused [her]198-tess to despair ? No , [she]198-tess would have taken it calmly , and found pleasure therein . Most of the misery had been generated by [her]198-tess conventional aspect , and not by [her]198-tess innate sensations .

Whatever [Tess]198-tess 's reasoning , some spirit had induced [her]198-tess to dress [herself]198-tess up neatly as [she]198-tess had formerly done , and come out into [the fields]498-the fields , harvest - hands being greatly in demand just then . This was why [she]198-tess had borne [herself]198-tess with dignity , and had looked [people]5930-people calmly in the face at times , even when holding [the baby]666-the baby in [her]198-tess arms .

[The harvest - men]1764-the harvest - men rose from the shock of corn , and stretched [their]1764-the harvest - men limbs , and extinguished [their]1764-the harvest - men pipes . The horses , which had been unharnessed and fed , were again attached to the scarlet machine . [Tess]198-tess , having quickly eaten [her]198-tess own meal , beckoned to [[her]198-tess eldest sister]1765-her eldest sister to come and take away [the baby]666-the baby , fastened [her]198-tess dress , put on the buff gloves again , and stooped anew to draw a bond from the last completed sheaf for the tying of the next .

In the afternoon and evening the proceedings of the morning were continued , [Tess]198-tess staying on till dusk with the body of [harvesters]1767-harvesters . Then [they]1768-they all rode [home]5850-home in one of [the largest wagons]1770-the largest wagons , in the company of a broad tarnished moon that had risen from the ground to the eastwards , its face resembling the outworn gold - leaf halo of some worm - eaten Tuscan saint . [[Tess]198-tess 's female companions]1771-tess 's female companions sang songs , and showed [themselves]1771-tess 's female companions very sympathetic and glad at [her]198-tess reappearance out of doors , though [they]1771-tess 's female companions could not refrain from mischievously throwing in a few verses of the ballad about [the maid who went to [the merry green wood]1773-the merry green wood and came back a changed state]1772-the maid who went to the merry green wood and came back a changed state . There are counterpoises and compensations in life ; and the event which had made of [her]198-tess a social warning had also for the moment made [her]198-tess the most interesting personage in [the village]473-the village to [many]1775-many . [Their]1771-tess 's female companions friendliness won [her]198-tess still farther away from [herself]198-tess , [their]1771-tess 's female companions lively spirits were contagious , and [she]198-tess became almost gay .

But now that [her]198-tess moral sorrows were passing away a fresh one arose on the natural side of [her]198-tess which knew no social law . When [she]198-tess reached [home]5850-home it was to learn to [her]198-tess grief that [the baby]666-the baby had been suddenly taken ill since the afternoon . Some such collapse had been probable , so tender and puny was its frame ; but the event came as a shock nevertheless .

[The baby]666-the baby 's offence against society in coming into [the world]497-the world was forgotten by [the girl - mother]1780-the girl - mother ; [her]1780-the girl - mother soul 's desire was to continue that offence by preserving the life of [the child]1735-the child . However , it soon grew clear that the hour of emancipation for [that little prisoner of the flesh]1782-that little prisoner of the flesh was to arrive earlier than [her]198-tess worst misgiving had conjectured . And when [she]198-tess had discovered this [she]198-tess was plunged into a misery which transcended that of [the child]1735-the child 's simple loss . [[Her]198-tess baby]1784-her baby had not been baptized .

[Tess]198-tess had drifted into a frame of mind which accepted passively the consideration that if [she]198-tess should have to burn for what [she]198-tess had done , burn [she]198-tess must , and there was an end of it . Like [all village girls]1785-all village girls , [she]198-tess was well grounded in the Holy Scriptures , and had dutifully studied the histories of [Aholah]263-aholah and [Aholibah]264-aholibah , and knew the inferences to be drawn therefrom . But when the same question arose with regard to [the baby]666-the baby , it had a very different colour . [[Her]198-tess darling]1787-her darling was about to die , and no salvation .

It was nearly bedtime , but [she]198-tess rushed [downstairs]1128-downstairs and asked if [she]198-tess might send for [the parson]450-the parson . The moment happened to be one at which [[her]198-tess father]557-her father 's sense of [the antique nobility of [[his]557-her father family]5890-his family]1791-the antique nobility of his family was highest , and [his]557-her father sensitiveness to the smudge which [Tess]198-tess had set upon that nobility most pronounced , for [he]557-her father had just returned from [his]557-her father weekly booze at [Rolliver 's Inn]59-rolliver 's inn . [No parson]1793-no parson should come inside [his]557-her father door , [he]557-her father declared , prying into [his]557-her father affairs , just then , when , by [her]198-tess shame , it had become more necessary than ever to hide them . [He]557-her father locked the door and put the key in [his]557-her father pocket .

[The household]874-the household went to bed , and , distressed beyond measure , [Tess]198-tess retired also . [She]198-tess was continually waking as [she]198-tess lay , and in the middle of the night found that [the baby]666-the baby was still worse . [It]666-the baby was obviously dying - quietly and painlessly , but none the less surely .

In [her]198-tess misery [she]198-tess rocked [herself]198-tess upon the bed . The clock struck the solemn hour of one , that hour when fancy stalks outside reason , and malignant possibilities stand rock - firm as facts . [She]198-tess thought of [the child]1735-the child consigned to [the nethermost corner of hell]1797-the nethermost corner of hell , as its double doom for lack of baptism and lack of legitimacy ; saw [the arch - fiend]1798-the arch - fiend tossing [it]1735-the child with [his]1798-the arch - fiend three - pronged fork , like the one [they]1799-they used for heating the oven on baking days ; to which picture [she]198-tess added many other quaint and curious details of torment sometimes taught [the young]1800-the young in [this Christian country]1801-this christian country . The lurid presentment so powerfully affected [her]198-tess imagination in the silence of [the sleeping house]1802-the sleeping house that [her]198-tess nightgown became damp with perspiration , and the bedstead shook with each throb of [her]198-tess heart .

[The infant]1739-the infant 's breathing grew more difficult , and [the mother]708-the mother 's mental tension increased . It was useless to devour the little thing with kisses ; [she]198-tess could stay in bed no longer , and walked feverishly about [the room]778-the room .

" [O merciful God]6341-o merciful god , have pity ; have pity upon [[my]198-tess poor baby]6342-my poor baby ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess cried . " Heap as much anger as [you]6341-o merciful god want to upon [me]198-tess , and welcome ; but pity [the child]1735-the child ! "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess leant against the chest of drawers , and murmured incoherent supplications for a long while , till [she]198-tess suddenly started up .

" Ah ! perhaps [baby]6344-baby can be saved ! Perhaps it will be just the same ! "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess spoke so brightly that it seemed as though [her]198-tess face might have shone in the gloom surrounding [her]198-tess . [She]198-tess lit a candle , and went to a second and a third bed under the wall , where [she]198-tess awoke [[her]198-tess young sisters]1806-her young sisters and brothers , all of whom occupied [the same room]1807-the same room . Pulling out the washing - stand so that [she]198-tess could get behind it , [she]198-tess poured some water from a jug , and made [them]1808-them kneel around , putting [their]1808-them hands together with fingers exactly vertical . While [the children]700-the children , scarcely awake , awe - stricken at [her]198-tess manner , [their]700-the children eyes growing larger and larger , remained in this position , [she]198-tess took [the baby]666-the baby from [[her]198-tess bed]1811-her bed - [[a child]1122-a child 's child]1813-a child 's child - so immature as scarce to seem a sufficient personality to endow [[its]666-the baby producer]1814-its producer with the maternal title . [Tess]198-tess then stood erect with [the infant]1739-the infant on [her]198-tess arm beside the basin ; [the next sister]1816-the next sister held the Prayer - Book open before [her]198-tess , as [the clerk at [church]813-church]1817-the clerk at church held it before [the parson]450-the parson ; and thus [the girl]647-the girl set about baptizing [[her]647-the girl child]1821-her child .

[Her]198-tess figure looked singularly tall and imposing as [she]198-tess stood in [her]198-tess long white nightgown , a thick cable of twisted dark hair hanging straight down [her]198-tess back to [her]198-tess waist . The kindly dimness of the weak candle abstracted from [her]198-tess form and features the little blemishes which sunlight might have revealed - the stubble scratches upon [her]198-tess wrists , and the weariness of [her]198-tess eyes - [her]198-tess high enthusiasm having a transfiguring effect upon the face which had been [her]198-tess undoing , showing it as a thing of immaculate beauty , with a touch of dignity which was almost regal . [The little ones]1179-the little ones kneeling round , [their]1179-the little ones sleepy eyes blinking and red , awaited [her]647-the girl preparations full of a suspended wonder which [their]1179-the little ones physical heaviness at that hour would not allow to become active .

[The most impressed of [them]1179-the little ones]1823-the most impressed of them said :

" Be [you]647-the girl really going to christen [him]6345-him , [Tess]198-tess ? "[1823-the most impressed of them]

[The girl - mother]1780-the girl - mother replied in a grave affirmative .

" What 's [his]6345-him name going to be ? "[1780-the girl - mother]

[She]647-the girl had not thought of that , but a name suggested by a phrase in the book of Genesis came into [her]647-the girl head as [she]647-the girl proceeded with the baptismal service , and now [she]647-the girl pronounced it :

" [SORROW]265-sorrow , [I]647-the girl baptize [thee]6345-him in the name of [the Father]6346-the father , and of [the Son]6347-the son , and of [the Holy Ghost]6348-the holy ghost . "[647-the girl]

[She]647-the girl sprinkled the water , and there was silence .

" Say ' Amen , ' [children]660-children . "[647-the girl]

The tiny voices piped in obedient response , " Amen ! "[647-the girl]

[Tess]198-tess went on :

" [We]6350-we receive [this child]6351-this child "[198-tess] - and so forth - " and do sign [him]6351-this child with the sign of the Cross . "[198-tess]

Here [she]198-tess dipped [her]198-tess hand into the basin , and fervently drew an immense cross upon [the baby]666-the baby with [her]198-tess forefinger , continuing with the customary sentences as to [his]666-the baby manfully fighting against sin , [the world]497-the world , and the devil , and being [a faithful soldier]1827-a faithful soldier and servant unto [his]666-the baby life 's end . [She]198-tess duly went on with the Lord 's Prayer , [the children]700-the children lisping it after [her]198-tess in a thin gnat - like wail , till , at the conclusion , raising [their]700-the children voices to clerk 's pitch , [they]700-the children again piped into silence , " Amen ! "[700-the children]

Then [[their]700-the children sister]1829-their sister , with much augmented confidence in the efficacy of the sacrament , poured forth from the bottom of [her]1829-their sister heart the thanksgiving that follows , uttering it boldly and triumphantly in the stopt - diapason note which [her]1829-their sister voice acquired when [her]1829-their sister heart was in [her]1829-their sister speech , and which will never be forgotten by [those who knew [her]1829-their sister]1830-those who knew her . The ecstasy of faith almost apotheosized [her]1829-their sister ; it set upon [her]1829-their sister face a glowing irradiation , and brought a red spot into the middle of each cheek ; while the miniature candle - flame inverted in [her]1829-their sister eye - pupils shone like a diamond . [The children]700-the children gazed up at [her]1829-their sister with more and more reverence , and no longer had a will for questioning . [She]1829-their sister did not look like [Sissy]234-sissy to [them]700-the children now , but as a being large , towering , and awful - [a divine personage with whom [they]700-the children had nothing in common]1832-a divine personage with whom they had nothing in common .

[Poor Sorrow]265-sorrow 's campaign against sin , [the world]497-the world , and [the devil]6137-the devil was doomed to be of limited brilliancy - luckily perhaps for [himself]265-sorrow , considering [his]6137-the devil beginnings . In the blue of the morning that [fragile soldier]1835-fragile soldier and [servant]1836-servant breathed [his]6137-the devil last , and when [the other children]1837-the other children awoke [they]700-the children cried bitterly , and begged [Sissy]234-sissy to have [another pretty baby]1838-another pretty baby .

The calmness which had possessed [Tess]198-tess since the christening remained with [her]198-tess in [the infant]1739-the infant 's loss . In the daylight , indeed , [she]198-tess felt [her]198-tess terrors about [his]6137-the devil soul to have been somewhat exaggerated ; whether well founded or not , [she]198-tess had no uneasiness now , reasoning that if [Providence]266-providence would not ratify such an act of approximation [she]198-tess , for one , did not value the kind of heaven lost by the irregularity - either for [herself]198-tess or for [[her]198-tess child]1821-her child .

So passed away Sorrow the Undesired - that intrusive creature , that bastard gift of shameless Nature , who respects not the social law ; [a waif to whom eternal Time had been a matter of days merely , who knew not that such things as years and centuries ever were]1841-a waif to whom eternal time had been a matter of days merely , who knew not that such things as years and centuries ever were ; to whom [the cottage interior]1842-the cottage interior was [the universe]1395-the universe , the week 's weather climate , new - born babyhood human existence , and the instinct to suck human knowledge .

[Tess]198-tess , who mused on the christening a good deal , wondered if it were doctrinally sufficient to secure a Christian burial for [the child]1735-the child . [Nobody]754-nobody could tell this but [the parson of [the parish]5847-the parish]1846-the parson of the parish , and [he]1846-the parson of the parish was [a new - comer]1848-a new - comer , and did not know [her]198-tess . [She]198-tess went to [[his]1846-the parson of the parish house]1849-his house after dusk , and stood by the gate , but could not summon courage to go in . The enterprise would have been abandoned if [she]198-tess had not by accident met [him]1846-the parson of the parish coming [homeward]1850-homeward as [she]198-tess turned away . In the gloom [she]198-tess did not mind speaking freely .

" [I]1846-the parson of the parish should like to ask [you]1846-the parson of the parish something , [sir]5821-sir . "[1846-the parson of the parish]

[He]1846-the parson of the parish expressed [his]1846-the parson of the parish willingness to listen , and [she]198-tess told the story of [the baby]666-the baby 's illness and the extemporized ordinance . " And now , [sir]5821-sir , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess added earnestly , " can [you]1846-the parson of the parish tell [me]198-tess this - will it be just the same for [him]1846-the parson of the parish as if [you]1846-the parson of the parish had baptized [him]1846-the parson of the parish ? "[198-tess]

Having the natural feelings of [a tradesman]1852-a tradesman at finding that a job [he]1846-the parson of the parish should have been called in for had been unskilfully botched by [[his]1846-the parson of the parish customers]1853-his customers among [themselves]1853-his customers , [he]1846-the parson of the parish was disposed to say no . Yet the dignity of [the girl]647-the girl , the strange tenderness in [her]647-the girl voice , combined to affect [his]1846-the parson of the parish nobler impulses - or rather those that [he]1846-the parson of the parish had left in [him]1846-the parson of the parish after ten years of endeavour to graft technical belief on actual scepticism . [The man]1516-the man and [the ecclesiastic]1856-the ecclesiastic fought within [him]1846-the parson of the parish , and the victory fell to [the man]1516-the man .
