" [[My]1846-the parson of the parish dear girl]6354-my dear girl , "[1846-the parson of the parish] [he]1846-the parson of the parish said , " it will be just the same . "[1846-the parson of the parish]

" Then will [you]1846-the parson of the parish give [him]666-the baby a Christian burial ? "[647-the girl] [she]647-the girl asked quickly .

[The Vicar]1858-the vicar felt [himself]1858-the vicar cornered . Hearing of [the baby]666-the baby 's illness , [he]1858-the vicar had conscientiously gone to [the house]652-the house after nightfall to perform the rite , and , unaware that the refusal to admit [him]1846-the parson of the parish had come from [[Tess]198-tess 's father]1861-tess 's father and not from [Tess]198-tess , [he]1858-the vicar could not allow the plea of necessity for its irregular administration .

" Ah - that 's another matter , "[1858-the vicar] [he]1858-the vicar said .

" Another matter - why ? "[198-tess] asked [Tess]198-tess , rather warmly .

" Well - [I]647-the girl would willingly do so if only [we]6355-we two were concerned . But [I]647-the girl must not - for certain reasons . "[647-the girl]

" Just for once , [sir]5821-sir ! "[647-the girl]

" Really [I]647-the girl must not . "[647-the girl]

" O [sir]5821-sir ! "[647-the girl] [She]647-the girl seized [his]1858-the vicar hand as [she]647-the girl spoke .

[He]1858-the vicar withdrew it , shaking [his]1858-the vicar head .

" Then [I]647-the girl do n't like [you]1858-the vicar ! "[647-the girl] [she]647-the girl burst out , " and [I]647-the girl 'll never come to [[your]1858-the vicar church]6358-your church no more ! "[647-the girl]

" Do n't talk so rashly . "[647-the girl]

" Perhaps it will be just the same to [him]1858-the vicar if [you]1858-the vicar do n't ? ... Will it be just the same ? Do n't for [God]222-god 's sake speak as [saint]6359-saint to [sinner]6360-sinner , but as [you]1858-the vicar [yourself]1858-the vicar to [me]647-the girl [myself]647-the girl - poor [me]647-the girl ! "[647-the girl]

How [the Vicar]1858-the vicar reconciled [his]1858-the vicar answer with the strict notions [he]1858-the vicar supposed [himself]1858-the vicar to hold on these subjects it is beyond [a layman]1863-a layman 's power to tell , though not to excuse . Somewhat moved , [he]1858-the vicar said in this case also -

" It will be just the same . "[1858-the vicar]

So [the baby]666-the baby was carried in a small deal box , under [an ancient woman]1865-an ancient woman 's shawl , to [the churchyard]6334-the churchyard that night , and buried by lantern - light , at the cost of a shilling and a pint of beer to [the sexton]1867-the sexton , in that shabby corner of [[God]222-god 's allotment]1868-god 's allotment where [He]222-god lets the nettles grow , and where [all unbaptized infants]1869-all unbaptized infants , [notorious drunkards]1870-notorious drunkards , suicides , and [others of the conjecturally damned]1871-others of the conjecturally damned are laid . In spite of the untoward surroundings , however , [Tess]198-tess bravely made a little cross of two laths and a piece of string , and having bound it with flowers , [she]198-tess stuck it up at the head of [the grave]886-the grave one evening when [she]198-tess could enter [the churchyard]6334-the churchyard without being seen , putting at the foot also a bunch of the same flowers in a little jar of water to keep them alive . What matter was it that on the outside of the jar the eye of mere observation noted the words " [Keelwell]267-keelwell 's Marmalade "[1874-the eye of maternal affection] ? [The eye of maternal affection]1874-the eye of maternal affection did not see them in its vision of higher things .

XV

" By experience , "[268-roger ascham] says [Roger Ascham]268-roger ascham , " [we]1875-us find out a short way by a long wandering . "[268-roger ascham] Not seldom that long wandering unfits [us]1875-us for further travel , and of what use is [our]1875-us experience to [us]1875-us then ? [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess 's experience was of this incapacitating kind . At last [she]198-tess had learned what to do ; but who would now accept [her]198-tess doing ?

If before going to the d'Urbervilles ' [she]198-tess had vigorously moved under the guidance of sundry gnomic texts and phrases known to [her]198-tess and to [the world]497-the world in general , no doubt [she]198-tess would never have been imposed on . But it had not been in [Tess]198-tess 's power - nor is it in [anybody]6181-anybody 's power - to feel the whole truth of golden opinions while it is possible to profit by them . [She]198-tess - and how many more - might have ironically said to [God]222-god with [Saint Augustine]269-saint augustine : " [Thou]6361-thou hast counselled a better course than [Thou]6361-thou hast permitted . "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess remained at [[[her]198-tess father]557-her father 's house]1430-her father 's house during the winter months , plucking fowls , or cramming turkeys and geese , or making clothes for [[her]198-tess sisters]1880-her sisters and [brothers]586-brothers out of some finery which d'Urberville had given [her]198-tess , and [she]198-tess had put by with contempt . Apply to [him]557-her father [she]198-tess would not . But [she]198-tess would often clasp [her]198-tess hands behind [her]198-tess head and muse when [she]198-tess was supposed to be working hard .

[She]198-tess philosophically noted dates as they came past in the revolution of the year ; the disastrous night of [her]198-tess undoing at [Trantridge]38-trantridge with its dark background of The Chase ; also the dates of [the baby]666-the baby 's birth and death ; also [her]198-tess own birthday ; and every other day individualized by incidents in which [she]198-tess had taken some share . [She]198-tess suddenly thought one afternoon , when looking in the glass at [her]198-tess fairness , that there was yet another date , of greater importance to [her]198-tess than those ; that of [her]198-tess own death , when all these charms would have disappeared ; a day which lay sly and unseen among all the other days of the year , giving no sign or sound when [she]198-tess annually passed over it ; but not the less surely there . When was it ? Why did [she]198-tess not feel the chill of each yearly encounter with such a cold relation ? [She]198-tess had [Jeremy Taylor]270-jeremy taylor 's thought that some time in the future [those who had known [her]198-tess]1883-those who had known her would say : " It is the - - th , the day that poor [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess died "[270-jeremy taylor] ; and there would be nothing singular to [their]1883-those who had known her minds in the statement . Of that day , doomed to be [her]198-tess terminus in time through all the ages , [she]198-tess did not know [the place]5882-the place in month , week , season or year .

Almost at a leap [Tess]198-tess thus changed from [simple girl]1885-simple girl to [complex woman]1886-complex woman . Symbols of reflectiveness passed into [her]198-tess face , and a note of tragedy at times into [her]198-tess voice . [Her]198-tess eyes grew larger and more eloquent . [She]198-tess became what would have been called [a fine creature]1887-a fine creature ; [her]198-tess aspect was fair and arresting ; [her]198-tess soul that of [a woman whom the turbulent experiences of the last year or two]1888-a woman whom the turbulent experiences of the last year or two had quite failed to demoralize . But for [the world]497-the world 's opinion those experiences would have been simply a liberal education .

[She]198-tess had held so aloof of late that [her]198-tess trouble , never generally known , was nearly forgotten in [Marlott]21-marlott . But it became evident to [her]198-tess that [she]198-tess could never be really comfortable again in a place which had seen the collapse of [[her]198-tess family]1011-her family 's attempt to " claim kin "[1891-the rich d'urbervilles] - and , through [her]198-tess , even closer union - with [the rich d'Urbervilles]1891-the rich d'urbervilles . At least [she]198-tess could not be comfortable [there]5839-there till long years should have obliterated [her]198-tess keen consciousness of it . Yet even now [Tess]198-tess felt the pulse of hopeful life still warm within [her]198-tess ; [she]198-tess might be happy in [some nook which had no memories]1893-some nook which had no memories . To escape the past and all that appertained thereto was to annihilate it , and to do that [she]198-tess would have to get away .

Was once lost always lost really true of chastity ? [she]198-tess would ask [herself]198-tess . [She]198-tess might prove it false if [she]198-tess could veil bygones . The recuperative power which pervaded organic nature was surely not denied to maidenhood alone .

[She]198-tess waited a long time without finding opportunity for a new departure . A particularly fine spring came round , and the stir of germination was almost audible in the buds ; it moved [her]198-tess , as it moved the wild animals , and made [her]198-tess passionate to go . At last , one day in early May , a letter reached [her]198-tess from [a former friend of [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's , to whom [she]198-tess had addressed inquiries long before - [a person whom [she]198-tess had never seen]1896-a person whom she had never seen]1894-a former friend of her mother 's , to whom she had addressed inquiries long before - a person whom she had never seen - that [a skilful milkmaid]1897-a skilful milkmaid was required at [a dairy - house]1898-a dairy - house many miles to [the southward]1899-the southward , and that [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman would be glad to have [her]1897-a skilful milkmaid for the summer months .

It was not quite so far off as could have been wished ; but it was probably far enough , [her]1897-a skilful milkmaid radius of movement and repute having been so small . To [persons of limited spheres]1901-persons of limited spheres , miles are as geographical degrees , [parishes]1902-parishes as [counties]1903-counties , [counties]1903-counties as [provinces]1905-provinces and [kingdoms]1906-kingdoms .

On one point [she]198-tess was resolved : there should be no more d'Urberville air - castles in the dreams and deeds of [her]198-tess new life . [She]198-tess would be [the dairymaid Tess]1907-the dairymaid tess , and nothing more . [[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother knew [Tess]198-tess 's feeling on this point so well , though no words had passed between [them]1909-them on the subject , that [she]198-tess never alluded to the knightly ancestry now .

Yet such is human inconsistency that one of the interests of [the new place to [her]198-tess]1910-the new place to her was the accidental virtues of [its]1911-its lying near [[[her]198-tess forefathers]6121-her forefathers ' country]1913-her forefathers ' country for [they]1914-they were not [Blakemore men]1915-blakemore men , though [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother was [Blakemore]22-blakemore to the bone . [The dairy called [Talbothays]60-talbothays , for which [she]198-tess was bound]1917-the dairy called talbothays , for which she was bound , stood not remotely from some of [the former estates of [the d'Urbervilles]1240-the d'urbervilles]1918-the former estates of the d'urbervilles , near [the great family vaults of [[her]198-tess granddames]1921-her granddames and [[their]1921-her granddames powerful husbands]1922-their powerful husbands]1920-the great family vaults of her granddames and their powerful husbands . [She]198-tess would be able to look at [them]1914-they , and think not only that d'Urberville , like [Babylon]272-babylon , had fallen , but that the individual innocence of [a humble descendant]1923-a humble descendant could lapse as silently . All the while [she]198-tess wondered if any strange good thing might come of [her]198-tess being in [[her]198-tess ancestral land]1924-her ancestral land ; and some spirit within [her]198-tess rose automatically as the sap in the twigs . It was unexpected youth , surging up anew after its temporary check , and bringing with it hope , and the invincible instinct towards self - delight .

END OF PHASE THE SECOND

Phase the Third : [The Rally

XVI]1925-the rally xvi

On a thyme - scented , bird - hatching morning in May , between two and three years after the return from [Trantridge]38-trantridge - silent , reconstructive years for [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess - [she]198-tess left [[her]198-tess [home]5850-home]1063-her home for the second time .

Having packed up [her]198-tess luggage so that it could be sent to [her]198-tess later , [she]198-tess started in a hired trap for [the little town of Stourcastle]840-the little town of stourcastle , through which it was necessary to pass on [her]198-tess journey , now in a direction almost opposite to that of [[her]198-tess first adventuring]1929-her first adventuring . On [the curve of the nearest hill]1930-the curve of the nearest hill [she]198-tess looked back regretfully at [Marlott]21-marlott and [[[her]198-tess father]557-her father 's house]1430-her father 's house , although [she]198-tess had been so anxious to get away .

[[Her]198-tess kindred dwelling]1933-her kindred dwelling there would probably continue [their]1933-her kindred dwelling daily lives as heretofore , with no great diminution of pleasure in [their]1933-her kindred dwelling consciousness , although [she]198-tess would be far off , and [they]1933-her kindred dwelling deprived of [her]198-tess smile . In a few days [the children]700-the children would engage in [their]700-the children games as merrily as ever , without the sense of any gap left by [her]198-tess departure . This leaving of [the younger children]704-the younger children [she]198-tess had decided to be for the best ; were [she]198-tess to remain [they]704-the younger children would probably gain less good by [her]198-tess precepts than harm by [her]198-tess example .

[She]198-tess went through [Stourcastle]32-stourcastle without pausing and onward to a junction of [highways]1936-highways , where [she]198-tess could await [[a carrier]1937-a carrier 's van that ran to [the south - west]1939-the south - west]1938-a carrier 's van that ran to the south - west ; for [the railways which engirdled [this interior tract of country]1941-this interior tract of country had never yet struck across [it]1941-this interior tract of country]1940-the railways which engirdled this interior tract of country had never yet struck across it . While waiting , however , there came along [a farmer in [[his]1942-a farmer in his spring cart , driving approximately in the direction that she wished to pursue spring cart]1943-his spring cart , driving approximately in the direction that [she]198-tess wished to pursue]1942-a farmer in his spring cart , driving approximately in the direction that she wished to pursue . Though [he]1942-a farmer in his spring cart , driving approximately in the direction that she wished to pursue was [a stranger to [her]198-tess]1944-a stranger to her [she]198-tess accepted [his]1942-a farmer in his spring cart , driving approximately in the direction that she wished to pursue offer of a seat beside [him]1942-a farmer in his spring cart , driving approximately in the direction that she wished to pursue , ignoring that its motive was a mere tribute to [her]198-tess countenance . [He]1942-a farmer in his spring cart , driving approximately in the direction that she wished to pursue was going to [Weatherbury]61-weatherbury , and by accompanying [him]1942-a farmer in his spring cart , driving approximately in the direction that she wished to pursue thither [she]198-tess could walk the remainder of the distance instead of travelling in [the van]945-the van by way of [Casterbridge]41-casterbridge .

[Tess]198-tess did not stop at [Weatherbury]61-weatherbury , after this long drive , further than to make a slight nondescript meal at noon at [a cottage to which [the farmer]1947-the farmer recommended [her]198-tess]1946-a cottage to which the farmer recommended her . Thence [she]198-tess started on foot , basket in hand , to reach [the wide upland of heath]1948-the wide upland of heath dividing [this district]564-this district from [the low - lying meads of]1950-the low - lying meads of [a further valley in which [the dairy]1952-the dairy stood that was the aim and end of [her]198-tess day 's pilgrimage]1951-a further valley in which the dairy stood that was the aim and end of her day 's pilgrimage .

[Tess]198-tess had never before visited [this part of [the country]507-the country]1953-this part of the country , and yet [she]198-tess felt akin to [the landscape]1955-the landscape . Not so very far to the left of [her]198-tess [she]198-tess could discern a dark patch in the scenery , which inquiry confirmed [her]198-tess in supposing to be trees marking [the environs of [Kingsbere]12-kingsbere]1956-the environs of kingsbere - in [the church of which parish the bones of [[her]198-tess ancestors]1958-her ancestors - [[her]198-tess useless ancestors]1959-her useless ancestors]1957-the church of which parish the bones of her ancestors - her useless ancestors - lay entombed .

[She]198-tess had no admiration for [them]1958-her ancestors now ; [she]198-tess almost hated [them]1958-her ancestors for the dance [they]1958-her ancestors had led [her]198-tess ; not a thing of all that had been theirs did [she]198-tess retain but the old seal and spoon . " Pooh - [I]198-tess have as much of [mother]5917-mother as [father]5842-father in [me]198-tess ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said . " All [my]198-tess prettiness comes from [her]5917-mother , and [she]5917-mother was only [a dairymaid]6364-a dairymaid . "[198-tess]

The journey over [the intervening uplands and lowlands of [Egdon]62-egdon]1960-the intervening uplands and lowlands of egdon , when [she]198-tess reached [them]1960-the intervening uplands and lowlands of egdon , was a more troublesome walk than [she]198-tess had anticipated , the distance being actually but a few miles . It was two hours , owing to sundry wrong turnings , ere [she]198-tess found [herself]198-tess on a summit commanding [the long - sought - for vale]1961-the long - sought - for vale , [the Valley of [the Great Dairies]1963-the great dairies]1962-the valley of the great dairies , [the valley in which milk and butter grew to rankness , and were produced more profusely , if less delicately , than at [[her]198-tess home]1063-her home]1964-the valley in which milk and butter grew to rankness , and were produced more profusely , if less delicately , than at her home - [the verdant plain so well watered by the river [Var]63-var or [Froom]64-froom]1966-the verdant plain so well watered by the river var or froom .

It was intrinsically different from [the Vale of Little Dairies]1967-the vale of little dairies , [Blackmoor Vale]53-blackmoor vale , which , save during [her]198-tess disastrous sojourn at [Trantridge]38-trantridge , [she]198-tess had exclusively known till now . [The world]497-the world was drawn to a larger pattern here . [The enclosures]1969-the enclosures numbered fifty acres instead of ten , [the farmsteads]1970-the farmsteads were more extended , the groups of cattle formed tribes hereabout ; there only [families]814-families . These myriads of cows stretching under [her]198-tess eyes from [the far east]1972-the far east to [the far west]1973-the far west outnumbered any [she]198-tess had ever seen at one glance before . [The green lea]1974-the green lea was speckled as thickly with them as a canvas by [Van Alsloot]273-van alsloot or [Sallaert]65-sallaert with [burghers]1975-burghers . The ripe hue of the red and dun kine absorbed the evening sunlight , which the white - coated animals returned to the eye in rays almost dazzling , even at the distant elevation on which [she]198-tess stood .

The bird's - eye perspective before [her]198-tess was not so luxuriantly beautiful , perhaps , as that other one which [she]198-tess knew so well ; yet it was more cheering . [It]1976-it lacked the intensely blue atmosphere of [the rival vale]1977-the rival vale , and [its]1977-the rival vale heavy soils and scents ; the new air was clear , bracing , ethereal . [The river itself]1978-the river itself , which nourished the grass and cows of [these renowned dairies]1979-these renowned dairies , flowed not like [the streams in [Blackmoor]4-blackmoor]1980-the streams in blackmoor . Those were slow , silent , often turbid ; flowing over beds of mud into which [the incautious wader might sink and vanish unawares]1981-the incautious wader might sink and vanish unawares . [The Froom waters]1982-the froom waters were clear as [the pure River of Life]1983-the pure river of life shown to [the Evangelist]66-the evangelist , rapid as the shadow of a cloud , with pebbly shallows that prattled to the sky all day long . There the water - flower was the lily ; the crow - foot here .

Either the change in the quality of the air from heavy to light , or the sense of being amid new scenes where there were no invidious eyes upon [her]198-tess , sent up [her]198-tess spirits wonderfully . [Her]198-tess hopes mingled with the sunshine in an ideal photosphere which surrounded [her]198-tess as [she]198-tess bounded along against the soft south wind . [She]198-tess heard a pleasant voice in every breeze , and in every bird 's note seemed to lurk a joy .

[Her]198-tess face had latterly changed with changing states of mind , continually fluctuating between beauty and ordinariness , according as the thoughts were gay or grave . One day [she]198-tess was pink and flawless ; another pale and tragical . When [she]198-tess was pink [she]198-tess was feeling less than when pale ; [her]198-tess more perfect beauty accorded with [her]198-tess less elevated mood ; [her]198-tess more intense mood with [her]198-tess less perfect beauty . It was [her]198-tess best face physically that was now set against the south wind .

The irresistible , universal , automatic tendency to find sweet pleasure somewhere , which pervades all life , from the meanest to the highest , had at length mastered [Tess]198-tess . Being even now only [a young woman of twenty , one who mentally and sentimentally had not finished growing]1984-a young woman of twenty , one who mentally and sentimentally had not finished growing , it was impossible that any event should have left upon [her]198-tess an impression that was not in time capable of transmutation .

And thus [her]198-tess spirits , and [her]198-tess thankfulness , and [her]198-tess hopes , rose higher and higher . [She]198-tess tried several ballads , but found them inadequate ; till , recollecting the psalter that [her]198-tess eyes had so often wandered over of a Sunday morning before [she]198-tess had eaten of the tree of knowledge , [she]198-tess chanted : " O [ye]6365-ye Sun and Moon ... O [ye]6365-ye Stars ... [ye]6365-ye Green Things upon [the Earth]67-the earth ... [ye]6365-ye Fowls of [the Air]68-the air ... Beasts and Cattle ... [Children of Men]6366-children of men ... bless [ye]6365-ye [the Lord]5926-the lord , praise [Him]5926-the lord and magnify [Him]5926-the lord for ever ! "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess suddenly stopped and murmured : " But perhaps [I]198-tess do n't quite know [the Lord]5926-the lord as yet . "[198-tess]

And probably the half - unconscious rhapsody was a Fetishistic utterance in a Monotheistic setting ; [women whose chief companions]1985-women whose chief companions are the forms and forces of outdoor Nature retain in [their]1985-women whose chief companions souls far more of the Pagan fantasy of [[their]1985-women whose chief companions remote forefathers]1986-their remote forefathers than of the systematized religion taught [their]1985-women whose chief companions race at later date . However , [Tess]198-tess found at least approximate expression for [her]198-tess feelings in the old Benedicite that [she]198-tess had lisped from infancy ; and it was enough . Such high contentment with such a slight initial performance as that of having started towards a means of independent living was a part of the Durbeyfield temperament . [Tess]198-tess really wished to walk uprightly , while [[her]198-tess father]557-her father did nothing of the kind ; but [she]198-tess resembled [him]557-her father in being content with immediate and small achievements , and in having no mind for laborious effort towards such petty social advancement as could alone be effected by [a family so heavily handicapped as [the once powerful d'Urbervilles were now]1989-the once powerful d'urbervilles were now]1988-a family so heavily handicapped as the once powerful d'urbervilles were now .

There was , it might be said , the energy of [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's unexpended family , as well as the natural energy of [Tess]198-tess 's years , rekindled after the experience which had so overwhelmed [her]198-tess for the time . Let the truth be told - [women]1628-women do as a rule live through such humiliations , and regain [their]1628-women spirits , and again look about [them]1628-women with an interested eye . While there 's life there 's hope is a conviction not so entirely unknown to [the " betrayed]6369-the " betrayed "[198-tess] as [some amiable theorists]1992-some amiable theorists would have [us]1993-us believe .

[Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess , then , in good heart , and full of zest for life , descended [the Egdon]62-egdon slopes lower and lower towards [the dairy of [her]198-tess pilgrimage]1994-the dairy of her pilgrimage .

The marked difference , in the final particular , between the rival vales now showed itself . The secret of [Blackmoor]4-blackmoor was best discovered from [the heights around]1995-the heights around ; to read aright [the valley]496-the valley before [her]198-tess it was necessary to descend into [its]496-the valley midst . When [Tess]198-tess had accomplished this feat [she]198-tess found [herself]198-tess to be standing on a carpeted level , which stretched to [the east and west]1997-the east and west as far as the eye could reach .

[The river]1998-the river had stolen from [the higher tracts]1999-the higher tracts and brought in particles to [the vale]917-the vale all [this horizontal land]2001-this horizontal land ; and now , exhausted , aged , and attenuated , lay serpentining along through the midst of [its]496-the valley former spoils .

Not quite sure of [her]198-tess direction , [Tess]198-tess stood still upon [the hemmed expanse of verdant flatness]2002-the hemmed expanse of verdant flatness , like a fly on a billiard - table of indefinite length , and of no more consequence to the surroundings than that fly . The sole effect of [her]198-tess presence upon [the placid valley]2003-the placid valley so far had been to excite the mind of a solitary heron , which , after descending to the ground not far from [her]198-tess path , stood with neck erect , looking at [her]198-tess .

Suddenly there arose from [all parts of [the lowland]2005-the lowland]2004-all parts of the lowland a prolonged and repeated call - " Waow ! waow ! waow ! "[198-tess]

From the furthest east to [the furthest west]2006-the furthest west the cries spread as if by contagion , accompanied in some cases by the barking of a dog . It was not the expression of [the valley]496-the valley 's consciousness that [beautiful Tess]198-tess had arrived , but the ordinary announcement of milking - time - half - past four o'clock , when [the dairymen]2008-the dairymen set about getting in the cows .

[The red and white herd nearest at hand , which had been phlegmatically waiting for the call]2009-the red and white herd nearest at hand , which had been phlegmatically waiting for the call , now trooped towards [the steading in the background]2010-the steading in the background , [their]2009-the red and white herd nearest at hand , which had been phlegmatically waiting for the call great bags of milk swinging under [them]2009-the red and white herd nearest at hand , which had been phlegmatically waiting for the call as [they]2009-the red and white herd nearest at hand , which had been phlegmatically waiting for the call walked . [Tess]198-tess followed slowly in [their]2009-the red and white herd nearest at hand , which had been phlegmatically waiting for the call rear , and entered [the barton by the open gate through which [they]2009-the red and white herd nearest at hand , which had been phlegmatically waiting for the call had entered before [her]198-tess]2011-the barton by the open gate through which they had entered before her . [Long thatched sheds]2012-long thatched sheds stretched round [the enclosure]2013-the enclosure , [their]2012-long thatched sheds slopes encrusted with vivid green moss , and [their]2012-long thatched sheds eaves supported by wooden posts rubbed to a glossy smoothness by the flanks of infinite cows and calves of bygone years , now passed to an oblivion almost inconceivable in its profundity . Between the post were ranged [the milchers]2014-the milchers , each exhibiting [herself]198-tess at the present moment to a whimsical eye in the rear as a circle on two stalks , down the centre of which a switch moved pendulum - wise ; while the sun , lowering itself behind this patient row , threw their shadows accurately inwards upon the wall . Thus it threw shadows of [these obscure and homely figures]2015-these obscure and homely figures every evening with as much care over each contour as if it had been the profile of [a court beauty on a palace wall]2016-a court beauty on a palace wall ; copied them as diligently as it had copied Olympian shapes on marble facades long ago , or the outline of [Alexander]367-alec d'urberville , [Caesar]274-caesar , and [the Pharaohs]2017-the pharaohs .

[They]2018-they were the less restful cows that were stalled . Those that would stand still of [their]2018-they own will were milked in the middle of [the yard]1272-the yard , where many of such better behaved ones stood waiting now - [all prime milchers , such as were seldom seen out of [this valley]2021-this valley]2020-all prime milchers , such as were seldom seen out of this valley , and not always within [it]2021-this valley ; nourished by the succulent feed which the water - meads supplied at this prime season of the year . Those of [them]2014-the milchers that were spotted with white reflected the sunshine in dazzling brilliancy , and the polished brass knobs of [their]2014-the milchers horns glittered with something of military display . [Their]2014-the milchers large - veined udders hung ponderous as sandbags , the teats sticking out like the legs of a gipsy 's crock ; and as each animal lingered for [her]198-tess turn to arrive the milk oozed forth and fell in drops to the ground .

XVII

[The dairymaids]2022-the dairymaids and [men]5841-men had flocked down from [[their]2014-the milchers cottages]2024-their cottages and out of [the dairy - house]2025-the dairy - house with the arrival of the cows from [the meads]2026-the meads ; [the maids]6216-the maids walking in pattens , not on account of the weather , but to keep [their]6216-the maids shoes above [the mulch of the barton]2028-the mulch of the barton . [Each girl]2029-each girl sat down on [her]2029-each girl three - legged stool , [her]2029-each girl face sideways , [her]2029-each girl right cheek resting against the cow , and looked musingly along the animal 's flank at [Tess]198-tess as [she]198-tess approached . [The male milkers]2030-the male milkers , with hat - brims turned down , resting flat on [their]2030-the male milkers foreheads and gazing on the ground , did not observe [her]198-tess .

One of these was [a sturdy middle - aged man]2031-a sturdy middle - aged man - whose long white " pinner "[2031-a sturdy middle - aged man] was somewhat finer and cleaner than the wraps of the others , and whose jacket underneath had a presentable marketing aspect - [the master - dairyman , of whom [she]198-tess was in quest]2032-the master - dairyman , of whom she was in quest , [his]2032-the master - dairyman , of whom she was in quest double character as [a working milker and butter maker]2033-a working milker and butter maker [here]5975-here during six days , and on the seventh as a man in shining broad - cloth in [[his]2032-the master - dairyman , of whom she was in quest family pew]2035-his family pew at [church]813-church , being so marked as to have inspired a rhyme :

Dairyman Dick All the week : - On Sundays [Mister Richard Crick]275-mister richard crick .

Seeing [Tess]198-tess standing at gaze [he]275-mister richard crick went across to [her]198-tess .

[The majority of [dairymen]2038-dairymen]2037-the majority of dairymen have a cross manner at milking time , but it happened that [Mr Crick]275-mister richard crick was glad to get a new hand - for the days were busy ones now - and [he]275-mister richard crick received [her]198-tess warmly ; inquiring for [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother and [the rest of [the family]719-the family]2040-the rest of the family - though this as a matter of form merely , for in reality [he]275-mister richard crick had not been aware of [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield 's existence till apprised of the fact by a brief business - letter about [Tess]198-tess .

" Oh - ay , as [a lad]6370-a lad [I]275-mister richard crick knowed [[your]198-tess part o ' [the country]507-the country]6371-your part o ' the country very well , "[275-mister richard crick] [he]275-mister richard crick said terminatively . " Though [I]275-mister richard crick 've never been [there]5839-there since . And [a aged woman of ninety that use to live nigh here]6374-a aged woman of ninety that use to live nigh here , but is dead and gone long ago , told [me]275-mister richard crick that [a family of some such name as [yours]198-tess in [Blackmoor Vale]53-blackmoor vale]6375-a family of some such name as yours in blackmoor vale came originally from [these parts]1368-these parts , and that ' twere a old ancient race that had all but perished off [the earth]1046-the earth - though [the new generations]6378-the new generations did n't know it . But , [Lord]6379-lord , [I]275-mister richard crick took no notice of [the old woman]1273-the old woman 's ramblings , not [I.]275-mister richard crick "[275-mister richard crick]

" Oh no - it is nothing , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess .

Then the talk was of business only .

" [You]198-tess can milk 'em clean , [[my]275-mister richard crick maidy]6381-my maidy ? [I]275-mister richard crick do n't want [my]275-mister richard crick cows going azew at this time o ' year . "[275-mister richard crick]

[She]198-tess reassured [him]2042-him on that point , and [he]2042-him surveyed [her]198-tess up and down . [She]198-tess had been staying indoors a good deal , and [her]198-tess complexion had grown delicate .

" Quite sure [you]198-tess can stand it ? ' Tis comfortable enough here for [rough folk]6382-rough folk ; but [we]6383-we do n't live in a cowcumber frame . "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess declared that [she]198-tess could stand it , and [her]198-tess zest and willingness seemed to win [him]2042-him over .

" Well , [I]198-tess suppose [you]198-tess 'll want a dish o ' tay , or victuals of some sort , hey ? Not yet ? Well , do as [ye]198-tess like about it . But faith , if ' twas [I]198-tess , [I]198-tess should be as dry as a kex wi ' travelling so far . "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess 'll begin milking now , to get [my]198-tess hand in , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess .

[She]198-tess drank a little milk as temporary refreshment - to the surprise - indeed , slight contempt - of [Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick , to whose mind it had apparently never occurred that milk was good as a beverage .

" Oh , if [ye]198-tess can swaller that , be it so , "[276-dairyman crick] [he]276-dairyman crick said indifferently , while holding up the pail that [she]198-tess sipped from . " ' Tis what [I]276-dairyman crick hain't touched for years - not [I.]276-dairyman crick Rot the stuff ; it would lie in [my]276-dairyman crick innerds like lead . [You]198-tess can try [your]198-tess hand upon [she]198-tess , "[276-dairyman crick] [he]276-dairyman crick pursued , nodding to the nearest cow . " Not but what [she]198-tess do milk rather hard . [We]6384-we 've hard ones and [we]6384-we 've easy ones , like [other folks]6385-other folks . However , [you]198-tess 'll find out that soon enough . "[276-dairyman crick]

When [Tess]198-tess had changed [her]198-tess bonnet for a hood , and was really on [her]198-tess stool under the cow , and the milk was squirting from [her]198-tess fists into the pail , [she]198-tess appeared to feel that [she]198-tess really had laid a new foundation for [her]198-tess future . The conviction bred serenity , [her]198-tess pulse slowed , and [she]198-tess was able to look about [her]198-tess .

[The milkers]2043-the milkers formed quite [a little battalion of [men]5841-men and [maids]2046-maids]2044-a little battalion of men and maids , [the men operating on the hard - teated animals]2047-the men operating on the hard - teated animals , [the maids on the kindlier natures]2048-the maids on the kindlier natures . It was [a large dairy]2049-a large dairy . There were nearly a hundred milchers under [[Crick]276-dairyman crick 's management]2050-crick 's management , all told ; and of the herd [the master - dairyman]2051-the master - dairyman milked six or eight with [his]2051-the master - dairyman own hands , unless away from [home]5850-home . These were [the cows that milked hardest of all]2053-the cows that milked hardest of all ; for [his]2051-the master - dairyman journey - [milkmen]2054-milkmen being more or less casually hired , [he]2051-the master - dairyman would not entrust [this half - dozen]2055-this half - dozen to [their]2055-this half - dozen treatment , lest , from indifference , [they]2054-milkmen should not milk [them]2055-this half - dozen fully ; nor to [the maids]6216-the maids , lest [they]6216-the maids should fail in the same way for lack of finger - grip ; with the result that in course of time the cows would " go azew "[6216-the maids] - that is , dry up . It was not the loss for the moment that made slack milking so serious , but that with the decline of demand there came decline , and ultimately cessation , of supply .

After [Tess]198-tess had settled down to [her]198-tess cow there was for a time no talk in the barton , and not a sound interfered with the purr of the milk - jets into the numerous pails , except a momentary exclamation to one or other of the beasts requesting [her]198-tess to turn round or stand still . The only movements were those of [the milkers]2043-the milkers ' hands up and down , and the swing of the cows ' tails . Thus [they]2043-the milkers all worked on , encompassed by the vast flat mead which extended to [either slope of [the valley]496-the valley]2058-either slope of the valley - a level landscape compounded of old landscapes long forgotten , and , no doubt , differing in character very greatly from [the landscape [they]2043-the milkers composed now]2060-the landscape they composed now .

" To [my]1900-the dairyman thinking , "[1900-the dairyman] said [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman , rising suddenly from a cow [he]1900-the dairyman had just finished off , snatching up [his]1900-the dairyman three - legged stool in one hand and the pail in the other , and moving on to the next hard - yielder in [[his]1900-the dairyman vicinity]2062-his vicinity , " to [my]1900-the dairyman thinking , the cows do n't gie down [their]2043-the milkers milk to - day as usual . Upon [my]1900-the dairyman life , if [Winker]277-winker do begin keeping back like this , [she]277-winker 'll not be worth going under by midsummer . "[1900-the dairyman]

" ' Tis because there 's a new hand come among [us]6386-us , "[278-jonathan] said [Jonathan Kail]278-jonathan . " [I]278-jonathan 've noticed such things afore . "[278-jonathan]

" To be sure . It may be so . [I]1900-the dairyman did n't think o't . "[1900-the dairyman]

" [I]6364-a dairymaid 've been told that it goes up into [their]2043-the milkers horns at such times , "[6364-a dairymaid] said [a dairymaid]6364-a dairymaid .

" Well , as to going up into [their]2043-the milkers horns , "[276-dairyman crick] replied [Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick dubiously , as though even witchcraft might be limited by anatomical possibilities , " [I]276-dairyman crick could n't say ; [I]276-dairyman crick certainly could not . But as nott cows will keep it back as well as [the horned ones]6387-the horned ones , [I]276-dairyman crick do n't quite agree to it . Do [ye]278-jonathan know that riddle about the nott cows , [Jonathan]278-jonathan ? Why do nott cows give less milk in a year than horned ? "[276-dairyman crick]

" [I]2064-the milkmaid do n't ! "[2064-the milkmaid] interposed [the milkmaid]2064-the milkmaid , " Why do [they]2043-the milkers ? "[2064-the milkmaid]

" Because there bain't so many of 'em , "[1900-the dairyman] said [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman . " [Howsomever]279-howsomever , [these gam'sters]6388-these gam'sters do certainly keep back [their]6388-these gam'sters milk to - day . [Folks]280-folks , [we]2068-the band of milkers must lift up a stave or two - that 's the only cure for't . "[1900-the dairyman]

Songs were often resorted to in [dairies]2066-dairies hereabout as an enticement to the cows when [they]2067-they showed signs of withholding [their]2067-they usual yield ; and [the band of [milkers]2069-milkers]2068-the band of milkers at this request burst into melody - in purely business - like tones , it is true , and with no great spontaneity ; the result , according to [their]2068-the band of milkers own belief , being a decided improvement during the song 's continuance . When [they]2068-the band of milkers had gone through fourteen or fifteen verses of a cheerful ballad about [a murderer who was afraid to go to bed in the dark]2070-a murderer who was afraid to go to bed in the dark because [he]2070-a murderer who was afraid to go to bed in the dark saw certain brimstone flames around [him]2070-a murderer who was afraid to go to bed in the dark , [one of [the male milkers]2030-the male milkers]2071-one of the male milkers said -

" [I]2071-one of the male milkers wish singing on the stoop did n't use up so much of [a man]1337-a man 's wind ! [You]1900-the dairyman should get [your]1900-the dairyman harp , [sir]5821-sir ; not but what a fiddle is best . "[2071-one of the male milkers]

[Tess]198-tess , who had given ear to this , thought the words were addressed to [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman , but [she]198-tess was wrong . A reply , in the shape of " Why ? "[198-tess] came as it were out of the belly of a dun cow in [the stalls]2074-the stalls ; it had been spoken by [a milker behind the animal , whom [she]2075-a milker behind the animal , whom she had not hitherto perceived had not hitherto perceived]2075-a milker behind the animal , whom she had not hitherto perceived .

" Oh yes ; there 's nothing like a fiddle , "[1900-the dairyman] said [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman . " Though [I]1900-the dairyman do think that bulls are more moved by a tune than cows - at least that 's [my]1900-the dairyman experience . Once there was [an old aged man]6391-an old aged man over at [Mellstock]70-mellstock - [William Dewy]281-william by name - one of [the family that used to do a good deal of business as tranters over there]6392-the family that used to do a good deal of business as tranters over there - [Jonathan]278-jonathan , do [ye]1900-the dairyman mind ? - [I]1900-the dairyman knowed [the man]1516-the man by sight as well as [I]1900-the dairyman know [[my]1900-the dairyman own brother]6394-my own brother , in a manner of speaking . Well , [this man]1582-this man was a coming [home]5850-home along from a wedding , where [he]1582-this man had been playing [his]1582-this man fiddle , one fine moonlight night , and for shortness ' sake [he]1582-this man took a cut across [Forty - acres]6397-forty - acres , [a field lying that way]6398-a field lying that way , where a bull was out to grass . The bull seed [William]281-william , and took after [him]1582-this man , horns aground , begad ; and though [William]281-william runned [his]281-william best , and had n't MUCH drink in [him]281-william considering ' twas a wedding , and [the folks]6399-the folks well off , [he]281-william found [he]281-william 'd never reach the fence and get over in time to save [himself]281-william . Well , as a last thought , [he]281-william pulled out [his]281-william fiddle as [he]281-william runned , and struck up a jig , turning to the bull , and backing towards the corner . [The bull]6400-the bull softened down , and stood still , looking hard at [William Dewy]281-william , who fiddled on and on ; till a sort of a smile stole over [the bull]6400-the bull 's face . But no sooner did [William]281-william stop [his]281-william playing and turn to get over hedge than [the bull]6400-the bull would stop [his]6400-the bull smiling and lower [his]6400-the bull horns towards the seat of [William]281-william 's breeches . Well , [William]281-william had to turn about and play on , willy - nilly ; and ' twas only three o'clock in [the world]497-the world , and ' a knowed that [nobody]754-nobody would come that way for hours , and [he]281-william so leery and tired that ' a did n't know what to do . When [he]281-william had scraped till about four o'clock [he]281-william felt that [he]281-william verily would have to give over soon , and [he]281-william said to [himself]281-william , ' There 's only this last tune between [me]1900-the dairyman and eternal welfare ! [Heaven]282-heaven save [me]1900-the dairyman , or [I]1900-the dairyman 'm [a done man]6405-a done man . ' Well , then [he]281-william called to mind how [he]281-william 'd seen the cattle kneel o ' Christmas Eves in the dead o ' night . It was not Christmas Eve then , but it came into [his]281-william head to play a trick upon the bull . So [he]281-william broke into the ' Tivity Hymm , just as at Christmas carol - singing ; when , lo and behold , down went the bull on [his]6400-the bull bended knees , in [his]6400-the bull ignorance , just as if ' twere the true ' Tivity night and hour . As soon as [[his]281-william horned friend]6406-his horned friend were down , [William]281-william turned , clinked off like a long - dog , and jumped safe over hedge , before the praying bull had got on [his]6400-the bull feet again to take after [him]6400-the bull . [William]281-william used to say that [he]281-william 'd seen [a man]1337-a man look [a fool]6029-a fool a good many times , but never such [a fool as that bull]6409-a fool as that bull looked when [he]281-william found [his]281-william pious feelings had been played upon , and ' twas not Christmas Eve . ... Yes , [William Dewy]281-william , that was [the man]1516-the man 's name ; and [I]1900-the dairyman can tell [you]281-william to a foot where 's [he]1516-the man a - lying in [Mellstock Churchyard]71-mellstock churchyard at this very moment - just between the second yew - tree and [the north aisle]6411-the north aisle . "[1900-the dairyman]

" It 's a curious story ; it carries [us]6412-us back to medieval times , when faith was a living thing ! "[198-tess]

The remark , singular for [a dairy - yard]2077-a dairy - yard , was murmured by the voice behind the dun cow ; but as [nobody]754-nobody understood the reference , no notice was taken , except that [the narrator]2079-the narrator seemed to think it might imply scepticism as to [his]2079-the narrator tale .

" Well , ' tis quite true , [sir]5821-sir , whether or no . [I]2079-the narrator knowed [the man]1516-the man well . "[2079-the narrator]

" Oh yes ; [I]2080-the person behind the dun cow have no doubt of it , "[2080-the person behind the dun cow] said [the person behind the dun cow]2080-the person behind the dun cow .

[Tess]198-tess 's attention was thus attracted to [[the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's interlocutor]2082-the dairyman 's interlocutor , of whom [she]198-tess could see but the merest patch , owing to [his]1900-the dairyman burying [his]1900-the dairyman head so persistently in the flank of the milcher . [She]198-tess could not understand why [he]1900-the dairyman should be addressed as ' [sir]5821-sir " even by [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman [himself]1900-the dairyman . But no explanation was discernible ; [he]1900-the dairyman remained under the cow long enough to have milked three , uttering a private ejaculation now and then , as if [he]1900-the dairyman could not get on .[1900-the dairyman]

" So [I]2085-the other find , "[2085-the other] said [the other]2085-the other , standing up at last and stretching [his]2085-the other arms . [Tess]198-tess could then see [him]1900-the dairyman at full length . [He]1900-the dairyman wore the ordinary white pinner and leather leggings of [a dairy - farmer]2086-a dairy - farmer when milking , and [his]1900-the dairyman boots were clogged with the mulch of [the yard]1272-the yard ; but this was all [his]1900-the dairyman local livery . Beneath it was something educated , reserved , subtle , sad , differing .

But the details of [his]1900-the dairyman aspect were temporarily thrust aside by the discovery that [he]1900-the dairyman was one whom [she]198-tess had seen before . Such vicissitudes had [Tess]198-tess passed through since that time that for a moment [she]198-tess could not remember where [she]198-tess had met [him]1900-the dairyman ; and then it flashed upon [her]198-tess that [he]1900-the dairyman was [the pedestrian who had joined in the club - dance at [Marlott]21-marlott]2088-the pedestrian who had joined in the club - dance at marlott - [the passing stranger who had come [she]198-tess knew not whence , had danced with [others]1383-others but not with [her]198-tess]2089-the passing stranger who had come she knew not whence , had danced with others but not with her , and slightingly left [her]198-tess , and gone on [his]1900-the dairyman way with [[his]1900-the dairyman friends]2091-his friends .

The flood of memories brought back by this revival of an incident anterior to [her]198-tess troubles produced a momentary dismay lest , recognizing [her]198-tess also , [he]1900-the dairyman should by some means discover [her]198-tess story . But it passed away when [she]198-tess found no sign of remembrance in [him]1900-the dairyman . [She]198-tess saw by degrees that since [their]2092-their first and only encounter [his]1900-the dairyman mobile face had grown more thoughtful , and had acquired [a young man]2093-a young man 's shapely moustache and beard - the latter of the palest straw colour where it began upon [his]1900-the dairyman cheeks , and deepening to a warm brown farther from its root . Under [his]1900-the dairyman linen milking - pinner [he]1900-the dairyman wore a dark velveteen jacket , cord breeches and gaiters , and a starched white shirt . Without the milking - gear [nobody]754-nobody could have guessed what [he]1900-the dairyman was . [He]1900-the dairyman might with equal probability have been [an eccentric landowner]2095-an eccentric landowner or [a gentlemanly ploughman]2096-a gentlemanly ploughman . That [he]1900-the dairyman was but a novice at dairy work [she]198-tess had realized in a moment , from the time [he]1900-the dairyman had spent upon the milking of one cow .

Meanwhile [many of [the milkmaids]2098-the milkmaids]2097-many of the milkmaids had said to one another of [the newcomer]804-the newcomer , " How pretty [she]198-tess is ! "[2097-many of the milkmaids] with something of real generosity and admiration , though with a half hope that [the auditors]2100-the auditors would qualify the assertion - which , strictly speaking , [they]2100-the auditors might have done , prettiness being an inexact definition of what struck the eye in [Tess]198-tess . When the milking was finished for the evening [they]2101-they straggled indoors , where [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick , [[the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's wife]2103-the dairyman 's wife - who was too respectable to go out milking [herself]283-mrs crick , and wore a hot stuff gown in warm weather because [the dairymaids]2022-the dairymaids wore prints - was giving an eye to the leads and things .

Only [two or three of [the maids]6216-the maids]2105-two or three of the maids , [Tess]198-tess learnt , slept in [the dairy - house]2025-the dairy - house besides [herself]198-tess , [most of [the helpers]2109-the helpers going to [[their]2109-the helpers homes]1420-their homes]2108-most of the helpers going to their homes . [She]198-tess saw nothing at supper - time of [the superior milker who had commented on the story]2111-the superior milker who had commented on the story , and asked no questions about [him]2111-the superior milker who had commented on the story , the remainder of the evening being occupied in arranging [her]198-tess place in the bed - chamber . It was [a large room over [the milk - house]2113-the milk - house]2112-a large room over the milk - house , some thirty feet long ; the sleeping - cots of [the other three indoor milkmaids]2114-the other three indoor milkmaids being in [the same apartment]830-the same apartment . [They]2114-the other three indoor milkmaids were [blooming young women]2116-blooming young women , and , except one , rather older than [herself]198-tess . By bedtime [Tess]198-tess was thoroughly tired , and fell asleep immediately .

But one of [the girls]576-the girls , who occupied an adjoining bed , was more wakeful than [Tess]198-tess , and would insist upon relating to the latter various particulars of [the homestead into which [she]198-tess had just entered]2118-the homestead into which she had just entered . [The girl]647-the girl 's whispered words mingled with the shades , and , to [Tess]198-tess 's drowsy mind , they seemed to be generated by the darkness in which [they]2120-they floated .

" [Mr Angel Clare]284-clare - [he]284-clare that is learning milking , and that plays the harp - never says much to [us]6417-us . [He]284-clare is [[a pa'son]6418-a pa'son 's son]6419-a pa'son 's son , and is too much taken up wi ' [his]284-clare own thoughts to notice [girls]1696-girls . [He]284-clare is [[the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's pupil]6422-the dairyman 's pupil - learning farming in all its branches . [He]284-clare has learnt sheep - farming at [another place]6423-another place , and [he]284-clare 's now mastering dairy - work .... Yes , [he]284-clare is quite [the gentleman - born]6424-the gentleman - born . [[His]284-clare father]457-his father is [the Reverent Mr Clare]285-the reverent mr clare at [Emminster]72-emminster - a good many miles from [here]5975-here . "[647-the girl]

" Oh - [I]1256-her companion have heard of [him]284-clare , "[1256-her companion] said [[her]2121-her companion]1256-her companion , now awake . " [A very earnest clergyman]6427-a very earnest clergyman , is [he]284-clare not ? "[1256-her companion]

" Yes - that [he]284-clare is - [the earnestest man in all [Wessex]37-wessex]6428-the earnestest man in all wessex , [they]6429-they say - [the last of [the old Low Church sort]6431-the old low church sort]6430-the last of the old low church sort , [they]6429-they tell [me]647-the girl - for all about here be what [they]6429-they call [High]286-high . All [[his]284-clare sons]6432-his sons , except [[our]6433-our [Mr Clare]285-the reverent mr clare]6434-our mr clare , be made [pa'sons]6435-pa'sons too . "[647-the girl]

[Tess]198-tess had not at this hour the curiosity to ask why [the present Mr Clare]285-the reverent mr clare was not made [a parson]2123-a parson like [[his]285-the reverent mr clare brethren]2124-his brethren , and gradually fell asleep again , the words of [[her]198-tess informant]2125-her informant coming to [her]198-tess along with the smell of the cheeses in [the adjoining cheeseloft]2126-the adjoining cheeseloft , and the measured dripping of the whey from the wrings downstairs .

XVIII

[Angel Clare]284-clare rises out of the past not altogether as [a distinct figure]2127-a distinct figure , but as an appreciative voice , [a long regard of fixed , abstracted eyes]2128-a long regard of fixed , abstracted eyes , and a mobility of mouth somewhat too small and delicately lined for [a man]1337-a man 's , though with an unexpectedly firm close of the lower lip now and then ; enough to do away with any inference of indecision . Nevertheless , something nebulous , preoccupied , vague , in [his]284-clare bearing and regard , marked [him]284-clare as one who probably had no very definite aim or concern about [his]284-clare material future . Yet as [a lad]6370-a lad [people]5930-people had said of [him]284-clare that [he]284-clare was one who might do anything if [he]284-clare tried .

[He]284-clare was [the youngest son of [[his]284-clare father]457-his father , a poor parson at [the other end of [the county]5889-the county]2134-the other end of the county]2132-the youngest son of his father , a poor parson at the other end of the county , and had arrived at [Talbothays Dairy]73-talbothays dairy as [a six months ' pupil]2136-a six months ' pupil , after going the round of [some other farms]2137-some other farms , [his]284-clare object being to acquire a practical skill in the various processes of farming , with a view either to [the Colonies]2138-the colonies or the tenure of [a home - farm]2139-a home - farm , as circumstances might decide .

[His]284-clare entry into the ranks of [the agriculturists and breeders]2140-the agriculturists and breeders was a step in [the young man]471-the young man 's career which had been anticipated neither by [himself]284-clare nor by [others]1383-others .

[[Mr Clare]284-clare the elder , whose first wife had died and left [him]284-clare [a daughter]2144-a daughter]2143-mr clare the elder , whose first wife had died and left him a daughter , married [a second late in life]2145-a second late in life . [This lady]1266-this lady had somewhat unexpectedly brought [him]284-clare [three sons]2147-three sons , so that between [Angel]284-clare , [the youngest]609-the youngest , and [[his]284-clare father]457-his father [the Vicar]1858-the vicar there seemed to be almost [a missing generation]2151-a missing generation . [Of [these boys]2153-these boys [the aforesaid Angel]2154-the aforesaid angel , [the child of [his]2154-the aforesaid angel old age]2155-the child of his old age]2152-of these boys the aforesaid angel , the child of his old age , was [the only son who had not taken a University degree]2156-the only son who had not taken a university degree , though [he]2154-the aforesaid angel was [the single one of [them]2153-these boys]2157-the single one of them [whose early promise might have done full justice to an academical training]2158-whose early promise might have done full justice to an academical training .

Some two or three years before [Angel]284-clare 's appearance at [the Marlott dance]2159-the marlott dance , on a day when [he]284-clare had left [school]927-school and was pursuing [his]284-clare studies at [home]5850-home , a parcel came to [the Vicarage]2162-the vicarage from [the local bookseller 's]2163-the local bookseller 's , directed to [the Reverend James Clare]287-the reverend james clare . [The Vicar]1858-the vicar having opened it and found it to contain a book , read a few pages ; whereupon [he]1858-the vicar jumped up from [his]1858-the vicar seat and went straight to [the shop]2165-the shop with the book under [his]1858-the vicar arm .

" Why has this been sent to [[my]1858-the vicar house]5894-my house ? "[1858-the vicar] [he]1858-the vicar asked peremptorily , holding up the volume .

" It was ordered , [sir]5821-sir . "[2166-the shopkeeper]

" Not by [me]2166-the shopkeeper , or [any one belonging to [me]2166-the shopkeeper]6438-any one belonging to me , [I]2166-the shopkeeper am happy to say . "[2166-the shopkeeper]

[The shopkeeper]2166-the shopkeeper looked into [his]2166-the shopkeeper order - book .

" Oh , it has been misdirected , [sir]5821-sir , "[2166-the shopkeeper] [he]2166-the shopkeeper said . " It was ordered by [Mr Angel Clare]284-clare , and should have been sent to [him]284-clare . "[2166-the shopkeeper]

[Mr Clare]284-clare winced as if [he]284-clare had been struck . [He]284-clare went [home]5850-home pale and dejected , and called [Angel]284-clare into [[his]284-clare study]2168-his study .

" Look into this book , [[my]284-clare boy]6440-my boy , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said . " What do [you]6440-my boy know about it ? "[284-clare]

" [I]284-clare ordered it , "[284-clare] said [Angel]284-clare simply .

" What for ? "[284-clare]

" To read . "[284-clare]

" How can [you]6440-my boy think of reading it ? "[284-clare]

" How can [I]284-clare ? Why - it is a system of philosophy . There is no more moral , or even religious , work published . "[284-clare]

" Yes - moral enough ; [I]284-clare do n't deny that . But religious ! - and for [YOU]6440-my boy , who intend to be [a minister of the Gospel]6441-a minister of the gospel ! "[284-clare]

" Since [you]284-clare have alluded to the matter , [father]5842-father , "[6347-the son] said [the son]6347-the son , with anxious thought upon [his]6347-the son face , " [I]6347-the son should like to say , once for all , that [I]6347-the son should prefer not to take Orders . [I]6347-the son fear [I]6347-the son could not conscientiously do so . [I]6347-the son love [the Church]6443-the church as [one]6172-one loves [a parent]6445-a parent . [I]6347-the son shall always have the warmest affection for [her]6443-the church . There is [no institution for whose history [I]6347-the son have a deeper admiration]6446-no institution for whose history i have a deeper admiration ; but [I]6347-the son can not honestly be ordained [[her]6443-the church minister]6447-her minister , as [[my]6347-the son brothers]6448-my brothers are , while [she]6443-the church refuses to liberate [her]6443-the church mind from an untenable redemptive theolatry . "[6347-the son]

It had never occurred to [the straightforward and simple - minded Vicar]2170-the straightforward and simple - minded vicar that one of [his]2170-the straightforward and simple - minded vicar own flesh and blood could come to this ! [He]2170-the straightforward and simple - minded vicar was stultified , shocked , paralysed . And if [Angel]284-clare were not going to enter the Church , what was the use of sending [him]284-clare to [Cambridge]74-cambridge ? [The University]75-the university as a step to anything but ordination seemed , to [this man of fixed ideas]2171-this man of fixed ideas , a preface without a volume . [He]284-clare was [a man]1337-a man not merely religious , but devout ; [a firm believer]2173-a firm believer - not as the phrase is now elusively construed by theological thimble - riggers in the Church and out of it , but in the old and ardent sense of [the Evangelical school]2174-the evangelical school : one who could

Indeed opine That the Eternal and Divine Did , eighteen centuries ago In very truth ...

[[Angel]284-clare 's father]2175-angel 's father tried argument , persuasion , entreaty .

" No , [father]5842-father ; [I]284-clare can not underwrite Article Four leave alone the rest , taking it ' in the literal and grammatical sense ' as required by the Declaration ; and , therefore , [I]284-clare ca n't be [a parson in the present state of affairs]6450-a parson in the present state of affairs , "[284-clare] said [Angel]284-clare . " [My]284-clare whole instinct in matters of religion is towards reconstruction ; to quote [your]5842-father favorite Epistle to [the Hebrews]288-the hebrews , ' the removing of those things that are shaken , as of things that are made , that those things which can not be shaken may remain . ' "[284-clare]

[[His]284-clare father]457-his father grieved so deeply that it made [Angel]284-clare quite ill to see [him]457-his father .

" What is the good of [[your]284-clare mother]6051-your mother and [me]457-his father economizing and stinting [ourselves]6452-ourselves to give [you]284-clare a University education , if it is not to be used for the honour and glory of [God]222-god ? "[457-his father] [[his]284-clare father]457-his father repeated .

" Why , that it may be used for the honour and glory of [man]970-man , [father]5842-father . "[457-his father]

Perhaps if [Angel]284-clare had persevered [he]284-clare might have gone to [Cambridge]74-cambridge like [[his]284-clare brothers]634-his brothers . But [the Vicar]1858-the vicar 's view of that seat of learning as a stepping - stone to Orders alone was quite a family tradition ; and so rooted was the idea in [his]284-clare mind that perseverance began to appear to [the sensitive son]2180-the sensitive son akin to an intent to misappropriate a trust , and wrong [the pious heads of [the household]874-the household , who had been and were , as [[his]284-clare father]457-his father had hinted , compelled to exercise much thrift to carry out this uniform plan of education for [the three young men]2184-the three young men]2181-the pious heads of the household , who had been and were , as his father had hinted , compelled to exercise much thrift to carry out this uniform plan of education for the three young men .

" [I]284-clare will do without [Cambridge]74-cambridge , "[284-clare] said [Angel]284-clare at last . " [I]284-clare feel that [I]284-clare have no right to go [there]5839-there in the circumstances . "[284-clare]

The effects of this decisive debate were not long in showing themselves . [He]284-clare spent years and years in desultory studies , undertakings , and meditations ; [he]284-clare began to evince considerable indifference to social forms and observances . The material distinctions of rank and wealth [he]284-clare increasingly despised . Even [the " good old family]6456-the " good old family "[6456-the " good old family] to use a favourite phrase of [a late local worthy]2185-a late local worthy had no aroma for [him]284-clare unless there were good new resolutions in [its representatives]2186-its representatives . As a balance to these austerities , when [he]284-clare went to live in [London]23-london to see what [the world]497-the world was like , and with a view to practising a profession or business [there]5839-there , [he]284-clare was carried off [his]284-clare head , and nearly entrapped by [a woman much older than [himself]284-clare]2189-a woman much older than himself , though luckily [he]284-clare escaped not greatly the worse for the experience .

Early association with country solitudes had bred in [him]284-clare an unconquerable , and almost unreasonable , aversion to [modern town]2190-modern town life , and shut [him]284-clare out from such success as [he]284-clare might have aspired to by following a mundane calling in the impracticability of the spiritual one . But something had to be done ; [he]284-clare had wasted many valuable years ; and having [an acquaintance who was starting on a thriving life as [a Colonial farmer]2192-a colonial farmer]2191-an acquaintance who was starting on a thriving life as a colonial farmer , it occurred to [Angel]284-clare that this might be a lead in the right direction . Farming , either in [the Colonies]2138-the colonies , [America]76-america , or at [home]5850-home - farming , at any rate , after becoming well qualified for the business by a careful apprenticeship - that was a vocation which would probably afford an independence without the sacrifice of what [he]284-clare valued even more than a competency - intellectual liberty .

So [we]2195-we find [Angel Clare]284-clare at six - and - twenty here at [Talbothays]60-talbothays as [a student of kine]2196-a student of kine , and , as there were [no houses near at hand]2197-no houses near at hand in which [he]284-clare could get [a comfortable lodging]2198-a comfortable lodging , [a boarder at [[the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's]2201-the dairyman 's]2199-a boarder at the dairyman 's .

[[His]284-clare room]2202-his room was [an immense attic which ran the whole length of [the dairy - house]2025-the dairy - house]2203-an immense attic which ran the whole length of the dairy - house . [It]2202-his room could only be reached by a ladder from [the cheese - loft]2205-the cheese - loft , and had been closed up for a long time till [he]284-clare arrived and selected [it]2202-his room as [[his]284-clare retreat]2206-his retreat . [Here]5975-here [Clare]284-clare had plenty of space , and could often be heard by [the dairy - folk]2208-the dairy - folk pacing up and down when [the household]874-the household had gone to rest . A portion was divided off at one end by a curtain , behind which was [his]284-clare bed , the outer part being furnished as [a homely sitting - room]2210-a homely sitting - room .

At first [he]284-clare lived up above entirely , reading a good deal , and strumming upon an old harp which [he]284-clare had bought at a sale , saying when in a bitter humour that [he]284-clare might have to get [his]284-clare living by it in [the streets]2211-the streets some day . But [he]284-clare soon preferred to read human nature by taking [his]284-clare meals [downstairs]1128-downstairs in [the general dining - kitchen]2213-the general dining - kitchen , with [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman and [[his]1900-the dairyman wife]819-his wife , and [the maids]6216-the maids and [men , who all together formed a lively assembly]2217-men , who all together formed a lively assembly ; for though but few milking hands slept in [the house]652-the house , [several]2219-several joined [the family]719-the family at meals . The longer [Clare]284-clare resided [here]5975-here the less objection had [he]284-clare to [[his]284-clare company]2222-his company , and the more did [he]284-clare like to share [quarters]2223-quarters with [them]2222-his company in common .

Much to [his]284-clare surprise [he]284-clare took , indeed , a real delight in [their]2222-his company companionship . [The conventional farm - folk of [his]284-clare imagination]2224-the conventional farm - folk of his imagination - personified in the newspaper - press by [the pitiable dummy known as [Hodge]289-hodge]2225-the pitiable dummy known as hodge - were obliterated after a few days ' residence . At close quarters no [Hodge]289-hodge was to be seen . At first , it is true , when [Clare]284-clare 's intelligence was fresh from a contrasting society , [these friends with whom [he]284-clare now hobnobbed]2226-these friends with whom he now hobnobbed seemed a little strange . Sitting down as [a level member of [[the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's household]2229-the dairyman 's household]2227-a level member of the dairyman 's household seemed at the outset an undignified proceeding . The ideas , the modes , the surroundings , appeared retrogressive and unmeaning . But with living on [there]5839-there , day after day , [the acute sojourner]2231-the acute sojourner became conscious of a new aspect in the spectacle . Without any objective change whatever , variety had taken the place of monotonousness . [[His]284-clare host]2232-his host and [[[his]284-clare host]2232-his host 's household]2234-his host 's household , [[his]284-clare men]2235-his men and [[his]284-clare maids]2236-his maids , as [they]2226-these friends with whom he now hobnobbed became intimately known to [Clare]284-clare , began to differentiate [themselves]2226-these friends with whom he now hobnobbed as in a chemical process . The thought of [Pascal]290-pascal 's was brought [home]5850-home to [him]284-clare : " A mesure qu'on a plus d'esprit , on trouve qu'il y a plus d'hommes originaux . Les gens du commun ne trouvent pas de difference entre les hommes . "[290-pascal] The typical and unvarying [Hodge]289-hodge ceased to exist . [He]289-hodge had been disintegrated into a number of varied fellow - creatures - [beings of many minds]2238-beings of many minds , [beings infinite in difference]2239-beings infinite in difference ; [some happy , many serene]2240-some happy , many serene , [a few depressed]2241-a few depressed , [one here and there bright even to genius]2242-one here and there bright even to genius , [some stupid]2243-some stupid , others wanton , others austere ; [some mutely Miltonic]2244-some mutely miltonic , [some potentially Cromwellian]2245-some potentially cromwellian - into [men who had private views of [each other]577-each other , as [he]289-hodge had of [[his]289-hodge friends]2091-his friends ; who could applaud or condemn [each other]577-each other , amuse or sadden [themselves]2246-men who had private views of each other , as he had of his friends ; who could applaud or condemn each other , amuse or sadden themselves by the contemplation of each other 's foibles or vices by the contemplation of [each other]577-each other 's foibles or vices]2246-men who had private views of each other , as he had of his friends ; who could applaud or condemn each other , amuse or sadden themselves by the contemplation of each other 's foibles or vices ; [men every one of whom walked in [his]289-hodge own individual way the road to dusty death]2251-men every one of whom walked in his own individual way the road to dusty death .

Unexpectedly [he]289-hodge began to like the outdoor life for its own sake , and for what it brought , apart from its bearing on [his]289-hodge own proposed career . Considering [his]289-hodge position [he]289-hodge became wonderfully free from the chronic melancholy which is taking hold of the civilized races with the decline of belief in a beneficent Power . For the first time of late years [he]289-hodge could read as [his]289-hodge musings inclined [him]289-hodge , without any eye to cramming for a profession , since the few farming handbooks which [he]289-hodge deemed it desirable to master occupied [him]289-hodge but little time .

[He]289-hodge grew away from old associations , and saw something new in life and humanity . Secondarily , [he]289-hodge made close acquaintance with phenomena which [he]289-hodge had before known but darkly - the seasons in [their]2246-men who had private views of each other , as he had of his friends ; who could applaud or condemn each other , amuse or sadden themselves by the contemplation of each other 's foibles or vices moods , morning and evening , night and noon , winds in [their]2246-men who had private views of each other , as he had of his friends ; who could applaud or condemn each other , amuse or sadden themselves by the contemplation of each other 's foibles or vices different tempers , trees , waters and mists , shades and silences , and the voices of inanimate things .

The early mornings were still sufficiently cool to render a fire acceptable in [the large room wherein [they]2253-they breakfasted]2252-the large room wherein they breakfasted ; and , by [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick 's orders , who held that [he]289-hodge was too genteel to mess at [their]2253-they table , it was [Angel Clare]284-clare 's custom to sit in the yawning chimney - corner during the meal , [his]289-hodge cup - and - saucer and plate being placed on a hinged flap at [his]289-hodge elbow . The light from the long , wide , mullioned window opposite shone in upon [[his]289-hodge nook]2254-his nook , and , assisted by a secondary light of cold blue quality which shone down the chimney , enabled [him]289-hodge to read there easily whenever disposed to do so . Between [Clare]284-clare and the window was the table at which [[his]284-clare companions]629-his companions sat , [their]629-his companions munching profiles rising sharp against the panes ; while to the side was the milk - house door , through which were visible the rectangular leads in rows , full to the brim with the morning 's milk . At the further end the great churn could be seen revolving , and its slip - slopping heard - the moving power being discernible through the window in the form of a spiritless horse walking in a circle and driven by [a boy]2256-a boy .

For several days after [Tess]198-tess 's arrival [Clare]284-clare , sitting abstractedly reading from some book , periodical , or piece of music just come by post , hardly noticed that [she]198-tess was present at table . [She]198-tess talked so little , and [the other maids]2257-the other maids talked so much , that the babble did not strike [him]284-clare as possessing a new note , and [he]284-clare was ever in the habit of neglecting the particulars of an outward scene for the general impression . One day , however , when [he]284-clare had been conning one of [his]284-clare music - scores , and by force of imagination was hearing the tune in [his]284-clare head , [he]284-clare lapsed into listlessness , and the music - sheet rolled to the hearth . [He]284-clare looked at the fire of logs , with its one flame pirouetting on the top in a dying dance after the breakfast - cooking and boiling , and it seemed to jig to [his]284-clare inward tune ; also at the two chimney crooks dangling down from the cotterel , or cross - bar , plumed with soot , which quivered to the same melody ; also at the half - empty kettle whining an accompaniment . The conversation at the table mixed in with [his]284-clare phantasmal orchestra till [he]284-clare thought : " What a fluty voice [one of [those milkmaids]6458-those milkmaids]6457-one of those milkmaids has ! [I]284-clare suppose it is [the new one]6459-the new one . "[284-clare]

[Clare]284-clare looked round upon [her]198-tess , seated with [the others]2258-the others .

[She]198-tess was not looking towards [him]284-clare . Indeed , owing to [his]284-clare long silence , [his]284-clare presence in [the room]778-the room was almost forgotten .

" [I]198-tess do n't know about ghosts , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess was saying ; " but [I]198-tess do know that [our]6460-our souls can be made to go outside [our]6460-our bodies when [we]6460-our are alive . "[198-tess]

[The dairyman]1900-the dairyman turned to [her]198-tess with [his]1900-the dairyman mouth full , [his]1900-the dairyman eyes charged with serious inquiry , and [his]1900-the dairyman great knife and fork breakfasts were breakfasts here planted erect on the table , like the beginning of a gallows .

" What - really now ? And is it so , [maidy]6461-maidy ? "[1900-the dairyman] [he]1900-the dairyman said .

" A very easy way to feel 'em go , "[198-tess] continued [Tess]198-tess , " is to lie on the grass at night and look straight up at some big bright star ; and , by fixing [your]6462-you mind upon it , [you]6462-you will soon find that [you]6462-you are hundreds and hundreds o ' miles away from [your]6462-you body , which [you]6462-you do n't seem to want at all . "[198-tess]

[The dairyman]1900-the dairyman removed [his]1900-the dairyman hard gaze from [Tess]198-tess , and fixed it on [[his]1900-the dairyman wife]819-his wife .

" Now that 's a rum thing , [Christianer]291-christianer - hey ? To think o ' the miles [I]1900-the dairyman 've vamped o ' starlight nights these last thirty year , courting , or trading , or for [doctor]6463-doctor , or for [nurse]1223-nurse , and yet never had the least notion o ' that till now , or feeled [my]1900-the dairyman soul rise so much as an inch above [my]1900-the dairyman shirt - collar . "[1900-the dairyman]
