The general attention being drawn to [her]198-tess , including that of [[the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's pupil]6422-the dairyman 's pupil , [Tess]198-tess flushed , and remarking evasively that it was only a fancy , resumed [her]198-tess breakfast .

[Clare]284-clare continued to observe [her]198-tess . [She]198-tess soon finished [her]198-tess eating , and having a consciousness that [Clare]284-clare was regarding [her]198-tess , began to trace imaginary patterns on the tablecloth with [her]198-tess forefinger with the constraint of a domestic animal that perceives itself to be watched .

" What [a fresh and virginal daughter of Nature that milkmaid]6465-a fresh and virginal daughter of nature that milkmaid is ! "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said to [himself]284-clare .

And then [he]284-clare seemed to discern in [her]198-tess something that was familiar , something which carried [him]284-clare back into a joyous and unforeseeing past , before the necessity of taking thought had made the heavens gray . [He]284-clare concluded that [he]284-clare had beheld [her]198-tess before ; where [he]284-clare could not tell . A casual encounter during some country ramble it certainly had been , and [he]284-clare was not greatly curious about it . But the circumstance was sufficient to lead [him]284-clare to select [Tess]198-tess in preference to [the other pretty milkmaids]2265-the other pretty milkmaids when [he]284-clare wished to contemplate contiguous womankind .

XIX

In general the cows were milked as [they]2266-they presented [themselves]2266-they , without fancy or choice . But certain cows will show a fondness for a particular pair of hands , sometimes carrying this predilection so far as to refuse to stand at all except to [their]2266-they favourite , the pail of [a stranger]1085-a stranger being unceremoniously kicked over .

It was [Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick 's rule to insist on breaking down these partialities and aversions by constant interchange , since otherwise , in the event of [a milkman]2268-a milkman or [maid]2269-maid going away from [the dairy]1952-the dairy , [he]284-clare was placed in a difficulty . [The maids]6216-the maids ' private aims , however , were the reverse of [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's rule , the daily selection by each damsel of the eight or ten cows to which [she]198-tess had grown accustomed rendering the operation on [their]6216-the maids willing udders surprisingly easy and effortless .

[Tess]198-tess , like [her]198-tess compeers , soon discovered which of the cows had a preference for [her]198-tess style of manipulation , and [her]198-tess fingers having become delicate from the long domiciliary imprisonments to which [she]198-tess had subjected [herself]198-tess at intervals during the last two or three years , [she]198-tess would have been glad to meet [the milchers]2014-the milchers ' views in this respect . Out of [the whole ninety - five]2274-the whole ninety - five there were eight in particular - [Dumpling , Fancy , Lofty , Mist]292-dumpling , fancy , lofty , mist , [Old Pretty]293-old pretty , [Young Pretty , Tidy]294-young pretty , tidy , and [Loud]295-loud - who , though the teats of [one or two were as hard as carrots]2275-one or two were as hard as carrots , gave down to [her]198-tess with a readiness that made [her]198-tess work on them a mere touch of the fingers . Knowing , however , [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's wish , [she]198-tess endeavoured conscientiously to take the animals just as [they]6216-the maids came , expecting the very hard yielders which [she]198-tess could not yet manage .

But [she]198-tess soon found a curious correspondence between the ostensibly chance position of the cows and [her]198-tess wishes in this matter , till [she]198-tess felt that [their]6216-the maids order could not be the result of accident . [[The dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's pupil]6422-the dairyman 's pupil had lent a hand in getting the cows together of late , and at the fifth or sixth time [she]198-tess turned [her]198-tess eyes , as [she]198-tess rested against the cow , full of sly inquiry upon [him]1900-the dairyman .

" [Mr Clare]284-clare , [you]1900-the dairyman have ranged the cows ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , blushing ; and in making the accusation , symptoms of a smile gently lifted [her]198-tess upper lip in spite of [her]198-tess , so as to show the tips of [her]198-tess teeth , the lower lip remaining severely still .

" Well , it makes no difference , "[1900-the dairyman] said [he]1900-the dairyman . " [You]198-tess will always be here to milk [them]6466-them . "[1900-the dairyman]

" Do [you]1900-the dairyman think so ? [I]1900-the dairyman HOPE [I]1900-the dairyman shall ! But [I]1900-the dairyman do n't KNOW . "[1900-the dairyman]

[She]198-tess was angry with [herself]198-tess afterwards , thinking that [he]1900-the dairyman , unaware of [her]198-tess grave reasons for liking this seclusion , might have mistaken [her]198-tess meaning . [She]198-tess had spoken so earnestly to [him]1900-the dairyman , as if [his]1900-the dairyman presence were somehow a factor in [her]198-tess wish . [Her]198-tess misgiving was such that at dusk , when the milking was over , [she]198-tess walked in [the garden]881-the garden alone , to continue [her]198-tess regrets that [she]198-tess had disclosed to [him]1900-the dairyman [her]198-tess discovery of [his]1900-the dairyman considerateness .

It was a typical summer evening in June , the atmosphere being in such delicate equilibrium and so transmissive that inanimate objects seemed endowed with two or three senses , if not five . There was no distinction between the near and the far , and an auditor felt close to everything within the horizon . The soundlessness impressed [her]198-tess as a positive entity rather than as the mere negation of noise . It was broken by the strumming of strings .

[Tess]198-tess had heard those notes in [the attic]2280-the attic above [her]198-tess head . Dim , flattened , constrained by their confinement , they had never appealed to [her]198-tess as now , when [they]2281-they wandered in the still air with a stark quality like that of nudity . To speak absolutely , both instrument and execution were poor ; but [the relative]2282-the relative is all , and as [she]198-tess listened [Tess]198-tess , like a fascinated bird , could not leave [the spot]2283-the spot . Far from leaving [she]198-tess drew up towards [the performer]2284-the performer , keeping behind the hedge that [he]2284-the performer might not guess [her]198-tess presence .

The outskirt of [the garden in which [Tess]198-tess found [herself]198-tess]2285-the garden in which tess found herself had been left uncultivated for some years , and was now damp and rank with juicy grass which sent up mists of pollen at a touch ; and with tall blooming weeds emitting offensive smells - weeds whose red and yellow and purple hues formed a polychrome as dazzling as that of cultivated flowers . [She]198-tess went stealthily as a cat through this profusion of growth , gathering cuckoo - spittle on [her]198-tess skirts , cracking snails that were underfoot , staining [her]198-tess hands with thistle - milk and slug - slime , and rubbing off upon [her]198-tess naked arms sticky blights which , though snow - white on the apple - tree trunks , made madder stains on [her]198-tess skin ; thus [she]198-tess drew quite near to [Clare]284-clare , still unobserved of [him]284-clare .

[Tess]198-tess was conscious of neither time nor space . The exaltation which [she]198-tess had described as being producible at will by gazing at a star came now without any determination of [hers]198-tess ; [she]198-tess undulated upon the thin notes of the second - hand harp , and their harmonies passed like breezes through [her]198-tess , bringing tears into [her]198-tess eyes . The floating pollen seemed to be [his]284-clare notes made visible , and the dampness of [the garden]881-the garden the weeping of [the garden]881-the garden 's sensibility . Though near nightfall , the rank - smelling weed - flowers glowed as if they would not close for intentness , and the waves of colour mixed with the waves of sound .

The light which still shone was derived mainly from a large hole in [the western bank of cloud]2288-the western bank of cloud ; it was like a piece of day left behind by accident , dusk having closed in elsewhere . [He]284-clare concluded [his]284-clare plaintive melody , a very simple performance , demanding no great skill ; and [she]198-tess waited , thinking another might be begun . But , tired of playing , [he]284-clare had desultorily come round the fence , and was rambling up behind [her]198-tess . [Tess]198-tess , [her]198-tess cheeks on fire , moved away furtively , as if hardly moving at all .

[Angel]284-clare , however , saw [her]198-tess light summer gown , and [he]284-clare spoke ; [his]284-clare low tones reaching [her]198-tess , though [he]284-clare was some distance off .

" What makes [you]198-tess draw off in that way , [Tess]198-tess ? "[284-clare] said [he]284-clare . " Are [you]198-tess afraid ? "[284-clare]

" Oh no , [sir]5821-sir - not of outdoor things ; especially just now when the apple - blooth is falling , and everything is so green . "[284-clare]

" But [you]198-tess have [your]198-tess indoor fears - eh ? "[284-clare]

" Well - yes , [sir]5821-sir . "[284-clare]

" What of ? "[284-clare]

" [I]284-clare could n't quite say . "[284-clare]

" The milk turning sour ? "[284-clare]

" No . "[284-clare]

" Life in general ? "[284-clare]

" Yes , [sir]5821-sir . "[284-clare]

" Ah - so have [I]284-clare , very often . This hobble of being alive is rather serious , do n't [you]284-clare think so ? "[284-clare]

" It is - now [you]284-clare put it that way . "[284-clare]

" All the same , [I]284-clare should n't have expected [a young girl like [you]284-clare]6470-a young girl like you to see it so just yet . How is it [you]284-clare do ? "[284-clare]

[She]198-tess maintained a hesitating silence .

" Come , [Tess]198-tess , tell [me]284-clare in confidence . "[284-clare]

[She]198-tess thought that [he]284-clare meant what were the aspects of things to [her]198-tess , and replied shyly -

" The trees have inquisitive eyes , have n't they ? - that is , seem as if they had . And [the river]1998-the river says , - ' Why do [ye]284-clare trouble [me]284-clare with [your]284-clare looks ? ' And [you]284-clare seem to see numbers of to - morrows just all in a line , the first of them the biggest and clearest , the others getting smaller and smaller as [they]6472-they stand farther away ; but [they]6472-they all seem very fierce and cruel and as if [they]6472-they said , ' [I]284-clare 'm coming ! Beware of [me]284-clare ! Beware of [me]284-clare ! ' ... But [YOU]284-clare , [sir]5821-sir , can raise up dreams with [your]284-clare music , and drive all such horrid fancies away ! "[284-clare]

[He]284-clare was surprised to find [this young woman]2289-this young woman - who though but [a milkmaid]2290-a milkmaid had just that touch of rarity about [her]2289-this young woman which might make [her]2289-this young woman the envied of [her]2289-this young woman housemates - shaping such sad imaginings . [She]2289-this young woman was expressing in [her]2289-this young woman own native phrases - assisted a little by [her]2289-this young woman Sixth Standard training - feelings which might almost have been called those of the age - the ache of modernism . The perception arrested [him]284-clare less when [he]284-clare reflected that what are called advanced ideas are really in great part but the latest fashion in definition - a more accurate expression , by words in logy and ism , of sensations which [men]5841-men and [women]1628-women have vaguely grasped for centuries .

Still , it was strange that [they]2293-they should have come to [her]2289-this young woman while yet so young ; more than strange ; it was impressive , interesting , pathetic . Not guessing the cause , there was nothing to remind [him]284-clare that experience is as to intensity , and not as to duration . [Tess]198-tess 's passing corporeal blight had been [her]198-tess mental harvest .

[Tess]198-tess , on [her]198-tess part , could not understand why [a man of clerical family and good education , and above physical want]2294-a man of clerical family and good education , and above physical want , should look upon it as a mishap to be alive . For [the unhappy pilgrim]2295-the unhappy pilgrim [herself]2295-the unhappy pilgrim there was very good reason . But how could [this admirable and poetic man]2296-this admirable and poetic man ever have descended into [the Valley of]77-the valley of [Humiliation]78-humiliation , have felt with [the man of [Uz]79-uz]2297-the man of uz - as [she]198-tess [herself]198-tess had felt two or three years ago - " [My]2297-the man of uz soul chooseth strangling and death rather than [my]2297-the man of uz life . [I]2297-the man of uz loathe it ; [I]2297-the man of uz would not live alway . "[2297-the man of uz]

It was true that [he]2297-the man of uz was at present out of [[his]2297-the man of uz class]2298-his class . But [she]198-tess knew that was only because , like [Peter the Great]296-peter the great in [[a shipwright]2299-a shipwright 's yard]2300-a shipwright 's yard , [he]2297-the man of uz was studying what [he]2297-the man of uz wanted to know . [He]2297-the man of uz did not milk cows because [he]2297-the man of uz was obliged to milk cows , but because [he]2297-the man of uz was learning to be [a rich and prosperous dairyman]2301-a rich and prosperous dairyman , [landowner]2302-landowner , agriculturist , and [breeder of cattle]2303-breeder of cattle . [He]2297-the man of uz would become [an American or Australian Abraham]2304-an american or australian abraham , commanding like [a monarch]2305-a monarch [his]2297-the man of uz flocks and [his]2297-the man of uz herds , [his]2297-the man of uz spotted and [his]2297-the man of uz ring - straked , [[his]2297-the man of uz men]2235-his men - [servants]2307-servants and [[his]2297-the man of uz maids]2236-his maids . At times , nevertheless , it did seem unaccountable to [her]2309-her that [a decidedly bookish , musical , thinking young man]2310-a decidedly bookish , musical , thinking young man should have chosen deliberately to be [a farmer]868-a farmer , and not [a clergyman]2312-a clergyman , like [[his]2297-the man of uz father]457-his father and [brothers]586-brothers .

Thus , neither having the clue to the other 's secret , [they]2315-they were respectively puzzled at what each revealed , and awaited new knowledge of [each other]577-each other 's character and mood without attempting to pry into [each other]577-each other 's history .

Every day , every hour , brought to [him]2297-the man of uz one more little stroke of [her]2309-her nature , and to [her]2309-her one more of [his]2297-the man of uz . [Tess]198-tess was trying to lead a repressed life , but [she]198-tess little divined the strength of [her]198-tess own vitality .

At first [Tess]198-tess seemed to regard [Angel Clare]284-clare as an intelligence rather than as [a man]1337-a man . As such [she]198-tess compared [him]284-clare with [herself]198-tess ; and at every discovery of the abundance of [his]284-clare illuminations , of the distance between [her]198-tess own modest mental standpoint and the unmeasurable , Andean altitude of [his]284-clare , [she]198-tess became quite dejected , disheartened from all further effort on [her]198-tess own part whatever .

[He]284-clare observed [her]198-tess dejection one day , when [he]284-clare had casually mentioned something to [her]198-tess about pastoral life in [ancient Greece]80-ancient greece . [She]198-tess was gathering the buds called " [lords]6474-lords and [ladies]6329-ladies "[198-tess] from the bank while [he]284-clare spoke .

" Why do [you]198-tess look so woebegone all of a sudden ? "[284-clare] [he]284-clare asked .

" Oh , ' tis only - about [my]198-tess own self , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , with a frail laugh of sadness , fitfully beginning to peel " [a lady]6038-a lady "[198-tess] meanwhile . " Just a sense of what might have been with [me]198-tess ! [My]198-tess life looks as if it had been wasted for want of chances ! When [I]198-tess see what [you]6477-you know , what [you]6477-you have read , and seen , and thought , [I]198-tess feel what a nothing [I]198-tess am ! [I]198-tess 'm like [the poor Queen of Sheba who lived in the Bible]6478-the poor queen of sheba who lived in the bible . There is no more spirit in [me]198-tess . "[198-tess]

" Bless [my]284-clare soul , do n't go troubling about that ! Why , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said with some enthusiasm , " [I]284-clare should be only too glad , [[my]284-clare dear]6039-my dear [Tess]198-tess , to help [you]198-tess to anything in the way of history , or any line of reading [you]198-tess would like to take up - "[284-clare]

" It is [a lady]6038-a lady again , "[2319-she] interrupted [she]2319-she , holding out the bud [she]2319-she had peeled .

" What ? "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess meant that there are always more [ladies]6329-ladies than [lords]6474-lords when [you]198-tess come to peel [them]6329-ladies . "[198-tess]

" Never mind about [the lords]6483-the lords and [ladies]6329-ladies . Would [you]198-tess like to take up any course of study - history , for example ? "[198-tess]

" Sometimes [I]198-tess feel [I]198-tess do n't want to know anything more about it than [I]198-tess know already . "[198-tess]

" Why not ? "[198-tess]

" Because what 's the use of learning that [I]198-tess am one of a long row only - finding out that there is set down in some old book somebody just like [me]198-tess , and to know that [I]198-tess shall only act [her]6485-her part ; making [me]198-tess sad , that 's all . The best is not to remember that [your]198-tess nature and [your]198-tess past doings have been just like thousands ' and [thousands]6486-thousands ' , and that [your]198-tess coming life and doings 'll be like thousands 's and [thousands]6486-thousands ' . "[198-tess]

" What , really , then , [you]198-tess do n't want to learn anything ? "[198-tess]

" [I]2320-her should n't mind learning why - why the sun do shine on the just and [the unjust alike]6488-the unjust alike , "[2320-her] [she]2320-her answered , with a slight quaver in [her]2320-her voice . " But that 's what books will not tell [me]2320-her . "[2320-her]

" [Tess]198-tess , fie for such bitterness ! "[2321-he] Of course [he]2321-he spoke with a conventional sense of duty only , for that sort of wondering had not been unknown to [himself]2321-he in bygone days . And as [he]2321-he looked at the unpracticed mouth and lips , [he]2321-he thought that [such a daughter of the soil]2322-such a daughter of the soil could only have caught up the sentiment by rote . [She]2320-her went on peeling [the lords]6483-the lords and [ladies]6329-ladies till [Clare]284-clare , regarding for a moment the wave - like curl of [her]2320-her lashes as they dropped with [her]2320-her bent gaze on [her]2320-her soft cheek , lingeringly went away . When [he]2321-he was gone [she]2320-her stood awhile , thoughtfully peeling the last bud ; and then , awakening from [her]2320-her reverie , flung it and all [the crowd of [floral nobility]2326-floral nobility]2325-the crowd of floral nobility impatiently on the ground , in an ebullition of displeasure with [herself]2320-her for [her]2320-her niaiserie , and with a quickening warmth in [her]2320-her heart of hearts .

How stupid [he]2321-he must think [her]2320-her ! In an access of hunger for [his]2321-he good opinion [she]2320-her bethought [herself]2320-her of what [she]2320-her had latterly endeavoured to forget , so unpleasant had been its issues - the identity of [[her]2320-her family]1011-her family with that of [the knightly d'Urbervilles]2328-the knightly d'urbervilles . Barren attribute as it was , disastrous as its discovery had been in many ways to [her]2320-her , perhaps [Mr Clare]284-clare , as [a gentleman]6008-a gentleman and [a student of history]2330-a student of history , would respect [her]2320-her sufficiently to forget [her]2320-her childish conduct with [the lords]6483-the lords and [ladies]6329-ladies if [he]2321-he knew that [those Purbeck - marble and alabaster people in [Kingsbere Church]2334-kingsbere church]2333-those purbeck - marble and alabaster people in kingsbere church really represented [[her]2320-her own lineal forefathers]2335-her own lineal forefathers ; that [she]2320-her was no spurious d'Urberville , compounded of money and ambition like those at [Trantridge]38-trantridge , but true d'Urberville to the bone .

But , before venturing to make the revelation , dubious [Tess]198-tess indirectly sounded [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman as to its possible effect upon [Mr Clare]284-clare , by asking [the former]2337-the former if [Mr Clare]284-clare had any great respect for [old county families]2338-old county families when [they]2338-old county families had lost all [their]2338-old county families money and land .

" [Mr Clare]284-clare , "[1900-the dairyman] said [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman emphatically , " is [one of the most rebellest rozums [you]284-clare ever knowed - not a bit like the rest of [[his]284-clare family]5890-his family]6489-one of the most rebellest rozums you ever knowed - not a bit like the rest of his family ; and if there 's one thing that [he]284-clare do hate more than another ' tis the notion of what 's called [a ' old family]6491-a ' old family . [He]284-clare says that it stands to reason that [old families]6492-old families have done [their]6492-old families spurt of work in past days , and ca n't have anything left in 'em now . There 's [the Billets]297-the billets and [the Drenkhards]298-the drenkhards and [the Greys]299-the greys and [the St Quintins]300-the st quintins and [the Hardys]6493-the hardys and [the Goulds]6494-the goulds , who used to own [the lands]6495-the lands for [miles down [this valley]2021-this valley]6496-miles down this valley ; [you]284-clare could buy 'em all up now for an old song a'most . Why , [[our]6498-our little Retty Priddle]6499-our little retty priddle here , [you]284-clare know , is [one of [the Paridelles]6501-the paridelles]6500-one of the paridelles - [the old family that used to own lots o ' [the lands out by [King 's Hintock]81-king 's hintock]6503-the lands out by king 's hintock , now owned by [the Earl o ' Wessex]6504-the earl o ' wessex , afore even [he]6504-the earl o ' wessex or [his]6504-the earl o ' wessex was heard of]6502-the old family that used to own lots o ' the lands out by king 's hintock , now owned by the earl o ' wessex , afore even he or his was heard of . Well , [Mr Clare]284-clare found this out , and spoke quite scornful to [the poor girl]6505-the poor girl for days . ' Ah ! ' [he]284-clare says to [her]6505-the poor girl , ' [you]6505-the poor girl 'll never make [a good dairymaid]6506-a good dairymaid ! All [your]6505-the poor girl skill was used up ages ago in [Palestine]82-palestine , and [you]6505-the poor girl must lie fallow for a thousand years to git strength for more deeds ! ' [A boy]2256-a boy came here t'other day asking for a job , and said [his]2256-a boy name was [Matt]301-matt , and when [we]6508-we asked [him]2256-a boy [his]2256-a boy surname [he]2256-a boy said [he]2256-a boy 'd never heard that ' a had any surname , and when [we]6508-we asked why , [he]2256-a boy said [he]2256-a boy supposed [[his]2256-a boy folks]6509-his folks had n't been ' stablished long enough . ' Ah ! [you]2256-a boy 're [the very boy [I]1900-the dairyman want]6510-the very boy i want ! ' says [Mr Clare]284-clare , jumping up and shaking hands wi'en ; ' [I]1900-the dairyman 've great hopes of [you]2256-a boy ; ' and gave [him]2256-a boy half - a - crown . O no ! [he]2256-a boy ca n't stomach old families ! "[1900-the dairyman]

After hearing this caricature of [Clare]284-clare 's opinion poor [Tess]198-tess was glad that [she]198-tess had not said a word in a weak moment about [[her]198-tess family]1011-her family - even though it was so unusually old almost to have gone round the circle and become [a new one]2341-a new one . Besides , [another diary - girl]2342-another diary - girl was as good as [she]198-tess , it seemed , in that respect . [She]2342-another diary - girl held [her]2342-another diary - girl tongue about [the d'Urberville vault]2343-the d'urberville vault and [the Knight of the Conqueror whose name [she]2342-another diary - girl bore]2344-the knight of the conqueror whose name she bore . The insight afforded into [Clare]284-clare 's character suggested to [her]198-tess that it was largely owing to [her]198-tess supposed untraditional newness that [she]198-tess had won interest in [his]284-clare eyes .

XX

The season developed and matured . Another year 's instalment of flowers , leaves , nightingales , thrushes , finches , and such ephemeral creatures , took up [their]2345-their positions where only a year ago [others]1383-others had stood in [their]2345-their place when these were nothing more than germs and inorganic particles . Rays from the sunrise drew forth the buds and stretched them into long stalks , lifted up sap in noiseless streams , opened petals , and sucked out scents in invisible jets and breathings .

[[Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick 's household of [maids]2046-maids and [men]5841-men]2347-dairyman crick 's household of maids and men lived on comfortably , placidly , even merrily . [Their]2347-dairyman crick 's household of maids and men position was perhaps the happiest of all positions in the social scale , being above the line at which neediness ends , and below the line at which the convenances begin to cramp natural feelings , and the stress of threadbare modishness makes too little of enough .

Thus passed the leafy time when arborescence seems to be the one thing aimed at out of doors . [Tess]198-tess and [Clare]284-clare unconsciously studied [each other]577-each other , ever balanced on the edge of a passion , yet apparently keeping out of it . All the while [they]2347-dairyman crick 's household of maids and men were converging , under an irresistible law , as surely as two streams in [one vale]2351-one vale .

[Tess]198-tess had never in [her]198-tess recent life been so happy as [she]198-tess was now , possibly never would be so happy again . [She]198-tess was , for one thing , physically and mentally suited among these new surroundings . The sapling which had rooted down to a poisonous stratum on the spot of its sowing had been transplanted to a deeper soil . Moreover [she]198-tess , and [Clare]284-clare also , stood as yet on [the debatable land between predilection]2352-the debatable land between predilection and love ; where no profundities have been reached ; no reflections have set in , awkwardly inquiring , " Whither does this new current tend to carry [me]198-tess ? What does it mean to [my]198-tess future ? How does it stand towards [my]198-tess past ? "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess was the merest stray phenomenon to [Angel Clare]284-clare as yet - a rosy , warming apparition which had only just acquired the attribute of persistence in [his]284-clare consciousness . So [he]284-clare allowed [his]284-clare mind to be occupied with [her]198-tess , deeming [his]284-clare preoccupation to be no more than [a philosopher]2353-a philosopher 's regard of an exceedingly novel , fresh , and interesting specimen of [womankind]2354-womankind .

[They]2355-they met continually ; [they]2355-they could not help it . [They]2355-they met daily in that strange and solemn interval , the twilight of the morning , in the violet or pink dawn ; for it was necessary to rise early , so very early , here . Milking was done betimes ; and before the milking came the skimming , which began at a little past three . It usually fell to the lot of [some one or other of [them]2355-they]2356-some one or other of them to wake the rest , the first being aroused by an alarm - clock ; and , as [Tess]198-tess was the latest arrival , and [they]2355-they soon discovered that [she]198-tess could be depended upon not to sleep though the alarm as others did , this task was thrust most frequently upon [her]198-tess . No sooner had the hour of three struck and whizzed , than [she]198-tess left [[her]198-tess room]2357-her room and ran to [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's door ; then up the ladder to [Angel]284-clare 's , calling [him]1900-the dairyman in a loud whisper ; then woke [[her]198-tess fellow - milkmaids]2359-her fellow - milkmaids . By the time that [Tess]198-tess was dressed [Clare]284-clare was [downstairs]1128-downstairs and out in the humid air . [The remaining maids]2361-the remaining maids and [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman usually gave [themselves]2355-they another turn on the pillow , and did not appear till a quarter of an hour later .

The gray half - tones of daybreak are not the gray half - tones of the day 's close , though the degree of their shade may be the same . In the twilight of the morning , light seems active , darkness passive ; in the twilight of evening it is the darkness which is active and crescent , and the light which is the drowsy reverse .

Being so often - possibly not always by chance - [the first two persons]2363-the first two persons to get up at [the dairy - house]2025-the dairy - house , [they]2363-the first two persons seemed to [themselves]2363-the first two persons [the first persons up of all [the world]497-the world]2365-the first persons up of all the world . In these early days of [her]198-tess residence [here]5975-here [Tess]198-tess did not skim , but went out of doors at once after rising , where [he]284-clare was generally awaiting [her]198-tess . The spectral , half - compounded , aqueous light which pervaded [the open mead]2368-the open mead impressed [them]2363-the first two persons with a feeling of isolation , as if [they]2363-the first two persons were [Adam]302-adam and [Eve]303-eve . At this dim inceptive stage of the day [Tess]198-tess seemed to [Clare]284-clare to exhibit a dignified largeness both of disposition and physique , an almost regnant power , possibly because [he]284-clare knew that at that preternatural time hardly [any woman so well endowed in person]2369-any woman so well endowed in person as [she]198-tess was likely to be walking in the open air within the boundaries of [his]284-clare horizon ; very few in [all [England]10-england]2370-all england . [Fair women]2371-fair women are usually asleep at mid - summer dawns . [She]198-tess was close at hand , and the rest were nowhere .

The mixed , singular , luminous gloom in which [they]2363-the first two persons walked along together to the spot where the cows lay often made [him]284-clare think of the Resurrection hour . [He]284-clare little thought that [the Magdalen]304-the magdalen might be at [his]284-clare side . Whilst all the landscape was in neutral shade [[his]284-clare companion]2372-his companion 's face , which was the focus of [his]284-clare eyes , rising above the mist stratum , seemed to have a sort of phosphorescence upon it . [She]2372-his companion looked ghostly , as if [she]2372-his companion were merely a soul at large . In reality [her]2372-his companion face , without appearing to do so , had caught the cold gleam of day from [the north - east]597-the north - east ; [his]284-clare own face , though [he]284-clare did not think of it , wore the same aspect to [her]2372-his companion .

It was then , as has been said , that [she]2372-his companion impressed [him]284-clare most deeply . [She]2372-his companion was no longer [the milkmaid]2064-the milkmaid , but a visionary essence of [woman]744-woman - [a whole sex condensed into one typical form]2376-a whole sex condensed into one typical form . [He]284-clare called [her]2372-his companion [Artemis]305-artemis , [Demeter]306-demeter , and other fanciful names half teasingly , which [she]2372-his companion did not like because [she]2372-his companion did not understand them .

" Call [me]2372-his companion [Tess]198-tess , "[2372-his companion] [she]2372-his companion would say askance ; and [he]284-clare did .

Then it would grow lighter , and [her]2372-his companion features would become simply feminine ; they had changed from those of [a divinity who could confer bliss to those of [a being who craved it]2378-a being who craved it]2377-a divinity who could confer bliss to those of a being who craved it .

At these non - human hours [they]2379-they could get quite close to the waterfowl . [Herons]307-the herons came , with a great bold noise as of opening doors and shutters , out of the boughs of [a plantation which [they]307-the herons frequented at the side of the mead]2380-a plantation which they frequented at the side of the mead ; or , if already on the spot , hardily maintained [their]307-the herons standing in [the water]2381-the water as [the pair]795-the pair walked by , watching [them]307-the herons by moving [their]307-the herons heads round in a slow , horizontal , passionless wheel , like the turn of puppets by clockwork .

[They]2379-they could then see the faint summer fogs in layers , woolly , level , and apparently no thicker than counterpanes , spread about [the meadows]544-the meadows in detached remnants of small extent . On the gray moisture of the grass were marks where the cows had lain through the night - dark - green islands of dry herbage the size of [their]307-the herons carcasses , in [the general sea of dew]2384-the general sea of dew . From [each island]2385-each island proceeded a serpentine trail , by which the cow had rambled away to feed after getting up , at the end of [which trail]2386-which trail [they]2379-they found [her]2372-his companion ; the snoring puff from [her]2372-his companion nostrils , when [she]2372-his companion recognized them , making an intenser little fog of [her]2372-his companion own amid the prevailing one . Then [they]2379-they drove the animals back to [the barton]2387-the barton , or sat down to milk [them]307-the herons on the spot , as the case might require .

Or perhaps the summer fog was more general , and [the meadows]544-the meadows lay like [a white sea]2389-a white sea , out of which the scattered trees rose like dangerous rocks . Birds would soar through it into the upper radiance , and hang on the wing sunning [themselves]2390-themselves , or alight on the wet rails subdividing the mead , which now shone like glass rods . Minute diamonds of moisture from the mist hung , too , upon [Tess]198-tess 's eyelashes , and drops upon [her]198-tess hair , like seed pearls . When the day grew quite strong and commonplace these dried off [her]198-tess ; moreover , [Tess]198-tess then lost [her]198-tess strange and ethereal beauty ; [her]198-tess teeth , lips , and eyes scintillated in the sunbeams and [she]198-tess was again [the dazzlingly fair dairymaid]2391-the dazzlingly fair dairymaid only , who had to hold [her]198-tess own against [the other women of [the world]497-the world]2392-the other women of the world .

About this time [they]2379-they would hear [Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick 's voice , lecturing [the non - resident milkers]2394-the non - resident milkers for arriving late , and speaking sharply to [old Deborah Fyander]308-old deborah fyander for not washing [her]308-old deborah fyander hands .

" For Heaven 's sake , pop [thy]308-old deborah fyander hands under the pump , [Deb]309-deb ! Upon [my]276-dairyman crick soul , if [the London folk]6511-the london folk only knowed of [thee]308-old deborah fyander and [thy]308-old deborah fyander slovenly ways , [they]6511-the london folk 'd swaller [their]6511-the london folk milk and butter more mincing than [they]6511-the london folk do a'ready ; and that 's saying a good deal . "[276-dairyman crick]

The milking progressed , till towards the end [Tess]198-tess and [Clare]284-clare , in common with [the rest]6118-the rest , could hear the heavy breakfast table dragged out from the wall in [the kitchen]2396-the kitchen by [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick , this being the invariable preliminary to each meal ; the same horrible scrape accompanying its return journey when the table had been cleared .

XXI

There was a great stir in [the milk - house]2113-the milk - house just after breakfast . The churn revolved as usual , but the butter would not come . Whenever this happened the dairy was paralyzed . Squish , squash echoed the milk in the great cylinder , but never arose the sound [they]2379-they waited for .

[Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick and [[his]276-dairyman crick wife]819-his wife , [the milkmaids]2098-the milkmaids [Tess]198-tess , [Marian]310-marian , [Retty Priddle]311-retty , [Izz Huett]312-izz , and [the married ones from [the cottages]2401-the cottages]2400-the married ones from the cottages ; also [Mr Clare]284-clare , [Jonathan Kail]278-jonathan , [old Deborah]308-old deborah fyander , and [the rest]6118-the rest , stood gazing hopelessly at the churn ; and [the boy who kept the horse going outside put on moon - like eyes to show [his]2403-the boy who kept the horse going outside put on moon - like eyes to show his sense of the situation sense of the situation]2403-the boy who kept the horse going outside put on moon - like eyes to show his sense of the situation . Even [the melancholy horse]2404-the melancholy horse [himself]2404-the melancholy horse seemed to look in at the window in inquiring despair at each walk round .

" ' Tis years since [I]1900-the dairyman went to [Conjuror [Trendle]313-trendle 's son]6512-conjuror trendle 's son in Egdon - years ! "[1900-the dairyman] said [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman bitterly . " And [he]6512-conjuror trendle 's son was nothing to what [[his]6512-conjuror trendle 's son father]457-his father had been . [I]1900-the dairyman have said fifty times , if [I]1900-the dairyman have said once , that [I]1900-the dairyman DON'T believe in en ; though ' [a do cast folks]6514-a do cast folks ' waters very true . But [I]1900-the dairyman shall have to go to ' n if [he]6512-conjuror trendle 's son 's alive . O yes , [I]1900-the dairyman shall have to go to ' n , if this sort of thing continnys ! "[1900-the dairyman]

Even [Mr Clare]284-clare began to feel tragical at [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's desperation .

" [Conjuror Fall]314-conjuror fall , t'other side of [Casterbridge]41-casterbridge , that [they]6515-they used to call ' Wide - O ' , was [a very good man]6516-a very good man when [I]278-jonathan was [a boy]2256-a boy , "[278-jonathan] said [Jonathan Kail]278-jonathan . " But [he]6512-conjuror trendle 's son 's rotten as touchwood by now . "[278-jonathan]

" [[My]276-dairyman crick grandfather]6518-my grandfather used to go to [Conjuror Mynterne]315-conjuror mynterne , out at [Owlscombe]83-owlscombe , and [a clever man]6519-a clever man [a ' were]6520-a ' were , so [I]276-dairyman crick 've heard [grandf'er]6521-grandf'er say , "[276-dairyman crick] continued [Mr Crick]276-dairyman crick . " But there 's [no such genuine folk about nowadays]6522-no such genuine folk about nowadays ! "[276-dairyman crick]

[Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick 's mind kept nearer to the matter in hand .

" Perhaps [somebody in [the house]652-the house]6523-somebody in the house is in love , "[283-mrs crick] [she]283-mrs crick said tentatively . " [I]283-mrs crick 've heard tell in [my]283-mrs crick younger days that that will cause it . Why , [Crick]283-mrs crick - [that maid]6525-that maid [we]6526-we had years ago , do [ye]283-mrs crick mind , and how the butter did n't come then - "[283-mrs crick]

" Ah yes , yes ! - but that is n't the rights o't . It had nothing to do with the love - making . [I]276-dairyman crick can mind all about it - ' twas the damage to the churn . "[276-dairyman crick]

[He]276-dairyman crick turned to [Clare]284-clare .

" [Jack Dollop]316-jack , a ' hore's - bird of [a fellow [we]6526-we had [here]5975-here as [milker]6529-milker]6527-a fellow we had here as milker at one time , [sir]5821-sir , courted [a young woman]6531-a young woman over at [Mellstock]70-mellstock , and deceived [her]6531-a young woman as [he]316-jack had deceived many afore . But [he]316-jack had [another sort o ' woman]6532-another sort o ' woman to reckon wi ' this time , and it was not [the girl]647-the girl [herself]647-the girl . One Holy Thursday of all days in the almanack , [we]6526-we was here as [we]6526-we mid be now , only there was no churning in hand , when [we]6526-we zid [[the girl]647-the girl 's mother]6535-the girl 's mother coming up to the door , [wi]6536-wi ' a great brass - mounted umbrella in [her]6535-the girl 's mother hand that would ha ' felled an ox , and saying ' Do [Jack Dollop]316-jack work [here]5975-here ? - because [I]276-dairyman crick want [him]316-jack ! [I]276-dairyman crick have a big bone to pick with [he]316-jack , [I]276-dairyman crick can assure ' n ! ' And some way behind [[her]647-the girl mother]658-her mother walked [[Jack]316-jack 's young woman]6539-jack 's young woman , crying bitterly into [her]6539-jack 's young woman handkercher . ' O [Lard]317-lard , here 's a time ! ' said [Jack]316-jack , looking out [o]6540-o ' winder at 'em . ' [She]6539-jack 's young woman 'll murder [me]276-dairyman crick ! Where shall [I]276-dairyman crick get - where shall [I]276-dairyman crick - ? Do n't tell [her]6539-jack 's young woman where [I]276-dairyman crick be ! ' And with that [he]316-jack scrambled into the churn through the trap - door , and shut [himself]316-jack inside , just as [[the young woman]6194-the young woman 's mother]6542-the young woman 's mother busted into [the milk - house]2113-the milk - house . ' [The villain]6544-the villain - where is [he]6544-the villain ? ' says [she]6542-the young woman 's mother . ' [I]276-dairyman crick 'll claw [his]6544-the villain face for'n , let [me]276-dairyman crick only catch [him]6544-the villain ! ' Well , [she]6542-the young woman 's mother hunted about everywhere , ballyragging [Jack]316-jack by side and by seam , [Jack]316-jack lying a'most stifled inside the churn , and [the poor maid]6545-the poor maid - or [young woman]6546-young woman rather - standing at the door crying [her]6542-the young woman 's mother eyes out . [I]276-dairyman crick shall never forget it , never ! ' Twould have melted a marble stone ! But [she]6542-the young woman 's mother could n't find [him]6544-the villain nowhere at all . "[276-dairyman crick]

[The dairyman]1900-the dairyman paused , and one or two words of comment came from [the listeners]2408-the listeners .

[Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick 's stories often seemed to be ended when they were not really so , and [strangers]568-strangers were betrayed into premature interjections of finality ; though [old friends]2410-old friends knew better . [The narrator]2079-the narrator went on -

" Well , how [the old woman]1273-the old woman should have had the wit to guess it [I]2079-the narrator could never tell , but [she]1273-the old woman found out that [he]6544-the villain was inside that [there churn]6548-there churn . Without saying a word [she]6542-the young woman 's mother took hold of the winch it was turned by handpower then , and round [she]6542-the young woman 's mother swung [him]6544-the villain , and [Jack]316-jack began to flop about inside . ' O Lard ! stop the churn ! let [me]2079-the narrator out ! ' says [he]6544-the villain , popping out [his]6544-the villain head . ' [I]2079-the narrator shall be churned into a pummy ! ' [He]6544-the villain was [a cowardly chap in [his]6544-the villain heart]6549-a cowardly chap in his heart , as [such men]6550-such men mostly be . ' Not till [ye]6544-the villain make amends for ravaging [her]1273-the old woman virgin innocence ! ' says [the old woman]1273-the old woman . ' Stop the churn [you]1273-the old woman [old witch]6552-old witch ! ' screams [he]6544-the villain . ' [You]6544-the villain call [me]2079-the narrator [old witch]6552-old witch , do [ye]6544-the villain , [[you]6544-the villain deceiver]6554-you deceiver ! ' says [she]1273-the old woman , ' when [ye]6544-the villain ought to ha ' been calling [me]2079-the narrator [mother - law]6555-mother - law these last five months ! ' And on went the churn , and [Jack]316-jack 's bones rattled round again . Well , [none of [us]6557-us]6556-none of us ventured to interfere ; and at last ' a promised to make it right wi ' [her]1273-the old woman . ' Yes - [I]2079-the narrator 'll be as good as [my]2079-the narrator word ! ' [he]2079-the narrator said . And so it ended that day . "[2079-the narrator]

While [the listeners]2408-the listeners were smiling [their]2408-the listeners comments there was a quick movement behind [their]2408-the listeners backs , and [they]2408-the listeners looked round . [Tess]198-tess , pale - faced , had gone to the door .

" How warm ' tis to - day ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , almost inaudibly .

It was warm , and none of [them]2408-the listeners connected [her]198-tess withdrawal with the reminiscences of [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman . [He]1900-the dairyman went forward and opened the door for [her]198-tess , saying with tender raillery -

" Why , [maidy]6461-maidy "[1900-the dairyman] [he]1900-the dairyman frequently , with unconscious irony , gave [her]198-tess this pet name , " [the prettiest milker [I]1900-the dairyman 've got in [[my]1900-the dairyman dairy]6560-my dairy]6559-the prettiest milker i 've got in my dairy ; [you]198-tess must n't get so fagged as this at the first breath of summer weather , or [we]6561-we shall be finely put to for want of ' ee by dog - days , sha n't [we]6561-we , [Mr Clare]284-clare ? "[1900-the dairyman]

" [I]198-tess was faint - and - [I]198-tess think [I]198-tess am better out o ' doors , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said mechanically ; and disappeared outside .

Fortunately for [her]198-tess the milk in the revolving churn at that moment changed its squashing for a decided flick - flack .

" ' Tis coming ! "[283-mrs crick] cried [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick , and the attention of all was called off from [Tess]198-tess .

[That fair sufferer]2414-that fair sufferer soon recovered [herself]2414-that fair sufferer externally ; but [she]2414-that fair sufferer remained much depressed all the afternoon . When the evening milking was done [she]2414-that fair sufferer did not care to be with [the rest of [them]2415-the rest of them]2415-the rest of them , and went out of doors , wandering along [she]2414-that fair sufferer knew not whither . [She]2414-that fair sufferer was wretched - O so wretched - at the perception that to [[her]2414-that fair sufferer companions]558-her companions [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's story had been rather a humorous narration than otherwise ; none of [them]2415-the rest of them but [herself]2414-that fair sufferer seemed to see the sorrow of it ; to a certainty , [not one]2418-not one knew how cruelly it touched the tender place in [her]2414-that fair sufferer experience . The evening sun was now ugly to [her]2414-that fair sufferer , like a great inflamed wound in the sky . [Only a solitary cracked - voice reed - sparrow]2419-only a solitary cracked - voice reed - sparrow greeted [her]2414-that fair sufferer from the bushes by [the river]1998-the river , in a sad , machine - made tone , resembling that of [a past friend whose friendship [she]2414-that fair sufferer had outworn]2421-a past friend whose friendship she had outworn .

In these long June days [the milkmaids]2098-the milkmaids , and , indeed , [most of [the household]874-the household]2423-most of the household , went to bed at sunset or sooner , the morning work before milking being so early and heavy at a time of full pails . [Tess]198-tess usually accompanied [[her]198-tess fellows]1347-her fellows [upstairs]762-upstairs . To - night , however , [she]198-tess was the first to go to [[their]1347-her fellows common chamber]2427-their common chamber ; and [she]198-tess had dozed when [the other girls]2428-the other girls came in . [She]2414-that fair sufferer saw [them]1347-her fellows undressing in the orange light of the vanished sun , which flushed [their]1347-her fellows forms with its colour ; [she]2414-that fair sufferer dozed again , but [she]2414-that fair sufferer was reawakened by [their]1347-her fellows voices , and quietly turned [her]2414-that fair sufferer eyes towards [them]1347-her fellows .

[Neither of [[her]2414-that fair sufferer three chamber - companions]2430-her three chamber - companions]2429-neither of her three chamber - companions had got into bed . [They]1347-her fellows were standing in a group , in [their]1347-her fellows nightgowns , barefooted , at the window , the last red rays of the west still warming [their]1347-her fellows faces and necks and the walls around [them]1347-her fellows . [All]622-all were watching [somebody]6000-somebody in [the garden]881-the garden with deep interest , [their]1347-her fellows three faces close together : [a jovial and round one]2434-a jovial and round one , [a pale one with dark hair]2435-a pale one with dark hair , and [a fair one whose tresses were auburn]2436-a fair one whose tresses were auburn .

" Do n't push ! [You]6562-you can see as well as [I]311-retty , "[311-retty] said [Retty]311-retty , [the auburn - haired and youngest girl]2437-the auburn - haired and youngest girl , without removing [her]311-retty eyes from the window .

" ' Tis no use for [you]6562-you to be in love with [him]6563-his any more than [me]310-marian , [Retty Priddle]311-retty , "[310-marian] said jolly - faced [Marian]310-marian , [the eldest]587-the eldest , slily . " [His]6563-his thoughts be of other cheeks than thine ! "[310-marian]

[Retty Priddle]311-retty still looked , and [the others]2258-the others looked again .

" There [he]6563-his is again ! "[312-izz] cried [Izz Huett]312-izz , [the pale girl with dark damp hair and keenly cut lips]2440-the pale girl with dark damp hair and keenly cut lips .

" [You]6562-you need n't say anything , [Izz]312-izz , "[311-retty] answered [Retty]311-retty . " For [I]311-retty zid [you]6562-you kissing [his]6563-his shade . "[311-retty]

" WHAT did [you]6562-you see [her]311-retty doing ? "[310-marian] asked [Marian]310-marian .

" Why - [he]6563-his was standing over the whey - tub to let off the whey , and the shade of [his]6563-his face came upon the wall behind , close to [Izz]312-izz , who was standing there filling a vat . [She]311-retty put [her]311-retty mouth against the wall and kissed the shade of [his]6563-his mouth ; [I]311-retty zid [her]311-retty , though [he]6563-his did n't . "[311-retty]

" O [Izz Huett]312-izz ! "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian .

A rosy spot came into the middle of [Izz Huett]312-izz 's cheek .

" Well , there was no harm in it , "[310-marian] [she]310-marian declared , with attempted coolness . " And if [I]310-marian be in love wi'en , so is [Retty]311-retty , too ; and so be [you]310-marian , [Marian]310-marian , come to that . "[310-marian]

[Marian]310-marian 's full face could not blush past its chronic pinkness .

" [I]310-marian ! "[310-marian] [she]310-marian said . " What a tale ! Ah , there [he]6563-his is again ! [Dear eyes]6564-dear eyes - dear face - dear [Mr Clare]284-clare ! "[310-marian]

" There - [you]310-marian 've owned it ! "[310-marian]

" So have [you]312-izz - so have [we]6565-we all , "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian , with the dry frankness of complete indifference to opinion . " It is silly to pretend otherwise amongst [ourselves]6565-we , though [we]6565-we need not own it to [other folks]6385-other folks . [I]310-marian would just marry ' n to - morrow ! "[310-marian]

" So would [I]312-izz - and more , "[312-izz] murmured [Izz Huett]312-izz .

" And [I]311-retty too , "[311-retty] whispered [the more timid Retty]311-retty .

[The listener]1327-the listener grew warm .

" [We]6565-we ca n't all marry [him]2445-him , "[312-izz] said [Izz]312-izz .

" [We]6565-we sha n't , either of [us]6565-we ; which is worse still , "[587-the eldest] said [the eldest]587-the eldest . " There [he]2445-him is again ! "[587-the eldest]

[[They]2443-us all three]2444-they all three blew [him]2445-him a silent kiss .

" Why ? "[311-retty] asked [Retty]311-retty quickly .

" Because [he]2445-him likes [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess best , "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian , lowering [her]310-marian voice . " [I]310-marian have watched [him]2445-him every day , and have found it out . "[310-marian]

There was a reflective silence .

" But [she]198-tess do n't care anything for ' n ? "[311-retty] at length breathed [Retty]311-retty .

" Well - [I]311-retty sometimes think that too . "[311-retty]

" But how silly all this is ! "[312-izz] said [Izz Huett]312-izz impatiently . " Of course [he]2445-him wo n't marry [any one of [us]2443-us]6567-any one of us , or [Tess]198-tess either - [[a gentleman]6008-a gentleman 's son , who 's going to be a great landowner and [farmer abroad]6570-farmer abroad]6569-a gentleman 's son , who 's going to be a great landowner and farmer abroad ! More likely to ask [us]2443-us to come wi'en as [farm - hands]6571-farm - hands at so much a year ! "[312-izz]

[One]6172-one sighed , and another sighed , and [Marian]310-marian 's plump figure sighed biggest of all . Somebody in bed hard by sighed too . Tears came into the eyes of [Retty Priddle]311-retty , [the pretty red - haired youngest]2447-the pretty red - haired youngest - [the last bud of [the Paridelles]318-the paridelles]2448-the last bud of the paridelles , so important in the county annals . [They]2449-they watched silently a little longer , [their]2449-they three faces still close together as before , and the triple hues of [their]2449-they hair mingling . But [the unconscious Mr Clare]284-clare had gone [indoors]2450-indoors , and [they]2449-they saw [him]284-clare no more ; and , the shades beginning to deepen , [they]2449-they crept into [their]2449-they beds . In a few minutes [they]2449-they heard [him]284-clare ascend the ladder to [[his]284-clare own room]2451-his own room . [Marian]310-marian was soon snoring , but [Izz]312-izz did not drop into forgetfulness for a long time . [Retty Priddle]311-retty cried [herself]311-retty to sleep .

The deeper - passioned [Tess]198-tess was very far from sleeping even then . This conversation was another of the bitter pills [she]311-retty had been obliged to swallow that day . [Scarce]319-scarce the least feeling of jealousy arose in [her]311-retty breast . For that matter [she]311-retty knew [herself]311-retty to have the preference . Being more finely formed , better educated , and , though [the youngest except [Retty]311-retty]2452-the youngest except retty , [more woman than either]2453-more woman than either , [she]311-retty perceived that only the slightest ordinary care was necessary for holding [her]311-retty own in [Angel Clare]284-clare 's heart against [these [her]311-retty candid friends]2454-these her candid friends . But the grave question was , ought [she]311-retty to do this ? There was , to be sure , hardly a ghost of a chance for either of [them]2455-them , in a serious sense ; but there was , or had been , a chance of one or the other inspiring [him]284-clare with a passing fancy for [her]311-retty , and enjoying the pleasure of [his]284-clare attentions while [he]284-clare stayed [here]5975-here . Such unequal attachments had led to marriage ; and [she]311-retty had heard from [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick that [Mr Clare]284-clare had one day asked , in a laughing way , what would be the use of [his]284-clare marrying [a fine lady]2457-a fine lady , and all the while [ten thousand acres of [Colonial pasture]2459-colonial pasture]2458-ten thousand acres of colonial pasture to feed , and cattle to rear , and corn to reap . [A farm - woman]2460-a farm - woman would be the only sensible kind of wife for [him]284-clare . But whether [Mr Clare]284-clare had spoken seriously or not , why should [she]311-retty , who could never conscientiously allow [any man]2461-any man to marry [her]311-retty now , and who had religiously determined that [she]311-retty never would be tempted to do so , draw off [Mr Clare]284-clare 's attention from [other women]2462-other women , for the brief happiness of sunning [herself]311-retty in [his]284-clare eyes while [he]284-clare remained at [Talbothays]60-talbothays ?

XXII

[They]2463-they came [downstairs]1128-downstairs yawning next morning ; but skimming and milking were proceeded with as usual , and [they]2463-they went indoors to breakfast . [Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick was discovered stamping about [the house]652-the house . [He]284-clare had received a letter , in which [a customer]2466-a customer had complained that the butter had a twang .

" And begad , so ' t have ! "[1900-the dairyman] said [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman , who held in [his]1900-the dairyman left hand a wooden slice on which a lump of butter was stuck . " Yes - taste for [yourself]1900-the dairyman ! "[1900-the dairyman]

Several of [them]2463-they gathered round [him]1900-the dairyman ; and [Mr Clare]284-clare tasted , [Tess]198-tess tasted , also [the other indoor milkmaids]2468-the other indoor milkmaids , [one or two of [the milking - men]2470-the milking - men]2469-one or two of the milking - men , and last of all [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick , who came out from the waiting breakfast - table . There certainly was a twang .

The dairyman , who had thrown [himself]1900-the dairyman into abstraction to better realize the taste , and so divine the particular species of noxious weed to which it appertained , suddenly exclaimed -

" ' Tis garlic ! and [I]1900-the dairyman thought there was n't a blade left in that mead ! "[1900-the dairyman]

Then [all the old hands]2471-all the old hands remembered that a certain dry mead , into which a few of the cows had been admitted of late , had , in years gone by , spoilt the butter in the same way . [The dairyman]1900-the dairyman had not recognized the taste at that time , and thought the butter bewitched .

" [We]2463-they must overhaul that mead , "[1900-the dairyman] [he]1900-the dairyman resumed ; " this must n't continny ! "[1900-the dairyman]

All having armed [themselves]2463-they with old pointed knives , [they]2463-they went out together . As the inimical plant could only be present in very microscopic dimensions to have escaped ordinary observation , to find it seemed rather a hopeless attempt in the stretch of rich grass before [them]2463-they . However , [they]2463-they formed [themselves]2463-they into line , all assisting , owing to the importance of the search ; [the dairyman at the upper end]2473-the dairyman at the upper end with [Mr Clare]284-clare , who had volunteered to help ; then [Tess]198-tess , [Marian]310-marian , [Izz Huett]312-izz , and [Retty]311-retty ; then [Bill Lewell]320-bill lewell , [Jonathan]278-jonathan , and [the married dairywomen]2474-the married dairywomen - [Beck Knibbs]321-beck knibbs , with [her]321-beck knibbs wooly black hair and rolling eyes ; and flaxen [Frances]322-frances , consumptive from the winter damps of the water - meads - who lived in [[their]2463-they respective cottages]2475-their respective cottages .

With eyes fixed upon the ground [they]2463-they crept slowly across a strip of [the field]610-the field , returning a little further down in such a manner that , when [they]2463-they should have finished , not a single inch of [the pasture]630-the pasture but would have fallen under the eye of [some one of [them]2463-they]2478-some one of them . It was a most tedious business , not more than half a dozen shoots of garlic being discoverable in [the whole field]2479-the whole field ; yet such was the herb 's pungency that probably one bite of it by one cow had been sufficient to season the whole dairy 's produce for the day .

Differing one from another in natures and moods so greatly as [they]2463-they did , they yet formed , bending , a curiously uniform row - automatic , noiseless ; and [an alien observer passing down [the neighbouring lane]2481-the neighbouring lane]2480-an alien observer passing down the neighbouring lane might well have been excused for massing [them]2463-they as " [Hodge]289-hodge "[2463-they] . As [they]2463-they crept along , stooping low to discern the plant , a soft yellow gleam was reflected from the buttercups into [their]2463-they shaded faces , giving [them]2463-they an elfish , moonlit aspect , though the sun was pouring upon [their]2463-they backs in all the strength of noon .

[Angel Clare]284-clare , who communistically stuck to [his]284-clare rule of taking part with the rest in everything , glanced up now and then . It was not , of course , by accident that [he]284-clare walked next to [Tess]198-tess .

" Well , how are [you]198-tess ? "[284-clare] [he]284-clare murmured .

" Very well , thank [you]284-clare , [sir]5821-sir , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess replied demurely .

As [they]2463-they had been discussing a score of personal matters only half - an - hour before , the introductory style seemed a little superfluous . But [they]2463-they got no further in speech just then . [They]2463-they crept and crept , the hem of [her]198-tess petticoat just touching [his]284-clare gaiter , and [his]284-clare elbow sometimes brushing [hers]198-tess . At last [the dairyman , who came next]2482-the dairyman , who came next , could stand it no longer .

" Upon [my]2482-the dairyman , who came next soul and body , this here stooping do fairly make [my]2482-the dairyman , who came next back open and shut ! "[2482-the dairyman , who came next] [he]2482-the dairyman , who came next exclaimed , straightening [himself]2482-the dairyman , who came next slowly with an excruciated look till quite upright . " And [you]198-tess , [maidy Tess]198-tess , [you]198-tess was n't well a day or two ago - this will make [your]198-tess head ache finely ! Do n't do any more , if [you]198-tess feel fainty ; leave the rest to finish it . "[2482-the dairyman , who came next]

[Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick withdrew , and [Tess]198-tess dropped behind . [Mr Clare]284-clare also stepped out of line , and began privateering about for the weed . When [she]198-tess found [him]284-clare near [her]198-tess , [her]198-tess very tension at what [she]198-tess had heard the night before made [her]198-tess the first to speak .

" Do n't [they]2484-these maidens look pretty ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said .

" Who ? "[198-tess]

" [Izzy Huett]323-izzy huett and [Retty]311-retty . "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess had moodily decided that [either of [these maidens]2484-these maidens]2483-either of these maidens would make [[a good farmer]2485-a good farmer 's wife]2486-a good farmer 's wife , and that [she]198-tess ought to recommend [them]2484-these maidens , and obscure [her]198-tess own wretched charms .

" Pretty ? Well , yes - [they]2484-these maidens are [pretty girls]6573-pretty girls - fresh looking . [I]198-tess have often thought so . "[198-tess]

" Though , [poor dears]6574-poor dears , prettiness wo n't last long ! "[2484-these maidens]

" O no , unfortunately . "[198-tess]

" [They]2484-these maidens are [excellent dairywomen]6575-excellent dairywomen . "[2484-these maidens]

" Yes : though not better than [you]284-clare . "[198-tess]

" [They]2484-these maidens skim better than [I.]284-clare "[2484-these maidens]

" Do [they]2484-these maidens ? "[198-tess]

[Clare]284-clare remained observing [them]2484-these maidens - not without [their]2484-these maidens observing [him]284-clare .

" [She]6576-she is colouring up , "[198-tess] continued [Tess]198-tess heroically .

" Who ? "[2484-these maidens]

" [Retty Priddle]311-retty . "[198-tess]

" Oh ! Why it that ? "[2484-these maidens]

" Because [you]284-clare are looking at [her]6576-she . "[198-tess]

Self - sacrificing as [her]198-tess mood might be , [Tess]198-tess could not well go further and cry , " Marry one of [them]2484-these maidens , if [you]284-clare really do want [a dairywoman]6577-a dairywoman and [not a lady]6578-not a lady ; and do n't think of marrying [me]198-tess ! "[198-tess] [She]198-tess followed [Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick , and had the mournful satisfaction of seeing that [Clare]284-clare remained behind .

From this day [she]198-tess forced [herself]198-tess to take pains to avoid [him]284-clare - never allowing [herself]198-tess , as formerly , to remain long in [his]284-clare company , even if [their]2487-their juxtaposition were purely accidental . [She]198-tess gave [the other three]2488-the other three every chance .

[Tess]198-tess was woman enough to realize from [their]2487-their avowals to [herself]198-tess that [Angel Clare]284-clare had the honour of [all the dairymaids in [his]284-clare keeping]2489-all the dairymaids in his keeping , and [her]198-tess perception of [his]284-clare care to avoid compromising the happiness of either in the least degree bred a tender respect in [Tess]198-tess for what [she]198-tess deemed , rightly or wrongly , the self - controlling sense of duty shown by [him]284-clare , a quality which [she]198-tess had never expected to find in [one of the opposite sex]2490-one of the opposite sex , and in the absence of which more than one of [the simple hearts who were [[his]284-clare house - mates]2492-his house - mates]2491-the simple hearts who were his house - mates might have gone weeping on [her]198-tess pilgrimage .

XXIII

The hot weather of July had crept upon [them]2487-their unawares , and the atmosphere of [the flat vale]2493-the flat vale hung heavy as an opiate over [the dairy - folk]2208-the dairy - folk , the cows , and the trees . Hot steaming rains fell frequently , making the grass where the cows fed yet more rank , and hindering the late hay - making in [the other meads]2495-the other meads .

It was Sunday morning ; the milking was done ; [the outdoor milkers]2496-the outdoor milkers had gone [home]5850-home . [Tess]198-tess and [the other three]2488-the other three were dressing [themselves]2487-their rapidly , [the whole bevy]2499-the whole bevy having agreed to go together to [Mellstock Church]84-mellstock church , which lay some three or four miles distant from [the dairy - house]2025-the dairy - house . [She]198-tess had now been two months at [Talbothays]60-talbothays , and this was [her]198-tess first excursion .

All the preceding afternoon and night heavy thunderstorms had hissed down upon [the meads]2026-the meads , and washed some of the hay into [the river]1998-the river ; but this morning the sun shone out all the more brilliantly for the deluge , and the air was balmy and clear .

[The crooked lane leading from [[their]2487-their own parish to [Mellstock]70-mellstock]2504-their own parish to mellstock]2503-the crooked lane leading from their own parish to mellstock ran along [the lowest levels]2505-the lowest levels in a portion of [its]2503-the crooked lane leading from their own parish to mellstock length , and when [the girls]576-the girls reached [the most depressed spot]2507-the most depressed spot [they]576-the girls found that the result of the rain had been to flood [the lane]631-the lane over - shoe to a distance of some fifty yards . This would have been no serious hindrance on a week - day ; [they]576-the girls would have clicked through it in [their]576-the girls high patterns and boots quite unconcerned ; but on this day of vanity , this Sun's - day , when flesh went forth to coquet with flesh while hypocritically affecting business with spiritual things ; on this occasion for wearing [their]2487-their white stockings and thin shoes , and [their]2487-their pink , white , and lilac gowns , on which every mud spot would be visible , the pool was an awkward impediment . [They]2487-their could hear the church - bell calling - as yet nearly a mile off .

" Who would have expected such a rise in [the river]1998-the river in summer - time ! "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian , from the top of [the roadside bank on which [they]2487-their had climbed]2509-the roadside bank on which they had climbed , and were maintaining a precarious footing in the hope of creeping along [its]2509-the roadside bank on which they had climbed slope till [they]2487-their were past [the pool]2510-the pool .

" [We]2487-their ca n't get [there]5839-there anyhow , without walking right through [it]5839-there , or else going round [the Turnpike]6581-the turnpike way ; and that would make [us]2487-their so very late ! "[311-retty] said [Retty]311-retty , pausing hopelessly .

" And [I]310-marian do colour up so hot , walking into [church]813-church late , and [all the people]6583-all the people staring round , "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian , " that [I]310-marian hardly cool down again till [we]2487-their get into the That - it - may - please - Thees . "[310-marian]

While [they]2487-their stood clinging to [the bank]466-the bank [they]2487-their heard a splashing round the bend of [the road]550-the road , and presently appeared [Angel Clare]284-clare , advancing along [the lane]631-the lane towards [them]2487-their through [the water]2381-the water .

Four hearts gave a big throb simultaneously .

[His]284-clare aspect was probably as un - Sabbatarian a one as [[a dogmatic parson]2515-a dogmatic parson 's son]2516-a dogmatic parson 's son often presented ; [his]284-clare attire being [his]284-clare dairy clothes , long wading boots , a cabbage - leaf inside [his]284-clare hat to keep [his]284-clare head cool , with a thistle - spud to finish [him]284-clare off . " [He]284-clare 's not going to [church]813-church , "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian .

" No - [I]198-tess wish [he]284-clare was ! "[198-tess] murmured [Tess]198-tess .

[Angel]284-clare , in fact , rightly or wrongly to adopt the safe phrase of [evasive controversialists]2517-evasive controversialists , preferred sermons in [stones]2518-stones to sermons in [churches]2519-churches and [chapels]2520-chapels on fine summer days . This morning , moreover , [he]284-clare had gone out to see if the damage to the hay by the flood was considerable or not . On [his]284-clare walk [he]284-clare observed [the girls]576-the girls from a long distance , though [they]576-the girls had been so occupied with [their]576-the girls difficulties of passage as not to notice [him]284-clare . [He]284-clare knew that the water had risen at that spot , and that it would quite check [their]576-the girls progress . So [he]284-clare had hastened on , with a dim idea of how [he]284-clare could help [them]576-the girls - one of [them]576-the girls in particular .

[The rosy - cheeked , bright - eyed quartet]2522-the rosy - cheeked , bright - eyed quartet looked so charming in [their]2522-the rosy - cheeked , bright - eyed quartet light summer attire , clinging to [the roadside bank]2523-the roadside bank like pigeons on a roof - slope , that [he]284-clare stopped a moment to regard [them]576-the girls before coming close . [Their]576-the girls gauzy skirts had brushed up from the grass innumerable flies and butterflies which , unable to escape , remained caged in the transparent tissue as in an aviary . [Angel]284-clare 's eye at last fell upon [Tess]198-tess , the hindmost of the four ; [she]198-tess , being full of suppressed laughter at [their]576-the girls dilemma , could not help meeting [his]284-clare glance radiantly .

[He]284-clare came beneath [them]576-the girls in the water , which did not rise over [his]284-clare long boots ; and stood looking at the entrapped flies and butterflies .

" Are [you]310-marian trying to get to [church]813-church ? "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said to [Marian]310-marian , who was in front , including the next two in [his]284-clare remark , but avoiding [Tess]198-tess .

" Yes , [sir]5821-sir ; and ' tis getting late ; and [my]284-clare colour do come up so - "[284-clare]

" [I]284-clare 'll carry [you]2524-the whole four through the pool - every Jill of [you]2524-the whole four . "[284-clare]

[The whole four]2524-the whole four flushed as if one heart beat through [them]2524-the whole four .

" [I]310-marian think [you]284-clare ca n't , [sir]5821-sir , "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian .

" It is the only way for [you]284-clare to get past . Stand still . Nonsense - [you]284-clare are not too heavy ! [I]284-clare 'd carry [you]2524-the whole four all four together . Now , [Marian]310-marian , attend , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare continued , " and put [your]310-marian arms round [my]284-clare shoulders , so . Now ! Hold on . That 's well done . "[284-clare]

[Marian]310-marian had lowered [herself]310-marian upon [his]284-clare arm and shoulder as directed , and [Angel]284-clare strode off with [her]310-marian , [his]284-clare slim figure , as viewed from behind , looking like the mere stem to the great nosegay suggested by [hers]310-marian . [They]2525-they disappeared round the curve of [the road]550-the road , and only [his]284-clare sousing footsteps and the top ribbon of [Marian]310-marian 's bonnet told where [they]2525-they were . In a few minutes [he]284-clare reappeared . [Izz Huett]312-izz was the next in order upon [the bank]466-the bank .

" Here [he]284-clare comes , "[310-marian] [she]310-marian murmured , and [they]2525-they could hear that [her]310-marian lips were dry with emotion . " And [I]310-marian have to put [my]310-marian arms round [his]284-clare neck and look into [his]284-clare face as [Marian]310-marian did . "[310-marian]

" There 's nothing in that , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess quickly .

" There 's a time for everything , "[312-izz] continued [Izz]312-izz , unheeding . " A time to embrace , and a time to refrain from embracing ; the first is now going to be [mine]312-izz . "[312-izz]

" Fie - it is [Scripture]324-scripture , [Izz]312-izz ! "[198-tess]

" Yes , "[312-izz] said [Izz]312-izz , " [I]312-izz 've always a ' ear at [church]813-church for pretty verses . "[312-izz]

[Angel Clare]284-clare , to whom three - quarters of this performance was a commonplace act of kindness , now approached [Izz]312-izz . [She]310-marian quietly and dreamily lowered [herself]310-marian into [his]284-clare arms , and [Angel]284-clare methodically marched off with [her]310-marian . When [he]284-clare was heard returning for the third time [Retty]311-retty 's throbbing heart could be almost seen to shake [her]310-marian . [He]284-clare went up to [the red - haired girl]2528-the red - haired girl , and while [he]284-clare was seizing [her]2528-the red - haired girl [he]284-clare glanced at [Tess]198-tess . [His]284-clare lips could not have pronounced more plainly , " It will soon be [you]198-tess and [I.]284-clare "[284-clare] [Her]198-tess comprehension appeared in [her]198-tess face ; [she]198-tess could not help it . There was an understanding between [them]2529-them .

[Poor little Retty]311-retty , though by far the lightest weight , was the most troublesome of [Clare]284-clare 's burdens . [Marian]310-marian had been like a sack of meal , a dead weight of plumpness under which [he]284-clare has literally staggered . [Izz]312-izz had ridden sensibly and calmly . [Retty]311-retty was a bunch of hysterics .

However , [he]284-clare got through with [the disquieted creature]2530-the disquieted creature , deposited [her]2528-the red - haired girl , and returned . [Tess]198-tess could see over the hedge [the distant three in a group , standing as [he]284-clare had placed [them]2531-the distant three in a group , standing as he had placed them on the next rising ground on the next rising ground]2531-the distant three in a group , standing as he had placed them on the next rising ground . It was now [her]198-tess turn . [She]198-tess was embarrassed to discover that excitement at the proximity of [Mr Clare]284-clare 's breath and eyes , which [she]198-tess had contemned in [[her]198-tess companions]558-her companions , was intensified in [herself]198-tess ; and as if fearful of betraying [her]198-tess secret , [she]198-tess paltered with [him]284-clare at the last moment .

" [I]198-tess may be able to clim ' along [the bank]466-the bank perhaps - [I]198-tess can clim ' better than [they]2531-the distant three in a group , standing as he had placed them on the next rising ground . [You]284-clare must be so tired , [Mr Clare]284-clare ! "[198-tess]

" No , no , [Tess]198-tess , "[284-clare] said [he]284-clare quickly . And almost before [she]198-tess was aware , [she]198-tess was seated in [his]284-clare arms and resting against [his]284-clare shoulder .

" Three Leahs to get one [Rachel]325-rachel , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare whispered .

" [They]2531-the distant three in a group , standing as he had placed them on the next rising ground are [better women]6590-better women than [I]198-tess , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess replied , magnanimously sticking to [her]198-tess resolve .

" Not to [me]284-clare , "[284-clare] said [Angel]284-clare .

[He]284-clare saw [her]198-tess grow warm at this ; and [they]2533-they went some steps in silence .

" [I]198-tess hope [I]198-tess am not too heavy ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said timidly .

" O no . [You]284-clare should lift [Marian]310-marian ! Such a lump . [You]284-clare are like an undulating billow warmed by the sun . And all this fluff of muslin about [you]284-clare is the froth . "[284-clare]

" It is very pretty - if [I]284-clare seem like that to [you]284-clare . "[284-clare]

" Do [you]284-clare know that [I]284-clare have undergone three - quarters of this labour entirely for the sake of the fourth quarter ? "[284-clare]

" No . "[284-clare]

" [I]284-clare did not expect such an event to - day . "[284-clare]

" Nor [I]284-clare ... The water came up so sudden . "[284-clare]

That the rise in the water was what [she]198-tess understood [him]284-clare to refer to , the state of breathing belied . [Clare]284-clare stood still and inclinced [his]284-clare face towards [hers]198-tess .

" O [Tessy]256-tessy ! "[284-clare] [he]284-clare exclaimed .

[The girl]647-the girl 's cheeks burned to the breeze , and [she]198-tess could not look into [his]284-clare eyes for [her]198-tess emotion . It reminded [Angel]284-clare that [he]284-clare was somewhat unfairly taking advantage of an accidental position ; and [he]284-clare went no further with it . No definite words of love had crossed [their]2535-their lips as yet , and suspension at this point was desirable now . However , [he]284-clare walked slowly , to make the remainder of the distance as long as possible ; but at last [they]2535-their came to [the bend]2536-the bend , and the rest of [their]2535-their progress was in full view of the other three . [The dry land]2537-the dry land was reached , and [he]284-clare set [her]198-tess down .

[[Her]198-tess friends]1616-her friends were looking with round thoughtful eyes at [her]198-tess and [him]284-clare , and [she]198-tess could see that [they]1616-her friends had been talking of [her]198-tess . [He]284-clare hastily bade [them]2535-their farewell , and splashed back along the stretch of [submerged road]2539-submerged road .

[The four]2540-the four moved on together as before , till [Marian]310-marian broke the silence by saying -
