" No - in all truth ; [we]2535-their have no chance against [her]198-tess ! "[310-marian] [She]310-marian looked joylessly at [Tess]198-tess .

" What do [you]462-the latter mean ? "[462-the latter] asked [the latter]462-the latter .

" [He]284-clare likes ' [ee]198-tess best - the very best ! [We]2535-their could see it as [he]284-clare brought ' [ee]198-tess . [He]284-clare would have kissed ' [ee]198-tess , if [you]198-tess had encouraged [him]284-clare to do it , ever so little . "[310-marian]

" No , no , "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess .

The gaiety with which [they]2540-the four had set out had somehow vanished ; and yet there was no enmity or malice between [them]2540-the four . [They]2540-the four were [generous young souls]2542-generous young souls ; [they]2540-the four had been reared in [the lonely country nooks where fatalism is a strong sentiment]2543-the lonely country nooks where fatalism is a strong sentiment , and [they]2540-the four did not blame [her]198-tess . Such supplanting was to be .

[Tess]198-tess 's heart ached . There was no concealing from [herself]198-tess the fact that [she]198-tess loved [Angel Clare]284-clare , perhaps all the more passionately from knowing that [the others]2258-the others had also lost [their]2258-the others hearts to [him]284-clare . There is contagion in this sentiment , especially among [women]1628-women . And yet that same hungry nature had fought against this , but too feebly , and the natural result had followed .

" [I]198-tess will never stand in [your]311-retty way , nor in the way of either of [you]311-retty ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess declared to [Retty]311-retty that night in [the bedroom]787-the bedroom [her]198-tess tears running down . " [I]198-tess ca n't help this , [[my]198-tess dear]6039-my dear ! [I]198-tess do n't think marrying is in [his]284-clare mind at all ; but if [he]284-clare were ever to ask [me]198-tess [I]198-tess should refuse [him]284-clare , as [I]198-tess should refuse [any man]2461-any man . "[198-tess]

" Oh ! would [you]311-retty ? Why ? "[311-retty] said [wondering Retty]311-retty .

" It can not be ! But [I]198-tess will be plain . Putting [myself]198-tess quite on one side , [I]198-tess do n't think [he]284-clare will choose either of [you]311-retty . "[198-tess]

" [I]311-retty have never expected it - thought of it ! "[311-retty] moaned [Retty]311-retty . " But O ! [I]311-retty wish [I]311-retty was dead ! "[311-retty]

[The poor child]2547-the poor child , torn by a feeling which [she]2547-the poor child hardly understood , turned to [the other two girls who came [upstairs]762-upstairs just then]2548-the other two girls who came upstairs just then .

" [We]2548-the other two girls who came upstairs just then be [friends]1681-friends with [her]2547-the poor child again , "[2547-the poor child] [she]2547-the poor child said to [them]2548-the other two girls who came upstairs just then . " [She]2547-the poor child thinks no more of [his]284-clare choosing [her]2547-the poor child than [we]2548-the other two girls who came upstairs just then do . "[2547-the poor child]

So the reserve went off , and they were confiding and warm .

" [I]310-marian do n't seem to care what [I]310-marian do now , "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian , whose mood was turned to its lowest bass . " [I]310-marian was going to marry [a dairyman at [Stickleford]85-stickleford]6594-a dairyman at stickleford , who 's asked [me]310-marian twice ; but - [my]310-marian soul - [I]310-marian would put an end to [myself]310-marian rather'n be [[his]284-clare wife]819-his wife now ! Why do n't [ye]6596-ye speak , [Izz]312-izz ? "[310-marian]

" To confess , then , "[312-izz] murmured [Izz]312-izz , " [I]312-izz made sure to - day that [he]284-clare was going to kiss [me]312-izz as [he]284-clare held [me]312-izz ; and [I]312-izz lay still against [his]284-clare breast , hoping and hoping , and never moved at all . But [he]284-clare did not . [I]312-izz do n't like biding here at [Talbothays]60-talbothays any longer ! [I]312-izz shall go hwome . "[312-izz]

The air of [the sleeping - chamber]2550-the sleeping - chamber seemed to palpitate with the hopeless passion of [the girls]576-the girls . [They]576-the girls writhed feverishly under the oppressiveness of an emotion thrust on [them]576-the girls by cruel Nature 's law - an emotion which [they]576-the girls had neither expected nor desired . The incident of the day had fanned the flame that was burning the inside of [their]576-the girls hearts out , and the torture was almost more than [they]576-the girls could endure . The differences which distinguished [them]576-the girls as [individuals]2552-individuals were abstracted by this passion , and each was but portion of [one organism called sex]2553-one organism called sex . There was so much frankness and so little jealousy because there was no hope . [Each one]1478-each one was [a girl of fair common sense]2555-a girl of fair common sense , and [she]1478-each one did not delude [herself]1478-each one with any vain conceits , or deny [her]1478-each one love , or give [herself]1478-each one airs , in the idea of outshining [the others]2258-the others . The full recognition of the futility of [their]576-the girls infatuation , from a social point of view ; its purposeless beginning ; its self - bounded outlook ; its lack of everything to justify its existence in the eye of civilization while lacking nothing in the eye of Nature ; the one fact that it did exist , ecstasizing [them]576-the girls to a killing joy - all this imparted to [them]576-the girls a resignation , a dignity , which a practical and sordid expectation of winning [him]2557-his as [a husband]2558-a husband would have destroyed .

[They]576-the girls tossed and turned on [their]576-the girls little beds , and the cheese - wring dripped monotonously [downstairs]1128-downstairs .

" B ' [you]198-tess awake , [Tess]198-tess ? "[6172-one] whispered [one]6172-one , half - an - hour later .

It was [Izz Huett]312-izz 's voice .

[Tess]198-tess replied in the affirmative , whereupon also [Retty]311-retty and [Marian]310-marian suddenly flung the bedclothes off [them]576-the girls , and sighed -

" So be [we]576-the girls ! "[310-marian]

" [I]310-marian wonder what [she]6597-she is like - [the lady [they]576-the girls say [[his]2557-his family]5890-his family]6598-the lady they say his family have looked out for [him]2557-his ! "[310-marian]

" [I]312-izz wonder , "[312-izz] said [Izz]312-izz .

" [Some lady]6600-some lady looked out for [him]2557-his ? "[198-tess] gasped [Tess]198-tess , starting . " [I]198-tess have never heard o ' that ! "[198-tess]

" O yes - ' tis whispered ; [a young lady of [his]2557-his own rank]6601-a young lady of his own rank , chosen by [[his]2557-his family]5890-his family ; [a Doctor of [Divinity]326-divinity 's daughter near [[his]2557-his father]457-his father 's parish of [Emminster]72-emminster]6603-a doctor of divinity 's daughter near his father 's parish of emminster ; [he]2557-his do n't much care for [her]2563-the bride , [they]2561-they say . But [he]2557-his is sure to marry [her]2563-the bride . "[310-marian]

[They]2561-they had heard so very little of this ; yet it was enough to build up wretched dolorous dreams upon , there in the shade of the night . [They]2561-they pictured all the details of [his]2562-he being won round to consent , of the wedding preparations , of [the bride]2563-the bride 's happiness , of [her]2563-the bride dress and veil , of [her]2563-the bride blissful home with [him]2562-he , when oblivion would have fallen upon [themselves]2561-they as far as [he]2562-he and [their]2561-they love were concerned . Thus [they]2561-they talked , and ached , and wept till sleep charmed [their]2561-they sorrow away .

After this disclosure [Tess]198-tess nourished no further foolish thought that there lurked any grave and deliberate import in [Clare]284-clare 's attentions to [her]198-tess . It was a passing summer love of [her]198-tess face , for love 's own temporary sake - nothing more . And the thorny crown of this sad conception was that [she]198-tess whom [he]2562-he really did prefer in a cursory way to the rest , [she]198-tess who knew [herself]198-tess to be more impassioned in nature , cleverer , more beautiful than [they]2561-they , was in the eyes of propriety far less worthy of [him]2562-he than [the homelier ones whom [he]2562-he ignored]2564-the homelier ones whom he ignored .

XXIV

Amid the oozing fatness and warm ferments of [the Froom Vale]86-the froom vale , at a season when the rush of juices could almost be heard below the hiss of fertilization , it was impossible that the most fanciful love should not grow passionate . The ready bosoms existing there were impregnated by [their]2561-they surroundings .

July passed over [their]2561-they heads , and the Thermidorean weather which came in its wake seemed an effort on the part of Nature to match the state of hearts at [Talbothays Dairy]73-talbothays dairy . The air of [the place]5882-the place , so fresh in the spring and early summer , was stagnant and enervating now . Its heavy scents weighed upon [them]2561-they , and at mid - day the landscape seemed lying in a swoon . Ethiopic scorchings browned [the upper slopes of [the pastures]2567-the pastures]2566-the upper slopes of the pastures , but there was still bright green herbage here where [the watercourses]2568-the watercourses purled . And as [Clare]284-clare was oppressed by the outward heats , so was [he]284-clare burdened inwardly by waxing fervour of passion for [the soft and silent Tess]2569-the soft and silent tess .

The rains having passed , [the uplands]2570-the uplands were dry . The wheels of [[the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's spring - cart]2572-the dairyman 's spring - cart , as [he]1900-the dairyman sped [home]5850-home from [market]2574-market , licked up the pulverized surface of [the highway]598-the highway , and were followed by white ribands of dust , as if [they]2561-they had set [a thin powder - train]2576-a thin powder - train on fire . The cows jumped wildly over the five - barred barton - gate , maddened by the gad - fly ; [Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick kept [his]276-dairyman crick shirt - sleeves permanently rolled up from Monday to Saturday ; open windows had no effect in ventilation without open doors , and in [the dairy - garden]2577-the dairy - garden the blackbirds and thrushes crept about under the currant - bushes , rather in the manner of quadrupeds than of winged creatures . The flies in [the kitchen]2396-the kitchen were lazy , teasing , and familiar , crawling about in the unwonted places , on the floors , into drawers , and over the backs of [the milkmaids]2098-the milkmaids ' hands . Conversations were concerning sunstroke ; while butter - making , and still more butter - keeping , was a despair .

[They]2098-the milkmaids milked entirely in the meads for coolness and convenience , without driving in the cows . During the day the animals obsequiously followed the shadow of the smallest tree as it moved round the stem with the diurnal roll ; and when [the milkers]2043-the milkers came [they]2043-the milkers could hardly stand still for the flies .

On one of these afternoons [four or five unmilked cows]2581-four or five unmilked cows chanced to stand apart from [the general herd]2582-the general herd , behind the corner of a hedge , among [them]2581-four or five unmilked cows being [Dumpling]327-dumpling and [Old Pretty]293-old pretty , who loved [Tess]198-tess 's hands above those of [any other maid]2583-any other maid . When [she]198-tess rose from [her]198-tess stool under a finished cow , [Angel Clare]284-clare , who had been observing [her]198-tess for some time , asked [her]198-tess if [she]198-tess would take the aforesaid creatures next . [She]198-tess silently assented , and with [her]198-tess stool at arm 's length , and the pail against [her]198-tess knee , went round to where [they]2098-the milkmaids stood . Soon the sound of [Old Pretty]293-old pretty 's milk fizzing into the pail came through the hedge , and then [Angel]284-clare felt inclined to go round the corner also , to finish off [a hard - yielding milcher who had strayed there]2584-a hard - yielding milcher who had strayed there , [he]2584-a hard - yielding milcher who had strayed there being now as capable of this as [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman [himself]2584-a hard - yielding milcher who had strayed there .

[All the men]2586-all the men , and [some of [the women]5900-the women]2587-some of the women , when milking , dug [their]2586-all the men foreheads into the cows and gazed into the pail . But a few - mainly [the younger ones]1615-the younger ones - rested [their]1615-the younger ones heads sideways . This was [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess 's habit , [her]198-tess temple pressing [the milcher]2590-the milcher 's flank , [her]198-tess eyes fixed on the far end of [the meadow]2591-the meadow with the quiet of one lost in meditation . [She]198-tess was milking [Old Pretty]293-old pretty thus , and the sun chancing to be on the milking - side , it shone flat upon [her]198-tess pink - gowned form and [her]198-tess white curtain - bonnet , and upon [her]198-tess profile , rendering it keen as a cameo cut from the dun background of the cow .

[She]198-tess did not know that [Clare]284-clare had followed [her]198-tess round , and that [he]284-clare sat under [his]284-clare cow watching [her]198-tess . The stillness of [her]198-tess head and features was remarkable : [she]198-tess might have been in a trance , [her]198-tess eyes open , yet unseeing . Nothing in the picture moved but [Old Pretty]293-old pretty 's tail and [Tess]198-tess 's pink hands , the latter so gently as to be a rhythmic pulsation only , as if they were obeying a reflex stimulus , like a beating heart .

How very lovable [her]198-tess face was to [him]284-clare . Yet there was nothing ethereal about it ; all was real vitality , real warmth , real incarnation . And it was in [her]198-tess mouth that this culminated . Eyes almost as deep and speaking [he]284-clare had seen before , and cheeks perhaps as fair ; brows as arched , a chin and throat almost as shapely ; [her]198-tess mouth [he]284-clare had seen nothing to equal on the face of [the earth]1046-the earth . To [a young man with the least fire in [him]284-clare that little upward lift in the middle of [her]198-tess red top lip]2593-a young man with the least fire in him that little upward lift in the middle of her red top lip was distracting , infatuating , maddening . [He]284-clare had never before seen [a woman]1028-a woman 's lips and teeth which forced upon [his]284-clare mind with such persistent iteration the old Elizabethan simile of roses filled with snow . Perfect , [he]284-clare , as [a lover]6249-a lover , might have called them off - hand . But no - they were not perfect . And it was the touch of the imperfect upon the would - be perfect that gave the sweetness , because it was that which gave the humanity .

[Clare]284-clare had studied the curves of those lips so many times that [he]284-clare could reproduce them mentally with ease : and now , as [they]2596-they again confronted [him]284-clare , clothed with colour and life , [they]2596-they sent an aura over [his]284-clare flesh , a breeze through [his]284-clare nerves , which well nigh produced a qualm ; and actually produced , by some mysterious physiological process , a prosaic sneeze .

[She]198-tess then became conscious that [he]284-clare was observing [her]198-tess ; but [she]198-tess would not show it by any change of position , though the curious dream - like fixity disappeared , and a close eye might easily have discerned that the rosiness of [her]198-tess face deepened , and then faded till only a tinge of it was left .

The influence that had passed into [Clare]284-clare like an excitation from the sky did not die down . [Resolutions]328-resolutions , reticences , prudences , fears , fell back like a defeated battalion . [He]284-clare jumped up from [his]284-clare seat , and , leaving [his]284-clare pail to be kicked over if [the milcher]2590-the milcher had such a mind , went quickly towards the desire of [his]284-clare eyes , and , kneeling down beside [her]198-tess , clasped [her]198-tess in [his]284-clare arms .

[Tess]198-tess was taken completely by surprise , and [she]198-tess yielded to [his]284-clare embrace with unreflecting inevitableness . Having seen that it was really [[her]198-tess lover]2598-her lover who had advanced , and [no one else]2599-no one else , [her]198-tess lips parted , and [she]198-tess sank upon [him]284-clare in [her]198-tess momentary joy , with something very like an ecstatic cry .

[He]284-clare had been on the point of kissing that too tempting mouth , but [he]284-clare checked [himself]284-clare , for tender conscience ' sake .

" Forgive [me]284-clare , [[Tess]198-tess dear]6605-tess dear ! "[284-clare] [he]284-clare whispered . " [I]284-clare ought to have asked . [I]284-clare - did not know what [I]284-clare was doing . [I]284-clare do not mean it as a liberty . [I]284-clare am devoted to [you]6605-tess dear , [Tessy]256-tessy , dearest , in all sincerity ! "[284-clare]

[Old Pretty]293-old pretty by this time had looked round , puzzled ; and seeing [two people]2600-two people crouching under [her]198-tess where , by immemorial custom , there should have been only one , lifted [her]198-tess hind leg crossly .

" [She]293-old pretty is angry - [she]293-old pretty does n't know what [we]2600-two people mean - [she]293-old pretty 'll kick over the milk ! "[198-tess] exclaimed [Tess]198-tess , gently striving to free [herself]198-tess , [her]198-tess eyes concerned with the quadruped 's actions , [her]198-tess heart more deeply concerned with [herself]198-tess and [Clare]284-clare .

[She]198-tess slipped up from [her]198-tess seat , and [they]2600-two people stood together , [his]284-clare arm still encircling [her]198-tess . [Tess]198-tess 's eyes , fixed on distance , began to fill .

" Why do [you]198-tess cry , [[my]284-clare darling]6606-my darling ? "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said .

" O - [I]198-tess do n't know ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess murmured .

As [she]198-tess saw and felt more clearly the position [she]198-tess was in [she]198-tess became agitated and tried to withdraw .

" Well , [I]284-clare have betrayed [my]284-clare feeling , [Tess]198-tess , at last , "[284-clare] said [he]284-clare , with a curious sigh of desperation , signifying unconsciously that [his]284-clare heart had outrun [his]284-clare judgement . " That [I]284-clare - love [you]198-tess dearly and truly [I]284-clare need not say . But [I]284-clare - it shall go no further now - it distresses [you]198-tess - [I]284-clare am as surprised as [you]198-tess are . [You]198-tess will not think [I]284-clare have presumed upon [your]198-tess defencelessness - been too quick and unreflecting , will [you]198-tess ? "[284-clare]

" N ' - [I]284-clare ca n't tell . "[284-clare]

[He]284-clare had allowed [her]198-tess to free [herself]198-tess ; and in a minute or two the milking of each was resumed . [Nobody]754-nobody had beheld the gravitation of the two into one ; and when [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman came round by [that screened nook]2603-that screened nook a few minutes later , there was not a sign to reveal that [the markedly sundered pair]2604-the markedly sundered pair were more to [each other than mere acquaintance]2605-each other than mere acquaintance . Yet in the interval since [Crick]276-dairyman crick 's last view of [them]2604-the markedly sundered pair something had occurred which changed the pivot of the universe for [their]2604-the markedly sundered pair two natures ; something which , had [he]284-clare known its quality , [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman would have despised , as [a practical man]2607-a practical man ; yet which was based upon a more stubborn and resistless tendency than a whole heap of so - called practicalities . A veil had been whisked aside ; the tract of [each one]1478-each one 's outlook was to have a new horizon thenceforward - for a short time or for a long .

END OF PHASE THE THIRD

Phase the Fourth : [The Consequence

XXV

Clare]329-the consequence xxv clare , restless , went out into the dusk when evening drew on , [she]198-tess who had won [him]284-clare having retired to [[her]198-tess chamber]911-her chamber .

The night was as sultry as the day . There was no coolness after dark unless on the grass . [Roads]2610-roads , [garden - paths]2611-garden - paths , [the house]652-the house - fronts , the barton - walls were warm as hearths , and reflected the noontime temperature into [the noctambulist]2613-the noctambulist 's face .

[He]284-clare sat on the east gate of [the dairy - yard]2614-the dairy - yard , and knew not what to think of [himself]284-clare . Feeling had indeed smothered judgement that day .

Since the sudden embrace , three hours before , [the twain]2615-the twain had kept apart . [She]198-tess seemed stilled , almost alarmed , at what had occurred , while the novelty , unpremeditation , mastery of circumstance disquieted [him]284-clare - palpitating , contemplative being that [he]284-clare was . [He]284-clare could hardly realize [their]2615-the twain true relations to [each other]577-each other as yet , and what [their]2615-the twain mutual bearing should be before third parties thenceforward .

[Angel]284-clare had come as pupil to [this dairy]2617-this dairy in the idea that [his]284-clare temporary existence [here]5975-here was to be the merest episode in [his]284-clare life , soon passed through and early forgotten ; [he]284-clare had come as to a place from which as from [a screened alcove]2619-a screened alcove [he]284-clare could calmly view [the absorbing world]2620-the absorbing world without , and , apostrophizing it with Walt Whitman -

Crowds of [men]5841-men and women attired in the usual costumes , How curious [you]2622-you are to [me]0-i ! -

resolve upon a plan for plunging into [that world]2623-that world anew . But behold , the absorbing scene had been imported hither . What had been [the engrossing world]2624-the engrossing world had dissolved into an uninteresting outer dumb - show ; while here , in [this apparently dim and unimpassioned place]2625-this apparently dim and unimpassioned place , novelty had volcanically started up , as it had never , for [him]284-clare , started up elsewhere .

Every window of [the house]652-the house being open , [Clare]284-clare could hear across [the yard]1272-the yard each trivial sound of [the retiring household]2628-the retiring household . [The dairy - house]2025-the dairy - house , so humble , so insignificant , so purely to [him]284-clare a place of constrained sojourn that [he]284-clare had never hitherto deemed [it]2630-it of sufficient importance to be reconnoitred as an object of any quality whatever in [the landscape]1955-the landscape ; what was it now ? [The aged and lichened brick gables]2632-the aged and lichened brick gables breathed forth " Stay ! "[2634-her] The windows smiled , the door coaxed and beckoned , [the creeper]2633-the creeper blushed confederacy . A personality within it was so far - reaching in [her]2634-her influence as to spread into and make the bricks , mortar , and whole overhanging sky throb with a burning sensibility . Whose was this mighty personality ? [A milkmaid]2290-a milkmaid 's .

It was amazing , indeed , to find how great a matter the life of the obscure dairy had become to [him]284-clare . And though new love was to be held partly responsible for this , it was not solely so . Many besides [Angel]284-clare have learnt that the magnitude of lives is not as to [their]2636-their external displacements , but as to [their]2636-their subjective experiences . [The impressionable peasant]2637-the impressionable peasant leads a larger , fuller , more dramatic life than [the pachydermatous king]2638-the pachydermatous king . Looking at it thus , [he]284-clare found that life was to be seen of the same magnitude here as elsewhere .

Despite [his]284-clare heterodoxy , faults , and weaknesses , [Clare]284-clare was [a man with a conscience]2639-a man with a conscience . [Tess]198-tess was [no insignificant creature to toy with and dismiss]2640-no insignificant creature to toy with and dismiss ; but [a woman living [her]198-tess precious life - a life which , to [herself]198-tess who endured or enjoyed it , possessed as great a dimension as the life of the mightiest to [himself]284-clare]2641-a woman living her precious life - a life which , to herself who endured or enjoyed it , possessed as great a dimension as the life of the mightiest to himself . Upon [her]198-tess sensations [the whole world]2642-the whole world depended to [Tess]198-tess ; through [her]198-tess existence all [her]198-tess fellow - creatures existed , to [her]198-tess . [The universe]1395-the universe itself only came into being for [Tess]198-tess on the particular day in the particular year in which [she]198-tess was born .

This consciousness upon which [he]284-clare had intruded was the single opportunity of existence ever vouchsafed to [Tess]198-tess by an unsympathetic First Cause - [her]198-tess all ; [her]198-tess every and only chance . How then should [he]284-clare look upon [her]198-tess as of less consequence than [himself]284-clare ; as [a pretty trifle to caress and grow weary of]2644-a pretty trifle to caress and grow weary of ; and not deal in the greatest seriousness with the affection which [he]284-clare knew that [he]284-clare had awakened in [her]198-tess - so fervid and so impressionable as [she]198-tess was under [her]198-tess reserve - in order that it might not agonize and wreck [her]198-tess ?

To encounter [her]198-tess daily in the accustomed manner would be to develop what had begun . Living in such close relations , to meet meant to fall into endearment ; flesh and blood could not resist it ; and , having arrived at no conclusion as to the issue of such a tendency , [he]284-clare decided to hold aloof for the present from occupations in which [they]2645-they would be mutually engaged . As yet the harm done was small .

But it was not easy to carry out the resolution never to approach [her]198-tess . [He]284-clare was driven towards [her]198-tess by every heave of [his]284-clare pulse .

[He]284-clare thought [he]284-clare would go and see [[his]284-clare friends]2091-his friends . It might be possible to sound [them]2091-his friends upon this . In less than five months [his]284-clare term [here]5975-here would have ended , and after a few additional months spent upon [other farms]1418-other farms [he]284-clare would be fully equipped in agricultural knowledge and in a position to start on [his]284-clare own account . Would not [a farmer]868-a farmer want [a wife]2650-a wife , and should [[a farmer]868-a farmer 's wife]2652-a farmer 's wife be [a drawing - room wax - figure]2653-a drawing - room wax - figure , or [a woman who understood farming]2654-a woman who understood farming ? Notwithstanding the pleasing answer returned to [him]284-clare by the silence , [he]284-clare resolved to go [his]284-clare journey .

One morning when [they]2655-they sat down to breakfast at [Talbothays Dairy]73-talbothays dairy [some maid]2656-some maid observed that [she]2656-some maid had not seen anything of [Mr Clare]284-clare that day .

" O no , "[276-dairyman crick] said [Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick . " [Mr Clare]284-clare has gone hwome to [Emminster]72-emminster to spend a few days wi ' [[his]284-clare kinsfolk]6607-his kinsfolk . "[276-dairyman crick]

For four impassioned ones around that table the sunshine of the morning went out at a stroke , and the birds muffled [their]2657-their song . But [neither girl]2658-neither girl by word or gesture revealed [her]2658-neither girl blankness . " [He]284-clare 's getting on towards the end of [his]284-clare time wi ' [me]1900-the dairyman , "[1900-the dairyman] added [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman , with a phlegm which unconsciously was brutal ; " and so [I]1900-the dairyman suppose [he]284-clare is beginning to see about [his]284-clare plans elsewhere . "[1900-the dairyman]

" How much longer is [he]284-clare to bide [here]5975-here ? "[312-izz] asked [Izz Huett]312-izz , [the only one of [the gloom - stricken bevy]2661-the gloom - stricken bevy who could trust [her]312-izz voice with the question]2660-the only one of the gloom - stricken bevy who could trust her voice with the question .

[The others]2258-the others waited for [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's answer as if [their]2258-the others lives hung upon it ; [Retty]311-retty , with parted lips , gazing on the tablecloth , [Marian]310-marian with heat added to [her]310-marian redness , [Tess]198-tess throbbing and looking out at the meads .

" Well , [I]276-dairyman crick ca n't mind the exact day without looking at [my]276-dairyman crick memorandum - book , "[276-dairyman crick] replied [Crick]276-dairyman crick , with the same intolerable unconcern . " And even that may be altered a bit . [He]1900-the dairyman 'll bide to get a little practice in the calving out at [the straw - yard]6609-the straw - yard , for certain . [He]1900-the dairyman 'll hang on till the end of the year [I]276-dairyman crick should say . "[276-dairyman crick]

Four months or so of torturing ecstasy in [his]1900-the dairyman society - of " pleasure girdled about with pain "[276-dairyman crick] . After that the blackness of unutterable night .

At this moment of the morning [Angel Clare]284-clare was riding along [a narrow lane ten miles distant from [the breakfasters]2665-the breakfasters]2664-a narrow lane ten miles distant from the breakfasters , in the direction of [[[his]284-clare father]457-his father 's Vicarage at [Emminster]72-emminster]2667-his father 's vicarage at emminster , carrying , as well as [he]284-clare could , a little basket which contained some black - puddings and a bottle of mead , sent by [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick , with [her]283-mrs crick kind respects , to [[his]284-clare parents]746-his parents . [The white lane]2669-the white lane stretched before [him]284-clare , and [his]284-clare eyes were upon it ; but [they]746-his parents were staring into next year , and not at [the lane]631-the lane . [He]284-clare loved [her]283-mrs crick ; ought [he]284-clare to marry [her]283-mrs crick ? Dared [he]284-clare to marry [her]283-mrs crick ? What would [[his]284-clare mother]6090-his mother and [[his]284-clare brothers]634-his brothers say ? What would [he]284-clare [himself]284-clare say a couple of years after the event ? That would depend upon whether the germs of staunch comradeship underlay the temporary emotion , or whether it were a sensuous joy in [her]283-mrs crick form only , with no substratum of everlastingness .

[[[His]284-clare father]457-his father 's hill - surrounded [little town]2674-little town]87-his father 's hill - surrounded little town , [the Tudor church - tower of red stone]2675-the tudor church - tower of red stone , [the clump of trees near [the Vicarage]2162-the vicarage]2676-the clump of trees near the vicarage , came at last into view beneath [him]284-clare , and [he]284-clare rode down towards the well - known gate . Casting a glance in the direction of [the church]6443-the church before entering [[his]284-clare home]2679-his home , [he]284-clare beheld standing by [the vestry]2680-the vestry - door a group of [girls , of ages between twelve and sixteen]2681-girls , of ages between twelve and sixteen , apparently awaiting the arrival of [some other one]2682-some other one , who in a moment became visible ; [a figure somewhat older than [the school - girls]2684-the school - girls , wearing a broad - brimmed hat and highly - starched cambric morning - gown , with a couple of books in [her]283-mrs crick hand]2683-a figure somewhat older than the school - girls , wearing a broad - brimmed hat and highly - starched cambric morning - gown , with a couple of books in her hand .

[Clare]284-clare knew [her]283-mrs crick well . [He]284-clare could not be sure that [she]283-mrs crick observed [him]284-clare ; [he]284-clare hoped [she]283-mrs crick did not , so as to render it unnecessary that [he]284-clare should go and speak to [her]283-mrs crick , blameless creature that [she]283-mrs crick was . An overpowering reluctance to greet [her]283-mrs crick made [him]284-clare decide that [she]283-mrs crick had not seen [him]284-clare . [The young lady]2685-the young lady was [Miss Mercy Chant]330-mercy , [the only daughter of [[his]284-clare father]457-his father 's neighbour and friend , whom it was [[his]284-clare parents]746-his parents ' quiet hope that [he]284-clare might [we]2689-we d some day]2686-the only daughter of his father 's neighbour and friend , whom it was his parents ' quiet hope that he might we d some day . [She]2685-the young lady was great at Antinomianism and Bible - classes , and was plainly going to hold a class now . [Clare]284-clare 's mind flew to [the impassioned , summer - steeped heathens in [the Var Vale]2691-the var vale]2690-the impassioned , summer - steeped heathens in the var vale , [their]2690-the impassioned , summer - steeped heathens in the var vale rosy faces court - patched with cow - droppings ; and to one the most impassioned of [them]2690-the impassioned , summer - steeped heathens in the var vale all .

It was on the impulse of the moment that [he]284-clare had resolved to trot over to [Emminster]72-emminster , and hence had not written to apprise [[his]284-clare mother]6090-his mother and [father]5842-father , aiming , however , to arrive about the breakfast hour , before [they]746-his parents should have gone out to [their]746-his parents parish duties . [He]284-clare was a little late , and [they]746-his parents had already sat down to the morning meal . [The group at the table]2694-the group at the table jumped up to welcome [him]284-clare as soon as [he]284-clare entered . [They]2694-the group at the table were [[his]284-clare father]457-his father and [mother]5917-mother , [[his]284-clare brother]2697-his brother [the Reverend Felix]202-felix - [curate at [a town in [the adjoining county]2700-the adjoining county]2699-a town in the adjoining county , [home]5850-home for the inside of a fortnight - and [[his]284-clare other brother]2702-his other brother , [the Reverend Cuthbert]201-cuthbert , [the classical scholar]2703-the classical scholar , and Fellow and Dean of [[his]284-clare College]2704-his college]2698-curate at a town in the adjoining county , home for the inside of a fortnight - and his other brother , the reverend cuthbert , the classical scholar , and fellow and dean of his college , down from [Cambridge]74-cambridge for the long vacation . [[His]284-clare mother]6090-his mother appeared in a cap and silver spectacles , and [[his]284-clare father]457-his father looked what in fact [he]457-his father was - [an earnest , God - fearing man , somewhat gaunt , in years about sixty - five , [his]457-his father pale face lined with thought and purpose]2707-an earnest , god - fearing man , somewhat gaunt , in years about sixty - five , his pale face lined with thought and purpose . Over [their]2708-their heads hung the picture of [[Angel]284-clare 's sister]2709-angel 's sister , [the eldest of the family]2710-the eldest of the family , sixteen years [his]284-clare senior , who had married [a missionary]2711-a missionary and gone out to [Africa]88-africa .

[Old Mr Clare]331-old mr clare was [a clergyman of a type which , within the last twenty years , has well nigh dropped out of contemporary life]2712-a clergyman of a type which , within the last twenty years , has well nigh dropped out of contemporary life . [A spiritual descendant in the direct line from [Wycliff]332-wycliff , [Huss]333-huss , [Luther]334-luther , [Calvin]335-calvin]2713-a spiritual descendant in the direct line from wycliff , huss , luther , calvin ; [an Evangelical of the Evangelicals]2714-an evangelical of the evangelicals , [a Conversionist]2715-a conversionist , [a man of Apostolic simplicity in life and thought]2716-a man of apostolic simplicity in life and thought , [he]331-old mr clare had in [his]331-old mr clare raw youth made up [his]331-old mr clare mind once for all in the deeper questions of existence , and admitted no further reasoning on them thenceforward . [He]331-old mr clare was regarded even by those of [his]331-old mr clare own date and school of thinking as extreme ; while , on the other hand , [those totally opposed to [him]331-old mr clare]2717-those totally opposed to him were unwillingly won to admiration for [his]331-old mr clare thoroughness , and for the remarkable power [he]331-old mr clare showed in dismissing all question as to principles in [his]331-old mr clare energy for applying them . [He]331-old mr clare loved [[Paul]336-paul of [Tarsus]89-tarsus]2718-paul of tarsus , liked [St John]337-st john , hated [St James]338-st james as much as [he]331-old mr clare dared , and regarded with mixed feelings [Timothy]339-timothy , [Titus]2719-titus , and [Philemon]340-philemon . [The New Testament]2720-the new testament was less a Christiad then [a Pauliad]2721-a pauliad to [his]331-old mr clare intelligence - less an argument than an intoxication . [His]331-old mr clare creed of determinism was such that it almost amounted to a vice , and quite amounted , on its negative side , to a renunciative philosophy which had cousinship with that of [Schopenhauer]341-schopenhauer and [Leopardi]342-leopardi . [He]331-old mr clare despised the Canons and Rubric , swore by the Articles , and deemed [himself]331-old mr clare consistent through the whole category - which in a way [he]331-old mr clare might have been . One thing [he]331-old mr clare certainly was - sincere .

To the aesthetic , sensuous , pagan pleasure in natural life and lush womanhood which [[his]331-old mr clare son]2722-his son [Angel]284-clare had lately been experiencing in [Var Vale]90-var vale , [his]331-old mr clare temper would have been antipathetic in a high degree , had [he]331-old mr clare either by inquiry or imagination been able to apprehend it . Once upon a time [Angel]284-clare had been so unlucky as to say to [[his]284-clare father]457-his father , in a moment of irritation , that it might have resulted far better for [mankind]1581-mankind if [Greece]80-ancient greece had been the source of the religion of modern civilization , and not [Palestine]82-palestine ; and [[his]284-clare father]457-his father 's grief was of that blank description which could not realize that there might lurk a thousandth part of a truth , much less a half truth or a whole truth , in such a proposition . [He]457-his father had simply preached austerely at [Angel]284-clare for some time after . But the kindness of [his]457-his father heart was such that [he]457-his father never resented anything for long , and welcomed [[his]457-his father son]2722-his son to - day with a smile which was as candidly sweet as [a child]1122-a child 's .

[Angel]284-clare sat down , and [the place]5882-the place felt like [home]5850-home ; yet [he]284-clare did not so much as formerly feel [himself]284-clare [one of [the family]719-the family gathered [there]5839-there]2730-one of the family gathered there . Every time that [he]284-clare returned hither [he]284-clare was conscious of this divergence , and since [he]284-clare had last shared in the Vicarage life it had grown even more distinctly foreign to [his]284-clare own than usual . [Its]5882-the place transcendental aspirations - still unconsciously based on the geocentric view of things , [a zenithal paradise]2733-a zenithal paradise , [a nadiral hell]2734-a nadiral hell - were as foreign to [his]284-clare own as if they had been the dreams of people on [another planet]2735-another planet . Latterly [he]284-clare had seen only Life , felt only the great passionate pulse of existence , unwarped , uncontorted , untrammelled by those creeds which futilely attempt to check what wisdom would be content to regulate .

On [their]2736-they part [they]2736-they saw a great difference in [him]284-clare , a growing divergence from the Angel Clare of former times . It was chiefly a difference in [his]284-clare manner that [they]2736-they noticed just now , particularly [[his]284-clare brothers]634-his brothers . [He]284-clare was getting to behave like [a farmer]868-a farmer ; [he]284-clare flung [his]284-clare legs about ; the muscles of [his]284-clare face had grown more expressive ; [his]284-clare eyes looked as much information as [his]284-clare tongue spoke , and more . The manner of [the scholar]2739-the scholar had nearly disappeared ; still more the manner of [the drawing - room young man]2740-the drawing - room young man . [A prig]2741-a prig would have said that [he]284-clare had lost culture , and a prude that [he]284-clare had become coarse . Such was the contagion of domiciliary fellowship with [the Talbothays]60-talbothays nymphs and [swains]2742-swains .

After breakfast [he]284-clare walked with [[his]284-clare two brothers]2743-his two brothers , [non - evangelical , well - educated , hall - marked young men]2744-non - evangelical , well - educated , hall - marked young men , correct to [their]2743-his two brothers remotest fibre , [such unimpeachable models as are turned out yearly by the lathe of a systematic tuition]2745-such unimpeachable models as are turned out yearly by the lathe of a systematic tuition . [They]2743-his two brothers were both somewhat short - sighted , and when it was the custom to wear a single eyeglass and string [they]2743-his two brothers wore a single eyeglass and string ; when it was the custom to wear a double glass [they]2743-his two brothers wore a double glass ; when it was the custom to wear spectacles [they]2743-his two brothers wore spectacles straightway , all without reference to the particular variety of defect in [their]2743-his two brothers own vision . When [Wordsworth]345-wordsworth was enthroned [they]2743-his two brothers carried pocket copies ; and when [Shelley]346-shelley was belittled [they]2743-his two brothers allowed [him]284-clare to grow dusty on [their]2743-his two brothers shelves . When [[Correggio]347-correggio 's Holy Families]2746-correggio 's holy families were admired , [they]2743-his two brothers admired [[Correggio]347-correggio 's Holy Families]2746-correggio 's holy families ; when [he]284-clare was decried in favour of [Velasquez]348-velasquez , [they]2743-his two brothers sedulously followed suit without any personal objection .

If [these two]2748-these two noticed [Angel]284-clare 's growing social ineptness , [he]284-clare noticed [their]2748-these two growing mental limitations . [Felix]202-felix seemed to [him]284-clare all Church ; [Cuthbert]201-cuthbert all College . [His]284-clare Diocesan Synod and Visitations were the mainsprings of [the world]497-the world to [the one]2750-the one ; [Cambridge]74-cambridge to the other . [Each brother]2751-each brother candidly recognized that there were [a few unimportant score of millions of [outsiders in civilized society]2753-outsiders in civilized society]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society , [persons who were neither [University men]2755-university men nor [churchmen]2756-churchmen]2754-persons who were neither university men nor churchmen ; but [they]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society were to be tolerated rather than reckoned with and respected .

[They]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society were [both dutiful and attentive sons]2757-both dutiful and attentive sons , and were regular in [their]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society visits to [[their]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society parents]2758-their parents . [Felix]202-felix , though an offshoot from a far more recent point in the devolution of theology than [[his]202-felix father]457-his father , was less self - sacrificing and disinterested . More tolerant than [[his]202-felix father]457-his father of a contradictory opinion , in its aspect as a danger to [[its]2761-its holder]2762-its holder , [he]202-felix was less ready than [[his]202-felix father]457-his father to pardon it as a slight to [his]202-felix own teaching . [Cuthbert]201-cuthbert was , upon the whole , the more liberal - minded , though , with greater subtlety , [he]201-cuthbert had not so much heart .

As [they]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society walked along [the hillside]2764-the hillside [Angel]284-clare 's former feeling revived in [him]201-cuthbert - that whatever [their]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society advantages by comparison with [himself]201-cuthbert , neither saw or set forth life as it really was lived . Perhaps , as with [many men]2765-many men , [their]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society opportunities of observation were not so good as [their]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society opportunities of expression . Neither had an adequate conception of the complicated forces at work outside the smooth and gentle current in which [they]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society and [[their]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society associates]2766-their associates floated . Neither saw the difference between local truth and universal truth ; that what [the inner world]2767-the inner world said in [their]2752-a few unimportant score of millions of outsiders in civilized society clerical and academic hearing was quite a different thing from what [the outer world]672-the outer world was thinking .

" [I]202-felix suppose it is farming or nothing for [you]2769-his youngest brother now , [[my]202-felix dear fellow]6610-my dear fellow , "[202-felix] [Felix]202-felix was saying , among other things , to [[his]202-felix youngest brother]2769-his youngest brother , as [he]202-felix looked through [his]202-felix spectacles at [the distant fields]2770-the distant fields with sad austerity . " And , therefore , [we]6611-we must make the best of it . But [I]202-felix do entreat [you]2769-his youngest brother to endeavour to keep as much as possible in touch with moral ideals . Farming , of course , means roughing it externally ; but high thinking may go with plain living , nevertheless . "[202-felix]

" Of course it may , "[284-clare] said [Angel]284-clare . " Was it not proved nineteen hundred years ago - if [I]284-clare may trespass upon [[your]2769-his youngest brother domain]6612-your domain a little ? Why should [you]2769-his youngest brother think , [Felix]202-felix , that [I]284-clare am likely to drop [my]284-clare high thinking and [my]284-clare moral ideals ? "[284-clare]

" Well , [I]202-felix fancied , from the tone of [your]2769-his youngest brother letters and [our]6611-we conversation - it may be fancy only - that [you]2769-his youngest brother were somehow losing intellectual grasp . Has n't it struck [you]2769-his youngest brother , [Cuthbert]201-cuthbert ? "[202-felix]

" Now , [Felix]202-felix , "[284-clare] said [Angel]284-clare drily , " [we]6611-we are [very good friends]6613-very good friends , [you]202-felix know ; each of [us]6611-we treading [our]6611-we allotted circles ; but if it comes to intellectual grasp , [I]284-clare think [you]202-felix , as [a contented dogmatist]6614-a contented dogmatist , had better leave [mine]284-clare alone , and inquire what has become of [yours]202-felix . "[284-clare]

[They]2771-their returned down [the hill]642-the hill to dinner , which was fixed at any time at which [[their]2771-their father]2773-their father 's and [mother]5917-mother 's morning work in [the parish]5847-the parish usually concluded . Convenience as [regarded afternoon callers]2776-regarded afternoon callers was the last thing to enter into the consideration of unselfish [Mr]2777-mr and [Mrs Clare]200-clare ; though [the three sons]2778-the three sons were sufficiently in unison on this matter to wish that [[their]2771-their parents]2758-their parents would conform a little to modern notions .

The walk had made [them]2771-their hungry , [Angel]200-clare in particular , who was now [an outdoor man]2780-an outdoor man , accustomed to the profuse dapes inemptae of [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's somewhat coarsely - laden table . But [neither of [the old people]2783-the old people]2782-neither of the old people had arrived , and it was not till [the sons]2784-the sons were almost tired of waiting that [[their]2771-their parents]2758-their parents entered . [The self - denying pair]2786-the self - denying pair had been occupied in coaxing the appetites of [some of [[their]2786-the self - denying pair sick parishioners]2788-their sick parishioners , whom [they]2786-the self - denying pair , somewhat inconsistently , tried to keep imprisoned in the flesh , [their]2786-the self - denying pair own appetites being quite forgotten]2787-some of their sick parishioners , whom they , somewhat inconsistently , tried to keep imprisoned in the flesh , their own appetites being quite forgotten .

[The family]719-the family sat down to table , and a frugal meal of cold viands was deposited before [them]719-the family . [Angel]200-clare looked round for [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick 's black - puddings , which [he]2780-an outdoor man had directed to be nicely grilled as [they]2786-the self - denying pair did them at [the dairy]1952-the dairy , and of which [he]2780-an outdoor man wished [[his]2780-an outdoor man father]457-his father and [mother]5917-mother to appreciate the marvellous herbal savours as highly as [he]2780-an outdoor man did [himself]2780-an outdoor man .

" Ah ! [you]2780-an outdoor man are looking for the black - puddings , [[my]200-clare dear boy]6615-my dear boy , "[200-clare] observed [[Clare]200-clare 's mother]2793-clare 's mother . " But [I]200-clare am sure [you]2780-an outdoor man will not mind doing without [them]6616-them as [I]200-clare am sure [[your]2780-an outdoor man father]5918-your father and [I]200-clare shall not , when [you]2780-an outdoor man know the reason . [I]200-clare suggested to [him]5918-your father that [we]6618-we should take [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick 's kind present to [the children of [the man who can earn nothing just now because of [his]5918-your father attacks of delirium tremens]6620-the man who can earn nothing just now because of his attacks of delirium tremens]6619-the children of the man who can earn nothing just now because of his attacks of delirium tremens ; and [he]5918-your father agreed that it would be a great pleasure to [them]6619-the children of the man who can earn nothing just now because of his attacks of delirium tremens ; so [we]6618-we did . "[200-clare]

" Of course , "[200-clare] said [Angel]200-clare cheerfully , looking round for the mead .

" [I]6090-his mother found the mead so extremely alcoholic , "[6090-his mother] continued [[his]2794-his mother]6090-his mother , " that it was quite unfit for use as a beverage , but as valuable as rum or brandy in an emergency ; so [I]6090-his mother have put it in [my]6090-his mother medicine - closet . "[6090-his mother]

" [We]6618-we never drink spirits at this table , on principle , "[457-his father] added [[his]2794-his father]457-his father .

" But what shall [I]200-clare tell [[the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's wife]2103-the dairyman 's wife ? "[200-clare] said [Angel]200-clare .

" The truth , of course , "[457-his father] said [[his]2794-his father]457-his father .

" [I]457-his father rather wanted to say [we]6618-we enjoyed the mead and the black - puddings very much . [She]2103-the dairyman 's wife is a kind , jolly sort of body , and is sure to ask [me]457-his father directly [I]457-his father return . "[457-his father]

" [You]284-clare can not , if [we]6618-we did not , "[284-clare] [Mr Clare]284-clare answered lucidly .

" Ah - no ; though that mead was a drop of pretty tipple . "[457-his father]

" A what ? "[201-cuthbert] said [Cuthbert]201-cuthbert and [Felix]202-felix both .

" Oh - ' tis an expression [they]746-his parents use down at [Talbothays]60-talbothays , "[284-clare] replied [Angel]284-clare , blushing . [He]284-clare felt that [[his]284-clare parents]746-his parents were right in [their]746-his parents practice if wrong in [their]746-his parents want of sentiment , and said no more .

XXVI

It was not till the evening , after family prayers , that [Angel]284-clare found opportunity of broaching to [[his]284-clare father]457-his father one or two subjects near [his]284-clare heart . [He]284-clare had strung [himself]284-clare up to the purpose while kneeling behind [[his]284-clare brothers]634-his brothers on the carpet , studying the little nails in the heels of [their]634-his brothers walking boots . When the service was over [they]634-his brothers went out of [the room]778-the room with [[their]634-his brothers mother]1138-their mother , and [Mr Clare]284-clare and [himself]284-clare were left alone .

[The young man]471-the young man first discussed with [the elder]534-the elder [his]471-the young man plans for the attainment of [his]471-the young man position as a farmer on an extensive scale - either in [England]10-england or in [the Colonies]2138-the colonies . [[His]471-the young man father]457-his father then told [him]471-the young man that , as [he]457-his father had not been put to the expense of sending [Angel]284-clare up to [Cambridge]74-cambridge , [he]457-his father had felt it [his]457-his father duty to set by a sum of money every year towards the purchase or lease of land for [him]471-the young man some day , that [he]471-the young man might not feel [himself]471-the young man unduly slighted .

" As far as worldly wealth goes , "[457-his father] continued [[his]471-the young man father]457-his father , " [you]284-clare will no doubt stand far superior to [[your]284-clare brothers]6623-your brothers in a few years . "[457-his father]

This considerateness on [old Mr Clare]284-clare 's part led [Angel]284-clare onward to [the other and dearer subject]2808-the other and dearer subject . [He]284-clare observed to [[his]471-the young man father]457-his father that [he]284-clare was then six - and - twenty , and that when [he]284-clare should start in the farming business [he]284-clare would require eyes in the back of [his]284-clare head to see to all matters - some one would be necessary to superintend the domestic labours of [[his]284-clare establishment]2810-his establishment whilst [he]284-clare was afield . Would it not be well , therefore , for [him]284-clare to marry ?

[[His]471-the young man father]457-his father seemed to think this idea not unreasonable ; and then [Angel]284-clare put the question -

" What kind of wife do [you]457-his father think would be best for [me]284-clare as [a thrifty hard - working farmer]6624-a thrifty hard - working farmer ? "[284-clare]

" [A truly Christian woman]6625-a truly christian woman , who will be a help and a comfort to [you]471-the young man in [your]471-the young man goings - out and [your]471-the young man comings - in . Beyond that , it really matters little . [Such an one]6626-such an one can be found ; indeed , [[my]284-clare earnest - minded friend]6627-my earnest - minded friend and neighbour , [Dr Chant]350-dr chant - "[284-clare]

" But ought [she]6625-a truly christian woman not primarily to be able to milk cows , churn good butter , make immense cheeses ; know how to sit hens and turkeys and rear chickens , to direct a field of [labourers]6628-labourers in an emergency , and estimate the value of sheep and calves ? "[284-clare]

" Yes ; [[a farmer]868-a farmer 's wife]2652-a farmer 's wife ; yes , certainly . It would be desirable . "[284-clare] [Mr Clare]284-clare , [the elder]534-the elder , had plainly never thought of these points before . " [I]284-clare was going to add , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said , " that for [a pure and saintly woman]6631-a pure and saintly woman [you]471-the young man will not find one more to [your]471-the young man true advantage , and certainly not more to [[your]471-the young man mother]6051-your mother 's mind and [my]284-clare own , than [[your]471-the young man friend]6633-your friend [Mercy]330-mercy , whom [you]471-the young man used to show a certain interest in . It is true that [[my]284-clare neighbour [Chant]330-mercy 's daughter]6634-my neighbour chant 's daughter had lately caught up the fashion of [the younger clergy]6635-the younger clergy round about [us]6636-us for decorating the Communion - table - altar , as [I]284-clare was shocked to hear [her]6634-my neighbour chant 's daughter call it one day - with flowers and other stuff on festival occasions . But [[her]6634-my neighbour chant 's daughter father]557-her father , who is quite as opposed to such flummery as [I]284-clare , says that can be cured . It is a mere girlish outbreak which , [I]284-clare am sure , will not be permanent . "[284-clare]

" Yes , yes ; [Mercy]330-mercy is good and devout , [I]2817-the impulsive angel know . But , [father]5842-father , do n't [you]5842-father think that [a young woman]6531-a young woman equally pure and virtuous as [Miss Chant]330-mercy , but one who , in place of [that lady]5965-that lady 's ecclesiastical accomplishments , understands the duties of farm life as well as [a farmer]868-a farmer [himself]868-a farmer , would suit [me]2817-the impulsive angel infinitely better ? "[2817-the impulsive angel]

[[His]2813-his father]457-his father persisted in [his]457-his father conviction that a knowledge of [[a farmer]868-a farmer 's wife]2652-a farmer 's wife 's duties came second to a Pauline view of humanity ; and [the impulsive Angel]2817-the impulsive angel , wishing to honour [[his]2813-his father]457-his father 's feelings and to advance the cause of [his]2813-his heart at the same time , grew specious . [He]2813-his said that fate or [Providence]266-providence had thrown in [his]2813-his way [a woman who possessed every qualification to be [the helpmate of [an agriculturist]2821-an agriculturist]2820-the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind . [He]2813-his would not say whether or not [she]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind had attached [herself]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind to [the sound Low Church School of [[his]2813-his father]457-his father]2822-the sound low church school of his father ; but [she]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind would probably be open to conviction on that point ; [she]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind was [a regular church - goer of simple faith]2824-a regular church - goer of simple faith ; honest - hearted , receptive , intelligent , graceful to a degree , chaste as [a vestal]2825-a vestal , and , in personal appearance , exceptionally beautiful .

" Is [she]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind of [a family such as [you]2813-his would care to marry into]6642-a family such as you would care to marry into - [a lady]6038-a lady , in short ? "[2826-his startled mother , who had come softly into the study during the conversation] asked [[his]2813-his startled mother , who had come softly into [the study]2827-the study during the conversation]2826-his startled mother , who had come softly into the study during the conversation .

" [She]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind is not what in common parlance is called [a lady]6038-a lady , "[284-clare] said [Angel]284-clare , unflinchingly , " for [she]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind is [[a cottager]6645-a cottager 's daughter]6646-a cottager 's daughter , as [I]284-clare am proud to say . But [she]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind IS [a lady]6038-a lady , nevertheless - in feeling and nature . "[284-clare]

" [Mercy Chant]330-mercy is of [a very good family]6648-a very good family . "[2826-his startled mother , who had come softly into the study during the conversation]

" Pooh ! - what 's the advantage of that , [mother]5917-mother ? "[284-clare] said [Angel]284-clare quickly . " How is [family]5943-family to avail [the wife of [a man who has to rough it as [I]284-clare have , and shall have to do]6652-a man who has to rough it as i have , and shall have to do]6651-the wife of a man who has to rough it as i have , and shall have to do ? "[284-clare]

" [Mercy]330-mercy is accomplished . And accomplishments have [their]6653-their charm , "[6090-his mother] returned [[his]284-clare mother]6090-his mother , looking at [him]284-clare through [her]6090-his mother silver spectacles .

" As to external accomplishments , what will be the use of them in the life [I]2826-his startled mother , who had come softly into the study during the conversation am going to lead ? - while as to [her]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind reading , [I]2826-his startled mother , who had come softly into the study during the conversation can take that in hand . [She]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind 'll be apt pupil enough , as [you]284-clare would say if [you]284-clare knew [her]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind . [She]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind LIVES what paper - [poets]6654-poets only write ...
