"[2826-his startled mother , who had come softly into the study during the conversation]

" O [Angel]284-clare , [you]284-clare are mocking ! "[6090-his mother]

" [Mother]228-mother , [I]284-clare beg pardon . But as [she]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind really does attend Church almost every Sunday morning , and is [a good Christian girl]6656-a good christian girl , [I]284-clare am sure [you]284-clare will tolerate any social shortcomings for the sake of that quality , and feel that [I]284-clare may do worse than choose [her]2819-a woman who possessed every qualification to be the helpmate of an agriculturist , and was decidedly of a serious turn of mind . "[284-clare] [Angel]284-clare waxed quite earnest on that rather automatic orthodoxy in [his]284-clare beloved [Tess]198-tess which never dreaming that it might stand [him]284-clare in such good stead [he]284-clare had been prone to slight when observing it practised by [her]198-tess and [the other milkmaids]2829-the other milkmaids , because of its obvious unreality amid beliefs essentially naturalistic .

In [their]2830-their sad doubts as to whether [[their]2830-their son]2831-their son had [himself]2831-their son any right whatever to the title [he]2831-their son claimed for [the unknown young woman]2832-the unknown young woman , [Mr]2833-mr and [Mrs Clare]200-clare began to feel it as an advantage not to be overlooked that [she]198-tess at least was sound in [her]198-tess views ; especially as the conjunction of [the pair]795-the pair must have arisen by an act of [Providence]266-providence ; for [Angel]200-clare never would have made orthodoxy a condition of [his]284-clare choice . [They]2830-their said finally that it was better not to act in a hurry , but that [they]2830-their would not object to see [her]198-tess .

[Angel]200-clare therefore refrained from declaring more particulars now . [He]284-clare felt that , single - minded and self - sacrificing as [[his]284-clare parents]746-his parents were , there yet existed certain latent prejudices of [theirs]746-his parents , as [middle - class people]2836-middle - class people , which it would require some tact to overcome . For though legally at liberty to do as [he]284-clare chose , and though [[their]2830-their daughter - in - law]2837-their daughter - in - law 's qualifications could make no practical difference to [their]2830-their lives , in the probability of [her]198-tess living far away from [them]2830-their , [he]284-clare wished for affection 's sake not to wound [their]2830-their sentiment in the most important decision of [his]284-clare life .

[He]284-clare observed [his]284-clare own inconsistencies in dwelling upon accidents in [Tess]198-tess 's life as if they were vital features . It was for [herself]198-tess that [he]284-clare loved [Tess]198-tess ; [her]198-tess soul , [her]198-tess heart , [her]198-tess substance - not for [her]198-tess skill in the dairy , [her]198-tess aptness as [[his]284-clare scholar]2838-his scholar , and certainly not for [her]198-tess simple formal faith - professions . [Her]198-tess unsophisticated open - air existence required no varnish of conventionality to make it palatable to [him]284-clare . [He]284-clare held that education had as yet but little affected the beats of emotion and impulse on which domestic happiness depends . It was probable that , in the lapse of ages , [improved systems of moral and intellectual training]2839-improved systems of moral and intellectual training would appreciably , perhaps considerably , elevate the involuntary and even the unconscious instincts of human nature ; but up to the present day , culture , as far as [he]284-clare could see , might be said to have affected only the mental epiderm of those lives which had been brought under its influence . This belief was confirmed by [his]284-clare experience of [women]1628-women , which , having latterly been extended from [the cultivated middle - class]2841-the cultivated middle - class into [the rural community]2842-the rural community , had taught [him]284-clare how much less was the intrinsic difference between the good and [wise woman of one social stratum]2843-wise woman of one social stratum and [the good and wise woman of another social stratum]2844-the good and wise woman of another social stratum , than between the good and bad , [the wise and the foolish , of the same stratum or class]2845-the wise and the foolish , of the same stratum or class .

It was the morning of [his]284-clare departure . [[His]284-clare brothers]634-his brothers had already left [the Vicarage]2162-the vicarage to proceed on a walking tour in [the north]2848-the north , whence [one]6172-one was to return to [[his]284-clare college]2704-his college , and [the other]2085-the other to [[his]284-clare curacy]2852-his curacy . [Angel]200-clare might have accompanied [them]634-his brothers , but preferred to rejoin [[his]284-clare sweetheart]2853-his sweetheart at [Talbothays]60-talbothays . [He]284-clare would have been [an awkward member of the party]2854-an awkward member of the party ; for , though [the most appreciative humanist]2855-the most appreciative humanist , [the most ideal religionist , even [the best - versed Christologist of the three]2857-the best - versed christologist of the three]2856-the most ideal religionist , even the best - versed christologist of the three , there was alienation in the standing consciousness that [his]284-clare squareness would not fit the round hole that had been prepared for [him]284-clare . To neither [Felix]202-felix nor [Cuthbert]201-cuthbert had [he]284-clare ventured to mention [Tess]198-tess .

[[His]284-clare mother]6090-his mother made [him]284-clare sandwiches , and [[his]284-clare father]457-his father accompanied [him]284-clare , on [[his]457-his father own mare]2860-his own mare , a little way along [the road]550-the road . Having fairly well advanced [his]284-clare own affairs , [Angel]200-clare listened in a willing silence , as [they]2862-they jogged on together through [the shady lanes]2863-the shady lanes , to [[his]284-clare father]457-his father 's account of [his]457-his father parish difficulties , and the coldness of [brother clergymen whom [he]457-his father loved , because of [his]457-his father strict interpretations of the New Testament by the light of what [they]2862-they deemed a pernicious Calvinistic doctrine]2865-brother clergymen whom he loved , because of his strict interpretations of the new testament by the light of what they deemed a pernicious calvinistic doctrine .

" Pernicious ! "[284-clare] said [Mr Clare]284-clare , with genial scorn ; and [he]284-clare proceeded to recount experiences which would show the absurdity of that idea . [He]284-clare told of wondrous conversions of evil livers of which [he]284-clare had been the instrument , not only amongst [the poor]2866-the poor , but amongst [the rich and well - to - do]2867-the rich and well - to - do ; and [he]284-clare also candidly admitted many failures .

As an instance of the latter , [he]284-clare mentioned the case of [a young upstart squire named d'Urberville]2868-a young upstart squire named d'urberville , living some forty miles off , in [the neighbourhood of [Trantridge]38-trantridge]2869-the neighbourhood of trantridge .

" Not one of the ancient d'Urbervilles of [Kingsbere]12-kingsbere and [other places]6657-other places ? "[2722-his son] asked [[his]284-clare son]2722-his son . " [That curiously historic worn - out family with its ghostly legend of [the coach - and - four]6659-the coach - and - four]6658-that curiously historic worn - out family with its ghostly legend of the coach - and - four ? "[2722-his son]

" O no . [The original d'Urbervilles]6660-the original d'urbervilles decayed and disappeared sixty or eighty years ago - at least , [I]284-clare believe so . This seems to be [a new family which had taken the name]6661-a new family which had taken the name ; for the credit of [the former knightly line]6662-the former knightly line [I]284-clare hope [they]6662-the former knightly line are spurious , [I]284-clare 'm sure . But it is odd to hear [you]2722-his son express interest in [old families]6492-old families . [I]284-clare thought [you]2722-his son set less store by [them]6492-old families even than [I.]284-clare "[284-clare]

" [You]2722-his son misapprehend [me]284-clare , [father]5842-father ; [you]2722-his son often do , "[284-clare] said [Angel]284-clare with a little impatience . " Politically [I]284-clare am sceptical as to the virtue of [their]6492-old families being old . [Some of the wise even among [themselves]6665-some of the wise even among themselves]6665-some of the wise even among themselves ' exclaim against [their]6665-some of the wise even among themselves own succession , ' as [Hamlet]351-hamlet puts it ; but lyrically , dramatically , and even historically , [I]284-clare am tenderly attached to [them]6492-old families . "[284-clare]

This distinction , though by no means a subtle one , was yet too subtle for [Mr Clare]284-clare [the elder]534-the elder , and [he]284-clare went on with the story [he]284-clare had been about to relate ; which was that after the death of [the senior so - called d'Urberville]2872-the senior so - called d'urberville , [the young man]471-the young man developed the most culpable passions , though [he]471-the young man had [a blind mother]2874-a blind mother , whose condition should have made [him]471-the young man know better . A knowledge of [his]471-the young man career having come to the ears of [Mr Clare]284-clare , when [he]471-the young man was in [that part of [the country]507-the country]2875-that part of the country preaching missionary sermons , [he]471-the young man boldly took occasion to speak to [the delinquent]2877-the delinquent on [his]471-the young man spiritual state . Though [he]471-the young man was [a stranger]1085-a stranger , occupying another 's pulpit , [he]471-the young man had felt this to be [his]471-the young man duty , and took for [his]471-the young man text the words from [St Luke]352-st luke : " [Thou]6666-thou fool , this night [thy]6666-thou soul shall be required of [thee]6666-thou ! "[352-st luke] [The young man]471-the young man much resented this directness of attack , and in the war of words which followed when [they]2880-they met [he]471-the young man did not scruple publicly to insult [Mr Clare]284-clare , without respect for [his]471-the young man gray hairs .

[Angel]284-clare flushed with distress .

" [Dear father]6667-dear father , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said sadly , " [I]284-clare wish [you]6667-dear father would not expose [yourself]6667-dear father to such gratuitous pain from [scoundrels]6668-scoundrels ! "[284-clare]

" Pain ? "[457-his father] said [[his]471-the young man father]457-his father , [his]457-his father rugged face shining in the ardour of self - abnegation . " The only pain to [me]457-his father was pain on [his]284-clare account , [poor , foolish young man]6669-poor , foolish young man . Do [you]6667-dear father suppose [his]284-clare incensed words could give [me]457-his father any pain , or even [his]284-clare blows ? ' Being reviled [we]6670-we bless ; being persecuted [we]6670-we suffer it ; being defamed [we]6670-we entreat ; [we]6670-we are made as the filth of [the world]497-the world , and as the offscouring of all things unto this day . ' Those ancient and noble words to [the Corinthians]353-the corinthians are strictly true at this present hour . "[457-his father]

" Not blows , [father]5842-father ? [He]284-clare did not proceed to blows ? "[284-clare]

" No , [he]284-clare did not . Though [I]457-his father have borne blows from [men]5841-men in a mad state of intoxication . "[457-his father]

" No ! "[284-clare]

" A dozen times , [[my]457-his father boy]6440-my boy . What then ? [I]457-his father have saved [them]5841-men from the guilt of murdering [their]5841-men own flesh and blood thereby ; and [they]5841-men have lived to thank [me]457-his father , and praise [God]222-god . "[457-his father]

" May [this young man]6675-this young man do the same ! "[284-clare] said [Angel]284-clare fervently . " But [I]284-clare fear otherwise , from what [you]5842-father say . "[284-clare]

" [We]6676-we 'll hope , nevertheless , "[284-clare] said [Mr Clare]284-clare . " And [I]284-clare continue to pray for [him]6675-this young man , though on this side of [the grave]886-the grave [we]6676-we shall probably never meet again . But , after all , one of those poor words of [mine]284-clare may spring up in [his]6675-this young man heart as a good seed some day . "[284-clare]

Now , as always , [[Clare]284-clare 's father]2882-clare 's father was sanguine as [a child]1122-a child ; and though [the younger]2884-the younger could not accept [[his]2884-the younger parent]2885-his parent 's narrow dogma , [he]2884-the younger revered [his]2882-clare 's father practice and recognized [the hero]2886-the hero under [the pietist]2887-the pietist . Perhaps [he]2884-the younger revered [[his]2884-the younger father]457-his father 's practice even more now than ever , seeing that , in the question of making [Tessy]256-tessy [[his]457-his father wife]819-his wife , [[his]2884-the younger father]457-his father had not once thought of inquiring whether [she]256-tessy were well provided or penniless . The same unworldliness was what had necessitated [Angel]284-clare 's getting a living as [a farmer]868-a farmer , and would probably keep [[his]284-clare brothers]634-his brothers in the position of poor parsons for the term of [their]634-his brothers activities ; yet [Angel]284-clare admired it none the less . Indeed , despite [his]284-clare own heterodoxy , [Angel]284-clare often felt that [he]284-clare was nearer to [[his]284-clare father]457-his father on the human side than was [either of [[his]284-clare brethren]2124-his brethren]2894-either of his brethren .

XXVII

An up - hill and down - hill ride of twenty - odd miles through a garish mid - day atmosphere brought [him]284-clare in the afternoon to [a detached knoll a mile or two west of [Talbothays]60-talbothays]2896-a detached knoll a mile or two west of talbothays , whence [he]284-clare again looked into [that green trough of sappiness and humidity]2897-that green trough of sappiness and humidity , [the valley of the Var]2898-the valley of the var or [Froom]64-froom . Immediately [he]284-clare began to descend from [the upland]2899-the upland to [the fat alluvial soil below]2900-the fat alluvial soil below , the atmosphere grew heavier ; the languid perfume of the summer fruits , the mists , the hay , the flowers , formed therein a vast pool of odour which at this hour seemed to make the animals , the very bees and butterflies drowsy . [Clare]284-clare was now so familiar with [the spot]2283-the spot that [he]284-clare knew the individual cows by [their]2902-their names when , a long distance off , [he]284-clare saw [them]2902-their dotted about [the meads]2026-the meads . It was with a sense of luxury that [he]284-clare recognized [his]284-clare power of viewing life here from [its]2904-its inner side , in a way that had been quite foreign to [him]284-clare in [his]284-clare student - days ; and , much as [he]284-clare loved [[his]284-clare parents]746-his parents , [he]284-clare could not help being aware that to come [here]5975-here , as now , after an experience of [home]5850-home - life , affected [him]284-clare like throwing off splints and bandages ; even the one customary curb on the humours of [English rural societies]2908-english rural societies being absent in [this place]2909-this place , [Talbothays]60-talbothays having [no resident landlord]2910-no resident landlord .

[Not a human being]2911-not a human being was out of doors at [the dairy]1952-the dairy . [The denizens]2913-the denizens were all enjoying the usual afternoon nap of an hour or so which the exceedingly early hours kept in summer - time rendered a necessity . At the door the wood - hooped pails , sodden and bleached by infinite scrubbings , hung like hats on a stand upon the forked and peeled limb of an oak fixed there for that purpose ; all of them ready and dry for the evening milking . [Angel]284-clare entered , and went through [the silent passages of [the house]652-the house]2914-the silent passages of the house to [the back quarters]2916-the back quarters , where [he]284-clare listened for a moment . Sustained snores came from [the cart - house]2917-the cart - house , where [some of [the men]2919-the men]2918-some of the men were lying down ; the grunt and squeal of sweltering pigs arose from the still further distance . The large - leaved rhubarb and cabbage plants slept too , their broad limp surfaces hanging in the sun like half - closed umbrellas .

[He]284-clare unbridled and fed [his]284-clare horse , and as [he]284-clare re - entered [the house]652-the house the clock struck three . Three was the afternoon skimming - hour ; and , with the stroke , [Clare]284-clare heard the creaking of the floor - boards above , and then the touch of a descending foot on the stairs . It was [Tess]198-tess 's , who in another moment came down before [his]284-clare eyes .

[She]198-tess had not heard [him]284-clare enter , and hardly realized [his]284-clare presence there . [She]198-tess was yawning , and [he]284-clare saw the red interior of [her]198-tess mouth as if it had been a snake 's . [She]198-tess had stretched one arm so high above [her]198-tess coiled - up cable of hair that [he]284-clare could see its satin delicacy above the sunburn ; [her]198-tess face was flushed with sleep , and [her]198-tess eyelids hung heavy over their pupils . The brim - fulness of [her]198-tess nature breathed from [her]198-tess . It was a moment when [a woman]1028-a woman 's soul is more incarnate than at any other time ; when the most spiritual beauty bespeaks itself flesh ; and sex takes the outside place in the presentation .

Then those eyes flashed brightly through their filmy heaviness , before the remainder of [her]198-tess face was well awake . With an oddly compounded look of gladness , shyness , and surprise , [she]198-tess exclaimed - " O [Mr Clare]284-clare ! How [you]284-clare frightened [me]198-tess - [I]198-tess - "[198-tess]

There had not at first been time for [her]198-tess to think of the changed relations which [his]284-clare declaration had introduced ; but the full sense of the matter rose up in [her]198-tess face when [she]198-tess encountered [Clare]284-clare 's tender look as [he]284-clare stepped forward to the bottom stair .

" Dear , darling [Tessy]256-tessy ! "[284-clare] [he]284-clare whispered , putting [his]284-clare arm round [her]198-tess , and [his]284-clare face to [her]198-tess flushed cheek . " Do n't , for Heaven 's sake , Mister [me]284-clare any more . [I]284-clare have hastened back so soon because of [you]198-tess ! "[284-clare]

[Tess]198-tess 's excitable heart beat against [his]284-clare by way of reply ; and there [they]2922-they stood upon the red - brick floor of [the entry]2923-the entry , the sun slanting in by the window upon [his]284-clare back , as [he]284-clare held [her]198-tess tightly to [his]284-clare breast ; upon [her]198-tess inclining face , upon the blue veins of [her]198-tess temple , upon [her]198-tess naked arm , and [her]198-tess neck , and into the depths of [her]198-tess hair . Having been lying down in [her]198-tess clothes [she]198-tess was warm as a sunned cat . At first [she]198-tess would not look straight up at [him]284-clare , but [her]198-tess eyes soon lifted , and [his]284-clare plumbed the deepness of the ever - varying pupils , with their radiating fibrils of blue , and black , and gray , and violet , while [she]198-tess regarded [him]284-clare as [Eve]303-eve at [her]198-tess second waking might have regarded [Adam]302-adam .

" [I]198-tess 've got to go a - skimming , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess pleaded , " and [I]198-tess have [on'y old Deb]309-deb to help [me]198-tess to - day . [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick is gone to [market]2574-market with [Mr Crick]276-dairyman crick , and [Retty]311-retty is not well , and [the others]2258-the others are gone out somewhere , and wo n't be [home]5850-home till milking . "[198-tess]

As [they]2924-they retreated to [the milk - house]2113-the milk - house [Deborah Fyander]308-old deborah fyander appeared on the stairs .

" [I]284-clare have come back , [Deborah]308-old deborah fyander , "[284-clare] said [Mr Clare]284-clare , upwards . " So [I]284-clare can help [Tess]198-tess with the skimming ; and , as [you]308-old deborah fyander are very tired , [I]284-clare am sure , [you]308-old deborah fyander need n't come down till milking - time . "[284-clare]

Possibly the Talbothays milk was not very thoroughly skimmed that afternoon . [Tess]198-tess was in a dream wherein familiar objects appeared as having light and shade and position , but no particular outline . Every time [she]198-tess held the skimmer under the pump to cool it for the work [her]198-tess hand trembled , the ardour of [his]284-clare affection being so palpable that [she]198-tess seemed to flinch under it like a plant in too burning a sun .

Then [he]284-clare pressed [her]198-tess again to [his]284-clare side , and when [she]198-tess had done running [her]198-tess forefinger round the leads to cut off the cream - edge , [he]284-clare cleaned it in nature 's way ; for the unconstrained manners of [Talbothays]60-talbothays dairy came convenient now .

" [I]284-clare may as well say it now as later , [dearest]6681-dearest , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare resumed gently . " [I]284-clare wish to ask [you]6681-dearest something of a very practical nature , which [I]284-clare have been thinking of ever since that day last week in the meads . [I]284-clare shall soon want to marry , and , being [a farmer]868-a farmer , [you]6681-dearest see [I]284-clare shall require for [[my]284-clare wife]5895-my wife [a woman who knows all about the management of [farms]6685-farms]6684-a woman who knows all about the management of farms . Will [you]6681-dearest be [that woman]6686-that woman , [Tessy]256-tessy ? "[284-clare]

[He]284-clare put it that way that [she]2926-she might not think [he]284-clare had yielded to an impulse of which [his]284-clare head would disapprove .

[She]2926-she turned quite careworn . [She]2926-she had bowed to the inevitable result of proximity , the necessity of loving [him]284-clare ; but [she]2926-she had not calculated upon this sudden corollary , which , indeed , [Clare]284-clare had put before [her]2926-she without quite meaning [himself]284-clare to do it so soon . With pain that was like the bitterness of dissolution [she]2926-she murmured the words of [her]2926-she indispensable and sworn answer as [an honourable woman]2927-an honourable woman .

" O [Mr Clare]284-clare - [I]2926-she can not be [[your]284-clare wife]6687-your wife - [I]2926-she can not be ! "[2926-she]

The sound of [her]2926-she own decision seemed to break [Tess]198-tess 's very heart , and [she]2926-she bowed [her]2926-she face in [her]2926-she grief .

" But , [Tess]198-tess ! "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said , amazed at [her]2926-she reply , and holding [her]198-tess still more greedily close . " Do [you]198-tess say no ? Surely [you]198-tess love [me]284-clare ? "[284-clare]

" O yes , yes ! And [I]2928-the distressed girl would rather be [yours]198-tess than [anybody]6181-anybody 's in [the world]497-the world , "[2928-the distressed girl] returned the sweet and honest voice of [the distressed girl]2928-the distressed girl . " But [I]2928-the distressed girl CANNOT marry [you]198-tess ! "[2928-the distressed girl]

" [Tess]198-tess , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said , holding [her]198-tess at arm 's length , " [you]198-tess are engaged to marry [some one else]6690-some one else ! "[284-clare]

" No , no ! "[2928-the distressed girl]

" Then why do [you]284-clare refuse [me]284-clare ? "[284-clare]

" [I]2928-the distressed girl do n't want to marry ! [I]2928-the distressed girl have not thought of doing it . [I]2928-the distressed girl can not ! [I]2928-the distressed girl only want to love [you]198-tess . "[2928-the distressed girl]

" But why ? "[284-clare]

Driven to subterfuge , [she]198-tess stammered -

" [[Your]198-tess father]5918-your father is [a parson]2123-a parson , and [[your]198-tess mother]6051-your mother wouldn ' like [you]198-tess to marry such as [me]198-tess . [She]6051-your mother will want [you]198-tess to marry [a lady]6038-a lady . "[198-tess]

" Nonsense - [I]2928-the distressed girl have spoken to [them]6695-them both . That was partly why [I]2928-the distressed girl went [home]5850-home . "[2928-the distressed girl]

" [I]198-tess feel [I]198-tess can not - never , never ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess echoed .

" Is it too sudden to be asked thus , [[my]2928-the distressed girl Pretty]6271-my pretty ? "[2928-the distressed girl]

" Yes - [I]2928-the distressed girl did not expect it . "[2928-the distressed girl]

" If [you]198-tess will let it pass , please , [Tessy]256-tessy , [I]2929-i will give [you]198-tess time , "[2929-i] [he]2929-i said . " It was very abrupt to come [home]5850-home and speak to [you]198-tess all at once . [I]2929-i 'll not allude to it again for a while . "[2929-i]

[She]198-tess again took up the shining skimmer , held it beneath the pump , and began anew . But [she]198-tess could not , as at other times , hit the exact under - surface of the cream with the delicate dexterity required , try as [she]198-tess might ; sometimes [she]198-tess was cutting down into the milk , sometimes in the air . [She]198-tess could hardly see , [her]198-tess eyes having filled with two blurring tears drawn forth by a grief which , to this [[her]198-tess best friend and dear advocate]2930-her best friend and dear advocate , [she]198-tess could never explain .

" [I]198-tess ca n't skim - [I]198-tess ca n't ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , turning away from [him]2929-i .

Not to agitate and hinder [her]198-tess longer , [the considerate Clare]2931-the considerate clare began talking in a more general way :

[You]2929-i quite misapprehend [[my]0-i parents]2932-my parents . [They]2932-my parents are [the most simple - mannered people alive]2933-the most simple - mannered people alive , and quite unambitious . [They]2932-my parents are two of [the few remaining [Evangelical school]2935-evangelical school]2934-the few remaining evangelical school . [Tessy]256-tessy , are [you]256-tessy [an Evangelical]2936-an evangelical ? "[256-tessy]

" [I]198-tess do n't know . "[198-tess]

" [You]2929-i go to [church]813-church very regularly , and [[our]6700-our parson]6701-our parson here is not very High , [they]2932-my parents tell [me]256-tessy . "[256-tessy]

[Tess]198-tess 's ideas on the views of [the parish clergyman]2937-the parish clergyman , whom [she]198-tess heard every week , seemed to be rather more vague than [Clare]284-clare 's , who had never heard [him]2937-the parish clergyman at all .

" [I]198-tess wish [I]198-tess could fix [my]198-tess mind on what [I]198-tess hear there more firmly than [I]198-tess do , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess remarked as a safe generality . " It is often a great sorrow to [me]198-tess . "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess spoke so unaffectedly that [Angel]284-clare was sure in [his]284-clare heart that [[his]284-clare father]457-his father could not object to [her]198-tess on religious grounds , even though [she]198-tess did not know whether [her]198-tess principles were High , Low or Broad . [He]284-clare [himself]284-clare knew that , in reality , the confused beliefs which [she]198-tess held , apparently imbibed in childhood , were , if anything , Tractarian as to phraseology , and Pantheistic as to essence . Confused or otherwise , to disturb [them]2939-them was [his]284-clare last desire :

Leave [thou]2940-thou [[thy]2940-thou sister]2941-thy sister , when [she]2941-thy sister prays , [Her]2941-thy sister early Heaven , [her]2941-thy sister happy views ; Nor [thou]2940-thou with shadow'd hint confuse A life that leads melodious days .

[He]284-clare had occasionally thought the counsel less honest than musical ; but [he]284-clare gladly conformed to it now .

[He]284-clare spoke further of the incidents of [his]284-clare visit , of [[his]284-clare father]457-his father 's mode of life , of [his]284-clare zeal for [his]284-clare principles ; [she]198-tess grew serener , and the undulations disappeared from [her]198-tess skimming ; as [she]198-tess finished one lead after another [he]284-clare followed [her]198-tess , and drew the plugs for letting down the milk .

" [I]198-tess fancied [you]284-clare looked a little downcast when [you]284-clare came in , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess ventured to observe , anxious to keep away from the subject of [herself]198-tess .

" Yes - well , [[my]198-tess father]6702-my father had been talking a good deal to [me]198-tess of [his]6702-my father troubles and difficulties , and the subject always tends to depress [me]198-tess . [He]6702-my father is so zealous that [he]6702-my father gets many snubs and buffetings from [people]5930-people of a different way of thinking from [himself]6702-my father , and [I]198-tess do n't like to hear of such humiliations to [a man of [his]6702-my father age]6704-a man of his age , the more particularly as [I]198-tess do n't think earnestness does any good when carried so far . [He]6702-my father has been telling [me]198-tess of a very unpleasant scene in which [he]6702-my father took part quite recently . [He]6702-my father went as [the deputy of some missionary society]6705-the deputy of some missionary society to preach in [the neighbourhood of [Trantridge]38-trantridge]2869-the neighbourhood of trantridge , [a place forty miles from here]6707-a place forty miles from here , and made it [his]6702-my father business to expostulate with [a lax young cynic [he]6702-my father met with somewhere about there]6708-a lax young cynic he met with somewhere about there - [son of some landowner up that way]6709-son of some landowner up that way - and who has [a mother afflicted with blindness]6710-a mother afflicted with blindness . [[My]198-tess father]6702-my father addressed [himself]6702-my father to [the gentleman]1007-the gentleman point - blank , and there was quite a disturbance . It was very foolish of [[my]198-tess father]6702-my father , [I]198-tess must say , to intrude [his]6702-my father conversation upon [a stranger]1085-a stranger when the probabilities were so obvious that it would be useless . But whatever [he]6702-my father thinks to be [his]6702-my father duty , that [he]6702-my father 'll do , in season or out of season ; and , of course , [he]6702-my father makes many enemies , not only among [the absolutely vicious]6715-the absolutely vicious , but among the easy - going , who hate being bothered . [He]6702-my father says [he]6702-my father glories in what happened , and that good may be done indirectly ; but [I]198-tess wish [he]6702-my father would not wear [himself]6702-my father out now [he]6702-my father is getting old , and would leave such pigs to [their]6716-their wallowing . "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess 's look had grown hard and worn , and [her]198-tess ripe mouth tragical ; but [she]198-tess no longer showed any tremulousness . [Clare]284-clare 's revived thoughts of [[his]284-clare father]457-his father prevented [his]284-clare noticing [her]198-tess particularly ; and so [they]2944-they went on down the white row of liquid rectangles till [they]2944-they had finished and drained them off , when [the other maids]2257-the other maids returned , and took [their]2257-the other maids pails , and [Deb]309-deb came to scald out the leads for the new milk . As [Tess]198-tess withdrew to go afield to the cows [he]457-his father said to [her]198-tess softly -

" And [my]457-his father question , [Tessy]256-tessy ? "[457-his father]

" O no - no ! "[198-tess] replied [she]198-tess with grave hopelessness , as [one who had heard anew the turmoil of [her]198-tess own past in the allusion to [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville]2946-one who had heard anew the turmoil of her own past in the allusion to alec d'urberville . " It CAN'T be ! "[457-his father]

[She]198-tess went out towards [the mead]2947-the mead , joining [the other milkmaids]2829-the other milkmaids with a bound , as if trying to make the open air drive away [her]198-tess sad constraint . [All the girls]2949-all the girls drew onward to the spot where the cows were grazing in [the farther mead]2950-the farther mead , [the bevy]2951-the bevy advancing with the bold grace of wild animals - the reckless , unchastened motion of women accustomed to unlimited space - in which [they]2952-they abandoned [themselves]2952-they to the air as a swimmer to the wave . It seemed natural enough to [him]457-his father now that [Tess]198-tess was again in sight to choose [a mate]2953-a mate from unconstrained Nature , and not from the abodes of Art .

XXVIII

[Her]198-tess refusal , though unexpected , did not permanently daunt [Clare]284-clare . [His]457-his father experience of [women]1628-women was great enough for [him]457-his father to be aware that the negative often meant nothing more than the preface to the affirmative ; and it was little enough for [him]457-his father not to know that in the manner of the present negative there lay a great exception to the dallyings of coyness . That [she]198-tess had already permitted [him]457-his father to make love to [her]198-tess [he]457-his father read as an additional assurance , not fully trowing that in [the fields]498-the fields and [pastures]2956-pastures to ' sigh gratis " is by no means deemed waste ; love - making being here more often accepted inconsiderately and for its own sweet sake than in [the carking , anxious homes of [the ambitious]6718-the ambitious , where [a girl]6719-a girl 's craving for [an establishment]6720-an establishment]6717-the carking , anxious homes of the ambitious , where a girl 's craving for an establishment paralyzes [her]6719-a girl healthy thought of a passion as an end .[457-his father]

" [Tess]198-tess , why did [you]198-tess say ' no ' in such a positive way ? "[457-his father] [he]457-his father asked [her]198-tess in the course of a few days .

[She]198-tess started .

" Do n't ask [me]457-his father . [I]457-his father told [you]457-his father why - partly . [I]457-his father am not good enough - not worthy enough . "[457-his father]

" How ? Not fine lady enough ? "[457-his father]

" Yes - something like that , "[198-tess] murmured [she]198-tess . " [[Your]457-his father friends]6033-your friends would scorn [me]198-tess . "[198-tess]

" Indeed , [you]457-his father mistake [them]6033-your friends - [[my]457-his father father]6702-my father and [mother]5917-mother . As for [[my]457-his father brothers]6448-my brothers , [I]457-his father do n't care - "[457-his father] [He]457-his father clasped [his]457-his father fingers behind [her]198-tess back to keep [her]198-tess from slipping away . " Now - [you]198-tess did not mean it , sweet ? - [I]457-his father am sure [you]198-tess did not ! [You]198-tess have made [me]457-his father so restless that [I]457-his father can not read , or play , or do anything . [I]457-his father am in no hurry , [Tess]198-tess , but [I]457-his father want to know - to hear from [your]198-tess own warm lips - that [you]198-tess will some day be [mine]457-his father - any time [you]198-tess may choose ; but some day ? "[457-his father]

[She]198-tess could only shake [her]198-tess head and look away from [him]457-his father .

[Clare]284-clare regarded [her]198-tess attentively , conned the characters of [her]198-tess face as if they had been hieroglyphics . The denial seemed real .

" Then [I]284-clare ought not to hold [you]198-tess in this way - ought [I]284-clare ? [I]284-clare have no right to [you]198-tess - no right to seek out where [you]198-tess are , or walk with [you]198-tess ! Honestly , [Tess]198-tess , do [you]198-tess love [any other man]6725-any other man ? "[284-clare]

" How can [you]457-his father ask ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , with continued self - suppression .

" [I]284-clare almost know that [you]457-his father do not . But then , why do [you]457-his father repulse [me]284-clare ? "[284-clare]

" [I]284-clare do n't repulse [you]457-his father . [I]284-clare like [you]457-his father to - tell [me]284-clare [you]457-his father love [me]284-clare ; and [you]457-his father may always tell [me]284-clare so as [you]457-his father go about with [me]284-clare - and never offend [me]284-clare . "[284-clare]

" But [you]457-his father will not accept [me]284-clare as [a husband]2558-a husband ? "[284-clare]

" Ah - that 's different - it is for [your]457-his father good , indeed , [[my]284-clare dearest]6727-my dearest ! O , believe [me]284-clare , it is only for [your]457-his father sake ! [I]284-clare do n't like to give [myself]284-clare the great happiness o ' promising to be [yours]457-his father in that way - because - because [I]284-clare am SURE [I]284-clare ought not to do it . "[284-clare]

" But [you]457-his father will make [me]284-clare happy ! "[284-clare]

" Ah - [you]457-his father think so , but [you]457-his father do n't know ! "[284-clare]

At such times as this , apprehending the grounds of [her]2957-her refusal to be [her]2957-her modest sense of incompetence in matters social and polite , [he]2958-his would say that [she]2957-her was wonderfully well - informed and versatile - which was certainly true , [her]2957-her natural quickness and [her]2957-her admiration for [him]2958-his having led [her]2957-her to pick up [his]2958-his vocabulary , [his]2958-his accent , and fragments of [his]2958-his knowledge , to a surprising extent . After these tender contests and [her]2957-her victory [she]2957-her would go away by [herself]2957-her under the remotest cow , if at milking - time , or into the sedge or into [[her]2957-her room]2357-her room , if at a leisure interval , and mourn silently , not a minute after an apparently phlegmatic negative .

The struggle was so fearful ; [her]2957-her own heart was so strongly on the side of [his]2958-his - two ardent hearts against one poor little conscience - that [she]2957-her tried to fortify [her]2957-her resolution by every means in [her]2957-her power . [She]2957-her had come to [Talbothays]60-talbothays with a made - up mind . On no account could [she]2957-her agree to a step which might afterwards cause bitter rueing to [[her]2957-her husband]791-her husband for [his]2958-his blindness in wedding [her]2957-her . And [she]2957-her held that what [her]2957-her conscience had decided for [her]2957-her when [her]2957-her mind was unbiassed ought not to be overruled now .

" Why do n't [somebody]6000-somebody tell [him]791-her husband all about [me]2957-her ? "[2957-her] [she]2957-her said . " It was only forty miles off - why has n't it reached here ? [Somebody]6000-somebody must know ! "[2957-her]

Yet [nobody]754-nobody seemed to know ; [nobody]754-nobody told [him]791-her husband .

For two or three days no more was said . [She]2957-her guessed from the sad countenances of [[her]2957-her chamber companions]2963-her chamber companions that [they]2963-her chamber companions regarded [her]2957-her not only as [the favourite]2964-the favourite , but as [the chosen]2965-the chosen ; but [they]2963-her chamber companions could see for [themselves]2963-her chamber companions that [she]2957-her did not put [herself]2957-her in [his]791-her husband way .

[Tess]198-tess had never before known a time in which the thread of [her]2957-her life was so distinctly twisted of two strands , positive pleasure and positive pain . At the next cheese - making [the pair]795-the pair were again left alone together . [The dairyman]1900-the dairyman [himself]1900-the dairyman had been lending a hand ; but [Mr Crick]276-dairyman crick , as well as [[his]276-dairyman crick wife]819-his wife , seemed latterly to have acquired a suspicion of mutual interest between [these two]2748-these two ; though [they]795-the pair walked so circumspectly that suspicion was but of the faintest . Anyhow , [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman left [them]795-the pair to [themselves]795-the pair .

[They]795-the pair were breaking up the masses of curd before putting [them]795-the pair into the vats . The operation resembled the act of crumbling bread on a large scale ; and amid the immaculate whiteness of the curds [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess 's hands showed [themselves]2971-themselves of the pinkness of the rose . [Angel]284-clare , who was filling the vats with [his]284-clare handful , suddenly ceased , and laid [his]284-clare hands flat upon [hers]198-tess . [Her]198-tess sleeves were rolled far above the elbow , and bending lower [he]284-clare kissed the inside vein of [her]198-tess soft arm .

Although the early September weather was sultry , [her]198-tess arm , from [her]198-tess dabbling in the curds , was as cold and damp to [his]284-clare mouth as a new - gathered mushroom , and tasted of the whey . But [she]198-tess was such a sheaf of susceptibilities that [her]198-tess pulse was accelerated by the touch , [her]198-tess blood driven to [her]198-tess finder - ends , and the cool arms flushed hot . Then , as though [her]198-tess heart had said , " Is coyness longer necessary ? Truth is truth between [man]970-man and [woman]744-woman , as between [man]970-man and [man]970-man , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess lifted [her]198-tess eyes and they beamed devotedly into [his]284-clare , as [her]198-tess lip rose in a tender half - smile .

" Do [you]198-tess know why [I]284-clare did that , [Tess]198-tess ? "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said .

" Because [you]198-tess love [me]198-tess very much ! "[198-tess]

" Yes , and as a preliminary to a new entreaty . "[198-tess]

" Not AGAIN ! "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess looked a sudden fear that [her]198-tess resistance might break down under [her]198-tess own desire .

" O , [Tessy]256-tessy ! "[284-clare] [he]284-clare went on , " [I]284-clare CANNOT think why [you]256-tessy are so tantalizing . Why do [you]256-tessy disappoint [me]284-clare so ? [You]256-tessy seem almost like a coquette , upon [my]284-clare life [you]256-tessy do - a coquette of the first urban water ! [They]6734-they blow hot and blow cold , just as [you]256-tessy do , and it is the very last sort of thing to expect to find in [a retreat like [Talbothays]60-talbothays]6735-a retreat like talbothays . ... And yet , [dearest]6681-dearest , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare quickly added , observing now the remark had cut [her]198-tess , " [I]284-clare know [you]256-tessy to be the most honest , spotless creature that ever lived . So how can [I]284-clare suppose [you]256-tessy [a flirt]6737-a flirt ? [Tess]198-tess , why do n't [you]256-tessy like the idea of being [[my]284-clare wife]5895-my wife , if [you]256-tessy love [me]284-clare as [you]256-tessy seem to do ? "[284-clare]

" [I]284-clare have never said [I]284-clare do n't like the idea , and [I]284-clare never could say it ; because - it is n't true ! "[284-clare]

The stress now getting beyond endurance , [her]198-tess lip quivered , and [she]198-tess was obliged to go away . [Clare]284-clare was so pained and perplexed that [he]284-clare ran after and caught [her]198-tess in [the passage]2972-the passage .

" Tell [me]284-clare , tell [me]284-clare ! "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said , passionately clasping [her]198-tess , in forgetfulness of [his]284-clare curdy hands : " do tell [me]284-clare that [you]198-tess wo n't belong to [anybody]6181-anybody but [me]284-clare ! "[284-clare]

" [I]198-tess will , [I]198-tess will tell [you]284-clare ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess exclaimed . " And [I]198-tess will give [you]284-clare a complete answer , if [you]284-clare will let [me]198-tess go now . [I]198-tess will tell [you]284-clare [my]198-tess experiences - all about [myself]198-tess - all ! "[198-tess]

" [Your]198-tess experiences , [dear]6259-dear ; yes , certainly ; any number . "[284-clare] [He]284-clare expressed assent in loving satire , looking into [her]198-tess face . " [[My]284-clare [Tess]198-tess]6741-my tess , no doubt , almost as many experiences as that wild convolvulus out there on the garden hedge , that opened itself this morning for the first time . Tell [me]284-clare anything , but do n't use that wretched expression any more about not being worthy of [me]284-clare . "[284-clare]

" [I]284-clare will try - not ! And [I]284-clare 'll give [you]198-tess [my]284-clare reasons to - morrow - next week . "[284-clare]

" Say on Sunday ? "[284-clare]

" Yes , on Sunday . "[284-clare]

At last [she]198-tess got away , and did not stop in [her]198-tess retreat till [she]198-tess was in the thicket of pollard willows at [the lower side of [the barton]2387-the barton]2973-the lower side of the barton , where [she]198-tess could be quite unseen . Here [Tess]198-tess flung [herself]198-tess down upon [the rustling undergrowth of spear - grass]2975-the rustling undergrowth of spear - grass , as upon a bed , and remained crouching in palpitating misery broken by momentary shoots of joy , which [her]198-tess fears about the ending could not altogether suppress .

In reality , [she]198-tess was drifting into acquiescence . Every see - saw of [her]198-tess breath , every wave of [her]198-tess blood , every pulse singing in [her]198-tess ears , was a voice that joined with nature in revolt against [her]198-tess scrupulousness . Reckless , inconsiderate acceptance of [him]2976-him ; to close with [him]2976-him at the altar , revealing nothing , and chancing discovery ; to snatch ripe pleasure before the iron teeth of pain could have time to shut upon [her]198-tess : that was what love counselled ; and in almost a terror of ecstasy [Tess]198-tess divined that , despite [her]198-tess many months of lonely self - chastisement , wrestlings , communings , schemes to lead a future of austere isolation , love 's counsel would prevail .

The afternoon advanced , and still [she]198-tess remained among the willows . [She]198-tess heard the rattle of taking down the pails from the forked stands ; the " waow - waow ! "[198-tess] which accompanied the getting together of the cows . But [she]198-tess did not go to the milking . [They]2977-they would see [her]198-tess agitation ; and [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman , thinking the cause to be love alone , would good - naturedly tease [her]198-tess ; and that harassment could not be borne .

[[Her]198-tess lover]2598-her lover must have guessed [her]198-tess overwrought state , and invented some excuse for [her]198-tess non - appearance , for no inquiries were made or calls given . At half - past six the sun settled down upon the levels with the aspect of a great forge in the heavens ; and presently a monstrous pumpkin - like moon arose on the other hand . The pollard willows , tortured out of their natural shape by incessant choppings , became spiny - haired monsters as [they]2980-they stood up against it . [She]198-tess went in and [upstairs]762-upstairs without a light .

It was now Wednesday . Thursday came , and [Angel]284-clare looked thoughtfully at [her]198-tess from a distance , but intruded in no way upon [her]198-tess . [The indoor milkmaids]2982-the indoor milkmaids , [Marian]310-marian and [the rest]6118-the rest , seemed to guess that something definite was afoot , for [they]2982-the indoor milkmaids did not force any remarks upon [her]198-tess in the bedchamber . [Friday]354-friday passed ; Saturday . To - morrow was the day .

" [I]198-tess shall give way - [I]198-tess shall say yes - [I]198-tess shall let [myself]198-tess marry [him]284-clare - [I]198-tess can not help it ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess jealously panted , with [her]198-tess hot face to the pillow that night , on hearing one of [the other girls]2428-the other girls sigh [his]284-clare name in [her]198-tess sleep . " [I]2428-the other girls ca n't bear to let [anybody]6181-anybody have [him]284-clare but [me]2428-the other girls ! Yet it is a wrong to [him]284-clare , and may kill [him]284-clare when [he]284-clare knows ! O [my]2428-the other girls heart - O - O - O ! "[2428-the other girls]

XXIX

" Now , who mid [ye]283-mrs crick think [I]276-dairyman crick 've heard news o ' this morning ? "[276-dairyman crick] said [Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick , as [he]276-dairyman crick sat down to breakfast next day , with a riddling gaze round upon [the munching men]2985-the munching men and [maids]2046-maids . " Now , just who mid [ye]283-mrs crick think ? "[276-dairyman crick]

[One]6172-one guessed , and another guessed . [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick did not guess , because [she]283-mrs crick knew already .

" Well , "[1900-the dairyman] said [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman , " ' tis [that slack - twisted ' hore's - bird of [a feller]6744-a feller]6743-that slack - twisted ' hore's - bird of a feller , [Jack Dollop]316-jack . [He]316-jack 's lately got married to [a widow - woman]6745-a widow - woman . "[1900-the dairyman]

" Not [Jack Dollop]316-jack ? [A villain]6746-a villain - to think o ' that ! "[2989-a milker] said [a milker]2989-a milker .

The name entered quickly into [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess 's consciousness , for it was the name of [the lover who had wronged [[his]2990-the lover who had wronged his sweetheart , and had afterwards been so roughly used by the young woman 's mother in the butter - churn sweetheart]2853-his sweetheart , and had afterwards been so roughly used by [[the young woman]6194-the young woman 's mother]6542-the young woman 's mother in the butter - churn]2990-the lover who had wronged his sweetheart , and had afterwards been so roughly used by the young woman 's mother in the butter - churn .

" And had [he]316-jack married [[the valiant matron]6747-the valiant matron 's daughter]6748-the valiant matron 's daughter , as [he]316-jack promised ? "[284-clare] asked [Angel Clare]284-clare absently , as [he]284-clare turned over the newspaper [he]284-clare was reading at the little table to which [he]284-clare was always banished by [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick , in [her]283-mrs crick sense of [his]284-clare gentility .

" Not [he]316-jack , [sir]5821-sir . Never meant to , "[1900-the dairyman] replied [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman . " As [I]1900-the dairyman say , ' tis [a widow - woman]6745-a widow - woman , and [she]6745-a widow - woman had money , it seems - fifty poun ' a year or so ; and that was all [he]316-jack was after . [They]6751-they were married in a great hurry ; and then [she]6745-a widow - woman told [him]316-jack that by marrying [she]6745-a widow - woman had lost [her]6745-a widow - woman fifty poun ' a year . " Well , [the silly body]6754-the silly body should have told [en]316-jack sooner that the ghost of [[her]6745-a widow - woman first man]6755-her first man would trouble [him]316-jack , "[283-mrs crick] said [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick .

" Ay , ay , "[1900-the dairyman] responded [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman indecisively . " Still , [you]6756-you can see exactly how ' twas . "[1900-the dairyman]

" [She]6745-a widow - woman ought to [ha]6759-ha ' told [him]316-jack just before [they]6760-they went to [church]813-church , when [he]316-jack could hardly have backed out , "[310-marian] exclaimed [Marian]310-marian .

" And what do [you]198-tess say , [[my]2998-the dairyman of tess dear]6039-my dear ? "[2998-the dairyman of tess] asked [the dairyman of [Tess]198-tess]2998-the dairyman of tess .

" Be cust if [I]321-beck knibbs 'd have done either o't , "[321-beck knibbs] said [Beck Knibbs]321-beck knibbs , [a married helper from one of [the cottages]2401-the cottages]2999-a married helper from one of the cottages . " All 's fair in love and war . [Any woman]6315-any woman could do it . "[321-beck knibbs]

The laughter which followed this sally was supplemented only by a sorry smile , for form 's sake , from [Tess]198-tess . What was comedy to [them]3001-them was tragedy to [her]198-tess ; and [she]198-tess could hardly bear [their]3001-them mirth . [She]198-tess soon rose from table , and , with an impression that [Clare]284-clare would soon follow [her]198-tess , went along a little wriggling path , now stepping to one side of the irrigating channels , and now to the other , till [she]198-tess stood by [the main stream of [the Var]63-var]3002-the main stream of the var . [Men]5841-men had been cutting the water - weeds higher up [the river]1998-the river , and [masses of [them]3006-them]3005-masses of them were floating past [her]198-tess - moving islands of green crow - foot , whereon [she]198-tess might almost have ridden ; long locks of which weed had lodged against the piles driven to keep the cows from crossing .

Yes , there was the pain of it . This question of [a woman]1028-a woman telling [her]1028-a woman story - the heaviest of crosses to [herself]1028-a woman - seemed but amusement to [others]1383-others . It was as if [people]5930-people should laugh at martyrdom .

" [Tessy]256-tessy ! "[284-clare] came from behind [her]198-tess , and [Clare]284-clare sprang across [the gully]3010-the gully , alighting beside [her]198-tess feet . " [[My]284-clare wife]5895-my wife - soon ! "[284-clare]

" No , no ; [I]284-clare can not . For [your]284-clare sake , [O Mr Clare]284-clare ; for [your]284-clare sake , [I]284-clare say no ! "[284-clare]

" [Tess]198-tess ! "[284-clare]

" Still [I]198-tess say no ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess repeated .

Not expecting this , [he]284-clare had put [his]284-clare arm lightly round [her]198-tess waist the moment after speaking , beneath [her]198-tess hanging tail of hair . [The younger dairymaids]3011-the younger dairymaids , including [Tess]198-tess , breakfasted with [their]3011-the younger dairymaids hair loose on Sunday mornings before building it up extra high for attending [church]813-church , a style [they]3011-the younger dairymaids could not adopt when milking with [their]3011-the younger dairymaids heads against the cows . If [she]198-tess had said " Yes "[198-tess] instead of " No "[198-tess] [he]284-clare would have kissed [her]198-tess ; it had evidently been [his]284-clare intention ; but [her]198-tess determined negative deterred [his]284-clare scrupulous heart . [Their]3013-their condition of domiciliary comradeship put [her]198-tess , as [the woman]674-the woman , to such disadvantage by its enforced intercourse , that [he]284-clare felt it unfair to [her]198-tess to exercise any pressure of blandishment which [he]284-clare might have honestly employed had [she]198-tess been better able to avoid [him]284-clare . [He]284-clare released [her]198-tess momentarily - imprisoned waist , and withheld the kiss .

It all turned on that release . What had given [her]198-tess strength to refuse [him]284-clare this time was solely the tale of [the widow]3015-the widow told by [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman ; and that would have been overcome in another moment . But [Angel]284-clare said no more ; [his]284-clare face was perplexed ; [he]284-clare went away .

Day after day [they]3013-their met - somewhat less constantly than before ; and thus two or three weeks went by . The end of [September]355-september drew near , and [she]198-tess could see in [his]284-clare eye that [he]284-clare might ask [her]198-tess again .

[His]284-clare plan of procedure was different now - as though [he]284-clare had made up [his]284-clare mind that [her]198-tess negatives were , after all , only coyness and youth startled by the novelty of the proposal . The fitful evasiveness of [her]198-tess manner when [the subject]3017-the subject was under discussion countenanced the idea . So [he]284-clare played a more coaxing game ; and while never going beyond words , or attempting the renewal of caresses , [he]284-clare did [his]284-clare utmost orally .

In this way [Clare]284-clare persistently wooed [her]198-tess in undertones like that of the purling milk - at the cow 's side , at skimmings , at butter - makings , at cheese - makings , among broody poultry , and among farrowing pigs - as [no milkmaid]3018-no milkmaid was ever wooed before by [such a man]3019-such a man .

[Tess]198-tess knew that [she]198-tess must break down . Neither a religious sense of a certain moral validity in the previous union nor a conscientious wish for candour could hold out against it much longer . [She]198-tess loved [him]284-clare so passionately , and [he]284-clare was so godlike in [her]198-tess eyes ; and being , though untrained , instinctively refined , [her]198-tess nature cried for [his]284-clare tutelary guidance . And thus , though [Tess]198-tess kept repeating to [herself]198-tess , " [I]198-tess can never be [[his]284-clare wife]819-his wife , "[198-tess] the words were vain . A proof of [her]198-tess weakness lay in the very utterance of what calm strength would not have taken the trouble to formulate . Every sound of [his]284-clare voice beginning on the old subject stirred [her]198-tess with a terrifying bliss , and [she]198-tess coveted the recantation [she]198-tess feared .

[His]284-clare manner was - what [man]970-man 's is not ? - so much that of one who would love and cherish and defend [her]198-tess under any conditions , changes , charges , or revelations , that [her]198-tess gloom lessened as [she]198-tess basked in it . The season meanwhile was drawing onward to the equinox , and though it was still fine , the days were much shorter . The dairy had again worked by morning candlelight for a long time ; and a fresh renewal of [Clare]284-clare 's pleading occurred one morning between three and four .

[She]198-tess had run up in [her]198-tess bedgown to [his]284-clare door to call [him]284-clare as usual ; then had gone back to dress and call [the others]2258-the others ; and in ten minutes was walking to the head of the stairs with the candle in [her]198-tess hand . At the same moment [he]284-clare came down [his]284-clare steps from above in [his]284-clare shirt - sleeves and put [his]284-clare arm across [the stairway]3022-the stairway .

" Now , [Miss Flirt]356-miss flirt , before [you]356-miss flirt go down , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said peremptorily . " It is a fortnight since [I]284-clare spoke , and this wo n't do any longer . [You]356-miss flirt MUST tell [me]284-clare what [you]356-miss flirt mean , or [I]284-clare shall have to leave [this house]6327-this house . [My]284-clare door was ajar just now , and [I]284-clare saw [you]356-miss flirt . For [your]356-miss flirt own safety [I]284-clare must go . [You]356-miss flirt do n't know . Well ? Is it to be yes at last ? "[284-clare]

" [I]3023-her am only just up , [Mr Clare]284-clare , and it is too early to take [me]3023-her to task ! "[3023-her] [she]3023-her pouted . " [You]3024-you need not call [me]3023-her [Flirt]356-miss flirt . ' Tis cruel and untrue . Wait till by and by . Please wait till by and by ! [I]3023-her will really think seriously about it between now and then . Let [me]3023-her go [downstairs]1128-downstairs ! "[3023-her]

" Call [me]3023-her [Angel]284-clare , then , and not [Mr Clare]284-clare . "[3023-her]

" [Angel]284-clare . "[3024-you]

" [Angel]284-clare dearest - why not ? "[3023-her]

" ' Twould mean that [I]3024-you agree , would n't it ? "[3024-you]

" It would only mean that [you]3024-you love [me]3023-her , even if [you]3024-you can not marry [me]3023-her ; and [you]3024-you were so good as to own that long ago . "[3023-her]

" Very well , then , ' [Angel dearest]6770-angel dearest ' , if [I]3023-her MUST , "[3023-her] [she]3023-her murmured , looking at [her]3023-her candle , a roguish curl coming upon [her]3023-her mouth , notwithstanding [her]3023-her suspense .

[Clare]284-clare had resolved never to kiss [her]3023-her until [he]284-clare had obtained [her]3023-her promise ; but somehow , as [Tess]198-tess stood there in [her]198-tess prettily tucked - up milking gown , [her]198-tess hair carelessly heaped upon [her]198-tess head till there should be leisure to arrange it when skimming and milking were done , [he]284-clare broke [his]284-clare resolve , and brought [his]284-clare lips to [her]3023-her cheek for one moment . [She]198-tess passed [downstairs]1128-downstairs very quickly , never looking back at [him]284-clare or saying another word . [The other maids]2257-the other maids were already down , and the subject was not pursued . Except [Marian]310-marian , [they]2257-the other maids all looked wistfully and suspiciously at [the pair]795-the pair , in the sad yellow rays which the morning candles emitted in contrast with the first cold signals of the dawn without .

When skimming was done - which , as the milk diminished with the approach of autumn , was a lessening process day by day - [Retty]311-retty and [the rest]6118-the rest went out . [The lovers]3029-the lovers followed [them]795-the pair .

" [Our]3029-the lovers tremulous lives are so different from [theirs]795-the pair , are [they]795-the pair not ? "[284-clare] [he]284-clare musingly observed to [her]3023-her , as [he]284-clare regarded the three figures tripping before [him]284-clare through the frigid pallor of opening day .

" Not so very different , [I]3023-her think , "[3023-her] [she]3023-her said .

" Why do [you]284-clare think that ? "[284-clare]

" There are [very few women]6771-very few women 's lives that are not - tremulous , "[198-tess] [Tess]198-tess replied , pausing over the new word as if it impressed [her]3023-her . " There 's more in those three than [you]284-clare think . "[198-tess]

" What is in [them]795-the pair ? "[198-tess]

" Almost either of ['em]6772-'em , "[3023-her] [she]3023-her began , " would make - perhaps would make - [a properer wife than [I.]3023-her]6773-a properer wife than i. And perhaps [they]3031-they love [you]284-clare as well as [I]3023-her - almost . "[3023-her]

" O , [Tessy]256-tessy ! "[198-tess]

There were signs that it was an exquisite relief to [her]3023-her to hear the impatient exclamation , though [she]3023-her had resolved so intrepidly to let [generosity]3030-generosity make one bid against [herself]3023-her . That was now done , and [she]3023-her had not the power to attempt self - immolation a second time then . [They]3031-they were joined by a milker from [one of [the cottages]2401-the cottages]3032-one of the cottages , and no more was said on that which concerned [them]3031-they so deeply . But [Tess]198-tess knew that this day would decide it .

In the afternoon [several of [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's household and [assistants]3036-assistants]3034-several of the dairyman 's household and assistants went down to [the meads]2026-the meads as usual , a long way from [the dairy]1952-the dairy , where many of the cows were milked without being driven [home]5850-home . The supply was getting less as the animals advanced in calf , and [the supernumerary milkers of the lush green season]3040-the supernumerary milkers of the lush green season had been dismissed .

The work progressed leisurely . Each pailful was poured into tall cans that stood in a large spring - waggon which had been brought upon the scene ; and when [they]3031-they were milked , the cows trailed away . [Dairyman Crick]276-dairyman crick , who was there with the rest , [his]276-dairyman crick wrapper gleaming miraculously white against a leaden evening sky , suddenly looked at [his]276-dairyman crick heavy watch .

" Why , ' tis later than [I]276-dairyman crick thought , "[276-dairyman crick] [he]276-dairyman crick said . " Begad ! [We]3031-they sha n't be soon enough with this milk at [the station]6774-the station , if [we]3031-they do n't mind . There 's no time to - day to take it [home]5850-home and mix it with the bulk afore sending off . It must go to [station]6776-station straight from here . Who 'll drive [it]6777-it across ? "[276-dairyman crick]

[Mr Clare]284-clare volunteered to do so , though it was none of [his]284-clare business , asking [Tess]198-tess to accompany [him]284-clare . The evening , though sunless , had been warm and muggy for the season , and [Tess]198-tess had come out with [her]198-tess milking - hood only , naked - armed and jacketless ; certainly not dressed for a drive . [She]198-tess therefore replied by glancing over [her]198-tess scant habiliments ; but [Clare]284-clare gently urged [her]198-tess . [She]198-tess assented by relinquishing [her]198-tess pail and stool to [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman to take [home]5850-home , and mounted the spring - waggon beside [Clare]284-clare .

XXX

In the diminishing daylight [they]3043-they went along the level roadway through [the meads]2026-the meads , which stretched away into gray miles , and were backed in the extreme edge of distance by [the swarthy and abrupt slopes of [Egdon Heath]93-egdon heath]3045-the swarthy and abrupt slopes of egdon heath . On [its]2026-the meads summit stood clumps and stretches of fir - trees , whose notched tips appeared like battlemented towers crowning black - fronted castles of enchantment .

[They]3043-they were so absorbed in the sense of being close to [each other]577-each other that [they]3043-they did not begin talking for a long while , the silence being broken only by the clucking of the milk in the tall cans behind [them]3043-they . [The lane]631-the lane [they]3043-they followed was so solitary that the hazel nuts had remained on the boughs till they slipped from their shells , and the blackberries hung in heavy clusters . Every now and then [Angel]284-clare would fling the lash of [his]284-clare whip round one of these , pluck it off , and give it to [[his]284-clare companion]2372-his companion .

The dull sky soon began to tell its meaning by sending down herald - drops of rain , and the stagnant air of the day changed into a fitful breeze which played about [their]3043-they faces . The quick - silvery glaze on [the rivers and pools]3049-the rivers and pools vanished ; from broad mirrors of light they changed to lustreless sheets of lead , with a surface like a rasp . But that spectacle did not affect [her]2372-his companion preoccupation . [Her]2372-his companion countenance , a natural carnation slightly embrowned by the season , had deepened its tinge with the beating of the rain - drops ; and [her]2372-his companion hair , which the pressure of the cows ' flanks had , as usual , caused to tumble down from its fastenings and stray beyond the curtain of [her]2372-his companion calico bonnet , was made clammy by the moisture , till it hardly was better than seaweed .

" [I]2372-his companion ought not to have come , [I]2372-his companion suppose , "[2372-his companion] [she]2372-his companion murmured , looking at the sky .

" [I]284-clare am sorry for the rain , "[284-clare] said [he]284-clare . " But how glad [I]2372-his companion am to have [you]2372-his companion [here]5975-here ! "[2372-his companion]

[Remote Egdon]357-remote egdon disappeared by degree behind the liquid gauze . The evening grew darker , and [the roads]928-the roads being crossed by [gates]3051-gates , it was not safe to drive faster than at a walking pace . The air was rather chill .

" [I]284-clare am so afraid [you]2372-his companion will get cold , with nothing upon [your]2372-his companion arms and shoulders , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said . " Creep close to [me]284-clare , and perhaps the drizzle wo n't hurt [you]2372-his companion much . [I]284-clare should be sorrier still if [I]284-clare did not think that the rain might be helping [me]284-clare . "[284-clare]

[She]2372-his companion imperceptibly crept closer , and [he]284-clare wrapped round [them]3052-they both a large piece of sail - cloth , which was sometimes used to keep the sun off the milk - cans . [Tess]198-tess held it from slipping off [him]284-clare as well as [herself]198-tess , [Clare]284-clare 's hands being occupied .

" Now [we]3052-they are all right again . Ah - no [we]3052-they are not ! It runs down into [my]284-clare neck a little , and it must still more into [yours]2372-his companion . That 's better . [Your]2372-his companion arms are like wet marble , [Tess]198-tess . Wipe them in the cloth . Now , if [you]2372-his companion stay quiet , [you]2372-his companion will not get another drop . Well , [dear]6259-dear - about that question of mine - that long - standing question ? "[284-clare]

The only reply that [he]284-clare could hear for a little while was the smack of the horse 's hoofs on [the moistening road]3053-the moistening road , and the cluck of the milk in the cans behind [them]3052-they .

" Do [you]284-clare remember what [you]284-clare said ? "[284-clare]

" [I]198-tess do , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess replied .

" Before [we]3052-they get [home]5850-home , mind . "[284-clare]

" [I]284-clare 'll try . "[284-clare]

[He]284-clare said no more then . As [they]3052-they drove on , the fragment of [an old manor house of Caroline date]3054-an old manor house of caroline date rose against the sky , and was in due course passed and left behind .

" That , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare observed , to entertain [her]198-tess , " is [an interesting old place]6781-an interesting old place - one of the several seats which belonged to [an ancient Norman family formerly of great influence in [this county]5863-this county]6782-an ancient norman family formerly of great influence in this county , [the d'Urbervilles]1240-the d'urbervilles . [I]284-clare never pass [one of [[their]6782-an ancient norman family formerly of great influence in this county residences]6786-their residences]6785-one of their residences without thinking of [them]6782-an ancient norman family formerly of great influence in this county . There is something very sad in the extinction of [a family of renown]6787-a family of renown , even if it was fierce , domineering , feudal renown . "[284-clare]

" Yes , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess .

[They]3052-they crept along towards a point in [the expanse of shade just at hand]3055-the expanse of shade just at hand at which a feeble light was beginning to assert its presence , a spot where , by day , a fitful white streak of steam at intervals upon the dark green background denoted intermittent moments of contact between [their]3052-they secluded world and modern life . Modern life stretched out its steam feeler to this point three or four times a day , touched the native existences , and quickly withdrew its feeler again , as if what it touched had been uncongenial .

[They]3052-they reached the feeble light , which came from the smoky lamp of [a little railway station]3056-a little railway station ; a poor enough terrestrial star , yet in one sense of more importance to [Talbothays Dairy]73-talbothays dairy and [mankind]1581-mankind than the celestial ones to which [it]3058-it stood in such humiliating contrast . The cans of new milk were unladen in the rain , [Tess]198-tess getting a little shelter from [a neighbouring holly tree]3059-a neighbouring holly tree .

Then there was the hissing of [a train]3060-a train , which drew up almost silently upon the wet rails , and the milk was rapidly swung can by can into [the truck]3061-the truck . The light of the engine flashed for a second upon [Tess Durbeyfield]198-tess 's figure , motionless under the great holly tree . No object could have looked more foreign to the gleaming cranks and wheels than [this unsophisticated girl , with the round bare arms , the rainy face and hair , the suspended attitude of a friendly leopard at pause , the print gown of no date or fashion]3062-this unsophisticated girl , with the round bare arms , the rainy face and hair , the suspended attitude of a friendly leopard at pause , the print gown of no date or fashion , and the cotton bonnet drooping on [her]198-tess brow .

[She]198-tess mounted again beside [[her]198-tess lover]2598-her lover , with a mute obedience characteristic of impassioned natures at times , and when [they]3052-they had wrapped [themselves]3052-they up over head and ears in the sailcloth again , [they]3052-they plunged back into the now thick night . [Tess]198-tess was so receptive that the few minutes of contact with the whirl of material progress lingered in [her]198-tess thought .

" [Londoners]6788-londoners will drink it at [their]6788-londoners breakfasts to - morrow , wo n't [they]6788-londoners ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess asked . " [Strange people that [we]6790-we have never seen]6789-strange people that we have never seen . "[198-tess]

" Yes - [I]3065-you suppose [they]6788-londoners will . Though not as [we]6790-we send it . When its strength has been lowered , so that it may not get up into [their]6788-londoners heads . "[3065-you]
