[XXXI

Tess]360-xxxi tess wrote a most touching and urgent letter to [[her]3077-her mother]658-her mother the very next day , and by the end of the week a response to [her]3077-her communication arrived in [Joan Durbeyfield]205-joan 's wandering last - century hand .

[DEAR TESS]361-dear tess , -

[J]362-j write these few lines Hoping [they]3079-they will find [you]361-dear tess well , as [they]3079-they leave [me]0-i at Present , thank [God]222-god for it . [Dear Tess]198-tess , [we]3080-we are all glad to Hear that [you]361-dear tess are going really to be married soon . But with respect to [your]361-dear tess question , [Tess]198-tess , [J]362-j say between [ourselves]3080-we , quite private but very strong , that on no account do [you]361-dear tess say a word of [your]361-dear tess Bygone Trouble to [him]3081-him . [J]362-j did not tell everything to [[your]361-dear tess Father]5918-your father , [he]3081-him being so Proud on account of [his]3081-him Respectability , which , perhaps , [your]361-dear tess Intended is the same . [Many a woman]3083-many a woman - [some of the Highest in [the Land]95-the land]3084-some of the highest in the land - have had a Trouble in [their]3083-many a woman time ; and why should [you]361-dear tess Trumpet [yours]361-dear tess when [others]1383-others do n't Trumpet [theirs]1383-others ? [No girl]3086-no girl would be such [a Fool]6029-a fool , specially as it is so long ago , and not [your]361-dear tess Fault at all . [J]362-j shall answer the same if [you]361-dear tess ask [me]0-i fifty times . Besides , [you]361-dear tess must bear in mind that , knowing it to be [your]361-dear tess Childish Nature to tell all that 's in [your]361-dear tess heart - so simple ! - [J]362-j made [you]361-dear tess promise [me]0-i never to let it out by Word or Deed , having [your]361-dear tess Welfare in [my]0-i Mind ; and [you]361-dear tess most solemnly did promise it going from this Door . [J]362-j have not named either that Question or [your]361-dear tess coming marriage to [[your]361-dear tess Father]5918-your father , as [he]5918-your father would blab it everywhere , [poor Simple Man]363-poor simple man .

[Dear Tess]198-tess , keep up [your]361-dear tess Spirits , and [we]3089-we mean to send [you]361-dear tess a Hogshead of [Cyder]96-cyder for [you]361-dear tess Wedding , knowing there is not much in [your]361-dear tess parts , and thin Sour Stuff what there is . So no more at present , and with kind love to [[your]361-dear tess Young Man]3090-your young man . - From [your]361-dear tess affectte . [Mother]228-mother ,

[J. DURBEYFIELD]364-j. durbeyfield

" O [mother]5917-mother , [mother]5917-mother ! "[198-tess] murmured [Tess]198-tess .

[She]198-tess was recognizing how light was the touch of events the most oppressive upon [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield 's elastic spirit . [[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother did not see life as [Tess]198-tess saw it . That haunting episode of bygone days was to [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother but a passing accident . But perhaps [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother was right as to the course to be followed , whatever [she]658-her mother might be in [her]658-her mother reasons . Silence seemed , on the face of it , best for [her]658-her mother adored [one]6172-one 's happiness : silence it should be .

Thus steadied by a command from [the only person in [the world]497-the world]3095-the only person in the world who had any shadow of right to control [her]658-her mother action , [Tess]198-tess grew calmer . The responsibility was shifted , and [her]198-tess heart was lighter than it had been for weeks . The days of declining autumn which followed [her]198-tess assent , beginning with the month of October , formed a season through which [she]198-tess lived in spiritual altitudes more nearly approaching ecstasy than any other period of [her]198-tess life .

There was hardly a touch of earth in [her]198-tess love for [Clare]284-clare . To [her]198-tess sublime trustfulness [he]284-clare was all that goodness could be - knew all that [a guide]3097-a guide , [philosopher]3098-philosopher , and [friend]1225-friend should know . [She]198-tess thought every line in the contour of [his]284-clare person the perfection of masculine beauty , [his]284-clare soul the soul of [a saint]1388-a saint , [his]284-clare intellect that of [a seer]3101-a seer . The wisdom of [her]198-tess love for [him]284-clare , as love , sustained [her]198-tess dignity ; [she]198-tess seemed to be wearing a crown . The compassion of [his]284-clare love for [her]198-tess , as [she]198-tess saw it , made [her]198-tess lift up [her]198-tess heart to [him]284-clare in devotion . [He]284-clare would sometimes catch [her]198-tess large , worshipful eyes , that had no bottom to [them]3102-them looking at [him]284-clare from their depths , as if [she]198-tess saw something immortal before [her]198-tess .

[She]198-tess dismissed the past - trod upon it and put it out , as one treads on a coal that is smouldering and dangerous .

[She]198-tess had not known that [men]5841-men could be so disinterested , chivalrous , protective , in [their]5841-men love for [women]1628-women as [he]284-clare . [Angel Clare]284-clare was far from all that [she]198-tess thought [him]284-clare in this respect ; absurdly far , indeed ; but [he]284-clare was , in truth , more spiritual than animal ; [he]284-clare had [himself]284-clare well in hand , and was singularly free from grossness . Though not cold - natured , [he]284-clare was rather bright than hot - less Byronic than [Shelleyan]365-shelleyan ; could love desperately , but with a love more especially inclined to the imaginative and ethereal ; it was a fastidious emotion which could jealously guard [the loved one]3105-the loved one against [his]3105-the loved one very self . This amazed and enraptured [Tess]198-tess , whose slight experiences had been so infelicitous till now ; and in [her]198-tess reaction from indignation against [the male sex]3106-the male sex [she]198-tess swerved to excess of honour for [Clare]284-clare .

[They]3107-they unaffectedly sought [each other]577-each other 's company ; in [her]198-tess honest faith [she]198-tess did not disguise [her]198-tess desire to be with [him]284-clare . The sum of [her]198-tess instincts on this matter , if clearly stated , would have been that the elusive quality of [her]198-tess sex which attracts [men]5841-men in general might be distasteful to so perfect [a man after an avowal of love]3110-a man after an avowal of love , since it must in its very nature carry with it a suspicion of art .

The country custom of unreserved comradeship out of doors during betrothal was the only custom [she]198-tess knew , and to [her]198-tess it had no strangeness ; though it seemed oddly anticipative to [Clare]284-clare till [he]284-clare saw how normal a thing [she]198-tess , in common with [all the other dairy - folk]3111-all the other dairy - folk , regarded it . Thus , during this October month of wonderful afternoons [they]3107-they roved along [the meads]2026-the meads by creeping paths which followed the brinks of trickling tributary brooks , hopping across by little wooden bridges to [the other side]3113-the other side , and back again . [They]3107-they were never out of the sound of some purling weir , whose buzz accompanied [their]3107-they own murmuring , while the beams of the sun , almost as horizontal as the mead itself , formed a pollen of radiance over the landscape . [They]3107-they saw tiny blue fogs in the shadows of trees and hedges , all the time that there was bright sunshine elsewhere . The sun was so near the ground , and the sward so flat , that the shadows of [Clare]284-clare and [Tess]198-tess would stretch a quarter of a mile ahead of [them]3107-they , like two long fingers pointing afar to where [the green alluvial reaches]3114-the green alluvial reaches abutted against the sloping sides of [the vale]917-the vale .

[Men]5841-men were at work here and there - for it was the season for " taking up "[5841-men] [the meadows]544-the meadows , or digging [the little waterways]3118-the little waterways clear for the winter irrigation , and mending [their]5841-men banks where trodden down by the cows . The shovelfuls of loam , black as jet , brought there by [the river]1998-the river when [it]1998-the river was as wide as [the whole valley]3120-the whole valley , were an essence of soils , pounded champaigns of the past , steeped , refined , and subtilized to extraordinary richness , out of which came all the fertility of [the mead]2947-the mead , and of the cattle grazing there .

[Clare]284-clare hardily kept [his]284-clare arm round [her]3122-she waist in sight of [these watermen]3123-these watermen , with the air of [a man who was accustomed to public dalliance]3124-a man who was accustomed to public dalliance , though actually as shy as [she]3122-she [who , with lips parted and eyes askance on the labourers]3125-who , with lips parted and eyes askance on the labourers , wore the look of [a wary animal the while]3126-a wary animal the while .

" [You]284-clare are not ashamed of owning [me]3122-she as [yours]284-clare before [them]3123-these watermen ! "[3122-she] [she]3122-she said gladly .

" O no ! "[3123-these watermen]

" But if it should reach the ears of [[your]284-clare friends]6033-your friends at [Emminster]72-emminster that [you]284-clare are walking about like this with [me]3127-her , [a milkmaid]2290-a milkmaid - "[3127-her]

" [The most bewitching milkmaid]6870-the most bewitching milkmaid ever seen . "[3123-these watermen]

" [They]3123-these watermen might feel it a hurt to [their]3123-these watermen dignity . "[3127-her]

" [[My]3123-these watermen dear girl]6354-my dear girl - a d'Urberville hurt the dignity of [a Clare]6872-a clare ! It is a grand card to play - that of [your]6354-my dear girl belonging to [such a family]6873-such a family , and [I]3123-these watermen am reserving it for a grand effect when [we]6874-we are married , and have the proofs of [your]6354-my dear girl descent from [Parson Tringham]179-parson tringham . Apart from that , [my]3123-these watermen future is to be totally foreign to [[my]3123-these watermen family]5849-my family - it will not affect even the surface of [their]5849-my family lives . [We]6874-we shall leave [this part of [England]10-england]6876-this part of england - perhaps [England]10-england itself - and what does it matter how [people]5930-people regard [us]6874-we [here]5975-here ? [You]3129-you will like going , will [you]3129-you not ? "[3123-these watermen]

[She]3127-her could answer no more than a bare affirmative , so great was the emotion aroused in [her]3127-her at the thought of going through [the world]497-the world with [him]3129-you as [[his]3129-you own familiar friend]3130-his own familiar friend . [Her]3127-her feelings almost filled [her]3127-her ears like a babble of waves , and surged up to [her]3127-her eyes . [She]3127-her put [her]3127-her hand in [his]3129-you , and thus [they]3131-they went on , to a place where the reflected sun glared up from [the river]1998-the river , under [a bridge]3133-a bridge , with a molten - metallic glow that dazzled [their]3131-they eyes , though the sun itself was hidden by [the bridge]1389-the bridge . [They]3131-they stood still , whereupon little furred and feathered heads popped up from the smooth surface of the water ; but , finding that the disturbing presences had paused , and not passed by , [they]3131-they disappeared again . Upon [this river]3135-this river - brink [they]3131-they lingered till the fog began to close round [them]3131-they - which was very early in the evening at this time of the year - settling on the lashes of [her]3127-her eyes , where it rested like crystals , and on [his]3129-you brows and hair .

[They]3131-they walked later on Sundays , when it was quite dark . [Some of [the dairy - people , who were also out of doors on the first Sunday evening]3137-the dairy - people , who were also out of doors on the first sunday evening after [their]3131-they engagement]3136-some of the dairy - people , who were also out of doors on the first sunday evening after their engagement , heard [her]3127-her impulsive speeches , ecstasized to fragments , though [they]3136-some of the dairy - people , who were also out of doors on the first sunday evening after their engagement were too far off to hear the words discoursed ; noted the spasmodic catch in [her]3127-her remarks , broken into syllables by the leapings of [her]3127-her heart , as [she]3127-her walked leaning on [his]3129-you arm ; [her]3127-her contented pauses , the occasional little laugh upon which [her]3127-her soul seemed to ride - the laugh of [a woman in company with [the man [she]3127-her loves and has won from [all other women]3140-all other women]3139-the man she loves and has won from all other women]3138-a woman in company with the man she loves and has won from all other women - unlike anything else in nature . [They]3131-they marked the buoyancy of [her]3127-her tread , like the skim of a bird which has not quite alighted .

[Her]3127-her affection for [him]3129-you was now the breath and life of [Tess]198-tess 's being ; it enveloped [her]3127-her as a photosphere , irradiated [her]3127-her into forgetfulness of [her]3127-her past sorrows , keeping back the gloomy spectres that would persist in [their]3131-they attempts to touch [her]3127-her - doubt , fear , moodiness , care , shame . [She]3127-her knew that [they]3131-they were waiting like wolves just outside the circumscribing light , but [she]3127-her had long spells of power to keep [them]3131-they in hungry subjection there .

A spiritual forgetfulness co - existed with an intellectual remembrance . [She]3127-her walked in brightness , but [she]3127-her knew that in the background those shapes of darkness were always spread . They might be receding , or [they]3131-they might be approaching , one or the other , a little every day .

One evening [Tess]198-tess and [Clare]284-clare were obliged to sit [indoors keeping house]3141-indoors keeping house , [all the other occupants of the domicile]3142-all the other occupants of the domicile being away . As [they]3143-they talked [she]3127-her looked thoughtfully up at [him]3129-you , and met [his]3129-you two appreciative eyes .

" [I]3127-her am not worthy of [you]3129-you - no , [I]3127-her am not ! "[3127-her] [she]3127-her burst out , jumping up from [her]3127-her low stool as though appalled at [his]3129-you homage , and the fulness of [her]3127-her own joy thereat .

[Clare]284-clare , deeming the whole basis of [her]3127-her excitement to be that which was only the smaller part of it , said -

" [I]284-clare wo n't have [you]3127-her speak like it , [dear Tess]198-tess ! "[284-clare]

[She]3127-her struggled with the sob in [her]3127-her throat . How often had that string of excellences made [her]3127-her young heart ache in church of late years , and how strange that [he]3129-you should have cited them now .

" Why did n't [you]3129-you stay and love [me]3127-her when [I]3127-her - was sixteen ; living with [[my]3127-her little sisters]6881-my little sisters and [brothers]586-brothers , and [you]3129-you danced on [the green]561-the green ? [Angel]284-clare began to comfort and reassure [her]3127-her , thinking to [himself]284-clare , truly enough , what [a creature of moods]3144-a creature of moods [she]3127-her was , and how careful [he]284-clare would have to be of [her]3127-her when [she]3127-her depended for [her]3127-her happiness entirely on [him]284-clare .

With [the woman]674-the woman 's instinct to hide [she]3127-her diverged hastily -

" [I]3127-her should have had four years more of [your]284-clare heart than [I]3127-her can ever have now . Then [I]3127-her should not have wasted [my]3127-her time as [I]3127-her have done - [I]3127-her should have had so much longer happiness ! "[3127-her]

It was [no mature woman]3146-no mature woman with a long dark vista of intrigue behind [her]3146-no mature woman who was tormented thus , but [a girl of simple life , not yet one]3147-a girl of simple life , not yet one - and twenty , who had been caught during [her]3146-no mature woman days of immaturity like a bird in a springe . [He]3127-her sat on by the cheerful firelight thrown from a bundle of green ash - sticks laid across the dogs ; the sticks snapped pleasantly , and hissed out bubbles of sap from their ends . When [she]3127-her came back [she]3127-her was [herself]3127-her again .

"[310-marian]

[They]3169-they were not aware that , at these words , salt , stinging tears trickled down upon [Tess]198-tess 's pillow anew , and how [she]198-tess resolved , with a bursting heart , to tell all [her]198-tess history to [Angel Clare]284-clare , despite [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's command - to let [him]284-clare for whom [she]198-tess lived and breathed despise [her]198-tess if [he]284-clare would , and [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother regard [her]198-tess as [a fool]6029-a fool , rather then preserve a silence which might be deemed a treachery to [him]284-clare , and which somehow seemed a wrong to these .

XXXII

This penitential mood kept [her]198-tess from naming the wedding - day . The beginning of November found its date still in abeyance , though [he]284-clare asked [her]198-tess at the most tempting times . But [Tess]198-tess 's desire seemed to be for a perpetual betrothal in which everything should remain as it was then .

The meads were changing now ; but it was still warm enough in early afternoons before milking to idle there awhile , and the state of dairy - work at this time of year allowed a spare hour for idling . Looking over the damp sod in the direction of the sun , a glistening ripple of gossamer webs was visible to [their]3169-they eyes under the luminary , like the track of moonlight on [the sea]3173-the sea . Gnats , knowing nothing of [their]3169-they brief glorification , wandered across the shimmer of [this pathway]3174-this pathway , irradiated as if [they]3169-they bore fire within [them]3169-they , then passed out of its line , and were quite extinct . In the presence of these things [he]284-clare would remind [her]198-tess that the date was still the question .

Or [he]284-clare would ask [her]198-tess at night , when [he]284-clare accompanied [her]198-tess on some mission invented by [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick to give [him]284-clare the opportunity . This was mostly a journey to [the farmhouse on [the slopes above [the vale]917-the vale]3176-the slopes above the vale]3175-the farmhouse on the slopes above the vale , to inquire how the advanced cows were getting on in the straw - barton to which [they]3178-they were relegated . For it was a time of the year that brought great changes to [the world of kine]3179-the world of kine . Batches of the animals were sent away daily to [this lying - in hospital]3180-this lying - in hospital , where [they]3178-they lived on straw till [their]3178-they calves were born , after which event , and as soon as the calf could walk , [mother]5917-mother and [offspring]3182-offspring were driven back to [the dairy]1952-the dairy . In the interval which elapsed before the calves were sold there was , of course , little milking to be done , but as soon as the calf had been taken away [the milkmaids]2098-the milkmaids would have to set to work as usual .

Returning from one of these dark walks [they]3178-they reached [a great gravel - cliff]3185-a great gravel - cliff immediately over [the levels]3186-the levels , where [they]3178-they stood still and listened . The water was now high in [the streams]3187-the streams , squirting through the weirs , and tinkling under culverts ; the smallest gullies were all full ; there was no taking short cuts anywhere , and [foot - passengers]3188-foot - passengers were compelled to follow the permanent ways . From [the whole extent of [the invisible vale]3190-the invisible vale]3189-the whole extent of the invisible vale came a multitudinous intonation ; it forced upon [their]3178-they fancy that [a great city]3191-a great city lay below [them]3178-they , and that the murmur was the vociferation of [[its]3191-a great city populace]3192-its populace .

" [It]6913-it seems like tens of thousands of [them]3178-they , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess ; " holding public - meetings in [[their]3178-they market - places]6914-their market - places , arguing , preaching , quarrelling , sobbing , groaning , praying , and cursing . "[198-tess]

[Clare]284-clare was not particularly heeding .

" Did [Crick]283-mrs crick speak to [you]284-clare to - day , [dear]6259-dear , about [his]6916-he not wanting much assistance during the winter months ? "[3193-i]

" No . "[3193-i]

" The cows are going dry rapidly . "[3193-i]

" Yes . Six or seven went to [the straw - barton]6917-the straw - barton yesterday , and three the day before , making nearly twenty in the straw already . Ah - is it that [the farmer]1947-the farmer do n't want [my]3193-i help for the calving ? O , [I]3193-i am not wanted [here]5975-here any more ! And [I]3193-i have tried so hard to - "[3193-i]

" [Crick]283-mrs crick did n't exactly say that [he]6916-he would no longer require [you]284-clare . But , knowing what [our]6920-our relations were , [he]6916-he said in the most good - natured and respectful manner possible that [he]6916-he supposed on [my]3193-i leaving at Christmas [I]3193-i should take [you]284-clare with [me]3193-i , and on [my]3193-i asking what [he]6916-he would do without [you]284-clare [he]6916-he merely observed that , as a matter of fact , it was a time of year when [he]6916-he could do with a very little female help . [I]3193-i am afraid [I]3193-i was sinner enough to feel rather glad that [he]6916-he was in this way forcing [your]284-clare hand . "[3193-i]

" [I]3193-i do n't think [you]284-clare ought to have felt glad , [Angel]284-clare . Because ' tis always mournful not to be wanted , even if at the same time ' tis convenient . "[3193-i]

" Well , it is convenient - [you]284-clare have admitted that . "[3193-i] [He]3193-i put [his]3193-i finger upon [her]3194-you cheek . " Ah ! "[3193-i] [he]3193-i said .

" What ? "[3193-i]

" [I]3193-i feel the red rising up at [her]3194-you having been caught ! But why should [I]3193-i trifle so ! [We]6921-we will not trifle - life is too serious . "[3193-i]

" It is . Perhaps [I]3193-i saw that before [you]3193-i did . "[3193-i]

[She]3194-you was seeing it then . To decline to marry [him]3193-i after all - in obedience to [her]3194-you emotion of last night - and leave [the dairy]1952-the dairy , meant to go to [some strange place]3196-some strange place , not [a dairy]3197-a dairy ; for [milkmaids]3198-milkmaids were not in request now calving - time was coming on ; to go to [some arable farm]3199-some arable farm where no divine being like [Angel Clare]284-clare was . [She]3194-you hated the thought , and [she]3194-you hated more the thought of going [home]5850-home .

" So that , seriously , dearest [Tess]198-tess , "[3193-i] [he]3193-i continued , ' since [you]3194-you will probably have to leave at Christmas , it is in every way desirable and convenient that [I]0-i should carry [you]3194-you off then as [[my]0-i property]3201-my property . Besides , if [you]3194-you were not [the most uncalculating girl in [the world]497-the world]3202-the most uncalculating girl in the world [you]3194-you would know that [we]3204-we could not go on like this for ever . "[3194-you]

" [I]3202-the most uncalculating girl in the world wish [we]3204-we could . That it would always be summer and autumn , and [you]3194-you always courting [me]3202-the most uncalculating girl in the world , and always thinking as much of [me]3202-the most uncalculating girl in the world as [you]3194-you have done through the past summer - time ! "[3202-the most uncalculating girl in the world]

" [I]3194-you always shall . "[3194-you]

" O , [I]3194-you know [you]3205-you will ! "[3194-you] [she]3194-you cried , with a sudden fervour of faith in [him]3205-you . " [Angel]284-clare , [I]3194-you will fix the day when [I]3194-you will become [yours]3194-you for always ! "[3194-you]

Thus at last it was arranged between [them]3204-we , during that dark walk [home]5850-home , amid the myriads of liquid voices on the right and left .

When [they]3204-we reached [the dairy]1952-the dairy [Mr]3208-mr and [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick were promptly told - with injunctions of secrecy ; for each of [the lovers]3029-the lovers was desirous that the marriage should be kept as private as possible . [The dairyman]1900-the dairyman , though [he]1900-the dairyman had thought of dismissing [her]3194-you soon , now made a great concern about losing [her]3194-you . What should [he]1900-the dairyman do about [his]1900-the dairyman skimming ? Who would make the ornamental butter - pats for [the Anglebury and Sandbourne ladies]3211-the anglebury and sandbourne ladies ? [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick congratulated [Tess]198-tess on the shilly - shallying having at last come to an end , and said that directly [she]283-mrs crick set eyes on [Tess]198-tess [she]283-mrs crick divined that [she]198-tess was to be the chosen one of somebody who was [no common outdoor man]3212-no common outdoor man ; [Tess]198-tess had looked so superior as [she]198-tess walked across [the barton]2387-the barton on that afternoon of [her]198-tess arrival ; that [she]198-tess was of [a good family]3214-a good family [she]198-tess could have sworn . In point of fact [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick did remember thinking that [Tess]198-tess was graceful and good - looking as [she]198-tess approached ; but the superiority might have been a growth of the imagination aided by subsequent knowledge .

[Tess]198-tess was now carried along upon the wings of the hours , without the sense of a will . The word had been given ; the number of the day written down . [Her]198-tess naturally bright intelligence had begun to admit the fatalistic convictions common to [field - folk]3215-field - folk and [those who associate more extensively with natural phenomena]3216-those who associate more extensively with natural phenomena than with [their]3216-those who associate more extensively with natural phenomena fellow - creatures ; and [she]198-tess accordingly drifted into that passive responsiveness to all things [[her]198-tess lover]2598-her lover suggested , characteristic of the frame of mind .

But [she]198-tess wrote anew to [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother , ostensibly to notify the wedding - day ; really to again implore [her]658-her mother advice . It was [a gentleman who had chosen [her]198-tess , which perhaps [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother had not sufficiently considered]3219-a gentleman who had chosen her , which perhaps her mother had not sufficiently considered . A post - nuptial explanation , which might be accepted with a light heart by [a rougher man]3221-a rougher man , might not be received with the same feeling by [him]3221-a rougher man . But this communication brought no reply from [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield .

Despite [Angel Clare]284-clare 's plausible representation to [himself]284-clare and to [Tess]198-tess of the practical need for [their]3222-their immediate marriage , there was in truth an element of precipitancy in the step , as became apparent at a later date . [He]284-clare loved [her]198-tess dearly , though perhaps rather ideally and fancifully than with the impassioned thoroughness of [her]198-tess feeling for [him]284-clare . [He]284-clare had entertained no notion , when doomed as [he]284-clare had thought to an unintellectual bucolic life , that such charms as [he]284-clare beheld in this idyllic creature would be found behind the scenes . Unsophistication was a thing to talk of ; but [he]284-clare had not known how it really struck one until [he]284-clare came [here]5975-here . Yet [he]284-clare was very far from seeing [his]284-clare future track clearly , and it might be a year or two before [he]284-clare would be able to consider [himself]284-clare fairly started in life . The secret lay in the tinge of recklessness imparted to [his]284-clare career and character by the sense that [he]284-clare had been made to miss [his]284-clare true destiny through the prejudices of [[his]284-clare family]5890-his family .

" Do n't [you]284-clare think ' twould have been better for [us]6922-us to wait till [you]284-clare were quite settled in [[your]284-clare midland farm]6923-your midland farm ? "[3225-her] [she]3225-her once asked timidly . [A midland farm]3226-a midland farm was the idea just then .

" To tell the truth , [[my]3225-her Tess]6741-my tess , [I]3225-her do n't like [you]284-clare to be left anywhere away from [my]3225-her protection and sympathy . "[3225-her]

The reason was a good one , so far as it went . [His]284-clare influence over [her]3225-her had been so marked that [she]3225-her had caught [his]284-clare manner and habits , [his]284-clare speech and phrases , [his]284-clare likings and [his]284-clare aversions . And to leave [her]3225-her in [farmland]3227-farmland would be to let [her]3225-her slip back again out of accord with [him]284-clare . [He]284-clare wished to have [her]3225-her under [his]284-clare charge for another reason . [[His]284-clare parents]746-his parents had naturally desired to see [her]3225-her once at least before [he]284-clare carried [her]3225-her off to [a distant settlement]3229-a distant settlement , English or colonial ; and as no opinion of [theirs]3230-theirs was to be allowed to change [his]284-clare intention , [he]284-clare judged that a couple of months ' life with [him]284-clare in [lodgings]3231-lodgings whilst seeking for an advantageous opening would be of some social assistance to [her]3225-her at what [she]3225-her might feel to be a trying ordeal - [her]3225-her presentation to [[his]284-clare mother]6090-his mother at [the Vicarage]2162-the vicarage .

Next , [he]284-clare wished to see a little of the working of [a flour - mill]3234-a flour - mill , having an idea that [he]284-clare might combine the use of one with corn - growing . [The proprietor of [a large old water - mill at [Wellbridge]17-wellbridge]3236-a large old water - mill at wellbridge]3235-the proprietor of a large old water - mill at wellbridge - once [the mill of [an Abbey]3238-an abbey]3237-the mill of an abbey - had offered [him]284-clare the inspection of [his]284-clare time - honoured mode of procedure , and a hand in the operations for a few days , whenever [he]284-clare should choose to come . [Clare]284-clare paid a visit to [the place]5882-the place , [some few miles distant]3240-some few miles distant , one day at this time , to inquire particulars , and returned to [Talbothays]60-talbothays in the evening . [She]3225-her found [him]284-clare determined to spend a short time at [the Wellbridge flour - mills]3241-the wellbridge flour - mills . And what had determined [him]284-clare ? Less the opportunity of an insight into grinding and bolting than the casual fact that lodgings were to be obtained in [that very farmhouse]3242-that very farmhouse which , before its mutilation , had been [the mansion of [a branch of [the d'Urberville family]456-the d'urberville family]3244-a branch of the d'urberville family]3243-the mansion of a branch of the d'urberville family . This was always how [Clare]284-clare settled practical questions ; by a sentiment which had nothing to do with [them]3246-them . [They]3247-we decided to go immediately after the wedding , and remain for a fortnight , instead of journeying to [towns]3248-towns and [inns]3249-inns .

" Then [we]3247-we will start off to examine [some farms on [the other side of [London]23-london that [I]284-clare have heard of]6926-the other side of london that i have heard of]6925-some farms on the other side of london that i have heard of , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said , " and by March or April [we]3247-we will pay a visit to [[my]284-clare father]6702-my father and [mother]5917-mother . "[284-clare]

Questions of procedure such as these arose and passed , and the day , the incredible day , on which [she]3250-she was to become [his]284-clare , loomed large in the near future . The thirty - first of December , New Year 's Eve , was the date . [[His]284-clare wife]819-his wife , [she]3250-she said to [herself]3250-she . Could it ever be ? [[Their]3247-we two selves]3252-their two selves together , nothing to divide [them]3247-we , every incident shared by [them]3247-we ; why not ? And yet why ?

One Sunday morning [Izz Huett]312-izz returned from [church]813-church , and spoke privately to [Tess]198-tess .

" [You]198-tess was not called [home]5850-home this morning . "[2085-the other]

" What ? "[2085-the other]

" It should ha ' been the first time of asking to - day , "[3250-she] [she]3250-she answered , looking quietly at [Tess]198-tess . " [You]198-tess meant to be married New Year 's Eve , [deary]6930-deary ? "[3250-she]

[The other]2085-the other returned a quick affirmative .

" And there must be three times of asking . And now there be only two Sundays left between . "[2085-the other]

[Tess]198-tess felt [her]198-tess cheek paling ; [Izz]312-izz was right ; of course there must be three . Perhaps [he]3255-he had forgotten ! If so , there must be a week 's postponement , and that was unlucky . How could [she]3250-she remind [[her]3250-she lover]2598-her lover ? [She]3250-she who had been so backward was suddenly fired with impatience and alarm lest [she]3250-she should lose [her]3250-she dear prize .

A natural incident relieved [her]3250-she anxiety . [Izz]312-izz mentioned the omission of [the banns]3257-the banns to [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick , and [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick assumed [a matron]3258-a matron 's privilege of speaking to [Angel]284-clare on the point .

" Have [ye]284-clare forgot ['em]6931-'em , [Mr Clare]284-clare ? [The banns]3257-the banns , [I]284-clare mean . "[284-clare]

" No , [I]284-clare have not forgot ['em]6931-'em , "[284-clare] says [Clare]284-clare .

As soon as [he]284-clare caught [Tess]198-tess alone [he]284-clare assured [her]198-tess :

" Do n't let [them]3257-the banns tease [you]198-tess about [the banns]3257-the banns . A licence will be quieter for [us]6934-us , and [I]284-clare have decided on a licence without consulting [you]198-tess . So if [you]198-tess go to [church]813-church on Sunday morning [you]198-tess will not hear [your]198-tess own name , if [you]198-tess wished to . "[284-clare]

" [I]198-tess did n't wish to hear it , [dearest]6681-dearest , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said proudly .

But to know that things were in train was an immense relief to [Tess]198-tess notwithstanding , who had well - nigh feared that [somebody]6000-somebody would stand up and forbid [the banns]3257-the banns on the ground of [her]198-tess history . How events were favouring [her]198-tess !

" [I]198-tess do n't quite feel easy , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said to [herself]198-tess . " All this good fortune may be scourged out of [me]198-tess afterwards by a lot of ill . That 's how [Heaven]282-heaven mostly does . [I]198-tess wish [I]198-tess could have had common banns ! "[198-tess]

But everything went smoothly . [She]198-tess wondered whether [he]3261-he would like [her]198-tess to be married in [her]198-tess present best white frock , or if [she]198-tess ought to buy a new one . The question was set at rest by [his]3261-he forethought , disclosed by the arrival of some large packages addressed to [her]198-tess . Inside them [she]198-tess found a whole stock of clothing , from bonnet to shoes , including a perfect morning costume , such as would well suit the simple wedding [they]3262-they planned . [He]3261-he entered [the house]652-the house shortly after the arrival of the packages , and heard [her]198-tess [upstairs]762-upstairs undoing them .

A minute later [she]198-tess came down with a flush on [her]198-tess face and tears in [her]198-tess eyes .

" How thoughtful [you]3261-he 've been ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess murmured , [her]198-tess cheek upon [his]3261-he shoulder . " Even to the gloves and handkerchief ! [My]198-tess own love - how good , how kind ! "[198-tess]

" No , no , [Tess]198-tess ; just an order to [a tradeswoman in [London]23-london]6937-a tradeswoman in london - nothing more . "[3261-he]

And to divert [her]198-tess from thinking too highly of [him]3261-he , [he]3261-he told [her]198-tess to go [upstairs]762-upstairs , and take [her]198-tess time , and see if it all fitted ; and , if not , to get [the village sempstress]3266-the village sempstress to make a few alterations .

[She]198-tess did return [upstairs]762-upstairs , and put on the gown . Alone , [she]198-tess stood for a moment before the glass looking at the effect of [her]198-tess silk attire ; and then there came into [her]198-tess head [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's ballad of the mystic robe -

That never would become that wife That had once done amiss ,

which [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield had used to sing to [her]198-tess as [a child]1122-a child , so blithely and so archly , [her]198-tess foot on the cradle , which [she]198-tess rocked to the tune . Suppose this robe should betray [her]198-tess by changing colour , as [her]198-tess robe had betrayed [Queen Guinevere]366-queen guinevere . Since [she]198-tess had been at [the dairy]1952-the dairy [she]198-tess had not once thought of the lines till now .

XXXIII

[Angel]284-clare felt that [he]284-clare would like to spend a day with [her]198-tess before the wedding , somewhere away from [the dairy]1952-the dairy , as a last jaunt in [her]198-tess company while there were yet [mere lover]3272-mere lover and [mistress]3273-mistress ; a romantic day , in circumstances that would never be repeated ; with that other and greater day beaming close ahead of [them]3274-they . During the preceding week , therefore , [he]284-clare suggested making a few purchases in [the nearest town]3275-the nearest town , and [they]3274-they started together .

[Clare]284-clare 's life at [the dairy]1952-the dairy had been that of [a recluse in respect the world of [[his]284-clare own class]3278-his own class]3277-a recluse in respect the world of his own class . For months [he]284-clare had never gone near [a town]3279-a town , and , requiring [no vehicle]3280-no vehicle , had never kept one , hiring [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's cob or gig if [he]284-clare rode or drove . [They]3274-they went in the gig that day .

And then for the first time in [their]3274-they lives [they]3274-they shopped as [partners]638-partners in one concern . It was Christmas Eve , with [its]3283-its loads a holly and mistletoe , and [the town]1346-the town was very full of [[strangers]568-strangers who had come in from [all parts of [the country]507-the country]3287-all parts of the country on account of the day]3286-strangers who had come in from all parts of the country on account of the day . [Tess]198-tess paid the penalty of walking about with happiness superadded to beauty on [her]198-tess countenance by being much stared at as [she]198-tess moved amid [them]3289-them on [his]284-clare arm .

In the evening [they]3274-they returned to [the inn at which [they]3274-they had put up]3290-the inn at which they had put up , and [Tess]198-tess waited in the entry while [Angel]284-clare went to see the horse and gig brought to the door . [The general sitting - room]3291-the general sitting - room was full of [guests]3292-guests , who were continually going in and out . As the door opened and shut each time for the passage of these , the light within [the parlour]3293-the parlour fell full upon [Tess]198-tess 's face . [Two men]3294-two men came out and passed by [her]198-tess among [the rest]6118-the rest . [One of [them]3294-two men]1380-one of them had stared [her]198-tess up and down in surprise , and [she]198-tess fancied [he]1380-one of them was [a Trantridge man]3297-a trantridge man , though [that village]3298-that village lay so many miles off that [Trantridge folk]3299-trantridge folk were rarities here .

" [A comely maid]6938-a comely maid that , "[2085-the other] said [the other]2085-the other .

" True , comely enough . But unless [I]1380-one of them make a great mistake - "[1380-one of them] And [he]1380-one of them negatived the remainder of the definition forthwith .

[Clare]284-clare had just returned from [the stable - yard]3301-the stable - yard , and , confronting [the man on the threshold]3302-the man on the threshold , heard the words , and saw the shrinking of [Tess]198-tess . The insult to [her]198-tess stung [him]284-clare to the quick , and before [he]284-clare had considered anything at all [he]284-clare struck [the man]1516-the man on the chin with the full force of [his]284-clare fist , sending [him]1516-the man staggering backwards into [the passage]2972-the passage .

[The man]1516-the man recovered [himself]1516-the man , and seemed inclined to come on , and [Clare]284-clare , stepping outside the door , put [himself]284-clare in a posture of defence . But [[his]284-clare opponent]3306-his opponent began to think better of the matter . [He]3306-his opponent looked anew at [Tess]198-tess as [he]3306-his opponent passed [her]198-tess , and said to [Clare]284-clare -

" [I]3306-his opponent beg pardon , [sir]5821-sir ; ' twas a complete mistake . [I]3306-his opponent thought [she]198-tess was [another woman]6940-another woman , forty miles from [here]5975-here . "[3306-his opponent]

[Clare]284-clare , feeling then that [he]284-clare had been too hasty , and that [he]284-clare was , moreover , to blame for leaving [her]198-tess standing in [an inn - passage]3307-an inn - passage , did what [he]284-clare usually did in such cases , gave [the man]1516-the man five shillings to plaster the blow ; and thus [they]3309-we parted , bidding [each other]577-each other a pacific good night . As soon as [Clare]284-clare had taken the reins from [the ostler]3311-the ostler , and [the young couple]3312-the young couple had driven off , [the two men]3313-the two men went in the other direction .

" And was it a mistake ? "[3314-the second one] said [the second one]3314-the second one .

" Not a bit of it . But [I]3314-the second one did n't want to hurt [the gentleman]1007-the gentleman 's feelings - not [I.]3314-the second one "[3314-the second one]

In the meantime [the lovers]3029-the lovers were driving onward .

" Could [we]3309-we put off [our]3309-we wedding till a little later ? "[198-tess] [Tess]198-tess asked in a dry dull voice . " [I]198-tess mean if [we]3309-we wished ? "[198-tess]

" No , [[my]3311-the ostler love]6943-my love . Calm [yourself]6943-my love . Do [you]6943-my love mean that [the fellow]6944-the fellow may have time to summon [me]3311-the ostler for assault ? "[3311-the ostler] [he]3311-the ostler asked good - humouredly .

" No - [I]198-tess only meant - if it should have to be put off . "[198-tess]

What [she]198-tess meant was not very clear , and [he]3311-the ostler directed [her]198-tess to dismiss such fancies from [her]198-tess mind , which [she]198-tess obediently did as well as [she]198-tess could . But [she]198-tess was grave , very grave , all the way [home]5850-home ; till [she]198-tess thought , " [We]3317-we shall go away , a very long distance , hundreds of miles from [these parts]1368-these parts , and such as this can never happen again , and [no ghost of the past]6946-no ghost of the past reach there . "[198-tess]

[They]3317-we parted tenderly that night on [the landing]3318-the landing , and [Clare]284-clare ascended to [[his]3311-the ostler attic]3319-his attic . [Tess]198-tess sat up getting on with some little requisites , lest the few remaining days should not afford sufficient time . While [she]198-tess sat [she]198-tess heard a noise in [[Angel]284-clare 's room]3320-angel 's room overhead , a sound of thumping and struggling . [Everybody else in [the house]652-the house]3321-everybody else in the house was asleep , and in [her]198-tess anxiety lest [Clare]284-clare should be ill [she]198-tess ran up and knocked at [his]3311-the ostler door , and asked [him]3311-the ostler what was the matter .

" Oh , nothing , [dear]6259-dear , "[3311-the ostler] [he]3311-the ostler said from within . " [I]3311-the ostler am so sorry [I]3311-the ostler disturbed [you]6259-dear ! But the reason is rather an amusing one : [I]3311-the ostler fell asleep and dreamt that [I]3311-the ostler was fighting [that fellow again who insulted [you]6259-dear]6948-that fellow again who insulted you , and the noise [you]6259-dear heard was [my]3311-the ostler pummelling away with [my]3311-the ostler fists at [my]3311-the ostler portmanteau , which [I]3311-the ostler pulled out to - day for packing . [I]3311-the ostler am occasionally liable to [these freaks]6949-these freaks in [my]3311-the ostler sleep . Go to bed and think of it no more . "[3311-the ostler]

This was the last drachm required to turn the scale of [her]198-tess indecision . Declare the past to [him]3311-the ostler by word of mouth [she]198-tess could not ; but there was another way . [She]198-tess sat down and wrote on the four pages of a note - sheet a succinct narrative of those events of three or four years ago , put it into an envelope , and directed it to [Clare]284-clare . Then , lest the flesh should again be weak , [she]198-tess crept [upstairs]762-upstairs without any shoes and slipped the note under [his]3311-the ostler door .

[Her]198-tess night was a broken one , as it well might be , and [she]198-tess listened for the first faint noise overhead . It came , as usual ; [he]3311-the ostler descended , as usual . [She]198-tess descended . [He]3311-the ostler met [her]198-tess at the bottom of [the stairs]3324-the stairs and kissed [her]198-tess . Surely it was as warmly as ever !

[He]3311-the ostler looked a little disturbed and worn , [she]198-tess thought . But [he]3311-the ostler said not a word to [her]198-tess about [her]198-tess revelation , even when [they]3325-they were alone . Could [he]3311-the ostler have had it ? Unless [he]3311-the ostler began the subject [she]198-tess felt that [she]198-tess could say nothing . So the day passed , and it was evident that whatever [he]3311-the ostler thought [he]3311-the ostler meant to keep to [himself]3311-the ostler . Yet [he]3311-the ostler was frank and affectionate as before . Could it be that [her]198-tess doubts were childish ? that [he]3311-the ostler forgave [her]198-tess ; that [he]3311-the ostler loved [her]198-tess for what [she]198-tess was , just as [she]198-tess was , and smiled at [her]198-tess disquiet as at a foolish nightmare ? Had [he]3311-the ostler really received [her]198-tess note ? [She]198-tess glanced into [[his]3311-the ostler room]2202-his room , and could see nothing of it . It might be that [he]3311-the ostler forgave [her]198-tess . But even if [he]3311-the ostler had not received it [she]198-tess had a sudden enthusiastic trust that [he]3311-the ostler surely would forgive [her]198-tess .

Every morning and night [he]3311-the ostler was the same , and thus New Year 's Eve broke - the wedding day .

[The lovers]3029-the lovers did not rise at milking - time , having through the whole of this last week of [their]3029-the lovers sojourn at [the dairy]1952-the dairy been accorded something of the position of [guests]3292-guests , [Tess]198-tess being honoured with [a room of [her]198-tess own]3330-a room of her own . When [they]3029-the lovers arrived [downstairs]1128-downstairs at breakfast - time [they]3029-the lovers were surprised to see what effects had been produced in [the large kitchen]3332-the large kitchen for [their]3029-the lovers glory since [they]3029-the lovers had last beheld it . At some unnatural hour of the morning [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman had caused the yawning chimney - corner to be whitened , and the brick hearth reddened , and a blazing yellow damask blower to be hung across the arch in place of the old grimy blue cotton one with a black sprig pattern which had formerly done duty there . This renovated aspect of what was the focus indeed of [the room]778-the room on a full winter morning threw a smiling demeanour over [the whole apartment]3335-the whole apartment .

" [I]1900-the dairyman was determined to do summat in honour o't "[1900-the dairyman] , said [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman . " And as [you]6950-you would n't hear of [my]1900-the dairyman gieing a rattling good randy wi ' fiddles and bass - viols complete , as [we]3029-the lovers should ha ' done in old times , this was all [I]1900-the dairyman could think o ' as a noiseless thing . "[1900-the dairyman]

[[Tess]198-tess 's friends]3337-tess 's friends lived so far off that [none]3338-none could conveniently have been present at the ceremony , even had any been asked ; but as a fact [nobody]754-nobody was invited from [Marlott]21-marlott . As for [[Angel]284-clare 's family]3340-angel 's family , [he]1900-the dairyman had written and duly informed [them]3340-angel 's family of the time , and assured [them]3340-angel 's family that [he]1900-the dairyman would be glad to see one at least of [them]3340-angel 's family there for the day if [he]1900-the dairyman would like to come . [[His]1900-the dairyman brothers]634-his brothers had not replied at all , seeming to be indignant with [him]1900-the dairyman ; while [[his]1900-the dairyman father]457-his father and [mother]5917-mother had written a rather sad letter , deploring [his]1900-the dairyman precipitancy in rushing into marriage , but making the best of the matter by saying that , though [a dairywoman]6577-a dairywoman was [the last daughter - in - law]3345-the last daughter - in - law [they]3346-they could have expected , [[their]3346-they son]2831-their son had arrived at an age which [he]2831-their son might be supposed to be [the best judge]3348-the best judge .

This coolness in [his]1900-the dairyman relations distressed [Clare]284-clare less than it would have done had [he]1900-the dairyman been without the grand card with which [he]1900-the dairyman meant to surprise [them]3346-they ere long . To produce [Tess]198-tess , fresh from the dairy , as [a d'Urberville]3349-a d'urberville and [a lady]6038-a lady , [he]1900-the dairyman had felt to be temerarious and risky ; hence [he]1900-the dairyman had concealed [her]198-tess lineage till such time as , familiarized with worldly ways by a few months ' travel and reading with [him]1900-the dairyman , [he]1900-the dairyman could take [her]198-tess on a visit to [[his]1900-the dairyman parents]746-his parents and impart the knowledge while triumphantly producing [her]198-tess as worthy of such an ancient line . It was [a pretty lover]3352-a pretty lover 's dream , if no more . Perhaps [Tess]198-tess 's lineage had more value for [himself]1900-the dairyman than for anybody in [the world]497-the world beside .

[Her]198-tess perception that [Angel]284-clare 's bearing towards [her]198-tess still remained in no whit altered by [her]198-tess own communication rendered [Tess]198-tess guiltily doubtful if [he]1900-the dairyman could have received it . [She]198-tess rose from breakfast before [he]1900-the dairyman had finished , and hastened [upstairs]762-upstairs . It had occurred to [her]198-tess to look once more into [the queer gaunt room which had been [Clare]284-clare 's den]3355-the queer gaunt room which had been clare 's den , or rather eyrie , for so long , and climbing the ladder [she]198-tess stood at the open door of [the apartment]3151-the apartment , regarding and pondering . [She]198-tess stooped to the threshold of the doorway , where [she]198-tess had pushed in the note two or three days earlier in such excitement . The carpet reached close to the sill , and under the edge of the carpet [she]198-tess discerned the faint white margin of the envelope containing [her]198-tess letter to [him]1900-the dairyman , which [he]1900-the dairyman obviously had never seen , owing to [her]198-tess having in [her]198-tess haste thrust it beneath the carpet as well as beneath the door .

With a feeling of faintness [she]198-tess withdrew the letter . There it was - sealed up , just as it had left [her]198-tess hands . [The mountain]3357-the mountain had not yet been removed . [She]198-tess could not let [him]1900-the dairyman read it now , [the house]652-the house being in full bustle of preparation ; and descending to [[her]198-tess own room]3359-her own room [she]198-tess destroyed the letter there .

[She]198-tess was so pale when [he]1900-the dairyman saw [her]198-tess again that [he]1900-the dairyman felt quite anxious . The incident of the misplaced letter [she]198-tess had jumped at as if it prevented a confession ; but [she]198-tess knew in [her]198-tess conscience that it need not ; there was still time . Yet everything was in a stir ; there was coming and going ; [all]622-all had to dress , [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman and [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick having been asked to accompany [them]622-all as [witnesses]3362-witnesses ; and reflection or deliberate talk was well - nigh impossible . The only minute [Tess]198-tess could get to be alone with [Clare]284-clare was when [they]3363-we met upon [the landing]3318-the landing .

" [I]198-tess am so anxious to talk to [you]1900-the dairyman - [I]198-tess want to confess all [my]198-tess faults and blunders ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said with attempted lightness .

" No , no - [we]3363-we ca n't have faults talked of - [you]198-tess must be deemed perfect to - day at least , [[my]284-clare Sweet]6951-my sweet ! "[284-clare] [he]284-clare cried . " [We]3363-we shall have plenty of time , hereafter , [I]284-clare hope , to talk over [our]3363-we failings . [I]284-clare will confess [mine]284-clare at the same time . "[284-clare]

" But it would be better for [me]3365-me to do it now , [I]3365-me think , so that [you]1900-the dairyman could not say - "[3365-me]

"[284-clare]

" Then [you]1900-the dairyman do n't wish [me]3365-me to , [dearest]6681-dearest ? "[3365-me]

" [I]284-clare do not , [Tessy]256-tessy , really . "[284-clare]

The hurry of dressing and starting left no time for more than this . Those words of [his]3365-me seemed to reassure [her]3366-her on further reflection . [She]3366-her was whirled onward through the next couple of critical hours by the mastering tide of [her]3366-her devotion to [him]3365-me , which closed up further meditation . [Her]3366-her one desire , so long resisted , to make [herself]3366-her [his]3365-me , to call [him]3365-me [[her]3366-her lord]3367-her lord , [her]3366-her own - then , if necessary , to die - had at last lifted [her]3366-her up from [her]3366-her plodding reflective pathway . In dressing , [she]3366-her moved about in a mental cloud of many - coloured idealities , which eclipsed all sinister contingencies by its brightness .

[The church]6443-the church was a long way off , and [they]3369-they were obliged to drive , particularly as it was winter . [A closed carriage]3370-a closed carriage was ordered from [a roadside inn]3371-a roadside inn , a vehicle which had been kept [there]5839-there ever since the old days of post - chaise travelling . [It]3370-a closed carriage had stout wheel - spokes , and heavy felloes a great curved bed , immense straps and springs , and a pole like a battering - ram . [The postilion]3373-the postilion was [a venerable " boy "[3374-a venerable " boy " of sixty] of sixty]3374-a venerable " boy " of sixty - [a martyr to rheumatic gout , the result of excessive exposure in youth]3375-a martyr to rheumatic gout , the result of excessive exposure in youth , counter - acted by [strong liquors]3376-strong liquors - who had stood at [inn]3377-inn - doors doing nothing for the whole five - and - twenty years that had elapsed since [he]3373-the postilion had no longer been required to ride professionally , as if expecting the old times to come back again . [He]3373-the postilion had a permanent running wound on the outside of [his]3373-the postilion right leg , originated by the constant bruisings of aristocratic carriage - poles during the many years that [he]3373-the postilion had been in regular employ at [[the King]506-the king 's Arms]97-the king 's arms , [Casterbridge]41-casterbridge .

Inside [this cumbrous and creaking structure]3379-this cumbrous and creaking structure , and behind [this decayed conductor]3380-this decayed conductor , [the partie carree]3381-the partie carree took [their]3381-the partie carree seats - [the bride]2563-the bride and [bridegroom]3383-bridegroom and [Mr]3384-mr and [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick . [Angel]284-clare would have liked one at least of [[his]284-clare brothers]634-his brothers to be present as [groomsman]3386-groomsman , but [their]634-his brothers silence after [his]284-clare gentle hint to that effect by letter had signified that [they]634-his brothers did not care to come . [They]634-his brothers disapproved of the marriage , and could not be expected to countenance it . Perhaps it was as well that [they]634-his brothers could not be present . [They]634-his brothers were not [worldly young fellows]3387-worldly young fellows , but fraternizing with [dairy - folk]3388-dairy - folk would have struck unpleasantly upon [their]634-his brothers biased niceness , apart from [their]634-his brothers views of the match .

Upheld by the momentum of the time , [Tess]198-tess knew nothing of this , did not see anything , did not know [the road [they]634-his brothers were taking to [the church]6443-the church]3389-the road they were taking to the church . [She]198-tess knew that [Angel]284-clare was close to [her]198-tess ; all the rest was a luminous mist . [She]198-tess was [a sort of celestial person]3391-a sort of celestial person , who owed [her]198-tess being to poetry - one of those classical divinities [Clare]284-clare was accustomed to talk to [her]198-tess about when [they]634-his brothers took [their]634-his brothers walks together .

The marriage being by licence there were only [a dozen or so of people in [the church]6443-the church]3392-a dozen or so of people in the church ; had there been a thousand [they]3392-a dozen or so of people in the church would have produced no more effect upon [her]198-tess . [They]3392-a dozen or so of people in the church were at stellar distances from [[her]198-tess present world]3394-her present world . In the ecstatic solemnity with which [she]198-tess swore [her]198-tess faith to [him]284-clare the ordinary sensibilities of sex seemed a flippancy . At a pause in the service , while [they]634-his brothers were kneeling together , [she]198-tess unconsciously inclined [herself]198-tess towards [him]284-clare , so that [her]198-tess shoulder touched [his]284-clare arm ; [she]198-tess had been frightened by a passing thought , and the movement had been automatic , to assure [herself]198-tess that [he]284-clare was really there , and to fortify [her]198-tess belief that [his]284-clare fidelity would be proof against all things .

[Clare]284-clare knew that [she]198-tess loved [him]284-clare - every curve of [her]198-tess form showed that - but [he]284-clare did not know at that time the full depth of [her]198-tess devotion , its single - mindedness , its meekness ; what long - suffering it guaranteed , what honesty , what endurance , what good faith .

As [they]634-his brothers came out of [church]813-church [the ringers]3396-the ringers swung the bells off [their]3396-the ringers rests , and a modest peal of three notes broke forth - that limited amount of expression having been deemed sufficient by [the church builders]3397-the church builders for the joys of such [a small parish]3398-a small parish . Passing by [the tower]3399-the tower with [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband on the path to the gate [she]198-tess could feel the vibrant air humming round [them]634-his brothers from [the louvred belfry in the circle of sound]3401-the louvred belfry in the circle of sound , and it matched the highly - charged mental atmosphere in which [she]198-tess was living .

This condition of mind , wherein [she]198-tess felt glorified by an irradiation not [her]198-tess own , like [the angel whom [St John]337-st john saw in the sun]3402-the angel whom st john saw in the sun , lasted till the sound of the church bells had died away , and the emotions of the wedding - service had calmed down . [Her]198-tess eyes could dwell upon details more clearly now , and [Mr]3403-mr and [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick having directed [their]634-his brothers own gig to be sent for [them]634-his brothers , to leave [the carriage]5893-the carriage to [the young couple]3312-the young couple , [she]198-tess observed the build and character of that conveyance for the first time . Sitting in silence [she]198-tess regarded it long .

" [I]284-clare fancy [you]198-tess seem oppressed , [Tessy]256-tessy , "[284-clare] said [Clare]284-clare .

" Now , [Tess]198-tess ! "[3406-he]

[He]3406-he silenced [her]198-tess by a kiss .

By the time [they]3407-we reached [home]5850-home [she]198-tess was contrite and spiritless . [She]198-tess was [Mrs Angel Clare]200-clare , indeed , but had [she]198-tess any moral right to the name ? Was [she]198-tess not more truly [Mrs Alexander d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville ? [She]198-tess knew not what was expected of [women]1628-women in such cases ; and [she]198-tess had [no counsellor]3411-no counsellor .

However , when [she]198-tess found [herself]198-tess alone in [[her]198-tess room]2357-her room for a few minutes - the last day this on which [she]198-tess was ever to enter [it]2357-her room - [she]198-tess knelt down and prayed . [Her]198-tess idolatry of [this man]1582-this man was such that [she]198-tess [herself]198-tess almost feared it to be ill - omened . [She]198-tess was conscious of the notion expressed by [Friar Laurence]368-friar laurence : " These violent delights have violent ends . "[368-friar laurence] It might be too desperate for human conditions - too rank , to wild , too deadly .

" O [my]198-tess love , why do [I]198-tess love [you]1582-this man so ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess whispered there alone ; " for [she]6969-she [you]1582-this man love is not [my]198-tess real self , but one in [my]198-tess image ; the one [I]198-tess might have been ! "[198-tess]

Afternoon came , and with it the hour for departure . [They]3415-they had decided to fulfil the plan of going for a few days to [the lodgings in [the old farmhouse near [Wellbridge Mill]98-wellbridge mill , at which [he]1582-this man meant to reside during [his]1582-this man investigation of flour processes]3417-the old farmhouse near wellbridge mill , at which he meant to reside during his investigation of flour processes]3416-the lodgings in the old farmhouse near wellbridge mill , at which he meant to reside during his investigation of flour processes . [All the servantry of the dairy]3418-all the servantry of the dairy were standing in the red - brick entry to see [them]3415-they go out , [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman and [[his]1900-the dairyman wife]819-his wife following to the door . [Tess]198-tess saw [[her]198-tess three chamber - mates]3421-her three chamber - mates in a row against the wall , pensively inclining [their]3421-her three chamber - mates heads . [She]198-tess had much questioned if [they]3421-her three chamber - mates would appear at the parting moment ; but there [they]3421-her three chamber - mates were , stoical and staunch to the last . [She]198-tess knew why [the delicate Retty]311-retty looked so fragile , and [Izz]3422-izz so tragically sorrowful , and [Marian]310-marian so blank ; and [she]198-tess forgot [her]198-tess own dogging shadow for a moment in contemplating [theirs]3421-her three chamber - mates .

[She]198-tess impulsively whispered to [him]1900-the dairyman -

" Will [you]1900-the dairyman kiss 'em all , once , poor things , for the first and last time ? "[198-tess]

[Clare]200-clare had not the least objection to such a farewell formality - which was all that it was to [him]1900-the dairyman - and as [he]1900-the dairyman passed [them]3421-her three chamber - mates [he]1900-the dairyman kissed [them]3421-her three chamber - mates in succession where [they]3421-her three chamber - mates stood , saying " Goodbye "[1900-the dairyman] to [each]542-each as [he]1900-the dairyman did so . When [they]3421-her three chamber - mates reached the door [Tess]198-tess femininely glanced back to discern the effect of that kiss of charity ; there was no triumph in [her]198-tess glance , as there might have been . If there had it would have disappeared when [she]198-tess saw how moved [the girls]576-the girls all were . The kiss had obviously done harm by awakening feelings [they]3421-her three chamber - mates were trying to subdue .

Of all this [Clare]200-clare was unconscious . Passing on to the wicket - gate [he]1900-the dairyman shook hands with [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman and [[his]1900-the dairyman wife]819-his wife , and expressed [his]1900-the dairyman last thanks to [them]3421-her three chamber - mates for [their]3421-her three chamber - mates attentions ; after which there was a moment of silence before [they]3421-her three chamber - mates had moved off . It was interrupted by the crowing of a cock . [The white one with the rose comb]3427-the white one with the rose comb had come and settled on the palings in front of [the house]652-the house , within a few yards of [them]3421-her three chamber - mates , and [his]1900-the dairyman notes thrilled [their]3421-her three chamber - mates ears through , dwindling away like echoes down [a valley of rocks]3429-a valley of rocks .

" Oh ? "[283-mrs crick] said [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick . " An afternoon crow ! "[283-mrs crick]
