XXXIV

[They]3440-they drove by [the level road along [the valley]496-the valley]3441-the level road along the valley to a distance of a few miles , and , reaching [Wellbridge]17-wellbridge , turned away from [the village]473-the village to the left , and over [the great Elizabethan bridge which gives [the place half]3445-the place half [its]3445-the place half name]3444-the great elizabethan bridge which gives the place half its name . Immediately behind [it]3444-the great elizabethan bridge which gives the place half its name stood [the house wherein [they]3440-they had [engaged lodgings]3447-engaged lodgings , whose exterior features are so well known to all travellers through [the Froom Valley]3448-the froom valley]3446-the house wherein they had engaged lodgings , whose exterior features are so well known to all travellers through the froom valley ; once portion of [a fine manorial residence]3449-a fine manorial residence , and [the property and seat of [a d'Urberville]3349-a d'urberville]3450-the property and seat of a d'urberville , but since [its]3444-the great elizabethan bridge which gives the place half its name partial demolition [a farmhouse]3452-a farmhouse .

" Welcome to [one of [[your]3454-your ancestral mansions]6973-your ancestral mansions]6972-one of your ancestral mansions ! "[200-clare] said [Clare]200-clare as [he]3453-he handed [her]3454-your down . But [he]3453-he regretted the pleasantry ; it was too near a satire .

On entering [they]3440-they found that , though [they]3440-they had only engaged [a couple of rooms]3455-a couple of rooms , [the farmer]1947-the farmer had taken advantage of [their]3440-they proposed presence during the coming days to pay a New Year 's visit to [some friends]3457-some friends , leaving [a woman from [a neighbouring cottage]3459-a neighbouring cottage]3458-a woman from a neighbouring cottage to minister to [their]3440-they few wants . The absoluteness of possession pleased [them]3440-they , and [they]3440-they realized it as the first moment of [their]3440-they experience under [their]3440-they own exclusive roof - tree .

But [he]3453-he found that the mouldy old habitation somewhat depressed [[his]3453-he bride]3460-his bride . When [the carriage]5893-the carriage was gone [they]3440-they ascended [the stairs]3324-the stairs to wash [their]3440-they hands , [the charwoman]3463-the charwoman showing the way . On [the landing]3318-the landing [Tess]198-tess stopped and started .

" What 's the matter ? "[3453-he] said [he]3453-he .

" [Those horrid women]6974-those horrid women ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess answered with a smile . " How [they]6974-those horrid women frightened [me]198-tess . "[198-tess]

[He]3453-he looked up , and perceived two life - size portraits on panels built into the masonry . As [all visitors to [the mansion]3466-the mansion]3465-all visitors to the mansion are aware , these paintings represent [women of middle age , of a date some two hundred years ago , whose lineaments once seen can never be forgotten]3467-women of middle age , of a date some two hundred years ago , whose lineaments once seen can never be forgotten . The long pointed features , narrow eye , and smirk of the one , so suggestive of merciless treachery ; the bill - hook nose , large teeth , and bold eye of the other suggesting arrogance to the point of ferocity , haunt [the beholder]3468-the beholder afterwards in [his]3453-he dreams .

" Whose portraits are those ? "[200-clare] asked [[Clare]200-clare of [the charwoman]3463-the charwoman]3469-clare of the charwoman .

" [I]198-tess have been told by [old folk]6975-old folk that [they]6974-those horrid women were [ladies of the d'Urberville family]6976-ladies of the d'urberville family , [the ancient lords of [this manor]6978-this manor]6977-the ancient lords of this manor , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , " Owing to [their]6974-those horrid women being builded into the wall [they]6974-those horrid women ca n't be moved away . "[198-tess]

The unpleasantness of the matter was that , in addition to their effect upon [Tess]198-tess , [her]198-tess fine features were unquestionably traceable in these exaggerated forms . [He]3453-he said nothing of this , however , and , regretting that [he]3453-he had gone out of [his]3453-he way to choose [the house]652-the house for [their]3472-their bridal time , went on into [the adjoining room]3473-the adjoining room . [The place]5882-the place having been rather hastily prepared for [them]3472-their , [they]3472-their washed [their]3472-their hands in one basin . [Clare]200-clare touched [hers]198-tess under the water .

" Which are [my]3453-he fingers and which are yours ? "[3453-he] [he]3453-he said , looking up . " They are very much mixed . "[3453-he]

" They are all [yours]3453-he , "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess , very prettily , and endeavoured to be gayer than [she]198-tess was . [He]3453-he had not been displeased with [her]198-tess thoughtfulness on such an occasion ; it was what [every sensible woman]3475-every sensible woman would show : but [Tess]198-tess knew that [she]198-tess had been thoughtful to excess , and struggled against it .

The sun was so low on that short last afternoon of the year that it shone in through a small opening and formed a golden staff which stretched across to [her]198-tess skirt , where it made a spot like a paint - mark set upon [her]198-tess . [They]3472-their went into [the ancient parlour]3476-the ancient parlour to tea , and here [they]3472-their shared [their]3472-their first common meal alone . Such was [their]3472-their childishness , or rather [his]3453-he , that [he]3453-he found it interesting to use the same bread - and - butter plate as [herself]198-tess , and to brush crumbs from [her]198-tess lips with [his]3453-he own . [He]3453-he wondered a little that [she]198-tess did not enter into these frivolities with [his]3453-he own zest .

Looking at [her]198-tess silently for a long time ; " [She]198-tess is a dear dear [Tess]198-tess , "[3453-he] [he]3453-he thought to [himself]3453-he , as one deciding on the true construction of a difficult passage . " Do [I]3453-he realize solemnly enough how utterly and irretrievably [this little womanly thing]6979-this little womanly thing is the creature of [my]3453-he good or bad faith and fortune ? [I]3453-he think not . [I]3453-he think [I]3453-he could not , unless [I]3453-he were [a woman]1028-a woman [myself]3453-he . What [I]3453-he am in worldly estate , [she]198-tess is . What [I]3453-he become , [she]198-tess must become . What [I]3453-he can not be , [she]198-tess can not be . And shall [I]3453-he ever neglect [her]198-tess , or hurt [her]198-tess , or even forget to consider [her]198-tess ? God forbid such a crime ! "[3453-he]

[They]3477-they sat on over the tea - table waiting for [their]3477-they luggage , which [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman had promised to send before it grew dark . But evening began to close in , and the luggage did not arrive , and [they]3477-they had brought nothing more than [they]3477-they stood in . With the departure of the sun the calm mood of the winter day changed . Out of doors there began noises as of silk smartly rubbed ; the restful dead leaves of the preceding autumn were stirred to irritated resurrection , and whirled about unwillingly , and tapped against the shutters . It soon began to rain .

" That cock knew the weather was going to change , "[200-clare] said [Clare]200-clare .

[The woman who had attended upon [them]3477-they]3479-the woman who had attended upon them had gone [home]5850-home for the night , but [she]3479-the woman who had attended upon them had placed candles upon the table , and now [they]3477-they lit them . Each candle - flame drew towards the fireplace .

" [These old houses]6981-these old houses are so draughty , "[200-clare] continued [Angel]200-clare , looking at the flames , and at the grease guttering down the sides . " [I]200-clare wonder where that luggage is . [We]3477-they have n't even a brush and comb . "[200-clare]

" [I]3479-the woman who had attended upon them do n't know , "[3479-the woman who had attended upon them] [she]3479-the woman who had attended upon them answered , absent - minded .

" [Tess]198-tess , [you]198-tess are not a bit cheerful this evening - not at all as [you]198-tess used to be . [Those harridans on the panels]6982-those harridans on the panels [upstairs]762-upstairs have unsettled [you]198-tess . [I]3479-the woman who had attended upon them am sorry [I]3479-the woman who had attended upon them brought [you]198-tess [here]5975-here . [I]3479-the woman who had attended upon them wonder if [you]198-tess really love [me]3479-the woman who had attended upon them , after all ? "[3479-the woman who had attended upon them]

[He]3481-he knew that [she]3479-the woman who had attended upon them did , and the words had no serious intent ; but [she]3479-the woman who had attended upon them was surcharged with emotion , and winced like a wounded animal . Though [she]3479-the woman who had attended upon them tried not to shed tears , [she]3479-the woman who had attended upon them could not help showing one or two .

" [I]3481-he did not mean it ! "[3481-he] said [he]3481-he , sorry . " [You]198-tess are worried at not having [your]198-tess things , [I]3481-he know . [I]3481-he can not think why [old Jonathan]278-jonathan has not come with [them]6985-them . Why , it is seven o'clock ? Ah , there [he]278-jonathan is ! "[3481-he]

A knock had come to the door , and , there being [nobody else]6245-nobody else to answer it , [Clare]200-clare went out . [He]3481-he returned to [the room]778-the room with a small package in [his]3481-he hand .

" It is not [Jonathan]278-jonathan , after all , "[3481-he] [he]3481-he said .

" How vexing ! "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess .

The packet had been brought by [a special messenger]3484-a special messenger , who had arrived at [Talbothays]60-talbothays from [Emminster Vicarage]100-emminster vicarage immediately after the departure of [the married couple]3485-the married couple , and had followed [them]3485-the married couple hither , being under injunction to deliver it into [nobody]754-nobody 's hands but [theirs]3485-the married couple . [Clare]200-clare brought it to the light . It was less than a foot long , sewed up in canvas , sealed in red wax with [[his]3481-he father]457-his father 's seal , and directed in [[his]3481-he father]457-his father 's hand to " [Mrs Angel Clare]200-clare . "[457-his father]

" It is a little wedding - present for [you]198-tess , [Tess]198-tess , "[3481-he] said [he]3481-he , handing it to [her]198-tess . " How thoughtful [they]3485-the married couple are ! "[3481-he]

[Tess]198-tess looked a little flustered as [she]198-tess took it .

" [I]198-tess think [I]198-tess would rather have [you]200-clare open it , [dearest]6681-dearest , "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess , turning over the parcel . " [I]198-tess do n't like to break those great seals ; they look so serious . Please open it for [me]198-tess ! "[198-tess]

[He]3481-he undid the parcel . Inside was a case of morocco leather , on the top of which lay a note and a key .

The note was for [Clare]200-clare , in the following words :

[[MY]0-i DEAR SON]3489-my dear son -

Possibly [you]200-clare have forgotten that on the death of [[your]200-clare godmother]3490-your godmother , [Mrs Pitney]369-mrs pitney , when [you]200-clare were [a lad]6370-a lad , [she]369-mrs pitney - vain , kind woman that [she]369-mrs pitney was - left to [me]0-i a portion of the contents of [her]369-mrs pitney jewel - case in trust for [[your]200-clare wife]6687-your wife , if [you]200-clare should ever have one , as a mark of [her]369-mrs pitney affection for [you]200-clare and whomsoever [you]200-clare should choose . This trust [I]0-i have fulfilled , and the diamonds have been locked up at [[my]0-i banker]3493-my banker 's ever since . Though [I]0-i feel it to be a somewhat incongruous act in the circumstances , [I]0-i am , as [you]200-clare will see , bound to hand over the articles to [the woman to whom the use of them for [her]3494-the woman to whom the use of them for her lifetime lifetime]3494-the woman to whom the use of them for her lifetime will now rightly belong , and they are therefore promptly sent . [They]3495-they become , [I]0-i believe , heirlooms , strictly speaking , according to the terms of [[your]200-clare godmother]3490-your godmother 's will . The precise words of the clause that refers to this matter are enclosed .

" [I]200-clare do remember , "[200-clare] said [Clare]200-clare ; " but [I]200-clare had quite forgotten . "[200-clare]

Unlocking the case , [they]3497-they found it to contain a necklace , with pendant , bracelets , and ear - rings ; and also some other small ornaments .

[Tess]198-tess seemed afraid to touch them at first , but [her]198-tess eyes sparkled for a moment as much as the stones when [Clare]200-clare spread out the set .

" Are they mine ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess asked incredulously .

" They are , certainly , "[3498-he] said [he]3498-he .

[He]3498-he looked into the fire . [He]3498-he remembered how , when [he]3498-he was [a lad of fifteen]3499-a lad of fifteen , [[his]3498-he godmother]3500-his godmother , [[the Squire]3501-the squire 's wife]3502-the squire 's wife - [the only rich person with whom [he]3498-he had ever come in contact]3503-the only rich person with whom he had ever come in contact - had pinned [her]3502-the squire 's wife faith to [his]3498-he success ; had prophesied a wondrous career for [him]3498-he . There had seemed nothing at all out of keeping with such a conjectured career in the storing up of these showy ornaments for [[his]3498-he wife]819-his wife and [the wives of [[her]819-his wife descendants]3506-her descendants]3505-the wives of her descendants . They gleamed somewhat ironically now . " Yet why ? "[3498-he] [he]3498-he asked [himself]3498-he . It was but a question of vanity throughout ; and if that were admitted into one side of the equation it should be admitted into the other . [[His]3498-he wife]819-his wife was [a d'Urberville]3349-a d'urberville : whom could [they]3509-they become better than [her]819-his wife ?

Suddenly [he]3498-he said with enthusiasm -

" [Tess]198-tess , put them on - put them on ! "[3498-he] And [he]3498-he turned from the fire to help [her]819-his wife .

But as if by magic [she]819-his wife had already donned them - necklace , ear - rings , bracelets , and all .

" But the gown is n't right , [Tess]198-tess , "[200-clare] said [Clare]200-clare . " It ought to be a low one for a set of brilliants like that . "[200-clare]

" Ought it ? "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess .

" Yes , "[3498-he] said [he]3498-he .

[He]3498-he suggested to [her]819-his wife how to tuck in the upper edge of [her]819-his wife bodice , so as to make it roughly approximate to the cut for evening wear ; and when [she]819-his wife had done this , and the pendant to the necklace hung isolated amid the whiteness of [her]819-his wife throat , as it was designed to do , [he]3498-he stepped back to survey [her]819-his wife .

" [My]200-clare heavens , "[200-clare] said [Clare]200-clare , " how beautiful [you]819-his wife are ! "[200-clare]

As [everybody]569-everybody knows , fine feathers make fine birds ; [a peasant girl but very moderately prepossessing to the casual observer in [her]3511-a peasant girl but very moderately prepossessing to the casual observer in her simple condition and attire simple condition and attire]3511-a peasant girl but very moderately prepossessing to the casual observer in her simple condition and attire will bloom as an amazing beauty if clothed as [a woman of fashion]3512-a woman of fashion with the aids that Art can render ; while the beauty of the midnight crush would often cut but a sorry figure if placed inside [the field - woman]1699-the field - woman 's wrapper upon a monotonous acreage of turnips on a dull day . [He]3498-he had never till now estimated the artistic excellence of [Tess]198-tess 's limbs and features .

" If [you]198-tess were only to appear in [a ball - room]6987-a ball - room ! "[3498-he] [he]3498-he said . " But no - no , dearest ; [I]3498-he think [I]3498-he love [you]198-tess best in the wing - bonnet and cotton - frock - yes , better than in this , well as [you]198-tess support these dignities . "[3498-he]

[Tess]198-tess 's sense of [her]198-tess striking appearance had given [her]198-tess a flush of excitement , which was yet not happiness .

" [I]198-tess 'll take them off , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , " in case [Jonathan]278-jonathan should see [me]198-tess . [They]3514-they are not fit for [me]198-tess , are [they]3514-they ? [They]3514-they must be sold , [I]198-tess suppose ? "[198-tess]

" Let [them]3514-they stay a few minutes longer . Sell them ? Never . It would be a breach of faith . "[198-tess]

Influenced by a second thought [she]198-tess readily obeyed . [She]198-tess had something to tell , and there might be help in these . [She]198-tess sat down with the jewels upon [her]198-tess ; and [they]3514-they again indulged in conjectures as to where [Jonathan]278-jonathan could possibly be with [their]3514-they baggage . The ale [they]3514-they had poured out for [his]278-jonathan consumption when [he]278-jonathan came had gone flat with long standing .

Shortly after this [they]3514-they began supper , which was already laid on a side - table . Ere [they]3514-they had finished there was a jerk in the fire - smoke , the rising skein of which bulged out into [the room]778-the room , as if [some giant]3516-some giant had laid [his]3516-some giant hand on the chimney - top for a moment . It had been caused by the opening of the outer door . A heavy step was now heard in [the passage]2972-the passage , and [Angel]200-clare went out .

" [I]278-jonathan couldn ' make [nobody]754-nobody hear at all by knocking , "[278-jonathan] apologized [Jonathan Kail]278-jonathan , for it was [he]278-jonathan at last ; " and as't was raining out [I]278-jonathan opened the door . [I]278-jonathan 've brought the things , [sir]5821-sir . "[278-jonathan]

" [I]278-jonathan am very glad to see them . But [you]278-jonathan are very late . "[278-jonathan]

" Well , yes , [sir]5821-sir . "[278-jonathan]

There was something subdued in [Jonathan Kail]278-jonathan 's tone which had not been there in the day , and lines of concern were ploughed upon [his]278-jonathan forehead in addition to the lines of years . [He]278-jonathan continued -

" [We]3514-they 've all been gallied at the dairy at what might ha ' been a most terrible affliction since [you]278-jonathan and [[your]278-jonathan Mis'ess]6991-your mis'ess - so to name [her]6991-your mis'ess now - left [us]3514-they this a'ternoon . Perhaps [you]278-jonathan ha'nt forgot the cock 's afternoon crow ? "[278-jonathan]

" [Dear]6259-dear [me]278-jonathan ; - what - "[278-jonathan]

" Well , [some]527-some says it do mane one thing , and some another ; but what 's happened is that poor little [Retty Priddle hev]311-retty tried to drown [herself]311-retty . "[278-jonathan]

" No ! Really ! Why , [she]311-retty bade [us]3514-they goodbye with [the rest]6118-the rest - "[278-jonathan]

" Yes . Well , [sir]5821-sir , when [you]278-jonathan and [[your]278-jonathan Mis'ess]6991-your mis'ess - so to name what [she]311-retty lawful is - when [you]278-jonathan two drove away , as [I]278-jonathan say , [Retty]311-retty and [Marian]310-marian put on [their]3514-they bonnets and went out ; and as there is not much doing now , being New Year 's Eve , and folks mops and brooms from what 's inside 'em , [nobody]754-nobody took much notice . [They]3514-they went on to [Lew - Everard]101-lew - everard , where [they]3514-they had summut to drink , and then on [they]3514-they vamped to [Dree - armed Cross]102-dree - armed cross , and there [they]3514-they seemed to have parted , [Retty]311-retty striking across [the water - meads]6998-the water - meads as if for [home]5850-home , and [Marian]310-marian going on to [the next village]7000-the next village , where there 's [another public - house]7001-another public - house . Nothing more was zeed or heard o ' [Retty]311-retty till [the waterman]7002-the waterman , on [his]7002-the waterman way [home]5850-home , noticed something by [the Great Pool]7004-the great pool ; ' twas [her]311-retty bonnet and shawl packed up . In [the water]2381-the water [he]7002-the waterman found [her]311-retty . [He]7002-the waterman and [another man]7006-another man brought [her]311-retty [home]5850-home , thinking a ' was dead ; but [she]311-retty fetched round by degrees . "[278-jonathan]

[Angel]200-clare , suddenly recollecting that [Tess]198-tess was overhearing this gloomy tale , went to shut the door between [the passage]2972-the passage and [the ante - room]3519-the ante - room to [the inner parlour]3520-the inner parlour where [she]3521-she was ; but [[his]3522-his wife]819-his wife , flinging a shawl round [her]3521-she , had come to [the outer room]3524-the outer room and was listening to [the man]1516-the man 's narrative , [her]819-his wife eyes resting absently on the luggage and the drops of rain glistening upon it .

" And , more than this , there 's [Marian]310-marian ; [she]310-marian 's been found dead drunk by [the withy - bed]7008-the withy - bed - [a girl who hev never been known to touch anything before except shilling ale]7009-a girl who hev never been known to touch anything before except shilling ale ; though , to be sure , ' a was always [a good trencher - woman]7010-a good trencher - woman , as [her]310-marian face showed . " And [Izz]312-izz ? "[198-tess] asked [Tess]198-tess .

" Izz is about [house]5948-house as usual ; but ' a do say ' [a]7013-a can guess how it happened ; and [she]3521-she seems to be very low in mind about it , [poor maid]7014-poor maid , as well [she]3521-she mid be . And so [you]1516-the man see , [sir]5821-sir , as all this happened just when [we]7016-we was packing [your]1516-the man few traps and [[your]1516-the man Mis'ess]6991-your mis'ess 's night - rail and dressing things into the cart , why , it belated [me]819-his wife . "[819-his wife]

" Yes . Well , [Jonathan]278-jonathan , will [you]278-jonathan get the trunks [upstairs]762-upstairs , and drink a cup of ale , and hasten back as soon as [you]278-jonathan can , in case [you]278-jonathan should be wanted ? "[819-his wife]

[Tess]198-tess had gone back to [the inner parlour]3520-the inner parlour , and sat down by the fire , looking wistfully into it . [She]198-tess heard [Jonathan Kail]278-jonathan 's heavy footsteps up and down the stairs till [he]278-jonathan had done placing the luggage , and heard [him]278-jonathan express [his]278-jonathan thanks for the ale [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband took out to [him]278-jonathan , and for the gratuity [he]278-jonathan received . [Jonathan]278-jonathan 's footsteps then died from the door , and [his]278-jonathan cart creaked away .

[Angel]200-clare slid forward the massive oak bar which secured the door , and coming in to where [she]198-tess sat over the hearth , pressed [her]198-tess cheeks between [his]278-jonathan hands from behind . [He]278-jonathan expected [her]198-tess to jump up gaily and unpack the toilet - gear that [she]198-tess had been so anxious about , but as [she]198-tess did not rise [he]278-jonathan sat down with [her]198-tess in the firelight , the candles on the supper - table being too thin and glimmering to interfere with its glow .

" [I]278-jonathan am so sorry [you]198-tess should have heard this sad story about [the girls]576-the girls , "[278-jonathan] [he]278-jonathan said . " Still , do n't let it depress [you]198-tess . [Retty]311-retty was naturally morbid , [you]198-tess know . "[278-jonathan]

" Without the least cause , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess . " While [they]3528-they who have cause to be , hide it , and pretend [they]3528-they are not . "[198-tess]

This incident had turned the scale for [her]198-tess . [They]3528-they were simple and [innocent girls on whom the unhappiness of unrequited love had fallen]3529-innocent girls on whom the unhappiness of unrequited love had fallen ; [they]3528-they had deserved better at the hands of [Fate]370-fate . [She]198-tess had deserved worse - yet [she]198-tess was [the chosen one]3530-the chosen one . It was wicked of [her]198-tess to take all without paying . [She]198-tess would pay to the uttermost farthing ; [she]198-tess would tell , there and then . This final determination [she]198-tess came to when [she]198-tess looked into the fire , [he]278-jonathan holding [her]198-tess hand .

A steady glare from the now flameless embers painted the sides and back of the fireplace with its colour , and the well - polished andirons , and the old brass tongs that would not meet . The underside of the mantel - shelf was flushed with the high - coloured light , and the legs of the table nearest the fire . [Tess]198-tess 's face and neck reflected the same warmth , which each gem turned into an Aldebaran or a Sirius - a constellation of white , red , and green flashes , that interchanged their hues with [her]198-tess every pulsation .

" Do [you]198-tess remember what [we]7020-we said to [each other]577-each other this morning about telling [our]7020-we faults ? "[278-jonathan] [he]278-jonathan asked abruptly , finding that [she]198-tess still remained immovable . " [We]7020-we spoke lightly perhaps , and [you]198-tess may well have done so . But for [me]198-tess it was no light promise . [I]198-tess want to make a confession to [you]198-tess , [Love]371-love . "[198-tess]

This , from [him]278-jonathan , so unexpectedly apposite , had the effect upon [her]198-tess of a Providential interposition .

" [You]278-jonathan have to confess something ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said quickly , and even with gladness and relief .

" [You]278-jonathan did not expect it ? Ah - [you]278-jonathan thought too highly of [me]278-jonathan . Now listen . Put [your]198-tess head there , because [I]278-jonathan want [you]198-tess to forgive [me]278-jonathan , and not to be indignant with [me]278-jonathan for not telling [you]198-tess before , as perhaps [I]278-jonathan ought to have done . "[278-jonathan]

How strange it was ! [He]278-jonathan seemed to be [her]198-tess double . [She]198-tess did not speak , and [Clare]200-clare went on -

" [I]200-clare did not mention it because [I]200-clare was afraid of endangering [my]200-clare chance of [you]198-tess , [darling]6254-darling , the great prize of [my]200-clare life - [my]200-clare Fellowship [I]200-clare call [you]198-tess . [[My]200-clare brother]7023-my brother 's Fellowship was won at [[his]7023-my brother college]2704-his college , mine at [Talbothays Dairy]73-talbothays dairy . Well , [I]200-clare would not risk it . [I]200-clare was going to tell [you]198-tess a month ago - at the time [you]198-tess agreed to be [mine]200-clare , but [I]200-clare could not ; [I]200-clare thought it might frighten [you]198-tess away from [me]200-clare . [I]200-clare put it off ; then [I]200-clare thought [I]200-clare would tell [you]198-tess yesterday , to give [you]198-tess a chance at least of escaping [me]200-clare . But [I]200-clare did not . And [I]200-clare did not this morning , when [you]198-tess proposed [our]7025-our confessing [our]7025-our faults on [the landing]3318-the landing - the sinner that [I]200-clare was ! But [I]200-clare must , now [I]200-clare see [you]198-tess sitting there so solemnly . [I]200-clare wonder if [you]198-tess will forgive [me]200-clare ? "[200-clare]

" O yes ! [I]200-clare am sure that - "[200-clare]

" Well , [I]200-clare hope so . But wait a minute . [You]198-tess do n't know . To begin at the beginning . Though [I]200-clare imagine [[my]200-clare poor father]7027-my poor father fears that [I]200-clare am one of the eternally lost for [my]200-clare doctrines , [I]200-clare am of course , [a believer in good morals]7028-a believer in good morals , [Tess]198-tess , as much as [you]198-tess . [I]200-clare used to wish to be [a teacher of]7029-a teacher of [men]5841-men , and it was a great disappointment to [me]200-clare when [I]200-clare found [I]200-clare could not enter [the Church]103-the church . [I]200-clare admired spotlessness , even though [I]200-clare could lay no claim to it , and hated impurity , as [I]200-clare hope [I]200-clare do now . Whatever one may think of plenary inspiration , [one]6172-one must heartily subscribe to these words of [Paul]336-paul : ' Be [thou]7032-thou an example - in word , in conversation , in charity , in spirit , in faith , in purity . ' It is the only safeguard for [[us]7033-us poor [human beings]7035-human beings]7034-us poor human beings . ' Integer vitae , ' says [a Roman poet]7036-a roman poet , who is strange company for [St Paul]336-paul -[200-clare]

" [The man of upright life]7037-the man of upright life , from frailties free , Stands not in need of Moorish spear or bow .[200-clare]

" Well , a certain place is paved with good intentions , and having felt all that so strongly , [you]3532-her will see what a terrible remorse it bred in [me]3531-i when , in the midst of [my]3531-i fine aims for [other people]7038-other people , [I]3531-i [myself]3531-i fell . "[3531-i]

[He]3531-i then told [her]3532-her of that time of [his]3531-i life to which allusion has been made when , tossed about by doubts and difficulties in [London]23-london , like a cork on the waves , [he]3531-i plunged into eight - and - forty hours ' dissipation with [a stranger]1085-a stranger .

" Happily [I]3531-i awoke almost immediately to a sense of [my]3531-i folly , "[3531-i] [he]3531-i continued . " [I]3531-i would have no more to say to [her]3532-her , and [I]3531-i came [home]5850-home . [I]3531-i have never repeated the offence . But [I]3531-i felt [I]3531-i should like to treat [you]3532-her with perfect frankness and honour , and [I]3531-i could not do so without telling this . Do [you]3531-i forgive [me]3531-i ? "[3531-i]

[She]3532-her pressed [his]3531-i hand tightly for an answer .

" Then [we]7040-we will dismiss it at once and for ever ! - too painful as it is for the occasion - and talk of something lighter . "[3532-her]

" O , [Angel]200-clare - [I]3532-her am almost glad - because now [YOU]3532-her can forgive [ME]3532-her ! [I]3532-her have not made [my]3532-her confession . [I]3532-her have a confession , too - remember , [I]3532-her said so . "[3532-her]

" Ah , to be sure ! Now then for it , [wicked little one]7041-wicked little one . "[3532-her]

" Perhaps , although [you]3531-i smile , it is as serious as [yours]3531-i , or more so . "[3532-her]

" It can hardly be more serious , dearest . "[3532-her]

" [It]7042-it can not - O no , it can not ! "[3532-her] [She]3532-her jumped up joyfully at the hope . " No , it can not be more serious , certainly , "[3532-her] [she]3532-her cried , " because ' tis just the same ! [I]3532-her will tell [you]3531-i now . "[3532-her]

[She]3532-her sat down again .

[Their]3534-their hands were still joined . The ashes under the grate were lit by the fire vertically , like a torrid waste . [Imagination]372-imagination might have beheld a Last Day luridness in this red - coaled glow , which fell on [his]3535-i face and hand , and on [hers]3532-her , peering into the loose hair about [her]3532-her brow , and firing the delicate skin underneath . A large shadow of [her]3532-her shape rose upon the wall and ceiling . [She]3532-her bent forward , at which each diamond on [her]3532-her neck gave a sinister wink like a toad 's ; and pressing [her]3532-her forehead against [his]3535-i temple [she]3532-her entered on [her]3532-her story of [her]3532-her acquaintance with [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville and its results , murmuring the words without flinching , and with [her]3532-her eyelids drooping down .

END OF PHASE THE FOURTH

Phase the Fifth : [The Woman]674-the woman Pays

XXXV

[Her]3532-her narrative ended ; even its re - assertions and secondary explanations were done . [Tess]198-tess 's voice throughout had hardly risen higher than its opening tone ; there had been no exculpatory phrase of any kind , and [she]3532-her had not wept .

But the complexion even of external things seemed to suffer transmutation as [her]3532-her announcement progressed . The fire in [the grate]3537-the grate looked impish - demoniacally funny , as if it did not care in the least about [her]3532-her strait . [The fender]3538-the fender grinned idly , as if it too did not care . The light from the water - bottle was merely engaged in a chromatic problem . All material objects around announced [their]3539-their irresponsibility with terrible iteration . And yet nothing had changed since the moments when [he]3535-i had been kissing [her]3532-her ; or rather , nothing in the substance of things . But the essence of things had changed .

When [she]3532-her ceased , the auricular impressions from [their]3540-their previous endearments seemed to hustle away into the corner of [their]3540-their brains , repeating themselves as echoes from a time of supremely purblind foolishness .

[Clare]200-clare performed the irrelevant act of stirring the fire ; the intelligence had not even yet got to the bottom of [him]3535-i . After stirring the embers [he]3535-i rose to [his]3535-i feet ; all the force of [her]3532-her disclosure had imparted itself now . [His]3535-i face had withered . In the strenuousness of [his]3535-i concentration [he]3535-i treadled fitfully on the floor . [He]3535-i could not , by any contrivance , think closely enough ; that was the meaning of [his]3535-i vague movement . When [he]3535-i spoke it was in the most inadequate , commonplace voice of the many varied tones [she]3532-her had heard from [him]3535-i .

" [Tess]198-tess ! "[3535-i]

" Yes , [dearest]6681-dearest . "[3535-i]

" Am [I]3535-i to believe this ? From [your]3535-i manner [I]3535-i am to take it as true . O [you]3535-i can not be out of [your]3535-i mind ! [You]3535-i ought to be ! Yet [you]3535-i are not ... [[My]3535-i wife]5895-my wife , [[my]3535-i Tess]6741-my tess - nothing in [you]3535-i warrants such a supposition as that ? "[3535-i]

" [I]3532-her am not out of [my]3532-her mind , "[3532-her] [she]3532-her said .

" And yet - "[3535-i] [He]3535-i looked vacantly at [her]3532-her , to resume with dazed senses : " Why did n't [you]3532-her tell [me]3535-i before ? Ah , yes , [you]3532-her would have told [me]3535-i , in a way - but [I]3535-i hindered [you]3532-her , [I]3535-i remember ! "[3535-i]

These and other of [his]3535-i words were nothing but the perfunctory babble of the surface while the depths remained paralyzed . [He]3535-i turned away , and bent over a chair . [Tess]198-tess followed [him]3535-i to the middle of [the room]778-the room , where [he]3535-i was , and stood there staring at [him]3535-i with eyes that did not weep . Presently [she]198-tess slid down upon [her]198-tess knees beside [his]3535-i foot , and from this position [she]198-tess crouched in a heap .

" In the name of [[our]7046-our love]7047-our love , forgive [me]198-tess ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess whispered with a dry mouth . " [I]198-tess have forgiven [you]3535-i for the same ! "[198-tess]

And , as [he]3535-i did not answer , [she]198-tess said again -

" Forgive [me]198-tess as [you]3535-i are forgiven ! [I]198-tess forgive [YOU]3535-i , [Angel]200-clare . "[198-tess]

" [You]3535-i - yes , [you]3535-i do . "[198-tess]

" But [you]3535-i do not forgive [me]198-tess ? "[198-tess]

" O [Tess]198-tess , forgiveness does not apply to the case ! [You]3535-i were [one person]7048-one person ; now [you]3535-i are another . [[My]198-tess God]5944-my god - how can forgiveness meet such a grotesque - prestidigitation as that ! "[198-tess]

[He]3535-i paused , contemplating this definition ; then suddenly broke into horrible laughter - as unnatural and ghastly as a laugh in hell .

" Do n't - do n't ! It kills [me]198-tess quite , that ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess shrieked . " O have mercy upon [me]198-tess - have mercy ! "[198-tess]

[He]3535-i did not answer ; and , sickly white , [she]198-tess jumped up .

" [Angel]200-clare , [Angel]200-clare ! what do [you]3535-i mean by that laugh ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess cried out . " Do [you]3535-i know what this is to [me]198-tess ? "[198-tess]

[He]3535-i shook [his]3535-i head .

" [I]3535-i have been hoping , longing , praying , to make [you]198-tess happy ! [I]3535-i have thought what joy it will be to do it , what [an unworthy wife]7050-an unworthy wife [I]3535-i shall be if [I]3535-i do not ! That 's what [I]3535-i have felt , [Angel]200-clare ! "[3535-i]

" [I]3535-i know that . "[3535-i]

" [I]3535-i thought , [Angel]200-clare , that [you]200-clare loved [me]3535-i - [me]3535-i , [[my]3535-i very self]7051-my very self ! If it is [I]3535-i [you]200-clare do love , O how can it be that [you]200-clare look and speak so ? It frightens [me]3535-i ! Having begun to love [you]200-clare , [I]3535-i love [you]200-clare for ever - in all changes , in all disgraces , because [you]200-clare are [yourself]200-clare . [I]3535-i ask no more . Then how can [you]200-clare , O [[my]3535-i own husband]7052-my own husband , stop loving [me]3535-i ? "[3535-i]

" [I]3543-he repeat , [the woman [I]3543-he have been loving]7053-the woman i have been loving is not [you]200-clare . "[3543-he]

" But who ? "[3535-i]

" [Another woman in [your]200-clare shape]7054-another woman in your shape . "[3543-he]

[She]3542-her perceived in [his]3543-he words the realization of [her]3542-her own apprehensive foreboding in former times . [He]3543-he looked upon [her]3542-her as [a species of imposter]3544-a species of imposter ; [a guilty woman]3545-a guilty woman in the guise of [an innocent one]3546-an innocent one . Terror was upon [her]3542-her white face as [she]3542-her saw it ; [her]3542-her cheek was flaccid , and [her]3542-her mouth had almost the aspect of a round little hole . The horrible sense of [his]3543-he view of [her]3542-her so deadened [her]3542-her that [she]3542-her staggered , and [he]3543-he stepped forward , thinking [she]3542-her was going to fall .

" Sit down , sit down , "[3543-he] [he]3543-he said gently . " [You]3542-her are ill ; and it is natural that [you]3542-her should be . "[3543-he]

[She]3542-her did sit down , without knowing where [she]3542-her was , that strained look still upon [her]3542-her face , and [her]3542-her eyes such as to make [his]3543-he flesh creep .

" [I]3542-her do n't belong to [you]3543-he any more , then ; do [I]3542-her , [Angel]200-clare ? "[3542-her] [she]3542-her asked helplessly . " It is not [me]3542-her , but [another woman like [me]3542-her that [he]3543-he loved]7055-another woman like me that he loved , [he]3543-he says . "[3542-her]

The image raised caused [her]3542-her to take pity upon [herself]3542-her as one who was ill - used . [Her]3542-her eyes filled as [she]3542-her regarded [her]3542-her position further ; [she]3542-her turned round and burst into a flood of self - sympathetic tears .

[Clare]200-clare was relieved at this change , for the effect on [her]3542-her of what had happened was beginning to be a trouble to [him]3543-he only less than the woe of the disclosure itself . [He]3543-he waited patiently , apathetically , till the violence of [her]3542-her grief had worn itself out , and [her]3542-her rush of weeping had lessened to a catching gasp at intervals .

" [Angel]200-clare , "[3542-her] [she]3542-her said suddenly , in [her]3542-her natural tones , the insane , dry voice of terror having left [her]3542-her now . " [Angel]200-clare , am [I]3542-her too wicked for [you]200-clare and [me]3542-her to live together ? "[3542-her]

" [I]3542-her have not been able to think what [we]7056-we can do . "[3542-her]

" [I]3542-her sha n't ask [you]200-clare to let [me]3542-her live with [you]200-clare , [Angel]200-clare , because [I]3542-her have no right to ! [I]3542-her shall not write to [mother]5917-mother and [sisters]825-sisters to say [we]7056-we be married , as [I]3542-her said [I]3542-her would do ; and [I]3542-her sha n't finish the good - hussif ' [I]3542-her cut out and meant to make while [we]7056-we were in [lodgings]3231-lodgings . "[3542-her]

" Sha n't [you]200-clare ? "[3542-her]

" No , [I]3542-her sha n't do anything , unless [you]200-clare order [me]3542-her to ; and if [you]200-clare go away from [me]3542-her [I]3542-her shall not follow [']7060-' [ee]7060-' ; and if [you]200-clare never speak to [me]3542-her any more [I]3542-her shall not ask why , unless [you]200-clare tell [me]3542-her [I]3542-her may . "[3542-her]

" And if [I]3542-her order [you]200-clare to do anything ? "[3542-her]

" [I]3542-her will obey [you]200-clare like [[your]200-clare wretched slave]7061-your wretched slave , even if it is to lie down and die . "[3542-her]

" [You]200-clare are very good . But it strikes [me]3542-her that there is a want of harmony between [your]200-clare present mood of self - sacrifice and [your]200-clare past mood of self - preservation . "[3542-her]

These were the first words of antagonism . To fling elaborate sarcasms at [Tess]198-tess , however , was much like flinging them at a dog or cat . The charms of [their]3547-their subtlety passed by [her]198-tess unappreciated , and [she]198-tess only received them as inimical sounds which meant that anger ruled . [She]198-tess remained mute , not knowing that [he]3548-he was smothering [his]3548-he affection for [her]198-tess . [She]198-tess hardly observed that a tear descended slowly upon [his]3548-he cheek , a tear so large that it magnified the pores of the skin over which it rolled , like the object lens of a microscope . Meanwhile reillumination as to the terrible and total change that [her]198-tess confession had wrought in [his]3548-he life , in [his]3548-he universe , returned to [him]3548-he , and [he]3548-he tried desperately to advance among the new conditions in which [he]3548-he stood . Some consequent action was necessary ; yet what ?

" [Tess]198-tess , "[3548-he] [he]3548-he said , as gently as [he]3548-he could speak , " [I]3548-he can not stay - in [this room]7062-this room - just now . [I]3548-he will walk out a little way . "[3548-he]

[He]3548-he quietly left [the room]778-the room , and the two glasses of wine that [he]3548-he had poured out for [their]3550-their supper - one for [her]198-tess , one for [him]3548-he - remained on the table untasted . This was what [their]3550-their agape had come to . At tea , two or three hours earlier , [they]3550-their had , in the freakishness of affection , drunk from one cup .

The closing of the door behind [him]3548-he , gently as it had been pulled to , roused [Tess]198-tess from [her]198-tess stupor . [He]3548-he was gone ; [she]198-tess could not stay . Hastily flinging [her]198-tess cloak around [her]198-tess [she]198-tess opened the door and followed , putting out the candles as if [she]198-tess were never coming back . The rain was over and the night was now clear .

[She]198-tess was soon close at [his]3548-he heels , for [Clare]200-clare walked slowly and without purpose . [His]3548-he form beside [her]198-tess light gray figure looked black , sinister , and forbidding , and [she]198-tess felt as sarcasm the touch of the jewels of which [she]198-tess had been momentarily so proud . [Clare]200-clare turned at hearing [her]198-tess footsteps , but [his]3548-he recognition of [her]198-tess presence seemed to make no difference to [him]3548-he , and [he]3548-he went on over the five yawning arches of [the great bridge in front of [the house]652-the house]3551-the great bridge in front of the house .

The cow and horse tracks in [the road]550-the road were full of water , the rain having been enough to charge them , but not enough to wash them away . Across [these minute pools]3554-these minute pools the reflected stars flitted in a quick transit as [she]198-tess passed ; [she]198-tess would not have known they were shining overhead if [she]198-tess had not seen them there - the vastest things of [the universe]1395-the universe imaged in objects so mean .

[The place to which [they]3557-they had travelled to - day]3556-the place to which they had travelled to - day was in [the same valley]3558-the same valley as [Talbothays]60-talbothays , but [some miles lower down [the river]1998-the river]3559-some miles lower down the river ; and the surroundings being open , [she]198-tess kept easily in sight of [him]3548-he . Away from [the house]652-the house [the road]550-the road wound through [the meads]2026-the meads , and along these [she]198-tess followed [Clare]200-clare without any attempt to come up with [him]3548-he or to attract [him]3548-he , but with dumb and vacant fidelity .

At last , however , [her]198-tess listless walk brought [her]198-tess up alongside [him]3548-he , and still [he]3548-he said nothing . The cruelty of fooled honesty is often great after enlightenment , and it was mighty in [Clare]200-clare now . The outdoor air had apparently taken away from [him]3548-he all tendency to act on impulse ; [she]198-tess knew that [he]3548-he saw [her]198-tess without irradiation - in all [her]198-tess bareness ; that Time was chanting [his]3548-he satiric psalm at [her]198-tess then -

Behold , when [thy]3564-thy face is made bare , [he]3548-he that loved [thee]3564-thy shall hate ; [Thy]3564-thy face shall be no more fair at the fall of [thy]3564-thy fate . For [thy]3564-thy life shall fall as a leaf and be shed as the rain ; And the veil of thine head shall be grief , and the crown shall be pain .

[He]3548-he was still intently thinking , and [her]198-tess companionship had now insufficient power to break or divert the strain of thought . What a weak thing [her]198-tess presence must have become to [him]3548-he ! [She]198-tess could not help addressing [Clare]200-clare .

" What have [I]198-tess done - what HAVE [I]198-tess done ! [I]198-tess have not told of anything that interferes with or belies [my]198-tess love for [you]200-clare . [You]200-clare do n't think [I]198-tess planned it , do [you]200-clare ? It is in [your]200-clare own mind what [you]200-clare are angry at , [Angel]200-clare ; it is not in [me]198-tess . O , it is not in [me]198-tess , and [I]198-tess am not [that deceitful woman [you]200-clare think [me]198-tess]7063-that deceitful woman you think me ! "[198-tess]

" H'm - well . Not deceitful , [[my]3565-you wife]5895-my wife ; but not the same . No , not the same . But do not make [me]3565-you reproach [you]200-clare . [I]3565-you have sworn that [I]3565-you will not ; and [I]3565-you will do everything to avoid it . "[3565-you]

But [she]3565-you went on pleading in [her]3565-you distraction ; and perhaps said things that would have been better left to silence .

" [Angel]200-clare ! - [Angel]200-clare ! [I]3565-you was [a child]1122-a child - [a child when it happened]7066-a child when it happened ! [I]3565-you knew nothing of [men]5841-men . "[3565-you]

" [You]3565-you were more sinned against than sinning , that [I]3565-you admit . "[3565-you]

" Then will [you]3565-you not forgive [me]3565-you ? "[3565-you]

" [I]3565-you do forgive [you]3565-you , but forgiveness is not all . "[3565-you]

" And love [me]3565-you ? "[3565-you]

To this question [he]3565-you did not answer .

" O [Angel]200-clare - [[my]3565-you mother]6050-my mother says that it sometimes happens so ! - [she]6050-my mother knows several cases where [they]7069-they were worse than [I]3565-you , and [the husband]7070-the husband has not minded it much - has got over it at least . And yet [the woman]674-the woman had not loved [him]7070-the husband as [I]3565-you do [you]3565-you ! "[3565-you]

" Do n't , [Tess]198-tess ; do n't argue . Different societies , different manners . [You]3565-you almost make [me]3565-you say [you]3565-you are [an unapprehending peasant woman , who have never been initiated into the proportions of social things]7072-an unapprehending peasant woman , who have never been initiated into the proportions of social things . [You]3565-you do n't know what [you]3565-you say . "[3565-you]

" [I]3565-you am only [a peasant]7073-a peasant by position , not by nature ! "[3565-you]

[She]3566-she spoke with an impulse to anger , but it went as it came .

" So much the worse for [you]3565-you . [I]3565-you think [that parson who unearthed [your]3565-you pedigree]7074-that parson who unearthed your pedigree would have done better if [he]7074-that parson who unearthed your pedigree had held [his]7074-that parson who unearthed your pedigree tongue . [I]3565-you can not help associating [your]3565-you decline as [a family]7075-a family with this other fact - of [your]3565-you want of firmness . Decrepit families imply decrepit wills , decrepit conduct . Heaven , why did [you]3565-you give [me]3565-you a handle for despising [you]3565-you more by informing [me]3565-you of [your]3565-you descent ! Here was [I]3565-you thinking [you]3565-you [a new - sprung child of nature]7076-a new - sprung child of nature ; there were [you]3565-you , the belated seedling of [an effete aristocracy]7077-an effete aristocracy ! "[3565-you]

" Lots of [families]814-families are as bad as [mine]3565-you in that ! [[Retty]311-retty 's family]7079-retty 's family were once [large landowners]7080-large landowners , and so were [Dairyman Billett]373-dairyman billett 's . And [the Debbyhouses]374-the debbyhouses , who now are [carters]7081-carters , were once [the De Bayeux family]375-the de bayeux family . [You]3565-you find such as [I]3567-i everywhere ; ' tis a feature of [our county]7082-our county , and [I]3567-i ca n't help it . "[3567-i]

" So much the worse for [the county]5889-the county . "[3567-i]

[She]3567-i took these reproaches in [their]3568-their bulk simply , not in [their]3568-their particulars ; [he]3569-she did not love [her]3567-i as [he]3569-she had loved [her]3567-i hitherto , and to all else [she]3567-i was indifferent .

[They]3568-their wandered on again in silence . It was said afterwards that [a cottager of [Wellbridge]17-wellbridge , who went out late that night for [a doctor]3571-a doctor]3570-a cottager of wellbridge , who went out late that night for a doctor , met [two lovers]3572-two lovers in [the pastures]2567-the pastures , walking very slowly , without converse , one behind the other , as in a funeral procession , and the glimpse that [he]3569-she obtained of [their]3572-two lovers faces seemed to denote that [they]3572-two lovers were anxious and sad . Returning later , [he]3569-she passed [them]3572-two lovers again in [the same field]3574-the same field , progressing just as slowly , and as regardless of the hour and of the cheerless night as before . It was only on account of [his]3569-she preoccupation with [his]3569-she own affairs , and the illness in [[his]3569-she house]1849-his house , that [he]3569-she did not bear in mind the curious incident , which , however , [he]3569-she recalled a long while after .

During the interval of [the cottager]3576-the cottager 's going and coming , [she]3567-i had said to [[her]3567-i husband]791-her husband -

" [I]3567-i do n't see how [I]3567-i can help being the cause of much misery to [you]3569-she all [your]3569-she life . [The river]1998-the river is down there . [I]3567-i can put an end to [myself]3567-i in it . [I]3567-i am not afraid . "[3567-i]

" [I]3569-she do n't wish to add murder to [my]3569-she other follies , "[3569-she] [he]3569-she said .

" [I]3567-i will leave something to show that [I]3567-i did it [myself]3567-i - on account of [my]3567-i shame . [They]7085-they will not blame [you]3569-she then . "[3567-i]

" Do n't speak so absurdly - [I]3567-i wish not to hear it . It is nonsense to have such thoughts in this kind of case , which is rather one for satirical laughter than for tragedy . [You]3569-she do n't in the least understand the quality of the mishap . It would be viewed in the light of a joke by nine - tenths of [the world]497-the world if it were known . Please oblige [me]3567-i by returning to [the house]652-the house , and going to bed . "[3567-i]

" [I]3569-she will , "[3569-she] said [she]3569-she dutifully .

[They]3578-they had rambled round by [a road]3579-a road which led to [the well - known ruins of [the Cistercian abbey behind [the mill]3582-the mill]3581-the cistercian abbey behind the mill]3580-the well - known ruins of the cistercian abbey behind the mill , the latter having , in centuries past , been attached to [the monastic establishment]3583-the monastic establishment . [The mill]3582-the mill still worked on , food being a perennial necessity ; [the abbey]3585-the abbey had perished , creeds being transient . [One]6172-one continually sees the ministration of the temporary outlasting the ministration of [the eternal]3587-the eternal . [Their]3578-they walk having been circuitous , [they]3578-they were still not far from [the house]652-the house , and in obeying [his]3589-he direction [she]3569-she only had to reach [the large stone bridge across [the main river]3591-the main river]3590-the large stone bridge across the main river and follow [the road]550-the road for a few yards . When [she]3569-she got back , everything remained as [she]3569-she had left [it]3593-it , the fire being still burning . [She]3569-she did not stay [downstairs]1128-downstairs for more than a minute , but proceeded to [[her]3569-she chamber]911-her chamber , whither the luggage had been taken . Here [she]3569-she sat down on the edge of the bed , looking blankly around , and presently began to undress . In removing the light towards the bedstead its rays fell upon the tester of white dimity ; something was hanging beneath it , and [she]3569-she lifted the candle to see what it was . A bough of mistletoe . [Angel]200-clare had put it there ; [she]3569-she knew that in an instant . This was the explanation of that mysterious parcel which it had been so difficult to pack and bring ; whose contents [he]3589-he would not explain to [her]3569-she , saying that time would soon show [her]3569-she the purpose thereof . In [his]3589-he zest and [his]3589-he gaiety [he]3589-he had hung it there . How foolish and inopportune that mistletoe looked now .

Having nothing more to fear , having scarce anything to hope , for that [he]3589-he would relent there seemed no promise whatever , [she]3569-she lay down dully . When sorrow ceases to be speculative , sleep sees [her]3569-she opportunity . Among so many happier moods which forbid repose this was a mood which welcomed it , and in a few minutes the lonely [Tess]198-tess forgot existence , surrounded by the aromatic stillness of [the chamber that had once , possibly , been [the bride - chamber of [her]198-tess own ancestry]3597-the bride - chamber of her own ancestry]3596-the chamber that had once , possibly , been the bride - chamber of her own ancestry .

Later on that night [Clare]200-clare also retraced [his]3589-he steps to [the house]652-the house . Entering softly to [the sitting - room]3599-the sitting - room [he]3589-he obtained a light , and with the manner of one who had considered [his]3589-he course [he]3589-he spread [his]3589-he rugs upon the old horse - hair sofa which stood there , and roughly shaped it to a sleeping - couch . Before lying down [he]3589-he crept shoeless [upstairs]762-upstairs , and listened at the door of [[her]3569-she apartment]3601-her apartment . [Her]3569-she measured breathing told that [she]3569-she was sleeping profoundly .

" Thank [God]222-god ! "[200-clare] murmured [Clare]200-clare ; and yet [he]3589-he was conscious of a pang of bitterness at the thought - approximately true , though not wholly so - that having shifted the burden of [her]3569-she life to [his]3589-he shoulders , [she]3569-she was now reposing without care .

[He]3589-he turned away to descend ; then , irresolute , faced round to [her]3569-she door again . In the act [he]3589-he caught sight of [one of [the d'Urberville dames]3603-the d'urberville dames , whose portrait was immediately over the entrance to [[Tess]198-tess 's bedchamber]3604-tess 's bedchamber]3602-one of the d'urberville dames , whose portrait was immediately over the entrance to tess 's bedchamber . In the candlelight the painting was more than unpleasant . Sinister design lurked in [the woman]674-the woman 's features , a concentrated purpose of revenge on the other sex - so it seemed to [him]3589-he then . The Caroline bodice of the portrait was low - precisely as [Tess]198-tess 's had been when [he]3589-he tucked it in to show the necklace ; and again [he]3589-he experienced the distressing sensation of a resemblance between [them]3606-them .

The check was sufficient . [He]3589-he resumed [his]3589-he retreat and descended .

[His]3589-he air remained calm and cold , [his]3589-he small compressed mouth indexing [his]3589-he powers of self - control ; [his]3589-he face wearing still that terrible sterile expression which had spread thereon since [her]198-tess disclosure . It was the face of [a man who was no longer passion 's slave , yet who found no advantage in [his]3589-he enfranchisement]3607-a man who was no longer passion 's slave , yet who found no advantage in his enfranchisement . [He]3589-he was simply regarding the harrowing contingencies of human experience , the unexpectedness of things . Nothing so pure , so sweet , so virginal as [Tess]198-tess had seemed possible all the long while that [he]3589-he had adored [her]198-tess , up to an hour ago ; but

The little less , and what worlds away !

[He]3589-he argued erroneously when [he]3589-he said to [himself]3589-he that [her]198-tess heart was not indexed in the honest freshness of [her]198-tess face ; but [Tess]198-tess had no advocate to set [him]3589-he right . Could it be possible , [he]3589-he continued , that eyes which as [they]3608-their gazed never expressed any divergence from what the tongue was telling , were yet ever seeing another world behind [her]198-tess ostensible one , discordant and contrasting ?

[He]3589-he reclined on [his]3589-he couch in [the sitting - room]3599-the sitting - room , and extinguished the light . The night came in , and took up its place there , unconcerned and indifferent ; the night which had already swallowed up [his]3589-he happiness , and was now digesting it listlessly ; and was ready to swallow up the happiness of [a thousand other people with as little disturbance or change of mien]3610-a thousand other people with as little disturbance or change of mien .

XXXVI

[Clare]200-clare arose in the light of a dawn that was ashy and furtive , as though associated with crime . The fireplace confronted [him]3589-he with its extinct embers ; the spread supper - table , whereon stood the two full glasses of untasted wine , now flat and filmy ; [her]198-tess vacated seat and [his]3589-he own ; the other articles of furniture , with [their]3608-their eternal look of not being able to help it , [their]3608-their intolerable inquiry what was to be done ? From above there was no sound ; but in a few minutes there came a knock at the door . [He]3589-he remembered that it would be [the neighbouring cottager 's wife]3611-the neighbouring cottager 's wife , who was to minister to [their]3612-they wants while [they]3612-they remained [here]5975-here .

The presence of [a third person]3614-a third person in [the house]652-the house would be extremely awkward just now , and , being already dressed , [he]3589-he opened the window and informed [her]198-tess that [they]3612-they could manage to shift for [themselves]3612-they that morning . [She]198-tess had a milk - can in [her]198-tess hand , which [he]3589-he told [her]198-tess to leave at the door . When [the dame]3616-the dame had gone away [he]3589-he searched in [the back quarters of [the house]652-the house]3617-the back quarters of the house for fuel , and speedily lit a fire . There was plenty of eggs , butter , bread , and so on in the larder , and [Clare]200-clare soon had breakfast laid , [his]3589-he experiences at [the dairy]1952-the dairy having rendered [him]3589-he facile in domestic preparations . The smoke of the kindled wood rose from the chimney without like a lotus - headed column ; [local people who were passing by]3620-local people who were passing by saw it , and thought of [the newly - married couple]3621-the newly - married couple , and envied [their]3621-the newly - married couple happiness .

[Angel]200-clare cast a final glance round , and then going to the foot of the stairs , called in a conventional voice -

" Breakfast is ready ! "[200-clare]

[He]3589-he opened the front door , and took a few steps in the morning air . When , after a short space , [he]3589-he came back [she]198-tess was already in [the sitting - room]3599-the sitting - room mechanically readjusting the breakfast things . As [she]198-tess was fully attired , and the interval since [his]3589-he calling [her]198-tess had been but two or three minutes , [she]198-tess must have been dressed or nearly so before [he]3589-he went to summon [her]198-tess . [Her]198-tess hair was twisted up in a large round mass at the back of [her]198-tess head , and [she]198-tess had put on one of the new frocks - a pale blue woollen garment with neck - frillings of white . [Her]198-tess hands and face appeared to be cold , and [she]198-tess had possibly been sitting dressed in [the bedroom]787-the bedroom a long time without any fire . The marked civility of [Clare]200-clare 's tone in calling [her]198-tess seemed to have inspired [her]198-tess , for the moment , with a new glimmer of hope . But it soon died when [she]198-tess looked at [him]3589-he .

[The pair]795-the pair were , in truth , but the ashes of [their]795-the pair former fires . To the hot sorrow of the previous night had succeeded heaviness ; it seemed as if nothing could kindle either of [them]795-the pair to fervour of sensation any more .

[He]3589-he spoke gently to [her]198-tess , and [she]198-tess replied with a like undemonstrativeness . At last [she]198-tess came up to [him]3589-he , looking in [his]3589-he sharply - defined face as one who had no consciousness that [her]198-tess own formed a visible object also .

" [Angel]200-clare ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , and paused , touching [him]3589-he with [her]198-tess fingers lightly as a breeze , as though [she]198-tess could hardly believe to be there in the flesh [the man who was once [her]198-tess lover]3625-the man who was once her lover . [Her]198-tess eyes were bright , [her]198-tess pale cheek still showed its wonted roundness , though half - dried tears had left glistening traces thereon ; and the usually ripe red mouth was almost as pale as [her]198-tess cheek . Throbbingly alive as [she]198-tess was still , under the stress of [her]198-tess mental grief the life beat so brokenly that a little further pull upon it would cause real illness , dull [her]198-tess characteristic eyes , and make [her]198-tess mouth thin .

[She]198-tess looked absolutely pure . [Nature]231-nature , in [her]231-nature fantastic trickery , had set such a seal of maidenhood upon [Tess]198-tess 's countenance that [he]3589-he gazed at [her]198-tess with a stupefied air .

" [Tess]198-tess ! Say it is not true ! No , it is not true ! "[3589-he]

" It is true . "[3589-he]

" Every word ? "[3589-he]

" Every word . "[3589-he]

[He]3589-he looked at [her]198-tess imploringly , as if [he]3589-he would willingly have taken a lie from [her]198-tess lips , knowing it to be one , and have made of it , by some sort of sophistry , a valid denial . However , [she]198-tess only repeated -

" It is true . "[198-tess]

" Is [he]3589-he living ? "[200-clare] [Angel]200-clare then asked .

" [The baby]666-the baby died . "[198-tess]

" But [the man]1516-the man ? "[198-tess]

" [He]3589-he is alive . "[198-tess]

A last despair passed over [Clare]200-clare 's face .

" Is [he]3589-he in [England]10-england ? "[198-tess]

" Yes . "[198-tess]

[He]3589-he took a few vague steps .

" [My]3589-he position - is this , "[3589-he] [he]3589-he said abruptly . " [I]3589-he thought - [any man]2461-any man would have thought - that by giving up all ambition to win [a wife with social standing , with fortune]7091-a wife with social standing , with fortune , with knowledge of [the world]497-the world , [I]3589-he should secure rustic innocence as surely as [I]3589-he should secure pink cheeks ; but - However , [I]3589-he am [no man]7093-no man to reproach [you]200-clare , and [I]3589-he will not . "[3589-he]

[Tess]198-tess felt [his]3589-he position so entirely that the remainder had not been needed . Therein lay just the distress of it ; [she]198-tess saw that [he]3589-he had lost all round .

" [Angel]200-clare - [I]198-tess should not have let it go on to marriage with [you]200-clare if [I]198-tess had not known that , after all , there was a last way out of it for [you]200-clare ; though [I]198-tess hoped [you]200-clare would never - "[198-tess]

[Her]198-tess voice grew husky .

" A last way ? "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess mean , to get rid of [me]198-tess . [You]200-clare CAN get rid of [me]198-tess . "[198-tess]

" How ? "[198-tess]

" By divorcing [me]198-tess . "[198-tess]

" Good heavens - how can [you]200-clare be so simple ! How can [I]198-tess divorce [you]200-clare ? "[198-tess]

" Ca n't [you]200-clare - now [I]198-tess have told [you]200-clare ? [I]198-tess thought [my]198-tess confession would give [you]200-clare grounds for that . "[198-tess]

" [O Tess]198-tess - [you]200-clare are too , too - childish - unformed - crude , [I]198-tess suppose ! [I]198-tess do n't know what [you]200-clare are . [You]200-clare do n't understand the law - [you]200-clare do n't understand ! "[198-tess]

" What - [you]200-clare can not ? "[198-tess]

" Indeed [I]198-tess can not . "[198-tess]

A quick shame mixed with the misery upon [[his]3626-his listener]3627-his listener 's face .

" [I]3627-his listener thought - [I]3627-his listener thought , "[3627-his listener] [she]3627-his listener whispered . " O , now [I]3627-his listener see how wicked [I]3627-his listener seem to [you]200-clare ! Believe [me]3627-his listener - believe [me]3627-his listener , on [my]3627-his listener soul , [I]3627-his listener never thought but that [you]200-clare could ! [I]3627-his listener hoped [you]200-clare would not ; yet [I]3627-his listener believed , without a doubt , that [you]200-clare could cast [me]3627-his listener off if [you]200-clare were determined , and did n't love [me]3627-his listener at - at - all ! "[3627-his listener]

" [You]3629-i were mistaken , "[3628-you] [he]3628-you said .

" O , then [I]3627-his listener ought to have done it , to have done it last night ! But [I]3627-his listener had n't the courage . That 's just like [me]3627-his listener ! "[3627-his listener]

" The courage to do what ? "[3627-his listener]

As [she]3629-i did not answer [he]3628-you took [her]3629-i by the hand .

" What were [you]3629-i thinking of doing ? "[3628-you] [he]3628-you inquired .

" Of putting an end to [myself]3627-his listener . "[3627-his listener]

" When ? "[3628-you]

[She]3629-i writhed under this inquisitorial manner of [his]3628-you . " Last night , "[3629-i] [she]3629-i answered .

" Where ? "[3627-his listener]

" Under [your]3628-you mistletoe . "[3627-his listener]

" [My]3628-you good - ! How ? "[3628-you] [he]3628-you asked sternly .

" [I]3629-i 'll tell [you]3628-you , if [you]3628-you wo n't be angry with [me]3629-i ! "[3629-i] [she]3629-i said , shrinking . " It was with the cord of [my]3629-i box . But [I]3629-i could not - do the last thing ! [I]3629-i was afraid that it might cause a scandal to [your]3628-you name . "[3629-i]

The unexpected quality of this confession , wrung from [her]3629-i , and not volunteered , shook [him]3628-you perceptibly . But [he]3628-you still held [her]3629-i , and , letting [his]3628-you glance fall from [her]3629-i face downwards , [he]3628-you said , " Now , listen to this . [You]3629-i must not dare to think of such a horrible thing ! How could [you]3629-i ! [You]3629-i will promise [me]3628-you as [[your]3629-i husband]6856-your husband to attempt that no more . "[3628-you]

" [I]3628-you am ready to promise . [I]3628-you saw how wicked it was . "[3628-you]

" Wicked ! The idea was unworthy of [you]3629-i beyond description . "[3628-you]

" But , [Angel]200-clare , "[3629-i] [she]3629-i pleaded , enlarging [her]3629-i eyes in calm unconcern upon [him]3628-you , " it was thought of entirely on [your]3628-you account - to set [you]3628-you free without the scandal of the divorce that [I]3629-i thought [you]3628-you would have to get . [I]3629-i should never have dreamt of doing it on [mine]3629-i . However , to do it with [my]3629-i own hand is too good for [me]3629-i , after all . It is [you]3628-you , [[my]3629-i ruined husband]7095-my ruined husband , who ought to strike the blow . [I]3629-i think [I]3629-i should love [you]3628-you more , if that were possible , if [you]3628-you could bring [yourself]3628-you to do it , since there 's no other way of escape for ' [ee]7096-ee . [I]3629-i feel [I]3629-i am so utterly worthless ! So very greatly in the way ! "[3629-i]

" Ssh ! "[3628-you]

" Well , since [you]3628-you say no , [I]3629-i wo n't . [I]3629-i have no wish opposed to [yours]3628-you . "[3629-i]

[He]3630-he knew this to be true enough . Since the desperation of the night [her]3631-her activities had dropped to zero , and there was no further rashness to be feared .

[Tess]198-tess tried to busy [herself]198-tess again over the breakfast - table with more or less success , and [they]3632-they sat down both on the same side , so that [their]3632-they glances did not meet . There was at first something awkward in hearing [each other]577-each other eat and drink , but this could not be escaped ; moreover , the amount of eating done was small on both sides . Breakfast over , [he]3630-he rose , and telling [her]198-tess the hour at which [he]3630-he might be expected to dinner , went off to [[the miller]3634-the miller 's]3635-the miller 's in a mechanical pursuance of the plan of studying that business , which had been [his]3630-he only practical reason for coming [here]5975-here .

When [he]3630-he was gone [Tess]198-tess stood at the window , and presently saw [his]3630-he form crossing [the great stone bridge which conducted to [the mill premises]3638-the mill premises]3637-the great stone bridge which conducted to the mill premises . [He]3630-he sank behind it , crossed [the railway beyond]3639-the railway beyond , and disappeared . Then , without a sigh , [she]198-tess turned [her]198-tess attention to [the room]778-the room , and began clearing the table and setting it in order .

[The charwoman]3463-the charwoman soon came . [Her]3463-the charwoman presence was at first a strain upon [Tess]198-tess , but afterwards an alleviation . At half - past twelve [she]198-tess left [[her]198-tess assistant]3642-her assistant alone in [the kitchen]2396-the kitchen , and , returning to [the sitting - room]3599-the sitting - room , waited for the reappearance of [Angel]200-clare 's form behind the bridge .

About one [he]3630-he showed [himself]3630-he . [Her]198-tess face flushed , although [he]3630-he was a quarter of a mile off . [She]198-tess ran to [the kitchen]2396-the kitchen to get the dinner served by the time [he]3630-he should enter . [He]3630-he went first to [the room where [they]3647-they had washed [their]3647-they hands together the day before]3646-the room where they had washed their hands together the day before , and as [he]3630-he entered [the sitting - room]3599-the sitting - room the dish - covers rose from the dishes as if by [his]3630-he own motion .

" How punctual ! "[3630-he] [he]3630-he said .

" Yes . [I]198-tess saw [you]3630-he coming over [the bridge]1389-the bridge , "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess .

The meal was passed in commonplace talk of what [he]3630-he had been doing during the morning at [the Abbey Mill]104-the abbey mill , of the methods of bolting and the old - fashioned machinery , which [he]3630-he feared would not enlighten [him]3630-he greatly on modern improved methods , some of it seeming to have been in use ever since the days it ground for [the monks in [the adjoining conventual buildings]3650-the adjoining conventual buildings]3649-the monks in the adjoining conventual buildings - now a heap of ruins . [He]3630-he left [the house]652-the house again in the course of an hour , coming [home]5850-home at dusk , and occupying [himself]3630-he through the evening with [his]3630-he papers . [She]198-tess feared [she]198-tess was in the way and , when [the old woman]1273-the old woman was gone , retired to [the kitchen]2396-the kitchen , where [she]198-tess made [herself]198-tess busy as well as [she]198-tess could for more than an hour .

[Clare]200-clare 's shape appeared at the door . " [You]198-tess must not work like this , "[3630-he] [he]3630-he said . " [You]198-tess are not [[my]3630-he servant]7098-my servant ; [you]198-tess are [[my]3630-he wife]5895-my wife . "[3630-he]

[She]198-tess raised [her]198-tess eyes , and brightened somewhat . " [I]198-tess may think [myself]198-tess that - indeed ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess murmured , in piteous raillery . " [You]3630-he mean in name ! Well , [I]198-tess do n't want to be anything more . "[198-tess]

" [You]198-tess MAY think so , [Tess]198-tess ! [You]198-tess are . What do [you]3630-he mean ? "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess do n't know , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said hastily , with tears in [her]198-tess accents . " [I]198-tess thought [I]198-tess - because [I]198-tess am not respectable , [I]198-tess mean . [I]198-tess told [you]3655-he [I]198-tess thought [I]198-tess was not respectable enough long ago - and on that account [I]198-tess did n't want to marry [you]3655-he , only - only [you]3655-he urged [me]198-tess ! "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess broke into sobs , and turned [her]198-tess back to [him]3655-he . It would almost have won round [any man but [Angel Clare]200-clare]3656-any man but angel clare . Within the remote depths of [his]3655-he constitution , so gentle and affectionate as [he]3655-he was in general , there lay hidden a hard logical deposit , like a vein of metal in a soft loam , which turned the edge of everything that attempted to traverse it . It had blocked [his]3655-he acceptance of [the Church]6443-the church ; it blocked [his]3655-he acceptance of [Tess]198-tess . Moreover , [his]3655-he affection itself was less fire than radiance , and , with regard to the other sex , when [he]3655-he ceased to believe [he]3655-he ceased to follow : contrasting in this with many impressionable natures , who remain sensuously infatuated with what [they]3658-they intellectually despise . [He]3655-he waited till [her]198-tess sobbing ceased .

" [I]3655-he wish [half the women in [England]10-england]7100-half the women in england were as respectable as [you]198-tess , "[3655-he] [he]3655-he said , in an ebullition of bitterness against [womankind]2354-womankind in general . " It is n't a question of respectability , but one of principle ! "[3655-he]

[He]3655-he spoke such things as these and more of a kindred sort to [her]198-tess , being still swayed by the antipathetic wave which warps direct souls with such persistence when once [their]3660-their vision finds itself mocked by appearances . There was , it is true , underneath , a back current of sympathy through which [a woman of [the world]497-the world]3661-a woman of the world might have conquered [him]3655-he . But [Tess]198-tess did not think of this ; [she]198-tess took everything as [her]198-tess deserts , and hardly opened [her]198-tess mouth . The firmness of [her]198-tess devotion to [him]3655-he was indeed almost pitiful ; quick - tempered as [she]198-tess naturally was , nothing that [he]3655-he could say made [her]198-tess unseemly ; [she]198-tess sought not [her]198-tess own ; was not provoked ; thought no evil of [his]3655-he treatment of [her]198-tess . [She]198-tess might just now have been [Apostolic Charity]376-apostolic charity [herself]198-tess returned to a self - seeking [modern world]3663-modern world .

This evening , night , and morning were passed precisely as the preceding ones had been passed . On one , and only one , occasion did [she]198-tess - [the formerly free and independent Tess]3664-the formerly free and independent tess - venture to make any advances . It was on the third occasion of [his]3655-he starting after a meal to go out to [the flour - mill]3665-the flour - mill . As [he]3655-he was leaving the table [he]3655-he said " Goodbye , "[3655-he] and [she]198-tess replied in the same words , at the same time inclining [her]198-tess mouth in the way of [his]3655-he . [He]3655-he did not avail [himself]3655-he of the invitation , saying , as [he]3655-he turned hastily aside -

" [I]3655-he shall be [home]5850-home punctually . "[3655-he]

[Tess]198-tess shrank into [herself]198-tess as if [she]198-tess had been struck . Often enough had [he]3655-he tried to reach those lips against [her]198-tess consent - often had [he]3655-he said gaily that [her]198-tess mouth and breath tasted of the butter and eggs and milk and honey on which [she]198-tess mainly lived , that [he]3655-he drew sustenance from them , and other follies of that sort . But [he]3655-he did not care for [them]3666-them now . [He]3655-he observed [her]198-tess sudden shrinking , and said gently -

" [You]198-tess know , [I]3655-he have to think of a course . It was imperative that [we]3668-they should stay together a little while , to avoid the scandal to [you]198-tess that would have resulted from [our]3668-they immediate parting . But [you]198-tess must see it is only for form 's sake . "[3655-he]

" Yes , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess absently .

[He]3655-he went out , and on [his]3655-he way to [the mill]3582-the mill stood still , and wished for a moment that [he]3655-he had responded yet more kindly , and kissed [her]198-tess once at least .

Thus [they]3668-they lived through this despairing day or two ; in [the same house]3669-the same house , truly ; but more widely apart than before [they]3668-they were [lovers]1460-lovers . It was evident to [her]198-tess that [he]3655-he was , as [he]3655-he had said , living with paralyzed activities in [his]3655-he endeavour to think of a plan of procedure . [She]198-tess was awe - stricken to discover such determination under such apparent flexibility . [His]3655-he consistency was , indeed , too cruel . [She]198-tess no longer expected forgiveness now . More than once [she]198-tess thought of going away from [him]3655-he during [his]3655-he absence at [the mill]3582-the mill ; but [she]198-tess feared that this , instead of benefiting [him]3655-he , might be the means of hampering and humiliating [him]3655-he yet more if it should become known .

Meanwhile [Clare]200-clare was meditating , verily . [His]3655-he thought had been unsuspended ; [he]3655-he was becoming ill with thinking ; eaten out with thinking , withered by thinking ; scourged out of all [his]3655-he former pulsating , flexuous domesticity . [He]3655-he walked about saying to [himself]3655-he , " What 's to be done - what 's to be done ? "[3655-he] and by chance [she]198-tess overheard [him]3655-he .
