It caused [her]198-tess to break the reserve about [their]3672-their future which had hitherto prevailed .

" [I]198-tess suppose - [you]3655-he are not going to live with [me]198-tess - long , are [you]3655-he , [Angel]200-clare ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess asked , the sunk corners of [her]198-tess mouth betraying how purely mechanical were the means by which [she]198-tess retained that expression of chastened calm upon [her]198-tess face .

" [I]3655-he can not "[3655-he] [he]3655-he said , " without despising [myself]3655-he , and what is worse , perhaps , despising [you]3655-he . [I]3655-he mean , of course , can not live with [you]3655-he in the ordinary sense . At present , whatever [I]3655-he feel , [I]3655-he do not despise [you]3655-he . And , let [me]3655-he speak plainly , or [you]3655-he may not see all [my]3655-he difficulties . How can [we]7102-we live together while [that man]7103-that man lives ? - [he]3655-he being [[your]3655-he husband]6856-your husband in nature , and not [I.]3655-he If [he]3655-he were dead it might be different ... Besides , that 's not all the difficulty ; it lies in another consideration - one bearing upon the future of [other people]7038-other people than [ourselves]7102-we . Think of years to come , and [children]660-children being born to [us]7102-we , and this past matter getting known - for it must get known . There is not an uttermost part of [the earth]1046-the earth but [somebody]6000-somebody comes from it or goes to it from elsewhere . Well , think of wretches of [our]7102-we flesh and blood growing up under a taunt which [they]7109-they will gradually get to feel the full force of with [their]7109-they expanding years . What an awakening for [them]7109-they ! What a prospect ! Can [you]3655-he honestly say ' Remain ' after contemplating this contingency ? Do n't [you]3655-he think [we]7102-we had better endure the ills [we]7102-we have than fly to [others]1383-others ? "[3655-he]

[Her]3673-i eyelids , weighted with trouble , continued drooping as before .

" [I]3673-i can not say ' Remain , ' "[3673-i] [she]3673-i answered , " [I]3673-i can not ; [I]3673-i had not thought so far . "[3673-i]

[Tess]198-tess 's feminine hope - shall [we]3674-we confess it ? - had been so obstinately recuperative as to revive in [her]198-tess surreptitious visions of a domiciliary intimacy continued long enough to break down [his]3675-his coldness even against [his]3675-his judgement . Though unsophisticated in the usual sense , [she]198-tess was not incomplete ; and it would have denoted deficiency of womanhood if [she]198-tess had not instinctively known what an argument lies in propinquity . Nothing else would serve [her]198-tess , [she]198-tess knew , if this failed . It was wrong to hope in what was of the nature of strategy , [she]198-tess said to [herself]198-tess : yet that sort of hope [she]198-tess could not extinguish . [His]3675-his last representation had now been made , and it was , as [she]198-tess said , a new view . [She]198-tess had truly never thought so far as that , and [his]3675-his lucid picture of possible offspring who would scorn [her]198-tess was one that brought deadly convictions to an honest heart which was humanitarian to its centre . Sheer experience had already taught [her]198-tess that in some circumstances there was one thing better than to lead a good life , and that was to be saved from leading any life whatever . Like [all who have been previsioned by suffering]3676-all who have been previsioned by suffering , [she]198-tess could , in the words of [M. Sully - Prudhomme]377-m. sully - prudhomme , hear a penal sentence in the fiat , " [You]200-clare shall be born , "[377-m. sully - prudhomme] particularly if addressed to potential issue of [hers]198-tess .

Yet such is the vulpine slyness of [Dame Nature]231-nature , that , till now , [Tess]198-tess had been hoodwinked by [her]198-tess love for [Clare]200-clare into forgetting it might result in vitalizations that would inflict upon [others]1383-others what [she]198-tess had bewailed as misfortune to [herself]198-tess .

[She]198-tess therefore could not withstand [his]3675-his argument . But with the self - combating proclivity of the supersensitive , an answer thereto arose in [Clare]200-clare 's own mind , and [he]3675-his almost feared it . It was based on [her]200-clare exceptional physical nature ; and [she]200-clare might have used it promisingly . [She]200-clare might have added besides : " On [an Australian upland]7111-an australian upland or [Texan plain]7112-texan plain , who is to know or care about [my]200-clare misfortunes , or to reproach [me]200-clare or [you]3675-his ? "[200-clare] Yet , like [the majority of [women]1628-women]3678-the majority of women , [she]200-clare accepted the momentary presentment as if it were the inevitable . And [she]200-clare may have been right . The intuitive heart of [woman]744-woman knoweth not only its own bitterness , but [its husband]3681-its husband 's , and even if these assumed reproaches were not likely to be addressed to [him]3675-his or to [his]3675-his by [strangers]568-strangers , [they]3683-they might have reached [his]3675-his ears from [his]3675-his own fastidious brain .

It was the third day of the estrangement . [Some]527-some might risk the odd paradox that with more animalism [he]3675-his would have been [the nobler man]3685-the nobler man . [We]3686-we do not say it . Yet [Clare]200-clare 's love was doubtless ethereal to a fault , imaginative to impracticability . With these natures , corporal presence is something less appealing than corporal absence ; the latter creating an ideal presence that conveniently drops the defects of the real . [She]200-clare found that [her]200-clare personality did not plead [her]200-clare cause so forcibly as [she]200-clare had anticipated . The figurative phrase was true : [she]200-clare was [another woman than the one who had excited [his]3675-his desire]3687-another woman than the one who had excited his desire .

" [I]200-clare have thought over what [you]3675-his say , "[200-clare] [she]200-clare remarked to [him]3675-his , moving [her]200-clare forefinger over the tablecloth , [her]200-clare other hand , which bore the ring that mocked [them]3688-we both , supporting [her]200-clare forehead . " It is quite true , all of it ; it must be . [You]3675-his must go away from [me]200-clare . "[200-clare]

" But what can [you]3675-his do ? "[200-clare]

" [I]200-clare can go [home]5850-home . "[200-clare]

[Clare]200-clare had not thought of that .

" Are [you]200-clare sure ? "[3675-his] [he]3675-his inquired .

" Quite sure . [We]3688-we ought to part , and [we]3688-we may as well get it past and done . [You]200-clare once said that [I]200-clare was apt to win [men]5841-men against [their]5841-men better judgement ; and if [I]200-clare am constantly before [your]200-clare eyes [I]200-clare may cause [you]200-clare to change [your]200-clare plans in opposition to [your]200-clare reason and wish ; and afterwards [your]200-clare repentance and [my]200-clare sorrow will be terrible . "[200-clare]

" And [you]3689-i would like to go [home]5850-home ? "[3675-his] [he]3675-his asked .

" [I]200-clare want to leave [you]3689-i , and go [home]5850-home . "[200-clare]

" Then it shall be so . "[200-clare]

Though [she]3689-i did not look up at [him]3675-his , [she]3689-i started . There was a difference between the proposition and the covenant , which [she]3689-i had felt only too quickly .

" [I]3689-i feared it would come to this , "[3689-i] [she]3689-i murmured , [her]3689-i countenance meekly fixed . " [I]3689-i do n't complain , [Angel]200-clare , [I]3689-i - [I]3689-i think it best . What [you]200-clare said has quite convinced [me]3689-i . Yes , though [nobody else]6245-nobody else should reproach [me]3689-i if [we]7118-we should stay together , yet somewhen , years hence , [you]200-clare might get angry with [me]3689-i for any ordinary matter , and knowing what [you]200-clare do of [[my]3689-i bygones]7119-my bygones , [you]200-clare [yourself]200-clare might be tempted to say words , and they might be overheard , perhaps by [[my]3689-i own children]7120-my own children . O , what only hurts [me]3689-i now would torture and kill [me]3689-i then ! [I]3689-i will go - to - morrow . "[3689-i]

" And [I]198-tess shall not stay [here]5975-here . Though [I]198-tess did n't like to initiate it , [I]198-tess have seen that it was advisable [we]7122-we should part - at least for a while , till [I]198-tess can better see the shape that things have taken , and can write to [you]198-tess . "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess stole a glance at [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband . [He]791-her husband was pale , even tremulous ; but , as before , [she]198-tess was appalled by the determination revealed in the depths of this gentle being [she]198-tess had married - the will to subdue the grosser to the subtler emotion , the substance to the conception , the flesh to the spirit . Propensities , tendencies , habits , were as dead leaves upon the tyrannous wind of [his]791-her husband imaginative ascendency .

[He]791-her husband may have observed [her]198-tess look , for [he]791-her husband explained -

" [I]791-her husband think of [people]5930-people more kindly when [I]791-her husband am away from [them]5930-people "[791-her husband] ; adding cynically , " God knows ; perhaps [we]3692-both will shake down together some day , for weariness ; [thousands]6486-thousands have done it ! "[791-her husband]

That day [he]791-her husband began to pack up , and [she]198-tess went [upstairs]762-upstairs and began to pack also . [Both]3692-both knew that it was in [their]3692-both two minds that [they]3692-both might part the next morning for ever , despite the gloss of assuaging conjectures thrown over [their]3692-both proceeding because [they]3692-both were of [the sort to whom any parting which has an air of finality]3693-the sort to whom any parting which has an air of finality is a torture . [He]791-her husband knew , and [she]198-tess knew , that , though the fascination which each had exercised over [the other]2085-the other - on [her]198-tess part independently of accomplishments - would probably in the first days of [their]3692-both separation be even more potent than ever , time must attenuate that effect ; the practical arguments against accepting [her]198-tess as [a housemate]3695-a housemate might pronounce themselves more strongly in the boreal light of a remoter view . Moreover , when [two people]2600-two people are once parted - have abandoned a common domicile and a common environment - new growths insensibly bud upward to fill [each vacated place]3697-each vacated place ; unforeseen accidents hinder intentions , and old plans are forgotten .

XXXVII

Midnight came and passed silently , for there was nothing to announce it in [the Valley of [the Froom]64-froom]3698-the valley of the froom .

Not long after one o'clock there was a slight creak in [the darkened farmhouse]3699-the darkened farmhouse once [the mansion of the d'Urbervilles]3700-the mansion of the d'urbervilles . [Tess]198-tess , who used [the upper chamber]3701-the upper chamber , heard it and awoke . It had come from the corner step of the staircase , which , as usual , was loosely nailed . [She]198-tess saw the door of [[her]198-tess bedroom]3158-her bedroom open , and the figure of [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband crossed the stream of moonlight with a curiously careful tread . [He]791-her husband was in [his]791-her husband shirt and trousers only , and [her]198-tess first flush of joy died when [she]198-tess perceived that [his]791-her husband eyes were fixed in an unnatural stare on vacancy . When [he]791-her husband reached the middle of [the room]778-the room [he]791-her husband stood still and murmured in tones of indescribable sadness -

" Dead ! dead ! dead ! "[791-her husband]

Under the influence of any strongly - disturbing force , [Clare]200-clare would occasionally walk in [his]791-her husband sleep , and even perform strange feats , such as [he]791-her husband had done on the night of [their]3705-their return from [market]2574-market just before [their]3705-their marriage , when [he]791-her husband re - enacted in [[his]791-her husband bedroom]3707-his bedroom [his]791-her husband combat with [the man who had insulted [her]198-tess]3708-the man who had insulted her . [Tess]198-tess saw that continued mental distress had wrought [him]791-her husband into that somnambulistic state now .

[Her]198-tess loyal confidence in [him]791-her husband lay so deep down in [her]198-tess heart , that , awake or asleep , [he]791-her husband inspired [her]198-tess with no sort of personal fear . If [he]791-her husband had entered with a pistol in [his]791-her husband hand [he]791-her husband would scarcely have disturbed [her]198-tess trust in [his]791-her husband protectiveness .

[Clare]200-clare came close , and bent over [her]198-tess . " Dead , dead , dead ! "[791-her husband] [he]791-her husband murmured .

After fixedly regarding [her]198-tess for some moments with the same gaze of unmeasurable woe , [he]791-her husband bent lower , enclosed [her]198-tess in [his]791-her husband arms , and rolled [her]198-tess in the sheet as in a shroud . Then lifting [her]198-tess from the bed with as much respect as one would show to a dead body , [he]791-her husband carried [her]198-tess across [the room]778-the room , murmuring -

" [[My]791-her husband poor , poor [Tess]198-tess]7125-my poor , poor tess - [[my]791-her husband dearest]6727-my dearest , darling [Tess]198-tess ! So sweet , so good , so true ! "[791-her husband]

The words of endearment , withheld so severely in [his]791-her husband waking hours , were inexpressibly sweet to [her]198-tess forlorn and hungry heart . If it had been to save [her]198-tess weary life [she]198-tess would not , by moving or struggling , have put an end to the position [she]198-tess found [herself]198-tess in . Thus [she]198-tess lay in absolute stillness , scarcely venturing to breathe , and , wondering what [he]791-her husband was going to do with [her]198-tess , suffered [herself]198-tess to be borne out upon [the landing]3318-the landing .

" [[My]791-her husband wife]5895-my wife - dead , dead ! "[791-her husband] [he]791-her husband said .

[He]791-her husband paused in [his]791-her husband labours for a moment to lean with [her]198-tess against the banister . Was [he]791-her husband going to throw [her]198-tess down ? Self - solicitude was near extinction in [her]198-tess , and in the knowledge that [he]791-her husband had planned to depart on the morrow , possibly for always , [she]198-tess lay in [his]791-her husband arms in this precarious position with a sense rather of luxury than of terror . If [they]3711-they could only fall together , and both be dashed to pieces , how fit , how desirable .

However , [he]791-her husband did not let [her]198-tess fall , but took advantage of the support of the handrail to imprint a kiss upon [her]198-tess lips - lips in the day - time scorned . Then [he]791-her husband clasped [her]198-tess with a renewed firmness of hold , and descended [the staircase]3712-the staircase . The creak of the loose stair did not awaken [him]791-her husband , and [they]3711-they reached the ground - floor safely . Freeing one of [his]791-her husband hands from [his]791-her husband grasp of [her]198-tess for a moment , [he]791-her husband slid back the door - bar and passed out , slightly striking [his]791-her husband stockinged toe against the edge of the door . But this [he]791-her husband seemed not to mind , and , having room for extension in the open air , [he]791-her husband lifted [her]198-tess against [his]791-her husband shoulder , so that [he]791-her husband could carry [her]198-tess with ease , the absence of clothes taking much from [his]791-her husband burden . Thus [he]791-her husband bore [her]198-tess off [the premises]755-the premises in [the direction of [the river]1998-the river]3714-the direction of the river a few yards distant .

[His]791-her husband ultimate intention , if [he]791-her husband had any , [she]198-tess had not yet divined ; and [she]198-tess found [herself]198-tess conjecturing on the matter as [a third person]3614-a third person might have done . So easefully had [she]198-tess delivered [her]198-tess whole being up to [him]791-her husband that it pleased [her]198-tess to think [he]791-her husband was regarding [her]198-tess as [his]791-her husband absolute possession , to dispose of as [he]791-her husband should choose . It was consoling , under the hovering terror of to - morrow 's separation , to feel that [he]791-her husband really recognized [her]198-tess now as [[his]791-her husband wife]819-his wife [Tess]198-tess , and did not cast [her]198-tess off , even if in that recognition [he]791-her husband went so far as to arrogate to [himself]791-her husband the right of harming [her]198-tess .

Ah ! now [she]198-tess knew what [he]791-her husband was dreaming of - that Sunday morning when [he]791-her husband had borne [her]198-tess along through [the water]2381-the water with [the other dairymaids]3719-the other dairymaids , who had loved [him]791-her husband nearly as much as [she]198-tess , if that were possible , which [Tess]198-tess could hardly admit . [Clare]200-clare did not cross [the bridge]1389-the bridge with [her]198-tess , but proceeding several paces on the same side towards [the adjoining mill]3721-the adjoining mill , at length stood still on [the brink of [the river]1998-the river]3722-the brink of the river .

[[Its]1998-the river waters]3724-its waters , in creeping down [these miles of meadowland]3725-these miles of meadowland , frequently divided , serpentining in purposeless curves , looping themselves around little islands that had no name , returning and re - embodying [themselves]3724-its waters as [a broad main stream further on]3726-a broad main stream further on . Opposite [the spot to which [he]791-her husband had brought [her]198-tess]3727-the spot to which he had brought her was such a general confluence , and [the river]1998-the river was proportionately voluminous and deep . Across [it]1998-the river was [a narrow foot - bridge]3729-a narrow foot - bridge ; but now the autumn flood had washed the handrail away , leaving the bare plank only , which , lying a few inches above the speeding current , formed a giddy pathway for even steady heads ; and [Tess]198-tess had noticed from the window of [the house]652-the house in [the day - time young men walking across upon [it]1998-the river]3731-the day - time young men walking across upon it as a feat in balancing . [[Her]198-tess husband]791-her husband had possibly observed the same performance ; anyhow , [he]791-her husband now mounted the plank , and , sliding one foot forward , advanced along it .

Was [he]791-her husband going to drown [her]198-tess ? Probably [he]791-her husband was . [The spot]2283-the spot was lonely , [the river]1998-the river deep and wide enough to make such a purpose easy of accomplishment . [He]791-her husband might drown [her]198-tess if [he]791-her husband would ; it would be better than parting to - morrow to lead severed lives .

[The swift stream]3735-the swift stream raced and gyrated under [them]3736-they , tossing , distorting , and splitting the moon 's reflected face . Spots of froth travelled past , and intercepted weeds waved behind the piles . If [they]3736-they could both fall together into the current now , [their]3736-they arms would be so tightly clasped together that [they]3736-they could not be saved ; [they]3736-they would go out of [the world]497-the world almost painlessly , and there would be no more reproach to [her]198-tess , or to [him]791-her husband for marrying [her]198-tess . [His]791-her husband last half - hour with [her]198-tess would have been a loving one , while if [they]3736-they lived till [he]791-her husband awoke , [his]791-her husband day - time aversion would return , and this hour would remain to be contemplated only as a transient dream .

The impulse stirred in [her]198-tess , yet [she]198-tess dared not indulge it , to make a movement that would have precipitated [them]3736-they both into [the gulf]3738-the gulf . How [she]198-tess valued [her]198-tess own life had been proved ; but [his]791-her husband - [she]198-tess had no right to tamper with it . [He]791-her husband reached the other side with [her]198-tess in safety .

Here [they]3736-they were within [a plantation which formed [the Abbey grounds]3740-the abbey grounds]3739-a plantation which formed the abbey grounds , and taking a new hold of [her]198-tess [he]791-her husband went onward a few steps till [they]3736-they reached [the ruined choir of [the Abbey - church]3742-the abbey - church]3741-the ruined choir of the abbey - church . Against the north wall was the empty stone coffin of [an abbot]3743-an abbot , in which [every tourist with a turn for grim humour]3744-every tourist with a turn for grim humour was accustomed to stretch [himself]3744-every tourist with a turn for grim humour . In [this Clare]3745-this clare carefully laid [Tess]198-tess . Having kissed [her]198-tess lips a second time [he]791-her husband breathed deeply , as if a greatly desired end were attained . [Clare]200-clare then lay down on the ground alongside , when [he]791-her husband immediately fell into the deep dead slumber of exhaustion , and remained motionless as a log . The spurt of mental excitement which had produced the effort was now over .

[Tess]198-tess sat up in the coffin . The night , though dry and mild for the season , was more than sufficiently cold to make it dangerous for [him]791-her husband to remain [here]5975-here long , in [his]791-her husband half - clothed state . If [he]791-her husband were left to [himself]791-her husband [he]791-her husband would in all probability stay [there]5839-there till the morning , and be chilled to certain death . [She]198-tess had heard of such deaths after sleep - walking . But how could [she]198-tess dare to awaken [him]791-her husband , and let [him]791-her husband know what [he]791-her husband had been doing , when it would mortify [him]791-her husband to discover [his]791-her husband folly in respect of [her]198-tess ? [Tess]198-tess , however , stepping out of [her]198-tess stone confine , shook [him]791-her husband slightly , but was unable to arouse [him]791-her husband without being violent . It was indispensable to do something , for [she]198-tess was beginning to shiver , the sheet being but a poor protection . [Her]198-tess excitement had in a measure kept [her]198-tess warm during the few minutes ' adventure ; but that beatific interval was over .

It suddenly occurred to [her]198-tess to try persuasion ; and accordingly [she]198-tess whispered in [his]791-her husband ear , with as much firmness and decision as [she]198-tess could summon -

" Let [us]7128-us walk on , [darling]6254-darling , "[198-tess] at the same time taking [him]791-her husband suggestively by the arm . To [her]198-tess relief , [he]791-her husband unresistingly acquiesced ; [her]198-tess words had apparently thrown [him]791-her husband back into [his]791-her husband dream , which thenceforward seemed to enter on a new phase , wherein [he]791-her husband fancied [she]198-tess had risen as a spirit , and was leading [him]791-her husband to [Heaven]6032-heaven . Thus [she]198-tess conducted [him]791-her husband by the arm to the stone bridge in front of [[their]3749-they residence]3750-their residence , crossing which [they]3749-they stood at [the manor - house]1255-the manor - house door . [Tess]198-tess 's feet were quite bare , and the stones hurt [her]198-tess , and chilled [her]198-tess to the bone ; but [Clare]200-clare was in [his]791-her husband woollen stockings , and appeared to feel no discomfort .

There was no further difficulty . [She]198-tess induced [him]791-her husband to lie down on [his]791-her husband own sofa bed , and covered [him]791-her husband up warmly , lighting a temporary fire of wood , to dry any dampness out of [him]791-her husband . The noise of these attentions [she]198-tess thought might awaken [him]791-her husband , and secretly wished that [they]3749-they might . But the exhaustion of [his]791-her husband mind and body was such that [he]791-her husband remained undisturbed .

As soon as [they]3749-they met the next morning [Tess]198-tess divined that [Angel]200-clare knew little or nothing of how far [she]198-tess had been concerned in the night 's excursion , though , as regarded [himself]791-her husband , [he]791-her husband may have been aware that [he]791-her husband had not lain still . In truth , [he]791-her husband had awakened that morning from a sleep deep as annihilation ; and during those first few moments in which the brain , like a Samson shaking [himself]791-her husband , is trying its strength , [he]791-her husband had some dim notion of an unusual nocturnal proceeding . But the realities of [his]791-her husband situation soon displaced conjecture on the other subject .

[He]791-her husband waited in expectancy to discern some mental pointing ; [he]791-her husband knew that if any intention of [his]791-her husband , concluded over - night , did not vanish in the light of morning , it stood on a basis approximating to one of pure reason , even if initiated by impulse of feeling ; that it was so far , therefore , to be trusted . [He]791-her husband thus beheld in the pale morning light the resolve to separate from [her]198-tess ; not as a hot and indignant instinct , but denuded of the passionateness which had made it scorch and burn ; standing in its bones ; nothing but a skeleton , but none the less there . [Clare]200-clare no longer hesitated .

At breakfast , and while [they]3749-they were packing the few remaining articles , [he]791-her husband showed [his]791-her husband weariness from the night 's effort so unmistakeably that [Tess]198-tess was on the point of revealing all that had happened ; but the reflection that it would anger [him]791-her husband , grieve [him]791-her husband , stultify [him]791-her husband , to know that [he]791-her husband had instinctively manifested a fondness for [her]198-tess of which [his]791-her husband common - sense did not approve , that [his]791-her husband inclination had compromised [his]791-her husband dignity when reason slept , again deterred [her]198-tess . It was too much like laughing at [a man]1337-a man when sober for [his]1337-a man erratic deeds during intoxication .

It just crossed [her]198-tess mind , too , that [he]791-her husband might have a faint recollection of [his]791-her husband tender vagary , and was disinclined to allude to it from a conviction that [she]198-tess would take amatory advantage of the opportunity it gave [her]198-tess of appealing to [him]791-her husband anew not to go .

[He]791-her husband had ordered by letter [a vehicle]3753-a vehicle from [the nearest town]3275-the nearest town , and soon after breakfast it arrived . [She]198-tess saw in it the beginning of the end - the temporary end , at least , for the revelation of [his]791-her husband tenderness by the incident of the night raised dreams of a possible future with [him]791-her husband . The luggage was put on the top , and [the man]1516-the man drove [them]3756-they off , [the miller]3634-the miller and [the old waiting - woman]3758-the old waiting - woman expressing some surprise at [their]3756-they precipitate departure , which [Clare]200-clare attributed to [his]791-her husband discovery that [the mill - work]3759-the mill - work was not of the modern kind which [he]791-her husband wished to investigate , a statement that was true so far as it went . Beyond this there was nothing in the manner of [their]3756-they leaving to suggest a fiasco , or that [they]3756-they were not going together to visit [friends]1681-friends .

[Their]3756-they route lay near [the dairy from which [they]3756-they had started with such solemn joy in [each other]577-each other a few days back]3761-the dairy from which they had started with such solemn joy in each other a few days back , and as [Clare]200-clare wished to wind up [his]791-her husband business with [Mr Crick]276-dairyman crick , [Tess]198-tess could hardly avoid paying [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick a call at the same time , unless [she]198-tess would excite suspicion of [their]3756-they unhappy state .

To make the call as unobtrusive as possible , [they]3756-they left [the carriage]5893-the carriage by [the wicket leading down from [the high road]543-the high road to [the dairy - house]2025-the dairy - house]3764-the wicket leading down from the high road to the dairy - house , and descended [the track]3767-the track on foot , side by side . The withy - bed had been cut , and [they]3756-they could see over the stumps the spot to which [Clare]200-clare had followed [her]198-tess when [he]791-her husband pressed [her]198-tess to be [[his]791-her husband wife]819-his wife ; to the left [the enclosure in which [she]198-tess had been fascinated by [his]791-her husband harp]3769-the enclosure in which she had been fascinated by his harp ; and far away behind [the cow - stalls the mead which had been the scene of [their]3756-they first embrace]3770-the cow - stalls the mead which had been the scene of their first embrace . The gold of the summer picture was now gray , the colours mean , the rich soil mud , and [the river]1998-the river cold .

Over the barton - gate [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman saw [them]3756-they , and came forward , throwing into [his]1900-the dairyman face the kind of jocularity deemed appropriate in [Talbothays]60-talbothays and its vicinity on the re - appearance of [the newly - married]3773-the newly - married . Then [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick emerged from [the house]652-the house , and [several others of [their]3756-they old acquaintance]3775-several others of their old acquaintance , though [Marian]310-marian and [Retty]311-retty did not seem to be there .

[Tess]198-tess valiantly bore [their]3756-they sly attacks and friendly humours , which affected [her]198-tess far otherwise than [they]3756-they supposed . In the tacit agreement of [husband]3776-husband and [wife]3777-wife to keep [their]3756-they estrangement a secret [they]3756-they behaved as would have been ordinary . And then , although [she]198-tess would rather there had been no word spoken on the subject , [Tess]198-tess had to hear in detail the story of [Marian]310-marian and [Retty]311-retty . [The later]3778-the later had gone [home]5850-home to [[her]198-tess father]557-her father 's , and [Marian]310-marian had left to look for employment elsewhere . [They]3756-they feared [she]198-tess would come to no good .

To dissipate the sadness of this recital [Tess]198-tess went and bade all [her]198-tess favourite cows goodbye , touching each of [them]3756-they with [her]198-tess hand , and as [she]198-tess and [Clare]200-clare stood side by side at leaving , as if united body and soul , there would have been something peculiarly sorry in [their]3756-they aspect to [one who should have seen it truly]3781-one who should have seen it truly ; two limbs of one life , as [they]3756-they outwardly were , [his]3782-his arm touching [hers]198-tess , [her]198-tess skirts touching [him]3782-his , facing one way , as against all the dairy facing the other , speaking in [their]3756-they adieux as " [we]7130-we "[3756-they] , and yet sundered like the poles . Perhaps something unusually stiff and embarrassed in [their]3756-they attitude , some awkwardness in acting up to [their]3756-they profession of unity , different from the natural shyness of [young couples]3783-young couples , may have been apparent , for when [they]3756-they were gone [Mrs Crick]283-mrs crick said to [[her]283-mrs crick husband]791-her husband -

" How onnatural the brightness of [her]198-tess eyes did seem , and how [they]3756-they stood like waxen images and talked as if [they]3756-they were in a dream ! Did n't it strike ' [ee]7131-ee that ' twas so ? [Tess]198-tess had always sommat strange in [her]198-tess , and [she]198-tess 's not now quite like [the proud young bride of [a well - be - doing man]7133-a well - be - doing man]7132-the proud young bride of a well - be - doing man . "[283-mrs crick]

[They]3756-they re - entered [the vehicle]836-the vehicle , and were driven along [the roads]928-the roads towards [Weatherbury]61-weatherbury and [Stagfoot Lane]54-stagfoot lane , till [they]3756-they reached [the Lane inn]3787-the lane inn , where [Clare]200-clare dismissed [the fly and man]3788-the fly and man . [They]3756-they rested [here]5975-here a while , and entering [the Vale]30-the vale were next driven onward towards [[her]200-clare home]1063-her home by [a stranger who did not know [their]3756-they relations]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations . At a midway point , when [Nuttlebury]106-nuttlebury had been passed , and where there were [cross - roads]3792-cross - roads , [Clare]200-clare stopped the conveyance and said to [Tess]198-tess that if [she]198-tess meant to return to [[[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's house]3794-her mother 's house it was here that [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations would leave [her]198-tess . As [they]3756-they could not talk with freedom in [the driver]1166-the driver 's presence [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations asked [her]198-tess to accompany [him]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations for a few steps on foot along [one of [the branch roads]3797-the branch roads]3796-one of the branch roads ; [she]198-tess assented , and directing [the man]1516-the man to wait a few minutes [they]3756-they strolled away .

" Now , let [us]3756-they understand [each other]577-each other , "[3791-a stranger who did not know their relations] [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations said gently . " There is no anger between [us]3756-they , though there is that which [I]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations can not endure at present . [I]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations will try to bring [myself]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations to endure it . [I]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations will let [you]198-tess know where [I]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations go to as soon as [I]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations know [myself]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations . And if [I]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations can bring [myself]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations to bear it - if it is desirable , possible - [I]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations will come to [you]198-tess . But until [I]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations come to [you]198-tess it will be better that [you]198-tess should not try to come to [me]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations . "[3791-a stranger who did not know their relations]

The severity of the decree seemed deadly to [Tess]198-tess ; [she]198-tess saw [his]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations view of [her]198-tess clearly enough ; [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations could regard [her]198-tess in no other light than that of [one who had practised gross deceit upon [him]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations]3799-one who had practised gross deceit upon him . Yet could [a woman who had done even what [she]3800-a woman who had done even what she had done had done]3800-a woman who had done even what she had done deserve all this ? But [she]198-tess could contest the point with [him]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations no further . [She]198-tess simply repeated after [him]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations [his]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations own words .

" Until [you]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations come to [me]198-tess [I]198-tess must not try to come to [you]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations ? "[198-tess]

" Just so . "[198-tess]

" May [I]198-tess write to [you]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations ? "[198-tess]

" O yes - if [you]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations are ill , or want anything at all . [I]198-tess hope that will not be the case ; so that it may happen that [I]198-tess write first to [you]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations . "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess agree to the conditions , [Angel]200-clare ; because [you]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations know best what [my]198-tess punishment ought to be ; only - only - do n't make it more than [I]198-tess can bear ! "[198-tess]

That was all [she]198-tess said on the matter . If [Tess]198-tess had been artful , had [she]198-tess made a scene , fainted , wept hysterically , in [that lonely lane]3801-that lonely lane , notwithstanding the fury of fastidiousness with which [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations was possessed , [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations would probably not have withstood [her]198-tess . But [her]198-tess mood of long - suffering made [his]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations way easy for [him]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations , and [she]198-tess [herself]198-tess was [[his]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations best advocate]3802-his best advocate . Pride , too , entered into [her]198-tess submission - which perhaps was a symptom of that reckless acquiescence in chance too apparent in [the whole d'Urberville family]3803-the whole d'urberville family - and the many effective chords which [she]198-tess could have stirred by an appeal were left untouched .

The remainder of [their]3804-their discourse was on practical matters only . [He]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations now handed [her]198-tess a packet containing a fairly good sum of money , which [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations had obtained from [[his]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations bankers]3805-his bankers for the purpose . The brilliants , the interest in which seemed to be [Tess]198-tess 's for [her]198-tess life only if [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations understood the wording of the will , [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations advised [her]198-tess to let [him]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations send to [a bank]3806-a bank for safety ; and to this [she]198-tess readily agreed .

These things arranged , [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations walked with [Tess]198-tess back to [the carriage]5893-the carriage , and handed [her]198-tess in . [The coachman]3808-the coachman was paid and told where to drive [her]198-tess . Taking next [his]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations own bag and umbrella - the sole articles [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations had brought with [him]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations hitherwards - [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations bade [her]198-tess goodbye ; and [they]3809-they parted there and then .

The fly moved creepingly up [a hill]3810-a hill , and [Clare]200-clare watched it go with an unpremeditated hope that [Tess]198-tess would look out of the window for one moment . But that [she]198-tess never thought of doing , would not have ventured to do , lying in a half - dead faint inside . Thus [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations beheld [her]198-tess recede , and in the anguish of [his]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations heart quoted a line from [a poet]3811-a poet , with peculiar emendations of [his]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations own -

[God]222-god 's NOT in [[his]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations heaven]3812-his heaven : All 's WRONG with [the world]497-the world !

When [Tess]198-tess had passed over [the crest of [the hill]642-the hill]3814-the crest of the hill [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations turned to go [his]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations own way , and hardly knew that [he]3791-a stranger who did not know their relations loved [her]198-tess still .

XXXVIII

As [she]198-tess drove on through [Blackmoor Vale]53-blackmoor vale , and the landscape of [her]198-tess youth began to open around [her]198-tess , [Tess]198-tess aroused [herself]198-tess from [her]198-tess stupor . [Her]198-tess first thought was how would [she]198-tess be able to face [[her]198-tess parents]873-her parents ?

[She]198-tess reached [a turnpike - gate which stood upon [the highway]598-the highway to [the village]473-the village]3817-a turnpike - gate which stood upon the highway to the village . [It]3817-a turnpike - gate which stood upon the highway to the village was thrown open by [a stranger]1085-a stranger , not by [the old man who had kept it for many years]3821-the old man who had kept it for many years , and to whom [she]198-tess had been known ; [he]3821-the old man who had kept it for many years had probably left on New Year 's Day , the date when such changes were made . Having received no intelligence lately from [[her]198-tess [home]5850-home]1063-her home , [she]198-tess asked [the turnpike - keeper]3824-the turnpike - keeper for news .

" Oh - nothing , [miss]7135-miss , "[3824-the turnpike - keeper] [he]3824-the turnpike - keeper answered . " [Marlott]21-marlott is [Marlott]21-marlott still . [Folks]6339-folks have died and that . [John Durbeyfield]192-john durbeyfield , too , [hev]192-john durbeyfield had [a daughter]2144-a daughter married this week to [a gentleman - farmer]7138-a gentleman - farmer ; not from [[John]192-john durbeyfield 's own house]7139-john 's own house , [you]7140-you know ; [they]7141-they was married elsewhere ; [the gentleman being of that high standing]7142-the gentleman being of that high standing that [[John]192-john durbeyfield 's own folk]7143-john 's own folk was not considered well - be - doing enough to have any part in it , [the bridegroom]7144-the bridegroom seeming not to know how't have been discovered that [John]192-john durbeyfield is [a old and ancient nobleman]7145-a old and ancient nobleman [himself]192-john durbeyfield by blood , with family skillentons in [[their]7143-john 's own folk own vaults]7146-their own vaults to this day , but done out of [[his]192-john durbeyfield property]7147-his property in the time o ' [the Romans]378-the romans . However , [Sir John]177-sir john , as [we]7148-we call ' n now , kept up the wedding - day as well as [he]177-sir john could , and stood treat to [everybody in [the parish]5847-the parish]7149-everybody in the parish ; and [[John]177-sir john 's wife]7151-john 's wife sung songs at [The Pure Drop]7152-the pure drop till past eleven o'clock . "[3824-the turnpike - keeper]

Hearing this , [Tess]198-tess felt so sick at heart that [she]198-tess could not decide to go [home]5850-home publicly in the fly with [her]198-tess luggage and belongings . [She]198-tess asked [the turnpike - keeper]3824-the turnpike - keeper if [she]198-tess might deposit [her]198-tess things at [[his]3824-the turnpike - keeper house]1849-his house for a while , and , on [his]3824-the turnpike - keeper offering no objection , [she]198-tess dismissed [[her]198-tess carriage]3828-her carriage , and went on to [the village]473-the village alone by [a back lane]3830-a back lane .

At sight of [[[her]198-tess father]557-her father 's chimney]3832-her father 's chimney [she]198-tess asked [herself]198-tess how [she]198-tess could possibly enter [the house]652-the house ? Inside [that cottage]3834-that cottage [[her]198-tess relations]3835-her relations were calmly supposing [her]198-tess far away on a wedding - tour with [a comparatively rich man]3836-a comparatively rich man , who was to conduct [her]198-tess to bouncing prosperity ; while [here]5975-here [she]198-tess was , friendless , creeping up to the old door quite by [herself]198-tess , with no better place to go to in [the world]497-the world .

[She]198-tess did not reach [the house]652-the house unobserved . Just by [the garden - hedge]3840-the garden - hedge [she]198-tess was met by [a girl who knew [her]198-tess]3841-a girl who knew her - [one of the two or three with whom [she]198-tess had been intimate at [school]927-school]3842-one of the two or three with whom she had been intimate at school . After making a few inquiries as to how [Tess]198-tess came [there]5839-there , [[her]198-tess friend]3163-her friend , unheeding [her]3163-her friend tragic look , interrupted with -

" But where 's [thy gentleman]7153-thy gentleman , [Tess]198-tess ? "[3163-her friend]

[Tess]198-tess hastily explained that [he]3163-her friend had been called away on business , and , leaving [[her]198-tess interlocutor]3846-her interlocutor , clambered over [the garden - hedge]3840-the garden - hedge , and thus made [her]198-tess way to [the house]652-the house .

As [she]198-tess went up [the garden - path]3849-the garden - path [she]198-tess heard [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother singing by the back door , coming in sight of which [she]198-tess perceived [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield on the doorstep in the act of wringing a sheet . Having performed this without observing [Tess]198-tess , [she]658-her mother went indoors , and [[her]658-her mother daughter]669-her daughter followed [her]658-her mother .

[The washing - tub]3852-the washing - tub stood in the same old place on [the same old quarter - hogshead]3853-the same old quarter - hogshead , and [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother , having thrown the sheet aside , was about to plunge [her]658-her mother arms in anew .

" Why - [Tess]198-tess ! - [my]658-her mother chil ' - [I]658-her mother thought [you]198-tess was married ! - married really and truly this time - [we]7154-we sent the cider - "[658-her mother]

" Yes , [mother]5917-mother ; so [I]658-her mother am . "[658-her mother]

" Going to be ? "[658-her mother]

" No - [I]658-her mother am married . "[658-her mother]

" Married ! Then where 's [[thy]198-tess husband]7156-thy husband ? "[658-her mother]

" Oh , [he]7156-thy husband 's gone away for a time . "[658-her mother]

" Gone away ! When was [you]198-tess married , then ? The day [you]198-tess said ? "[658-her mother]

" Yes , Tuesday , [mother]5917-mother . "[658-her mother]

" And now ' tis on'y Saturday , and [he]7156-thy husband gone away ? "[658-her mother]

" Yes , [he]7156-thy husband 's gone . "[658-her mother]

" What 's the meaning o ' that ? ' Nation seize such husbands as [you]198-tess seem to get , say [I]658-her mother ! "[658-her mother]

" [Mother]5917-mother ! "[198-tess] [Tess]198-tess went across to [Joan Durbeyfield]205-joan , laid [her]198-tess face upon [the matron]668-the matron 's bosom , and burst into sobs . " [I]658-her mother do n't know how to tell ' [ee]668-the matron , [mother]5917-mother ! [You]5917-mother said to [me]658-her mother , and wrote to [me]658-her mother , that [I]658-her mother was not to tell [him]7156-thy husband . But [I]658-her mother did tell [him]7156-thy husband - [I]658-her mother could n't help it - and [he]7156-thy husband went away ! "[658-her mother]

" O [[you]198-tess little fool]7160-you little fool - [you little fool]7160-you little fool ! "[180-mrs durbeyfield] burst out [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield , splashing [Tess]198-tess and [herself]198-tess in [her]198-tess agitation . " [My]198-tess good God ! that ever [I]198-tess should ha ' lived to say it , but [I]198-tess say it again , [[you]198-tess little fool]7160-you little fool ! "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess was convulsed with weeping , the tension of so many days having relaxed at last .

" [I]198-tess know it - [I]198-tess know - [I]198-tess know ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess gasped through [her]198-tess sobs . " But , O [[my]198-tess mother]6050-my mother , [I]198-tess could not help it ! [He]7164-him was so good - and [I]198-tess felt the wickedness of trying to blind [him]7164-him as to what had happened ! If - if - it were to be done again - [I]198-tess should do the same . [I]198-tess could not - [I]198-tess dared not - so sin - against [him]7164-him ! "[198-tess]

" But [you]198-tess sinned enough to marry [him]7164-him first ! "[198-tess]

" Yes , yes ; that 's where [my]198-tess misery do lie ! But [I]198-tess thought [he]7164-him could get rid o ' [me]198-tess by law if [he]7164-him were determined not to overlook it . And O , if [you]198-tess knew - if [you]198-tess could only half know how [I]198-tess loved [him]7164-him - how anxious [I]198-tess was to have [him]7164-him - and how wrung [I]198-tess was between caring so much for [him]7164-him and [my]198-tess wish to be fair to [him]7164-him ! "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess was so shaken that [she]198-tess could get no further , and sank , a helpless thing , into a chair .

" Well , well ; what 's done ca n't be undone ! [I]198-tess 'm sure [I]198-tess do n't know why [children o ' [my]198-tess bringing forth]7165-children o ' my bringing forth should all be [bigger simpletons]7166-bigger simpletons than [other people]7038-other people 's - not to know better than to blab such a thing as that , when [he]7164-him could n't [ha]7168-ha ' found it out till too late ! "[198-tess] Here [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield began shedding tears on [her]180-mrs durbeyfield own account as [a mother]3856-a mother to be pitied . " What [[your]198-tess father]5918-your father will say [I]180-mrs durbeyfield do n't know , "[180-mrs durbeyfield] [she]180-mrs durbeyfield continued ; " for [he]5918-your father 's been talking about the wedding up at [Rolliver 's]211-rolliver and The Pure Drop every day since , and about [[his]5918-your father family]5890-his family getting back to [their]5890-his family rightful position through [you]198-tess - [poor silly man]7171-poor silly man ! - and now [you]198-tess 've made this mess of it ! [The Lord]7172-the lord - [a - Lord]7173-a - lord ! "[180-mrs durbeyfield]

As if to bring matters to a focus , [[Tess]198-tess 's father]1861-tess 's father was heard approaching at that moment . [He]1861-tess 's father did not , however , enter immediately , and [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield said that [she]180-mrs durbeyfield would break the bad news to [him]1861-tess 's father [herself]180-mrs durbeyfield , [Tess]198-tess keeping out of sight for the present . After [her]180-mrs durbeyfield first burst of disappointment [Joan]205-joan began to take the mishap as [she]205-joan had taken [Tess]198-tess 's original trouble , as [she]205-joan would have taken a wet holiday or failure in the potato - crop ; as a thing which had come upon [them]3858-them irrespective of desert or folly ; a chance external impingement to be borne with ; not a lesson .

[Tess]198-tess retreated [upstairs]762-upstairs and beheld casually that the beds had been shifted , and new arrangements made . [[Her]198-tess old bed]3860-her old bed had been adapted for [two younger children]3861-two younger children . There was no place here for [her]198-tess now .

[The room below]801-the room below being unceiled [she]198-tess could hear most of what went on [there]5839-there . Presently [[her]198-tess father]557-her father entered , apparently carrying in a live hen . [He]1861-tess 's father was [a foot - haggler]3865-a foot - haggler now , having been obliged to sell [his]1861-tess 's father second horse , and [he]1861-tess 's father travelled with [his]1861-tess 's father basket on [his]1861-tess 's father arm . The hen had been carried about this morning as it was often carried , to show [people]5930-people that [he]1861-tess 's father was in [his]1861-tess 's father work , though it had lain , with its legs tied , under the table at Rolliver 's for more than an hour .

" [We]7174-we 've just had up a story about - "[180-mrs durbeyfield] [Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield began , and thereupon related in detail to [[his]1861-tess 's father wife]819-his wife a discussion which had arisen at [the inn]697-the inn about [the clergy]3869-the clergy , originated by the fact of [[his]1861-tess 's father daughter]3870-his daughter having married into [a clerical family]3871-a clerical family . " [They]7175-they was formerly styled ' [sir]5821-sir ' , like [my]1861-tess 's father own ancestry , "[1861-tess 's father] [he]1861-tess 's father said , " though nowadays [their]7175-they true style , strictly speaking , is ' [clerk]7177-clerk ' only . "[1861-tess 's father] As [Tess]198-tess had wished that no great publicity should be given to the event , [he]1861-tess 's father had mentioned no particulars . [He]1861-tess 's father hoped [she]198-tess would remove that prohibition soon . [He]1861-tess 's father proposed that [the couple]3872-the couple should take [Tess]198-tess 's own name , d'Urberville , as uncorrupted . It was better than [[her]198-tess husbands]3873-her husbands 's . [He]1861-tess 's father asked if any letter had come from [her]198-tess that day .

Then [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield informed [him]1861-tess 's father that no letter had come , but [Tess]198-tess unfortunately had come [herself]198-tess .

When at length the collapse was explained to [him]1861-tess 's father , a sullen mortification , not usual with [Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield , overpowered the influence of the cheering glass . Yet the intrinsic quality of the event moved [his]1861-tess 's father touchy sensitiveness less than its conjectured effect upon the minds of [others]1383-others .

" To think , now , that this was to be the end o't ! "[177-sir john] said [Sir John]177-sir john . " And [I]177-sir john with [a family vault under [that there church of [Kingsbere]12-kingsbere as big as [Squire Jollard]379-squire jollard 's ale - cellar]7179-that there church of kingsbere as big as squire jollard 's ale - cellar]7178-a family vault under that there church of kingsbere as big as squire jollard 's ale - cellar , and [[my]177-sir john folk]7180-my folk lying there in sixes and sevens , as genuine county bones and marrow as any recorded in history . And now to be sure what [they]7180-my folk fellers at [Rolliver]211-rolliver 's and [The Pure Drop]380-the pure drop will say to [me]177-sir john ! How [they]7180-my folk 'll squint and glane , and say , ' This is [yer]180-mrs durbeyfield mighty match is it ; this is [yer]180-mrs durbeyfield getting back to the true level of [[yer]180-mrs durbeyfield forefathers]7181-yer forefathers in King Norman 's time ! ' [I]177-sir john feel this is too much , [Joan]205-joan ; [I]177-sir john shall put an end to [myself]177-sir john , title and all - [I]177-sir john can bear it no longer ! ... But [she]205-joan can make [him]177-sir john keep [her]205-joan if [he]177-sir john 's married [her]205-joan ? "[177-sir john]

" Why , yes . But [she]205-joan wo n't think o ' doing that . "[180-mrs durbeyfield]

" [D'ye]381-d'ye think [he]177-sir john really have married [her]205-joan ? - or is it like the first - "[177-sir john]

[Poor Tess]198-tess , who had heard as far as this , could not bear to hear more . The perception that [her]198-tess word could be doubted even here , in [[her]198-tess own parental house]3875-her own parental house , set [her]198-tess mind against the spot as nothing else could have done . How unexpected were the attacks of destiny ! And if [[her]198-tess father]557-her father doubted [her]198-tess a little , would not [neighbours]3877-neighbours and acquaintance doubt [her]198-tess much ? O , [she]198-tess could not live long at [home]5850-home !

A few days , accordingly , were all that [she]198-tess allowed [herself]198-tess here , at the end of which time [she]198-tess received a short note from [Clare]200-clare , informing [her]198-tess that [he]557-her father had gone to [the North of [England]10-england]3879-the north of england to look at [a farm]3880-a farm . In [her]198-tess craving for the lustre of [her]198-tess true position as [[his]557-her father wife]819-his wife , and to hide from [[her]198-tess parents]873-her parents the vast extent of the division between [them]873-her parents , [she]198-tess made use of this letter as [her]198-tess reason for again departing , leaving [them]873-her parents under the impression that [she]198-tess was setting out to join [him]557-her father . Still further to screen [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband from any imputation of unkindness to [her]198-tess , [she]198-tess took twenty - five of the fifty pounds [Clare]200-clare had given [her]198-tess , and handed the sum over to [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother , as if [the wife of [a man like [Angel Clare]200-clare]3886-a man like angel clare]3885-the wife of a man like angel clare could well afford it , saying that it was a slight return for the trouble and humiliation [she]198-tess had brought upon [them]873-her parents in years past . With this assertion of [her]198-tess dignity [she]198-tess bade [them]873-her parents farewell ; and after that there were lively doings in [the Durbeyfield household]729-the durbeyfield household for some time on the strength of [Tess]198-tess 's bounty , [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother saying , and , indeed , believing , that the rupture which had arisen between [the young husband]3889-the young husband and [wife]3777-wife had adjusted itself under [their]873-her parents strong feeling that [they]873-her parents could not live apart from each other .

XXXIX

It was three weeks after the marriage that [Clare]200-clare found [himself]200-clare descending [the hill]642-the hill which led to [the well - known parsonage of [[his]3889-the young husband father]457-his father]3892-the well - known parsonage of his father . With [his]3889-the young husband downward course [the tower of [the church]6443-the church]3894-the tower of the church rose into the evening sky in a manner of inquiry as to why [he]3889-the young husband had come ; and [no living person in [the twilighted town]3897-the twilighted town]3896-no living person in the twilighted town seemed to notice [him]3889-the young husband , still less to expect [him]3889-the young husband . [He]3889-the young husband was arriving like a ghost , and the sound of [his]3889-the young husband own footsteps was almost an encumbrance to be got rid of .

The picture of life had changed for [him]3889-the young husband . Before this time [he]3889-the young husband had known it but speculatively ; now [he]3889-the young husband thought [he]3889-the young husband knew it as [a practical man]2607-a practical man ; though perhaps [he]3889-the young husband did not , even yet . [Nevertheless humanity]382-nevertheless humanity stood before [him]3889-the young husband no longer in the pensive sweetness of Italian art , but in the staring and ghastly attitudes of [a Wiertz Museum]3899-a wiertz museum , and with the leer of a study by [Van Beers]383-van beers .

[His]3889-the young husband conduct during these first weeks had been desultory beyond description . After mechanically attempting to pursue [his]3889-the young husband agricultural plans as though nothing unusual had happened , in the manner recommended by [the great and wise men of all ages]3900-the great and wise men of all ages , [he]3889-the young husband concluded that [very few of [those great and wise men]3902-those great and wise men]3901-very few of those great and wise men had ever gone so far outside [themselves]3901-very few of those great and wise men as to test the feasibility of [their]3901-very few of those great and wise men counsel . " This is the chief thing : be not perturbed , "[3903-the pagan moralist] said [the Pagan moralist]3903-the pagan moralist . That was just [Clare]200-clare 's own opinion . But [he]3889-the young husband was perturbed . " Let not [your]3889-the young husband heart be troubled , neither let it be afraid , "[384-the nazarene] said [the Nazarene]384-the nazarene . [Clare]200-clare chimed in cordially ; but [his]3889-the young husband heart was troubled all the same . How [he]3889-the young husband would have liked to confront [those two great thinkers]3904-those two great thinkers , and earnestly appeal to [them]3904-those two great thinkers as [fellow - man to [fellow - men]3906-fellow - men]3905-fellow - man to fellow - men , and ask [them]3904-those two great thinkers to tell [him]3889-the young husband [their]3904-those two great thinkers method !

[His]3889-the young husband mood transmuted itself into a dogged indifference till at length [he]3889-the young husband fancied [he]3889-the young husband was looking on [his]3889-the young husband own existence with the passive interest of [an outsider]3907-an outsider .

[He]3889-the young husband was embittered by the conviction that all this desolation had been brought about by the accident of [her]3908-her being [a d'Urberville]3349-a d'urberville . When [he]3889-the young husband found that [Tess]198-tess came of that exhausted ancient line , and was not of the new tribes from below , as [he]3889-the young husband had fondly dreamed , why had [he]3889-the young husband not stoically abandoned [her]198-tess in fidelity to [his]3889-the young husband principles ? This was what [he]3889-the young husband had got by apostasy , and [his]3889-the young husband punishment was deserved .

Then [he]3889-the young husband became weary and anxious , and [his]3889-the young husband anxiety increased . [He]3889-the young husband wondered if [he]3889-the young husband had treated [her]198-tess unfairly . [He]3889-the young husband ate without knowing that [he]3889-the young husband ate , and drank without tasting . As the hours dropped past , as the motive of each act in the long series of bygone days presented itself to [his]3889-the young husband view , [he]3889-the young husband perceived how intimately the notion of having [Tess]198-tess as a dear possession was mixed up with all [his]3889-the young husband schemes and words and ways .

In going hither and [thither]3910-thither [he]3889-the young husband observed in [the outskirts of [a small town]3912-a small town]3911-the outskirts of a small town a red - and - blue placard setting forth the great advantages of [the Empire of]3913-the empire of [Brazil]109-brazil as [a field for [the emigrating agriculturist]3915-the emigrating agriculturist]3914-a field for the emigrating agriculturist . [Land]95-the land was offered [there]5839-there on exceptionally advantageous terms . [Brazil]109-brazil somewhat attracted [him]3889-the young husband as a new idea . [Tess]198-tess could eventually join [him]3889-the young husband [there]5839-there , and perhaps in [that country of]3918-that country of contrasting scenes and notions and habits the conventions would not be so operative which made life with [her]198-tess seem impracticable to [him]3889-the young husband [here]5975-here . In brief [he]3889-the young husband was strongly inclined to try [Brazil]109-brazil , especially as the season for going thither was just at hand .

With this view [he]3889-the young husband was returning to [Emminster]72-emminster to disclose [his]3889-the young husband plan to [[his]3889-the young husband parents]746-his parents , and to make the best explanation [he]3889-the young husband could make of arriving without [Tess]198-tess , short of revealing what had actually separated [them]746-his parents . As [he]3889-the young husband reached the door the new moon shone upon [his]3889-the young husband face , just as [the old one]3921-the old one had done in the small hours of that morning when [he]3889-the young husband had carried [[his]3889-the young husband wife]819-his wife in [his]3889-the young husband arms across [the river]1998-the river to [the graveyard of [the monks]3925-the monks]3924-the graveyard of the monks ; but [his]3889-the young husband face was thinner now .

[Clare]200-clare had given [[his]3889-the young husband parents]746-his parents no warning of [his]3889-the young husband visit , and [his]3889-the young husband arrival stirred the atmosphere of [the Vicarage]2162-the vicarage as the dive of the kingfisher stirs [a quiet pool]3928-a quiet pool . [[His]3889-the young husband father]457-his father and [mother]5917-mother were both in [the drawing - room]3931-the drawing - room , but [neither of [[his]3889-the young husband brothers]634-his brothers]3932-neither of his brothers was now at [home]5850-home . [Angel]200-clare entered , and closed the door quietly behind [him]3889-the young husband .

" But - where 's [[your]3889-the young husband wife]6687-your wife , [dear Angel]200-clare ? "[6090-his mother] cried [[his]3889-the young husband mother]6090-his mother . " How [you]3889-the young husband surprise [us]7183-we ! "[6090-his mother]

" [She]6687-your wife is at [[her]6687-your wife mother]658-her mother 's - temporarily . [I]200-clare have come [home]5850-home rather in a hurry because [I]200-clare 've decided to go to [Brazil]109-brazil . "[200-clare]

" [Brazil]109-brazil ! Why [they]7186-they are [all Roman Catholics]7187-all roman catholics there surely ! "[6090-his mother]

" Are [they]7186-they ? [I]200-clare had n't thought of that . "[200-clare]

But even the novelty and painfulness of [his]3889-the young husband going to [a Papistical land]3936-a papistical land could not displace for long [Mr]3937-mr and [Mrs Clare]200-clare 's natural interest in [[their]3938-their son]2831-their son 's marriage .

" [We]7183-we had [your]3889-the young husband brief note three weeks ago announcing that it had taken place , "[200-clare] said [Mrs Clare]200-clare , " and [[your]3889-the young husband father]5918-your father sent [[your]3889-the young husband godmother]3490-your godmother 's gift to [her]3490-your godmother , as [you]3889-the young husband know . Yet [I]200-clare wish [I]200-clare could have seen [her]3490-your godmother first , [Angel]200-clare , or have known a little more about [her]3490-your godmother . [We]7183-we sent [her]3490-your godmother no present of [our]7183-we own , not knowing what would best give [her]3490-your godmother pleasure , but [you]3889-the young husband must suppose it only delayed . [Angel]200-clare , there is no irritation in [my]200-clare mind or [[your]3889-the young husband father]5918-your father 's against [you]3889-the young husband for this marriage ; but [we]7183-we have thought it much better to reserve [our]7183-we liking for [[your]3889-the young husband wife]6687-your wife till [we]7183-we could see [her]3490-your godmother . And now [you]3889-the young husband have not brought [her]3490-your godmother . It seems strange . What has happened ? "[200-clare]

[He]3940-he replied that it had been thought best by [them]3941-them that [she]3942-she should to go [[[her]3942-she parents]873-her parents ' home]3944-her parents ' home for the present , whilst [he]3940-he came [there]5839-there .

" [I]3940-he do n't mind telling [you]6687-your wife , [dear mother]7197-dear mother , "[3940-he] [he]3940-he said , " that [I]3940-he always meant to keep [her]3490-your godmother away from [this house]6327-this house till [I]3940-he should feel [she]3490-your godmother could some with credit to [you]6687-your wife . [She]3490-your godmother will remain at [[her]3490-your godmother mother]658-her mother 's till [I]3940-he come back . "[3940-he]

" And [I]3940-he shall not see [her]3490-your godmother before [you]3940-he start ? "[3940-he]

[He]3940-he was afraid [they]3946-they would not . [His]3940-he original plan had been , as [he]3940-he had said , to refrain from bringing [her]3947-her [there]5839-there for some little while - not to wound [their]3946-they prejudices - feelings - in any way ; and for other reasons [he]3940-he had adhered to it . [He]3940-he would have to visit [home]5850-home in the course of a year , if [he]3940-he went out at once ; and it would be possible for [them]3946-they to see [her]3947-her before [he]3940-he started a second time - with [her]3947-her .

A hastily prepared supper was brought in , and [Clare]200-clare made further exposition of [his]3940-he plans . [[His]3940-he mother]6090-his mother 's disappointment at not seeing [the bride]2563-the bride still remained with [her]6090-his mother . [Clare]200-clare 's late enthusiasm for [Tess]198-tess had infected [her]6090-his mother through [her]6090-his mother maternal sympathies , till [she]6090-his mother had almost fancied that a good thing could come out of [Nazareth]111-nazareth - [a charming woman out of [Talbothays Dairy]73-talbothays dairy]3952-a charming woman out of talbothays dairy . [She]6090-his mother watched [[her]6090-his mother son]6089-her son as [he]6089-her son ate .

" Can not [you]6089-her son describe [her]2563-the bride ? [I]6090-his mother am sure [she]2563-the bride is very pretty , [Angel]200-clare . "[6090-his mother]

"[6090-his mother]

"[6090-his mother]

" [I]1858-the vicar think , since [Angel]200-clare has come , that it will be more appropriate to read the thirty - first of Proverbs than the chapter which [we]7209-we should have had in the usual course of [our]7209-we reading ? "[1858-the vicar]

[We]7209-we shall not need to be reminded to apply the words to the absent one . May Heaven shield [her]7212-a virtuous wife in all [her]7212-a virtuous wife ways ! "[200-clare]

A lump rose in [Clare]200-clare 's throat . The portable lectern was taken out from the corner and set in the middle of the fireplace , [the two old servants]3958-the two old servants came in , and [[Angel]200-clare 's father]2175-angel 's father began to read at the tenth verse of the aforesaid chapter -

" Who can find [a virtuous woman]7213-a virtuous woman ? for [her]7213-a virtuous woman price is far above rubies . [She]7213-a virtuous woman riseth while it is yet night , and giveth meat to [[her]7213-a virtuous woman household]7214-her household . [She]7213-a virtuous woman looketh well to the ways of [[her]7213-a virtuous woman household]7214-her household , and eateth not the bread of idleness .
