When prayers were over , [[his]3960-you mother]6090-his mother said -

" [I]6090-his mother could not help thinking how very aptly that chapter [[your]3960-you dear father]7220-your dear father read applied , in some of its particulars , to [the woman [you]3960-you have chosen]7221-the woman you have chosen . [The perfect woman]7222-the perfect woman , [you]3960-you see , was [a working woman]7223-a working woman ; not [an idler]7224-an idler ; not [a fine lady]2457-a fine lady ; but [one who used [her]7213-a virtuous woman hands and [her]7213-a virtuous woman head and [her]7213-a virtuous woman heart for the good of others]7226-one who used her hands and her head and her heart for the good of others . ' [[Her]7213-a virtuous woman children]7216-her children arise up and call [her]7213-a virtuous woman blessed ; [[her]7213-a virtuous woman husband]791-her husband also , and [he]791-her husband praiseth [her]7213-a virtuous woman . [Many daughters]7218-many daughters have done virtuously , but [she]7213-a virtuous woman excelleth [them]7218-many daughters all . ' Well , [I]6090-his mother wish [I]6090-his mother could have seen [her]7213-a virtuous woman , [Angel]200-clare . Since [she]7213-a virtuous woman is pure and chaste , [she]7213-a virtuous woman would have been refined enough for [me]6090-his mother . "[6090-his mother]

[Clare]200-clare could bear this no longer . [His]3962-he eyes were full of tears , which seemed like drops of molten lead . [He]3962-he bade a quick good night to [these sincere and simple souls whom [he]3962-he loved so well ; who knew neither [the world]497-the world , the flesh , nor the devil in [their]3963-these sincere and simple souls whom he loved so well ; who knew neither the world , the flesh , nor the devil in their own hearts own hearts]3963-these sincere and simple souls whom he loved so well ; who knew neither the world , the flesh , nor the devil in their own hearts , only as something vague and external to [themselves]3963-these sincere and simple souls whom he loved so well ; who knew neither the world , the flesh , nor the devil in their own hearts . [He]3962-he went to [[his]3962-he own chamber]3965-his own chamber .

[[His]3962-he mother]6090-his mother followed [him]3962-he , and tapped at [his]3962-he door . [Clare]200-clare opened it to discover [her]6090-his mother standing without , with anxious eyes .

" [Angel]200-clare , "[6090-his mother] [she]6090-his mother asked , " is there something wrong that [you]200-clare go away so soon ? [I]6090-his mother am quite sure [you]200-clare are not [yourself]200-clare . "[6090-his mother]

" [I]3962-he am not , quite , [mother]5917-mother , "[3962-he] said [he]3962-he .

" About [her]6090-his mother ? Now , [[my]6090-his mother son]7207-my son , [I]6090-his mother know it is that - [I]6090-his mother know it is about [her]6090-his mother ! Have [you]3962-he quarrelled in these three weeks ? "[6090-his mother]

" [We]7232-we have not exactly quarrelled , "[3962-he] [he]3962-he said . " But [we]7232-we have had a difference - "[3962-he]

" [Angel]200-clare - is [she]6090-his mother [a young woman whose history will bear investigation]7233-a young woman whose history will bear investigation ? "[6090-his mother]

With [a mother]3856-a mother 's instinct [Mrs Clare]200-clare had put [her]200-clare finger on the kind of trouble that would cause such a disquiet as seemed to agitate [[her]200-clare son]6089-her son .

" [She]6090-his mother is spotless ! "[3962-he] [he]3962-he replied ; and felt that if it had sent [him]3962-he to eternal hell there and then [he]3962-he would have told that lie .

" Then never mind the rest . After all , there are few purer things in nature then [an unsullied country maid]7234-an unsullied country maid . Any crudeness of manner which may offend [your]6089-her son more educated sense at first , will , [I]200-clare am sure , disappear under the influence or [your]6089-her son companionship and tuition . "[200-clare]

Such terrible sarcasm of blind magnanimity brought [home]5850-home to [Clare]200-clare the secondary perception that [he]3962-he had utterly wrecked [his]3962-he career by this marriage , which had not been among [his]3962-he early thoughts after the disclosure . True , on [his]3962-he own account [he]3962-he cared very little about [his]3962-he career ; but [he]3962-he had wished to make it at least a respectable one on account of [[his]3962-he parents]746-his parents and [brothers]586-brothers . And now as [he]3962-he looked into the candle its flame dumbly expressed to [him]3962-he that it was made to shine on [sensible people]3972-sensible people , and that it abhorred lighting the face of [a dupe and a failure]3973-a dupe and a failure .

When [his]3962-he agitation had cooled [he]3962-he would be at moments incensed with [[his]3962-he poor wife]3974-his poor wife for causing a situation in which [he]3962-he was obliged to practise deception on [[his]3962-he parents]746-his parents . [He]3962-he almost talked to [her]3974-his poor wife in [his]3962-he anger , as if [she]3974-his poor wife had been in [the room]778-the room . And then [her]3974-his poor wife cooing voice , plaintive in expostulation , disturbed the darkness , the velvet touch of [her]3974-his poor wife lips passed over [his]3962-he brow , and [he]3962-he could distinguish in the air the warmth of [her]3974-his poor wife breath .

This night [the woman of [his]3962-he belittling deprecations]3977-the woman of his belittling deprecations was thinking how great and good [[her]3974-his poor wife husband]791-her husband was . But over [them]3979-them both there hung a deeper shade than the shade which [Angel Clare]200-clare perceived , namely , the shade of [his]3962-he own limitations . With all [his]3962-he attempted independence of judgement [this advanced and well - meaning young man]3980-this advanced and well - meaning young man , a sample product of the last five - and - twenty years , was yet [the slave to custom and conventionality]3981-the slave to custom and conventionality when surprised back into [his]3962-he early teachings . [No prophet]3982-no prophet had told [him]3962-he , and [he]3962-he was not prophet enough to tell [himself]3962-he , that essentially [this young wife of]3983-this young wife of [his]3962-he was as deserving of the praise of [King Lemuel]387-king lemuel as [any other woman endowed with the same dislike of evil]3984-any other woman endowed with the same dislike of evil , [her]3983-this young wife of moral value having to be reckoned not by achievement but by tendency . Moreover , [the figure near at hand]3985-the figure near at hand suffers on such occasion , because it shows up its sorriness without shade ; while [vague figures afar off]3986-vague figures afar off are honoured , in that [their]3986-vague figures afar off distance makes artistic virtues of [their]3986-vague figures afar off stains . In considering what [Tess]198-tess was not , [he]3962-he overlooked what [she]198-tess was , and forgot that [the defective]3987-the defective can be more than the entire .

XL

At breakfast [Brazil]109-brazil was the topic , and all endeavoured to take a hopeful view of [Clare]200-clare 's proposed experiment with [[that country]3988-that country 's soil]3989-that country 's soil , notwithstanding the discouraging reports of [some farm - labourers who had emigrated thither and returned [home]5850-home within the twelve months]3990-some farm - labourers who had emigrated thither and returned home within the twelve months . After breakfast [Clare]200-clare went into [the little town]3992-the little town to wind up such trifling matters as [he]3962-he was concerned with there , and to get from [the local bank]3993-the local bank all the money [he]3962-he possessed . On [his]3962-he way back [he]3962-he encountered [Miss Mercy Chant]330-mercy by [the church]6443-the church , from whose walls [she]330-mercy seemed to be a sort of emanation . [She]330-mercy was carrying an armful of Bibles for [[her]330-mercy class]3995-her class , and such was [her]330-mercy view of life that events which produced heartache in others wrought beatific smiles upon [her]330-mercy - an enviable result , although , in the opinion of [Angel]200-clare , it was obtained by a curiously unnatural sacrifice of humanity to mysticism .

[She]330-mercy had learnt that [he]3962-he was about to leave [England]10-england , and observed what an excellent and promising scheme it seemed to be .

" Yes ; it is a likely scheme enough in a commercial sense , no doubt , "[3962-he] [he]3962-he replied . " But , [my]3962-he dear [Mercy]330-mercy , it snaps the continuity of existence . Perhaps a cloister would be preferable . "[3962-he]

" A cloister ! O , [Angel Clare]200-clare ! "[330-mercy]

" Well ? "[3962-he]

" Why , [[you]200-clare wicked man]7235-you wicked man , [a cloister]7236-a cloister implies [a monk]7237-a monk , and [a monk Roman Catholicism]7238-a monk roman catholicism . "[330-mercy]

" And Roman Catholicism sin , and sin damnation . [Thou]7239-thou art in a parlous state , [Angel Clare]200-clare . "[3962-he]

" [I]330-mercy glory in [my]330-mercy Protestantism ! "[330-mercy] [she]330-mercy said severely .

Then [Clare]200-clare , thrown by sheer misery into one of the demoniacal moods in which [a man]1337-a man does despite to [his]1337-a man true principles , called [her]330-mercy close to [him]3962-he , and fiendishly whispered in [her]330-mercy ear the most heterodox ideas [he]3962-he could think of . [His]3962-he momentary laughter at the horror which appeared on [her]330-mercy fair face ceased when it merged in pain and anxiety for [his]3962-he welfare .

" [Dear Mercy]388-dear mercy , "[3962-he] [he]3962-he said , " [you]330-mercy must forgive [me]3962-he . [I]3962-he think [I]3962-he am going crazy ! "[3962-he]

[She]330-mercy thought that [he]3962-he was ; and thus the interview ended , and [Clare]200-clare re - entered [the Vicarage]2162-the vicarage . With [the local banker]3998-the local banker [he]3962-he deposited the jewels till happier days should arise . [He]3962-he also paid into the bank thirty pounds - to be sent to [Tess]198-tess in a few months , as [she]198-tess might require ; and wrote to [her]198-tess at [[her]198-tess parents ' home in [Blackmoor Vale]53-blackmoor vale]3999-her parents ' home in blackmoor vale to inform [her]198-tess of what [he]3962-he had done . This amount , with the sum [he]3962-he had already placed in [her]198-tess hands - about fifty pounds - [he]3962-he hoped would be amply sufficient for [her]198-tess wants just at present , particularly as in an emergency [she]198-tess had been directed to apply to [[his]3962-he father]457-his father .

[He]3962-he deemed it best not to put [[his]3962-he parents]746-his parents into communication with [her]198-tess by informing [them]746-his parents of [her]198-tess address ; and , being unaware of what had really happened to estrange [the two]1022-the two , neither [[his]3962-he father]457-his father nor [[his]3962-he mother]6090-his mother suggested that [he]3962-he should do so . During the day [he]3962-he left [the parsonage]4005-the parsonage , for what [he]3962-he had to complete [he]3962-he wished to get done quickly .

As the last duty before leaving [this part of [England]10-england]6876-this part of england it was necessary for [him]3962-he to call at [the Wellbridge farmhouse]4007-the wellbridge farmhouse , in which [he]3962-he had spent with [Tess]198-tess the first three days of [their]1022-the two marriage , the trifle of rent having to be paid , the key given up of [the rooms [they]1022-the two had occupied]4008-the rooms they had occupied , and two or three small articles fetched away that [they]1022-the two had left behind . It was under this roof that the deepest shadow ever thrown upon [his]3962-he life had stretched its gloom over [him]3962-he . Yet when [he]3962-he had unlocked the door of [the sitting - room]3599-the sitting - room and looked into it , the memory which returned first upon [him]3962-he was that of [their]1022-the two happy arrival on a similar afternoon , the first fresh sense of sharing a habitation conjointly , the first meal together , the chatting by the fire with joined hands .

[The farmer]1947-the farmer and [[his]1947-the farmer wife]819-his wife were in [the field]610-the field at the moment of [his]3962-he visit , and [Clare]200-clare was in [the rooms]4013-the rooms alone for some time . [Inwardly]389-inwardly swollen with a renewal of sentiment that [he]3962-he had not quite reckoned with , [he]3962-he went [upstairs]762-upstairs to [[her]200-clare chamber]911-her chamber , which had never been [his]3962-he . The bed was smooth as [she]200-clare had made [it]4016-it with [her]200-clare own hands on the morning of leaving . The mistletoe hung under the tester just as [he]3962-he had placed it . Having been there three or four weeks it was turning colour , and the leaves and berries were wrinkled . [Angel]200-clare took it down and crushed it into the grate . Standing there , [he]3962-he for the first time doubted whether [his]3962-he course in this conjecture had been a wise , much less a generous , one . But had [he]3962-he not been cruelly blinded ? In the incoherent multitude of [his]3962-he emotions [he]3962-he knelt down at the bedside wet - eyed . " [O Tess]198-tess ! If [you]198-tess had only told [me]3962-he sooner , [I]3962-he would have forgiven [you]198-tess ! "[3962-he] [he]3962-he mourned .

Hearing a footstep below , [he]3962-he rose and went to the top of [the stairs]3324-the stairs . At the bottom of [the flight]4018-the flight [he]3962-he saw [a woman]1028-a woman standing , and on [her]1028-a woman turning up [her]1028-a woman face recognized the pale , dark - eyed Izz Huett .

" [Mr Clare]284-clare , "[1028-a woman] [she]1028-a woman said , " [I]1028-a woman 've called to see [you]284-clare and [Mrs Clare]200-clare , and to inquire if [ye]284-clare be well . [I]1028-a woman thought [you]284-clare might be back [here]5975-here again . "[1028-a woman]

This was [a girl whose secret [he]3962-he had guessed , but who had not yet guessed [his]3962-he]4020-a girl whose secret he had guessed , but who had not yet guessed his ; [an honest girl who loved [him]3962-he]4021-an honest girl who loved him - one who would have made as good , or nearly as good , [[a practical farmer]4022-a practical farmer 's wife]4023-a practical farmer 's wife as [Tess]198-tess .

[Izz]312-izz looked down .

" How are [the others]2258-the others ? "[3962-he] [he]3962-he inquired . " How is [Retty]311-retty ? "[3962-he]

[She]4043-she gave the promise .

" Heaven bless and keep [you]4044-he , [sir]5821-sir . Goodbye ! "[4044-he]

[He]4044-he drove on ; but no sooner had [Izz]312-izz turned into [the lane]631-the lane , and [Clare]200-clare was out of sight , than [she]200-clare flung [herself]200-clare down on the bank in a fit of racking anguish ; and it was with a strained unnatural face that [she]200-clare entered [[[her]200-clare mother]658-her mother 's cottage]4047-her mother 's cottage late that night . [Nobody]754-nobody ever was told how [Izz]312-izz spent the dark hours that intervened between [Angel Clare]200-clare 's parting from [her]200-clare and [her]200-clare arrival [home]5850-home .

[Clare]200-clare , too , after bidding [the girl]647-the girl farewell , was wrought to aching thoughts and quivering lips . But [his]4044-he sorrow was not for [Izz]312-izz . That evening [he]4044-he was within a feather - weight 's turn of abandoning [[his]4044-he road]4051-his road to [the nearest station]4052-the nearest station , and driving across [that elevated dorsal line of South Wessex]4053-that elevated dorsal line of south wessex which divided [him]4044-he from [[his]4044-he [Tess]198-tess 's home]4054-his tess 's home . It was neither a contempt for [her]200-clare nature , nor the probable state of [her]200-clare heart , which deterred [him]4044-he .

No ; it was a sense that , despite [her]200-clare love , as corroborated by [Izz]312-izz 's admission , the facts had not changed . If [he]4044-he was right at first , [he]4044-he was right now . And the momentum of the course on which [he]4044-he had embarked tended to keep [him]4044-he going in it , unless diverted by a stronger , more sustained force than had played upon [him]4044-he this afternoon . [He]4044-he could soon come back to [her]200-clare . [He]4044-he took [the train]531-the train that night for [London]23-london , and five days after shook hands in farewell of [[his]4044-he brothers]634-his brothers at [the port of embarkation]4057-the port of embarkation .

XLI

From the foregoing events of the winter - time let [us]4058-we press on to an October day , more than eight months subsequent to the parting of [Clare]200-clare and [Tess]198-tess . [We]4058-we discover the latter in changed conditions ; instead of [a bride with boxes and trunks which others]4059-a bride with boxes and trunks which others bore , [we]4058-we see [her]200-clare [a lonely woman with a basket and a bundle in [her]200-clare own porterage]4060-a lonely woman with a basket and a bundle in her own porterage , as at an earlier time when [she]200-clare was [no bride]4061-no bride ; instead of the ample means that were projected by [[her]200-clare husband]791-her husband for [her]200-clare comfort through this probationary period , [she]200-clare can produce only a flattened purse .

After again leaving [Marlott]21-marlott , [[her]200-clare home]1063-her home , [she]200-clare had got through the spring and summer without any great stress upon [her]200-clare physical powers , the time being mainly spent in rendering light irregular service at dairy - work near [Port - Bredy]115-port - bredy to [the west of [the Blackmoor Valley]116-the blackmoor valley]4064-the west of the blackmoor valley , equally remote from [[her]200-clare native place and from [Talbothays]60-talbothays]4065-her native place and from talbothays . [She]200-clare preferred this to living on [his]791-her husband allowance . Mentally [she]200-clare remained in utter stagnation , a condition which the mechanical occupation rather fostered than checked . [Her]200-clare consciousness was at [that other dairy]4066-that other dairy , at that other season , in the presence of [the tender lover who had confronted [her]200-clare there]4067-the tender lover who had confronted her there - [he]4067-the tender lover who had confronted her there who , the moment [she]200-clare had grasped [him]4067-the tender lover who had confronted her there to keep for [her]200-clare own , had disappeared like a shape in a vision .

The dairy - work lasted only till the milk began to lessen , for [she]200-clare had not met with a second regular engagement as at [Talbothays]60-talbothays , but had done duty as [a supernumerary]4068-a supernumerary only . However , as harvest was now beginning , [she]200-clare had simply to remove from [the pasture]630-the pasture to [the stubble]4070-the stubble to find plenty of further occupation , and this continued till harvest was done .

Of the five - and - twenty pounds which had remained to [her]200-clare of [Clare]200-clare 's allowance , after deducting the other half of the fifty as a contribution to [[her]200-clare parents]873-her parents for the trouble and expense to which [she]200-clare had put [them]873-her parents , [she]200-clare had as yet spent but little . But there now followed an unfortunate interval of wet weather , during which [she]200-clare was obliged to fall back upon [[her]200-clare sovereigns]4072-her sovereigns .

[She]200-clare could not bear to let [them]4072-her sovereigns go . [Angel]200-clare had put them into [her]200-clare hand , had obtained them bright and new from [[his]4073-his bank]4074-his bank for [her]200-clare ; [his]4073-his touch had consecrated them to souvenirs of [himself]4073-his - they appeared to have had as yet no other history than such as was created by [his]4073-his and [her]200-clare own experiences - and to disperse them was like giving away relics . But [she]200-clare had to do it , and one by one [they]4072-her sovereigns left [her]200-clare hands .

[She]200-clare had been compelled to send [[her]200-clare mother]658-her mother [her]200-clare address from time to time , but [she]200-clare concealed [her]200-clare circumstances . When [her]200-clare money had almost gone a letter from [[her]200-clare mother]658-her mother reached [her]200-clare . [Joan]205-joan stated that [they]4077-they were in dreadful difficulty ; the autumn rains had gone through the thatch of [the house]652-the house , which required entire renewal ; but this could not be done because the previous thatching had never been paid for . New rafters and a new ceiling upstairs also were required , which , with the previous bill , would amount to a sum of twenty pounds . As [[her]200-clare husband]791-her husband was [a man of means]4080-a man of means , and had doubtless returned by this time , could [she]200-clare not send [them]4077-they the money ?

[Tess]198-tess had thirty pounds coming to [her]198-tess almost immediately from [[Angel]200-clare 's bankers]4081-angel 's bankers , and , the case being so deplorable , as soon as the sum was received [she]198-tess sent the twenty as requested . Part of the remainder [she]198-tess was obliged to expend in winter clothing , leaving only a nominal sum for the whole inclement season at hand . When the last pound had gone , a remark of [Angel]200-clare 's that whenever [she]198-tess required further resources [she]198-tess was to apply to [[his]791-her husband father]457-his father , remained to be considered .

But the more [Tess]198-tess thought of the step , the more reluctant was [she]198-tess to take it . The same delicacy , pride , false shame , whatever it may be called , on [Clare]200-clare 's account , which had led [her]200-clare to hide from [[her]200-clare own parents]4083-her own parents the prolongation of the estrangement , hindered [her]200-clare owning to [his]457-his father that [she]200-clare was in want after the fair allowance [he]457-his father had left [her]200-clare . [They]4083-her own parents probably despised [her]200-clare already ; how much more [they]4083-her own parents would despise [her]200-clare in the character of [a mendicant]4084-a mendicant ! The consequence was that by no effort could [[the parson]450-the parson 's daughter - in - law]4086-the parson 's daughter - in - law bring [herself]4086-the parson 's daughter - in - law to let [him]457-his father know [her]200-clare state .

[Her]200-clare reluctance to communicate with [[[her]200-clare husband]791-her husband 's parents]4088-her husband 's parents might , [she]200-clare thought , lessen with the lapse of time ; but with [her]200-clare own the reverse obtained . On [her]200-clare leaving [[their]4083-her own parents house]4089-their house after the short visit subsequent to [her]200-clare marriage [they]4083-her own parents were under the impression that [she]200-clare was ultimately going to join [[her]200-clare husband]791-her husband ; and from that time to the present [she]200-clare had done nothing to disturb [their]4083-her own parents belief that [she]200-clare was awaiting [his]457-his father return in comfort , hoping against hope that [his]457-his father journey to [Brazil]109-brazil would result in a short stay only , after which [he]457-his father would come to fetch [her]200-clare , or that [he]457-his father would write for [her]200-clare to join [him]457-his father ; in any case that [they]4083-her own parents would soon present a united front to [[their]4083-her own parents families]4091-their families and [the world]497-the world . This hope [she]200-clare still fostered . To let [[her]200-clare parents]873-her parents know that [she]200-clare was [a deserted wife]4094-a deserted wife , dependent , now that [she]200-clare had relieved [their]873-her parents necessities , on [her]200-clare own hands for a living , after the eclat of a marriage which was to nullify the collapse of the first attempt , would be too much indeed .

The set of brilliants returned to [her]200-clare mind . Where [Clare]200-clare had deposited [them]4095-they [she]200-clare did not know , and it mattered little , if it were true that [she]200-clare could only use and not sell them . Even were [they]4095-they absolutely hers it would be passing mean to enrich [herself]200-clare by a legal title to [them]4095-they which was not essentially [hers]200-clare at all .

Meanwhile [[her]200-clare husband]791-her husband 's days had been by no means free from trial . At this moment [he]791-her husband was lying ill of fever in [the clay lands near [Curitiba]117-curitiba in [Brazil]109-brazil]4097-the clay lands near curitiba in brazil , having been drenched with thunder - storms and persecuted by other hardships , in common with all [the English farmers]4098-the english farmers and [farm - labourers who , just at this time , were deluded into going thither by the promises of the Brazilian Government]4099-farm - labourers who , just at this time , were deluded into going thither by the promises of the brazilian government , and by the baseless assumption that those frames which , ploughing and sowing on [English uplands]4100-english uplands , had resisted all the weathers to whose moods [they]4095-they had been born , could resist equally well all the weathers by which [they]4095-they were surprised on [Brazilian plains]4101-brazilian plains .

To return . Thus it happened that when [the last of [Tess]198-tess 's sovereigns]4102-the last of tess 's sovereigns had been spent [she]198-tess was unprovided with [others]1383-others to take [their]1383-others place , while on account of the season [she]198-tess found it increasingly difficult to get employment . Not being aware of the rarity of intelligence , energy , health , and willingness in any sphere of life , [she]198-tess refrained from seeking an indoor occupation ; fearing [towns]3248-towns , [large houses]4105-large houses , [people of means and social sophistication]4106-people of means and social sophistication , and of manners other than rural . From that direction of gentility [Black Care]390-black care had come . Society might be better than [she]198-tess supposed from [her]198-tess slight experience of it . But [she]198-tess had no proof of this , and [her]198-tess instinct in the circumstances was to avoid its purlieus .

[The small dairies to the west , beyond [Port - Bredy]115-port - bredy , in which [she]198-tess had served as [supernumerary milkmaid]4108-supernumerary milkmaid]4107-the small dairies to the west , beyond port - bredy , in which she had served as supernumerary milkmaid during the spring and summer required no further aid . [Room]4109-room would probably have been made for [her]198-tess at [Talbothays]60-talbothays , if only out of sheer compassion ; but comfortable as [her]198-tess life had been [there]5839-there , [she]198-tess could not go back . The anti - climax would be too intolerable ; and [her]198-tess return might bring reproach upon [[her]198-tess idolized husband]4111-her idolized husband . [She]198-tess could not have borne [their]4112-their pity , and [their]4112-their whispered remarks to [one another]4113-one another upon [her]198-tess strange situation ; though [she]198-tess would almost have faced a knowledge of [her]198-tess circumstances by [every individual there]4114-every individual there , so long as [her]198-tess story had remained isolated in the mind of [each]542-each . It was the interchange of ideas about [her]198-tess that made [her]198-tess sensitiveness wince . [Tess]198-tess could not account for this distinction ; [she]198-tess simply knew that [she]198-tess felt it .

[She]198-tess was now on [her]198-tess way to [an upland farm in [the centre of [the county]5889-the county , to which [she]198-tess had been recommended by a wandering letter which had reached [her]198-tess from [Marian]310-marian]4117-the centre of the county , to which she had been recommended by a wandering letter which had reached her from marian]4116-an upland farm in the centre of the county , to which she had been recommended by a wandering letter which had reached her from marian . [Marian]310-marian had somehow heard that [Tess]198-tess was separated from [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband - probably through [Izz Huett]312-izz - and [the good - natured and now tippling girl]4120-the good - natured and now tippling girl , deeming [Tess]198-tess in trouble , had hastened to notify to [[her]198-tess former friend]4121-her former friend that [she]198-tess [herself]198-tess had gone to [this upland spot]4122-this upland spot after leaving [the dairy]1952-the dairy , and would like to see [her]198-tess there , where there was room for other hands , if it was really true that [she]198-tess worked again as of old .

With the shortening of the days all hope of obtaining [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband 's forgiveness began to leave [her]198-tess ; and there was something of the habitude of the wild animal in the unreflecting instinct with which [she]198-tess rambled on - disconnecting [herself]198-tess by littles from [her]198-tess eventful past at every step , obliterating [her]198-tess identity , giving no thought to accidents or contingencies which might make a quick discovery of [her]198-tess whereabouts by others of importance to [her]198-tess own happiness , if not to [theirs]4125-theirs .

Among the difficulties of [her]198-tess lonely position not the least was the attention [she]198-tess excited by [her]198-tess appearance , a certain bearing of distinction , which [she]198-tess had caught from [Clare]200-clare , being superadded to [her]198-tess natural attractiveness . Whilst the clothes lasted which had been prepared for [her]198-tess marriage , these casual glances of interest caused [her]198-tess no inconvenience , but as soon as [she]198-tess was compelled to don the wrapper of [a fieldwoman]4126-a fieldwoman , rude words were addressed to [her]198-tess more than once ; but nothing occurred to cause [her]198-tess bodily fear till a particular November afternoon .

[She]198-tess had preferred [the country west of [the River]118-the river]4127-the country west of the river Brit to [the upland farm for which [she]198-tess was now bound]4128-the upland farm for which she was now bound , because , for one thing , it was nearer to [the home of [[her]198-tess husband 's father]4130-her husband 's father]4129-the home of her husband 's father ; and to hover about [that region unrecognized]4131-that region unrecognized , with the notion that [she]198-tess might decide to call at [the Vicarage]2162-the vicarage some day , gave [her]198-tess pleasure . But having once decided to try [the higher and drier levels]4133-the higher and drier levels , [she]198-tess pressed back eastward , marching afoot towards [the village of [Chalk - Newton]119-chalk - newton , where [she]198-tess meant to pass the night]4134-the village of chalk - newton , where she meant to pass the night .

[The lane]631-the lane was long and unvaried , and , owing to the rapid shortening of the days , dusk came upon [her]198-tess before [she]198-tess was aware . [She]198-tess had reached the top of [a hill down which [the lane]631-the lane]4136-a hill down which the lane stretched [its]631-the lane serpentine length in glimpses , when [she]198-tess heard footsteps behind [her]198-tess back , and in a few moments [she]198-tess was overtaken by [a man]1337-a man . [He]1337-a man stepped up alongside [Tess]198-tess and said -

" Good night , [[my]1337-a man pretty maid]7278-my pretty maid "[1337-a man] : to which [she]198-tess civilly replied .

The light still remaining in the sky lit up [her]198-tess face , though the landscape was nearly dark . [The man]1516-the man turned and stared hard at [her]198-tess .

" Why , surely , it is [the young wench]7279-the young wench who was at [Trantridge]38-trantridge awhile - [young [Squire d'Urberville]379-squire jollard 's friend]7280-young squire d'urberville 's friend ? [I]1516-the man was [there]5839-there at that time , though [I]1516-the man do n't live [there]5839-there now . "[1516-the man]

[She]198-tess recognized in [him]1516-the man [the well - to - do boor whom [Angel]200-clare had knocked down at [the inn]697-the inn for addressing [her]198-tess coarsely]4140-the well - to - do boor whom angel had knocked down at the inn for addressing her coarsely . A spasm of anguish shot through [her]198-tess , and [she]198-tess returned [him]1516-the man no answer .

" Be honest enough to own it , and that what [I]198-tess said in [the town]1346-the town was true , though [[your]1516-the man fancy - man]7284-your fancy - man was so up about it - hey , [[my]198-tess sly one]7285-my sly one ? [You]1516-the man ought to beg [my]198-tess pardon for that blow of [his]7284-your fancy - man , considering . "[198-tess]

Still no answer came from [Tess]198-tess . There seemed only one escape for [her]198-tess hunted soul . [She]198-tess suddenly took to [her]198-tess heels with the speed of the wind , and , without looking behind [her]198-tess , ran along [the road]550-the road till [she]198-tess came to a gate which opened directly into [a plantation]4143-a plantation . Into this [she]198-tess plunged , and did not pause till [she]198-tess was deep enough in [its]4143-a plantation shade to be safe against any possibility of discovery .

Under foot the leaves were dry , and the foliage of some holly bushes which grew among the deciduous trees was dense enough to keep off draughts . [She]198-tess scraped together the dead leaves till [she]198-tess had formed them into a large heap , making a sort of nest in the middle . Into this [Tess]198-tess crept .

Such sleep as [she]198-tess got was naturally fitful ; [she]198-tess fancied [she]198-tess heard strange noises , but persuaded [herself]198-tess that they were caused by the breeze . [She]198-tess thought of [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband in [some vague warm clime on [the other side of the globe]4146-the other side of the globe]4145-some vague warm clime on the other side of the globe , while [she]198-tess was here in the cold . Was there [another such a wretched being as [she]198-tess in [the world]497-the world]4147-another such a wretched being as she in the world ? [Tess]198-tess asked [herself]198-tess ; and , thinking of [her]198-tess wasted life , said , " All is vanity . "[198-tess] [She]198-tess repeated the words mechanically , till [she]198-tess reflected that this was a most inadequate thought for modern days . [Solomon]216-solomon had thought as far as that more than two thousand years ago ; [she]198-tess [herself]198-tess , though not in the van of thinkers , had got much further . If all were only vanity , who would mind it ? All was , alas , worse than vanity - injustice , punishment , exaction , death . [The wife of [Angel Clare]200-clare]4149-the wife of angel clare put [her]4149-the wife of angel clare hand to [her]4149-the wife of angel clare brow , and felt its curve , and the edges of [her]4149-the wife of angel clare eye - sockets perceptible under the soft skin , and thought as [she]4149-the wife of angel clare did so that a time would come when that bone would be bare . " [I]4149-the wife of angel clare wish it were now , "[4149-the wife of angel clare] [she]4149-the wife of angel clare said .

In the midst of these whimsical fancies [she]4149-the wife of angel clare heard a new strange sound among the leaves . It might be the wind ; yet there was scarcely any wind . Sometimes it was a palpitation , sometimes a flutter ; sometimes it was a sort of gasp or gurgle . Soon [she]4149-the wife of angel clare was certain that the noises came from wild creatures of some kind , the more so when , originating in the boughs overhead , they were followed by the fall of a heavy body upon the ground . Had [she]4149-the wife of angel clare been ensconced here under other and more pleasant conditions [she]4149-the wife of angel clare would have become alarmed ; but , outside humanity , [she]4149-the wife of angel clare had at present no fear .

Day at length broke in the sky . When it had been day aloft for some little while it became day in [the wood]4150-the wood .

Directly the assuring and prosaic light of [the world]497-the world 's active hours had grown strong , [she]4149-the wife of angel clare crept from under [her]4149-the wife of angel clare hillock of leaves , and looked around boldly . Then [she]4149-the wife of angel clare perceived what had been going on to disturb [her]4149-the wife of angel clare . [The plantation wherein [she]4149-the wife of angel clare had taken shelter]4152-the plantation wherein she had taken shelter ran down at [this spot]4153-this spot into [a peak]4154-a peak , which ended [it]4152-the plantation wherein she had taken shelter hitherward , outside the hedge being arable ground . Under the trees several pheasants lay about , their rich plumage dabbled with blood ; some were dead , some feebly twitching a wing , some staring up at the sky , some pulsating quickly , some contorted , some stretched out - all of [them]4155-them writhing in agony , except [the fortunate ones whose tortures had ended during the night by the inability of nature to bear more]4156-the fortunate ones whose tortures had ended during the night by the inability of nature to bear more .

[Tess]198-tess guessed at once the meaning of this . The birds had been driven down into this corner the day before by [some shooting - party]4157-some shooting - party ; and while [those that had dropped dead under the shot , or had died before nightfall]4158-those that had dropped dead under the shot , or had died before nightfall , had been searched for and carried off , many badly wounded birds had escaped and hidden [themselves]4159-they away , or risen among the thick boughs , where [they]4159-they had maintained [their]4159-they position till [they]4159-they grew weaker with loss of blood in the night - time , when [they]4159-they had fallen one by one as [she]4149-the wife of angel clare had heard [them]4159-they .

[She]4149-the wife of angel clare had occasionally caught glimpses of [these men]4160-these men in girlhood , looking over hedges , or peeping through bushes , and pointing [their]4160-these men guns , strangely accoutred , a bloodthirsty light in [their]4160-these men eyes . [She]4149-the wife of angel clare had been told that , rough and brutal as [they]4160-these men seemed just then , [they]4160-these men were not like this all the year round , but were , in fact , quite civil persons save during certain weeks of autumn and winter , when , like [the inhabitants of [the Malay Peninsula]120-the malay peninsula]4161-the inhabitants of the malay peninsula , [they]4160-these men ran amuck , and made it [their]4160-these men purpose to destroy life - in this case harmless feathered creatures , brought into being by artificial means solely to gratify these propensities - at once so unmannerly and so unchivalrous towards [[their]4160-these men weaker fellows in [Nature 's teeming family]4163-nature 's teeming family]4162-their weaker fellows in nature 's teeming family .

With the impulse of [a soul who could feel for [kindred sufferers]4165-kindred sufferers as much as for [herself]4149-the wife of angel clare]4164-a soul who could feel for kindred sufferers as much as for herself , [Tess]198-tess 's first thought was to put the still living birds out of [their]4160-these men torture , and to this end with [her]198-tess own hands [she]198-tess broke the necks of as many as [she]198-tess could find , leaving [them]4160-these men to lie where [she]198-tess had found [them]4160-these men till [the game - keepers]4166-the game - keepers should come - as [they]4166-the game - keepers probably would come - to look for [them]4160-these men a second time .

" [Poor darlings]7286-poor darlings - to suppose [myself]198-tess the most miserable being on [earth]7287-earth in the sight o ' such misery as [yours]7286-poor darlings ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess exclaimed , [her]198-tess tears running down as [she]198-tess killed the birds tenderly . " And not a twinge of bodily pain about [me]198-tess ! [I]198-tess be not mangled , and [I]198-tess be not bleeding , and [I]198-tess have two hands to feed and clothe [me]198-tess . "[198-tess] [She]198-tess was ashamed of [herself]198-tess for [her]198-tess gloom of the night , based on nothing more tangible than a sense of condemnation under an arbitrary law of society which had no foundation in Nature .

XLII

It was now broad day , and [she]198-tess started again , emerging cautiously upon [the highway]598-the highway . But there was no need for caution ; [not a soul]475-not a soul was at hand , and [Tess]198-tess went onward with fortitude , [her]198-tess recollection of the birds ' silent endurance of their night of agony impressing upon [her]198-tess the relativity of sorrows and the tolerable nature of [her]198-tess own , if [she]198-tess could once rise high enough to despise opinion . But that [she]198-tess could not do so long as it was held by [Clare]200-clare .

[She]198-tess reached [Chalk - Newton]119-chalk - newton , and breakfasted at [an inn]740-an inn , where [several young men]4170-several young men were troublesomely complimentary to [her]198-tess good looks . Somehow [she]198-tess felt hopeful , for was it not possible that [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband also might say these same things to [her]198-tess even yet ? [She]198-tess was bound to take care of [herself]198-tess on the chance of it , and keep off [these casual lovers]4172-these casual lovers . To this end [Tess]198-tess resolved to run no further risks from [her]198-tess appearance . As soon as [she]198-tess got out of [the village]473-the village [she]198-tess entered a thicket and took from [her]198-tess basket one of the oldest field - gowns , which [she]198-tess had never put on even at [the dairy]1952-the dairy - never since [she]198-tess had worked among the stubble at [Marlott]21-marlott . [She]198-tess also , by a felicitous thought , took a handkerchief from [her]198-tess bundle and tied it round [her]198-tess face under [her]198-tess bonnet , covering [her]198-tess chin and half [her]198-tess cheeks and temples , as if [she]198-tess were suffering from toothache . Then with [her]198-tess little scissors , by the aid of a pocket looking - glass , [she]198-tess mercilessly nipped [her]198-tess eyebrows off , and thus insured against aggressive admiration , [she]198-tess went on [her]198-tess uneven way .

" What [a mommet of a maid]7288-a mommet of a maid ! "[4175-the next man who met her to a companion] said [the next man who met [her]198-tess to [a companion]4176-a companion]4175-the next man who met her to a companion .

Tears came into [her]198-tess eyes for very pity of [herself]198-tess as [she]198-tess heard [him]4175-the next man who met her to a companion .

" But [I]198-tess do n't care ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said . " O no - [I]198-tess do n't care ! [I]198-tess 'll always be ugly now , because [Angel]200-clare is not [here]5975-here , and [I]198-tess have [nobody]754-nobody to take care of [me]198-tess . [[My]198-tess husband]7291-my husband that was is gone away , and never will love [me]198-tess any more ; but [I]198-tess love [him]7291-my husband just the same , and hate [all other men]7292-all other men , and like to make ['em]7293-'em think scornfully of [me]198-tess ! "[198-tess]

Thus [Tess]198-tess walks on ; a figure which is part of [the landscape]1955-the landscape ; [a fieldwoman]4126-a fieldwoman pure and simple , in winter guise ; a gray serge cape , a red woollen cravat , a stuff skirt covered by a whitey - brown rough wrapper , and buff - leather gloves . Every thread of that old attire has become faded and thin under the stroke of raindrops , the burn of sunbeams , and the stress of winds . There is no sign of young passion in [her]198-tess now -

[The maiden]441-the maiden 's mouth is cold . . . Fold over simple fold Binding [her]198-tess head .

Inside this exterior , over which the eye might have roved as over a thing scarcely percipient , almost inorganic , there was the record of a pulsing life which had learnt too well , for its years , of the dust and ashes of things , of the cruelty of lust and the fragility of love .

Next day the weather was bad , but [she]198-tess trudged on , the honesty , directness , and impartiality of elemental enmity disconcerting [her]198-tess but little . [Her]198-tess object being a winter 's occupation and a winter 's [home]5850-home , there was no time to lose . [Her]198-tess experience of short hirings had been such that [she]198-tess was determined to accept no more .

Thus [she]198-tess went forward from [farm]4181-farm to farm in the direction of the place whence [Marian]310-marian had written to [her]198-tess , which [she]198-tess determined to make use of as a last shift only , its rumoured stringencies being the reverse of tempting . First [she]198-tess inquired for the lighter kinds of employment , and , as acceptance in any variety of these grew hopeless , applied next for the less light , till , beginning with the dairy and poultry tendance that [she]198-tess liked best , [she]198-tess ended with the heavy and course pursuits which [she]198-tess liked least - work on [arable land]4182-arable land : work of such roughness , indeed , as [she]198-tess would never have deliberately voluteered for .

Towards the second evening [she]198-tess reached [the irregular chalk table - land or plateau]4183-the irregular chalk table - land or plateau , bosomed with semi - globular tumuli - as if Cybele the Many - breasted were supinely extended there - which stretched between [the valley of]4184-the valley of [her]198-tess birth and [the valley of]4184-the valley of [her]198-tess love .

Here the air was dry and cold , and [the long cart - roads]4186-the long cart - roads were blown white and dusty within a few hours after rain . There were few trees , or none , those that would have grown in the hedges being mercilessly plashed down with the quickset by [the tenant - farmers]4187-the tenant - farmers , [the natural enemies of tree , bush , and brake]4188-the natural enemies of tree , bush , and brake . In the middle distance ahead of [her]198-tess [she]198-tess could see [the summits of [Bulbarrow]122-bulbarrow and of [Nettlecombe Tout]44-nettlecombe - tout]4189-the summits of bulbarrow and of nettlecombe tout , and [they]4189-the summits of bulbarrow and of nettlecombe tout seemed friendly . [They]4189-the summits of bulbarrow and of nettlecombe tout had a low and unassuming aspect from [this upland]4190-this upland , though as approached on the other side from [Blackmoor]4-blackmoor in [her]198-tess childhood they were as lofty bastions against the sky . Southerly , at many miles ' distance , and over [the hills]494-the hills and [ridges coastward]4192-ridges coastward , [she]198-tess could discern a surface like polished steel : it was [the English Channel]124-the english channel at [a point far out towards [France]125-france]4193-a point far out towards france .

Before [her]198-tess , in a slight depression , were the remains of [a village]4031-a village . [She]198-tess had , in fact , reached [Flintcomb - Ash]126-flintcomb - ash , [the place of [Marian]310-marian 's sojourn]4195-the place of marian 's sojourn . There seemed to be no help for [it]4196-it ; hither [she]198-tess was doomed to come . [The stubborn soil around [her]198-tess]4197-the stubborn soil around her showed plainly enough that the kind of labour in demand [here]5975-here was of the roughest kind ; but it was time to rest from searching , and [she]198-tess resolved to stay , particularly as it began to rain . At the entrance to [the village]473-the village was [a cottage whose gable jutted into [the road]550-the road]4200-a cottage whose gable jutted into the road , and before applying for [a lodging]4202-a lodging [she]198-tess stood under [its]4200-a cottage whose gable jutted into the road shelter , and watched the evening close in .

" Who would think [I]198-tess was [Mrs Angel Clare]200-clare ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said .

The wall felt warm to [her]198-tess back and shoulders , and [she]198-tess found that immediately within the gable was [the cottage]1251-the cottage fireplace , the heat of which came through the bricks . [She]198-tess warmed [her]198-tess hands upon them , and also put [her]198-tess cheek - red and moist with the drizzle - against their comforting surface . The wall seemed to be the only friend [she]198-tess had . [She]198-tess had so little wish to leave [it]4204-it that [she]198-tess could have stayed [there]5839-there all night .

[Tess]198-tess could hear [the occupants of [the cottage]1251-the cottage]4206-the occupants of the cottage - gathered together after [their]4206-the occupants of the cottage day 's labour - talking to [each other within]4208-each other within , and the rattle of [their]4206-the occupants of the cottage supper - plates was also audible . But in [[the village]473-the village - street]4210-the village - street [she]198-tess had seen [no soul]4211-no soul as yet . The solitude was at last broken by the approach of [one feminine figure , who , though the evening was cold , wore the print gown and the tilt - bonnet of summer time]4212-one feminine figure , who , though the evening was cold , wore the print gown and the tilt - bonnet of summer time . [Tess]198-tess instinctively thought it might be [Marian]310-marian , and when [she]198-tess came near enough to be distinguishable in the gloom , surely enough it was [she]310-marian . [Marian]310-marian was even stouter and redder in the face than formerly , and decidedly shabbier in attire . At any previous period of [her]198-tess existence [Tess]198-tess would hardly have cared to renew the acquaintance in such conditions ; but [her]198-tess loneliness was excessive , and [she]198-tess responded readily to [Marian]310-marian 's greeting .

[Marian]310-marian was quite respectful in [her]310-marian inquiries , but seemed much moved by the fact that [Tess]198-tess should still continue in no better condition than at first ; though [she]198-tess had dimly heard of the separation .

" [Tess]198-tess - [Mrs Clare]200-clare - [the dear wife of dear [he]7295-he]7294-the dear wife of dear he ! And is it really so bad as this , [[my]310-marian child]7296-my child ? Why is [your]7296-my child cwomely face tied up in such a way ? [Anybody]391-anybody been beating ' [ee]7296-my child ? Not [HE]7295-he ? "[310-marian]

" No , no , no ! [I]310-marian merely did it not to be clipsed or colled , [Marian]310-marian . "[310-marian]

[She]310-marian pulled off in disgust a bandage which could suggest such wild thoughts .

" And [you]310-marian 've got no collar on "[198-tess] [Tess]198-tess had been accustomed to wear a little white collar at the dairy .

" [I]310-marian know it , [Marian]310-marian . "[310-marian]

" [You]310-marian 've lost it travelling . "[310-marian]

" [I]310-marian 've not lost it . The truth is , [I]310-marian do n't care anything about [my]310-marian looks ; and so [I]310-marian did n't put it on . "[310-marian]

" And [you]310-marian do n't wear [your]310-marian wedding - ring ? "[310-marian]

" Yes , [I]310-marian do ; but not in public . [I]310-marian wear it round [my]310-marian neck on a ribbon . [I]310-marian do n't wish [people]5930-people to think who [I]310-marian am by marriage , or that [I]310-marian am married at all ; it would be so awkward while [I]310-marian lead [my]310-marian present life . "[310-marian]

[Marian]310-marian paused .

" But [you]310-marian BE [a gentleman 's wife]7298-a gentleman 's wife ; and it seems hardly fair that [you]310-marian should live like this ! "[310-marian]

" O yes it is , quite fair ; though [I]310-marian am very unhappy . "[310-marian]

" Well , well . [HE]7299-he married [you]310-marian - and [you]310-marian can be unhappy ! "[310-marian]

" [Wives]7300-wives are unhappy sometimes ; from no fault of [[their]7300-wives husbands]7301-their husbands - from [their]7300-wives own . "[310-marian]

" [You]310-marian 've no faults , [deary]6930-deary ; that [I]310-marian 'm sure of . And [he]7299-he 's none . So it must be something outside [ye]310-marian both . "[310-marian]

" [Marian]310-marian , dear [Marian]310-marian , will [you]310-marian do [me]310-marian a good turn without asking questions ? [[My]310-marian husband]7291-my husband has gone abroad , and somehow [I]310-marian have overrun [my]310-marian allowance , so that [I]310-marian have to fall back upon [my]310-marian old work for a time . Do not call [me]310-marian [Mrs Clare]200-clare , but [Tess]198-tess , as before . Do [they]7304-they want a hand [here]5975-here ? "[310-marian]

" O yes ; [they]7304-they 'll take one always , because [few]540-few care to come . ' Tis [a starve - acre place]7307-a starve - acre place . Corn and [swedes]7308-swedes are all [they]7304-they grow . Though [I]310-marian be [here]5975-here [myself]310-marian , [I]310-marian feel ' tis a pity for such as [you]310-marian to come . "[310-marian]

" But [you]310-marian used to be as good [a dairywoman]6577-a dairywoman as [I.]310-marian "[310-marian]

" Yes ; but [I]310-marian 've got out o ' that since [I]310-marian took to drink . [Lord]7311-lord , that 's the only comfort [I]310-marian 've got now ! If [you]310-marian engage , [you]310-marian 'll be set swede - hacking . That 's what [I]310-marian be doing ; but [you]310-marian wo n't like it . "[310-marian]

" O - anything ! Will [you]310-marian speak for [me]310-marian ? "[310-marian]

" [You]310-marian will do better by speaking for [yourself]310-marian . "[310-marian]

" Very well . Now , [Marian]310-marian , remember - nothing about [HIM]7312-he if [I]310-marian get [the place]5882-the place . [I]310-marian do n't wish to bring [his]7312-he name down to the dirt . "[310-marian]

[Marian]310-marian , who was really [a trustworthy girl]4213-a trustworthy girl though of coarser grain than [Tess]198-tess , promised anything [she]310-marian asked .

" This is pay - night , "[310-marian] [she]310-marian said , " and if [you]310-marian were to come with [me]310-marian [you]310-marian would know at once . [I]310-marian be real sorry that [you]310-marian are not happy ; but ' tis because [he]7312-he 's away , [I]310-marian know . [You]310-marian could n't be unhappy if [he]7312-he were [here]5975-here , even if [he]7312-he gie'd [ye]310-marian no money - even if [he]7312-he used [you]310-marian like [a drudge]7315-a drudge . "[310-marian]

" That 's true ; [I]310-marian could not ! "[310-marian]

[They]4214-they walked on together and soon reached [the farmhouse]4215-the farmhouse , which was almost sublime in [its]4215-the farmhouse dreariness . There was not a tree within sight ; there was not , at this season , [a green pasture]4216-a green pasture - nothing but fallow and turnips everywhere , in [large fields divided by hedges plashed to unrelieved levels]4217-large fields divided by hedges plashed to unrelieved levels .

[Tess]198-tess waited outside the door of [the farmhouse]4215-the farmhouse till [the group of workfolk]4219-the group of workfolk had received [their]4219-the group of workfolk wages , and then [Marian]310-marian introduced [her]198-tess . [The farmer]1947-the farmer [himself]1947-the farmer , it appeared , was not at [home]5850-home , but [[his]1947-the farmer wife]819-his wife , who represented [him]1947-the farmer this evening , made no objection to hiring [Tess]198-tess , on [her]198-tess agreeing to remain till [Old Lady]392-old lady - Day . Female field - labour was seldom offered now , and its cheapness made it profitable for tasks which [women]1628-women could perform as readily as [men]5841-men .

Having signed the agreement , there was nothing more for [Tess]198-tess to do at present than to get a lodging , and [she]198-tess found one in [the house at whose gable - wall [she]198-tess had warmed [herself]198-tess]4225-the house at whose gable - wall she had warmed herself . It was a poor subsistence that [she]198-tess had ensured , but [it]4226-it would afford a shelter for the winter at any rate .

That night [she]198-tess wrote to inform [[her]198-tess parents]873-her parents of [her]198-tess new address , in case a letter should arrive at [Marlott]21-marlott from [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband . But [she]198-tess did not tell [them]873-her parents of the sorriness of [her]198-tess situation : it might have brought reproach upon [him]791-her husband .

[XLIII]393-xliii

There was no exaggeration in [Marian]310-marian 's definition of [Flintcomb - Ash farm]4229-flintcomb - ash farm as [a starve - acre place]7307-a starve - acre place . The single fat thing on [the soil]1536-the soil was [Marian]310-marian [herself]310-marian ; and [she]310-marian was an importation . Of the three classes of [village]4232-village , [the village]473-the village cared for by [[its]473-the village lord]4234-its lord , [the village]473-the village cared for by [itself]473-the village , and [the village]473-the village uncared for either by [itself]473-the village or by [[its]473-the village lord]4234-its lord in other words , [the village of [[a resident squires]4239-a resident squires 's tenantry]4240-a resident squires 's tenantry]4238-the village of a resident squires 's tenantry , [the village of free- or [copy - holders]4242-copy - holders , and [the absentee - owner]4243-the absentee - owner 's village , farmed with [the land [this place]2909-this place , [Flintcomb - Ash]126-flintcomb - ash]4244-the land this place , flintcomb - ash]4241-the village of free- or copy - holders , and the absentee - owner 's village , farmed with the land this place , flintcomb - ash , was the third .

But [Tess]198-tess set to work . Patience , that blending of moral courage with physical timidity , was now no longer a minor feature in [Mrs Angel Clare]200-clare ; and it sustained [her]198-tess .

[The swede - field in which [she]198-tess and [[her]198-tess companion]1256-her companion were set hacking]4246-the swede - field in which she and her companion were set hacking was a stretch of [a hundred odd acres]4248-a hundred odd acres in one patch , on [the highest ground of [the farm]7206-the farm]4249-the highest ground of the farm , rising above stony lanchets or lynchets - the outcrop of siliceous veins in the chalk formation , composed of myriads of loose white flints in bulbous , cusped , and phallic shapes . The upper half of each turnip had been eaten off by the live - stock , and it was the business of [the two women]815-the two women to grub up the lower or earthy half of the root with a hooked fork called [a hacker , that it might be eaten also]4252-a hacker , that it might be eaten also . Every leaf of the vegetable having already been consumed , [the whole field]2479-the whole field was in colour a desolate drab ; it was a complexion without features , as if a face , from chin to brow , should be only an expanse of skin . The sky wore , in another colour , the same likeness ; a white vacuity of countenance with the lineaments gone . So [these two upper and nether visages]4254-these two upper and nether visages confronted each other all day long , the white face looking down on the brown face , and the brown face looking up at the white face , without anything standing between [them]4254-these two upper and nether visages but [the two girls]1271-the two girls crawling over the surface of the former like flies .

[Nobody]754-nobody came near [them]815-the two women , and [their]815-the two women movements showed a mechanical regularity ; [their]815-the two women forms standing enshrouded in Hessian " wroppers "[815-the two women] - sleeved brown pinafores , tied behind to the bottom , to keep [their]815-the two women gowns from blowing about - scant skirts revealing boots that reached high up the ankles , and yellow sheepskin gloves with gauntlets . The pensive character which the curtained hood lent to [their]815-the two women bent heads would have reminded [the observer]4257-the observer of some early Italian conception of [the two Marys]4258-the two marys .

[They]815-the two women worked on hour after hour , unconscious of the forlorn aspect [they]815-the two women bore in the landscape , not thinking of the justice or injustice of [their]815-the two women lot . Even in such a position as [theirs]815-the two women it was possible to exist in a dream . In the afternoon the rain came on again , and [Marian]310-marian said that [they]815-the two women need not work any more . But if [they]815-the two women did not work [they]815-the two women would not be paid ; so [they]815-the two women worked on . It was so high a situation , [this field]4259-this field , that the rain had no occasion to fall , but raced along horizontally upon the yelling wind , sticking into [them]815-the two women like glass splinters till [they]815-the two women were wet through . [Tess]198-tess had not known till now what was really meant by that . There are degrees of dampness , and a very little is called being wet through in common talk . But to stand working slowly in [a field]1433-a field , and feel the creep of rain - water , first in legs and shoulders , then on hips and head , then at back , front , and sides , and yet to work on till the leaden light diminishes and marks that the sun is down , demands a distinct modicum of stoicism , even of valour .

Yet [they]815-the two women did not feel the wetness so much as might be supposed . [They]815-the two women were both young , and [they]815-the two women were talking of the time when [they]815-the two women lived and loved together at [Talbothays Dairy]73-talbothays dairy , [that happy green tract of land where summer had been liberal in [her]198-tess gifts]4261-that happy green tract of land where summer had been liberal in her gifts ; in substance to all , emotionally to these . [Tess]198-tess would fain not have conversed with [Marian]310-marian of [the man who was legally , if not actually , [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband]4262-the man who was legally , if not actually , her husband ; but the irresistible fascination of the subject betrayed [her]198-tess into reciprocating [Marian]310-marian 's remarks . And thus , as has been said , though the damp curtains of [their]815-the two women bonnets flapped smartly into [their]815-the two women faces , and [their]815-the two women wrappers clung about [them]815-the two women to wearisomeness , [they]815-the two women lived all this afternoon in memories of green , sunny , romantic [Talbothays]60-talbothays .

" [You]198-tess can see a gleam of [a hill within a few miles o ' [Froom Valley]128-froom valley]7316-a hill within a few miles o ' froom valley from here when ' tis fine , "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian .

" Ah ! Can [you]310-marian ? "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess , awake to the new value of [this locality]4264-this locality .

So [the two forces]4265-the two forces were at work [here]5975-here as everywhere , the inherent will to enjoy , and the circumstantial will against enjoyment . [Marian]310-marian 's will had a method of assisting itself by taking from [her]310-marian pocket as the afternoon wore on a pint bottle corked with white rag , from which [she]310-marian invited [Tess]198-tess to drink . [Tess]198-tess 's unassisted power of dreaming , however , being enough for [her]198-tess sublimation at present , [she]198-tess declined except the merest sip , and then [Marian]310-marian took a pull from the spirits .

" [I]198-tess 've got used to it , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , " and ca n't leave it off now . ' Tis [my]198-tess only comfort - [You]310-marian see [I]198-tess lost [him]7317-him : [you]310-marian did n't ; and [you]310-marian can do without it perhaps . "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess thought [her]198-tess loss as great as [Marian]310-marian 's , but upheld by the dignity of being [[Angel]200-clare 's wife]4267-angel 's wife , in the letter at least , [she]198-tess accepted [Marian]310-marian 's differentiation .

Amid this scene [Tess]198-tess slaved in the morning frosts and in the afternoon rains . When it was not swede - grubbing it was swede - trimming , in which process [they]4268-they sliced off the earth and the fibres with a bill - hook before storing the roots for future use . At this occupation [they]4268-they could shelter [themselves]4268-they by a thatched hurdle if it rained ; but if it was frosty even [their]4268-they thick leather gloves could not prevent the frozen masses [they]4268-they handled from biting [their]4268-they fingers . Still [Tess]198-tess hoped . [She]198-tess had a conviction that sooner or later the magnanimity which [she]198-tess persisted in reckoning as a chief ingredient of [Clare]200-clare 's character would lead [him]4269-him to rejoin [her]198-tess .

[Marian]310-marian , primed to a humorous mood , would discover the queer - shaped flints aforesaid , and shriek with laughter , [Tess]198-tess remaining severely obtuse . [They]4268-they often looked across [the country]507-the country to where the Var or [Froom]64-froom was know to stretch , even though [they]4268-they might not be able to see it ; and , fixing [their]4268-they eyes on the cloaking gray mist , imagined the old times [they]4268-they had spent out there .

" Ah , "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian , " how [I]310-marian should like another or two of [our]4268-they old set to come here ! Then [we]4268-they could bring up [Talbothays]60-talbothays every day here afield , and talk of [he]60-talbothays , and of what nice times [we]4268-they had [there]5839-there , and o ' the old things [we]4268-they used to know , and make it all come back a'most , in seeming ! "[310-marian] [Marian]310-marian 's eyes softened , and [her]310-marian voice grew vague as the visions returned . " [I]310-marian 'll write to [Izz Huett]312-izz , "[310-marian] [she]310-marian said . " [She]312-izz 's biding at [home]5850-home doing nothing now , [I]310-marian know , and [I]310-marian 'll tell [her]312-izz [we]4268-they be here , and ask [her]312-izz to come ; and perhaps [Retty]311-retty is well enough now . "[310-marian]

[Tess]198-tess had nothing to say against the proposal , and the next [she]198-tess heard of this plan for importing [old Talbothays]60-talbothays ' joys was two or three days later , when [Marian]310-marian informed [her]198-tess that [Izz]4271-izz had replied to [her]198-tess inquiry , and had promised to come if [she]198-tess could .

There had not been such a winter for years . It came on in stealthy and measured glides , like the moves of [a chess - player]4272-a chess - player . One morning the few lonely trees and the thorns of the hedgerows appeared as if [they]4273-they had put off a vegetable for an animal integument . Every twig was covered with a white nap as of fur grown from the rind during the night , giving it four times its usual stoutness ; the whole bush or tree forming a staring sketch in white lines on the mournful gray of the sky and horizon . Cobwebs revealed [their]4273-they presence on [sheds]4274-sheds and walls where none had ever been observed till brought out into visibility by the crystallizing atmosphere , hanging like loops of white worsted from salient points of [the out - houses]4275-the out - houses , [posts]4276-posts , and gates .

After this season of congealed dampness came a spell of dry frost , when strange birds from behind [the North Pole]129-the north pole began to arrive silently on [the upland of Flintcomb - Ash]4277-the upland of flintcomb - ash ; [gaunt spectral creatures with tragical eyes - eyes which had witnessed scenes of cataclysmal horror in [inaccessible polar regions]4279-inaccessible polar regions of a magnitude such as [no human being]4280-no human being had ever conceived , in curdling temperatures that [no man]7093-no man could endure ; which had beheld the crash of icebergs and the slide of snow - hills by the shooting light of [the Aurora]130-the aurora]4278-gaunt spectral creatures with tragical eyes - eyes which had witnessed scenes of cataclysmal horror in inaccessible polar regions of a magnitude such as no human being had ever conceived , in curdling temperatures that no man could endure ; which had beheld the crash of icebergs and the slide of snow - hills by the shooting light of the aurora ; been half blinded by the whirl of colossal storms and terraqueous distortions ; and retained the expression of feature that such scenes had engendered . [These nameless birds]4282-these nameless birds came quite near to [Tess]198-tess and [Marian]310-marian , but of all [they]4282-these nameless birds had seen which [humanity]4283-humanity would never see , [they]4282-these nameless birds brought no account . [The traveller]4284-the traveller 's ambition to tell was not [theirs]4282-these nameless birds , and , with dumb impassivity , [they]4282-these nameless birds dismissed experiences which [they]4282-these nameless birds did not value for the immediate incidents of [this homely upland]4285-this homely upland - the trivial movements of [the two girls]1271-the two girls in disturbing the clods with [their]1271-the two girls hackers so as to uncover something or other that [these visitants]4287-these visitants relished as food .

Then one day a peculiar quality invaded the air of [this open country]4288-this open country . There came a moisture which was not of rain , and a cold which was not of frost . It chilled the eyeballs of [the twain]2615-the twain , made [their]2615-the twain brows ache , penetrated to [their]2615-the twain skeletons , affecting the surface of the body less than its core . [They]4282-these nameless birds knew that it meant snow , and in the night the snow came . [Tess]198-tess , who continued to live at [the cottage]1251-the cottage with the warm gable that cheered [any lonely pedestrian who paused beside [it]1251-the cottage]4291-any lonely pedestrian who paused beside it , awoke in the night , and heard above the thatch noises which seemed to signify that the roof had turned itself into a gymnasium of all the winds . When [she]198-tess lit [her]198-tess lamp to get up in the morning [she]198-tess found that the snow had blown through a chink in the casement , forming a white cone of the finest powder against the inside , and had also come down the chimney , so that it lay sole - deep upon the floor , on which [her]198-tess shoes left tracks when [she]198-tess moved about . Without , the storm drove so fast as to create a snow - mist in [the kitchen]2396-the kitchen ; but as yet it was too dark out - of - doors to see anything .

[Tess]198-tess knew that it was impossible to go on with [the swedes]4293-the swedes ; and by the time [she]198-tess had finished breakfast beside the solitary little lamp , [Marian]310-marian arrived to tell [her]198-tess that [they]4282-these nameless birds were to join [the rest of [the women at reed - drawing in [the barn]4296-the barn]4295-the women at reed - drawing in the barn]4294-the rest of the women at reed - drawing in the barn till the weather changed . As soon , therefore , as the uniform cloak of darkness without began to turn to a disordered medley of grays , [they]4282-these nameless birds blew out the lamp , wrapped [themselves]4282-these nameless birds up in [their]4282-these nameless birds thickest pinners , tied [their]4282-these nameless birds woollen cravats round [their]4282-these nameless birds necks and across [their]4282-these nameless birds chests , and started for [the barn]4296-the barn . The snow had followed the birds from [the polar basin]4298-the polar basin as a white pillar of a cloud , and individual flakes could not be seen . The blast smelt of icebergs , [arctic seas]4299-arctic seas , whales , and white bears , carrying the snow so that it licked [the land]6031-the land but did not deepen on it . [They]4282-these nameless birds trudged onwards with slanted bodies through [the flossy fields]4301-the flossy fields , keeping as well as [they]4282-these nameless birds could in the shelter of hedges , which , however , acted as strainers rather than screens . The air , afflicted to pallor with the hoary multitudes that infested it , twisted and spun them eccentrically , suggesting an achromatic chaos of things . But both [the young women]4302-the young women were fairly cheerful ; such weather on [a dry upland]4303-a dry upland is not in itself dispiriting .

" Ha - ha ! the cunning northern birds knew this was coming , "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian . " Depend upon't , [they]4282-these nameless birds keep just in front o't all the way from [the North Star]131-the north star . [[Your]310-marian husband]6856-your husband , [[my]310-marian dear]6039-my dear , is , [I]310-marian make no doubt , having scorching weather all this time . [Lord]7322-lord , if [he]6856-your husband could only see [[his]6856-your husband pretty wife]7323-his pretty wife now ! Not that this weather hurts [your]310-marian beauty at all - in fact , it rather does it good . "[310-marian]

" [You]310-marian must n't talk about [him]6856-your husband to [me]198-tess , [Marian]310-marian , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess severely .

" Well , but - surely [you]310-marian care for'n ! Do [you]310-marian ? "[310-marian]

Instead of answering , [Tess]198-tess , with tears in [her]198-tess eyes , impulsively faced in the direction in which [she]198-tess imagined [South America]132-south america to lie , and , putting up [her]198-tess lips , blew out a passionate kiss upon the snowy wind .

" Well , well , [I]310-marian know [you]310-marian do . But ' pon [my]310-marian body , it is a rum life for [a married couple]7324-a married couple ! There - [I]310-marian wo n't say another word ! Well , as for the weather , it wo n't hurt [us]4304-us in [the wheat - barn]7325-the wheat - barn ; but reed - drawing is fearful hard work - worse than swede - hacking . [I]310-marian can stand it because [I]310-marian 'm stout ; but [you]310-marian be slimmer than [I.]310-marian [I]310-marian ca n't think why [maister]7326-maister should have set ' ee at [it]7325-the wheat - barn . "[310-marian]

[They]4304-us reached [the wheat - barn]7325-the wheat - barn and entered [it]7325-the wheat - barn . One end of [the long structure]4306-the long structure was full of corn ; the middle was where the reed - drawing was carried on , and there had already been placed in the reed - press the evening before as many sheaves of wheat as would be sufficient for [the women]5900-the women to draw from during the day .

" Why , here 's Izz ! "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian .

[Izz]4308-izz it was , and [she]310-marian came forward . [She]310-marian had walked all the way from [[[her]310-marian mother]658-her mother 's home]4310-her mother 's home on the previous afternoon , and , not deeming the distance so great , had been belated , arriving , however , just before the snow began , and sleeping at [the alehouse]4311-the alehouse . [The farmer]1947-the farmer had agreed with [[her]310-marian mother]658-her mother at market to take [her]310-marian on if [she]310-marian came to - day , and [she]310-marian had been afraid to disappoint [him]1947-the farmer by delay .

In addition to [Tess]198-tess , [Marian]310-marian , and [Izz]312-izz , there were [two women from [a neighbouring village]4315-a neighbouring village]4314-two women from a neighbouring village ; [two Amazonian sisters]4316-two amazonian sisters , whom [Tess]198-tess with a start remembered as [Dark Car]394-dark car , [the Queen of Spades]1468-the queen of spades , and [[her]198-tess junior]4318-her junior , [the Queen of [Diamonds]56-diamonds]1426-the queen of diamonds - [those who had tried to fight with [her]198-tess in the midnight quarrel at [Trantridge]38-trantridge]4320-those who had tried to fight with her in the midnight quarrel at trantridge . [They]4314-two women from a neighbouring village showed no recognition of [her]198-tess , and possibly had none , for [they]4314-two women from a neighbouring village had been under the influence of liquor on that occasion , and were only temporary sojourners there as here . [They]4314-two women from a neighbouring village did all kinds of [men]5841-men 's work by preference , including well - sinking , hedging , ditching , and excavating , without any sense of fatigue . [Noted]395-noted reed - drawers were [they]4314-two women from a neighbouring village too , and looked round upon the other three with some superciliousness .

Putting on [their]4314-two women from a neighbouring village gloves , all set to work in a row in front of the press , an erection formed of two posts connected by a cross - beam , under which the sheaves to be drawn from were laid ears outward , the beam being pegged down by pins in the uprights , and lowered as the sheaves diminished .

The day hardened in colour , the light coming in at the barndoors upwards from the snow instead of downwards from the sky . [The girls]576-the girls pulled handful after handful from the press ; but by reason of the presence of [the strange women]4323-the strange women , who were recounting scandals , [Marian]310-marian and [Izz]312-izz could not at first talk of old times as [they]4314-two women from a neighbouring village wished to do . Presently [they]4314-two women from a neighbouring village heard the muffled tread of a horse , and [the farmer]1947-the farmer rode up to the barndoor . When [he]1947-the farmer had dismounted [he]1947-the farmer came close to [Tess]198-tess , and remained looking musingly at the side of [her]198-tess face . [She]198-tess had not turned at first , but [his]1947-the farmer fixed attitude led [her]198-tess to look round , when [she]198-tess perceived that [[her]198-tess employer]4325-her employer was [the native of [Trantridge]38-trantridge from whom [she]198-tess had taken flight on [the high - road]4327-the high - road]4326-the native of trantridge from whom she had taken flight on the high - road because of [his]1947-the farmer allusion to [her]198-tess history .

[He]1947-the farmer waited till [she]198-tess had carried the drawn bundles to the pile outside , when [he]1947-the farmer said , " So [you]198-tess be [the young woman who took [my]1947-the farmer civility in such ill part]7327-the young woman who took my civility in such ill part ? Be drowned if [I]1947-the farmer did n't think [you]198-tess might be as soon as [I]1947-the farmer heard of [your]198-tess being hired ! Well , [you]198-tess thought [you]198-tess had got the better of [me]1947-the farmer the first time at [the inn]697-the inn with [[your]198-tess fancy - man]7284-your fancy - man , and the second time on [the road]550-the road , when [you]198-tess bolted ; but now [I]1947-the farmer think [I]1947-the farmer 've got the better [you]198-tess . "[1947-the farmer] [He]1947-the farmer concluded with a hard laugh .

[Tess]198-tess , between [the Amazons]396-the amazons and [the farmer , like a bird caught in a clap - net]4328-the farmer , like a bird caught in a clap - net , returned no answer , continuing to pull the straw .
