[She]198-tess could read character sufficiently well to know by this time that [she]198-tess had nothing to fear from [[her]198-tess employer]4325-her employer 's gallantry ; it was rather the tyranny induced by [his]1947-the farmer mortification at [Clare]200-clare 's treatment of [him]1947-the farmer . Upon the whole [she]198-tess preferred that sentiment in [man]970-man and felt brave enough to endure it .

" [You]1947-the farmer thought [I]4332-i was in love with ' [ee]7331-ee [I]4332-i suppose ? [Some women]6278-some women are [such fools]7333-such fools , to take every look as serious earnest . But there 's nothing like a winter afield for taking that nonsense out o ' [young wenches]7334-young wenches ' heads ; and [you]1947-the farmer 've signed and agreed till Lady - Day . Now , are [you]1947-the farmer going to beg [my]4332-i pardon ? "[4332-i]

" [I]970-man think [you]1947-the farmer ought to beg [mine]970-man . "[970-man]

" Very well - as [you]1947-the farmer like . But [we]7335-we 'll see which is [master]7336-master here . Be [they]4331-the two stalwart women all the sheaves [you]1947-the farmer 've done to - day ? "[4332-i]

" Yes , [sir]5821-sir . "[970-man]

" ' Tis a very poor show . Just see what [they]4331-the two stalwart women 've done over there "[4332-i] pointing to [the two stalwart women]4331-the two stalwart women . " [The rest]6118-the rest , too , have done better than [you]1947-the farmer . "[4332-i]

" [They]4331-the two stalwart women 've all practised it before , and [I]970-man have not . And [I]970-man thought it made no difference to [you]1947-the farmer as it is task work , and [we]7335-we are only paid for what [we]7335-we do . "[970-man]

" Oh , but it does . [I]4332-i want [the barn]4296-the barn cleared . "[4332-i]

" [I]4332-i am going to work all the afternoon instead of leaving at two as [the others]2258-the others will do . "[4332-i]

[He]4332-i looked sullenly at [her]4333-her and went away . [Tess]198-tess felt that [she]198-tess could not have come to a much worse place ; but anything was better than gallantry . When [two o'clock]4334-two o'clock arrived [the professional reed - drawers]4335-the professional reed - drawers tossed off the last half - pint in [their]4335-the professional reed - drawers flagon , put down [their]4335-the professional reed - drawers hooks , tied [their]4335-the professional reed - drawers last sheaves , and went away . [Marian]310-marian and [Izz]312-izz would have done likewise , but on hearing that [Tess]198-tess meant to stay , to make up by longer hours for [her]198-tess lack of skill , [they]4335-the professional reed - drawers would not leave [her]198-tess . Looking out at the snow , which still fell , [Marian]310-marian exclaimed , " Now , [we]4335-the professional reed - drawers 've got it all to [ourselves]4335-the professional reed - drawers . "[310-marian] And so at last the conversation turned to [their]4335-the professional reed - drawers old experiences at [the dairy]1952-the dairy ; and , of course , the incidents of [their]4335-the professional reed - drawers affection for [Angel Clare]200-clare .

" [Izz]312-izz and [Marian]310-marian , "[200-clare] said [Mrs Angel Clare]200-clare , with a dignity which was extremely touching , seeing how very little of [a wife]2650-a wife [she]200-clare was : " [I]200-clare ca n't join in talk with [you]7341-you now , as [I]200-clare used to do , about [Mr Clare]284-clare ; [you]7341-you will see that [I]200-clare can not ; because , although [he]284-clare is gone away from [me]200-clare for the present , [he]284-clare is [[my]200-clare husband]7291-my husband . "[200-clare]

[Izz]4338-izz was by nature [the sauciest and most caustic of all the four girls who had loved [Clare]284-clare]4339-the sauciest and most caustic of all the four girls who had loved clare . " [He]284-clare was [a very splendid lover]7343-a very splendid lover , no doubt , "[200-clare] [she]200-clare said ; " but [I]200-clare do n't think [he]284-clare is [a too fond husband]7344-a too fond husband to go away from [you]7341-you so soon . "[200-clare]

" [He]284-clare had to go - [he]284-clare was obliged to go , to see about [the land over there]7345-the land over there ! "[198-tess] pleaded [Tess]198-tess .

" [He]284-clare might have tided ' [ee]7346-ee over the winter . "[200-clare]

" Ah - that 's owing to an accident - a misunderstanding ; and [we]4340-they wo n't argue it , "[198-tess] [Tess]198-tess answered , with tearfulness in [her]198-tess words . " Perhaps there 's a good deal to be said for [him]284-clare ! [He]284-clare did not go away , like [some husbands]7347-some husbands , without telling [me]198-tess ; and [I]198-tess can always find out where [he]284-clare is . "[198-tess]

After this [they]4340-they continued for some long time in a reverie , as [they]4340-they went on seizing the ears of corn , drawing out the straw , gathering it under [their]4340-they arms , and cutting off the ears with [their]4340-they bill - hooks , nothing sounding in [the barn]4296-the barn but the swish of the straw and the crunch of the hook . Then [Tess]198-tess suddenly flagged , and sank down upon the heap of wheat - ears at [her]198-tess feet .

" [I]310-marian knew [you]198-tess would n't be able to stand it ! "[310-marian] cried [Marian]310-marian . " It wants harder flesh than [yours]198-tess for this work . "[310-marian]

Just then [the farmer]1947-the farmer entered . " Oh , that 's how [you]198-tess get on when [I]1947-the farmer am away , "[1947-the farmer] [he]1947-the farmer said to [her]198-tess .

" But it is [my]198-tess own loss , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess pleaded . " Not [yours]1947-the farmer . "[198-tess]

" [I]1947-the farmer want it finished , "[1947-the farmer] [he]1947-the farmer said doggedly , as [he]1947-the farmer crossed [the barn]4296-the barn and went out at the other door .

" Do n't ' [ee]7348-ee mind [him]1947-the farmer , there 's [a dear]7349-a dear , "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian . " [I]310-marian 've worked [here]5975-here before . Now [you]7349-a dear go and lie down there , and [Izz]310-marian and [I]310-marian will make up [your]7349-a dear number . "[310-marian]

" [I]198-tess do n't like to let [you]7349-a dear do that . [I]198-tess 'm taller than [you]7349-a dear , too . "[198-tess]

However , [she]198-tess was so overcome that [she]198-tess consented to lie down awhile , and reclined on a heap of pull - tails - the refuse after the straight straw had been drawn - thrown up at the further side of [the barn]4296-the barn . [Her]198-tess succumbing had been as largely owning to agitation at the re - opening the subject of [her]198-tess separation from [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband as to the hard work . [She]198-tess lay in a state of percipience without volition , and the rustle of the straw and the cutting of the ears by [the others]2258-the others had the weight of bodily touches .

[She]198-tess could hear from [her]198-tess corner , in addition to these noises , the murmur of [their]4347-their voices . [She]198-tess felt certain that [they]4347-their were continuing the subject already broached , but [their]4347-their voices were so low that [she]198-tess could not catch the words . At last [Tess]198-tess grew more and more anxious to know what [they]4347-their were saying , and , persuading [herself]198-tess that [she]198-tess felt better , [she]198-tess got up and resumed work .

Then [Izz Huett]312-izz broke down . [She]312-izz had walked more than a dozen miles the previous evening , had gone to bed at midnight , and had risen again at five o'clock . [Marian]310-marian alone , thanks to [her]310-marian bottle of liquor and [her]310-marian stoutness of build , stood the strain upon back and arms without suffering . [Tess]198-tess urged [Izz]312-izz to leave off , agreeing , as [she]198-tess felt better , to finish the day without [her]198-tess , and make equal division of the number of sheaves .

[Izz]312-izz accepted the offer gratefully , and disappeared through the great door into [the snowy track]4348-the snowy track to [[her]198-tess lodging]4349-her lodging . [Marian]310-marian , as was the case every afternoon at this time on account of the bottle , began to feel in a romantic vein .

" [I]310-marian should not have thought it of [him]7351-he - never ! "[310-marian] [she]310-marian said in a dreamy tone . " And [I]310-marian loved [him]7351-he so ! [I]310-marian did n't mind [his]7351-he having [YOU]7352-you . But this about [Izz]312-izz is too bad ! "[310-marian]

[Tess]198-tess , in [her]198-tess start at the words , narrowly missed cutting off a finger with the bill - hook .

" Is it about [[my]198-tess husband]7291-my husband ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess stammered .

" Well , yes . [Izz]312-izz said , ' Do n't ' [ee]7354-her tell [her]7354-her ' ; but [I]198-tess am sure [I]198-tess ca n't help it ! It was what [he]7351-he wanted [Izz]312-izz to do . [He]7351-he wanted [her]7354-her to go off to [Brazil]109-brazil with [him]7351-he . "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess 's face faded as white as the scene without , and its curves straightened . " And did [Izz]312-izz refuse to go ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess asked .

" [I]198-tess do n't know . Anyhow [he]7351-he changed [his]7351-he mind . "[198-tess]

" Pooh - then [he]7351-he did n't mean it ! ' Twas just [a man]1337-a man 's jest ! "[198-tess]

" Yes [he]7351-he did ; for [he]7351-he drove [her]7354-her a good - ways towards [the station]6774-the station . "[198-tess]

" [He]7351-he did n't take [her]7354-her ! "[198-tess]

[They]4350-they pulled on in silence till [Tess]198-tess , without any premonitory symptoms , burst out crying .

" [There]5839-there ! "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian . " Now [I]310-marian wish [I]310-marian had n't told [']310-marian [ee]310-marian ! "[310-marian]

" No . It is a very good thing that [you]310-marian have done ! [I]198-tess have been living on in a thirtover , lackaday way , and have not seen what it may lead to ! [I]198-tess ought to have sent [him]7351-he a letter oftener . [He]7351-he said [I]198-tess could not go to [him]7351-he , but [he]7351-he did n't say [I]198-tess was not to write as often as [I]198-tess liked . [I]198-tess wo n't dally like this any longer ! [I]198-tess have been very wrong and neglectful in leaving everything to be done by [him]7351-he ! "[198-tess]

The dim light in [the barn]4296-the barn grew dimmer , and [they]4352-they could see to work no longer . When [Tess]198-tess had reached [home]5850-home that evening , and had entered into the privacy of [[her]198-tess little white - washed chamber]4354-her little white - washed chamber , [she]198-tess began impetuously writing a letter to [Clare]284-clare . But falling into doubt , [she]198-tess could not finish it . Afterwards [she]198-tess took the ring from the ribbon on which [she]198-tess wore it next [her]198-tess heart , and retained it on [her]198-tess finger all night , as if to fortify [herself]198-tess in the sensation that [she]198-tess was really [the wife of [this elusive lover of [hers]198-tess , who could propose that [Izz]312-izz should go with [him]4356-this elusive lover of hers , who could propose that izz should go with him abroad abroad]4356-this elusive lover of hers , who could propose that izz should go with him abroad , so shortly after [he]4356-this elusive lover of hers , who could propose that izz should go with him abroad had left [her]198-tess]4355-the wife of this elusive lover of hers , who could propose that izz should go with him abroad , so shortly after he had left her . Knowing that , how could [she]198-tess write entreaties to [him]4356-this elusive lover of hers , who could propose that izz should go with him abroad , or show that [she]198-tess cared for [him]4356-this elusive lover of hers , who could propose that izz should go with him abroad any more ?

XLIV

By the disclosure in [the barn]4296-the barn [her]198-tess thoughts were led anew in the direction which [they]4358-they had taken more than once of late - to [the distant Emminster Vicarage]4359-the distant emminster vicarage . It was through [[[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband 's parents]4088-her husband 's parents that [she]198-tess had been charged to send a letter to [Clare]284-clare if [she]198-tess desired ; and to write to [them]4088-her husband 's parents direct if in difficulty . But that sense of [her]198-tess having morally no claim upon [him]4356-this elusive lover of hers , who could propose that izz should go with him abroad had always led [Tess]198-tess to suspend [her]198-tess impulse to send these notes ; and to [the family at [the Vicarage]2162-the vicarage]4362-the family at the vicarage , therefore , as to [[her]198-tess own parents]4083-her own parents since [her]198-tess marriage , [she]198-tess was virtually non - existent . This self - effacement in both directions had been quite in consonance with [her]198-tess independent character of desiring nothing by way of favour or pity to which [she]198-tess was not entitled on a fair consideration of [her]198-tess deserts . [She]198-tess had set [herself]198-tess to stand or fall by [her]198-tess qualities , and to waive such merely technical claims upon a strange family as had been established for [her]198-tess by the flimsy fact of [a member of [that family]4366-that family]4365-a member of that family , in a season of impulse , writing [his]4365-a member of that family name in a church - book beside [hers]198-tess .

But now that [she]198-tess was stung to a fever by [Izz]312-izz 's tale , there was a limit to [her]198-tess powers of renunciation . Why had [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband not written to [her]198-tess ? [He]791-her husband had distinctly implied that [he]791-her husband would at least let [her]198-tess know of [the locality to which [he]791-her husband had journeyed]4368-the locality to which he had journeyed ; but [he]791-her husband had not sent a line to notify [his]791-her husband address . Was [he]791-her husband really indifferent ? But was [he]791-her husband ill ? Was it for [her]198-tess to make some advance ? Surely [she]198-tess might summon the courage of solicitude , call at [the Vicarage]2162-the vicarage for intelligence , and express [her]198-tess grief at [his]791-her husband silence . If [[Angel]284-clare 's father]2175-angel 's father were [the good man [she]198-tess had heard [him]791-her husband represented to be]4371-the good man she had heard him represented to be , [he]791-her husband would be able to enter into [her]198-tess heart - starved situation . [Her]198-tess social hardships [she]198-tess could conceal .

To leave [the farm]7206-the farm on a week - day was not in [her]198-tess power ; Sunday was the only possible opportunity . [Flintcomb - Ash]126-flintcomb - ash being in [the middle of [the cretaceous tableland over which no railway had climbed as yet]4374-the cretaceous tableland over which no railway had climbed as yet]4373-the middle of the cretaceous tableland over which no railway had climbed as yet , it would be necessary to walk . And the distance being fifteen miles each way [she]198-tess would have to allow [herself]198-tess a long day for the undertaking by rising early .

A fortnight later , when the snow had gone , and had been followed by a hard black frost , [she]198-tess took advantage of the state of [the roads]928-the roads to try the experiment . At four o'clock that Sunday morning [she]198-tess came [downstairs]1128-downstairs and stepped out into the starlight . The weather was still favourable , the ground ringing under [her]198-tess feet like an anvil .

[Marian]310-marian and [Izz]312-izz were much interested in [her]198-tess excursion , knowing that the journey concerned [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband . [[Their]4378-their lodgings]4379-their lodgings were in [a cottage a little further along [the lane]631-the lane]4380-a cottage a little further along the lane , but [they]4378-their came and assisted [Tess]198-tess in [her]198-tess departure , and argued that [she]198-tess should dress up in [her]198-tess very prettiest guise to captivate the hearts of [[her]198-tess parents - in - law]4382-her parents - in - law ; though [she]198-tess , knowing of the austere and Calvinistic tenets of [old Mr Clare]284-clare , was indifferent , and even doubtful . A year had now elapsed since [her]198-tess sad marriage , but [she]198-tess had preserved sufficient draperies from the wreck of [her]198-tess then full wardrobe to clothe [her]198-tess very charmingly as [a simple country girl with no pretensions to recent fashion]4383-a simple country girl with no pretensions to recent fashion ; a soft gray woollen gown , with white crape quilling against the pink skin of [her]198-tess face and neck , and a black velvet jacket and hat .

" ' Tis a thousand pities [[your]198-tess husband]6856-your husband ca n't see ' ee now - [you]198-tess do look [a real beauty]7359-a real beauty ! "[312-izz] said [Izz Huett]312-izz , regarding [Tess]198-tess as [she]198-tess stood on the threshold between the steely starlight without and the yellow candlelight within . [Izz]312-izz spoke with a magnanimous abandonment of [herself]312-izz to the situation ; [she]312-izz could not be - [no woman with a heart bigger than a hazel - nut]4384-no woman with a heart bigger than a hazel - nut could be - antagonistic to [Tess]198-tess in [her]198-tess presence , the influence which [she]312-izz exercised over those of [her]312-izz own sex being of a warmth and strength quite unusual , curiously overpowering the less worthy feminine feelings of spite and rivalry .

With a final tug and touch here , and a slight brush there , [they]4385-they let [her]312-izz go ; and [she]312-izz was absorbed into the pearly air of the fore - dawn . [They]4385-they heard [her]312-izz footsteps tap along [the hard road]4386-the hard road as [she]312-izz stepped out to [her]312-izz full pace . Even [Izz]312-izz hoped [she]312-izz would win , and , though without any particular respect for [her]312-izz own virtue , felt glad that [she]312-izz had been prevented wronging [[her]312-izz friend]3163-her friend when momentarily tempted by [Clare]284-clare .

It was a year ago , all but a day , that [Clare]284-clare had married [Tess]198-tess , and only a few days less than a year that [he]284-clare had been absent from [her]312-izz . Still , to start on a brisk walk , and on such an errand as [hers]312-izz , on a dry clear wintry morning , through the rarefied air of these chalky hogs'-backs , was not depressing ; and there is no doubt that [her]312-izz dream at starting was to win the heart of [[her]312-izz mother - in - law]4388-her mother - in - law , tell [her]312-izz whole history to [that lady]5965-that lady , enlist [her]5965-that lady on [her]4388-her mother - in - law side , and so gain back the truant .

In time [she]312-izz reached the edge of the vast escarpment below which stretched [the loamy Vale of [Blackmoor]4-blackmoor]4390-the loamy vale of blackmoor , now lying misty and still in the dawn . Instead of the colourless air of [the uplands]2570-the uplands , the atmosphere down there was a deep blue . Instead of the great enclosures of a hundred acres in which [she]312-izz was now accustomed to toil , there were [little fields below [her]312-izz of less than half - a - dozen acres]4392-little fields below her of less than half - a - dozen acres , so numerous that [they]4392-little fields below her of less than half - a - dozen acres looked from this height like the meshes of a net . Here the landscape was whitey - brown ; down there , as in [Froom Valley]128-froom valley , it was always green . Yet it was in [that vale]4393-that vale that [her]312-izz sorrow had taken shape , and [she]312-izz did not love it as formerly . Beauty to [her]312-izz , as to [all who have felt]4394-all who have felt , lay not in the thing , but in what the thing symbolized .

Keeping [the Vale]30-the vale on [her]312-izz right , [she]312-izz steered steadily westward ; passing above [the Hintocks]133-the hintocks , crossing at right - angles [the high - road from [Sherton - Abbas]134-sherton - abbas to [Casterbridge]41-casterbridge]4395-the high - road from sherton - abbas to casterbridge , and skirting [Dogbury Hill]135-dogbury hill and [High - Stoy]136-high - stoy , with the dell between them called " [The Devil 's Kitchen]7360-the devil 's kitchen "[312-izz] . Still following the elevated way [she]312-izz reached [Cross - in - Hand]4396-cross - in - hand , where the stone pillar stands desolate and silent , to mark the site of a miracle , or murder , or both . Three miles further [she]312-izz cut across [the straight and deserted Roman road called [Long - Ash Lane]137-long - ash lane]4397-the straight and deserted roman road called long - ash lane ; leaving which as soon as [she]312-izz reached [it]4397-the straight and deserted roman road called long - ash lane [she]312-izz dipped down [a hill]3810-a hill by [a transverse lane]4399-a transverse lane into [the small town or village of Evershead]4400-the small town or village of evershead , being now about halfway over the distance . [She]312-izz made a halt here , and breakfasted a second time , heartily enough - not at [the Sow - and - Acorn]4401-the sow - and - acorn , for [she]312-izz avoided [inns]3249-inns , but at [a cottage by [the church]6443-the church]4403-a cottage by the church .

The second half of [her]312-izz journey was through [a more gentle country]4405-a more gentle country , by way of [Benvill Lane]138-benvill lane . But as the mileage lessened between [her]312-izz and the spot of [her]312-izz pilgrimage , so did [Tess]198-tess 's confidence decrease , and [her]312-izz enterprise loom out more formidably . [She]312-izz saw [her]312-izz purpose in such staring lines , and the landscape so faintly , that [she]312-izz was sometimes in danger of losing [her]312-izz way . However , about noon [she]312-izz paused by a gate on the edge of the basin in which [Emminster]72-emminster and [[its]72-emminster Vicarage]4406-its vicarage lay .

[The square tower]4407-the square tower , beneath which [she]312-izz knew that at that moment [the Vicar]1858-the vicar and [[his]1858-the vicar congregation]4409-his congregation were gathered , had a severe look in [her]312-izz eyes . [She]312-izz wished that [she]312-izz had somehow contrived to come on a week - day . [Such a good man]4410-such a good man might be prejudiced against [a woman who had chosen Sunday , never realizing the necessities of [her]312-izz case]4411-a woman who had chosen sunday , never realizing the necessities of her case . But it was incumbent upon [her]312-izz to go on now . [She]312-izz took off the thick boots in which [she]312-izz had walked thus far , put on [her]312-izz pretty thin ones of patent leather , and , stuffing the former into the hedge by the gatepost where [she]312-izz might readily find them again , descended [the hill]642-the hill ; the freshness of colour [she]312-izz had derived from the keen air thinning away in spite of [her]312-izz as [she]312-izz drew near [the parsonage]4005-the parsonage .

[Tess]198-tess hoped for some accident that might favour [her]198-tess , but nothing favoured [her]198-tess . The shrubs on [the Vicarage lawn]4414-the vicarage lawn rustled uncomfortably in the frosty breeze ; [she]198-tess could not feel by any stretch of imagination , dressed to [her]198-tess highest as [she]198-tess was , that [the house]652-the house was [the residence of [near relations]4417-near relations]4416-the residence of near relations ; and yet nothing essential , in nature or emotion , divided [her]198-tess from them : in pains , pleasures , thoughts , birth , death , and after - death , they were the same .

[She]312-izz nerved [herself]312-izz by an effort , entered the swing - gate , and rang the door - bell . The thing was done ; there could be no retreat . No ; the thing was not done . [Nobody]754-nobody answered to [her]312-izz ringing . The effort had to be risen to and made again . [She]312-izz rang a second time , and the agitation of the act , coupled with [her]312-izz weariness after the fifteen miles ' walk , led [her]312-izz support [herself]312-izz while [she]312-izz waited by resting [her]312-izz hand on [her]312-izz hip , and [her]312-izz elbow against the wall of [the porch]4419-the porch . The wind was so nipping that the ivy - leaves had become wizened and gray , each tapping incessantly upon its neighbour with a disquieting stir of [her]312-izz nerves . A piece of blood - stained paper , caught up from [some meat - buyer]4420-some meat - buyer 's dust - heap , beat up and down [the road]550-the road without the gate ; too flimsy to rest , too heavy to fly away ; and a few straws kept it company .

The second peal had been louder , and still [nobody]754-nobody came . Then [she]312-izz walked out of [the porch]4419-the porch , opened the gate , and passed through . And though [she]312-izz looked dubiously at [the house]652-the house - front as if inclined to return , it was with a breath of relied that [she]312-izz closed the gate . A feeling haunted [her]312-izz that [she]312-izz might have been recognized though how [she]312-izz could not tell , and orders been given not to admit [her]312-izz .

[Tess]198-tess went as far as the corner . [She]198-tess had done all [she]198-tess could do ; but determined not to escape present trepidation at the expense of future distress , [she]198-tess walked back again quite past [the house]652-the house , looking up at all the windows .

Ah - the explanation was that [they]4426-they were all at [church]813-church , [every one]1715-every one . [She]198-tess remembered [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband saying that [[his]791-her husband father]457-his father always insisted upon [the household]874-the household , [servants]2307-servants included , going to morning - service , and , as a consequence , eating cold food when [they]4426-they came [home]5850-home . It was , therefore , only necessary to wait till the service was over . [She]198-tess would not make [herself]198-tess conspicuous by waiting on the spot , and [she]198-tess started to get past [the church]6443-the church into [the lane]631-the lane . But as [she]198-tess reached [the churchyard - gate]4436-the churchyard - gate [the people]4437-the people began pouring out , and [Tess]198-tess found [herself]198-tess in the midst of [them]4437-the people .

[The Emminster congregation]4438-the emminster congregation looked at [her]198-tess as only [a congregation of [small country - townsfolk walking [home]5850-home at its leisure]4440-small country - townsfolk walking home at its leisure]4439-a congregation of small country - townsfolk walking home at its leisure can look at [a woman out of the common whom it perceives to be [a stranger]1085-a stranger]4442-a woman out of the common whom it perceives to be a stranger . [She]198-tess quickened [her]198-tess pace , and ascended [the the road by which [she]198-tess had come]4444-the the road by which she had come , to find a retreat between [its]4444-the the road by which she had come hedges till [[the Vicar]1858-the vicar 's family]4446-the vicar 's family should have lunched , and it might be convenient for [them]4446-the vicar 's family to receive [her]198-tess . [She]198-tess soon distanced [the churchgoers]4447-the churchgoers , except [two youngish men]4448-two youngish men , who , linked arm - in - arm , were beating up behind [her]198-tess at a quick step .

As [they]4448-two youngish men drew nearer [she]198-tess could hear [their]4448-two youngish men voices engaged in earnest discourse , and , with the natural quickness of [a woman]1028-a woman in [her]1028-a woman situation , did not fail to recognize in those noises the quality of [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband 's tones . [The pedestrians]4451-the pedestrians were [[his]791-her husband two brothers]2743-his two brothers . Forgetting all [her]198-tess plans , [Tess]198-tess 's one dread was lest [they]4448-two youngish men should overtake [her]198-tess now , in [her]198-tess disorganized condition , before [she]198-tess was prepared to confront [them]4448-two youngish men ; for though [she]198-tess felt that [they]4448-two youngish men could not identify [her]198-tess , [she]198-tess instinctively dreaded [their]4448-two youngish men scrutiny . The more briskly [they]4448-two youngish men walked , the more briskly walked [she]198-tess . [They]4448-two youngish men were plainly bent upon taking a short quick stroll before going indoors to lunch or dinner , to restore warmth to limbs chilled with sitting through a long service .

[Only one person]4453-only one person had preceded [Tess]198-tess up [the hill]642-the hill - [a ladylike young woman]4455-a ladylike young woman , somewhat interesting , though , perhaps , [a trifle guindee and prudish]4456-a trifle guindee and prudish . [Tess]198-tess had nearly overtaken [her]198-tess when the speed of [[her]198-tess brothers - in - law]4457-her brothers - in - law brought [them]4448-two youngish men so nearly behind [her]198-tess back that [she]198-tess could hear every word of [their]4448-two youngish men conversation . [They]4448-two youngish men said nothing , however , which particularly interested [her]198-tess till , observing [the young lady still further in front]4458-the young lady still further in front , [one of [them]4448-two youngish men]1380-one of them remarked , " There is [Mercy Chant]330-mercy . [Tess]198-tess knew the name . [The young lady still further ahead]4466-the young lady still further ahead heard [their]4465-they footsteps and turned . [Cuthbert Clare]397-clare , who had been [the one to find them]4474-the one to find them , picked them up for [her]198-tess with the crook of [his]4473-his stick ; and [Tess]198-tess 's boots were appropriated .

[She]198-tess , who had heard this , walked past under the screen of [her]198-tess woollen veil till , presently looking back , [she]198-tess perceived that [the church party]4475-the church party had left the gate with [her]198-tess boots and retreated down [the hill]642-the hill .

Thereupon [[our]4477-our heroine]1449-our heroine resumed [her]1449-our heroine walk . Tears , blinding tears , were running down [her]1449-our heroine face . [She]1449-our heroine knew that it was all sentiment , all baseless impressibility , which had caused [her]1449-our heroine to read the scene as [her]1449-our heroine own condemnation ; nevertheless [she]1449-our heroine could not get over it ; [she]1449-our heroine could not contravene in [her]1449-our heroine own defenceless person all those untoward omens . It was impossible to think of returning to [the Vicarage]2162-the vicarage . [[Angel]284-clare 's wife]4267-angel 's wife felt almost as if [she]4267-angel 's wife had been hounded up [that hill]4481-that hill like a scorned thing by those - to [[her]4267-angel 's wife - superfine clerics]4482-her - superfine clerics . Innocently as the slight had been inflicted , it was somewhat unfortunate that [she]4267-angel 's wife had encountered [the sons]2784-the sons and not [the father]6346-the father , who , despite [his]6346-the father narrowness , was far less starched and ironed than [they]2784-the sons , and had to the full the gift of charity . As [she]4267-angel 's wife again thought of [her]4267-angel 's wife dusty boots [she]4267-angel 's wife almost pitied those habiliments for the quizzing to which [they]2784-the sons had been subjected , and felt how hopeless life was for [[their]2784-the sons owner]4485-their owner .

" Ah ! "[4267-angel 's wife] [she]4267-angel 's wife said , still sighing in pity of [herself]4267-angel 's wife , " [THEY]2784-the sons did n't know that [I]4267-angel 's wife wore those over the roughest part of [the road]550-the road to save these pretty ones [HE]4485-their owner bought for [me]4267-angel 's wife - no - [they]2784-the sons did not know it ! "[4267-angel 's wife]

Then [she]4267-angel 's wife grieved for [the beloved man whose conventional standard of judgement had caused [her]4267-angel 's wife all these latter sorrows]4486-the beloved man whose conventional standard of judgement had caused her all these latter sorrows ; and [she]4267-angel 's wife went [her]4267-angel 's wife way without knowing that the greatest misfortune of [her]4267-angel 's wife life was this feminine loss of courage at the last and critical moment through [her]4267-angel 's wife estimating [[her]4267-angel 's wife father - in - law]4487-her father - in - law by [[his]4487-her father - in - law sons]6432-his sons . [Her]4267-angel 's wife present condition was precisely one which would have enlisted the sympathies of [old Mr]4489-old mr and [Mrs Clare]200-clare . [Their]4490-their hearts went out of [them]4490-their at a bound towards extreme cases , when the subtle mental troubles of the less desperate among [mankind]1581-mankind failed to win [their]4490-their interest or regard . In jumping at [Publicans]4492-publicans and [Sinners]4493-sinners [they]4490-their would forget that a word might be said for the worries of [Scribes]4494-scribes and [Pharisees]4495-pharisees ; and this defect or limitation might have recommended [[their]4490-their own daughter - in - law]4496-their own daughter - in - law to [them]4490-their at this moment as [a fairly choice sort of lost person for [their]4490-their love]4497-a fairly choice sort of lost person for their love .

Thereupon [she]4267-angel 's wife began to plod back along the road by which [she]4267-angel 's wife had come not altogether full of hope , but full of a conviction that a crisis in [her]4267-angel 's wife life was approaching . No crisis , apparently , had supervened ; and there was nothing left for [her]4267-angel 's wife to do but to continue upon [that starve - acre farm]4498-that starve - acre farm till [she]4267-angel 's wife could again summon courage to face [the Vicarage]2162-the vicarage . [She]4267-angel 's wife did , indeed , take sufficient interest in [herself]4267-angel 's wife to throw up [her]4267-angel 's wife veil on this return journey , as if to let [the world]497-the world see that [she]4267-angel 's wife could at least exhibit a face such as [Mercy Chant]330-mercy could not show . But it was done with a sorry shake of the head . " It is nothing - it is nothing ! "[4267-angel 's wife] [she]4267-angel 's wife said . " [Nobody]754-nobody loves it ; [nobody]754-nobody sees it . Who cares about the looks of [a castaway like [me]4267-angel 's wife]7372-a castaway like me ! "[4267-angel 's wife]

[Her]4267-angel 's wife journey back was rather a meander than a march . It had no sprightliness , no purpose ; only a tendency . Along [the tedious length of Benvill Lane]4501-the tedious length of benvill lane [she]4267-angel 's wife began to grow tired , and [she]4267-angel 's wife leant upon gates and paused by milestones .

[She]4267-angel 's wife did not enter [any house]4502-any house till , at the seventh or eighth mile , [she]4267-angel 's wife descended [the steep long hill below which lay [the village]473-the village or [townlet of Evershead]4505-townlet of evershead]4503-the steep long hill below which lay the village or townlet of evershead , where in the morning [she]4267-angel 's wife had breakfasted with such contrasting expectations . [The cottage by [the church]6443-the church , in which [she]4267-angel 's wife again sat down]4506-the cottage by the church , in which she again sat down , was almost the first at [that end of [the village]473-the village]4508-that end of the village , and while [the woman]674-the woman fetched [her]4267-angel 's wife some milk from the pantry , [Tess]198-tess , looking down [the street]4511-the street , perceived that [the place]5882-the place seemed quite deserted .

" [The people]4437-the people are gone to afternoon service , [I]198-tess suppose ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said .

" No , [[my]1273-the old woman dear]6039-my dear , "[1273-the old woman] said [the old woman]1273-the old woman . " ' Tis too soon for that ; the bells hain't strook out yet .
