[Tess]198-tess soon went onward into [the village]473-the village , [her]198-tess footsteps echoing against [the houses]4515-the houses as though [it]4515-the houses were [a place of the dead]4516-a place of the dead . Nearing the central part , [her]198-tess echoes were intruded on by other sounds ; and seeing [the barn]4296-the barn not far off [the road]550-the road , [she]198-tess guessed these to be the utterances of [the preacher]4519-the preacher .

[His]4519-the preacher voice became so distinct in the still clear air that [she]198-tess could soon catch [his]4519-the preacher sentences , though [she]198-tess was on the closed side of [the barn]4296-the barn . The sermon , as might be expected , was of the extremest antinomian type ; on justification by faith , as expounded in the theology of [St Paul]336-paul . This fixed idea of [the rhapsodist]4521-the rhapsodist was delivered with animated enthusiasm , in a manner entirely declamatory , for [he]4519-the preacher had plainly no skill as [a dialectician]4522-a dialectician . Although [Tess]198-tess had not heard the beginning of the address , [she]198-tess learnt what the text had been from its constant iteration -

" [O foolish galatians , who hath bewitched [you]7381-you , that [ye]7381-you should not obey the truth , before whose eyes [Jesus Christ]398-jesus christ hath been evidently set forth , crucified among [you]7381-you]7380-o foolish galatians , who hath bewitched you , that ye should not obey the truth , before whose eyes jesus christ hath been evidently set forth , crucified among you ? "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess was all the more interested , as [she]198-tess stood listening behind , in finding that [the preacher]4519-the preacher 's doctrine was a vehement form of the view of [[Angel]200-clare 's father]2175-angel 's father , and [her]198-tess interest intensified when [the speaker]617-the speaker began to detail [his]617-the speaker own spiritual experiences of how [he]617-the speaker had come by those views . [He]4519-the preacher had , [he]4519-the preacher said , been [the greatest of [sinners]4493-sinners]4526-the greatest of sinners . [He]4519-the preacher had scoffed ; [he]4519-the preacher had wantonly associated with the reckless and the lewd . But a day of awakening had come , and , in a human sense , it had been brought about mainly by the influence of [a certain clergyman]4528-a certain clergyman , whom [he]4519-the preacher had at first grossly insulted ; but whose parting words had sunk into [his]4519-the preacher heart , and had remained there , till by the grace of [Heaven]282-heaven [they]4529-they had worked this change in [him]4519-the preacher , and made [him]4519-the preacher what [they]4529-they saw [him]4519-the preacher .

But more startling to [Tess]198-tess than the doctrine had been the voice , which , impossible as it seemed , was precisely that of [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville . [Her]198-tess face fixed in painful suspense , [she]198-tess came round to the front of [the barn]4296-the barn , and passed before [it]4531-it . The low winter sun beamed directly upon the great double - doored entrance on this side ; one of the doors being open , so that the rays stretched far in over the threshing - floor to [the preacher]4519-the preacher and [[his]4519-the preacher audience]4533-his audience , all snugly sheltered from the northern breeze . [The listeners]2408-the listeners were entirely [villagers]4535-villagers , among [them]4535-villagers being [the man whom [she]198-tess had seen carrying the red paint - pot on a former memorable occasion]4536-the man whom she had seen carrying the red paint - pot on a former memorable occasion . But [her]198-tess attention was given to [the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing [the people]4437-the people and the door]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door . The three o'clock sun shone full upon [him]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door , and the strange enervating conviction that [[her]198-tess seducer]4539-her seducer confronted [her]198-tess , which had been gaining ground in [Tess]198-tess ever since [she]198-tess had heard [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door words distinctly , was at last established as a fact indeed .

END OF PHASE THE FIFTH

Phase the Sixth : [The Convert

XLV]399-the convert xlv

Till this moment [she]198-tess had never seen or heard from d'Urberville since [her]198-tess departure from [Trantridge]38-trantridge .

[The rencounter]4540-the rencounter came at a heavy moment , one of all moments calculated to permit its impact with the least emotional shock . But such was unreasoning memory that , though [he]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door stood there openly and palpably [a converted man , who was sorrowing for [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door past irregularities]4541-a converted man , who was sorrowing for his past irregularities , a fear overcame [her]198-tess , paralyzing [her]198-tess movement so that [she]198-tess neither retreated nor advanced .

To think of what emanated from that countenance when [she]198-tess saw it last , and to behold it now ! ... There was the same handsome unpleasantness of [mien]4542-mien , but now [he]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door wore neatly trimmed , old - fashioned whiskers , the sable moustache having disappeared ; and [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door dress was half - clerical , a modification which had changed [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door expression sufficiently to abstract the dandyism from [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door features , and to hinder for a second [her]198-tess belief in [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door identity .

To [Tess]198-tess 's sense there was , just at first , a ghastly bizarrerie , a grim incongruity , in the march of these solemn words of Scripture out of such a mouth . This too familiar intonation , less than four years earlier , had brought to [her]198-tess ears expressions of such divergent purpose that [her]198-tess heart became quite sick at the irony of the contrast .

It was less a reform than a transfiguration . The former curves of sensuousness were now modulated to lines of devotional passion . The lip - shapes that had meant seductiveness were now made to express supplication ; the glow on the cheek that yesterday could be translated as riotousness was evangelized to - day into the splendour of pious rhetoric ; animalism had become fanaticism ; Paganism , [Paulinism]400-paulinism ; the bold rolling eye that had flashed upon [her]198-tess form in the old time with such mastery now beamed with the rude energy of a theolatry that was almost ferocious . Those black angularities which [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door face had used to put on when [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door wishes were thwarted now did duty in picturing [the incorrigible backslider who would insist upon turning again to [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door wallowing in the mire]4543-the incorrigible backslider who would insist upon turning again to his wallowing in the mire .

The lineaments , as such , seemed to complain . [They]4544-their had been diverted from [their]4544-their hereditary connotation to signify impressions for which Nature did not intend them . Strange that [their]4544-their very elevation was a misapplication , that to raise seemed to falsify .

Yet could it be so ? [She]198-tess would admit the ungenerous sentiment no longer . [D'Urberville]230-d'urberville was not [the first wicked man who had turned away from [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door wickedness to save [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door soul alive]4545-the first wicked man who had turned away from his wickedness to save his soul alive , and why should [she]198-tess deem it unnatural in [him]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door ? It was but the usage of thought which had been jarred in [her]198-tess at hearing good new words in bad old notes . The greater [the sinner]4546-the sinner , the greater [the saint]4547-the saint ; it was not necessary to dive far into Christian history to discover that .

Such impressions as these moved [her]198-tess vaguely , and without strict definiteness . As soon as the nerveless pause of [her]198-tess surprise would allow [her]198-tess to stir , [her]198-tess impulse was to pass on out of [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door sight . [He]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door had obviously not discerned [her]198-tess yet in [her]198-tess position against the sun .

But the moment that [she]198-tess moved again [he]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door recognized [her]198-tess . The effect upon [[her]198-tess old lover]4548-her old lover was electric , far stronger than the effect of [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door presence upon [her]198-tess . [His]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door fire , the tumultuous ring of [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door eloquence , seemed to go out of [him]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door . [His]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door lip struggled and trembled under the words that lay upon it ; but deliver [them]4549-them it could not as long as [she]198-tess faced [him]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door . [His]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door eyes , after their first glance upon [her]198-tess face , hung confusedly in every other direction but [hers]198-tess , but came back in a desperate leap every few seconds . This paralysis lasted , however , but a short time ; for [Tess]198-tess 's energies returned with the atrophy of [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door , and [she]198-tess walked as fast as [she]198-tess was able past [the barn]4296-the barn and onward .

As soon as [she]198-tess could reflect , it appalled [her]198-tess , this change in [their]4551-their relative platforms . [He]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door who had wrought [her]198-tess undoing was now on the side of [the Spirit]4552-the spirit , while [she]198-tess remained unregenerate . And , as in the legend , it had resulted that [her]198-tess Cyprian image had suddenly appeared upon [his]4537-the central figure , who stood upon some sacks of corn , facing the people and the door altar , whereby the fire of [the priest]4553-the priest had been well nigh extinguished .

[She]198-tess went on without turning [her]198-tess head . [Her]198-tess back seemed to be endowed with a sensitiveness to ocular beams - even [her]198-tess clothing - so alive was [she]198-tess to a fancied gaze which might be resting upon [her]198-tess from the outside of [that barn]6303-that barn . All the way along to this point [her]198-tess heart had been heavy with an inactive sorrow ; now there was a change in the quality of its trouble . That hunger for affection too long withheld was for the time displaced by an almost physical sense of an implacable past which still engirdled [her]198-tess . It intensified [her]198-tess consciousness of error to a practical despair ; the break of continuity between [her]198-tess earlier and present existence , which [she]198-tess had hoped for , had not , after all , taken place . Bygones would never be complete bygones till [she]198-tess was [a bygone [herself]198-tess]4555-a bygone herself .

Thus absorbed , [she]198-tess recrossed [the northern part of [Long - Ash Lane]4557-long - ash lane]4556-the northern part of long - ash lane at right angles , and presently saw before [her]198-tess [the road]550-the road ascending whitely to [the upland along whose margin the remainder of [her]198-tess journey lay]4559-the upland along whose margin the remainder of her journey lay . [Its]550-the road dry pale surface stretched severely onward , unbroken by a single figure , [vehicle]4560-vehicle , or mark , save some occasional brown horse - droppings which dotted [its]550-the road cold aridity here and there . While slowly breasting this ascent [Tess]198-tess became conscious of footsteps behind [her]198-tess , and turning [she]198-tess saw approaching [that well - known form]4561-that well - known form - so strangely accoutred as [the Methodist]4562-the methodist - [the one personage in all [the world]497-the world [she]198-tess wished not to encounter alone on [this side of the grave]4565-this side of the grave]4563-the one personage in all the world she wished not to encounter alone on this side of the grave .

There was not much time , however , for thought or elusion , and [she]198-tess yielded as calmly as [she]198-tess could to the necessity of letting [him]4566-he overtake [her]198-tess . [She]198-tess saw that [he]4566-he was excited , less by the speed of [his]4566-he walk than by the feelings within [him]4566-he .

" [Tess]198-tess ! "[4566-he] [he]4566-he said .

[She]198-tess slackened speed without looking round .

" [Tess]198-tess ! "[4566-he] [he]4566-he repeated . " It is [I]4566-he - [Alec]367-alec d'urberville d'Urberville . "[4566-he]

[She]198-tess then looked back at [him]4566-he , and [he]4566-he came up .

" [I]198-tess see it is , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess answered coldly .

" Well - is that all ? Yet [I]4566-he deserve no more ! Of course , "[4566-he] [he]4566-he added , with a slight laugh , " there is something of the ridiculous to [your]198-tess eyes in seeing [me]4566-he like this . But - [I]4566-he must put up with that . ... [I]4566-he heard [you]198-tess had gone away ; [nobody]754-nobody knew where . [Tess]198-tess , [you]198-tess wonder why [I]4566-he have followed [you]198-tess ? "[4566-he]

" [I]198-tess do , rather ; and [I]198-tess would that [you]198-tess had not , with all [my]198-tess heart ! "[198-tess]

" Yes - [you]198-tess may well say it , "[4566-he] [he]4566-he returned grimly , as [they]4567-they moved onward together , [she]198-tess with unwilling tread . " But do n't mistake [me]198-tess ; [I]198-tess beg this because [you]198-tess may have been led to do so in noticing - if [you]198-tess did notice it - how [your]198-tess sudden appearance unnerved [me]198-tess down there . It was but a momentary faltering ; and considering what [you]198-tess have been to [me]198-tess , it was natural enough . But will helped [me]198-tess through it - though perhaps [you]198-tess think [me]198-tess [a humbug]7383-a humbug for saying it - and immediately afterwards [I]198-tess felt that of [all persons in [the world]497-the world]7384-all persons in the world whom it was [my]198-tess duty and desire to save from the wrath to come - sneer if [you]198-tess like - [the woman whom [I]198-tess had so grievously wronged]7386-the woman whom i had so grievously wronged was [that person]7387-that person . [I]198-tess have come with that sole purpose in view - nothing more . "[198-tess]

There was the smallest vein of scorn in [her]4568-her words of rejoinder : " Have [you]4569-i saved [yourself]4569-i ? [Charity]376-apostolic charity begins at [home]5850-home , [they]7389-they say . "[4568-her]

" [I]4569-i have done nothing ! "[4569-i] said [he]4569-i indifferently . " [Heaven]282-heaven , as [I]4569-i have been telling [[my]4569-i hearers]7390-my hearers , has done all . No amount of contempt that [you]198-tess can pour upon [me]4569-i , [Tess]198-tess , will equal what [I]4569-i have poured upon [myself]4569-i - [the old Adam of [my]4569-i former years]7391-the old adam of my former years ! Well , it is a strange story ; believe it or not ; but [I]4569-i can tell [you]198-tess the means by which [my]4569-i conversion was brought about , and [I]4569-i hope [you]198-tess will be interested enough at least to listen . Have [you]198-tess ever heard the name of [the parson of [Emminster]72-emminster]7392-the parson of emminster - [you]198-tess must have done do ? - [old Mr Clare]284-clare ; [one of the most earnest of [his]284-clare school]7393-one of the most earnest of his school ; [one of [the few intense men left in [the Church]103-the church]7395-the few intense men left in the church ; not so intense as the extreme wing of [Christian believers with which [I]4569-i have thrown in [my]4569-i lot]7396-christian believers with which i have thrown in my lot , but quite an exception among [the Established clergy]7397-the established clergy , the younger of whom are gradually attenuating the true doctrines by [their]7397-the established clergy sophistries , till [they]7397-the established clergy are but the shadow of what [they]7397-the established clergy were]7394-one of the few intense men left in the church ; not so intense as the extreme wing of christian believers with which i have thrown in my lot , but quite an exception among the established clergy , the younger of whom are gradually attenuating the true doctrines by their sophistries , till they are but the shadow of what they were . [I]4569-i only differ from [him]284-clare on the question of Church and State - the interpretation of the text , ' Come out from among [them]7397-the established clergy and be [ye]198-tess separate , saith [the Lord]5926-the lord ' - that 's all . [He]284-clare is one who , [I]4569-i firmly believe , has been the humble means of saving more souls in [this country]7399-this country than [any other man [you]198-tess can name]7400-any other man you can name . [You]198-tess have heard of [him]284-clare ? "[4569-i]

" [I]4570-i have , "[4570-i] [she]4570-i said .

" [He]284-clare came to [Trantridge]38-trantridge two or three years ago to preach on behalf of [some missionary society]7401-some missionary society ; and [I]4573-i , [wretched fellow that [I]4573-i was]7402-wretched fellow that i was , insulted [him]284-clare when , in [his]284-clare disinterestedness , [he]284-clare tried to reason with [me]4573-i and show [me]4573-i the way . [He]284-clare did not resent [my]4573-i conduct , [he]284-clare simply said that some day [I]4573-i should receive the first - fruits of the Spirit - that [those who came to scoff]7403-those who came to scoff sometimes remained to pray . There was a strange magic in [his]284-clare words . They sank into [my]4573-i mind . But the loss of [[my]4573-i mother]6050-my mother hit [me]4573-i most ; and by degrees [I]4573-i was brought to see daylight . Since then [my]4573-i one desire has been to hand on the true view to [others]1383-others , and that is what [I]4573-i was trying to do to - day ; though it is only lately that [I]4573-i have preached hereabout . The first months of [my]4573-i ministry have been spent in [the North of [England]10-england]3879-the north of england among [strangers]568-strangers , where [I]4573-i preferred to make [my]4573-i earliest clumsy attempts , so as to acquire courage before undergoing that severest of all tests of [one]6172-one 's sincerity , addressing [those who have known one]7409-those who have known one , and have been [one 's companions]7410-one 's companions in the days of darkness . If [you]4571-i could only know , [Tess]198-tess , the pleasure of having a good slap at [yourself]4571-i , [I]4573-i am sure - "[4573-i]

" Do n't go on with it ! "[4571-i] [she]4571-i cried passionately , as [she]4571-i turned away from [him]4572-you to a stile by the wayside , on which [she]4571-i bent [herself]4571-i . " [I]4571-i ca n't believe in such sudden things ! [I]4571-i feel indignant with [you]4572-you for talking to [me]4571-i like this , when [you]4572-you know - when [you]4572-you know what harm [you]4572-you 've done [me]4571-i ! [You]4572-you , and those like [you]4572-you , take [your]4572-you fill of pleasure on earth by making the life of such as [me]4571-i bitter and black with sorrow ; and then it is a fine thing , when [you]4572-you have had enough of that , to think of securing [your]4572-you pleasure in [heaven]6032-heaven by becoming converted ! Out upon such - [I]4571-i do n't believe in [you]4572-you - [I]4571-i hate it ! "[4571-i]

" [Tess]198-tess , "[4573-i] [he]4573-i insisted ; " do n't speak so ! It came to [me]4573-i like a jolly new idea ! And [you]198-tess do n't believe [me]4573-i ? What do n't [you]198-tess believe ? "[4573-i]

" [Your]4572-you conversion . [Your]4572-you scheme of religion . "[4571-i]

" Why ? "[4573-i]

[She]4573-i dropped [her]4573-i voice . " Because [a better man]7412-a better man than [you]4573-i does not believe in such . "[4573-i]

" What [a woman]1028-a woman 's reason ! Who is [this better man]7414-this better man ? "[4571-i]

" [I]4573-i can not tell [you]4573-i . "[4573-i]

" Well , "[4573-i] [he]4573-i declared , a resentment beneath [his]4573-i words seeming ready to spring out at a moment 's notice , " God forbid that [I]4573-i should say [I]4573-i am [a good man]6308-a good man - and [you]4573-i know [I]4573-i do n't say any such thing . [I]4573-i am new to goodness , truly ; but newcomers see furthest sometimes . "[4573-i]

" Yes , "[4573-i] [she]4573-i replied sadly . " But [I]4573-i can not believe in [your]4573-i conversion to a new spirit . Such flashes as [you]4573-i feel , [Alec]367-alec d'urberville , [I]4573-i fear do n't last ! "[4573-i]

Thus speaking [she]4573-i turned from the stile over which [she]4573-i had been leaning , and faced [him]4573-i ; whereupon [his]4573-i eyes , falling casually upon the familiar countenance and form , remained contemplating [her]4573-i . [The inferior man]4574-the inferior man was quiet in [him]4573-i now ; but it was surely not extracted , nor even entirely subdued .

" Do n't look at [me]4573-i like that ! "[4573-i] [he]4573-i said abruptly .

[Tess]198-tess , who had been quite unconscious of [her]4573-i action and mien , instantly withdrew the large dark gaze of [her]198-tess eyes , stammering with a flush , " [I]198-tess beg [your]4573-i pardon ! "[198-tess] And there was revived in [her]4573-i the wretched sentiment which had often come to [her]4573-i before , that in inhabiting the fleshly tabernacle with which [Nature]231-nature had endowed [her]4573-i [she]4573-i was somehow doing wrong .

" No , no ! Do n't beg [my]198-tess pardon . But since [you]4573-i wear a veil to hide [your]4573-i good looks , why do n't [you]4573-i keep it down ? "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess pulled down the veil , saying hastily , " It was mostly to keep off the wind . "[198-tess]

" It may seem harsh of [me]4573-i to dictate like this , "[4573-i] [he]4573-i went on ; " but it is better that [I]4573-i should not look too often on [you]198-tess . It might be dangerous . "[4573-i]

" Ssh ! "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess .

" Well , [women]1628-women 's faces have had too much power over [me]4573-i already for [me]4573-i not to fear [them]1628-women ! [An evangelist]7417-an evangelist has nothing to do with such as [they]1628-women ; and it reminds [me]4573-i of the old times that [I]4573-i would forget ! "[4573-i]

After this [their]4575-they conversation dwindled to a casual remark now and then as [they]4575-they rambled onward , [Tess]198-tess inwardly wondering how far [he]4573-i was going with [her]198-tess , and not liking to send [him]4573-i back by positive mandate . Frequently when [they]4575-they came to a gate or stile [they]4575-they found painted thereon in red or blue letters some text of Scripture , and [she]198-tess asked [him]4573-i if [he]4573-i knew who had been at the pains to blazon these announcements . [He]4573-i told [her]198-tess that [the man]1516-the man was employed by [himself]4573-i and [others who were working with [him]4573-i in [that district]4578-that district]4577-others who were working with him in that district , to paint these reminders that no means might be left untried which might move the hearts of [a wicked generation]4579-a wicked generation .

At length [the road]550-the road touched the spot called " Cross - in - Hand . "[4573-i] Of all spots on [the bleached and desolate upland this]4581-the bleached and desolate upland this was the most forlorn . [It]4582-it was so far removed from the charm which is sought in landscape by [artists]4583-artists and [view - lovers]4584-view - lovers as to reach a new kind of beauty , a negative beauty of tragic tone . [The place]5882-the place took its name from a stone pillar which stood there , [a strange rude monolith]4586-a strange rude monolith , from a stratum unknown in [any local quarry]4587-any local quarry , on which was roughly carved a human hand . Differing accounts were given of [its]5882-the place history and purport . [Some authorities]4588-some authorities stated that a devotional cross had once formed the complete erection thereon , of which the present relic was but the stump ; others that the stone as it stood was entire , and that it had been fixed there to mark a boundary or place of meeting . Anyhow , whatever the origin of the relic , there was and is something sinister , or solemn , according to mood , in the scene amid which [it]5882-the place stands ; something tending to impress [the most phlegmatic passer - by]4589-the most phlegmatic passer - by .

" [I]4573-i think [I]4573-i must leave [you]7418-you now , "[4573-i] [he]4573-i remarked , as [they]4590-they drew near to this spot . " [I]4573-i have to preach at [Abbot's - Cernel]140-abbot's - cernel at six this evening , and [my]4573-i way lies across to the right from here . And [you]7418-you upset [me]4573-i somewhat too , [Tessy]256-tessy - [I]4573-i can not , will not , say why . [I]4573-i must go away and get strength . ... How is it that [you]7418-you speak so fluently now ? Who has taught [you]7418-you such good English ? "[4573-i]

" [I]4573-i have learnt things in [my]4573-i troubles , "[4573-i] [she]4573-i said evasively .

" What troubles have [you]7418-you had ? "[4573-i]

[She]4573-i told [him]4573-i of the first one - the only one that related to [him]4573-i .

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville was struck mute . " [I]4573-i knew nothing of this till now ! "[4573-i] [he]4573-i next murmured . " Why did n't [you]7418-you write to [me]4573-i when [you]7418-you felt [your]7418-you trouble coming on ? "[4573-i]

[She]4573-i did not reply ; and [he]4573-i broke the silence by adding : " Well - [you]4573-i will see [me]4573-i again . "[4573-i]

" No , "[4573-i] [she]4573-i answered . " Do not again come near [me]4573-i ! "[4573-i]

" [I]4573-i will think . But before [we]7419-we part come here . "[4573-i] [He]4573-i stepped up to the pillar . " This was once [a Holy Cross]7420-a holy cross . Relics are not in [my]4573-i creed ; but [I]4573-i fear [you]4573-i at moments - far more than [you]4573-i need fear [me]4573-i at present ; and to lessen [my]4573-i fear , put [your]4573-i hand upon that stone hand , and swear that [you]4573-i will never tempt [me]4573-i - by [your]4573-i charms or ways . "[4573-i]

" Good [God]222-god - how can [you]222-god ask what is so unnecessary ! All that is furthest from [my]4573-i thought ! "[4573-i]

" Yes - but swear it . "[4573-i]

[Tess]198-tess , half frightened , gave way to [his]4573-i importunity ; placed [her]198-tess hand upon the stone and swore .

" [I]4573-i am sorry [you]4573-i are not [a believer]7421-a believer , "[4573-i] [he]4573-i continued ; " that [some unbeliever]7422-some unbeliever should have got hold of [you]4573-i and unsettled [your]4573-i mind . But no more now . At [home]5850-home at least [I]4573-i can pray for [you]4573-i ; and [I]4573-i will ; and who knows what may not happen ? [I]4573-i 'm off . Goodbye ! "[4573-i]

[He]4573-i turned to a hunting - gate in the hedge and , without letting [his]4573-i eyes again rest upon [her]198-tess , leapt over and struck out across the down in the direction of [Abbot's - Cernel]140-abbot's - cernel . As [he]4573-i walked [his]4573-i pace showed perturbation , and by - and - by , as if instigated by a former thought , [he]4573-i drew from [his]4573-i pocket a small book , between the leaves of which was folded a letter , worn and soiled , as from much re - reading . [D'Urberville]230-d'urberville opened the letter . It was dated several months before this time , and was signed by [Parson Clare]401-parson clare .

The letter began by expressing [the writer]4591-the writer 's unfeigned joy at d'Urberville 's conversion , and thanked [him]4573-i for [his]4573-i kindness in communicating with [the parson on the subject]4592-the parson on the subject . [It]4593-it expressed [Mr Clare]284-clare 's warm assurance of forgiveness for [d'Urberville]230-d'urberville 's former conduct and [his]284-clare interest in [the young man]471-the young man 's plans for the future . [He]284-clare , [Mr Clare]284-clare , would much have liked to see [d'Urberville]230-d'urberville in [the Church to whose ministry]4595-the church to whose ministry [he]284-clare had devoted so many years of [his]284-clare own life , and would have helped [him]284-clare to enter [a theological college]4596-a theological college to that end ; but since [[his]284-clare correspondent]4597-his correspondent had possibly not cared to do this on account of the delay it would have entailed , [he]284-clare was not [the man to insist upon its paramount importance]4598-the man to insist upon its paramount importance . [Every man]4599-every man must work as [he]4599-every man could best work , and in the method towards which [he]4599-every man felt impelled by [the Spirit]402-the spirit .

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville read and re - read this letter , and seemed to quiz [himself]230-d'urberville cynically . [He]230-d'urberville also read some passages from memoranda as [he]230-d'urberville walked till [his]230-d'urberville face assumed a calm , and apparently the image of [Tess]198-tess no longer troubled [his]230-d'urberville mind .

[She]198-tess meanwhile had kept along the edge of [the hill]642-the hill by which lay [[her]198-tess nearest way [home]5850-home]4601-her nearest way home . Within the distance of a mile [she]198-tess met [a solitary shepherd]4603-a solitary shepherd .

" What is the meaning of that old stone [I]198-tess have passed ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess asked of [him]4603-a solitary shepherd . " Was it ever a Holy Cross ? "[198-tess]

" Cross - no ; ' twer not a cross ! ' Tis a thing of ill - omen , [Miss.]403-miss. It was put up in wuld times by [the relations of [a malefactor who was tortured there]7425-a malefactor who was tortured there by nailing [his]7425-a malefactor who was tortured there [hand to a post and afterwards hung]7426-hand to a post and afterwards hung . The bones lie underneath . [They]7427-they say [he]7425-a malefactor who was tortured there sold [his]7425-a malefactor who was tortured there soul to the devil , and that [he]7425-a malefactor who was tortured there walks at times]7424-the relations of a malefactor who was tortured there by nailing his hand to a post and afterwards hung . the bones lie underneath . they say he sold his soul to the devil , and that he walks at times . "[4604-the solitary man]

[She]198-tess felt the petite mort at this unexpectedly gruesome information , and left [the solitary man]4604-the solitary man behind [her]198-tess . It was dusk when [she]198-tess drew near to [Flintcomb - Ash]126-flintcomb - ash , and in [the lane at the entrance to [the hamlet]4606-the hamlet]4605-the lane at the entrance to the hamlet [she]198-tess approached [a girl]6719-a girl and [[her]6719-a girl lover]2598-her lover without [their]4609-their observing [her]198-tess . [They]4609-their were talking no secrets , and the clear unconcerned voice of [the young woman]6194-the young woman , in response to the warmer accents of [the man]1516-the man , spread into the chilly air as the one soothing thing within the dusky horizon , full of a stagnant obscurity upon which nothing else intruded . For a moment the voices cheered the heart of [Tess]198-tess , till [she]198-tess reasoned that this interview had its origin , on one side or the other , in the same attraction which had been the prelude to [her]198-tess own tribulation . When [she]198-tess came close , [the girl]647-the girl turned serenely and recognized [her]198-tess , [the young man]471-the young man walking off in embarrassment . [The woman]674-the woman was [Izz Huett]312-izz , whose interest in [Tess]198-tess 's excursion immediately superseded [her]674-the woman own proceedings . [Tess]198-tess did not explain very clearly its results , and [Izz]312-izz , who was [a girl of tact]4615-a girl of tact , began to speak of [her]312-izz own little affair , a phase of which [Tess]198-tess had just witnessed .

" [He]1516-the man is [Amby Seedling]404-amby seedling , [the chap who used to sometimes come and help at [Talbothays]60-talbothays]7428-the chap who used to sometimes come and help at talbothays , "[312-izz] [she]312-izz explained indifferently . " [He]1516-the man actually inquired and found out that [I]312-izz had come [here]5975-here , and has followed [me]312-izz . [He]1516-the man says [he]1516-the man 's been in love wi ' [me]312-izz these two years . But [I]312-izz 've hardly answered [him]1516-the man . "[312-izz]

XLVI

Several days had passed since [her]198-tess futile journey , and [Tess]198-tess was afield . The dry winter wind still blew , but a screen of thatched hurdles erected in the eye of the blast kept its force away from [her]198-tess . On the sheltered side was a turnip - slicing machine , whose bright blue hue of new paint seemed almost vocal in the otherwise subdued scene . Opposite [its]4616-its front was [a long mound or " grave "]7430-a long mound or " grave "[1337-a man] , in which the roots had been preserved since early winter . [Tess]198-tess was standing at the uncovered end , chopping off with a bill - hook the fibres and earth from each root , and throwing it after the operation into the slicer . [A man]1337-a man was turning the handle of the machine , and from its trough came [the newly - cut swedes]4618-the newly - cut swedes , the fresh smell of whose yellow chips was accompanied by the sounds of the snuffling wind , the smart swish of the slicing - blades , and the choppings of the hook in [Tess]198-tess 's leather - gloved hand .

The wide acreage of blank agricultural brownness , apparent where the swedes had been pulled , was beginning to be striped in wales of darker brown , gradually broadening to ribands . Along the edge of each of these something crept upon ten legs , moving without haste and without rest up and down the whole length of [the field]610-the field ; it was two horses and [a man]1337-a man , the plough going between [them]4621-them , turning up the cleared ground for a spring sowing .

For hours nothing relieved the joyless monotony of things . Then , far beyond [the ploughing - teams]4622-the ploughing - teams , a black speck was seen . It had come from the corner of a fence , where there was a gap , and [its]4616-its tendency was up the incline , towards the swede - cutters . From the proportions of a mere point it advanced to the shape of a ninepin , and was soon perceived to be [a man in black]4623-a man in black , arriving from the direction of [Flintcomb - Ash]126-flintcomb - ash . [The man at the slicer]4624-the man at the slicer , having nothing else to do with [his]4624-the man at the slicer eyes , continually observed [the comer]1042-the comer , but [Tess]198-tess , who was occupied , did not perceive [him]4624-the man at the slicer till [[her]198-tess companion]1256-her companion directed [her]198-tess attention to [his]4624-the man at the slicer approach .

It was not [[her]198-tess hard taskmaster]4627-her hard taskmaster , [Farmer Groby]406-farmer groby ; it was [one in a semi - clerical costume]4628-one in a semi - clerical costume , who now represented what had once been [the free - and - easy Alec d'Urberville]4629-the free - and - easy alec d'urberville . Not being hot at [his]4624-the man at the slicer preaching there was less enthusiasm about [him]4624-the man at the slicer now , and the presence of [the grinder]4630-the grinder seemed to embarrass [him]4624-the man at the slicer . A pale distress was already on [Tess]198-tess 's face , and [she]198-tess pulled [her]198-tess curtained hood further over it .

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville came up and said quietly -

" [I]230-d'urberville want to speak to [you]198-tess , [Tess]198-tess . "[230-d'urberville]

" [You]230-d'urberville have refused [my]198-tess last request , not to come near [me]198-tess ! "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess .

" Yes , but [I]230-d'urberville have a good reason . "[230-d'urberville]

" Well , tell it . "[230-d'urberville]

" It is more serious than [you]198-tess may think . "[230-d'urberville]

[He]230-d'urberville glanced round to see if [he]230-d'urberville were overheard . [They]4631-they were at some distance from [the man who turned the slicer , and the movement of the machine]4632-the man who turned the slicer , and the movement of the machine , too , sufficiently prevented [Alec]367-alec d'urberville 's words reaching other ears . [D'Urberville]230-d'urberville placed [himself]230-d'urberville so as to screen [Tess]198-tess from [the labourer]4633-the labourer , turning [his]230-d'urberville back to [the latter]462-the latter .

" It is this , "[230-d'urberville] [he]230-d'urberville continued , with capricious compunction . " In thinking of [your]198-tess soul and [mine]230-d'urberville when [we]4631-they last met , [I]230-d'urberville neglected to inquire as to [your]198-tess worldly condition . [You]198-tess were well dressed , and [I]230-d'urberville did not think of it . But [I]230-d'urberville see now that it is hard - harder than it used to be when [I]230-d'urberville - knew [you]198-tess - harder than [you]198-tess deserve . Perhaps a good deal of it is owning to [me]230-d'urberville ! "[230-d'urberville]

[She]198-tess did not answer , and [he]230-d'urberville watched [her]198-tess inquiringly , as , with bent head , [her]198-tess face completely screened by the hood , [she]198-tess resumed [her]198-tess trimming of the swedes . By going on with [her]198-tess work [she]198-tess felt better able to keep [him]230-d'urberville outside [her]198-tess emotions .

" [Tess]198-tess , "[230-d'urberville] [he]230-d'urberville added , with a sigh of discontent , - " yours was the very worst case [I]230-d'urberville ever was concerned in ! [I]230-d'urberville had no idea of what had resulted till [you]198-tess told [me]230-d'urberville . Scamp that [I]230-d'urberville was to foul that innocent life ! The whole blame was [mine]230-d'urberville - the whole unconventional business of [our]7431-our time at [Trantridge]38-trantridge . [You]198-tess , too , the real blood of which [I]230-d'urberville am but the base imitation , what [a blind young thing]7432-a blind young thing [you]198-tess were as to possibilities ! [I]230-d'urberville say in all earnestness that it is a shame for [parents]7433-parents to bring up [[their]7433-parents girls]7434-their girls in such dangerous ignorance of the gins and nets that the wicked may set for [them]7434-their girls , whether [their]7434-their girls motive be a good one or the result of simple indifference . "[230-d'urberville]

[Tess]198-tess still did no more than listen , throwing down one globular root and taking up another with automatic regularity , the pensive contour of [the mere fieldwoman]4635-the mere fieldwoman alone marking [her]198-tess .

" But it is not that [I]4636-i came to say , "[4636-i] d'Urberville went on . " [My]4636-i circumstances are these . [I]4636-i have lost [[my]4636-i mother]6050-my mother since [you]198-tess were at [Trantridge]38-trantridge , and [the place]5882-the place is [my]4636-i own . But [I]4636-i intend to sell it , and devote [myself]4636-i to missionary work in [Africa]88-africa . A devil of a poor hand [I]4636-i shall make at the trade , no doubt . However , what [I]4636-i want to ask [you]198-tess is , will [you]198-tess put it in [my]4636-i power to do [my]4636-i duty - to make the only reparation [I]4636-i can make for the trick played [you]198-tess : that is , will [you]198-tess be [[my]4636-i wife]5895-my wife , and go with [me]4636-i ? ... [I]4636-i have already obtained this precious document . It was [[my]4636-i old mother]7438-my old mother 's dying wish . "[4636-i]

[He]4636-i drew a piece of parchment from [his]4636-i pocket , with a slight fumbling of embarrassment .

" What is it ? "[4637-she] said [she]4637-she .

" A marriage licence . "[4636-i]

" O no , [sir]5821-sir - no ! "[4637-she] [she]4637-she said quickly , starting back .

" [You]4636-i will not ? Why is that ? "[4636-i]

And as [he]4636-i asked the question a disappointment which was not entirely the disappointment of thwarted duty crossed [d'Urberville]230-d'urberville 's face . It was unmistakably a symptom that something of [his]4636-i old passion for [her]4637-she had been revived ; duty and desire ran hand - in - hand .

" Surely , "[4636-i] [he]4636-i began again , in more impetuous tones , and then looked round at [the labourer who turned the slicer]4638-the labourer who turned the slicer .

[Tess]198-tess , too , felt that the argument could not be ended there . Informing [the man]1516-the man that [a gentleman]6008-a gentleman had come to see [her]198-tess , with whom [she]198-tess wished to walk a little way , [she]198-tess moved off with [d'Urberville]230-d'urberville across [the zebra - striped field]4641-the zebra - striped field . When [they]4642-they reached [the first newly - ploughed section]4643-the first newly - ploughed section [he]4636-i held out [his]4636-i hand to help [her]4637-she over it ; but [she]4637-she stepped forward on the summits of [the earth]1046-the earth - rolls as if [she]4637-she did not see [him]4636-i .

" [You]198-tess will not marry [me]4636-i , [Tess]198-tess , and make [me]4636-i [a self - respecting man]7440-a self - respecting man ? "[4636-i] [he]4636-i repeated , as soon as [they]4642-they were over the furrows .

" [I]4636-i can not . "[4636-i]

" But why ? "[4637-she]

" [You]198-tess know [I]4636-i have no affection for [you]198-tess . "[4636-i]

" But [you]198-tess would get to feel that in time , perhaps - as soon as [you]198-tess really could forgive [me]4637-she ? "[4637-she]

" Never ! "[4636-i]

" Why so positive ? "[4637-she]

" [I]4636-i love [somebody else]7441-somebody else . "[4636-i]

The words seemed to astonish [him]4636-i .

" [You]198-tess do ? "[4636-i] [he]4636-i cried . " [Somebody else]7441-somebody else ? But has not a sense of what is morally right and proper any weight with [you]198-tess ? "[4636-i]

" No , no , no - do n't say that ! "[4637-she]

" Anyhow , then , [your]198-tess love for [this other man]7443-this other man may be only a passing feeling which [you]198-tess will overcome - "[4636-i]

" No - no . "[4637-she]

" Yes , yes ! Why not ? "[4636-i]

" [I]4637-she can not tell [you]198-tess . "[4637-she]

" [You]198-tess must in honour ! "[4636-i]

" Well then ... [I]4637-she have married [him]7443-this other man . "[4637-she]

" Ah ! "[4636-i] [he]4636-i exclaimed ; and [he]4636-i stopped dead and gazed at [her]4636-i .

" [I]4636-i did not wish to tell - [I]4636-i did not mean to ! "[4636-i] [she]4636-i pleaded . " It is a secret here , or at any rate but dimly known . So will [you]198-tess , [PLEASE]407-please will [you]198-tess , keep from questioning [me]4636-i ? [You]198-tess must remember that [we]7444-we are now [strangers]568-strangers . "[4636-i]

" [Strangers]568-strangers - are [we]7444-we ? [Strangers]568-strangers ! "[4645-the labourer who turned the machine]

For a moment a flash of [his]4636-i old irony marked [his]4636-i face ; but [he]4636-i determinedly chastened it down .

" Is [that man]7103-that man [[your]4636-i husband]6856-your husband ? "[4636-i] [he]4636-i asked mechanically , denoting by a sign [the labourer who turned the machine]4645-the labourer who turned the machine .

" [That man]7103-that man ! "[4636-i] [she]4636-i said proudly . " [I]4636-i should think not ! "[4636-i]

" Who , then ? "[4636-i]

" Do not ask what [I]4636-i do not wish to tell ! "[4636-i] [she]4636-i begged , and flashed [her]4636-i appeal to [him]4636-i from [her]4636-i upturned face and lash - shadowed eyes .

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville was disturbed .

" But [I]4636-i only asked for [your]4636-i sake ! "[4636-i] [he]4636-i retorted hotly . " Angels of [heaven]6032-heaven ! - [God]222-god forgive [me]4636-i for such an expression - [I]4636-i came here , [I]4636-i swear , as [I]4636-i thought for [your]4636-i good . [Tess]198-tess - do n't look at [me]4636-i so - [I]4636-i can not stand [your]198-tess looks ! There never were such eyes , surely , before Christianity or since ! There - [I]4636-i wo n't lose [my]4636-i head ; [I]4636-i dare not . [I]4636-i own that the sight of [you]198-tess had waked up [my]4636-i love for [you]198-tess , which , [I]4636-i believed , was extinguished with all such feelings . But [I]4636-i thought that [our]7452-our marriage might be a sanctification for [us]7452-our both . ' [The unbelieving husband]7453-the unbelieving husband is sanctified by [the wife]7454-the wife , and [the unbelieving wife]7455-the unbelieving wife is sanctified by [the husband]7070-the husband , ' [I]4636-i said to [myself]4636-i . But [my]4636-i plan is dashed from [me]4636-i ; and [I]4636-i must bear the disappointment ! "[4636-i]

[He]4646-i moodily reflected with [his]4646-i eyes on the ground .

" Married . Married ! ... Well , that being so , "[4646-i] [he]4646-i added , quite calmly , tearing the licence slowly into halves and putting them in [his]4646-i pocket ; " that being prevented , [I]4646-i should like to do some good to [you]198-tess and [[your]198-tess husband]6856-your husband , whoever [he]6856-your husband may be . There are many questions that [I]4646-i am tempted to ask , but [I]4646-i will not do so , of course , in opposition to [your]198-tess wishes . Though , if [I]4646-i could know [[your]198-tess husband]6856-your husband , [I]4646-i might more easily benefit [him]6856-your husband and [you]198-tess . Is [he]6856-your husband on [this farm]7459-this farm ? "[4646-i]

" No , "[4647-her] [she]4647-her murmured . " [He]6856-your husband is far away . "[4647-her]

" Far away ? From [YOU]4646-i ? What sort of [husband]3776-husband can [he]6856-your husband be ? "[4646-i]

" O , do not speak against [him]6856-your husband ! It was through [you]4646-i ! [He]6856-your husband found out - "[4647-her]

" Ah , is it so ! ... That 's sad , [Tess]198-tess ! "[4646-i]

" Yes . "[4647-her]

" But to stay away from [you]198-tess - to leave [you]198-tess to work like this ! "[4646-i]

" [He]6856-your husband does not leave [me]4647-her to work ! "[4647-her] [she]4647-her cried , springing to the defence of [the absent one]4648-the absent one with all [her]4647-her fervour . " [He]6856-your husband do n't know it ! It is by [my]4647-her own arrangement . "[4647-her]

" Then , does [he]6856-your husband write ? "[4646-i]

" [I]4647-her - [I]4647-her can not tell [you]4646-i . There are things which are private to [ourselves]7461-ourselves . "[4647-her]

" Of course that means that [he]6856-your husband does not . [You]198-tess are [a deserted wife]4094-a deserted wife , [[my]4646-i fair [Tess]198-tess]7463-my fair tess - "[4646-i]

In an impulse [he]4649-he turned suddenly to take [her]4647-her hand ; the buff - glove was on it , and [he]4649-he seized only the rough leather fingers which did not express the life or shape of those within .

" [You]4649-he must not - [you]4649-he must not ! "[4647-her] [she]4647-her cried fearfully , slipping [her]4647-her hand from the glove as from a pocket , and leaving it in [his]4649-he grasp . " O , will [you]4649-he go away - for the sake of [me]4647-her and [[my]4647-her husband]7291-my husband - go , in the name of [[your]4649-he own Christianity]7465-your own christianity ! "[4647-her]

" Yes , yes ; [I]4649-he will , "[4649-he] [he]4649-he said abruptly , and thrusting the glove back to [her]4647-her [he]4649-he turned to leave . Facing round , however , [he]4649-he said , " [Tess]198-tess , as [God]222-god is [[my]4649-he judge]7466-my judge , [I]4649-he meant no humbug in taking [your]198-tess hand ! "[4649-he]

A pattering of hoofs on the soil of [the field]610-the field , which [they]4651-they had not noticed in [their]4651-they preoccupation , ceased close behind [them]4651-they ; and a voice reached [her]4647-her ear :

" What the devil are [you]198-tess doing away from [your]198-tess work at this time o ' day ? "[230-d'urberville]

[Farmer Groby]406-farmer groby had espied [the two figures]4652-the two figures from the distance , and had inquisitively ridden across , to learn what was [their]4652-the two figures business in [[his]406-farmer groby field]4653-his field .

" Do n't speak like that to [her]4647-her ! "[406-farmer groby] said [d'Urberville]230-d'urberville , [his]406-farmer groby face blackening with something that was not Christianity .

" Indeed , [Mister]7467-mister ! And what [mid Methodist pa'sons]408-mid methodist pa'sons have to do with [she]4647-her ? "[406-farmer groby]

" Who is [the fellow]6944-the fellow ? "[230-d'urberville] asked d'Urberville , turning to [Tess]198-tess .

[She]198-tess went close up to [him]406-farmer groby .

" Go - [I]198-tess do beg [you]406-farmer groby ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said .

" What ! And leave [you]406-farmer groby to [that tyrant]7469-that tyrant ? [I]230-d'urberville can see in [his]7469-that tyrant face what [a churl]7470-a churl [he]7469-that tyrant is . "[230-d'urberville]

" [He]7469-that tyrant wo n't hurt [me]4654-her defender . [HE]7469-that tyrant 'S not in love with [me]4654-her defender . [I]4654-her defender can leave at Lady - Day . "[4654-her defender]

" Well , [I]230-d'urberville have no right but to obey , [I]230-d'urberville suppose . But - well , goodbye ! "[230-d'urberville]

[[Her]198-tess defender]4654-her defender , whom [she]198-tess dreaded more than [[her]198-tess assailant]4655-her assailant , having reluctantly disappeared , [the farmer]1947-the farmer continued [his]1947-the farmer reprimand , which [Tess]198-tess took with the greatest coolness , that sort of attack being independent of sex . To have as [a master]4657-a master [this man of stone]4658-this man of stone , who would have cuffed [her]198-tess if [he]4658-this man of stone had dared , was almost a relief after [her]198-tess former experiences . [She]198-tess silently walked back towards the summit of [the field that was the scene of [her]198-tess labour]4659-the field that was the scene of her labour , so absorbed in the interview which had just taken place that [she]198-tess was hardly aware that the nose of [Groby]406-farmer groby 's horse almost touched [her]198-tess shoulders .

" If so be [you]198-tess make an agreement to work for [me]1947-the farmer till [Lady]7471-lady - Day , [I]1947-the farmer 'll see that [you]198-tess carry it out , "[1947-the farmer] [he]1947-the farmer growled . " ' Od rot [the women]5900-the women - now ' tis one thing , and then ' tis another . But [I]1947-the farmer 'll put up with it no longer ! "[1947-the farmer]

Knowing very well that [he]1947-the farmer did not harass [the other women of [the farm]7206-the farm]4660-the other women of the farm as [he]1947-the farmer harassed [her]198-tess out of spite for the flooring [he]1947-the farmer had once received , [she]198-tess did for one moment picture what might have been the result if [she]198-tess had been free to accept the offer just made [her]198-tess of being [the monied [Alec]367-alec d'urberville 's wife]4662-the monied alec 's wife . It would have lifted [her]198-tess completely out of subjection , not only to [[her]198-tess present oppressive employer]4663-her present oppressive employer , but to [a whole world who seemed to despise [her]198-tess]4664-a whole world who seemed to despise her . " But no , no ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said breathlessly ; " [I]198-tess could not have married [him]284-clare now ! [He]284-clare is so unpleasant to [me]198-tess . "[198-tess]

That very night [she]198-tess began an appealing letter to [Clare]284-clare , concealing from [him]284-clare [her]198-tess hardships , and assuring [him]284-clare of [her]198-tess undying affection . [Any one who had been in a position to read between the lines]4665-any one who had been in a position to read between the lines would have seen that at the back of [her]198-tess great love was some monstrous fear - almost a desperation - as to some secret contingencies which were not disclosed . But again [she]198-tess did not finish [her]198-tess effusion ; [he]284-clare had asked [Izz]4666-izz to go with [him]284-clare , and perhaps [he]284-clare did not care for [her]198-tess at all . [She]198-tess put the letter in [her]198-tess box , and wondered if it would ever reach [Angel]284-clare 's hands .

After this [her]198-tess daily tasks were gone through heavily enough , and brought on the day which was of great import to [agriculturists]4667-agriculturists - the day of the Candlemas Fair . It was at this fair that new engagements were entered into for the twelve months following the ensuing Lady - Day , and [those of [the farming population who thought of changing [their]4668-those of the farming population who thought of changing their places duly attended at the county - town where the fair was held places]4669-the farming population who thought of changing their places duly attended at [the county - town where the fair was held]4670-the county - town where the fair was held]4668-those of the farming population who thought of changing their places duly attended at the county - town where the fair was held . [Nearly all the labourers on [Flintcomb]141-flintcomb]4671-nearly all the labourers on flintcomb - [Ash farm]4672-ash farm intended flight , and early in the morning there was a general exodus in the direction of [the town]1346-the town , which lay at a distance of from ten to a dozen miles over [hilly country]4674-hilly country . Though [Tess]198-tess also meant to leave at the quarter - day , [she]198-tess was [one of the few who did not go to the fair]4675-one of the few who did not go to the fair , having a vaguely - shaped hope that something would happen to render another outdoor engagement unnecessary .

It was a peaceful February day , of wonderful softness for the time , and [one]6172-one would almost have thought that winter was over . [She]198-tess had hardly finished [her]198-tess dinner when [d'Urberville]1551-d'urberville 's figure darkened the window of [the cottage]1251-the cottage wherein [she]198-tess was [a lodger]4679-a lodger , which [she]198-tess had all to [herself]198-tess to - day .

[Tess]198-tess jumped up , but [[her]198-tess visitor]4680-her visitor had knocked at the door , and [she]198-tess could hardly in reason run away . [D'Urberville]230-d'urberville 's knock , [his]230-d'urberville walk up to the door , had some indescribable quality of difference from [his]230-d'urberville air when [she]198-tess last saw [him]230-d'urberville . They seemed to be acts of which [the doer]4681-the doer was ashamed . [She]198-tess thought that [she]198-tess would not open the door ; but , as there was no sense in that either , [she]198-tess arose , and having lifted the latch stepped back quickly . [He]230-d'urberville came in , saw [her]198-tess , and flung [himself]230-d'urberville down into a chair before speaking .

" [Tess]198-tess - [I]230-d'urberville could n't help it ! "[230-d'urberville] [he]230-d'urberville began desperately , as [he]230-d'urberville wiped [his]230-d'urberville heated face , which had also a superimposed flush of excitement . " [I]230-d'urberville felt that [I]230-d'urberville must call at least to ask how [you]198-tess are . [I]230-d'urberville assure [you]198-tess [I]230-d'urberville had not been thinking of [you]198-tess at all till [I]230-d'urberville saw [you]198-tess that Sunday ; now [I]230-d'urberville can not get rid of [your]198-tess image , try how [I]230-d'urberville may ! It is hard that [a good woman]7267-a good woman should do harm to [a bad man]7474-a bad man ; yet so it is . If [you]198-tess would only pray for [me]230-d'urberville , [Tess]198-tess ! "[230-d'urberville]

The suppressed discontent of [his]230-d'urberville manner was almost pitiable , and yet [Tess]198-tess did not pity [him]230-d'urberville .

" How can [I]198-tess pray for [you]230-d'urberville , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , " when [I]198-tess am forbidden to believe that [the great Power who moves [the world]497-the world]7475-the great power who moves the world would alter [His]7475-the great power who moves the world plans on [my]198-tess account ? "[198-tess]

" [You]230-d'urberville really think that ? "[230-d'urberville]

" Yes . [I]198-tess have been cured of the presumption of thinking otherwise . "[198-tess]

" Cured ? By whom ? "[230-d'urberville]

" By [[my]198-tess husband]7291-my husband , if [I]198-tess must tell . "[198-tess]

" Ah - [[your]198-tess husband]6856-your husband - [[your]198-tess husband]6856-your husband ! How strange it seems ! [I]4682-he remember [you]4683-i hinted something of the sort the other day . What do [you]4683-i really believe in these matters , [Tess]198-tess ? "[4682-he] [he]4682-he asked . " [You]4683-i seem to have no religion - perhaps owing to [me]4682-he . "[4682-he]

" But [I]198-tess have . Though [I]198-tess do n't believe in anything supernatural . "[198-tess]

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville looked at [her]4683-i with misgiving .

" Then do [you]4683-i think that the line [I]198-tess take is all wrong ? "[198-tess]

" A good deal of it . "[198-tess]

" H'm - and yet [I]4682-he 've felt so sure about it , "[4682-he] [he]4682-he said uneasily .

" [I]198-tess believe in the SPIRIT of the Sermon on [the Mount]142-the mount , and so did [[my]198-tess dear husband]7480-my dear husband ... But [I]198-tess do n't believe - "[198-tess]

Here [she]4683-i gave [her]4683-i negations .

" The fact is , "[230-d'urberville] said [d'Urberville]230-d'urberville drily , " whatever [[your]4683-i dear husband]7481-your dear husband believed [you]4683-i accept , and whatever [he]4682-he rejected [you]4683-i reject , without the least inquiry or reasoning on [your]4683-i own part . That 's just like [[you]4683-i women]7482-you women . [Your]4683-i mind is enslaved to [his]4682-he . "[230-d'urberville]

" Ah , because [he]4682-he knew everything ! "[4683-i] said [she]4683-i , with a triumphant simplicity of faith in [Angel Clare]284-clare that [the most perfect man]4684-the most perfect man could hardly have deserved , much less [[her]4683-i husband]791-her husband .

" Yes , but [you]4683-i should not take negative opinions wholesale from [another person like that]7483-another person like that . [A pretty fellow]7484-a pretty fellow [he]4682-he must be to teach [you]4683-i such scepticism ! "[230-d'urberville]

" [He]4682-he never forced [my]4683-i judgement ! [He]4682-he would never argue on the subject with [me]4683-i ! But [I]4683-i looked at it in this way ; what [he]4682-he believed , after inquiring deep into doctrines , was much more likely to be right than what [I]4683-i might believe , who had n't looked into doctrines at all . "[4683-i]

" What used [he]4682-he to say ? [He]4682-he must have said something ? "[4683-i]

[She]4683-i reflected ; and with [her]4683-i acute memory for the letter of [Angel Clare]284-clare 's remarks , even when [she]4683-i did not comprehend [their]4686-their spirit , [she]4683-i recalled a merciless polemical syllogism that [she]4683-i had heard [him]284-clare use when , as it occasionally happened , [he]284-clare indulged in a species of thinking aloud with [her]4683-i at [his]284-clare side . In delivering it [she]4683-i gave also [Clare]284-clare 's accent and manner with reverential faithfulness .

" Say that again , "[4683-i] asked d'Urberville , who had listened with the greatest attention .

[She]4683-i repeated the argument , and [d'Urberville]230-d'urberville thoughtfully murmured the words after [her]4683-i .

" Anything else ? "[230-d'urberville] [he]230-d'urberville presently asked .

" [He]4682-he said at another time something like this "[4683-i] ; and [she]4683-i gave another , which might possibly have been paralleled in many a work of the pedigree ranging from the Dictionnaire Philosophique to [Huxley]409-huxley 's Essays .

" Ah - ha ! How do [you]230-d'urberville remember them ? "[4683-i]

" [I]4683-i wanted to believe what [he]4682-he believed , though [he]4682-he did n't wish [me]4683-i to ; and [I]4683-i managed to coax [him]4682-he to tell [me]4683-i a few of [his]4682-he thoughts . " H'm . Fancy [your]4687-i being able to teach [me]4683-i what [you]4687-i do n't know [yourself]4687-i ! "[4683-i]

[He]230-d'urberville fell into thought .

" And so [I]4687-i threw in [my]4687-i spiritual lot with [his]4682-he , "[4687-i] [she]4687-i resumed . " [I]4687-i did n't wish it to be different . What 's good enough for [him]4682-he is good enough for [me]4687-i . "[4687-i]

" Does [he]4682-he know that [you]4687-i are as big [an infidel]7485-an infidel as [he]4682-he ? "[4683-i]

" No - [I]4687-i never told [him]4682-he - if [I]4687-i am [an infidel]7485-an infidel . "[4687-i]

" Well - [you]4687-i are better off to - day that [I]4683-i am , [Tess]198-tess , after all ! [You]4687-i do n't believe that [you]4687-i ought to preach [my]4683-i doctrine , and , therefore , do no despite to [your]4687-i conscience in abstaining .
