[The threshers]4783-the threshers now began to stir below .

" So much for [our]7559-our quarrel , "[4778-his] [he]4778-his said , letting [her]4782-her go . " Now [I]4778-his shall leave [you]4782-her , and shall come again for [your]4782-her answer during the afternoon . [You]4782-her do n't know [me]4778-his yet ! But [I]4778-his know [you]4782-her . "[4778-his]

[She]4782-her had not spoken again , remaining as if stunned . [D'Urberville]230-d'urberville retreated over the sheaves , and descended the ladder , while [the workers below]4784-the workers below rose and stretched [their]4784-the workers below arms , and shook down the beer [they]4784-the workers below had drunk . Then the threshing - machine started afresh ; and amid the renewed rustle of the straw [Tess]198-tess resumed [her]198-tess position by the buzzing drum as one in a dream , untying sheaf after sheaf in endless succession .

XLVIII

In the afternoon [the farmer]1947-the farmer made it known that [the rick]4730-the rick was to be finished that night , since there was a moon by which [they]1947-the farmer could see to work , and [the man with the engine]4787-the man with the engine was engaged for [another farm]4788-another farm on the morrow . Hence the twanging and humming and rustling proceeded with even less intermission than usual .

It was not till " nammet"-time[4787-the man with the engine] , about three o - clock , that [Tess]198-tess raised [her]198-tess eyes and gave a momentary glance round . [She]198-tess felt but little surprise at seeing that [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville had come back , and was standing under the hedge by the gate . [He]4787-the man with the engine had seen [her]198-tess lift [her]198-tess eyes , and waved [his]4787-the man with the engine hand urbanely to [her]198-tess , while [he]4787-the man with the engine blew [her]198-tess a kiss . It meant that [their]4789-their quarrel was over . [Tess]198-tess looked down again , and carefully abstained from gazing in that direction .

Thus the afternoon dragged on . [The wheat - rick]4790-the wheat - rick shrank lower , and the straw - rick grew higher , and the corn - sacks were carted away . At six o'clock the wheat - rick was about shoulder - high from the ground . But the unthreshed sheaves remaining untouched seemed countless still , notwithstanding the enormous numbers that had been gulped down by [the insatiable swallower]4791-the insatiable swallower , fed by [the man]1516-the man and [Tess]198-tess , through whose two young hands the greater part of [them]1947-the farmer had passed . And the immense [stack of straw where in the morning there had been nothing]4793-stack of straw where in the morning there had been nothing , appeared as the faeces of the same buzzing red glutton . From the west sky a wrathful shine - all that wild March could afford in the way of sunset - had burst forth after the cloudy day , flooding the tired and sticky faces of [the threshers]4783-the threshers , and dyeing [them]4783-the threshers with a coppery light , as also the flapping garments of [the women]5900-the women , which clung to [them]4783-the threshers like dull flames .

A panting ache ran through the rick . [The man who fed]4747-the man who fed was weary , and [Tess]198-tess could see that the red nape of [his]4787-the man with the engine neck was encrusted with dirt and husks . [She]198-tess still stood at [her]198-tess post , [her]198-tess flushed and perspiring face coated with the corndust , and [her]198-tess white bonnet embrowned by it . [She]198-tess was the only woman whose place was upon [the machine so as to be shaken bodily by its spinning]4797-the machine so as to be shaken bodily by its spinning , and the decrease of the stack now separated [her]198-tess from [Marian]310-marian and [Izz]312-izz , and prevented [their]1947-the farmer changing duties with [her]198-tess as [they]1947-the farmer had done . The incessant quivering , in which every fibre of [her]198-tess frame participated , had thrown [her]198-tess into a stupefied reverie in which [her]198-tess arms worked on independently of [her]198-tess consciousness . [She]198-tess hardly knew where [she]198-tess was , and did not hear [Izz Huett]312-izz tell [her]198-tess from below that [her]198-tess hair was tumbling down .

By degrees the freshest among [them]1947-the farmer began to grow cadaverous and saucer - eyed . Whenever [Tess]198-tess lifted [her]198-tess head [she]198-tess beheld always the great upgrown straw - stack , with [the men in shirt - sleeves]4798-the men in shirt - sleeves upon it , against the gray north sky ; in front of it the long red elevator like a Jacob 's ladder , on which a perpetual stream of threshed straw ascended , a yellow river running uphill , and spouting out on the top of the rick .

[She]198-tess knew that [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville was still on the scene , observing [her]198-tess from some point or other , though [she]198-tess could not say where . There was an excuse for [his]4799-his remaining , for when the threshed rick drew near its final sheaves a little ratting was always done , and [men unconnected with the threshing]4800-men unconnected with the threshing sometimes dropped in for that performance - [sporting characters of all descriptions]4801-sporting characters of all descriptions , [gents with terriers and facetious pipes , roughs with sticks and stones]4802-gents with terriers and facetious pipes , roughs with sticks and stones .

But there was another hour 's work before the layer of live rats at the base of the stack would be reached ; and as the evening light in the direction of [the Giant 's Hill by [Abbot's - Cernel]140-abbot's - cernel]4803-the giant 's hill by abbot's - cernel dissolved away , the white - faced moon of the season arose from the horizon that lay towards [Middleton Abbey]147-middleton abbey and [Shottsford]148-shottsford on the other side . For the last hour or two [Marian]310-marian had felt uneasy about [Tess]198-tess , whom [she]310-marian could not get near enough to speak to , [the other women]1702-the other women having kept up [their]1702-the other women strength by drinking ale , and [Tess]198-tess having done without it through traditionary dread , owing to its results at [[her]198-tess home]1063-her home in childhood . But [Tess]198-tess still kept going : if [she]198-tess could not fill [her]198-tess part [she]198-tess would have to leave ; and this contingency , which [she]198-tess would have regarded with equanimity and even with relief a month or two earlier , had become a terror since d'Urberville had begun to hover round [her]198-tess .

The sheaf - pitchers and feeders had now worked the rick so low that [people on the ground]4806-people on the ground could talk to [them]4807-them . To [Tess]198-tess 's surprise [Farmer Groby]406-farmer groby came up on the machine to [her]198-tess , and said that if [she]198-tess desired to join [[her]198-tess friend]3163-her friend [he]406-farmer groby did not wish [her]198-tess to keep on any longer , and would send [somebody else]7441-somebody else to take [her]198-tess place . [The " friend]7560-the " friend "[7560-the " friend] was d'Urberville , [she]198-tess knew , and also that this concession had been granted in obedience to the request of [that friend]4810-that friend , or [enemy]4811-enemy . [She]198-tess shook [her]198-tess head and toiled on .

The time for the rat - catching arrived at last , and the hunt began . The creatures had crept downwards with the subsidence of the rick till [they]4812-they were all together at the bottom , and being now uncovered from [their]4812-they last refuge , [they]4812-they ran across the open ground in all directions , a loud shriek from [the by - this - time half - tipsy Marian]4813-the by - this - time half - tipsy marian informing [[her]4813-the by - this - time half - tipsy marian companions]558-her companions that one of the rats had invaded [her]4813-the by - this - time half - tipsy marian person - a terror which the rest of [the women had guarded against by various schemes of skirt - tucking and self - elevation]4815-the women had guarded against by various schemes of skirt - tucking and self - elevation . The rat was at last dislodged , and , amid the barking of dogs , masculine shouts , feminine screams , oaths , stampings , and confusion as of Pandemonium , [Tess]198-tess untied [her]198-tess last sheaf ; the drum slowed , the whizzing ceased , and [she]198-tess stepped from the machine to the ground .

[[Her]198-tess lover , who had only looked on at [the rat - catching]4817-the rat - catching]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching , was promptly at [her]198-tess side .

" What - after all - [my]198-tess insulting slap , too ! "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess in an underbreath . [She]198-tess was so utterly exhausted that [she]198-tess had not strength to speak louder .

" [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching should indeed be foolish to feel offended at anything [you]198-tess say or do , "[4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching] [he]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching answered , in the seductive voice of the Trantridge time . " How the little limbs tremble ! [You]198-tess are as weak as a bled calf , [you]198-tess know [you]198-tess are ; and yet [you]198-tess need have done nothing since [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching arrived . How could [you]198-tess be so obstinate ? However , [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching have told [the farmer]1947-the farmer that [he]1947-the farmer has no right to employ [women]1628-women at steam - threshing . It is not proper work for [them]1628-women ; and on all the better class of [farms]6685-farms [it]7564-it has been given up , as [he]1947-the farmer knows very well . [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching will walk with [you]198-tess as far as [[your]198-tess home]7565-your home . "[4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching]

" O yes , "[4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching] [she]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching answered with a jaded gait . " Walk wi ' [me]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching if [you]198-tess will ! [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching do bear in mind that [you]198-tess came to marry [me]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching before [you]198-tess knew o ' [my]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching state . Perhaps - perhaps [you]198-tess are a little better and kinder than [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching have been thinking [you]198-tess were . Whatever is meant as kindness [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching am grateful for ; whatever is meant in any other way [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching am angered at . [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching can not sense [your]198-tess meaning sometimes . "[4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching]

" If [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching can not legitimize [our]7566-our former relations at least [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching can assist [you]198-tess . And [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching will do it with much more regard for [your]198-tess feelings than [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching formerly showed . [My]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching religious mania , or whatever it was , is over . But [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching retain a little good nature ; [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching hope [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching do . Now , [Tess]198-tess , by all that 's tender and strong between [man]970-man and [woman]744-woman , trust [me]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching ! [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching have enough and more than enough to put [you]198-tess out of anxiety , both for [yourself]198-tess and [[your]198-tess parents]7569-your parents and [sisters]825-sisters . [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching can make [them]7571-them all comfortable if [you]198-tess will only show confidence in [me]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching . "[4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching]

" Have [you]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching seen ['em]7572-'em lately ? "[4818-she] [she]4818-she quickly inquired .

" Yes . [They]7571-them did n't know where [you]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching were . It was only by chance that [I]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching found [you]4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching [here]5975-here . "[4816-her lover , who had only looked on at the rat - catching]

The cold moon looked aslant upon [Tess]198-tess 's fagged face between the twigs of the garden - hedge as [she]4818-she paused outside [the cottage]1251-the cottage which was [[her]4818-she temporary home]4820-her temporary home , d'Urberville pausing beside [her]4818-she .

" Do n't mention [[my]4818-she little brothers]7574-my little brothers and [sisters]825-sisters - do n't make [me]4818-she break down quite ! "[4818-she] [she]4818-she said . " If [you]4821-you want to help [them]7571-them - [God]222-god knows [they]7571-them need it - do it without telling [me]4818-she . But no , no ! "[4818-she] [she]4818-she cried . " [I]4818-she will take nothing from [you]4821-you , either for [them]7571-them or for [me]4818-she ! "[4818-she]

[He]4821-you did not accompany [her]4818-she further , since , as [she]4818-she lived with [the household]874-the household , all was public indoors . No sooner had [she]4818-she [herself]4818-she entered , laved [herself]4818-she in a washing - tub , and shared supper with [the family]719-the family than [she]4818-she fell into thought , and withdrawing to the table under the wall , by the light of [her]4818-she own little lamp wrote in a passionate mood -

[[MY]0-i OWN HUSBAND]7052-my own husband , -

Let [me]0-i call [you]7052-my own husband so - [I]0-i must - even if it makes [you]7052-my own husband angry to think of such an unworthy wife as [I.]0-i [I]0-i must cry to [you]7052-my own husband in [my]0-i trouble - [I]0-i have [no one else]2599-no one else ! [I]0-i am so exposed to temptation , [Angel]284-clare . [I]0-i fear to say who it is , and [I]0-i do not like to write about it at all . But [I]0-i cling to [you]7052-my own husband in a way [you]7052-my own husband can not think ! Can [you]7052-my own husband not come to [me]0-i now , at once , before anything terrible happens ? O , [I]0-i know [you]7052-my own husband can not , because [you]7052-my own husband are so far away ! [I]0-i think [I]0-i must die if [you]7052-my own husband do not come soon , or tell [me]0-i to come to [you]7052-my own husband . The punishment [you]7052-my own husband have measured out to [me]0-i is deserved - [I]0-i do know that - well deserved - and [you]7052-my own husband are right and just to be angry with [me]0-i . But , [Angel]284-clare , please , please , not to be just - only a little kind to [me]0-i , even if [I]0-i do not deserve it , and come to [me]0-i ! If [you]7052-my own husband would come , [I]0-i could die in [your]7052-my own husband arms ! [I]0-i would be well content to do that if so be [you]7052-my own husband had forgiven [me]0-i !

[Angel]284-clare , [I]0-i live entirely for [you]7052-my own husband . [I]0-i love [you]7052-my own husband too much to blame [you]7052-my own husband for going away , and [I]0-i know it was necessary [you]7052-my own husband should find [a farm]3880-a farm . Do not think [I]0-i shall say a word of sting or bitterness . Only come back to [me]0-i . [I]0-i am desolate without [you]7052-my own husband , [[my]0-i darling]6606-my darling , O , so desolate ! [I]0-i do not mind having to work : but if [you]7052-my own husband will send [me]0-i one little line , and say , " [I]7052-my own husband am coming soon , "[7052-my own husband] [I]0-i will bide on , [Angel]284-clare - O , so cheerfully !

It has been so much [my]0-i religion ever since [we]4828-we were married to be faithful to [you]7052-my own husband in every thought and look , that even when [a man]1337-a man speaks a compliment to [me]0-i before [I]0-i am aware , it seems wronging [you]7052-my own husband . Have [you]7052-my own husband never felt one little bit of what [you]7052-my own husband used to feel when [we]4828-we were at [the dairy]1952-the dairy ? If [you]7052-my own husband have , how can [you]7052-my own husband keep away from [me]0-i ? [I]0-i am [the same women]4831-the same women , [Angel]284-clare , as [you]7052-my own husband fell in love with ; yes , the very same ! - not the one [you]7052-my own husband disliked but never saw . What was the past to [me]0-i as soon as [I]0-i met [you]7052-my own husband ? It was a dead thing altogether . [I]0-i became [another woman]6940-another woman , filled full of new life from [you]7052-my own husband . How could [I]0-i be [the early one]4833-the early one ? Why do [you]7052-my own husband not see this ? [Dear]6259-dear , if [you]7052-my own husband would only be a little more conceited , and believe in [yourself]7052-my own husband so far as to see that [you]7052-my own husband were strong enough to work this change in [me]0-i , [you]7052-my own husband would perhaps be in a mind to come to [me]0-i , [[your]7052-my own husband poor wife]4835-your poor wife .

How silly [I]0-i was in [my]0-i happiness when [I]0-i thought [I]0-i could trust [you]7052-my own husband always to love [me]0-i ! [I]0-i ought to have known that such as that was not for poor [me]0-i . But [I]0-i am sick at heart , not only for old times , but for the present . Think - think how it do hurt [my]0-i heart not to see [you]7052-my own husband ever - ever ! Ah , if [I]0-i could only make [your]7052-my own husband dear heart ache one little minute of each day as [mine]0-i does every day and all day long , it might lead [you]7052-my own husband to show pity to [[your]7052-my own husband poor lonely one]4836-your poor lonely one .

[People]5930-people still say that [I]0-i am rather pretty , [Angel]284-clare handsome is the word [they]5930-people use , since [I]0-i wish to be truthful . Perhaps [I]0-i am what [they]5930-people say . But [I]0-i do not value [my]0-i good looks ; [I]0-i only like to have them because they belong to [you]7052-my own husband , [[my]0-i dear]6039-my dear , and that there may be at least one thing about [me]0-i worth [your]7052-my own husband having . So much have [I]0-i felt this , that when [I]0-i met with annoyance on account of the same , [I]0-i tied up [my]0-i face in a bandage as long as [people]5930-people would believe in it . O [Angel]284-clare , [I]0-i tell [you]7052-my own husband all this not from vanity - [you]7052-my own husband will certainly know [I]0-i do not - but only that [you]7052-my own husband may come to [me]0-i !

If [you]7052-my own husband really can not come to [me]0-i , will [you]7052-my own husband let [me]0-i come to [you]7052-my own husband ? [I]0-i am , as [I]0-i say , worried , pressed to do what [I]0-i will not do . It can not be that [I]0-i shall yield one inch , yet [I]0-i am in terror as to what an accident might lead to , and [I]0-i so defenceless on account of [my]0-i first error . [I]0-i can not say more about this - it makes [me]0-i too miserable . But if [I]0-i break down by falling into some fearful snare , [my]0-i last state will be worse than [my]0-i first . [O God]4840-o god , [I]0-i can not think of it ! Let [me]0-i come at once , or at once come to [me]0-i !

[I]0-i would be content , ay , glad , to live with [you]7052-my own husband as [[your]7052-my own husband servant]4841-your servant , if [I]0-i may not as [[your]7052-my own husband wife]6687-your wife ; so that [I]0-i could only be near [you]7052-my own husband , and get glimpses of [you]7052-my own husband , and think of [you]7052-my own husband as [mine]0-i .

The daylight has nothing to show [me]0-i , since [you]7052-my own husband are not [here]5975-here , and [I]0-i do n't like to see the rooks and starlings in [the field]610-the field , because [I]0-i grieve and grieve to miss [you]7052-my own husband who used to see [them]4845-them with [me]0-i . [I]0-i long for only one thing in [heaven or earth]4846-heaven or earth or under [the earth]1046-the earth , to meet [you]7052-my own husband , [[my]0-i own dear]4848-my own dear ! Come to [me]0-i - come to [me]0-i , and save [me]0-i from what threatens [me]0-i ! -

[Your]7052-my own husband faithful heartbroken

[TESS

XLIX

The]198-tess appeal duly found its way to [the breakfast - table of [the quiet Vicarage]4850-the quiet vicarage to [the westward]4851-the westward]4849-the breakfast - table of the quiet vicarage to the westward , in [that valley where the air is so soft and the soil so rich that the effort of growth]4852-that valley where the air is so soft and the soil so rich that the effort of growth requires but superficial aid by comparison with the tillage at [Flintcomb - Ash]126-flintcomb - ash , and where to [Tess]198-tess [the human world]4853-the human world seemed so different though it was much the same . It was purely for security that [she]198-tess had been requested by [Angel]284-clare to send [her]198-tess communications through [[his]284-clare father]457-his father , whom [he]284-clare kept pretty well informed of [his]284-clare changing addresses in [the country [he]284-clare had gone to exploit for [himself]284-clare]4855-the country he had gone to exploit for himself with a heavy heart .

" Now , "[284-clare] said [old Mr Clare]284-clare to [[his]284-clare wife]819-his wife , when [he]284-clare had read the envelope , " if [Angel]284-clare proposes leaving [Rio]149-rio for a visit [home]5850-home at the end of next month , as [he]284-clare told [us]7577-us that [he]284-clare hoped to do , [I]284-clare think this may hasten [his]284-clare plans ; for [I]284-clare believe it to be from [[his]284-clare wife]819-his wife . "[284-clare] [He]284-clare breathed deeply at the thought of [her]819-his wife ; and the letter was redirected to be promptly sent on to [Angel]284-clare .

" [Dear fellow]7579-dear fellow , [I]200-clare hope [he]284-clare will get [home]5850-home safely , "[200-clare] murmured [Mrs Clare]200-clare . " To [my]200-clare dying day [I]200-clare shall feel that [he]284-clare has been ill - used . [You]200-clare should have sent [him]284-clare to [Cambridge]74-cambridge in spite of [his]284-clare want of faith and given [him]284-clare the same chance as [the other boys]7581-the other boys had . [He]284-clare would have grown out of it under proper influence , and perhaps would have taken Orders after all . [Church]813-church or [no Church]7583-no church , it would have been fairer to [him]284-clare . "[200-clare]

This was the only wail with which [Mrs Clare]200-clare ever disturbed [[her]200-clare husband]791-her husband 's peace in respect to [[their]4858-their sons]4859-their sons . And [she]200-clare did not vent this often ; for [she]200-clare was as considerate as [she]200-clare was devout , and knew that [his]791-her husband mind too was troubled by doubts as to [his]791-her husband justice in this matter . Only too often had [she]200-clare heard [him]791-her husband lying awake at night , stifling sighs for [Angel]200-clare with prayers . But [the uncompromising Evangelical]4860-the uncompromising evangelical did not even now hold that [he]791-her husband would have been justified in giving [[his]791-her husband son]2722-his son , [an unbeliever]4862-an unbeliever , the same academic advantages that [he]791-her husband had given to [the two others]4863-the two others , when it was possible , if not probable , that those very advantages might have been used to decry the doctrines which [he]791-her husband had made it [his]791-her husband life 's mission and desire to propagate , and the mission of [[his]791-her husband ordained sons]4864-his ordained sons likewise . To put with one hand a pedestal under the feet of [the two faithful ones]4865-the two faithful ones , and with the other to exalt the unfaithful by the same artificial means , [he]791-her husband deemed to be alike inconsistent with [his]791-her husband convictions , [his]791-her husband position , and [his]791-her husband hopes . Nevertheless , [he]791-her husband loved [his]791-her husband misnamed [Angel]200-clare , and in secret mourned over this treatment of [him]791-her husband as [Abraham]212-abraham might have mourned over the doomed [Isaac]413-isaac while [they]4866-they went up [the hill]642-the hill together . [His]791-her husband silent self - generated regrets were far bitterer than the reproaches which [[his]791-her husband wife]819-his wife rendered audible .

[They]4866-they blamed [themselves]4866-they for this unlucky marriage . If [Angel]200-clare had never been destined for [a farmer]868-a farmer [he]791-her husband would never have been thrown with [agricultural girls]4870-agricultural girls . [They]4866-they did not distinctly know what had separated [him]791-her husband and [[his]791-her husband wife]819-his wife , nor the date on which the separation had taken place . At first [they]4866-they had supposed it must be something of the nature of a serious aversion . But in [his]791-her husband later letters [he]791-her husband occasionally alluded to the intention of coming [home]5850-home to fetch [her]819-his wife ; from which expressions [they]4866-they hoped the division might not owe its origin to anything so hopelessly permanent as that . [He]791-her husband had told [them]4866-they that [she]819-his wife was with [[her]819-his wife relatives]922-her relatives , and in [their]4866-they doubts [they]4866-they had decided not to intrude into a situation which [they]4866-they knew no way of bettering .

The eyes for which [Tess]198-tess 's letter was intended were gazing at this time on [a limitless expanse of country]4874-a limitless expanse of country from the back of a mule which was bearing [him]791-her husband from [the interior of [the South - American Continent]150-the south - american continent towards [the coast]489-the coast]4875-the interior of the south - american continent towards the coast . [His]791-her husband experiences of [this strange land]4877-this strange land had been sad . The severe illness from which [he]791-her husband had suffered shortly after [his]791-her husband arrival had never wholly left [him]791-her husband , and [he]791-her husband had by degrees almost decided to relinquish [his]791-her husband hope of farming here , though , as long as the bare possibility existed of [his]791-her husband remaining , [he]791-her husband kept this change of view a secret from [[his]791-her husband parents]746-his parents .

[The crowds of agricultural labourers who had come out to [the country]507-the country in [his]791-her husband wake , dazzled by representations of easy independence]4879-the crowds of agricultural labourers who had come out to the country in his wake , dazzled by representations of easy independence , had suffered , died , and wasted away . [He]791-her husband would see mothers from [English farms]4881-english farms trudging along with [[their]746-his parents infants]4882-their infants in [their]746-his parents arms , when [the child]1735-the child would be stricken with fever and would die ; [the mother]708-the mother would pause to dig a hole in the loose earth with [her]708-the mother bare hands , would bury [the babe therein with the same natural grave - tools]4885-the babe therein with the same natural grave - tools , shed one tear , and again trudge on .

[Angel]200-clare 's original intention had not been emigration to [Brazil]109-brazil but [a northern or eastern farm in [[his]791-her husband own country]4887-his own country]4886-a northern or eastern farm in his own country . [He]791-her husband had come to [this place]2909-this place in a fit of desperation , the [Brazil]109-brazil movement among [the English agriculturists]4889-the english agriculturists having by chance coincided with [his]791-her husband desire to escape from [his]791-her husband past existence .

During this time of absence [he]791-her husband had mentally aged a dozen years . What arrested [him]791-her husband now as of value in life was less its beauty than its pathos . Having long discredited the old systems of mysticism , [he]791-her husband now began to discredit the old appraisements of morality . [He]791-her husband thought [they]4890-they wanted readjusting . Who was [the moral man]4891-the moral man ? Still more pertinently , who was [the moral woman]4892-the moral woman ? The beauty or ugliness of a character lay not only in its achievements , but in its aims and impulses ; its true history lay , not among things done , but among things willed .

How , then , about [Tess]198-tess ?

Viewing [her]198-tess in these lights , a regret for [his]791-her husband hasty judgement began to oppress [him]791-her husband . Did [he]791-her husband reject [her]198-tess eternally , or did [he]791-her husband not ? [He]791-her husband could no longer say that [he]791-her husband would always reject [her]198-tess , and not to say that was in spirit to accept [her]198-tess now .

This growing fondness for [her]198-tess memory coincided in point of time with [her]198-tess residence at [Flintcomb - Ash]126-flintcomb - ash , but it was before [she]198-tess had felt [herself]198-tess at liberty to trouble [him]791-her husband with a word about [her]198-tess circumstances or [her]198-tess feelings . [He]791-her husband was greatly perplexed ; and in [his]791-her husband perplexity as to [her]198-tess motives in withholding intelligence , [he]791-her husband did not inquire . Thus [her]198-tess silence of docility was misinterpreted . How much it really said if [he]791-her husband had understood ! - that [she]198-tess adhered with literal exactness to orders which [he]791-her husband had given and forgotten ; that despite [her]198-tess natural fearlessness [she]198-tess asserted no rights , admitted [his]791-her husband judgement to be in every respect [the true one]4893-the true one , and bent [her]198-tess head dumbly thereto .

In the before - mentioned journey by mules through [the interior of [the country]507-the country]4894-the interior of the country , [another man]7006-another man rode beside [him]791-her husband . [[Angel]200-clare 's companion]4897-angel 's companion was also [an Englishman , bent on the same errand]4898-an englishman , bent on the same errand , though [he]4897-angel 's companion came from [another part of [the island]4900-the island]4899-another part of the island . [They]4901-they were both in a state of mental depression , and [they]4901-they spoke of [home affairs]4902-home affairs . [Confidence]414-confidence begat confidence . With that curious tendency evinced by [men]5841-men , more especially when in [distant lands]4904-distant lands , to entrust to [strangers]568-strangers details of [their]5841-men lives which [they]5841-men would on no account mention to [friends]1681-friends , [Angel]200-clare admitted to [this man]1582-this man as [they]4901-they rode along the sorrowful facts of [his]1582-this man marriage .

[The stranger]657-the stranger had sojourned in [many more lands]4909-many more lands and among [many more peoples]4910-many more peoples than [Angel]200-clare ; to [his]657-the stranger cosmopolitan mind such deviations from the social norm , so immense to domesticity , were no more than are the irregularities of [vale and mountain - chain]4911-vale and mountain - chain to [the whole terrestrial curve]4912-the whole terrestrial curve . [He]657-the stranger viewed the matter in quite a different light from [Angel]200-clare ; thought that what [Tess]198-tess had been was of no importance beside what [she]198-tess would be , and plainly told [Clare]200-clare that [he]657-the stranger was wrong in coming away from [her]198-tess .

The next day [they]4901-they were drenched in a thunder - storm . [[Angel]200-clare 's companion]4897-angel 's companion was struck down with fever , and died by the week 's end . [Clare]200-clare waited a few hours to bury [him]4897-angel 's companion , and then went on [his]657-the stranger way .

The cursory remarks of [the large - minded stranger , of whom [he]657-the stranger knew absolutely nothing beyond a commonplace name]4914-the large - minded stranger , of whom he knew absolutely nothing beyond a commonplace name , were sublimed by [his]657-the stranger death , and influenced [Clare]200-clare more than all the reasoned ethics of [the philosophers]4915-the philosophers . [His]657-the stranger own parochialism made [him]657-the stranger ashamed by its contrast . [His]657-the stranger inconsistencies rushed upon [him]657-the stranger in a flood . [He]657-the stranger had persistently elevated Hellenic Paganism at the expense of Christianity ; yet in that civilization an illegal surrender was not certain disesteem . Surely then [he]657-the stranger might have regarded that abhorrence of the un - intact state , which [he]657-the stranger had inherited with the creed of mysticism , as at least open to correction when the result was due to treachery . A remorse struck into [him]657-the stranger . The words of [Izz Huett]312-izz , never quite stilled in [his]657-the stranger memory , came back to [him]657-the stranger . [He]657-the stranger had asked [Izz]312-izz if [she]312-izz loved [him]657-the stranger , and [she]312-izz had replied in the affirmative . Did [she]312-izz love [him]657-the stranger more than [Tess]198-tess did ? No , [she]312-izz had replied ; [Tess]198-tess would lay down [her]198-tess life for [him]657-the stranger , and [she]198-tess [herself]198-tess could do no more .

[He]657-the stranger thought of [Tess]198-tess as [she]198-tess had appeared on the day of the wedding . How [her]198-tess eyes had lingered upon [him]657-the stranger ; how [she]198-tess had hung upon [his]657-the stranger words as if they were a god 's ! And during the terrible evening over the hearth , when [her]198-tess simple soul uncovered itself to [his]657-the stranger , how pitiful [her]198-tess face had looked by the rays of the fire , in [her]198-tess inability to realize that [his]657-the stranger love and protection could possibly be withdrawn .

Thus from being [[her]198-tess critic]4916-her critic [he]657-the stranger grew to be [[her]198-tess advocate]4917-her advocate . Cynical things [he]657-the stranger had uttered to [himself]657-the stranger about [her]198-tess ; but [no man]7093-no man can be always [a cynic]4919-a cynic and live ; and [he]657-the stranger withdrew them . The mistake of expressing them had arisen from [his]657-the stranger allowing [himself]657-the stranger to be influenced by general principles to the disregard of the particular instance .

But the reasoning is somewhat musty ; [lovers]1460-lovers and [husbands]4921-husbands have gone over the ground before to - day . [Clare]200-clare had been harsh towards [her]198-tess ; there is no doubt of it . [Men]5841-men are too often harsh with [women]1628-women [they]5841-men love or have loved ; [[women]1628-women with [men]5841-men]4925-women with men . And yet these harshnesses are tenderness itself when compared with the universal harshness out of which [they]4927-they grow ; the harshness of the position towards the temperament , of the means towards the aims , of to - day towards yesterday , of hereafter towards to - day .

The historic interest of [[her]198-tess family]1011-her family - that masterful line of d'Urbervilles - whom [he]657-the stranger had despised as a spent force , touched [his]657-the stranger sentiments now . Why had [he]657-the stranger not known the difference between the political value and the imaginative value of these things ? In the latter aspect [her]198-tess d'Urberville descent was a fact of great dimensions ; worthless to economics , it was a most useful ingredient to [the dreamer]4929-the dreamer , to [the moralizer on declines and falls]4930-the moralizer on declines and falls . It was a fact that would soon be forgotten - that bit of distinction in poor [Tess]198-tess 's blood and name , and oblivion would fall upon [her]198-tess hereditary link with the marble monuments and leaded skeletons at [Kingsbere]12-kingsbere . So does Time ruthlessly destroy [his]657-the stranger own romances . In recalling [her]198-tess face again and again , [he]657-the stranger thought now that [he]657-the stranger could see therein a flash of the dignity which must have graced [[her]198-tess grand]4931-her grand - dames ; and the vision sent that aura through [his]657-the stranger veins which [he]657-the stranger had formerly felt , and which left behind it a sense of sickness .

Despite [her]198-tess not - inviolate past , what still abode in [such a woman as [Tess]198-tess]4932-such a woman as tess outvalued the freshness of [[her]198-tess fellows]1347-her fellows . Was not the gleaning of the grapes of [Ephraim]415-ephraim better than the vintage of [Abiezer]416-abiezer ?

So spoke [love renascent]371-love , preparing the way for [Tess]198-tess 's devoted outpouring , which was then just being forwarded to [him]657-the stranger by [[his]657-the stranger father]457-his father ; though owing to [his]657-the stranger distance inland it was to be a long time in reaching [him]657-the stranger .

Meanwhile [the writer]4591-the writer 's expectation that [Angel]200-clare would come in response to the entreaty was alternately great and small . What lessened it was that the facts of [her]198-tess life which had led to the parting had not changed - could never change ; and that , if [her]198-tess presence had not attenuated them , [her]198-tess absence could not . Nevertheless [she]198-tess addressed [her]198-tess mind to the tender question of what [she]198-tess could do to please [him]657-the stranger best if [he]657-the stranger should arrive . [Sighs]417-sighs were expended on the wish that [she]198-tess had taken more notice of the tunes [he]657-the stranger played on [his]657-the stranger harp , that [she]198-tess had inquired more curiously of [him]657-the stranger which were [his]657-the stranger favourite ballads among those [the country - girls]4936-the country - girls sang . [She]198-tess indirectly inquired of [Amby Seedling]404-amby seedling , who had followed [Izz]4937-izz from [Talbothays]60-talbothays , and by chance [Amby]404-amby seedling remembered that , amongst the snatches of melody in which [they]4938-they had indulged at [the dairyman]1900-the dairyman 's , to induce the cows to let down [their]4940-their milk , [Clare]200-clare had seemed to like " [Cupid]386-cupid 's Gardens "[200-clare] , " [I]200-clare have [parks]7584-parks , [I]200-clare have hounds "[200-clare] , and " The break o ' the day "[200-clare] ; and had seemed not to care for " [The Tailor]418-the tailor 's Breeches "[200-clare] and " Such a beauty [I]198-tess did grow "[198-tess] , excellent ditties as they were .

To perfect the ballads was now [her]198-tess whimsical desire . [She]198-tess practised them privately at odd moments , especially " The break o ' the day "[198-tess] :

Arise , arise , arise ! And pick [your]4941-your love a posy , All o ' the sweetest flowers That in [the garden]881-the garden grow . The turtle doves and sma ' birds In every bough a - building , So early in the May - time At the break o ' the day !

It would have melted the heart of a stone to hear [her]198-tess singing these ditties whenever [she]198-tess worked apart from [the rest of [the girls]576-the girls]4943-the rest of the girls in this cold dry time ; the tears running down [her]198-tess cheeks all the while at the thought that perhaps [he]4945-he would not , after all , come to hear [her]198-tess , and the simple silly words of the songs resounding in painful mockery of the aching heart of [the singer]4946-the singer .

[Tess]198-tess was so wrapt up in this fanciful dream that [she]198-tess seemed not to know how the season was advancing ; that the days had lengthened , that [Lady]4947-lady - Day was at hand , and would soon be followed by [Old Lady - Day]392-old lady , the end of [her]198-tess term [here]5975-here .

But before the quarter - day had quite come , something happened which made [Tess]198-tess think of far different matters . [She]198-tess was at [[her]198-tess lodging]4349-her lodging as usual one evening , sitting in the [downstairs room]4950-downstairs room with [the rest of [the family]719-the family]2040-the rest of the family , when [somebody]6000-somebody knocked at the door and inquired for [Tess]198-tess . Through the doorway [she]198-tess saw against the declining light [a figure with the height of [a woman]1028-a woman and the breadth of [a child]1122-a child]4954-a figure with the height of a woman and the breadth of a child , [a tall , thin , girlish creature whom [she]198-tess did not recognize in the twilight]4957-a tall , thin , girlish creature whom she did not recognize in the twilight till [the girl]647-the girl said " [Tess]198-tess ! "[647-the girl]

" What - is it ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu ? "[198-tess] asked [Tess]198-tess , in startled accents . [[Her]198-tess sister , whom a little over a year ago [she]198-tess had left at [home]5850-home as [a child]1122-a child]4959-her sister , whom a little over a year ago she had left at home as a child , had sprung up by a sudden shoot to a form of this presentation , of which as yet [Lu]213-liza - lu seemed [herself]213-liza - lu scarce able to understand the meaning . [Her]213-liza - lu thin legs , visible below [her]213-liza - lu once - long frock , now short by [her]213-liza - lu growing , and [her]213-liza - lu uncomfortable hands and arms revealed [her]213-liza - lu youth and inexperience .

" Yes , [I]213-liza - lu have been traipsing about all day , [Tess]198-tess , "[213-liza - lu] said [Lu]213-liza - lu , with unemotional gravity , " a - trying to find [' ee]198-tess ; and [I]213-liza - lu 'm very tired . "[213-liza - lu]

" What is the matter at [home]5850-home ? "[213-liza - lu]

" [Mother]228-mother is took very bad , and [the doctor]5937-the doctor says [she]228-mother 's dying , and as [father]5842-father is not very well neither , and says ' tis wrong for [a man of such a high family as [his]5842-father to slave and drave at common labouring work]7588-a man of such a high family as his to slave and drave at common labouring work , [we]7589-we do n't know what to do . "[213-liza - lu]

[Tess]198-tess stood in reverie a long time before [she]198-tess thought of asking ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu to come in and sit down . When [she]198-tess had done so , and ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu was having some tea , [she]198-tess came to a decision . It was imperative that [she]198-tess should go [home]5850-home . [Her]198-tess agreement did not end till [Old Lady]392-old lady - Day , the sixth of April , but as the interval thereto was not a long one [she]198-tess resolved to run the risk of starting at once .

To go that night would be a gain of twelve - hours ; but [[her]198-tess sister]715-her sister was too tired to undertake such a distance till the morrow . [Tess]198-tess ran down to where [Marian]310-marian and [Izz]4964-izz lived , informed [them]4965-them of what had happened , and begged [them]4965-them to make the best of [her]198-tess case to [the farmer]1947-the farmer . Returning , [she]198-tess got [Lu]213-liza - lu a supper , and after that , having tucked [the younger]2884-the younger into [her]198-tess own bed , packed up as many of [her]198-tess belongings as would go into a withy basket , and started , directing [Lu]213-liza - lu to follow [her]198-tess next morning .

L

[She]198-tess plunged into the chilly equinoctial darkness as the clock struck ten , for [her]198-tess fifteen miles ' walk under the steely stars . In lonely districts night is a protection rather than a danger to [a noiseless pedestrian]4968-a noiseless pedestrian , and knowing this , [Tess]198-tess pursued the nearest course along by - lanes that [she]198-tess would almost have feared in the day - time ; but [marauders]4969-marauders were wanting now , and spectral fears were driven out of [her]198-tess mind by thoughts of [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother . Thus [she]198-tess proceeded mile after mile , ascending and descending till [she]198-tess came to [Bulbarrow]122-bulbarrow , and about midnight looked from that height into the abyss of chaotic shade which was all that revealed itself of [the vale on whose further side]4971-the vale on whose further side [she]198-tess was born . Having already traversed about five miles on [the upland]2899-the upland , [she]198-tess had now some ten or eleven in [the lowland]2005-the lowland before [her]198-tess journey would be finished . [The winding road]4974-the winding road downwards became just visible to [her]198-tess under the wan starlight as [she]198-tess followed it , and soon [she]198-tess paced [a soil so contrasting with that above]4975-a soil so contrasting with that above [it]4975-a soil so contrasting with that above that the difference was perceptible to the tread and to the smell . [It]4976-it was [the heavy clay land of [Blackmoor Vale]53-blackmoor vale]4977-the heavy clay land of blackmoor vale , and [a part of [the Vale]917-the vale to which [turnpike - roads]4980-turnpike - roads]4978-a part of the vale to which turnpike - roads had never penetrated . Superstitions linger longest on [these heavy soils]4981-these heavy soils . Having once been forest , at this shadowy time it seemed to assert something of [its]4976-it old character , the far and the near being blended , and every tree and tall hedge making the most of its presence . [The harts that had been hunted [here]5975-here]4982-the harts that had been hunted here , [the witches that had been pricked and ducked]4984-the witches that had been pricked and ducked , the green - spangled fairies that " whickered "[4981-these heavy soils] at [you]4985-you as [you]4985-you passed ; - [the place]5882-the place teemed with beliefs in [them]4981-these heavy soils still , and [they]4981-these heavy soils formed an impish multitude now .

At [Nuttlebury]106-nuttlebury [she]198-tess passed [the village inn]4987-the village inn , whose sign creaked in response to the greeting of [her]198-tess footsteps , which not [a human soul]4988-a human soul heard but [herself]198-tess . Under the thatched roofs [her]198-tess mind 's eye beheld relaxed tendons and flaccid muscles , spread out in the darkness beneath coverlets made of little purple patchwork squares , and undergoing a bracing process at the hands of sleep for renewed labour on the morrow , as soon as a hint of pink nebulosity appeared on [Hambledon Hill]24-hambledon hill .

At three [she]198-tess turned the last corner of [the maze of lanes [she]198-tess had threaded]4989-the maze of lanes she had threaded , and entered [Marlott]21-marlott , passing [the field in which as [a club - girl]4991-a club - girl [she]198-tess had first seen [Angel Clare]200-clare , when [he]4992-he had not danced with [her]198-tess]4990-the field in which as a club - girl she had first seen angel clare , when he had not danced with her ; the sense of disappointment remained with [her]198-tess yet . In the direction of [[[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's house]3794-her mother 's house [she]198-tess saw a light . It came from the bedroom window , and a branch waved in front of it and made it wink at [her]198-tess . As soon as [she]198-tess could discern the outline of [the house]652-the house - newly thatched with [her]198-tess money - it had all its old effect upon [Tess]198-tess 's imagination . Part of [her]198-tess body and life it ever seemed to be ; the slope of [its]652-the house dormers , the finish of [its]652-the house gables , the broken courses of brick which topped the chimney , all had something in common with [her]198-tess personal character . A stupefaction had come into these features , to [her]198-tess regard ; it meant the illness of [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother .

[She]198-tess opened the door so softly as to disturb [nobody]754-nobody ; [the lower room]1130-the lower room was vacant , but [the neighbour who was sitting up with [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother]4999-the neighbour who was sitting up with her mother came to the top of the stairs , and whispered that [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield was no better , though [she]180-mrs durbeyfield was sleeping just then . [Tess]198-tess prepared [herself]198-tess a breakfast , and then took [her]198-tess place as nurse in [[[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's chamber]5002-her mother 's chamber .

In the morning , when [she]198-tess contemplated [the children]700-the children , [they]700-the children had all a curiously elongated look ; although [she]198-tess had been away little more than a year , [their]700-the children growth was astounding ; and the necessity of applying [herself]198-tess heart and soul to [their]700-the children needs took [her]198-tess out of [her]198-tess own cares .

[[Her]198-tess father]557-her father 's ill - health was the same indefinite kind , and [he]557-her father sat in [his]557-her father chair as usual . But the day after [her]198-tess arrival [he]557-her father was unusually bright . [He]557-her father had a rational scheme for living , and [Tess]198-tess asked [him]557-her father what it was .

" [I]557-her father 'm thinking of sending round to [all the old antiqueerians in [this part of [England]10-england]6876-this part of england]7590-all the old antiqueerians in this part of england , "[557-her father] [he]557-her father said , " asking [them]7590-all the old antiqueerians in this part of england to subscribe to a fund to maintain [me]557-her father . [I]557-her father 'm sure [they]7590-all the old antiqueerians in this part of england 'd see it as a romantical , artistical , and proper thing to do . [They]7590-all the old antiqueerians in this part of england spend lots o ' money in keeping up old ruins , and finding the bones o ' things , and such like ; and living remains must be more interesting to ['em]7592-'em still , if [they]7590-all the old antiqueerians in this part of england only knowed of [me]557-her father . Would that [somebody]6000-somebody would go round and tell ['em]7592-'em what there is living among ['em]7592-'em , and [they]7590-all the old antiqueerians in this part of england thinking nothing of [him]6000-somebody ! If [Pa'son Tringham]191-pa'son tringham , who discovered [me]557-her father , had lived , [he]191-pa'son tringham 'd ha ' done it , [I]557-her father 'm sure . "[557-her father]

[Tess]198-tess postponed [her]198-tess arguments on this high project till [she]198-tess had grappled with pressing matters in hand , which seemed little improved by [her]198-tess remittances . When indoor necessities had been eased , [she]198-tess turned [her]198-tess attention to external things . It was now the season for planting and sowing ; [many gardens]5005-many gardens and allotments of [the villagers]5006-the villagers had already received [their]5006-the villagers spring tillage ; but [the garden]881-the garden and the allotment of [the Durbeyfields]218-the durbeyfields were behindhand . [She]198-tess found , to [her]198-tess dismay , that this was owing to [their]5008-their having eaten all the seed potatoes , - that last lapse of the improvident . At the earliest moment [she]198-tess obtained what others [she]198-tess could procure , and in a few days [[her]198-tess father]557-her father was well enough to see to [the garden]881-the garden , under [Tess]198-tess 's persuasive efforts : while [she]198-tess [herself]198-tess undertook the allotment - plot which [they]5008-their rented in [a field a couple of hundred yards out of [the village]473-the village]5011-a field a couple of hundred yards out of the village .

[She]198-tess liked doing it after the confinement of the sick chamber , where [she]198-tess was not now required by reason of [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's improvement . Violent motion relieved thought . [The plot of ground]5014-the plot of ground was in a high , dry , open enclosure , where there were forty or fifty such pieces , and where labour was at its briskest when the hired labour of the day had ended . Digging began usually at six o'clock and extended indefinitely into the dusk or moonlight . Just now heaps of dead weeds and refuse were burning on many of [the plots]5015-the plots , the dry weather favouring [their]5015-the plots combustion .

One fine day [Tess]198-tess and [' Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu worked on [here]5975-here with [[their]5008-their neighbours]5017-their neighbours till the last rays of the sun smote flat upon the white pegs that divided [the plots]5015-the plots . As soon as twilight succeeded to sunset the flare of the couch - grass and cabbage - stalk fires began to light up the allotments fitfully , their outlines appearing and disappearing under the dense smoke as wafted by the wind . When a fire glowed , banks of smoke , blown level along the ground , would themselves become illuminated to an opaque lustre , screening [the workpeople]5019-the workpeople from one another ; and the meaning of the " pillar of a cloud "[198-tess] , which was a wall by day and a light by night , could be understood .

As evening thickened , [some of [the gardening men]5021-the gardening men and [women]1628-women]5020-some of the gardening men and women gave over for the night , but [the greater number]5023-the greater number remained to get [their]5023-the greater number planting done , [Tess]198-tess being among [them]5023-the greater number , though [she]198-tess sent [[her]198-tess sister]715-her sister [home]5850-home . It was on one of [the couch - burning plots]5026-the couch - burning plots that [she]198-tess laboured with [her]198-tess fork , its four shining prongs resounding against the stones and dry clods in little clicks . Sometimes [she]198-tess was completely involved in the smoke of [her]198-tess fire ; then it would leave [her]198-tess figure free , irradiated by the brassy glare from the heap . [She]198-tess was oddly dressed to - night , and presented a somewhat staring aspect , [her]198-tess attire being a gown bleached by many washings , with a short black jacket over it , the effect of the whole being that of a wedding and [funeral guest]5027-funeral guest in one . [The women further back]5028-the women further back wore white aprons , which , with [their]5028-the women further back pale faces , were all that could be seen of [them]5028-the women further back in the gloom , except when at moments [they]5028-the women further back caught a flash from the flames .

Westward , the wiry boughs of the bare thorn hedge which formed the boundary of [the field]610-the field rose against the pale opalescence of the lower sky . Above , [Jupiter]419-jupiter hung like a full - blown jonquil , so bright as almost to throw a shade . A few small nondescript stars were appearing elsewhere . In the distance a dog barked , and wheels occasionally rattled along [the dry road]5030-the dry road .

Still the prongs continued to click assiduously , for it was not late ; and though the air was fresh and keen there was a whisper of spring in it that cheered [the workers]5031-the workers on . Something in [the place]5882-the place , the hours , the crackling fires , the fantastic mysteries of light and shade , made others as well as [Tess]198-tess enjoy being [there]5839-there . Nightfall , which in the frost of winter comes as [a fiend and in the warmth of summer]5034-a fiend and in the warmth of summer as [a lover]6249-a lover , came as a tranquillizer on this March day .

[Nobody]754-nobody looked at [his]5037-his or [[her]5038-her companions]558-her companions . The eyes of all were on the soil as its turned surface was revealed by the fires . Hence as [Tess]198-tess stirred the clods and sang [her]198-tess foolish little songs with scarce now a hope that [Clare]200-clare would ever hear them , [she]198-tess did not for a long time notice [the person who worked nearest to [her]198-tess]5040-the person who worked nearest to her - [a man in a long smockfrock who , [she]198-tess found , was forking the same plot as [herself]198-tess , and whom [she]198-tess supposed [[her]198-tess father]557-her father had sent [there]5839-there to advance the work]5041-a man in a long smockfrock who , she found , was forking the same plot as herself , and whom she supposed her father had sent there to advance the work . [She]198-tess became more conscious of [him]5040-the person who worked nearest to her when the direction of [his]5040-the person who worked nearest to her digging brought [him]5040-the person who worked nearest to her closer . Sometimes the smoke divided [them]5044-them ; then it swerved , and [the two]1022-the two were visible to each other but divided from all the rest .

[Tess]198-tess did not speak to [[her]198-tess fellow - worker]5046-her fellow - worker , nor did [he]5040-the person who worked nearest to her speak to [her]198-tess . Nor did [she]198-tess think of [him]5040-the person who worked nearest to her further than to recollect that [he]5040-the person who worked nearest to her had not been [there]5839-there when it was broad daylight , and that [she]198-tess did not know [him]5040-the person who worked nearest to her as [any one of [the Marlott labourers]5049-the marlott labourers]5048-any one of the marlott labourers , which was no wonder , [her]198-tess absences having been so long and frequent of late years . By - and - by [he]5040-the person who worked nearest to her dug so close to [her]198-tess that the fire - beams were reflected as distinctly from the steel prongs of [his]5040-the person who worked nearest to her fork as from [her]198-tess own . On going up to the fire to throw a pitch of dead weeds upon it , [she]198-tess found that [he]5040-the person who worked nearest to her did the same on the other side . The fire flared up , and [she]198-tess beheld the face of [d'Urberville]1551-d'urberville .

The unexpectedness of [his]5040-the person who worked nearest to her presence , the grotesqueness of [his]5040-the person who worked nearest to her appearance in a gathered smockfrock , such as was now worn only by [the most old - fashioned of [the labourers]5052-the labourers]5051-the most old - fashioned of the labourers , had a ghastly comicality that chilled [her]198-tess as to its bearing . [D'Urberville]230-d'urberville emitted a low , long laugh .

" If [I]5040-the person who worked nearest to her were inclined to joke , [I]5040-the person who worked nearest to her should say , How much this seems like [Paradise]154-paradise ! "[5040-the person who worked nearest to her] [he]5040-the person who worked nearest to her remarked whimsically , looking at [her]198-tess with an inclined head .

" What do [you]5040-the person who worked nearest to her say ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess weakly asked .

" [A jester]7594-a jester might say this is just like [Paradise]154-paradise . [You]198-tess are [Eve]303-eve , and [I]230-d'urberville am the old Other One come to tempt [you]198-tess in the disguise of an inferior animal . [I]230-d'urberville used to be quite up in that scene of [Milton]420-milton 's when [I]230-d'urberville was theological . Some of it goes -[230-d'urberville]

" ' [Empress]421-empress , the way is ready , and not long , Beyond a row of myrtles ... ... If [thou]7595-thou accept [My]230-d'urberville conduct , [I]230-d'urberville can bring [thee]7595-thou thither soon . ' ' Lead then , ' said [Eve]303-eve .[230-d'urberville]

" And so on . [[My]230-d'urberville dear]6039-my dear [Tess]198-tess , [I]230-d'urberville am only putting this to [you]198-tess as a thing that [you]198-tess might have supposed or said quite untruly , because [you]198-tess think so badly of [me]230-d'urberville . "[230-d'urberville]

" [I]230-d'urberville never said [you]198-tess were [Satan]411-satan , or thought it . [I]230-d'urberville do n't think of [you]198-tess in that way at all . [My]230-d'urberville thoughts of [you]198-tess are quite cold , except when [you]198-tess affront [me]230-d'urberville . What , did [you]198-tess come digging [here]5975-here entirely because of [me]230-d'urberville ? "[230-d'urberville]

" Entirely . To see [you]198-tess ; nothing more . The smockfrock , which [I]230-d'urberville saw hanging for sale as [I]230-d'urberville came along , was an afterthought , that [I]230-d'urberville might n't be noticed . [I]230-d'urberville come to protest against [your]198-tess working like this . "[230-d'urberville]

" But [I]230-d'urberville like doing it - it is for [[my]230-d'urberville father]6702-my father . "[230-d'urberville]

" [Your]230-d'urberville engagement at [the other place]7599-the other place is ended ? "[230-d'urberville]

" Yes . "[230-d'urberville]

" Where are [you]230-d'urberville going to next ? To join [[your]230-d'urberville dear husband]7481-your dear husband ? "[230-d'urberville]

[She]5053-i could not bear the humiliating reminder .

" O - [I]5053-i do n't know ! "[5053-i] [she]5053-i said bitterly . " [I]5053-i have [no husband]7601-no husband ! "[5053-i]

" It is quite true - in the sense [you]230-d'urberville mean . But [you]198-tess have [a friend]7602-a friend , and [I]230-d'urberville have determined that [you]198-tess shall be comfortable in spite of [yourself]198-tess .
