" O , [Alec]367-alec d'urberville , [I]5053-i wish [you]5054-i would n't give [me]5053-i anything at all ! [I]5053-i can not take it from [you]5054-i ! [I]5053-i do n't like - it is not right ! "[5053-i]

" It IS right ! "[5054-i] [he]5054-i cried lightly . " [I]5054-i am not going to see [a woman whom [I]5054-i feel so tenderly for as [I]5054-i do for [you]5054-i in trouble without trying to help [her]7604-a woman whom i feel so tenderly for as i do for you in trouble without trying to help her]7604-a woman whom i feel so tenderly for as i do for you in trouble without trying to help her . "[5054-i]

" But [I]5053-i am very well off ! [I]5053-i am only in trouble about - about - not about living at all ! "[5053-i]

[She]5055-she turned , and desperately resumed [her]5055-she digging , tears dripping upon the fork - handle and upon the clods .

" About [the children]700-the children - [[your]5054-i brothers]6623-your brothers and [sisters]825-sisters , "[5054-i] [he]5054-i resumed . " [I]5054-i 've been thinking of [them]700-the children . "[5054-i]

[Tess]198-tess 's heart quivered - [he]5054-i was touching [her]198-tess in a weak place . [He]5054-i had divined [her]198-tess chief anxiety . Since returning [home]5850-home [her]198-tess soul had gone out to [those children]5057-those children with an affection that was passionate .

" If [[your]5054-i mother]6051-your mother does not recover , [somebody]6000-somebody ought to do something for [them]700-the children ; since [[your]5054-i father]5918-your father will not be able to do much , [I]5054-i suppose ? "[5054-i]

" [He]5918-your father can with [my]5054-i assistance . [He]5918-your father must ! "[5054-i]

" And with [mine]5054-i . "[5054-i]

" No , [sir]5821-sir ! "[5054-i]

" How damned foolish this is ! "[5054-i] burst out d'Urberville . " Why , [he]5918-your father thinks [we]7612-we are [the same family]7613-the same family ; and will be quite satisfied ! "[5054-i]

" [He]5918-your father do n't . [I]5054-i 've undeceived [him]5918-your father . "[5054-i]

" The more fool [you]5821-sir ! "[5054-i]

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville in anger retreated from [her]5058-her to the hedge , where [he]230-d'urberville pulled off the long smockfrock which had disguised [him]230-d'urberville ; and rolling it up and pushing it into the couch - fire , went away .

[Tess]198-tess could not get on with [her]198-tess digging after this ; [she]198-tess felt restless ; [she]198-tess wondered if [he]230-d'urberville had gone back to [[[her]198-tess father]557-her father 's house]1430-her father 's house ; and taking the fork in [her]198-tess hand proceeded homewards .

Some twenty yards from [the house]652-the house [she]198-tess was met by [one of [[her]198-tess sisters]1880-her sisters]5062-one of her sisters .

" O , [Tessy]256-tessy - what do [you]256-tessy think ! ' [Liza]213-liza - lu - [Lu]213-liza - lu is a - crying , and there 's [a lot of [folk]7615-folk in [the house]652-the house]7614-a lot of folk in the house , and [mother]5917-mother is a good deal better , but [they]7614-a lot of folk in the house think [father]5842-father is dead ! "[5062-one of her sisters]

[The child]1735-the child realized the grandeur of the news ; but not as yet its sadness , and stood looking at [Tess]198-tess with round - eyed importance till , beholding the effect produced upon [her]198-tess , [she]1735-the child said -

" What , [Tess]198-tess , sha n't [we]5065-the durbeyfield couple talk to [father]5842-father never no more ? "[1735-the child]

" But [father]5842-father was only a little bit ill ! "[198-tess] exclaimed [Tess]198-tess distractedly .

' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu came up .

" [He]5842-father dropped down just now , and [the doctor who was there for [mother]5917-mother]7621-the doctor who was there for mother said there was no chance for [him]5842-father , because [his]5842-father heart was growed in . "[213-liza - lu]

Yes ; [the Durbeyfield couple]5065-the durbeyfield couple had changed places ; [the dying one]5066-the dying one was out of danger , and [the indisposed one]5067-the indisposed one was dead . The news meant even more than it sounded . [[Her]198-tess father]557-her father 's life had a value apart from [his]557-her father personal achievements , or perhaps it would not have had much . It was the last of the three lives for whose duration [the house]652-the house and [premises]5070-premises were held under a lease ; and it had long been coveted by [the tenant - farmer]5071-the tenant - farmer for [[his]5071-the tenant - farmer regular labourers]5072-his regular labourers , who were stinted in [cottage accommodation]5073-cottage accommodation . Moreover , [" liviers "]7623-" liviers "[5075-little freeholders] were disapproved of in [villages]912-villages almost as much as [little freeholders]5075-little freeholders , because of [their]5075-little freeholders independence of manner , and when a lease determined it was never renewed .

Thus [the Durbeyfields]218-the durbeyfields , once d'Urbervilles , saw descending upon [them]218-the durbeyfields the destiny which , no doubt , when [they]218-the durbeyfields were among [the Olympians of [the county]5889-the county]5076-the olympians of the county , [they]218-the durbeyfields had caused to descend many a time , and severely enough , upon the heads of such landless ones as [they]218-the durbeyfields themselves were now . So do flux and reflux - the rhythm of change - alternate and persist in everything under the sky .

[LI]422-li

At length it was the eve of Old Lady - Day , and [the agricultural world]1710-the agricultural world was in a fever of mobility such as only occurs at that particular date of the year . It is a day of fulfilment ; agreements for outdoor service during the ensuing year , entered into at Candlemas , are to be now carried out . [The labourers]5052-the labourers - or " [work - folk]6240-work - folk "[5052-the labourers] , as [they]5052-the labourers used to call [themselves]5052-the labourers immemorially till the other word was introduced from without - who wish to remain no longer in old places are removing to [the new farms]5080-the new farms .

These annual migrations from [farm]4181-farm to [farm]4181-farm were on the increase here . When [[Tess]198-tess 's mother]673-tess 's mother was [a child]1122-a child [the majority of [the field - folk about [Marlott]21-marlott]5086-the field - folk about marlott]5085-the majority of the field - folk about marlott had remained all [their]5085-the majority of the field - folk about marlott lives on [one farm]5087-one farm , which had been [the home also of [[their]5085-the majority of the field - folk about marlott fathers and [grandfathers]5090-grandfathers]5089-their fathers and grandfathers]5088-the home also of their fathers and grandfathers ; but latterly the desire for yearly removal had risen to a high pitch . With [the younger families]5091-the younger families it was a pleasant excitement which might possibly be an advantage . The Egypt of [one family]5092-one family was [the Land of Promise]5093-the land of promise to [the family who saw it from a distance]5094-the family who saw it from a distance , till by residence there it became it turn [[their]5094-the family who saw it from a distance Egypt]5095-their egypt also ; and so [they]5094-the family who saw it from a distance changed and changed .

However , all the mutations so increasingly discernible in [village]4232-village life did not originate entirely in the agricultural unrest . A depopulation was also going on . [The village]473-the village had formerly contained , side by side with [the argicultural labourers]5098-the argicultural labourers , an interesting and better - informed class , ranking distinctly above the former - [the class to which [[Tess]198-tess 's father]1861-tess 's father and [mother]5917-mother had belonged]5099-the class to which tess 's father and mother had belonged - and including [the carpenter]5102-the carpenter , [the smith]5103-the smith , [the shoemaker]5104-the shoemaker , [the huckster]5105-the huckster , together with [nondescript workers other than [farm - labourers]5107-farm - labourers]5106-nondescript workers other than farm - labourers ; a set of [people who owed a certain stability of aim and conduct]5108-people who owed a certain stability of aim and conduct to the fact of [their]5108-people who owed a certain stability of aim and conduct being lifeholders like [[Tess]198-tess 's father]1861-tess 's father , or [copyholders]5110-copyholders , or occasionally , [small freeholders]5111-small freeholders . But as the long holdings fell in , [they]5112-they were seldom again let to [similar tenants]5113-similar tenants , and were mostly pulled down , if not absolutely required by [the farmer]1947-the farmer for [his]1947-the farmer hands . [Cottagers who were not directly employed on]5115-cottagers who were not directly employed on [the land]6031-the land were looked upon with disfavour , and the banishment of some starved the trade of [others , who were thus obliged to follow]5117-others , who were thus obliged to follow . [These families , who had formed the backbone of [the village]473-the village life in the past , who were the depositaries of [the village]473-the village traditions]5118-these families , who had formed the backbone of the village life in the past , who were the depositaries of the village traditions , had to seek refuge in [the large centres]5121-the large centres ; the process , humorously designated by [statisticians]5122-statisticians as " the tendency of [the rural population]7625-the rural population towards [the large towns]7626-the large towns "[5122-statisticians] , being really the tendency of water to flow uphill when forced by machinery .

[The cottage accommodation at [Marlott]21-marlott]5123-the cottage accommodation at marlott having been in this manner considerably curtailed by demolitions , [every house which remained standing]5124-every house which remained standing was required by the agriculturist for [[his]1947-the farmer work - people]5125-his work - people . Ever since the occurrence of the event which had cast such a shadow over [Tess]198-tess 's life , [the Durbeyfield family whose descent was not credited]5126-the durbeyfield family whose descent was not credited had been tacitly looked on as one which would have to go when [their]5126-the durbeyfield family whose descent was not credited lease ended , if only in the interests of morality . It was , indeed , quite true that [the household]874-the household had not been shining examples either of temperance , soberness , or chastity . [The father]6346-the father , and even [the mother]708-the mother , had got drunk at times , [the younger children]704-the younger children seldom had gone to [church]813-church , and [the eldest daughter]5132-the eldest daughter had made queer unions . By some means [the village]473-the village had to be kept pure . So on this , the first Lady - Day on which [the Durbeyfields]218-the durbeyfields were expellable , [the house]652-the house , being roomy , was required for [a carter with [a large family]5136-a large family]5135-a carter with a large family ; and [Widow Joan]423-joan , [[her]423-joan daughters]5137-her daughters [Tess]198-tess and ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu , [the boy Abraham]5138-the boy abraham , and [the younger children]704-the younger children had to go elsewhere .

On the evening preceding [their]5126-the durbeyfield family whose descent was not credited removal it was getting dark betimes by reason of a drizzling rain which blurred the sky . As it was the last night [they]5126-the durbeyfield family whose descent was not credited would spend in [the village]473-the village which had been [[their]5126-the durbeyfield family whose descent was not credited home and birthplace]5141-their home and birthplace , [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield , ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu , and [Abraham]212-abraham had gone out to bid [some friends]3457-some friends goodbye , and [Tess]198-tess was keeping [house]5948-house till [they]5126-the durbeyfield family whose descent was not credited should return .

[She]198-tess was kneeling in the window - bench , [her]198-tess face close to the casement , where an outer pane of rain - water was sliding down the inner pane of glass . [Her]198-tess eyes rested on the web of a spider , probably starved long ago , which had been mistakenly placed in a corner where no flies ever came , and shivered in the slight draught through the casement . [Tess]198-tess was reflecting on the position of [the household]874-the household , in which [she]198-tess perceived [her]198-tess own evil influence . Had [she]198-tess not come [home]5850-home , [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother and [the children]700-the children might probably have been allowed to stay on as [weekly tenants]5148-weekly tenants . But [she]198-tess had been observed almost immediately on [her]198-tess return by [some people of scrupulous character and great influence]5149-some people of scrupulous character and great influence : [they]5149-some people of scrupulous character and great influence had seen [her]198-tess idling in [the churchyard]6334-the churchyard , restoring as well as [she]198-tess could with a little trowel [a baby]5151-a baby 's obliterated grave . By this means [they]5149-some people of scrupulous character and great influence had found that [she]198-tess was living [here]5975-here again ; [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother was scolded for " harbouring "[658-her mother] [her]198-tess ; sharp retorts had ensued from [Joan]423-joan , who had independently offered to leave at once ; [she]198-tess had been taken at [her]198-tess word ; and here was the result .

" [I]198-tess ought never to have come [home]5850-home , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess to [herself]198-tess , bitterly .

[She]198-tess was so intent upon these thoughts that [she]198-tess hardly at first took note of [a man in a white mackintosh whom [she]198-tess saw riding down [the street]4511-the street]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street . Possibly it was owing to [her]198-tess face being near to the pane that [he]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street saw [her]198-tess so quickly , and directed [his]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street horse so close to [the cottage]1251-the cottage - front that [his]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street hoofs were almost upon the narrow border for plants growing under the wall . It was not till [he]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street touched the window with [his]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street riding - crop that [she]198-tess observed [him]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street . The rain had nearly ceased , and [she]198-tess opened the casement in obedience to [his]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street gesture .

" Did n't [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street see [me]230-d'urberville ? "[230-d'urberville] asked d'Urberville .

" [I]198-tess was not attending , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said . " [I]198-tess heard [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street , [I]198-tess believe , though [I]198-tess fancied it was [a carriage]5908-a carriage and horses . [I]198-tess was in a sort of dream . "[198-tess]

" Ah ! [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street heard [the d'Urberville Coach]6957-the d'urberville coach , perhaps . [You]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street know the legend , [I]230-d'urberville suppose ? "[230-d'urberville]

" No . [My]198-tess - [somebody]6000-somebody was going to tell it [me]198-tess once , but did n't . "[198-tess]

" If [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street are a genuine d'Urberville [I]230-d'urberville ought not to tell [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street either , [I]230-d'urberville suppose . As for [me]230-d'urberville , [I]230-d'urberville 'm [a sham one]7631-a sham one , so it does n't matter . It is rather dismal . It is that this sound of [a non - existent coach]7632-a non - existent coach can only be heard by [one of d'Urberville blood]7633-one of d'urberville blood , and it is held to be of ill - omen to [the one who hears it]7634-the one who hears it . It has to do with a murder , committed by [one of [the family]719-the family]7635-one of the family , centuries ago . "[230-d'urberville]

" Now [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street have begun it , finish it . "[198-tess]

" Very well . [One of [the family]719-the family]7635-one of the family is said to have abducted [some beautiful woman]7639-some beautiful woman , who tried to escape from [the coach in which [he]7635-one of the family was carrying [her]7639-some beautiful woman off]7640-the coach in which he was carrying her off , and in the struggle [he]7635-one of the family killed [her]7639-some beautiful woman - or [she]7639-some beautiful woman killed [him]7635-one of the family - [I]230-d'urberville forget which . Such is one version of the tale ... [I]230-d'urberville see that [your]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street tubs and buckets are packed . Going away , are n't [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street ? "[230-d'urberville]

" Yes , to - morrow - [Old Lady Day]392-old lady . "[198-tess]

" [I]230-d'urberville heard [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street were , but could hardly believe it ; it seems so sudden . Why is it ? "[230-d'urberville]

" [Father]424-father 's was the last life on [the property]1243-the property , and when that dropped [we]7642-we had no further right to stay . Though [we]7642-we might , perhaps , have stayed as [weekly tenants]5148-weekly tenants - if it had not been for [me]198-tess . "[198-tess]

" What about [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street ? "[230-d'urberville]

" [I]198-tess am not [a - proper woman]7644-a - proper woman . "[198-tess]

[D'Urberville]230-d'urberville 's face flushed .

" What a blasted shame ! [Miserable snobs]7645-miserable snobs ! May [their]7645-miserable snobs dirty souls be burnt to cinders ! "[230-d'urberville] [he]230-d'urberville exclaimed in tones of ironic resentment . " That 's why [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street are going , is it ? Turned out ? "[230-d'urberville]

" [We]7642-we are not turned out exactly ; but as [they]7645-miserable snobs said [we]7642-we should have to go soon , it was best to go now [everybody]569-everybody was moving , because there are better chances . "[230-d'urberville]

" Where are [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street going to ? "[230-d'urberville]

" [Kingsbere]12-kingsbere . [We]7642-we have taken [rooms]7647-rooms [there]5839-there . [Mother]228-mother is so foolish about [[father]5842-father 's people]7650-father 's people that [she]228-mother will go [there]5839-there . "[230-d'urberville]

" But [[[your]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street mother]6051-your mother 's family]7653-your mother 's family are not fit for [lodgings]3231-lodgings , and in [a little hole of [a town]3279-a town like that]7655-a little hole of a town like that . Now why not come to [[my]230-d'urberville garden - house at [Trantridge]38-trantridge]7657-my garden - house at trantridge ? There are hardly any poultry now , since [[my]230-d'urberville mother]6050-my mother 's death ; but there 's [the house]652-the house , as [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street know it , and [the garden]881-the garden . [It]652-the house can be whitewashed in a day , and [[your]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street mother]6051-your mother can live [there]5839-there quite comfortably ; and [I]230-d'urberville will put [the children]700-the children to [a good school]7664-a good school . Really [I]230-d'urberville ought to do something for [you]5154-a man in a white mackintosh whom she saw riding down the street ! "[230-d'urberville]

" But [we]7665-we have already taken [the rooms at [Kingsbere]12-kingsbere]7666-the rooms at kingsbere ! "[5157-she] [she]5157-she declared . " And [we]7665-we can wait there - "[5157-she]

" Wait - what for ? For [that nice husband]7667-that nice husband , no doubt . Now look here , [Tess]198-tess , [I]230-d'urberville know what [men]5841-men are , and , bearing in mind the grounds of [[your]198-tess separation]7669-your separation , [I]230-d'urberville am quite positive [he]7667-that nice husband will never make it up with [you]198-tess . "[230-d'urberville]

[Tess]198-tess breathed more and more quickly , and at length [she]198-tess said -

" How do [I]198-tess know that [you]5158-i would do all this ? [Your]5158-i views may change - and then - [we]7673-we should be - [[my]198-tess mother]6050-my mother would be - homeless again . "[198-tess]

" O no - no . [I]198-tess would guarantee [you]5158-i against such as that in writing , if necessary . Think it over . "[198-tess]

[Tess]198-tess shook [her]198-tess head . But d'Urberville persisted ; [she]198-tess had seldom seen [him]5158-i so determined ; [he]5158-i would not take a negative .

" Please just tell [[your]198-tess mother]6051-your mother , "[5158-i] [he]5158-i said , in emphatic tones . " It is [her]6051-your mother business to judge - not [yours]198-tess . [I]5158-i shall get [the house]652-the house swept out and whitened to - morrow morning , and fires lit ; and it will be dry by the evening , so that [you]198-tess can come straight there . Now mind , [I]5158-i shall expect [you]198-tess . "[5158-i]

[Tess]198-tess again shook [her]198-tess head , [her]198-tess throat swelling with complicated emotion . [She]198-tess could not look up at [d'Urberville]230-d'urberville .

" [I]5158-i owe [you]198-tess something for the past , [you]198-tess know , "[5158-i] [he]5158-i resumed . " And [you]198-tess cured [me]5158-i , too , of that craze ; so [I]5158-i am glad - "[5158-i]

" [I]230-d'urberville would rather [you]5158-i had kept the craze , so that [you]5158-i had kept the practice which went with it ! "[230-d'urberville]

" [I]5158-i am glad of this opportunity of repaying [you]198-tess a little . To - morrow [I]5158-i shall expect to hear [[your]198-tess mother]6051-your mother 's goods unloading ... Give [me]5158-i [your]5158-i hand on it now - dear , beautiful [Tess]198-tess ! "[5158-i]

With the last sentence [he]5158-i had dropped [his]5158-i voice to a murmur , and put [his]5158-i hand in at the half - open casement . With stormy eyes [she]5159-she pulled the stay - bar quickly , and , in doing so , caught [his]5158-i arm between the casement and the stone mullion .

" Damnation - [you]5158-i are very cruel ! "[5158-i] [he]5158-i said , snatching out [his]5158-i arm . " No , no ! - [I]5158-i know [you]198-tess did n't do it on purpose . Well [I]5158-i shall expect [you]198-tess , or [[your]198-tess mother]6051-your mother and [children]660-children at least . "[5158-i]

" [I]5159-she shall not come - [I]5159-she have plenty of money ! "[5159-she] [she]5159-she cried .

" Where ? "[5158-i]

" At [[my]5158-i father]6702-my father - in - law 's , if [I]5158-i ask for it . "[5158-i]

" IF [you]198-tess ask for it . But [you]198-tess wo n't , [Tess]198-tess ; [I]5158-i know [you]198-tess ; [you]198-tess 'll never ask for it - [you]198-tess 'll starve first ! "[5158-i]

With these words [he]5160-he rode off . Just at the corner of [the street]4511-the street [he]5160-he met [the man with the paint - pot]5162-the man with the paint - pot , who asked [him]5160-he if [he]5160-he had deserted [the brethren]7488-the brethren .

" [You]198-tess go to the devil ! "[5158-i] said d'Urberville .

[Tess]198-tess remained where [she]198-tess was a long while , till a sudden rebellious sense of injustice caused the region of [her]198-tess eyes to swell with the rush of hot tears thither . [[Her]198-tess husband]791-her husband , [Angel Clare]200-clare [himself]791-her husband , had , like [others]1383-others , dealt out hard measure to [her]198-tess ; surely [he]791-her husband had ! [She]198-tess had never before admitted such a thought ; but [he]791-her husband had surely ! Never in [her]198-tess life - [she]198-tess could swear it from the bottom of [her]198-tess soul - had [she]198-tess ever intended to do wrong ; yet these hard judgements had come . Whatever [her]198-tess sins , they were not sins of intention , but of inadvertence , and why should [she]198-tess have been punished so persistently ?

[She]198-tess passionately seized the first piece of paper that came to hand , and scribbled the following lines :

O why have [you]791-her husband treated [me]0-i so monstrously , [Angel]200-clare ! [I]0-i do not deserve it . [I]0-i have thought it all over carefully , and [I]0-i can never , never forgive [you]791-her husband ! [You]791-her husband know that [I]0-i did not intend to wrong [you]791-her husband - why have [you]791-her husband so wronged [me]0-i ? [You]791-her husband are cruel , cruel indeed ! [I]0-i will try to forget [you]791-her husband . It is all injustice [I]0-i have received at [your]791-her husband hands ! T.

[She]198-tess watched till [the postman]5166-the postman passed by , ran out to [him]5166-the postman with [her]198-tess epistle , and then again took [her]198-tess listless place inside the window - panes .

It was just as well to write like that as to write tenderly . How could [he]5166-the postman give way to entreaty ? The facts had not changed : there was no new event to alter [his]5166-the postman opinion .

It grew darker , the fire - light shining over [the room]778-the room . [The two biggest of [the younger children]704-the younger children]5168-the two biggest of the younger children had gone out with [[their]5168-the two biggest of the younger children mother]1138-their mother ; the four smallest , [their]704-the younger children ages ranging from three - and - a - half years to eleven , all in black frocks , were gathered round the hearth babbling [[their]704-the younger children own little subjects]5171-their own little subjects . [Tess]198-tess at length joined [them]704-the younger children , without lighting a candle .

" This is the last night that [we]704-the younger children shall sleep here , [dears]6199-dears , in [the house where [we]704-the younger children were born]7686-the house where we were born , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said quickly . " [We]704-the younger children ought to think of it , ought n't [we]704-the younger children ? "[198-tess]

[They]704-the younger children all became silent ; with the impressibility of [their]704-the younger children age [they]704-the younger children were ready to burst into tears at the picture of finality [she]198-tess had conjured up , though all the day hitherto [they]704-the younger children had been rejoicing in the idea of a new place . [Tess]198-tess changed the subject .

" Sing to [me]198-tess , [dears]6199-dears , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said .

" What shall [we]5173-we sing ? "[198-tess]

" Anything [you]6199-dears know ; [I]198-tess do n't mind . "[198-tess]

There was a momentary pause ; it was broken , first , in one little tentative note ; then a second voice strengthened it , and a third and a fourth chimed in unison , with words [they]704-the younger children had learnt at [the Sunday - school]5172-the sunday - school -

Here [we]5173-we suffer grief and pain , Here [we]5173-we meet to part again ; In [Heaven]282-heaven [we]5173-we part no more .

[The four]2540-the four sang on with the phlegmatic passivity of [persons who had long ago settled the question , and there being no mistake about it]5175-persons who had long ago settled the question , and there being no mistake about it , felt that further thought was not required . With features strained hard to enunciate the syllables [they]2540-the four continued to regard the centre of the flickering fire , the notes of [the youngest]609-the youngest straying over into the pauses of the rest .

[Tess]198-tess turned from [them]2540-the four , and went to the window again . Darkness had now fallen without , but [she]198-tess put [her]198-tess face to the pane as though to peer into the gloom . It was really to hide [her]198-tess tears . If [she]198-tess could only believe what [the children]700-the children were singing ; if [she]198-tess were only sure , how different all would now be ; how confidently [she]198-tess would leave [them]700-the children to [Providence]266-providence and [[their]700-the children future kingdom]5178-their future kingdom ! But , in default of that , it behoved [her]198-tess to do something ; to be [[their]700-the children Providence]5179-their providence ; for to [Tess]198-tess , as to [not a few millions of others]5180-not a few millions of others , there was ghastly satire in [the poet]5181-the poet 's lines -

Not in utter nakedness But trailing clouds of glory do [we]5182-we come .

To [her]198-tess and [her]198-tess like , birth itself was an ordeal of degrading personal compulsion , whose gratuitousness nothing in the result seemed to justify , and at best could only palliate .

In the shades of [the wet road]5183-the wet road [she]198-tess soon discerned [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother with tall ' Liza - Lu and [Abraham]212-abraham . [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield 's pattens clicked up to the door , and [Tess]198-tess opened it .

" [I]423-joan see the tracks of a horse outside the window , "[423-joan] said [Joan]423-joan . " [Hev]7688-hev [somebody]6000-somebody called ? "[423-joan]

" No , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess .

[The children by the fire]5185-the children by the fire looked gravely at [her]198-tess , and [one]6172-one murmured -

" Why , [Tess]198-tess , [the gentleman a - horseback]7690-the gentleman a - horseback ! "[6172-one]

" [He]7690-the gentleman a - horseback did n't call , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess . " [He]7690-the gentleman a - horseback spoke to [me]198-tess in passing . "[198-tess]

" Who was [the gentleman]1007-the gentleman ? "[708-the mother] asked [the mother]708-the mother . " [[Your]708-the mother husband]6856-your husband ? "[708-the mother]

" Then who was it ? "[6172-one]

" [I]708-the mother will tell [you]708-the mother when [we]7693-we are settled in [[our]7693-we lodging at [Kingsbere]12-kingsbere]7694-our lodging at kingsbere to - morrow - every word . "[708-the mother]

It was not [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband , [she]198-tess had said . Yet a consciousness that in a physical sense [this man]1582-this man alone was [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband seemed to weigh on [her]198-tess more and more .

[LII]425-lii

During the small hours of the next morning , while it was still dark , [dwellers near [the highways]5192-the highways]5191-dwellers near the highways were conscious of a disturbance of [their]5191-dwellers near the highways night 's rest by rumbling noises , intermittently continuing till daylight - noises as certain to recur in this particular first week of the month as the voice of the cuckoo in the third week of the same . [They]5193-they were the preliminaries of the general removal , the passing of the empty waggons and [teams]5194-teams to fetch the goods of [the migrating families]5195-the migrating families ; for it was always by the vehicle of [the farmer who required [his]1582-this man services that [the hired man]5197-the hired man was conveyed to [his]1582-this man destination]5196-the farmer who required his services that the hired man was conveyed to his destination . That this might be accomplished within the day was the explanation of the reverberation occurring so soon after midnight , the aim of [the carters]5198-the carters being to reach the door of [the outgoing households]5199-the outgoing households by six o'clock , when the loading of [their]5198-the carters movables at once began .

But to [Tess]198-tess and [[[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's household]5201-her mother 's household [no such anxious farmer]5202-no such anxious farmer sent [[his]1582-this man team]5203-his team . [They]5193-they were [only women]5204-only women ; [they]5193-they were not [regular labourers]5205-regular labourers ; [they]5193-they were not particularly required anywhere ; hence [they]5193-they had to hire a waggon at [their]5193-they own expense , and got nothing sent gratuitously .

It was a relief to [Tess]198-tess , when [she]198-tess looked out of the window that morning , to find that though the weather was windy and louring , it did not rain , and that [the waggon]5206-the waggon had come . [A wet Lady - Day]5207-a wet lady - day was a spectre which [removing families]5208-removing families never forgot ; damp furniture , damp bedding , damp clothing accompanied it , and left a train of ills .

[[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother , ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu , and [Abraham]212-abraham were also awake , but [the younger children]704-the younger children were let sleep on . [The four]2540-the four breakfasted by the thin light , and the " house - ridding "[658-her mother] was taken in hand .

It proceeded with some cheerfulness , [a friendly neighbour]5212-a friendly neighbour or two assisting . When the large articles of furniture had been packed in position , a circular nest was made of the beds and bedding , in which [Joan Durbeyfield]205-joan and [the young children]1590-the young children were to sit through the journey . After loading there was a long delay before the horses were brought , these having been unharnessed during the ridding ; but at length , about two o'clock , the whole was under way , the cooking - pot swinging from the axle of [the waggon]5206-the waggon , [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield and [family]5943-family at the top , [the matron]668-the matron having in [her]668-the matron lap , to prevent injury to [its]5206-the waggon works , the head of the clock , which , at any exceptional lurch of the waggon , struck one , or one - and - a - half , in hurt tones . [Tess]198-tess and [the next eldest girl]5217-the next eldest girl walked alongside till [they]2540-the four were out of [the village]473-the village .

[They]2540-the four had called on [a few neighbours]5219-a few neighbours that morning and the previous evening , and [some]527-some came to see [them]2540-the four off , all wishing [them]2540-the four well , though , in [their]2540-the four secret hearts , hardly expecting welfare possible to [such a family]6873-such a family , harmless as [the Durbeyfields]218-the durbeyfields were to all except [themselves]2540-the four . Soon the equipage began to ascend to higher ground , and the wind grew keener with the change of level and soil .

The day being the sixth of April , [the Durbeyfield waggon]180-mrs durbeyfield met many other waggons with [families]814-families on [the summit of the load]5223-the summit of the load , which was built on a wellnigh unvarying principle , as peculiar , probably , to [the rural labourer]5224-the rural labourer as the hexagon to the bee . The groundwork of the arrangement was the family dresser , which , with its shining handles , and finger - marks , and domestic evidences thick upon it , stood importantly in front , over the tails of the shaft - horses , in its erect and natural position , like some Ark of the Covenant that [they]2540-the four were bound to carry reverently .

[Some of [the households]5226-the households]5225-some of the households were lively , some mournful ; [some]527-some were stopping at the doors of [wayside inns]5228-wayside inns ; where , in due time , [the Durbeyfield menagerie]5229-the durbeyfield menagerie also drew up to bait horses and refresh [the travellers]5230-the travellers .

During the halt [Tess]198-tess 's eyes fell upon a three - pint blue mug , which was ascending and descending through the air to and from the feminine section of [a household]5231-a household , sitting on the summit of a load that had also drawn up at a little distance from [the same inn]5232-the same inn . [She]198-tess followed one of the mug 's journeys upward , and perceived it to be clasped by [hands whose owner [she]198-tess well knew]5233-hands whose owner she well knew . [Tess]198-tess went towards the waggon .

" [Marian]310-marian and [Izz]312-izz ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess cried to [the girls]576-the girls , for it was [they]576-the girls , sitting with [the moving family at whose house [they]576-the girls had lodged]5235-the moving family at whose house they had lodged . " Are [you]576-the girls [house]5948-house - ridding to - day , like [everybody else]7696-everybody else ? "[198-tess]

[They]576-the girls were , [they]576-the girls said . It had been too rough a life for [them]576-the girls at [Flintcomb]141-flintcomb - Ash , and [they]576-the girls had come away , almost without notice , leaving [Groby]406-farmer groby to prosecute [them]576-the girls if [he]406-farmer groby chose . [They]576-the girls told [Tess]198-tess [their]576-the girls destination , and [Tess]198-tess told [them]576-the girls [hers]198-tess .

[Marian]310-marian leant over the load , and lowered [her]310-marian voice . " Do [you]576-the girls know that the gentleman who follows ' [ee]7697-ee - [you]576-the girls 'll guess who [I]310-marian mean - came to ask for ' ee at [Flintcomb]141-flintcomb after [you]576-the girls had gone ? [We]576-the girls did n't tell'n where [you]576-the girls was , knowing [you]576-the girls would n't wish to see [him]406-farmer groby . "[310-marian]

" Ah - but [I]198-tess did see [him]406-farmer groby ! "[198-tess] [Tess]198-tess murmured . " [He]406-farmer groby found [me]198-tess . "[198-tess]

" And do [he]406-farmer groby know where [you]198-tess be going ? "[310-marian]

" [I]198-tess think so . "[198-tess]

" [Husband]3776-husband come back ? "[310-marian]

" No . "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess bade [her]198-tess acquaintance goodbye - for [the respective carters]5236-the respective carters had now come out from [the inn]697-the inn - and [the two waggons]5238-the two waggons resumed [their]5238-the two waggons journey in opposite directions ; [the vehicle]836-the vehicle whereon sat [Marian]310-marian , [Izz]312-izz , and [[the ploughman]5240-the ploughman 's family with whom [they]5238-the two waggons had thrown in [[their]5238-the two waggons lot]5242-their lot , being brightly painted , and drawn by three powerful horses with shining brass ornaments on [their]5238-the two waggons harness]5241-the ploughman 's family with whom they had thrown in their lot , being brightly painted , and drawn by three powerful horses with shining brass ornaments on their harness ; while the waggon on which [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield and [[her]180-mrs durbeyfield family]1011-her family rode was a creaking erection that would scarcely bear the weight of the superincumbent load ; one which had known no paint since it was made , and drawn by two horses only . The contrast well marked the difference between being fetched by [a thriving farmer]5244-a thriving farmer and conveying [oneself]5245-oneself whither [no hirer]5246-no hirer waited [one]6172-one 's coming .

The distance was great - too great for a day 's journey - and it was with the utmost difficulty that the horses performed it . Though [they]5238-the two waggons had started so early , it was quite late in the afternoon when [they]5238-the two waggons turned the flank of [an eminence which formed part of [the upland]2899-the upland called [Greenhill]13-greenhill]5248-an eminence which formed part of the upland called greenhill . While the horses stood to stale and breathe [themselves]5238-the two waggons [Tess]198-tess looked around . Under [the hill]642-the hill , and just ahead of [them]5238-the two waggons , was [the half - dead townlet of [their]5238-the two waggons pilgrimage]5251-the half - dead townlet of their pilgrimage , [Kingsbere]12-kingsbere , where lay [those ancestors of whom [[her]198-tess father]557-her father had spoken and sung to painfulness]5252-those ancestors of whom her father had spoken and sung to painfulness : [Kingsbere]12-kingsbere , [the spot of all spots in [the world]497-the world which could be considered [the d'Urbervilles ' home]5256-the d'urbervilles ' home , since [they]5238-the two waggons had resided [there]5839-there for full five hundred years]5254-the spot of all spots in the world which could be considered the d'urbervilles ' home , since they had resided there for full five hundred years .

[A man]1337-a man could be seen advancing from the outskirts towards [them]5238-the two waggons , and when [he]1337-a man beheld the nature of [their]5238-the two waggons waggon - load [he]1337-a man quickened [his]1337-a man steps .

" [You]198-tess be [the woman [they]5238-the two waggons call [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield]7699-the woman they call mrs durbeyfield , [I]1337-a man reckon ? "[1337-a man] [he]1337-a man said to [[Tess]198-tess 's mother]673-tess 's mother , who had descended to walk the remainder of the way .

[She]673-tess 's mother nodded . " Though widow of [the late Sir John d'Urberville]177-sir john , [poor nobleman]7700-poor nobleman , if [I]673-tess 's mother cared for [my]673-tess 's mother rights ; and returning to the domain of [[his]177-sir john forefathers]7701-his forefathers . "[673-tess 's mother]

" Oh ? Well , [I]1516-the man know nothing about that ; but if [you]198-tess be [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield , [I]1516-the man am sent to tell [']673-tess 's mother [ee]673-tess 's mother that [the rooms]4013-the rooms [you]198-tess wanted be let . [We]7703-we did n't know that [you]198-tess was coming till [we]7703-we got [your]198-tess letter this morning - when ' twas too late . But no doubt [you]198-tess can get other lodgings somewhere . "[1516-the man]

[The man]1516-the man had noticed the face of [Tess]198-tess , which had become ash - pale at [his]1516-the man intelligence . [[Her]198-tess mother]658-her mother looked hopelessly at fault . " What shall [we]5262-we do now , [Tess]198-tess ? "[658-her mother] [she]658-her mother said bitterly . " Here 's a welcome to [[[your]198-tess ancestors]7704-your ancestors ' lands]7705-your ancestors ' lands ! However , let 's try further . "[658-her mother]

[They]5262-we moved on into [the town]1346-the town , and tried with all [their]5262-we might , [Tess]198-tess remaining with the waggon to take care of [the children]700-the children whilst [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother and ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu made inquiries . At the last return of [Joan]205-joan to [the vehicle]836-the vehicle , an hour later , when [her]205-joan search for accommodation had still been fruitless , [the driver of the waggon]5267-the driver of the waggon said the goods must be unloaded , as the horses were half - dead , and [he]5267-the driver of the waggon was bound to return part of the way at least that night .

" Very well - unload it here , "[205-joan] said [Joan]205-joan recklessly . " [I]205-joan 'll get shelter somewhere . "[205-joan]

[The waggon]5206-the waggon had drawn up under [the churchyard wall]5269-the churchyard wall , in a spot screened from view , and [the driver]1166-the driver , nothing loth , soon hauled down the poor heap of household goods . This done , [she]205-joan paid [him]1166-the driver , reducing [herself]205-joan to almost [her]205-joan last shilling thereby , and [he]1166-the driver moved off and left [them]5271-we , only too glad to get out of further dealings with [such a family]6873-such a family . It was a dry night , and [he]1166-the driver guessed that [they]5271-we would come to no harm .

[Tess]198-tess gazed desperately at the pile of furniture . The cold sunlight of this spring evening peered invidiously upon the crocks and kettles , upon the bunches of dried herbs shivering in the breeze , upon the brass handles of the dresser , upon the wicker - cradle [they]5271-we had all been rocked in , and upon the well - rubbed clock - case , all of which gave out the reproachful gleam of indoor articles abandoned to the vicissitudes of a roofless exposure for which they were never made . Round about were [deparked hills]5273-deparked hills and slopes - now cut up into little paddocks - and the green foundations that showed where [the d'Urberville mansion]944-the d'urberville mansion once had stood ; also [an outlying stretch of [Egdon Heath]93-egdon heath that had always belonged to [the estate]973-the estate]5275-an outlying stretch of egdon heath that had always belonged to the estate . Hard by , [the aisle of [the church called the d'Urberville Aisle]5278-the church called the d'urberville aisle]5277-the aisle of the church called the d'urberville aisle looked on imperturbably .

" Is n't [[your]198-tess family]5835-your family vault [your]198-tess own freehold ? "[673-tess 's mother] said [[Tess]198-tess 's mother]673-tess 's mother , as [she]673-tess 's mother returned from a reconnoitre of [the church]6443-the church and graveyard . " Why , of course ' tis , and that 's where [we]5271-we will camp , [girls]1696-girls , till [the place of [[your]198-tess ancestors]7704-your ancestors]7708-the place of your ancestors finds [us]5271-we a roof ! Now , [Tess]198-tess and ' [Liza]213-liza - lu and [Abraham]212-abraham , [you]198-tess help [me]673-tess 's mother . [We]5271-we 'll make a nest for [these children]7710-these children , and then [we]5271-we 'll have another look round . "[673-tess 's mother]

[Tess]198-tess listlessly lent a hand , and in a quarter of an hour [the old four - post bedstead]5281-the old four - post bedstead was dissociated from the heap of goods , and erected under the south wall of [the church]6443-the church , the part of [the building known as [the d'Urberville Aisle]5284-the d'urberville aisle , beneath which the huge vaults lay]5283-the building known as the d'urberville aisle , beneath which the huge vaults lay . Over the tester of the bedstead was a beautiful traceried window , of many lights , its date being the fifteenth century . It was called [the d'Urberville Window]5285-the d'urberville window , and in the upper part could be discerned heraldic emblems like those on [Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield 's old seal and spoon .

[Joan]205-joan drew the curtains round the bed so as to make an excellent tent of it , and put [the smaller children]5286-the smaller children inside . " If it comes to the worst [we]5271-we can sleep [there]5839-there too , for one night , "[205-joan] [she]205-joan said . " But let [us]5271-we try further on , and get something for [the dears]7712-the dears to eat ! O , [Tess]198-tess , what 's the use of [your]198-tess playing at marrying [gentlemen]7713-gentlemen , if it leaves [us]5271-we like this ! "[205-joan]

Accompanied by ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu and [the boy]472-the boy , [she]198-tess again ascended [the little lane which secluded [the church]6443-the church from [the townlet]1362-the townlet]5288-the little lane which secluded the church from the townlet . As soon as [they]5291-they got into [the street]4511-the street [they]5291-they beheld [a man on horseback]5293-a man on horseback gazing up and down . " Ah - [I]5293-a man on horseback 'm looking for [you]5291-they ! "[5293-a man on horseback] [he]5293-a man on horseback said , riding up to [them]5291-they . " This is indeed a family gathering on the historic spot ! "[5293-a man on horseback]

It was [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville . " Where is [Tess]198-tess ? "[5293-a man on horseback] [he]5293-a man on horseback asked .

[Personally Joan]426-personally joan had no liking for [Alec]367-alec d'urberville . [She]198-tess cursorily signified the direction of [the church]6443-the church , and went on , d'Urberville saying that [he]5293-a man on horseback would see [them]5291-they again , in case [they]5291-they should be still unsuccessful in [their]5291-they search for shelter , of which [he]5293-a man on horseback had just heard . When [they]5291-they had gone , d'Urberville rode to [the inn]697-the inn , and shortly after came out on foot .

In the interim [Tess]198-tess , left with [the children inside the bedstead]5296-the children inside the bedstead , remained talking with [them]5296-the children inside the bedstead awhile , till , seeing that no more could be done to make [them]5296-the children inside the bedstead comfortable just then , [she]198-tess walked about [the churchyard]6334-the churchyard , now beginning to be embrowned by the shades of nightfall . The door of [the church]6443-the church was unfastened , and [she]198-tess entered [it]6443-the church for the first time in [her]198-tess life .

Within the window under which the bedstead stood were the tombs of [the family]719-the family , covering in [their]719-the family dates several centuries . [They]719-the family were canopied , altar - shaped , and plain ; [their]719-the family carvings being defaced and broken ; [their]719-the family brasses torn from the matrices , the rivet - holes remaining like martin - holes in a sandcliff . Of all the reminders that [she]198-tess had ever received that [[her]198-tess people]5300-her people were socially extinct , there was none so forcible as this spoliation .

[She]198-tess drew near to a dark stone on which was inscribed :

OSTIUM SEPULCHRI ANTIQUAE FAMILIAE D'URBERVILLE

[Tess]198-tess did not read Church - Latin like a Cardinal , but [she]198-tess knew that this was the door of [[her]198-tess ancestral sepulchre]5301-her ancestral sepulchre , and that [the tall knights of whom [[her]198-tess father]557-her father had chanted in [his]557-her father cups]5302-the tall knights of whom her father had chanted in his cups lay inside .

[She]198-tess musingly turned to withdraw , passing near an altar - tomb , the oldest of [them]719-the family all , on which was a recumbent figure . In the dusk [she]198-tess had not noticed it before , and would hardly have noticed it now but for an odd fancy that the effigy moved . As soon as [she]198-tess drew close to it [she]198-tess discovered all in a moment that [the figure]5304-the figure was [a living person]5305-a living person ; and the shock to [her]198-tess sense of not having been alone was so violent that [she]198-tess was quite overcome , and sank down nigh to fainting , not , however , till [she]198-tess had recognized [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville in the form .

[He]557-her father leapt off the slab and supported [her]198-tess .

" [I]557-her father saw [you]198-tess come in , "[557-her father] [he]557-her father said smiling , " and got up there not to interrupt [your]198-tess meditations . A family gathering , is it not , with [these old fellows under [us]7715-us here]7714-these old fellows under us here ? Listen . "[557-her father]

[He]557-her father stamped with [his]557-her father heel heavily on the floor ; whereupon there arose a hollow echo from below .

" That shook [them]7714-these old fellows under us here a bit , [I]557-her father 'll warrant ! "[557-her father] [he]557-her father continued . " And [you]198-tess thought [I]557-her father was the mere stone reproduction of one of [them]7714-these old fellows under us here . But no . [The old order]7716-the old order changeth . The little finger of the sham d'Urberville can do more for [you]198-tess than [the whole dynasty of the real underneath]7717-the whole dynasty of the real underneath ... Now command [me]557-her father . What shall [I]557-her father do ? "[557-her father]

" Go away ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess murmured .

" [I]557-her father will - [I]557-her father 'll look for [[your]198-tess mother]6051-your mother , "[557-her father] said [he]557-her father blandly . But in passing [her]198-tess [he]557-her father whispered : " Mind this ; [you]198-tess 'll be civil yet ! "[557-her father]

When [he]557-her father was gone [she]198-tess bent down upon the entrance to [the vaults]5306-the vaults , and said -

" Why am [I]198-tess on the wrong side of this door ! "[198-tess]

In the meantime [Marian]310-marian and [Izz Huett]312-izz had journeyed onward with the chattels of [the ploughman]5240-the ploughman in the direction of [[their]5308-their land of [Canaan]156-canaan]5309-their land of canaan - [the Egypt of [some other family who had left it only that morning]5311-some other family who had left it only that morning]5310-the egypt of some other family who had left it only that morning . But [the girls]576-the girls did not for a long time think of where [they]5308-their were going . [Their]5308-their talk was of [Angel Clare]200-clare and [Tess]198-tess , and [[Tess]198-tess 's persistent lover]5313-tess 's persistent lover , whose connection with [her]198-tess previous history [they]5308-their had partly heard and partly guessed ere this .

" ' Tisn't as though [she]198-tess had never known [him]5240-the ploughman afore , "[310-marian] said [Marian]310-marian . " [His]5240-the ploughman having won [her]198-tess once makes all the difference in [the world]497-the world . ' Twould be a thousand pities if [he]5240-the ploughman were to tole [her]198-tess away again . [Mr Clare]284-clare can never be anything to [us]5308-their , [Izz]310-marian ; and why should [we]5308-their grudge [him]284-clare to [her]198-tess , and not try to mend this quarrel ? If [he]284-clare could on'y know what straits [she]198-tess 's put to , and what 's hovering round , [he]284-clare might come to take care of [his]284-clare own . "[310-marian]

" Could [we]5308-their let [him]284-clare know ? "[310-marian]

[They]5314-they thought of this all the way to [their]5314-they destination ; but the bustle of re - establishment in [[their]5314-they new place]5315-their new place took up all [their]5314-they attention then . But when [they]5314-they were settled , a month later , [they]5314-they heard of [Clare]284-clare 's approaching return , though [they]5314-they had learnt nothing more of [Tess]198-tess . Upon that , agitated anew by [their]5314-they attachment to [him]284-clare , yet honourably disposed to [her]198-tess , [Marian]310-marian uncorked the penny ink - bottle [they]5314-they shared , and a few lines were concocted between [the two girls]1271-the two girls .

HONOUR'D SIR -

Look to [[your]5317-you Wife]6687-your wife if [you]5317-you do love [her]6687-your wife as much as [she]6687-your wife do love [you]5317-you . For [she]6687-your wife is sore put to by [an Enemy]1746-an enemy in the shape of [a Friend]7602-a friend . [Sir]5821-sir , there is one near [her]6687-your wife who ought to be Away . [A woman]1028-a woman should not be try'd beyond [her]1028-a woman Strength , and continual dropping will wear away a Stone - ay , more - a Diamond .

FROM TWO WELL - WISHERS

This was addressed to [Angel Clare]284-clare at [the only place [they]5314-they had ever heard [him]284-clare to be connected with]5323-the only place they had ever heard him to be connected with , [Emminster Vicarage]100-emminster vicarage ; after which [they]5314-they continued in a mood of emotional exaltation at [their]5314-they own generosity , which made [them]5314-they sing in hysterical snatches and weep at the same time .

[END OF PHASE THE SIXTH

Phase the Seventh]157-end of phase the sixth phase the seventh : Fulfilment

LIII

It was evening at [Emminster Vicarage]100-emminster vicarage . The two customary candles were burning under [their]5314-they green shades in [[the Vicar]1858-the vicar 's study]5325-the vicar 's study , but [he]284-clare had not been sitting there . Occasionally [he]284-clare came in , stirred the small fire which sufficed for the increasing mildness of the spring , and went out again ; sometimes pausing at the front door , going on to [the drawing - room]3931-the drawing - room , then returning again to the front door .

[It]5327-it faced westward , and though gloom prevailed inside , there was still light enough without to see with distinctness . [Mrs Clare]200-clare , who had been sitting in [the drawing - room]3931-the drawing - room , followed [him]284-clare hither .

" Plenty of time yet , "[1858-the vicar] said [the Vicar]1858-the vicar . " [He]284-clare does n't reach [Chalk - Newton]119-chalk - newton till six , even if [the train]531-the train should be punctual , and [ten miles of [country - road]7722-country - road]7721-ten miles of country - road , five of [them]7721-ten miles of country - road in [Crimmercrock Lane]159-crimmercrock lane , are not jogged over in a hurry by [our]5330-they old horse . "[1858-the vicar]

" But [he]284-clare has done it in an hour with [us]5330-they , [[my]1858-the vicar dear]6039-my dear . "[1858-the vicar]

" Years ago . "[1858-the vicar]

Thus [they]5330-they passed the minutes , each well knowing that this was only waste of breath , the one essential being simply to wait .

At length there was a slight noise in [the lane]631-the lane , and the old pony - chaise appeared indeed outside the railings . [They]5330-they saw alight therefrom a form which [they]5330-they affected to recognize , but would actually have passed by in [the street]4511-the street without identifying had [he]284-clare not got out of [[their]5330-they carriage]5333-their carriage at the particular moment when [a particular person]5334-a particular person was due .

[Mrs Clare]200-clare rushed through [the dark passage]5335-the dark passage to the door , and [[her]200-clare husband]791-her husband came more slowly after [her]200-clare .

[The new arrival , who was just about to enter]5337-the new arrival , who was just about to enter , saw [their]5330-they anxious faces in the doorway and the gleam of the west in [their]5330-they spectacles because [they]5330-they confronted the last rays of day ; but [they]5330-they could only see [his]284-clare shape against the light .

" O , [[my]200-clare boy]6440-my boy , [[my]200-clare boy]6440-my boy - [home]5850-home again at last ! "[200-clare] cried [Mrs Clare]200-clare , who cared no more at that moment for the stains of heterodoxy which had caused all this separation than for the dust upon [his]284-clare clothes . [What woman]5338-what woman , indeed , among [the most faithful adherents of the truth]5339-the most faithful adherents of the truth , believes the promises and threats of the Word in the sense in which [she]5338-what woman believes in [[her]5338-what woman own children]5340-her own children , or would not throw [her]5338-what woman theology to the wind if weighed against [their]5340-her own children happiness ? As soon as [they]5330-they reached [the room where the candles were lighted]5341-the room where the candles were lighted [she]200-clare looked at [his]284-clare face .

" O , it is not [Angel]200-clare - not [[my]200-clare son]7207-my son - [the Angel who went away]7728-the angel who went away ! "[200-clare] [she]200-clare cried in all the irony of sorrow , as [she]200-clare turned [herself]200-clare aside .

[[His]284-clare father]457-his father , too , was shocked to see [him]284-clare , so reduced was that figure from its former contours by worry and the bad season that [Clare]200-clare had experienced , in the climate to which [he]284-clare had so rashly hurried in [his]284-clare first aversion to the mockery of events at [home]5850-home . [You]5344-you could see the skeleton behind [the man]1516-the man , and almost [the ghost behind the skeleton]5346-the ghost behind the skeleton . [He]284-clare matched [Crivelli]427-crivelli 's dead [Christus]428-christus . [His]284-clare sunken eye - pits were of morbid hue , and the light in [his]284-clare eyes had waned . The angular hollows and lines of [[his]284-clare aged ancestors]5347-his aged ancestors had succeeded to [their]5347-his aged ancestors reign in [his]284-clare face twenty years before [their]5347-his aged ancestors time .

" [I]284-clare was ill over there , [you]7729-you know , "[284-clare] [he]284-clare said . " [I]284-clare am all right now . "[284-clare]

As if , however , to falsify this assertion , [his]284-clare legs seemed to give way , and [he]284-clare suddenly sat down to save [himself]284-clare from falling . It was only a slight attack of faintness , resulting from the tedious day 's journey , and the excitement of arrival .

" Has any letter come for [me]284-clare lately ? "[284-clare] [he]284-clare asked . " [I]284-clare received the last [you]7729-you sent on by the merest chance , and after considerable delay through being inland ; or [I]284-clare might have come sooner . "[284-clare]

" It was from [[your]284-clare wife]6687-your wife , [we]5349-we supposed ? "[5349-we]

" It was . "[284-clare]

[Only one other]5348-only one other had recently come . [They]5349-we had not sent it on to [him]284-clare , knowing [he]284-clare would start for [home]5850-home so soon .

[He]284-clare hastily opened the letter produced , and was much disturbed to read in [Tess]198-tess 's handwriting the sentiments expressed in [her]198-tess last hurried scrawl to [him]284-clare .

O why have [you]284-clare treated [me]0-i so monstrously , [Angel]200-clare ! [I]0-i do not deserve it . [I]0-i have thought it all over carefully , and [I]0-i can never , never forgive [you]284-clare ! [You]284-clare know that [I]0-i did not intend to wrong [you]284-clare - why have [you]284-clare so wronged [me]0-i ? [You]284-clare are cruel , cruel indeed ! [I]0-i will try to forget [you]284-clare . It is all injustice [I]0-i have received at [your]284-clare hands ! T.

" It is quite true ! "[200-clare] said [Angel]200-clare , throwing down the letter . " Perhaps [she]6090-his mother will never be reconciled to [me]200-clare ! "[200-clare]

" Do n't , [Angel]200-clare , be so anxious about [a mere child of the soil]7731-a mere child of the soil ! "[6090-his mother] said [[his]284-clare mother]6090-his mother .

" [Child of the soil]7732-child of the soil ! Well , [we]7733-we all are [children of the soil]7734-children of the soil . [I]6090-his mother wish [she]6090-his mother were so in the sense [you]284-clare mean ; but let [me]6090-his mother now explain to [you]284-clare what [I]6090-his mother have never explained before , that [[her]6090-his mother father]557-her father is [a descendant in [the male line of one of [the oldest Norman houses]7738-the oldest norman houses]7737-the male line of one of the oldest norman houses , like a good many others who lead obscure agricultural lives in [[our]7739-our villages]7740-our villages]7736-a descendant in the male line of one of the oldest norman houses , like a good many others who lead obscure agricultural lives in our villages , and are dubbed ' [sons of the soil]7741-sons of the soil . ' "[6090-his mother]

[He]284-clare soon retired to bed ; and the next morning , feeling exceedingly unwell , [he]284-clare remained in [[his]284-clare room]2202-his room pondering . The circumstances amid which [he]284-clare had left [Tess]198-tess were such that though , while on [the south of [the Equator]160-the equator]5353-the south of the equator and just in receipt of [her]198-tess loving epistle , it had seemed the easiest thing in [the world]497-the world to rush back into [her]198-tess arms the moment [he]284-clare chose to forgive [her]198-tess , now that [he]284-clare had arrived it was not so easy as it had seemed . [She]198-tess was passionate , and [her]198-tess present letter , showing that [her]198-tess estimate of [him]284-clare had changed under [his]284-clare delay - too justly changed , [he]284-clare sadly owned , - made [him]284-clare ask [himself]284-clare if it would be wise to confront [her]198-tess unannounced in the presence of [[her]198-tess parents]873-her parents . Supposing that [her]198-tess love had indeed turned to dislike during the last weeks of separation , a sudden meeting might lead to bitter words .

[Clare]200-clare therefore thought it would be best to prepare [Tess]198-tess and [[her]198-tess family]1011-her family by sending a line to [Marlott]21-marlott announcing [his]284-clare return , and [his]284-clare hope that [she]198-tess was still living with [them]1011-her family [there]5839-there , as [he]284-clare had arranged for [her]198-tess to do when [he]284-clare left [England]10-england . [He]284-clare despatched the inquiry that very day , and before the week was out there came a short reply from [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield which did not remove [his]284-clare embarrassment , for it bore no address , though to [his]284-clare surprise it was not written from [Marlott]21-marlott .

[SIR]5821-sir ,

[J]362-j write these few lines to say that [[my]0-i Daughter]5359-my daughter is away from [me]0-i at present , and [J]362-j am not sure when [she]198-tess will return , but [J]362-j will let [you]5821-sir know as Soon as [she]198-tess do . [J]362-j do not feel at liberty to tell [you]5821-sir Where [she]198-tess is temperly biding . [J]362-j should say that [me]0-i and [[my]0-i Family]5849-my family have left [Marlott]21-marlott for some Time . -

[Yours]5821-sir ,

[J. DURBEYFIELD]364-j. durbeyfield

It was such a relief to [Clare]200-clare to learn that [Tess]198-tess was at least apparently well that [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother 's stiff reticence as to [her]198-tess whereabouts did not long distress [him]5821-sir . [They]5362-they were all angry with [him]5821-sir , evidently . [He]5821-sir would wait till [Mrs Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield could inform [him]5821-sir of [Tess]198-tess 's return , which [her]180-mrs durbeyfield letter implied to be soon . [He]5821-sir deserved no more . [His]5363-his had been a love " which alters when it alteration finds "[5363-his] . [He]5821-sir had undergone some strange experiences in [his]5821-sir absence ; [he]5821-sir had seen the virtual [Faustina]429-faustina in the literal [Cornelia]430-cornelia , a spiritual Lucretia in a corporeal Phryne ; [he]5821-sir had thought of [the woman taken and set in the midst]5364-the woman taken and set in the midst as one deserving to be stoned , and of [the wife of [Uriah]431-uriah]5365-the wife of uriah being made [a queen]5366-a queen ; and [he]5821-sir had asked [himself]5821-sir why [he]5821-sir had not judged [Tess]198-tess constructively rather than biographically , by the will rather than by the deed ?

A day or two passed while [he]5821-sir waited at [[[his]5821-sir father]457-his father 's house]5368-his father 's house for the promised second note from [Joan Durbeyfield]205-joan , and indirectly to recover a little more strength . The strength showed signs of coming back , but there was no sign of [Joan]205-joan 's letter . Then [he]5821-sir hunted up the old letter sent on to [him]5821-sir in [Brazil]109-brazil , which [Tess]198-tess had written from [Flintcomb - Ash]126-flintcomb - ash , and re - read it . The sentences touched [him]5821-sir now as much as when [he]5821-sir had first perused them .

... [I]0-i must cry to [you]5369-you in [my]0-i trouble - [I]0-i have [no one else]2599-no one else ! ... [I]0-i think [I]0-i must die if [you]5369-you do not come soon , or tell [me]0-i to come to [you]5369-you ... please , please , not to be just - only a little kind to [me]0-i ... [I]0-i would be well content to do that if so be [you]5369-you had forgiven [me]0-i ! ... if [you]5369-you will send [me]0-i one little line , and say , " [I]5369-you am coming soon , "[5369-you] [I]0-i will bide on , [Angel]200-clare - O , so cheerfully ! ... think how it do hurt [my]0-i heart not to see [you]5369-you ever - ever ! Ah , if [I]0-i could only make [your]5369-you dear heart ache one little minute of each day as [mine]0-i does every day and all day long , it might lead [you]5369-you to show pity to [[your]5369-you poor lonely one]4836-your poor lonely one . ... [I]0-i would be content , ay , glad , to live with [you]5369-you as [[your]5369-you servant]4841-your servant , if [I]0-i may not as [[your]5369-you wife]6687-your wife ; so that [I]0-i could only be near [you]5369-you , and get glimpses of [you]5369-you , and think of [you]5369-you as [mine]0-i . ... Come to [me]0-i - come to [me]0-i , and save [me]0-i from what threatens [me]0-i !

[Clare]200-clare determined that [he]5377-he would no longer believe in [her]5369-you more recent and severer regard of [him]5377-he , but would go and find [her]5369-you immediately . [He]5377-he asked [[his]5377-he father]457-his father if [she]5369-you had applied for any money during [his]5377-he absence . [[His]5377-he father]457-his father returned a negative , and then for the first time it occurred to [Angel]200-clare that [her]5369-you pride had stood in [her]5369-you way , and that [she]5369-you had suffered privation . In a quarter of an hour [Clare]200-clare was leaving [the house]652-the house , whence [[his]5377-he mother]6090-his mother watched [his]5377-he thin figure as it disappeared into [the street]4511-the street . [He]5377-he went to [the inn]697-the inn , where [he]5377-he hired a trap , and could hardly wait during the harnessing . In a very few minutes after , [he]5377-he was driving up [the hill]642-the hill out of [the town]1346-the town which , three or four months earlier in the year , [Tess]198-tess had descended with such hopes and ascended with such shattered purposes .

[Benvill Lane]138-benvill lane soon stretched before [him]5377-he , [its]138-benvill lane hedges and trees purple with buds ; but [he]5377-he was looking at other things , and only recalled [himself]5377-he to the scene sufficiently to enable [him]5377-he to keep the way . In something less than an hour - and - a - half [he]5377-he had skirted [the south of [the King 's Hintock estates]5390-the king 's hintock estates]5389-the south of the king 's hintock estates and ascended to [the untoward solitude of Cross - in - Hand]5391-the untoward solitude of cross - in - hand , the unholy stone whereon [Tess]198-tess had been compelled by [Alec d'Urberville]367-alec d'urberville , in [his]5377-he whim of reformation , to swear the strange oath that [she]198-tess would never wilfully tempt [him]5377-he again . The pale and blasted nettle - stems of the preceding year even now lingered nakedly in the banks , young green nettles of the present spring growing from their roots .

Thence [he]5377-he went along the verge of [the upland overhanging the other Hintocks]5392-the upland overhanging the other hintocks , and , turning to the right , plunged into [the bracing calcareous region of [Flintcomb - Ash]126-flintcomb - ash]5393-the bracing calcareous region of flintcomb - ash , the address from which [she]198-tess had written to [him]5377-he in one of the letters , and which [he]5377-he supposed to be the place of sojourn referred to by [[her]198-tess mother]658-her mother . Here , of course , [he]5377-he did not find [her]198-tess ; and what added to [his]5377-he depression was the discovery that no " [Mrs Clare]200-clare "[1947-the farmer] had ever been heard of by [the cottagers]5395-the cottagers or by [the farmer]1947-the farmer [himself]5377-he , though [Tess]198-tess was remembered well enough by [her]198-tess Christian name . [His]5377-he name [she]198-tess had obviously never used during [their]5397-their separation , and [her]198-tess dignified sense of [their]5397-their total severance was shown not much less by this abstention than by the hardships [she]198-tess had chosen to undergo of which [he]5377-he now learnt for the first time rather than apply to [[his]5377-he father]457-his father for more funds .

[The house in which [Tess]198-tess had passed the years of [her]198-tess childhood]5414-the house in which tess had passed the years of her childhood was now inhabited by [another family who had never known [her]198-tess]5415-another family who had never known her . LV

At eleven o'clock that night , having secured a bed at [one of [the hotels]5466-the hotels]5465-one of the hotels and telegraphed [his]5459-he address to [[his]5459-he father]457-his father immediately on [his]5459-he arrival , [he]5459-he walked out into [the streets of [Sandbourne]161-sandbourne]5468-the streets of sandbourne . It was too late to call on or inquire for any one , and [he]5459-he reluctantly postponed [his]5459-he purpose till the morning . But [he]5459-he could not retire to rest just yet .

[This fashionable watering - place]5469-this fashionable watering - place , with [its]5469-this fashionable watering - place eastern and [its]5469-this fashionable watering - place western stations , [its]5469-this fashionable watering - place piers , [its]5469-this fashionable watering - place groves of pines , [its]5469-this fashionable watering - place promenades , and [its]5469-this fashionable watering - place covered gardens , was , to [Angel Clare]200-clare , like [a fairy place]5470-a fairy place suddenly created by the stroke of a wand , and allowed to get a little dusty . [An outlying eastern tract of the enormous [Egdon Waste]162-egdon waste]5471-an outlying eastern tract of the enormous egdon waste was close at hand , yet on the very verge of that tawny piece of antiquity such a glittering novelty as [this pleasure city]5472-this pleasure city had chosen to spring up . Within the space of a mile from [its]5469-this fashionable watering - place outskirts every irregularity of [the soil]1536-the soil was prehistoric , [every channel an undisturbed British trackway]5474-every channel an undisturbed british trackway ; not a sod having been turned there since the days of [the Caesars]434-the caesars . Yet the exotic had grown [here]5975-here , suddenly as [the prophet]5476-the prophet 's gourd ; and had drawn hither [Tess]198-tess .

By the midnight lamps [he]5459-he went up and down the winding way of [this new world]5477-this new world in an old one , and could discern between the trees and against the stars the lofty roofs , chimneys , [gazebos]5478-gazebos , and towers of [the numerous fanciful residences of which [the place]5882-the place was composed]5479-the numerous fanciful residences of which the place was composed . It was [a city of [detached mansions]5482-detached mansions]5481-a city of detached mansions ; [a Mediterranean lounging - place on [the English Channel]124-the english channel]5483-a mediterranean lounging - place on the english channel ; and as seen now by night [it]5469-this fashionable watering - place seemed even more imposing than [it]5469-this fashionable watering - place was .

[The sea]3173-the sea was near at hand , but not intrusive ; it murmured , and [he]5459-he thought it was the pines ; the pines murmured in precisely the same tones , and [he]5459-he thought they were [the sea]3173-the sea .

Where could [Tess]198-tess possibly be , [a cottage - girl , [[his]5459-he young wife]5487-his young wife , amidst all this wealth and fashion]5486-a cottage - girl , his young wife , amidst all this wealth and fashion ? The more [he]5459-he pondered , the more was [he]5459-he puzzled . Were there any cows to milk [here]5975-here ? There certainly were no fields to till . [She]198-tess was most probably engaged to do something in [one of [these large houses]5490-these large houses]5489-one of these large houses ; and [he]5459-he sauntered along , looking at the chamber - windows and [their]5490-these large houses lights going out one by one , and wondered which of [them]5490-these large houses might be [hers]198-tess .

Conjecture was useless , and just after twelve o'clock [he]5459-he entered and went to bed . Before putting out [his]5459-he light [he]5459-he re - read [Tess]198-tess 's impassioned letter . Sleep , however , [he]5459-he could not - so near [her]198-tess , yet so far from [her]198-tess - and [he]5459-he continually lifted the window - blind and regarded the backs of [the opposite houses]5491-the opposite houses , and wondered behind which of the sashes [she]198-tess reposed at that moment .

[He]5459-he might almost as well have sat up all night . In the morning [he]5459-he arose at seven , and shortly after went out , taking the direction of [the chief post - office]5492-the chief post - office . " Do [you]5459-he know the address of [a Mrs Clare]200-clare ? "[200-clare] asked [Angel]200-clare . [The postman]5166-the postman shook [his]5166-the postman head .

" Of [a Miss Durbeyfield]435-a miss durbeyfield ? "[200-clare]

" [Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield ? "[5166-the postman]

" There 's [visitors]7761-visitors coming and going every day , as [you]5459-he know , [sir]5821-sir , "[5459-he] [he]5459-he said ; " and without the name of [the house]652-the house [']7764-' tis impossible to find ['em]7764-' . "[5459-he]
