" [I]589-the second know no name of [Durbeyfield]180-mrs durbeyfield ; but there is the name of d'Urberville at [The Herons]307-the herons , "[589-the second] said [the second]589-the second .

" That 's it ! "[200-clare] cried [Clare]200-clare , pleased to think that [she]200-clare had reverted to the real pronunciation . " What place is [The Herons]307-the herons ? "[200-clare]

" [A stylish lodging - house]7765-a stylish lodging - house . ' Tis all [lodging - houses]7766-lodging - houses [here]5975-here , bless ' ee . "[5499-the milkman]

[Clare]200-clare received directions how to find [the house]652-the house , and hastened thither , arriving with [the milkman]5499-the milkman . [The Herons]5500-the herons , though [an ordinary villa]5501-an ordinary villa , stood in [[its]5500-the herons own grounds]5502-its own grounds , and was certainly [the last place in which [one]6172-one would have expected to find [lodgings]3231-lodgings]5503-the last place in which one would have expected to find lodgings , so private was [its]5500-the herons appearance . If [poor Tess]198-tess was [a servant here]5506-a servant here , as [he]5499-the milkman feared , [she]198-tess would go to the back - door to [that milkman]5507-that milkman , and [he]5499-the milkman was inclined to go thither also . However , in [his]5499-the milkman doubts [he]5499-the milkman turned to the front , and rang .

The hour being early , [the landlady]763-the landlady [herself]763-the landlady opened the door . [Clare]200-clare inquired for [Teresa]359-mistress teresa d'Urberville or [Durbeyfield]198-tess .

" [Mrs d'Urberville]6191-mrs d'urberville ? "[763-the landlady]

" Yes . "[763-the landlady]

[Tess]198-tess , then , passed as [a married woman]7516-a married woman , and [he]5499-the milkman felt glad , even though [she]198-tess had not adopted [his]5499-the milkman name .

" Will [you]5499-the milkman kindly tell [her]198-tess that [a relative]7769-a relative is anxious to see [her]198-tess ? "[763-the landlady]

" It is rather early . What name shall [I]763-the landlady give , [sir]5821-sir ? "[763-the landlady]

" [Angel]200-clare . "[763-the landlady]

" [Mr Angel]284-clare ? "[763-the landlady]

" No ; [Angel]200-clare . It is [my]763-the landlady Christian name . [She]198-tess 'll understand . "[763-the landlady]

" [I]763-the landlady 'll see if [she]198-tess is awake . "[763-the landlady]

[He]5499-the milkman was shown into [the front room]5510-the front room - [the dining - room]5511-the dining - room - and looked out through the spring curtains at [the little lawn]5512-the little lawn , and the rhododendrons and other shrubs upon it . Obviously [her]198-tess position was by no means so bad as [he]5499-the milkman had feared , and it crossed [his]5499-the milkman mind that [she]198-tess must somehow have claimed and sold the jewels to attain it . [He]5499-the milkman did not blame [her]198-tess for one moment . Soon [his]5499-the milkman sharpened ear detected footsteps upon the stairs , at which [his]5499-the milkman heart thumped so painfully that [he]5499-the milkman could hardly stand firm . " Dear [me]5499-the milkman ! what will [she]198-tess think of [me]5499-the milkman , so altered as [I]5499-the milkman am ! "[5499-the milkman] [he]5499-the milkman said to [himself]5499-the milkman ; and the door opened .

[Tess]198-tess appeared on the threshold - not at all as [he]5499-the milkman had expected to see [her]198-tess - bewilderingly otherwise , indeed . [Her]198-tess great natural beauty was , if not heightened , rendered more obvious by [her]198-tess attire . [She]198-tess was loosely wrapped in a cashmere dressing - gown of gray - white , embroidered in half - mourning tints , and [she]198-tess wore slippers of the same hue . [Her]198-tess neck rose out of a frill of down , and [her]198-tess well - remembered cable of dark - brown hair was partially coiled up in a mass at the back of [her]198-tess head and partly hanging on [her]198-tess shoulder - the evident result of haste .

[He]5499-the milkman had held out [his]5499-the milkman arms , but they had fallen again to [his]5499-the milkman side ; for [she]198-tess had not come forward , remaining still in the opening of the doorway . Mere yellow skeleton that [he]5499-the milkman was now , [he]5499-the milkman felt the contrast between [them]5513-them , and thought [his]5499-the milkman appearance distasteful to [her]198-tess .

" [Tess]198-tess ! "[5499-the milkman] [he]5499-the milkman said huskily , " can [you]198-tess forgive [me]5499-the milkman for going away ? Ca n't [you]198-tess - come to [me]5499-the milkman ? How do [you]198-tess get to be - like this ? "[5499-the milkman]

" It is too late , "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess , [her]198-tess voice sounding hard through [the room]778-the room , [her]198-tess eyes shining unnaturally .

" [I]5499-the milkman did not think rightly of [you]198-tess - [I]5499-the milkman did not see [you]198-tess as [you]198-tess were ! "[5499-the milkman] [he]5499-the milkman continued to plead . " [I]5499-the milkman have learnt to since , dearest Tessy mine ! "[5499-the milkman]

" Too late , too late ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , waving [her]198-tess hand in the impatience of [a person whose tortures cause every instant to seem an hour]5515-a person whose tortures cause every instant to seem an hour . " Do n't come close to [me]198-tess , [Angel]200-clare ! No - [you]200-clare must not . Keep away . "[198-tess]

" But do n't [you]200-clare love [me]198-tess , [[my]198-tess dear wife]7771-my dear wife , because [I]198-tess have been so pulled down by illness ? [You]200-clare are not so fickle - [I]198-tess am come on purpose for [you]200-clare - [[my]198-tess mother]6050-my mother and [father]5842-father will welcome [you]200-clare now ! "[198-tess]

" Yes - O , yes , yes ! But [I]198-tess say , [I]198-tess say it is too late . "[198-tess]

[She]198-tess seemed to feel like [a fugitive in a dream , who tries to move away]5516-a fugitive in a dream , who tries to move away , but can not . " Do n't [you]200-clare know all - do n't [you]200-clare know it ? Yet how do [you]200-clare come here if [you]200-clare do not know ? "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess inquired here and there , and [I]198-tess found the way . "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess waited and waited for [you]200-clare , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess went on , [her]198-tess tones suddenly resuming their old fluty pathos . " But [you]200-clare did not come ! And [I]198-tess wrote to [you]200-clare , and [you]200-clare did not come ! [He]5842-father kept on saying [you]200-clare would never come any more , and that [I]198-tess was [a foolish woman]7774-a foolish woman . [He]5842-father was very kind to [me]198-tess , and to [mother]5917-mother , and to all of [us]7776-us after [father]5842-father 's death . [He]5842-father - "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess do n't understand . "[198-tess]

" [He]5842-father has won [me]198-tess back to [him]5842-father . "[198-tess]

[Clare]200-clare looked at [her]198-tess keenly , then , gathering [her]198-tess meaning , flagged like one plague - stricken , and [his]5517-his glance sank ; it fell on [her]198-tess hands , which , once rosy , were now white and more delicate .

[She]198-tess continued -

" [He]5842-father is [upstairs]762-upstairs . [I]198-tess hate [him]5842-father now , because [he]5842-father told [me]198-tess a lie - that [you]200-clare would not come again ; and [you]200-clare HAVE come ! These clothes are what [he]5842-father 's put upon [me]198-tess : [I]198-tess did n't care what [he]5842-father did wi ' [me]198-tess ! But - will [you]5520-he go away , [Angel]200-clare , please , and never come any more ? "[198-tess]

[They]5518-their stood fixed , [their]5518-their baffled hearts looking out of [their]5518-their eyes with a joylessness pitiful to see . [Both]3692-both seemed to implore something to shelter [them]5518-their from reality .

" Ah - it is [my]200-clare fault ! "[200-clare] said [Clare]200-clare .

But [he]5520-he could not get on . Speech was as inexpressive as silence . But [he]5520-he had a vague consciousness of one thing , though it was not clear to [him]5520-he till later ; that [his]5520-he original [Tess]198-tess had spiritually ceased to recognize the body before [him]5520-he as [hers]198-tess - allowing it to drift , like a corpse upon the current , in a direction dissociated from its living will .

A few instants passed , and [he]5520-he found that [Tess]198-tess was gone . [His]5520-he face grew colder and more shrunken as [he]5520-he stood concentrated on the moment , and a minute or two after , [he]5520-he found [himself]5520-he in [the street]4511-the street , walking along [he]5520-he did not know whither .

[LVI

Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks , [the lady who was [the householder at [The Herons]307-the herons]5523-the householder at the herons and [owner of all the handsome furniture]5524-owner of all the handsome furniture]5522-the lady who was the householder at the herons and owner of all the handsome furniture , was not [a person of an unusually curious turn of mind]5525-a person of an unusually curious turn of mind . [She]436-mrs brooks was too deeply materialized , [poor woman , by [her]436-mrs brooks long and enforced bondage to [that arithmetical demon Profit - and - Loss]5527-that arithmetical demon profit - and - loss]5526-poor woman , by her long and enforced bondage to that arithmetical demon profit - and - loss , to retain much curiousity for its own sake , and apart from [possible lodgers]5528-possible lodgers ' pockets . Nevertheless , the visit of [Angel Clare]200-clare to [[her]200-clare well - paying tenants]5529-her well - paying tenants , [Mr]5530-mr and [Mrs d'Urberville]5531-mrs d'urberville , as [she]436-mrs brooks deemed [them]5529-her well - paying tenants , was sufficiently exceptional in point of time and manner to reinvigorate the feminine proclivity which had been stifled down as useless save in its bearings to the letting trade .

[Tess]198-tess had spoken to [[her]198-tess husband]791-her husband from the doorway , without entering [the dining - room]5511-the dining - room , and [Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks , who stood within the partly - closed door of [[her]436-mrs brooks own sitting - room at the back of [the passage]2972-the passage]5534-her own sitting - room at the back of the passage , could hear fragments of the conversation - if conversation it could be called - between [those two wretched souls]5536-those two wretched souls . [She]436-mrs brooks heard [Tess]198-tess re - ascend the stairs to [the first floor]5537-the first floor , and the departure of [Clare]200-clare , and the closing of the front door behind [him]791-her husband . Then the door of [the room above]5538-the room above was shut , and [Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks knew that [Tess]198-tess had re - entered [[her]436-mrs brooks apartment]3601-her apartment . As [the young lady]2685-the young lady was not fully dressed , [Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks knew that [she]2685-the young lady would not emerge again for some time .

[She]436-mrs brooks accordingly ascended the stairs softly , and stood at the door of [the front room]5510-the front room - [a drawing - room]5542-a drawing - room , connected with [the room immediately behind [it]5510-the front room which was [a bedroom]5544-a bedroom by folding - doors in the common manner]5543-the room immediately behind it which was a bedroom by folding - doors in the common manner . [This first floor , containing [[Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks 's best apartments]5546-mrs brooks 's best apartments]5545-this first floor , containing mrs brooks 's best apartments , had been taken by the week by [the d'Urbervilles]1240-the d'urbervilles . [The back room]5548-the back room was now in silence ; but from [the drawing - room]3931-the drawing - room there came sounds .

All that [she]436-mrs brooks could at first distinguish of them was one syllable , continually repeated in a low note of moaning , as if it came from [a soul bound to some Ixionian wheel]5550-a soul bound to some ixionian wheel -

" O - O - O ! "[5550-a soul bound to some ixionian wheel]

Then a silence , then a heavy sigh , and again -

" O - O - O ! "[763-the landlady]

[The landlady]763-the landlady looked through the keyhole . Only a small space of [the room inside]5552-the room inside was visible , but within [that space]5553-that space came a corner of the breakfast table , which was already spread for the meal , and also a chair beside . Over the seat of the chair [Tess]198-tess 's face was bowed , [her]198-tess posture being a kneeling one in front of it ; [her]198-tess hands were clasped over [her]198-tess head , the skirts of [her]198-tess dressing - gown and the embroidery of [her]198-tess night - gown flowed upon the floor behind [her]198-tess , and [her]198-tess stockingless feet , from which the slippers had fallen , protruded upon the carpet . It was from [her]198-tess lips that came the murmur of unspeakable despair .

Then [a man]1337-a man 's voice from [the adjoining bedroom]5555-the adjoining bedroom -

" What 's the matter ? "[1337-a man]

[She]198-tess did not answer , but went on , in a tone which was a soliloquy rather than an exclamation , and a dirge rather than a soliloquy . [Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks could only catch a portion :

" And then [[my]5556-you dear , dear husband]7779-my dear , dear husband came [home]5850-home to [me]5556-you ... and [I]5556-you did not know it ! ... And [you]5556-you had used [your]5556-you cruel persuasion upon [me]5556-you ... [you]5556-you did not stop using it - no - [you]5556-you did not stop ! [[My]5556-you little sisters]6881-my little sisters and [brothers]586-brothers and [[my]5556-you mother]6050-my mother 's needs - [they]7784-they were the things [you]5556-you moved [me]5556-you by ... and [you]5556-you said [[my]5556-you husband]7291-my husband would never come back - never ; and [you]5556-you taunted [me]5556-you , and said what [a simpleton]7786-a simpleton [I]5556-you was to expect [him]7291-my husband ! ... And at last [I]5556-you believed [you]5556-you and gave way ! ... And then [he]7291-my husband came back ! Now [he]7291-my husband is gone . Gone a second time , and [I]5556-you have lost [him]7291-my husband now for ever ... and [he]7291-my husband will not love [me]5556-you the littlest bit ever any more - only hate [me]5556-you ! ... O yes , [I]5556-you have lost [him]7291-my husband now - again because of - [you]5556-you ! "[5556-you] In writhing , with [her]5556-you head on the chair , [she]5556-you turned [her]5556-you face towards the door , and [Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks could see the pain upon it , and that [her]5556-you lips were bleeding from the clench of [her]5556-you teeth upon them , and that the long lashes of [her]5556-you closed eyes stuck in wet tags to [her]5556-you cheeks . [She]5556-you continued : " And [he]7291-my husband is dying - [he]7291-my husband looks as if [he]7291-my husband is dying ! ... And [my]5556-you sin will kill [him]7291-my husband and not kill [me]5556-you ! ... O , [you]5556-you have torn [my]5556-you life all to pieces ... made [me]5556-you be what [I]5556-you prayed [you]5556-you in pity not to make [me]5556-you be again ! ... [[My]5556-you own true husband]7787-my own true husband will never , never - O [God]222-god - [I]5556-you ca n't bear this ! - [I]5556-you can not ! "[5556-you]

There were more and sharper words from [the man]1516-the man ; then a sudden rustle ; [she]5556-you had sprung to [her]5556-you feet . [Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks , thinking that [the speaker]617-the speaker was coming to rush out of the door , hastily retreated down [the stairs]3324-the stairs .

[She]436-mrs brooks need not have done so , however , for the door of [the sitting - room]3599-the sitting - room was not opened . But [Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks felt it unsafe to watch on [the landing]3318-the landing again , and entered [[her]436-mrs brooks own parlour]5562-her own parlour below .

[She]436-mrs brooks could hear nothing through the floor , although [she]436-mrs brooks listened intently , and thereupon went to [the kitchen]2396-the kitchen to finish [her]436-mrs brooks interrupted breakfast . Coming up presently to [the front room on [the ground floor]5565-the ground floor]5564-the front room on the ground floor [she]436-mrs brooks took up some sewing , waiting for [[her]436-mrs brooks lodgers]5566-her lodgers to ring that [she]436-mrs brooks might take away the breakfast , which [she]436-mrs brooks meant to do [herself]436-mrs brooks , to discover what was the matter if possible . Overhead , as [she]436-mrs brooks sat , [she]436-mrs brooks could now hear the floorboards slightly creak , as if [some one]5567-some one were walking about , and presently the movement was explained by the rustle of garments against the banisters , the opening and the closing of the front door , and the form of [Tess]198-tess passing to the gate on [her]198-tess way into [the street]4511-the street . [She]436-mrs brooks was fully dressed now in the walking costume of [a well - to - do young lady]5569-a well - to - do young lady in which [she]436-mrs brooks had arrived , with the sole addition that over [her]436-mrs brooks hat and black feathers a veil was drawn .

[Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks had not been able to catch any word of farewell , temporary or otherwise , between [[her]436-mrs brooks tenants at the door above]5570-her tenants at the door above . [They]5570-her tenants at the door above might have quarrelled , or [Mr d'Urberville]5571-mr d'urberville might still be asleep , for [he]5571-mr d'urberville was not [an early riser]5572-an early riser .

[She]436-mrs brooks went into [the back room]5548-the back room , which was more especially [[her]436-mrs brooks own apartment]5574-her own apartment , and continued [her]436-mrs brooks sewing [there]5839-there . [The lady lodger]5576-the lady lodger did not return , nor did [the gentleman]1007-the gentleman ring [his]1007-the gentleman bell . [Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks pondered on the delay , and on what probable relation [the visitor who had called so early]5578-the visitor who had called so early bore to [the couple]3872-the couple [upstairs]762-upstairs . In reflecting [she]436-mrs brooks leant back in [her]436-mrs brooks chair .

As [she]436-mrs brooks did so [her]436-mrs brooks eyes glanced casually over the ceiling till they were arrested by a spot in the middle of its white surface which [she]436-mrs brooks had never noticed there before . It was about the size of a wafer when [she]436-mrs brooks first observed it , but it speedily grew as large as the palm of [her]436-mrs brooks hand , and then [she]436-mrs brooks could perceive that it was red . The oblong white ceiling , with this scarlet blot in the midst , had the appearance of a gigantic ace of hearts .

[Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks had strange qualms of misgiving . [She]436-mrs brooks got upon the table , and touched the spot in the ceiling with [her]436-mrs brooks fingers . It was damp , and [she]436-mrs brooks fancied that it was a blood stain .

Descending from the table , [she]436-mrs brooks left [the parlour]3293-the parlour , and went [upstairs]762-upstairs , intending to enter [the room overhead , which was [the bedchamber at the back of [the drawing - room]3931-the drawing - room]5584-the bedchamber at the back of the drawing - room]5583-the room overhead , which was the bedchamber at the back of the drawing - room . But , nerveless woman as [she]436-mrs brooks had now become , [she]436-mrs brooks could not bring [herself]436-mrs brooks to attempt the handle . [She]436-mrs brooks listened . The dead silence within was broken only by a regular beat .

Drip , drip , drip .

[Mrs Brooks]436-mrs brooks hastened [downstairs]1128-downstairs , opened the front door , and ran into [the street]4511-the street . [A man [she]436-mrs brooks knew]5588-a man she knew , [one of [the workmen employed at [an adjoining villa]5591-an adjoining villa]5590-the workmen employed at an adjoining villa]5589-one of the workmen employed at an adjoining villa , was passing by , and [she]436-mrs brooks begged [him]5588-a man she knew to come in and go [upstairs]762-upstairs with [her]436-mrs brooks ; [she]436-mrs brooks feared something had happened to [one of [[her]436-mrs brooks lodgers]5566-her lodgers]5593-one of her lodgers . [The workman]5595-the workman assented , and followed [her]436-mrs brooks to [the landing]3318-the landing .

[She]436-mrs brooks opened the door of [the drawing - room]3931-the drawing - room , and stood back for [him]5588-a man she knew to pass in , entering [herself]436-mrs brooks behind [him]5588-a man she knew . [The room]778-the room was empty ; the breakfast - a substantial repast of coffee , eggs , and a cold ham - lay spread upon the table untouched , as when [she]436-mrs brooks had taken it up , excepting that the carving - knife was missing . [She]436-mrs brooks asked [the man]1516-the man to go through the folding - doors into [the adjoining room]3473-the adjoining room .

[He]1516-the man opened the doors , entered a step or two , and came back almost instantly with a rigid face . " [My]1516-the man good God , [the gentleman in bed]7788-the gentleman in bed is dead ! [I]1516-the man think [he]1516-the man has been hurt with a knife - a lot of blood had run down upon the floor ! "[1516-the man]

The alarm was soon given , and [the house which had lately been so quiet]5601-the house which had lately been so quiet resounded with the tramp of many footsteps , [a surgeon among the rest]5602-a surgeon among the rest . The wound was small , but the point of the blade had touched the heart of [the victim]5603-the victim , who lay on [his]5603-the victim back , pale , fixed , dead , as if [he]5603-the victim had scarcely moved after the infliction of the blow . In a quarter of an hour the news that [a gentleman who was [a temporary visitor to [the town]1346-the town]5605-a temporary visitor to the town]5604-a gentleman who was a temporary visitor to the town had been stabbed in [his]1516-the man bed , spread through [every street]5607-every street and villa of [the popular watering - place]5608-the popular watering - place .

LVII

Meanwhile [Angel Clare]200-clare had walked automatically along the way by which [he]1516-the man had come , and , entering [[his]1516-the man hotel]5609-his hotel , sat down over the breakfast , staring at nothingness . [He]1516-the man went on eating and drinking unconsciously till on a sudden [he]1516-the man demanded [his]1516-the man bill ; having paid which , [he]1516-the man took [his]1516-the man dressing - bag in [his]1516-the man hand , the only luggage [he]1516-the man had brought with [him]1516-the man , and went out .

At the moment of [his]1516-the man departure a telegram was handed to [him]1516-the man - a few words from [[his]1516-the man mother]6090-his mother , stating that [they]6090-his mother were glad to know [his]1516-the man address , and informing [him]1516-the man that [[his]1516-the man brother]2697-his brother [Cuthbert]397-clare had proposed to and been accepted by [Mercy Chant]330-mercy .

[Clare]397-clare crumpled up the paper and followed the route to [the station]6774-the station ; reaching it , [he]1516-the man found that there would be [no train]5613-no train leaving for an hour and more . [He]1516-the man sat down to wait , and having waited a quarter of an hour felt that [he]1516-the man could wait there no longer . Broken in heart and numbed , [he]1516-the man had nothing to hurry for ; but [he]1516-the man wished to get out of [a town which had been the scene of such an experience]5614-a town which had been the scene of such an experience , and turned to walk to [the first station]5615-the first station onward , and let [the train]531-the train pick [him]1516-the man up [there]5839-there .

[The highway]598-the highway that [he]1516-the man followed was open , and at a little distance dipped into [a valley]5619-a valley , across which [it]598-the highway could be seen running from edge to edge . [He]1516-the man had traversed the greater part of [this depression]5620-this depression , and was climbing [the western acclivity]5621-the western acclivity when , pausing for breath , [he]1516-the man unconsciously looked back . Why [he]1516-the man did so [he]1516-the man could not say , but something seemed to impel [him]1516-the man to the act . The tape - like surface of [the road]550-the road diminished in [his]1516-the man rear as far as [he]1516-the man could see , and as [he]1516-the man gazed a moving spot intruded on the white vacuity of its perspective .

It was [a human figure]5623-a human figure running . [Clare]397-clare waited , with a dim sense that [somebody]6000-somebody was trying to overtake [him]1516-the man .

[The form descending the incline]5625-the form descending the incline was [a woman]1028-a woman 's , yet so entirely was [his]1516-the man mind blinded to the idea of [[his]1516-the man wife]819-his wife 's following [him]1516-the man that even when [she]1028-a woman came nearer [he]1516-the man did not recognize [her]1028-a woman under the totally changed attire in which [he]1516-the man now beheld [her]1028-a woman . It was not till [she]1028-a woman was quite close that [he]1516-the man could believe [her]1028-a woman to be [Tess]198-tess .

" [I]1028-a woman saw [you]1028-a woman - turn away from [the station]6774-the station - just before [I]1028-a woman got [there]5839-there - and [I]1028-a woman have been following [you]1028-a woman all this way ! "[1028-a woman]

[She]1028-a woman was so pale , so breathless , so quivering in every muscle , that [he]1516-the man did not ask [her]1028-a woman a single question , but seizing [her]1028-a woman hand , and pulling it within [his]1516-the man arm , [he]1516-the man led [her]1028-a woman along . To avoid meeting any possible [wayfarers]5628-wayfarers [he]1516-the man left [the high road]543-the high road and took a footpath under some fir - trees . When [they]5630-they were deep among the moaning boughs [he]1516-the man stopped and looked at [her]1028-a woman inquiringly .

" [Angel]200-clare , "[1028-a woman] [she]1028-a woman said , as if waiting for this , " do [you]200-clare know what [I]1028-a woman have been running after [you]200-clare for ? To tell [you]200-clare that [I]1028-a woman have killed [him]1516-the man ! "[1028-a woman] A pitiful white smile lit [her]1028-a woman face as [she]1028-a woman spoke .

" What ! "[1516-the man] said [he]1516-the man , thinking from the strangeness of [her]1028-a woman manner that [she]1028-a woman was in some delirium .

" [I]1028-a woman have done it - [I]1028-a woman do n't know how , "[1028-a woman] [she]1028-a woman continued . " Still , [I]1028-a woman owed it to [you]200-clare , and to [myself]1028-a woman , [Angel]200-clare . [I]1028-a woman feared long ago , when [I]1028-a woman struck [him]1516-the man on the mouth with [my]1028-a woman glove , that [I]1028-a woman might do it some day for the trap [he]1516-the man set for [me]1028-a woman in [my]1028-a woman simple youth , and [his]1516-the man wrong to [you]200-clare through [me]1028-a woman . [He]1516-the man has come between [us]7791-us and ruined [us]7791-us , and now [he]1516-the man can never do it any more . [I]1028-a woman never loved [him]1516-the man at all , [Angel]200-clare , as [I]1028-a woman loved [you]200-clare . [You]200-clare know it , do n't [you]200-clare ? [You]200-clare believe it ? [You]200-clare did n't come back to [me]1028-a woman , and [I]1028-a woman was obliged to go back to [him]1516-the man . Why did [you]200-clare go away - why did [you]200-clare - when [I]1028-a woman loved [you]200-clare so ? [I]1028-a woman ca n't think why [you]200-clare did it . But [I]1028-a woman do n't blame [you]200-clare ; only , [Angel]200-clare , will [you]200-clare forgive [me]1028-a woman [my]1028-a woman sin against [you]200-clare , now [I]1028-a woman have killed [him]1516-the man ? [I]1028-a woman thought as [I]1028-a woman ran along that [you]200-clare would be sure to forgive [me]1028-a woman now [I]1028-a woman have done that . It came to [me]1028-a woman as a shining light that [I]1028-a woman should get [you]200-clare back that way . [I]1028-a woman could not bear the loss of [you]200-clare any longer - [you]200-clare do n't know how entirely [I]1028-a woman was unable to bear [your]200-clare not loving [me]1028-a woman ! Say [you]200-clare do now , [dear , dear husband]7792-dear , dear husband ; say [you]200-clare do , now [I]1028-a woman have killed [him]5631-he ! "[1028-a woman]

" [I]5631-he do love [you]5632-her , [Tess]198-tess - O , [I]5631-he do - it is all come back ! "[5631-he] [he]5631-he said , tightening [his]5631-he arms round [her]5632-her with fervid pressure . " But how do [you]5632-her mean - [you]5632-her have killed [him]5631-he ? "[5631-he]

" [I]5632-her mean that [I]5632-her have , "[5632-her] [she]5632-her murmured in a reverie .

" What , [bodily]7793-bodily ? Is [he]5631-he dead ? "[5631-he]

" Yes . [He]5631-he heard [me]5631-he crying about [you]5632-her , and [he]5631-he bitterly taunted [me]5631-he ; and called [you]5632-her by a foul name ; and then [I]5631-he did it . [My]5631-he heart could not bear it . [He]5631-he had nagged [me]5631-he about [you]5632-her before . And then [I]5631-he dressed [myself]5631-he and came away to find [you]5632-her . "[5631-he]

By degrees [he]5633-he was inclined to believe that [she]5632-her had faintly attempted , at least , what [she]5632-her said [she]5632-her had done ; and [his]5633-he horror at [her]5632-her impulse was mixed with amazement at the strength of [her]5632-her affection for [himself]5633-he , and at the strangeness of its quality , which had apparently extinguished [her]5632-her moral sense altogether . Unable to realize the gravity of [her]5632-her conduct , [she]5632-her seemed at last content ; and [he]5633-he looked at [her]5632-her as [she]5632-her lay upon [his]5633-he shoulder , weeping with happiness , and wondered what obscure strain in the d'Urberville blood had led to this aberration - if it were an aberration . There momentarily flashed through [his]5633-he mind that the family tradition of the coach and murder might have arisen because [the d'Urbervilles]1240-the d'urbervilles had been known to do these things . As well as [his]5633-he confused and excited ideas could reason , [he]5633-he supposed that in the moment of mad grief of which [she]5632-her spoke , [her]5632-her mind had lost its balance , and plunged [her]5632-her into this abyss .

It was very terrible if true ; if a temporary hallucination , sad . But , anyhow , here was [this deserted wife of [his]5633-he]5635-this deserted wife of his , [this passionately - fond woman , clinging to [him]5633-he without a suspicion that [he]5633-he would be anything to [her]5632-her but [a protector]5637-a protector]5636-this passionately - fond woman , clinging to him without a suspicion that he would be anything to her but a protector . [He]5633-he saw that for [him]5633-he to be otherwise was not , in [her]5632-her mind , within the region of the possible . Tenderness was absolutely dominant in [Clare]200-clare at last . [He]5633-he kissed [her]5632-her endlessly with [his]5633-he white lips , and held [her]5632-her hand , and said -

" [I]5633-he will not desert [you]5632-her ! [I]5633-he will protect [you]5632-her by every means in [my]5633-he power , dearest love , whatever [you]5632-her may have done or not have done ! "[5633-he]

[They]5638-they then walked on under the trees , [Tess]198-tess turning [her]198-tess head every now and then to look at [him]5633-he . Worn and unhandsome as [he]5633-he had become , it was plain that [she]198-tess did not discern the least fault in [his]5633-he appearance . To [her]198-tess [he]5633-he was , as of old , all that was perfection , personally and mentally . [He]5633-he was still [[her]198-tess Antinous]5639-her antinous , [her]198-tess Apollo even ; [his]5633-he sickly face was beautiful as the morning to [her]198-tess affectionate regard on this day no less than when [she]198-tess first beheld [him]5633-he ; for was it not the face of [the one man on earth]5640-the one man on earth who had loved [her]198-tess purely , and who had believed in [her]198-tess as pure !

With an instinct as to possibilities , [he]5633-he did not now , as [he]5633-he had intended , make for [the first station beyond [the town]1346-the town]5641-the first station beyond the town , but plunged still farther under the firs , which here abounded for miles . Each clasping the other round the waist [they]5643-they promenaded over the dry bed of fir - needles , thrown into a vague intoxicating atmosphere at the consciousness of being together at last , with no living soul between [them]5643-they ; ignoring that there was a corpse . Thus [they]5643-they proceeded for several miles till [Tess]198-tess , arousing [herself]198-tess , looked about [her]198-tess , and said , timidly -

" Are [we]5643-they going anywhere in particular ? "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess do n't know , [dearest]6681-dearest . Why ? "[198-tess]

" [I]198-tess do n't know . "[198-tess]

" Well , [we]5643-they might walk a few miles further , and when it is evening find [lodgings]3231-lodgings somewhere or other - in [a lonely cottage]7796-a lonely cottage , perhaps . Can [you]198-tess walk well , [Tessy]256-tessy ? "[198-tess]

" O yes ! [I]198-tess could walk for ever and ever with [your]198-tess arm round [me]198-tess ! "[198-tess]

Upon the whole it seemed a good thing to do . Thereupon [they]5643-they quickened [their]5643-they pace , avoiding [high roads]5644-high roads , and following obscure paths tending more or less northward . But there was an unpractical vagueness in [their]5643-they movements throughout the day ; [neither one of [them]5643-they]5645-neither one of them seemed to consider any question of effectual escape , disguise , or long concealment . [Their]5643-they every idea was temporary and unforefending , like the plans of [two children]5646-two children .

At mid - day [they]5643-they drew near to [a roadside inn]3371-a roadside inn , and [Tess]198-tess would have entered [it]3371-a roadside inn with [him]5648-he to get something to eat , but [he]5648-he persuaded [her]198-tess to remain among the trees and bushes of [this half - woodland]5649-this half - woodland , [half - moorland part of [the country]507-the country]5650-half - moorland part of the country till [he]5648-he should come back . [Her]198-tess clothes were of recent fashion ; even the ivory - handled parasol that [she]198-tess carried was of a shape unknown in [the retired spot to which [they]5643-they had now wandered]5652-the retired spot to which they had now wandered ; and the cut of such articles would have attracted attention in the settle of [a tavern]5653-a tavern . [He]5648-he soon returned , with food enough for [half - a - dozen people]5654-half - a - dozen people and two bottles of wine - enough to last [them]5643-they for a day or more , should any emergency arise .

[They]5643-they sat down upon some dead boughs and shared [their]5643-they meal . Between one and two o'clock [they]5643-they packed up the remainder and went on again .

" [I]198-tess feel strong enough to walk any distance , "[198-tess] said [she]198-tess .

" [I]200-clare think [we]5643-they may as well steer in a general way towards [the interior of [the country]507-the country]4894-the interior of the country , where [we]5643-they can hide for a time , and are less likely to be looked for than anywhere near [the coast]489-the coast , "[200-clare] [Clare]200-clare remarked . " Later on , when [they]5643-they have forgotten [us]5643-they , [we]5643-they can make for [some port]7800-some port . "[200-clare]

[She]198-tess made no reply to this beyond that of grasping [him]5648-he more tightly , and straight inland [they]5643-they went . Though the season was an English May , the weather was serenely bright , and during the afternoon it was quite warm . Through the latter miles of [their]5643-they walk [their]5643-they footpath had taken [them]5643-they into [the depths of [the New Forest]5656-the new forest]5655-the depths of the new forest , and towards evening , turning the corner of [a lane]5657-a lane , [they]5643-they perceived behind [a brook]5658-a brook and bridge a large board on which was painted in white letters , " [This desirable Mansion]7801-this desirable mansion to be Let Furnished "[5662-he] ; particulars following , with directions to apply to [some London agents]5659-some london agents . Passing through the gate [they]5643-they could see [the house]652-the house , [an old brick building of regular design and large accommodation]5661-an old brick building of regular design and large accommodation .

" [I]200-clare know it , "[200-clare] said [Clare]200-clare . " [It]652-the house is [Bramshurst Court]165-bramshurst court . [You]7802-you can see that [it]652-the house is shut up , and grass is growing on [the drive]963-the drive . "[200-clare]

" Some of the windows are open , "[198-tess] said [Tess]198-tess .

" Just to air [the rooms]4013-the rooms , [I]200-clare suppose . "[200-clare]

" [All [these rooms]7806-these rooms empty , and [we]5643-they without a roof to [our]5643-they heads]7805-all these rooms empty , and we without a roof to our heads ! "[200-clare]

" [You]198-tess are getting tired , [[my]5662-he [Tess]198-tess]6741-my tess ! "[5662-he] [he]5662-he said . " [We]5663-they 'll stop soon . "[5662-he] And kissing [her]198-tess sad mouth , [he]5662-he again led [her]198-tess onwards .

[He]5662-he was growing weary likewise , for [they]5663-they had wandered a dozen or fifteen miles , and it became necessary to consider what [they]5663-they should do for rest . [They]5663-they looked from afar at [isolated cottages]5664-isolated cottages and [little inns]5665-little inns , and were inclined to approach one of the latter , when [their]5663-they hearts failed [them]5663-they , and [they]5663-they sheered off . At length [their]5663-they gait dragged , and [they]5663-they stood still .

" Could [we]5663-they sleep under the trees ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess asked .

[He]5662-he thought the season insufficiently advanced .

" [I]5662-he have been thinking of [that empty mansion [we]5663-they passed]7808-that empty mansion we passed , "[5662-he] [he]5662-he said . " Let [us]5663-they go back towards [it]7808-that empty mansion we passed again . "[5662-he]

[They]5663-they retraced [their]5663-they steps , but it was half an hour before [they]5663-they stood without the entrance - gate as earlier . [He]5662-he then requested [her]198-tess to stay where [she]198-tess was , whilst [he]5662-he went to see who was within .

[She]198-tess sat down among the bushes within the gate , and [Clare]200-clare crept towards [the house]652-the house . [His]5662-he absence lasted some considerable time , and when [he]5662-he returned [Tess]198-tess was wildly anxious , not for [herself]198-tess , but for [him]5662-he . [He]5662-he had found out from [a boy]2256-a boy that there was only [an old woman in charge]5668-an old woman in charge as [caretaker]5669-caretaker , and [she]5668-an old woman in charge only came [there]5839-there on fine days , from [the hamlet near]5671-the hamlet near , to open and shut the windows . [She]5668-an old woman in charge would come to shut them at sunset . " Now , [we]7809-we can get in through one of the lower windows , and rest there , "[5662-he] said [he]5662-he .

Under [his]5662-he escort [she]198-tess went tardily forward to the main front , whose shuttered windows , like sightless eyeballs , excluded the possibility of [watchers]5672-watchers . The door was reached a few steps further , and one of the windows beside [it]5673-it was open . [Clare]200-clare clambered in , and pulled [Tess]198-tess in after [him]5662-he .

Except [the hall]5674-the hall , [the rooms]4013-the rooms were all in darkness , and [they]4013-the rooms ascended the staircase . Up here also the shutters were tightly closed , the ventilation being perfunctorily done , for this day at least , by opening the hall - window in front and an upper window behind . [Clare]200-clare unlatched the door of [a large chamber]5676-a large chamber , felt [his]5662-he way across [it]5676-a large chamber , and parted the shutters to the width of two or three inches . A shaft of dazzling sunlight glanced into [the room]778-the room , revealing heavy , old - fashioned furniture , crimson damask hangings , and an enormous four - post bedstead , along the head of which were carved running figures , apparently [Atalanta]437-atalanta 's race .

" Rest at last ! "[5662-he] said [he]5662-he , setting down [his]5662-he bag and the parcel of viands .

[They]4013-the rooms remained in great quietness till [the caretaker]5678-the caretaker should have come to shut the windows : as a precaution , putting [themselves]4013-the rooms in total darkness by barring the shutters as before , lest [the woman]674-the woman should open the door of [[their]4013-the rooms chamber]5680-their chamber for any casual reason . Between six and seven o'clock [she]674-the woman came , but did not approach [the wing [they]4013-the rooms were in]5681-the wing they were in . [They]4013-the rooms heard [her]674-the woman close the windows , fasten them , lock the door , and go away . Then [Clare]200-clare again stole a chink of light from the window , and [they]4013-the rooms shared another meal , till by - and - by [they]4013-the rooms were enveloped in the shades of night which [they]4013-the rooms had no candle to disperse .

LVIII

The night was strangely solemn and still . In the small hours [she]674-the woman whispered to [him]5662-he the whole story of how [he]5662-he had walked in [his]5662-he sleep with [her]674-the woman in [his]5662-he arms across [the Froom stream]5682-the froom stream , at the imminent risk of both [their]4013-the rooms lives , and laid [her]674-the woman down in the stone coffin at [the ruined abbey]5683-the ruined abbey . [He]5662-he had never known of that till now .

" Why did n't [you]674-the woman tell [me]5662-he next day ? "[5662-he] [he]5662-he said . " It might have prevented much misunderstanding and woe . "[5662-he]

" Do n't think of what 's past ! "[674-the woman] said [she]674-the woman . " [I]674-the woman am not going to think outside of now . Why should [we]4013-the rooms ! Who knows what to - morrow has in store ? "[674-the woman]

But it apparently had no sorrow . The morning was wet and foggy , and [Clare]200-clare , rightly informed that [the caretaker only opened the windows on fine days]5684-the caretaker only opened the windows on fine days , ventured to creep out of [[their]4013-the rooms chamber]5680-their chamber and explore [the house]652-the house , leaving [Tess]198-tess asleep . There was no food on [the premises]755-the premises , but there was water , and [he]5662-he took advantage of the fog to emerge from [the mansion]3466-the mansion and fetch tea , bread , and butter from [a shop in [a little place two miles beyond]5690-a little place two miles beyond]5689-a shop in a little place two miles beyond , as also a small tin kettle and spirit - lamp , that [they]4013-the rooms might get fire without smoke . [His]5662-he re - entry awoke [her]674-the woman ; and [they]4013-the rooms breakfasted on what [he]5662-he had brought .

[They]4013-the rooms were indisposed to stir abroad , and the day passed , and the night following , and the next , and next ; till , almost without [their]4013-the rooms being aware , five days had slipped by in absolute seclusion , not a sight or sound of [a human being]5691-a human being disturbing [their]4013-the rooms peacefulness , such as it was . The changes of the weather were [their]4013-the rooms only events , the birds of the New Forest [their]4013-the rooms only company . By tacit consent [they]4013-the rooms hardly once spoke of any incident of the past subsequent to [their]4013-the rooms wedding - day . The gloomy intervening time seemed to sink into chaos , over which the present and prior times closed as if it never had been . Whenever [he]5662-he suggested that [they]4013-the rooms should leave [[their]4013-the rooms shelter]5692-their shelter , and go forwards towards [Southampton]166-southampton or [London]23-london , [she]674-the woman showed a strange unwillingness to move .

" Why should [we]4013-the rooms put an end to all that 's sweet and lovely ! "[674-the woman] [she]674-the woman deprecated . " What must come will come . "[674-the woman] And , looking through the shutter - chink : " All is trouble outside there ; inside here content . "[674-the woman]

[He]5662-he peeped out also . It was quite true ; within was affection , union , error forgiven : outside was the inexorable .

" And - and , "[674-the woman] [she]674-the woman said , pressing [her]674-the woman cheek against [his]5662-he , " [I]674-the woman fear that what [you]5662-he think of [me]674-the woman now may not last . [I]674-the woman do not wish to outlive [your]5662-he present feeling for [me]674-the woman . [I]674-the woman would rather not . [I]674-the woman would rather be dead and buried when the time comes for [you]5662-he to despise [me]674-the woman , so that it may never be known to [me]674-the woman that [you]5662-he despised [me]674-the woman . "[674-the woman]

" [I]5662-he can not ever despise [you]5662-he . "[5662-he]

" [I]674-the woman also hope that . But considering what [my]674-the woman life has been , [I]674-the woman can not see why [any man]2461-any man should , sooner or later , be able to help despising [me]674-the woman .... How wickedly mad [I]674-the woman was ! Yet formerly [I]674-the woman never could bear to hurt a fly or a worm , and the sight of a bird in a cage used often to make [me]674-the woman cry . "[674-the woman]

[They]5693-they remained yet another day . In the night the dull sky cleared , and the result was that [the old caretaker at]5694-the old caretaker at [the cottage]1251-the cottage awoke early . The brilliant sunrise made [her]5694-the old caretaker at unusually brisk ; [she]5694-the old caretaker at decided to open [the contiguous mansion]5696-the contiguous mansion immediately , and to air [it]5696-the contiguous mansion thoroughly on such a day . Thus it occurred that , having arrived and opened [the lower rooms]1231-the lower rooms before six o'clock , [she]5694-the old caretaker at ascended to [the bedchambers]5698-the bedchambers , and was about to turn the handle of the one wherein [they]5693-they lay . At that moment [she]5694-the old caretaker at fancied [she]5694-the old caretaker at could hear the breathing of [persons within]5699-persons within . [Her]5694-the old caretaker at slippers and [her]5694-the old caretaker at antiquity had rendered [her]5694-the old caretaker at progress a noiseless one so far , and [she]5694-the old caretaker at made for instant retreat ; then , deeming that [her]5694-the old caretaker at hearing might have deceived [her]5694-the old caretaker at , [she]5694-the old caretaker at turned anew to the door and softly tried the handle . The lock was out of order , but a piece of furniture had been moved forward on the inside , which prevented [her]5694-the old caretaker at opening the door more than an inch or two . A stream of morning light through the shutter - chink fell upon the faces of [the pair]795-the pair , wrapped in profound slumber , [Tess]198-tess 's lips being parted like a half - opened flower near [his]5701-he cheek . [The caretaker]5678-the caretaker was so struck with [their]795-the pair innocent appearance , and with the elegance of [Tess]198-tess 's gown hanging across a chair , [her]198-tess silk stockings beside it , the pretty parasol , and the other habits in which [she]5694-the old caretaker at had arrived because [she]5694-the old caretaker at had none else , that [her]5694-the old caretaker at first indignation at the effrontery of [tramps]5703-tramps and [vagabonds]5704-vagabonds gave way to a momentary sentimentality over this genteel elopement , as it seemed . [She]5694-the old caretaker at closed the door , and withdrew as softly as [she]5694-the old caretaker at had come , to go and consult with [[her]5694-the old caretaker at neighbours]1488-her neighbours on the odd discovery .

Not more than a minute had elapsed after [her]198-tess withdrawal when [Tess]198-tess woke , and then [Clare]200-clare . [Both]3692-both had a sense that something had disturbed [them]3692-both , though [they]3692-both could not say what ; and the uneasy feeling which it engendered grew stronger . As soon as [he]5701-he was dressed [he]5701-he narrowly scanned [the lawn]1023-the lawn through the two or three inches of shutter - chink .

" [I]5701-he think [we]3692-both will leave at once , "[5701-he] said [he]5701-he . " It is a fine day . And [I]5701-he can not help fancying [somebody]6000-somebody is about [the house]652-the house . At any rate , [the woman]674-the woman will be sure to come to - day . "[5701-he]

[She]198-tess passively assented , and putting [the room]778-the room in order , [they]3692-both took up the few articles that belonged to [them]3692-both , and departed noiselessly . When [they]3692-both had got into [the Forest]5709-the forest [she]198-tess turned to take a last look at [the house]652-the house .

" Ah , [happy house]7814-happy house - goodbye ! "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said . " [My]198-tess life can only be a question of a few weeks . Why should [we]3692-both not have stayed [there]5839-there ? "[198-tess]

" Do n't say it , [Tess]198-tess ! [We]3692-both shall soon get out of [this district]564-this district altogether . [We]3692-both 'll continue [our]3692-both course as [we]3692-both 've begun it , and keep straight north . [Nobody]754-nobody will think of looking for [us]3692-both [there]5839-there . [We]3692-both shall be looked for at [the [Wessex]37-wessex ports]7819-the wessex ports if [we]3692-both are sought at all . When [we]3692-both are in [the north]2848-the north [we]3692-both will get to [a port]7821-a port and away . "[198-tess]

Having thus persuaded [her]5711-her , the plan was pursued , and [they]5712-they kept a bee - line northward . [Their]5712-they long repose at [the manor - house]1255-the manor - house lent [them]5712-they walking power now ; and towards mid - day [they]5712-they found that [they]5712-they were approaching [the steepled city of [Melchester]167-melchester , which lay directly in [their]5712-they way]5714-the steepled city of melchester , which lay directly in their way . [He]5715-he decided to rest [her]5711-her in a clump of trees during the afternoon , and push onward under cover of darkness . At dusk [Clare]200-clare purchased food as usual , and [their]5712-they night march began , the boundary between Upper and [Mid - Wessex]5716-mid - wessex being crossed about eight o'clock .

To walk across country without much regard to [roads]2610-roads was not new to [Tess]198-tess , and [she]198-tess showed [her]198-tess old agility in the performance . [The intercepting city]5718-the intercepting city , ancient [Melchester]167-melchester , [they]5712-they were obliged to pass through in order to take advantage of [the town]1346-the town bridge for crossing [a large river]5720-a large river that obstructed [them]5712-they . It was about midnight when [they]5712-they went along [the deserted streets]5721-the deserted streets , lighted fitfully by the few lamps , keeping off the pavement that it might not echo [their]5712-they footsteps . The graceful pile of cathedral architecture rose dimly on [their]5712-they left hand , but it was lost upon [them]5712-they now . Once out of [the town]1346-the town [they]5712-they followed [the turnpike - road]5723-the turnpike - road , which after a few miles plunged across [an open plain]5724-an open plain .

Though the sky was dense with cloud , a diffused light from some fragment of a moon had hitherto helped [them]5712-they a little . But the moon had now sunk , the clouds seemed to settle almost on [their]5712-they heads , and the night grew as dark as [a cave]5725-a cave . However , [they]5712-they found [their]5712-they way along , keeping as much on the turf as possible that [their]5712-they tread might not resound , which it was easy to do , there being no hedge or fence of any kind . All around was open loneliness and black solitude , over which a stiff breeze blew .

[They]5712-they had proceeded thus gropingly two or three miles further when on a sudden [Clare]200-clare became conscious of some vast erection close in [his]5726-he front , rising sheer from the grass . [They]5712-they had almost struck [themselves]5712-they against it .

" What monstrous place is this ? "[200-clare] said [Angel]200-clare .

" It hums , "[200-clare] said [she]200-clare . " Hearken ! "[200-clare]

[He]5726-he listened . The wind , playing upon the edifice , produced a booming tune , like the note of some gigantic one - stringed harp . No other sound came from it , and lifting [his]5726-he hand and advancing a step or two , [Clare]200-clare felt the vertical surface of [the structure]5727-the structure . [It]5728-it seemed to be of solid stone , without joint or moulding . Carrying [his]5726-he fingers onward [he]5726-he found that what [he]5726-he had come in contact with was a colossal rectangular pillar ; by stretching out [his]5726-he left hand [he]5726-he could feel a similar one adjoining . At an indefinite height overhead something made the black sky blacker , which had the semblance of a vast architrave uniting the pillars horizontally . [They]5712-they carefully entered beneath and between ; the surfaces echoed their soft rustle ; but they seemed to be still out of doors . [The place]5882-the place was roofless . [Tess]198-tess drew [her]198-tess breath fearfully , and [Angel]200-clare , perplexed , said -

" What can it be ? "[200-clare]

Feeling sideways [they]5712-they encountered another tower - like pillar , square and uncompromising as the first ; beyond [it]5730-it another and another . [The place]5882-the place was all doors and pillars , some connected above by continuous architraves .

" [A very Temple of the Winds]7822-a very temple of the winds , "[5726-he] [he]5726-he said .

The next pillar was isolated ; others composed a trilithon ; others were prostrate , [their]5732-their flanks forming a causeway wide enough for [a carriage]5908-a carriage ; and it was soon obvious that [they]5712-they made up a forest of monoliths grouped upon [the grassy expanse of [the plain]5735-the plain]5734-the grassy expanse of the plain . [The couple]3872-the couple advanced further into [this pavilion of the night]5737-this pavilion of the night till [they]5712-they stood in [its]5737-this pavilion of the night midst .

" [It]5882-the place is [Stonehenge]438-stonehenge ! "[200-clare] said [Clare]200-clare .

" [The heathen temple]7823-the heathen temple , [you]5726-he mean ? "[200-clare]

" Yes . Older than the centuries ; older than the d'Urbervilles ! Well , what shall [we]3872-the couple do , [darling]6254-darling ? [We]3872-the couple may find shelter further on . "[200-clare]

But [Tess]198-tess , really tired by this time , flung [herself]198-tess upon [an oblong slab that lay close at hand]5738-an oblong slab that lay close at hand , and was sheltered from the wind by a pillar . Owing to the action of the sun during the preceding day , the stone was warm and dry , in comforting contrast to the rough and chill grass around , which had damped [her]198-tess skirts and shoes .

" [I]198-tess do n't want to go any further , [Angel]200-clare , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess said , stretching out [her]198-tess hand for [his]5739-i . " Ca n't [we]3872-the couple bide here ? "[198-tess]

" [I]5739-i fear not . [This spot]4153-this spot is visible for miles by day , although it does not seem so now . "[5739-i]

" [One of [[my]198-tess mother 's people]7827-my mother 's people]7826-one of my mother 's people was [a shepherd hereabouts]7828-a shepherd hereabouts , now [I]198-tess think of it . And [you]198-tess used to say at [Talbothays]60-talbothays that [I]198-tess was [a heathen]7829-a heathen . So now [I]198-tess am at [home]5850-home . "[198-tess]

[He]5739-i knelt down beside [her]198-tess outstretched form , and put [his]5739-i lips upon [hers]198-tess .

" Sleepy are [you]198-tess , [dear]6259-dear ? [I]5739-i think [you]198-tess are lying on an altar . "[5739-i]

" [I]198-tess like very much to be [here]5975-here , "[198-tess] [she]198-tess murmured . " It is so solemn and lonely - after [my]198-tess great happiness - with nothing but the sky above [my]198-tess face . It seems as if there were [no folk in [the world]497-the world]7833-no folk in the world but [we]7835-we two ; and [I]198-tess wish there were not - except ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu . "[198-tess]

[Clare]200-clare though [she]198-tess might as well rest [here]5975-here till it should get a little lighter , and [he]5739-i flung [his]5739-i overcoat upon [her]198-tess , and sat down by [her]198-tess side .

" [Angel]200-clare , if anything happens to [me]198-tess , will [you]200-clare watch over ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu for [my]198-tess sake ? "[198-tess] [she]198-tess asked , when [they]5741-they had listened a long time to the wind among the pillars .

" [I]5739-i will . "[5739-i]

" [She]213-liza - lu is so good and simple and pure . O , [Angel]200-clare - [I]5739-i wish [you]200-clare would marry [her]213-liza - lu if [you]200-clare lose [me]5739-i , as [you]200-clare will do shortly . O , if [you]200-clare would ! "[5739-i]

" If [I]5739-i lose [you]200-clare [I]5739-i lose all ! And [she]213-liza - lu is [[my]5739-i sister - in - law]7836-my sister - in - law . "[5739-i]

" That 's nothing , [dearest]6681-dearest . [People]5930-people marry [sister - laws]7839-sister - laws continually about [Marlott]21-marlott ; and ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu is so gentle and sweet , and [she]213-liza - lu is growing so beautiful . O , [I]5739-i could share [you]200-clare with [her]213-liza - lu willingly when [we]7840-we are [spirits]7841-spirits ! If [you]200-clare would train [her]213-liza - lu and teach [her]213-liza - lu , [Angel]200-clare , and bring [her]213-liza - lu up for [your]200-clare own self ! ... [She]213-liza - lu had all the best of [me]5739-i without the bad of [me]5739-i ; and if [she]213-liza - lu were to become [yours]200-clare it would almost seem as if death had not divided [us]7840-we ... Well , [I]5739-i have said it . [I]5739-i wo n't mention it again . "[5739-i]

[She]5742-i ceased , and [he]5743-he fell into thought . In the far north - east sky [he]5743-he could see between the pillars a level streak of light . The uniform concavity of black cloud was lifting bodily like the lid of a pot , letting in at the earth 's edge the coming day , against which the towering monoliths and trilithons began to be blackly defined .

" Did [they]7842-they sacrifice to [God]222-god here ? "[5742-i] asked [she]5742-i .

" No , "[5743-he] said [he]5743-he .

" Who to ? "[5744-he]

" [I]5744-he believe to the sun . That lofty stone set away by itself is in the direction of the sun , which will presently rise behind it . "[5744-he]

" This reminds [me]5742-i , [dear]6259-dear , "[5742-i] [she]5742-i said . " [You]6259-dear remember [you]6259-dear never would interfere with any belief of [mine]5742-i before [we]7840-we were married ? But [I]5742-i knew [your]6259-dear mind all the same , and [I]5742-i thought as [you]6259-dear thought - not from any reasons of [my]5742-i own , but because [you]6259-dear thought so . Tell [me]5742-i now , [Angel]200-clare , do [you]6259-dear think [we]7840-we shall meet again after [we]7840-we are dead ? [I]5742-i want to know . "[5742-i]

[He]5744-he kissed [her]5742-i to avoid a reply at such a time .

" O , [Angel]200-clare - [I]5742-i fear that means no ! "[5742-i] said [she]5742-i , with a suppressed sob . " And [I]5742-i wanted so to see [you]6259-dear again - so much , so much ! What - not even [you]6259-dear and [I]5742-i , [Angel]200-clare , who love [each other]577-each other so well ? "[5742-i]

Like [a greater than [himself]5744-he]5745-a greater than himself , to the critical question at the critical time [he]5744-he did not answer ; and [they]5746-they were again silent . In a minute or two [her]5742-i breathing became more regular , [her]5742-i clasp of [his]5744-he hand relaxed , and [she]5742-i fell asleep . The band of silver paleness along the east horizon made even [the distant parts of [the Great Plain]168-the great plain]5747-the distant parts of the great plain appear dark and near ; and [the whole enormous landscape]5748-the whole enormous landscape bore that impress of reserve , taciturnity , and hesitation which is usual just before day . The eastward pillars and [their]5749-their architraves stood up blackly against the light , and the great flame - shaped Sun - stone beyond [them]5749-their ; and the Stone of [Sacrifice]169-sacrifice midway . Presently the night wind died out , and the quivering little pools in the cup - like hollows of the stones lay still . At the same time something seemed to move on the verge of the dip eastward - a mere dot . It was the head of [a man approaching [them]5746-they]5750-a man approaching them from [the hollow beyond the Sun - stone]5751-the hollow beyond the sun - stone . [Clare]200-clare wished [they]5746-they had gone onward , but in the circumstances decided to remain quiet . [The figure]5304-the figure came straight towards the circle of pillars in which [they]5746-they were .

[He]5744-he heard something behind [him]5744-he , the brush of feet . Turning , [he]5744-he saw over [the prostrate columns another figure]5753-the prostrate columns another figure ; then before [he]5744-he was aware , another was at hand on the right , under a trilithon , and another on the left . The dawn shone full on the front of [the man]1516-the man westward , and [Clare]200-clare could discern from this that [he]1516-the man was tall , and walked as if trained . [They]5746-they all closed in with evident purpose . [Her]200-clare story then was true ! Springing to [his]5744-he feet , [he]5744-he looked around for a weapon , loose stone , means of escape , anything . By this time [the nearest man]5755-the nearest man was upon [him]5744-he .

" It is no use , [sir]5821-sir , "[5755-the nearest man] [he]5755-the nearest man said . " There are sixteen of [us]5746-they on [the Plain]5735-the plain , and [the whole country]7847-the whole country is reared . "[5755-the nearest man]

" Let [her]200-clare finish [her]200-clare sleep ! "[5744-he] [he]5744-he implored in a whisper of [the men]2919-the men as [they]2919-the men gathered round .

When [they]2919-the men saw where [she]200-clare lay , which [they]2919-the men had not done till then , [they]2919-the men showed no objection , and stood watching [her]200-clare , as still as the pillars around . [He]5744-he went to the stone and bent over [her]200-clare , holding one poor little hand ; [her]200-clare breathing now was quick and small , like that of [a lesser creature than [a woman]1028-a woman]5757-a lesser creature than a woman . [All]622-all waited in the growing light , [their]622-all faces and hands as if [they]622-all were silvered , the remainder of [their]622-all figures dark , the stones glistening green - gray , [the Plain]5735-the plain still a mass of shade . Soon the light was strong , and a ray shone upon [her]200-clare unconscious form , peering under [her]200-clare eyelids and waking [her]200-clare .

" What is it , [Angel]200-clare ? "[200-clare] [she]200-clare said , starting up . " Have [they]2919-the men come for [me]200-clare ? "[200-clare]

" Yes , [dearest]6681-dearest , "[5744-he] [he]5744-he said . " [They]2919-the men have come . "[5744-he]

" It is as it should be , "[200-clare] [she]200-clare murmured . " [Angel]200-clare , [I]200-clare am almost glad - yes , glad ! This happiness could not have lasted . It was too much . [I]200-clare have had enough ; and now [I]200-clare shall not live for [you]5744-he to despise [me]200-clare ! "[200-clare]

[She]200-clare stood up , shook [herself]200-clare , and went forward , [neither of [the men]2919-the men]5761-neither of the men having moved .

" [I]200-clare am ready , "[200-clare] [she]200-clare said quietly .

[LIX]170-lix

[The city of Wintoncester]5763-the city of wintoncester , [that fine old city]5764-that fine old city , [aforetime capital of [Wessex]37-wessex]5765-aforetime capital of wessex , lay amidst [its]5764-that fine old city convex and concave downlands in all the brightness and warmth of a July morning . [The gabled brick , tile , and freestone houses]5766-the gabled brick , tile , and freestone houses had almost dried off for the season [their]5766-the gabled brick , tile , and freestone houses integument of lichen , the streams in [the meadows]544-the meadows were low , and in the sloping [High Street]171-high street , from [the West Gateway to [the mediaeval cross]5769-the mediaeval cross]5768-the west gateway to the mediaeval cross , and from [the mediaeval cross]5769-the mediaeval cross to [the bridge]1389-the bridge , that leisurely dusting and sweeping was in progress which usually ushers in an old - fashioned market - day .

From the western gate aforesaid [the highway]598-the highway , as every [Wintoncestrian]172-wintoncestrian knows , ascends a long and regular incline of the exact length of a measured mile , leaving [the houses]4515-the houses gradually behind . Up [this road]5823-this road from [the precincts of [the city]5776-the city]5775-the precincts of the city [two persons]5777-two persons were walking rapidly , as if unconscious of the trying ascent - unconscious through preoccupation and not through buoyancy . [They]5777-two persons had emerged upon [this road]5823-this road through a narrow , barred wicket in a high wall a little lower down . [They]5777-two persons seemed anxious to get out of the sight of [the houses]4515-the houses and of [their]5777-two persons kind , and [this road]5823-this road appeared to offer the quickest means of doing so . Though [they]5777-two persons were young , [they]5777-two persons walked with bowed heads , which gait of grief the sun 's rays smiled on pitilessly .

[One of the pair]5781-one of the pair was [Angel Clare]200-clare , [the other a tall budding creature]5782-the other a tall budding creature - [half girl]5783-half girl , [half woman]5784-half woman - a spiritualized image of [Tess]198-tess , slighter than [she]198-tess , but with the same beautiful eyes - [[Clare]200-clare 's sister - in - law]5785-clare 's sister - in - law , ' [Liza - Lu]213-liza - lu . [Their]5777-two persons pale faces seemed to have shrunk to half [their]5777-two persons natural size . [They]5777-two persons moved on hand in hand , and never spoke a word , the drooping of [their]5777-two persons heads being that of [Giotto]439-giotto 's " [Two Apostles]7849-two apostles "[5777-two persons] .

When [they]5777-two persons had nearly reached the top of [the great West Hill]5786-the great west hill the clocks in [the town]1346-the town struck eight . [Each]542-each gave a start at the notes , and , walking onward yet a few steps , [they]5777-two persons reached the first milestone , standing whitely on the green margin of the grass , and backed by the down , which here was open to [the road]550-the road . [They]5777-two persons entered upon the turf , and , impelled by a force that seemed to overrule [their]5777-two persons will , suddenly stood still , turned , and waited in paralyzed suspense beside the stone .

The prospect from [this summit]5790-this summit was almost unlimited . In [the valley beneath]5791-the valley beneath lay [the city [they]5777-two persons had just left]5792-the city they had just left , [[its]5792-the city they had just left more prominent buildings]5793-its more prominent buildings showing as in an isometric drawing - among [them]5793-its more prominent buildings [the broad cathedral tower , with [its]5794-the broad cathedral tower , with its norman windows and immense length of aisle and nave Norman windows and immense length of aisle and nave]5794-the broad cathedral tower , with its norman windows and immense length of aisle and nave , the spires of [St Thomas 's]173-st thomas 's , [the pinnacled tower of [the College]5796-the college]5795-the pinnacled tower of the college , and , more to the right , [the tower and gables of [the ancient hospice]5798-the ancient hospice]5797-the tower and gables of the ancient hospice , where to this day [the pilgrim]5799-the pilgrim may receive [his]5799-the pilgrim dole of bread and ale . Behind [the city]5776-the city swept [the rotund upland of [St Catherine]174-st catherine 's Hill]5801-the rotund upland of st catherine 's hill ; further off , landscape beyond landscape , till the horizon was lost in the radiance of the sun hanging above [it]5802-it .

Against [these far stretches of country]5803-these far stretches of country rose , in front of [the other city]5804-the other city edifices , [a large red - brick building , with level gray roofs , and rows of short barred windows bespeaking captivity]5805-a large red - brick building , with level gray roofs , and rows of short barred windows bespeaking captivity , the whole contrasting greatly by [its]5805-a large red - brick building , with level gray roofs , and rows of short barred windows bespeaking captivity formalism with the quaint irregularities of the Gothic erections . [It]5805-a large red - brick building , with level gray roofs , and rows of short barred windows bespeaking captivity was somewhat disguised from [the road]550-the road in passing [it]5805-a large red - brick building , with level gray roofs , and rows of short barred windows bespeaking captivity by [yews and evergreen oaks]5807-yews and evergreen oaks , but [it]5805-a large red - brick building , with level gray roofs , and rows of short barred windows bespeaking captivity was visible enough up here . The wicket from which [the pair]795-the pair had lately emerged was in the wall of [this structure]5809-this structure . From the middle of [the building an ugly flat - topped octagonal tower]5810-the building an ugly flat - topped octagonal tower ascended against the east horizon , and viewed from this spot , on [its]5810-the building an ugly flat - topped octagonal tower shady side and against the light , it seemed the one blot on [the city]5776-the city 's beauty . Yet it was with this blot , and not with the beauty , that [the two gazers]5812-the two gazers were concerned .

Upon the cornice of [the tower]3399-the tower a tall staff was fixed . [Their]5812-the two gazers eyes were riveted on it . A few minutes after the hour had struck something moved slowly up the staff , and extended itself upon the breeze . It was a black flag .

" Justice "[5814-the president of the immortals] was done , and [the President of [the Immortals]5815-the immortals]5814-the president of the immortals , in Aeschylean phrase , had ended [his]5814-the president of the immortals sport with [Tess]198-tess . And [the d'Urberville knights]5816-the d'urberville knights and [dames]5817-dames slept on in [[their]5812-the two gazers tombs]5818-their tombs unknowing . [The two speechless gazers]5819-the two speechless gazers bent [themselves]5819-the two speechless gazers down to [the earth]1046-the earth , as if in prayer , and remained thus a long time , absolutely motionless : the flag continued to wave silently . As soon as [they]5819-the two speechless gazers had strength , [they]5819-the two speechless gazers arose , joined hands again , and went on .
